# notes:                
40001001	This is the boke of the generacion of Iesus Christ the sonne of Dauid the sonne also of Abraham .
40001002	Abraham begat Isaac : Isaac begat Iacob : Iacob begat Iudas and his brethren :
40001003	Iudas begat Phares and zaram of Thamar : Phares begat Hesrom : Hesrom begat Aram :
40001004	Aram begat Aminadab : Aminadab begat Naasson : Naasson begat Salmon :
40001005	Salmon begat Boos of Rahab : Boos begat Obed of Ruth : Obed begat Iesse :
40001006	Iesse begat Dauid the kynge : Dauid the kynge begat Salomon of her that was the wyfe of Vry :
40001007	Salomon begat Roboam : Roboam begat Abia : Abia begat Asa :
40001008	Asa begat Iosaphat : Iosaphat begat Ioram : Ioram begat Osias :
40001009	Osias begat Ioatham : Ioatham begat Achas : Achas begat Ezechias :
40001010	Ezechias begat Manasses : Manasses begat Amon : Amon begat Iosias :
40001011	Iosias begat Iechonias and his brethren aboute ye tyme they were caryed awaye to Babylon .
40001012	And after they were brought to Babylon Iechonias begat Salathiel : Salathiel begat Zorobabel :
40001013	Zorobabel begat Abiud : Abiud begat Eliachim : Eliachim begat Azor :
40001014	Azor begat Sadoc : Sadoc begat Achin : Achin begat Eliud :
40001015	Eliud begat Eleasar : Eleasar begat Matthan : Matthan begat Iacob :
40001016	Iacob begat Ioseph the husbande of Mary of which was boren that Iesus that is called Christ .
40001017	All the generacions from Abraham to David are fowretene generacios . And fro David vnto the captivite of Babylon are fowretene generacions . And from the captivite of Babylon vnto Christ are also fowrtene generacios .
40001018	The byrthe of Iesus Christ was on thys wyse . When hys mother Mary was betrouthed to Ioseph before they came to dwell to gedder she was foude with chylde by ye holy goost .
40001019	The Ioseph her husbande beinge a perfect ma and loth to make an ensample of hir was mynded to put her awaye secretely .
40001020	Whill he thus thought behold ye angell of ye Lorde appered vnto him in a dreame saynge : Ioseph ye sonne of David feare not to take vnto ye Mary thy wyfe . For that which is coceaved in her is of the holy goost .
40001021	She shall brynge forthe a sonne and thou shalt call his name Iesus . For he shall save his peple from their synnes .
40001022	All this was done to fulfill yt which was spoken of the Lorde by the Prophet saynge :
40001023	Beholde a mayde shall be with chylde and shall brynge forthe a sonne and they shall call his name Emanuel which is by interpretacion God with vs .
40001024	And Ioseph assone as he awoke out of slepe did as the angell of the Lorde bade hym and toke hys wyfe vnto hym
40001025	and knewe her not tyll she had brought forth hir fyrst sonne and called hys name Iesus .
40002001	When Iesus was borne at Bethleem in Iury in the tyme of Herode the kynge . Beholde there came wyse me from the eest to Ierusalem
40002002	saynge : Where is he yt is borne kynge of ye Iues ? We have sene his starre in ye eest and are come to worship him .
40002003	When Herode ye kynge had herde thys he was troubled and all Ierusalem with hym
40002004	and he gathered all ye chefe Prestes and Scribes of the people and axed of them where Christ shulde be borne .
40002005	And they sayde vnto hym : at Bethlee in Iury . For thus it is written by the Prophet .
40002006	And thou Bethleem in the londe of Iury art not the leest concernynge the Princes of Iuda . For out of the shall come the captayne that shall govern my people Israhel .
40002007	Then Herod prevely called the wyse men and dyligetly enquyred of them ye tyme of the starre that appered
40002008	and sent the to Bethleem saynge : Goo and searche dyligetly for ye chylde . And when ye have founde hym bringe me worde yt I maye come and worshippe hym also .
40002009	When they had heard the kynge they departed : and lo the starre which they sawe in ye eeste went before them tyll it came and stode over the place where the chylde was .
40002010	When they sawe the starre they were marvelously glad :
40002011	and went into the house and found the chylde with Mary hys mother and kneled doune and worshipped hym and opened their treasures and offred vnto hym gyftes gold frackynsence and myrre .
40002012	And after they were warned of God in a dreame that they shuld not go ageyne to Herod they retourned into their awne countre another waye .
40002013	When they were departed : beholde the angell of the Lorde appered to Ioseph in dreame sayinge : aryse and take the chylde and his mother and flye into Egypte and abyde there tyll I brynge the worde . For Herod will seke the chylde to destroye hym .
40002014	The he arose and toke the chylde and his mother by night and departed into Egypte
40002015	and was there vnto ye deeth of Herod to fulfill that which was spoken of the Lorde by ye Prophet which sayeth out of Egypte haue I called my sonne .
40002016	Then Herod perceavynge yt he was moocked of the wyse men was excedynge wroth and sent forth and slue all the chyldren that were in Bethleem and in all the costes there of as many as were two yere olde and vnder accordynge to the tyme which he had diligetly searched oute of the wyse men .
40002017	Then was fulfilled yt which was spoken by the Prophet Ieremy sayinge :
40002018	On the hilles was a voyce herde mornynge wepynge and greate lamentacion : Rachel wepynge for her chyldren and wolde not be conforted because they were not .
40002019	When Herode was deed : beholde an angell of ye Lorde appered in a dreame to Ioseph in Egypte
40002020	sayinge : arise and take ye chylde and his mother and go into ye londe of Israel . For they are deed which sought ye chyldes life .
40002021	The he arose vp and toke ye chylde and his mother and cam into the londe of Israhel .
40002022	But whe he hearde yt Archelaus did raygne in Iury in ye roume of his father Herode he was afrayde to goo thither . Not withstondynge after he was warned of god in a dreame he turned a syde into ye parties of Galile
40002023	and wet and dwelt in a cite called Nazareth to fulfill yt which was spoken by ye Prophetes : he shalbe called a Nazarite
40003001	In those dayes Ihon the Baptyst came and preached in the wildernes of Iury
40003002	saynge . Repet the kyngdome of heue is at honde .
40003003	This is he of whom it is spoken by the Prophet Esay which sayeth : The voyce of a cryer in wyldernes prepare the Lordes waye and make hys pathes strayght .
40003004	This Iho had hys garmet of camels heer and a gerdell of a skynne aboute his loynes . Hys meate was locustes and wylde hony .
40003005	The went oute to hym Ierusalem and all Iury and all ye regio roude aboute Iorda
40003006	and were baptised of him in Iorda cofessynge their synnes .
40003007	When he sawe many of ye Pharises and of ye Saduces come to hys baptim he sayde vnto the : O generacio of vipers who hath taught you to fle fro the vengeauce to come ?
40003008	Brynge forth therfore the frutes belongynge to repentauce .
40003009	And se that ye ons thynke not to saye in your selues we haue Abraham to oure father . For I saye vnto you that God is able of these stones to rayse vp chyldern vnto Abraha .
40003010	Euenowe is ye axe put vnto ye rote of ye trees : soo that every tree which bringeth not forthe goode frute is hewe doune and cast into ye fyre .
40003011	I baptise you in water in toke of repentauce : but he ye cometh after me is myghtier then I whose shues I am not worthy to beare . He shall baptise you with ye holy gost and with fyre :
40003012	which hath also his fan in his hod and will pourge his floure and gadre ye wheet into his garner and will burne ye chaffe with vnquecheable fyre
40003013	Then cam Iesus from Galile to Iordan vnto Ihon to be baptised of hym .
40003014	But Ihon forbade hym saynge : I ought to be baptysed of the : and comest thou to me ?
40003015	Iesus answered and sayd to hym : Let it be so now . For thus it becommeth vs to fulfyll all rightwesnes . Then he suffred hym .
40003016	And Iesus assone as he was baptised came strayght out of ye water . And lo heue was ope over hym : and Ihon sawe the spirite of God descende lyke a doue and lyght vpon hym .
40003017	And lo there came a voyce from heven sayng : Thys ys that my beloved sonne in whom is my delyte .
40004001	Then was Iesus ledd awaye of ye spirite into wildernes to be tempted of ye devyll .
40004002	And when he had fasted fourtye dayes and fourtye nightes he was afterward an hungred .
40004003	Then came to hym the tempter and sayde : yf thou be the sonne of God commaunde that these stones be made breed .
40004004	He answered and sayde : yt is wrytten man shall not lyve by brede onlye but by every worde yt proceadeth out of the mouth of God .
40004005	Then the devyll tooke hym vp into ye holy cite and set hym on a pynacle of the teple
40004006	and sayd vnto hym : yf thou be the sonne of God cast thy sylfe doune . For it is wrytte he shall geve his angels charge over the and with their handes they shall holde yt vp that thou dashe not thy fote agaynst a stone .
40004007	And Iesus sayde to hym it ys wrytten also : Thou shalt not tempte thy Lorde God .
40004008	The devyll toke hym vp agayne and ledde hym in to an excedynge hye mountayne and shewed hym all the kyngdomes of ye worlde and all ye glorie of them
40004009	and sayde to hym : all these will I geue ye if thou wilt faull doune and worship me .
40004010	Then sayde Iesus vnto hym . Avoyd Satan . For it is writte thou shalt worshyp ye Lorde thy God and hym only shalt thou serve .
40004011	Then the dyvell left hym and beholde the angels came and ministred vnto hym .
40004012	When Iesus had hearde yt Ihon was taken he departed into Galile
40004013	and left Nazareth and went and dwelte in Capernaum which is a cite apon the see in ye coostes of zabulon and Neptalim
40004014	to fulfill that whiche was spoken by Esay the Prophet sayinge :
40004015	The londe of zabulon and Neptalim the waye of the see beyonde Iordan Galile of the Gentyls
40004016	ye people which sat in darknes sawe greate lyght and to them which sate in the region and shadowe of deeth lyght is begone to shyne .
40004017	From yt tyme Iesus begane to preache and to saye : repet for ye kigdome of heve is at hode .
40004018	As Iesus walked by the see of Galile he sawe two brethren : Simon which was called Peter and Andrew his brother castynge a neet into the see for they were fisshers
40004019	and he sayde vnto them folowe me and I will make you fisshers of men .
40004020	And they strayght waye lefte their nettes and folowed hym .
40004021	And he went forthe from thence and sawe other twoo brethren Iames the sonne of zebede and Ihon his brother in the shippe with zebede their father mendynge their nettes and called them .
40004022	And they with out taryinge lefte the shyp and their father and folowed hym .
40004023	And Iesus went aboute all Galile teachyng in their synagoges and preachynge ye gospell of the kyngdome and healed all maner of sicknes and all maner dyseases amoge ye people .
40004024	And his fame spreed abroode through oute all Siria . And they brought vnto hym all sicke people that were taken with divers diseases and gripinges and them yt were possessed with devils and those which were lunatyke and those that had the palsie : and he healed the .
40004025	And ther folowed hym a greate nombre of people from Galile and from the ten cyties and from Ierusalem and from Iury and from ye regions that lye beyonde Iordan .
40005001	When he sawe the people he went vp into a mountayne and when he was set his disciples came to hym
40005002	and he opened hys mouthe and taught them sayinge :
40005003	Blessed are the povre in sprete : for theirs is the kyngdome of heven .
40005004	Blessed are they that morne : for they shalbe conforted .
40005005	Blessed are the meke : for they shall inheret the erth .
40005006	Blessed are they which honger and thurst for rightewesnes : for they shalbe filled .
40005007	Blessed are ye mercifull : for they shall obteyne mercy .
40005008	Blessed are the pure in herte : for they shall se God .
40005009	Blessed are the peacemakers : for they shalbe called the chyldren of God .
40005010	Blessed are they which suffre persecucio for rightwesnes sake : for theirs ys the kyngdome of heuen .
40005011	Blessed are ye when men reuyle you and persecute you and shall falsly say all manner of yvell saynges agaynst you for my sake .
40005012	Reioyce and be glad for greate is youre rewarde in heven . For so persecuted they ye Prophetes which were before youre dayes .
40005013	ye are ye salt of the erthe : but and yf ye salt have lost hir saltnes what can be salted ther with ? It is thence forthe good for nothynge but to be cast oute and to be troade vnder fote of men .
40005014	Ye are ye light of the worlde . A cite yt is set on an hill cannot be hid
40005015	nether do men lyght a cadell and put it vnder a busshell but on a candelstick and it lighteth all that are in the house .
40005016	Let youre light so shyne before men yt they maye se youre good workes and glorify youre father which is in heven .
40005017	Thinke not yt I am come to destroye the lawe or the Prophets : no I am nott come to destroye them but to fulfyll them .
40005018	For truely I saye vnto you till heven and erth perisshe one iott or one tytle of the lawe shall not scape tyll all be fulfilled .
40005019	Whosoever breaketh one of these lest commaundmentes and teacheth men so he shalbe called the leest in the kyngdome of heve . But whosoever obserueth and teacheth ye same shal be called greate in the kyngdome of heven .
40005020	For I saye vnto you except youre rightewesnes excede the righetewesnes of ye Scribes and Pharises ye canot entre into ye kyngdome of heven .
40005021	Ye have herde howe it was sayd vnto the of ye olde tyme : Thou shalt not kyll . For whoso ever kylleth shall be in daunger of iudgemet .
40005022	But I say vnto you whosoever is angre with hys brother shalbe in daunger of iudgement . Whosoeuer sayeth vnto his brother Racha shalbe in dauger of a cousell . But whosoeuer sayeth thou fole shalbe in dauger of hell fyre .
40005023	Therfore whe thou offrest thy gifte at the altare and their remembrest that thy brother hath ought agaynst the :
40005024	leue there thyne offrynge before the altre and go thy waye first and be reconcyled to thy brother and then come and offre thy gyfte .
40005025	Agre with thyne adversary quicklye whyles thou arte in ye waye with hym lest that adversary deliver ye to ye iudge and ye iudge delivre ye to ye minister and the thou be cast into preson .
40005026	I say vnto ye verely : thou shalt not come out thece till thou have payed ye utmost farthige .
40005027	Ye haue hearde howe it was sayde to the of olde tyme : Thou shalt not comitt advoutrie .
40005028	But I say vnto you that whosoeuer looketh on a wyfe lustynge after her hathe comitted advoutrie with hir alredy in his hert .
40005029	Wherfore yf thy right eye offende ye plucke hym out and caste him from the . Better it is for the yt one of thy membres perisshe then that thy hole bodye shuld be cast into hell .
40005030	Also if thy right honde offend ye cut hym of and caste hym from the . Better yt ys that one of thy membres perisshe then that all thy body shulde be caste in to hell .
40005031	It ys sayd whosoever put awaye his wyfe let hym geve her a testymonyall also of the devorcement .
40005032	But I say vnto you : whosoever put awaye his wyfe ( except it be for fornicacion ) causeth her to breake matrymony . And whosoever maryeth her that is devorsed breaketh wedlocke .
40005033	Agayne ye haue hearde how it was sayd to the of olde tyme thou shalt not forsuere thy selfe but shalt performe thyne othe to God .
40005034	But I saye vnto you swere not at all nether by heue for it ys Goddes seate :
40005035	nor yet by the erth for it is his fote stole : nether by Ierusalem for it ys ye cyte of yt greate kynge :
40005036	nether shalt thou sweare by thy heed because thou canst not make one white heer or blacke :
40005037	But your comunicacion shalbe ye ye : nay nay . For whatsoeuer is more then yt cometh of yvell .
40005038	Ye have hearde how it ys sayd an eye for an eye : a tothe for a tothe .
40005039	But I saye to you that ye resist not wroge . But whosoever geve the a blowe on thy right cheke tourne to him the other .
40005040	And yf eny man will sue the at the lawe and take awaye thy coote let hym have thy cloocke also .
40005041	And whosoever wyll copell the to goo a myle goo wyth him twayne .
40005042	Geve to him that axeth and fro him that wolde borowe tourne not awaye .
40005043	Ye have hearde how it is sayde : thou shalt love thyne neghbour and hate thine enimy .
40005044	But I saye vnto you love youre enimies . Blesse the that coursse you . Do good to them that hate you . Praye for them which doo you wronge and persecute you
40005045	that ye maye be ye chyldern of youre father that is in heauen : for he maketh his sunne to aryse on ye yvell and on the good and sendeth his reyn on the iuste and vniuste .
40005046	For yf ye love them which love you : what rewarde shall ye have ? Doo not the Publicans euen so ?
40005047	And yf ye be frendly to youre brethren onlye : what singuler thynge doo ye ? Do not the Publicans lyke wyse ?
40005048	ye shall therfore be perfecte eve as youre father which is in heauen is perfecte .
40006001	Take hede to youre almes . That ye geve it not in the syght of men to the intent that ye wolde be sene of them . Or els ye get no rewarde of youre father which is in heve .
40006002	Whe soever therfore thou gevest thine almes thou shalt not make a tropet to be blowe before the as ye ypocrites do in the synagogis and in the stretis for to be preysed of men . Verely I say vnto you they have their rewarde .
40006003	But whe thou doest thine almes let not thy lyfte had knowe what thy righte had doth
40006004	yt thine almes may be secret : and thy father which seith in secret shall rewarde ye opely .
40006005	And when thou prayest thou shalt not be as ye ypocrytes are . For they love to stond and praye in the synagoges and in the corners of ye stretes because they wolde be sene of men . Verely I saye vnto you they haue their rewarde .
40006006	But when thou prayest entre into thy chamber and shut thy dore to the and praye to thy father which ys in secrete : and thy father which seith in secret shall rewarde the openly .
40006007	And whe ye praye bable not moche as the hethe do : for they thincke that they shalbe herde for their moche bablynges sake .
40006008	Be ye not lyke them therfore . For youre father knoweth wherof ye haue neade before ye axe of him .
40006009	After thys maner therfore praye ye . O oure father which arte in heve halowed be thy name .
40006010	Let thy kyngdome come . Thy wyll be fulfilled as well in erth as it ys in heven .
40006011	Geve vs this daye oure dayly breede .
40006012	And forgeve vs oure treaspases eve as we forgeve oure trespacers .
40006013	And leade vs not into teptacion : but delyver vs fro evell . For thyne is ye kyngedome and ye power and ye glorye for ever . Amen .
40006014	For and yf ye shall forgeve other men their treaspases youre hevenly father shall also forgeve you .
40006015	But and ye wyll not forgeve men their trespases nomore shall youre father forgeve youre treaspases .
40006016	Moreoure when ye faste be not sad as ye ypocrytes are . For they disfigure their faces that they myght be sene of me how they faste . Verely I say vnto you they have their rewarde .
40006017	But thou whe thou fastest annoynte thyne heed and washe thy face
40006018	that it appere not vnto men howe that thou fastest : but vnto thy father which is in secrete : and thy father which seeth in secret shall rewarde the openly .
40006019	Se that ye gaddre you not treasure vpon ye erth where rust and mothes corrupte and where theves breake through and steale .
40006020	But gaddre ye treasure togeder in heve where nether rust nor mothes corrupte and where theves nether breake vp nor yet steale .
40006021	For where soever youre treasure ys there will youre hertes be also .
40006022	The light of the body is thyne eye . Wher fore if thyne eye besyngle all thy body shalbe full of light .
40006023	But and if thyne eye be wycked then all thy body shalbe full of derckenes . Wherfore yf the light that is in the be darckenes : how greate is that darckenes .
40006024	No ma can serve two masters . For ether he shall hate the one and love the other : or els he shall lene to ye one and despise ye other : ye can not serve God and mammon .
40006025	Therfore I saye vnto you be not carefull for your lyfe what ye shall eate or what ye shall drincke nor yet for youre body what ye shall put on . ys not ye lyfe more worth then meate and the body more of value then raymeut ?
40006026	Beholde the foules of ye ayer : for they sowe not nether reepe nor yet cary into ye barnes : and yet youre hevely father fedeth the . Are ye not moche better the they ?
40006027	Which of you ( though he toke thought therfore ) coulde put one cubit vnto his stature ?
40006028	And why care ye then for raymet ? Considre ye lylies of ye felde how they growe . They labour not nether spynne .
40006029	And yet for all yt I saye vnto you yt eue Salomon in all his royalte was not arayed lyke vnto one of these .
40006030	Wherfore yf God so clothe the grasse which ys to daye in the felde and to morowe shalbe caste in to the fournace : shall he not moche more do the same vnto you o ye of lytle fayth ?
40006031	Therfore take no thought sayinge : what shall we eate or what shall we drincke or wherwt shall we be clothed ?
40006032	After all these thynges seke the getyls . For youre hevely father knoweth that ye have neade of all these thynges .
40006033	But rather seke ye fyrst the kyngdome of heuen and the rightwisnes therof and all these thynges shalbe ministred vnto you .
40006034	Care not then for the morow but let ye morow care for it selfe : for the daye present hath ever ynough of his awne trouble .
40007001	Iudge not that ye be not iudged .
40007002	For as ye iudge so shall ye be iudged . And wt what mesure ye mete wt the same shall it be mesured to you agayne .
40007003	Why seist thou a moote in thy brothers eye and perceavest not the beame yt ys yn thyne awne eye .
40007004	Or why sayest thou to thy brother : suffre me to plucke oute the moote oute of thyne eye and behold a beame is in thyne awne eye .
40007005	Ypocryte fyrst cast oute the beame oute of thyne awne eye and then shalte thou se clearly to plucke oute the moote out of thy brothers eye .
40007006	Geve not that which is holy to dogges nether cast ye youre pearles before swyne lest they treade them vnder their fete and ye other tourne agayne and all to rent you .
40007007	Axe and it shalbe geven you . Seke and ye shall fynd . knocke and it shalbe opened vnto you .
40007008	For whosoever axeth receaveth and he yt seketh fyndeth and to hym that knocketh it shalbe opened .
40007009	Ys there eny man amoge you which if his sonne axed hym bread wolde offer him astone ?
40007010	Or if he axed fysshe wolde he proffer hym a serpet ?
40007011	Yf ye then which are evyll cane geve to youre chyldren good gyftes : how moche moore shall youre father which is in heve geve good thynges to them yt axe hym ?
40007012	Therfore whatsoever ye wolde that men shulde do to you even so do ye to them . This ys the lawe and the Prophettes .
40007013	Enter in at the strayte gate : for wyde is ye gate and broade is the waye that leadeth to destruccion : and many ther be which goo yn therat .
40007014	But strayte is the gate and narowe ys the waye which leadeth vnto lyfe : and feawe there be that fynde it .
40007015	Beware of false Prophetes which come to you in shepes clothinge but inwardly they are ravenynge wolves .
40007016	Ye shall knowe them by their frutes . Do men gaddre grapes of thornes ? or figges of bryres ?
40007017	Euen soo every good tree bryngeth forthe good frute . But a corrupte tree bryngethe forthe evyll frute .
40007018	A good tree canot brynge forthe bad frute : nor yet a bad tree can bringe forthe good frute .
40007019	Every tree that bryngethe not forthe good frute shalbe hewe doune and cast into the fyre .
40007020	Wherfore by their frutes ye shall knowe the .
40007021	Not all they that saye vnto me Master Master shall enter in to the kyngdome of heven : but he that dothe my fathers will which ys in heven .
40007022	Many will saye to me in that daye Master master have we not in thy name prophesied ? And in thy name have caste oute devyls ? And in thy name have done many miracles ?
40007023	And then will I knowlege vnto them that I never knewe them . Departe from me ye workers of iniquite .
40007024	Whosoever heareth of me these sayinges and doethe the same I wyll lyken hym vnto a wyse man which bylt hys housse on a rocke :
40007025	and aboundance of rayne descended and the fluddes came and the wyndes blewe and bet vpon that same housse and it fell not because it was grounded on the rocke .
40007026	And whosoever heareth of me these sayinges and doth the not shalbe lykened vnto a folysh man which bilt hys housse apo the sondes :
40007027	and abundauce of rayne descended and the fluddes came and ye wyndes blewe and beet vpon that housse and it fell and great was the fall of it .
40007028	And it came to passe that when Iesus had ended these saynges the people were astonnyed at hys doctryne .
40007029	For he taught them as one havynge power and not as the Scribes .
40008001	When he was come downe from the moutayne moch people folowed him .
40008002	And lo ther came a lepre and worsheped him sayinge : Master if thou wylt thou canst make me clene .
40008003	And Iesus put forthe hys hond and touched hym sayinge : I wyll be thou clene and immediatly hys leprosie was clensed .
40008004	And Iesus sayde vnto him . Se thou tell no man but go and shewe thy selfe to the preste and offer the gyfte that Moses comaunded in witnes to them .
40008005	When Iesus was entred into Capernau ther came vnto him a certayne Centurion and besought hym
40008006	sayinge : Master my seruaunt lyeth sicke at home of ye palsye and ys greuously payned .
40008007	And Iesus sayd vnto hym : I will come and heale him .
40008008	The Centurio answered and sayde : Syr I am not worthy yt thou shuldest come vnder my rofe but speake ye worde only and my servaut shalbe healed .
40008009	For I also my selfe am a man vndre power and have sowdiers vndre me and I saye to one go and he goeth and to anothre come and he cometh : and to my seruaut do this and he doeth it .
40008010	When Iesus hearde yt he marveled and sayd to them yt folowed hym . Derely I say vnto you I have not foude so great fayth : no not in Israel .
40008011	I say therfore vnto you that many shall come fro the eest and weest and shall rest wt Abraham Isaac and Iacob in the kingdome of heve :
40008012	and the chyldren of ye kyngdome shalbe cast out in to vtter darcknes : there shalbe wepinge and gnasshing of tethe .
40008013	The Iesus sayd vnto ye Centurion go thy waye and as thou belevest so be it vnto the . And his servaunt was healed the selfe houre .
40008014	And then Iesus went to Peters housse and sawe hys wyves mother lyinge sicke of a fevre
40008015	and touched her hande and the fevre left hir : and she arose and ministred vnto them .
40008016	When the eue was come they brought vn to him many yt were possessed with devyllis . And he cast out ye spirites with a worde and healed all yt were sicke
40008017	to fulfill yt which was spoke by Esayas ye Prophet sayinge . He toke on him oure infirmities and bare oure sickneses .
40008018	Whe Iesus sawe moche people about him he comaunded to go over ye water .
40008019	And ther came a scribe and sayd vnto hym : master I wyll folowe ye whyther so ever thou goest .
40008020	And Iesus sayd vnto him : the foxes have holes and the bryddes of the ayer have nestes but ye sonne of the man hath not whero to rest his heede .
40008021	A nothre yt was one of hys disciples sayd vnto hym : master suffre me fyrst to go and burye my father .
40008022	But Iesus sayd vnto him : folowe me and let the deed burie their deed .
40008023	And he entred in to a shyppe and his disciples folowed him .
40008024	And beholde there arose a a greate tepest in ye see in so moche yt the shippe was covered wt waves and he was a slepe .
40008025	And his disciples came vn to him and awoke hym sayinge : master save vs we perishe .
40008026	And he sayd vnto them : why are ye fearfull o ye of lytell faithe ? Then he arose and rebuked ye wyndes and the see and ther folowed a greate calme .
40008027	And the men marveyled and sayd : what man is this that bothe wyndes and see obey hym ?
40008028	And when he was come to ye other syde in to ye coutre of ye Gergesites ther met him two possessed of devylles which came out of the graves and were out of measure fearce so yt no ma myght go by that waye .
40008029	And behold they cryed out sayinge : O Iesu the sonne of God what have we to do with the ? Art thou come hyther to tormet vs before the tyme be come ?
40008030	And ther was a good waye of fro them a greate heerd of swyne fedinge .
40008031	Then ye devyles besought him sayinge : if thou cast vs out suffre vs to go oure waye in to the heerd of swyne .
40008032	And he sayd vnto the : go youre wayes . Then wet they out and departed into ye heerd of swyne And beholde ye whoale heerd of swyne was caryed wt violence hedlinge in to the see and perisshed in ye water .
40008033	Then ye heerdme fleed and wet their ways in to ye cyte and tolde every thinge and what had fortuned vnto the possessed of the devyls .
40008034	And beholde all the cyte came out and met Iesus . And when they sawe hym they besought hym to departe oute of their costes .
40009001	Then he entred in to a shippe and passed over and came in to his awne cite .
40009002	And lo they brought to him a ma sicke of ye palsie lyinge in his bed . And when Iesus sawe ye faith of the he sayd to the sicke of ye palsie : sonne be of good chere thy sinnes be forgeve the .
40009003	And beholde certeyne of ye scribes sayd in the selves this ma blasphemeth .
40009004	And whe Iesus sawe their thoughtes he sayd : wherfore thinke ye evill in youre hertes ?
40009005	Whether ys esyer to saye thy synnes be forgeven ye or to saye : arise and walke ?
40009006	That ye maye knowe that ye sonne of ma hath power to forgeve sinnes in erth then sayd he vnto ye sicke of ye palsye : arise take vp thy beed and go home to thine housse .
40009007	And he arose and departed to his awne housse .
40009008	And when ye people sawe it they marveyled and glorified god which had geve suche power to me .
40009009	And as Iesus passed forth fro thence he sawe a ma syt a receyuinge of custome named Mathew and sayd to him : folowe me .
40009010	And he arose and folowed him . And it came to passe as he sat at meate in the housse : beholde many publicans and synners came and sate downe also with Iesus and hys disciples .
40009011	When the Pharises sawe that they sayd to hys disciples : why eateth youre master wt publicans and synners ?
40009012	When Iesus herde that he sayde vnto them : The whole neade not the phisicion but they that are sicke .
40009013	Goo and learne what that meaneth : I have pleasure in mercy and not in offerynge . For I am not come to call the rightewes but the synners to repentaunce .
40009014	Then came ye disciples of Ihon to hym sayinge : why do we and the Pharises fast ofte : but thy disciples fast not ?
40009015	And Iesus sayde vnto them : Can ye weddynge chyldren morne as longe as ye bridegrome is wt them ? The tyme will come whe the bridegrome shalbe take fro them and then shall they faste .
40009016	Noo man peceth and olde garment with a pece of newe cloothe . For then taketh he awaye ye pece agayne from the garmet and the rent ys made greater .
40009017	Nether do men put newe wyne into olde vessels for then the vessels breake and the wyne runneth oute and the vessels perysshe . But they powre newe wyne into newe vessels and so are both saved togeder .
40009018	Whyls he thus spake vnto the beholde ther came a certayne ruler and worshipped him sayinge : my doghter is euen now deceased but come and lay thy honde on her and she shall live .
40009019	And Iesus arose and folowed hym with hys disciples .
40009020	And beholde a woman which was diseased wt an yssue of bloude . xii . yeres came behynde hym and toched ye hem of hys vesture .
40009021	For she sayd in her silfe : yf I maye toche but even his vesture only I shalbe safe .
40009022	Then Iesus tourned him about and behelde her sayinge : Doughter be of good conforte thy faith hath made the safe . And she was made whole even that same houre .
40009023	And when Iesus came into ye rulers housse and sawe the minstrels and the people raginge
40009024	he sayde vnto them : Get you hence for ye mayde is not deed but slepeth . And they laughed hym to scorne .
40009025	Assone as ye people were put forthe he went in and toke her by ye hond and the mayde arose .
40009026	And this was noysed through out all that lande .
40009027	And as Iesus departed thence two blynde men folowed hym crying and saying : O thou sonne of David have mercy on vs .
40009028	And when he was come to housse the blynd came to hym And Iesus sayde vnto them : Beleve ye that I am able to do thys ? And they sayde vnto hym : ye Lorde .
40009029	Then touched he their eyes saying : acordynge to youre faythe be it vnto you .
40009030	And their eyes were opened . And Iesus charged the saying : Se yt no man knowe of it .
40009031	But they assone as they were departed spreed abroade his name through oute all the londe .
40009032	As they went out beholde they brought to hym a dome ma possessed af a devyll .
40009033	And as sone as the devyll was cast oute the domme spake : And the people merveled sayinge : it was never so sene in Israel .
40009034	But the Pharises sayde : he casteth oute devyls by the power of the chefe devyll .
40009035	And Iesus went about all cities and tounes teachynge in their synagoges and preachyng the glad tidinges of ye kyngdome and healinge all maner sicknes and desease amoge ye people .
40009036	But when he sawe the people he had copassion on the because they were pyned awaye and scattered abroade eve as shepe havige no shepherd .
40009037	Then sayde he to hys disciples : the hervest is greate but the laborers are feawe .
40009038	Wherfore praye the Lorde of the harvest to sende forthe laborers into hys harvest .
40010001	And he called his . xii . disciples vnto hym and gave them power over vnclene sprites to cast them oute and to heale all maner of sicknesses and all maner of deseases .
40010002	The names of the . xii . Apostles are these . The fyrst Simon called also Peter : and Andrew his brother . Iames the sonne of zebede aud Ihon his brother .
40010003	Philip and Bartlemew . Thomas and Mathew the Publican . Iames the sonne of Alphe and Lebbeus otherwyse called Taddeus .
40010004	Simon of Cane and Iudas Iscarioth which also betrayed hym .
40010005	These . xii . sent Iesus and comaunded them sayinge : Go not in to ye wayes yt leade to the gentyls and in to ye cities of ye Samaritans enter ye not .
40010006	But go rather to ye lost shepe of the housse of Israel .
40010007	Go and preach sayinge : yt the kyngdome of heve is at hande .
40010008	Heale the sicke clense the lepers rayse the deed caste oute the devils . Frely ye have receved frely geve agayne .
40010009	Posses not golde nor silver nor brassse yn youre gerdels
40010010	nor yet scrip towardes your iorney : nether two cotes nether shues nor yet a staffe . For the workma is worthy to have his meate .
40010011	In to whatsoever cite or toune ye shall come enquyre who ys worthy yn it and there abyde till ye goo thence .
40010012	And whe ye come in to an housse salute ye same .
40010013	And yf the housse be worthy youre peace shall come apon it . But yf it be not worthy youre peace shall retourne to you agayne .
40010014	And whosoever shall not receave you nor will heare youre preachynge : when ye departe oute of yt housse or that cite shake of the duste of youre fete .
40010015	Truly I say vnto you : it shalbe easier for the londe of zodoma and Gomorra in the daye of iudgement then for that cite .
40010016	Beholde I sende you forthe as shepe amoge wolves . Be ye therfore wyse as serpetes and innocent as doves .
40010017	Beware of men for they shall deliver you vp to ye cousels and shall scourge you in their synagoges .
40010018	And ye shall be brought to the heed rulers and kynges for my sake in witnes to them and to the gentyls .
40010019	But when they delyver you vp take no thought how or what ye shall speake for yt shalbe geve you eve in that same houre what ye shall saye .
40010020	For it is not ye that speke but ye sprite of your father which speaketh in you .
40010021	The brother shall betraye the brother to deeth and the father the sonne . And the chyldre shall aryse agaynste their fathers and mothers and shall put them to deethe :
40010022	and ye shall be hated of all me for my name . But he that endureth to the ende shalbe saved .
40010023	When they persecute you in one cite flye in to another . I tell you for a treuth ye shall not fynysshe all yt cities of Israel tyll ye sonne of man be come .
40010024	The disciple ys not above hys master : nor yet ye servaut above his lorde .
40010025	It is ynough for the disciple to be as hys master ys and that the servaunt be as his lorde ys . yf they have called the lorde of the housse beelzebub : how moche more shall they call them of his housholde so ?
40010026	Feare the not therfore . There is no thinge so close that shall not be openned and no thinge so hyd that shall not be knowen .
40010027	What I tell you in dercknes that speake ye in lyght . And what ye heare in the eare that preache ye on the housse toppes .
40010028	And feare ye not them which kyll the body and be not able to kyll the soule . But rather feare hym which is able to destroye bothe soule and body into hell .
40010029	Are not two sparowes solde for a farthinge ? And none of them dothe lyght on the grounde with out youre father .
40010030	And now are all the heeris of youre heedis numbred .
40010031	Feare ye not therfore : ye are of more value then many sparowes .
40010032	Who soever therfore shall knowledge me before men hym will I knowledge also before my father which is in heuen .
40010033	But whoso ever shall denye me before men hym will I also denye before my father which is in heven .
40010034	Thynke not that I am come to sende peace into the erth . I came not to send peace but a swearde .
40010035	For I am come to set a man at varyaunce ageynst hys father and the doughter ageynst hyr mother and the doughterlawe ageynst her motherlawe :
40010036	And a mannes fooes shalbe they of hys owne housholde .
40010037	He that lovith hys father or mother more then me is not mete for me . And he that loveth his sonne or doughter more then me is not mete for me .
40010038	And he yt taketh not his crosse and foloweth me ys not mete for me .
40010039	He that fyndeth hys lyfe shall lose it : and he that losith hys lyfe for my sake shall fynde it .
40010040	He that receavith you receavith me : and he that receavith me receavith him that sent me .
40010041	He that receavith a prophet in ye name of a prophet shall receave a prophetes rewarde . And he that receavith a righteous man in the name of a righteous man shall receave the rewarde of a righteous man .
40010042	And whosoever shall geve vnto one of these lytle ones to drincke a cuppe of colde water only in the name of a disciple : I tel you of a trueth he shall not lose his rewarde .
40011001	And it came to passe when Iesus had made an ende of comaundinge his . xii . disciples that he departed thence to teache and to preache in their cities .
40011002	When Ihon beinge in preson hearde ye workes of Christ he sent two of his disciples
40011003	and sayde vnto him . Arte thou he that shall come : or shall we loke for another .
40011004	Iesus answered and sayde vnto them . Go and shewe Ihon what ye have hearde and sene .
40011005	The blynd se the halt goo the lepers are clensed : the deef heare the ded ryse ageyne and the glad tidinges is preached to the povre .
40011006	And happy is he that is not offended by me .
40011007	And as they departed Iesus begane to speake vnto the people of Ihon . What for to se wet ye out in to the wyldernes ? wet ye out to se a rede shake with ye wynde ?
40011008	other what wet ye out for to se ? A man clothed in soofte raymet : ? Beholde they yt weare soofte clothig are in kynges howses .
40011009	But what wet ye oute for to se ? A prophete ? Ye I saye to you and more the a prophete .
40011010	For this is he of who it is wrytte . Beholde I sende my messenger before thy face which shall prepare thy waye before ye .
40011011	Verely I saye vnto you amonge ye chyldren of wemen arose there not a gretter then Ihon the baptist . Notwithstondinge he that ys lesse in the kyngdome of heven ys gretter then he .
40011012	From the tyme of Ihon Baptist hytherto ye kyngdome of heve suffreth violence and they that go to it with violence pluck it vnto them .
40011013	For all the prophetes and the lawe prophesyed vnto to the tyme of Ihon .
40011014	Also yf ye wyll receave it this is Helyas which shuld come .
40011015	He yt hathe eares to heare let him heare .
40011016	But wher vnto shall I lyken this generacion ? It ys lyke vnto chyldre which syt in the market and call vnto their felowes
40011017	and saye : we have pyped vnto you and ye have not daunsed ? We have morned vnto you and ye have not sorowed .
40011018	For Ihon came nether eatinge nor drinkinge and they saye he hath the devyll .
40011019	The sonne of man came eatinge and drinkinge and they saye beholde a glutton and drynker of wyne and a frend vnto publicas and synners . Never the later wysdome ys iustified of hir children .
40011020	Then bega he to vpbrayd the cities in which most of his miracles were done because they meded not .
40011021	Wo be to ye Chorasin . Wo be to ye Betzaida : for if the miracles which were shewd in you had bene done in Tyre and Sidon they had repented longe agone in sackcloth and asshes .
40011022	Neverthelesse I say to you : it shall be esier for Tyre and Sidon at the day of iudgemet then for you .
40011023	And thou Capernau which art lift vp vnto heve shalt be brought doune to hell . For if the miracles which have bene done in the had bene shewed in zodom : they had remayned to this daye .
40011024	Neverthelesse I saye vnto you : it shalbe easiar for ye londe of zodo in the daye of iudgemet the for ye .
40011025	At yt tyme Iesus answered and sayd : I prayse ye o father lorde of heve and erth because thou hast hid these thinges fro the wyse and prudet and hast opened the vnto babes :
40011026	eve so father for so it pleased ye .
40011027	All thinges are geve vnto me of my father . And noma knoweth ye sonne but ye father : nether knoweth eny ma ye father save ye sonne and he to whome ye sonne will ope him .
40011028	Come vnto me all ye that laboure and are laden and I wyll ease you .
40011029	Take my yoke on you and lerne of me for I am meke and lowly in herte : and ye shall fynd rest vnto youre soules .
40011030	For my yoke is easy and my burden is light .
40012001	In that tyme went Iesus on the Sabot dayes thorow the corne and his disciples were anhogred and begane to plucke the eares of coorne and to eate .
40012002	When ye pharises sawe that they sayde vnto him : Beholde thy disciples do that which is not lawfull to do apon ye saboth daye .
40012003	He sayde vnto the : Haue ye not reed what David did whe he was anhougered and they also which were with him ?
40012004	How he entred into the housse of God and ate ye halowed loves which were not lawfull for him to eate nether for the which were wt him but only for ye prestes .
40012005	Or have ye not reed in ye lawe how that ye prestes in ye temple breake the saboth daye and yet are blamlesse ?
40012006	But I saye vnto you : that here is one greater then ye teple .
40012007	Wherfore yf ye had wist what this sayinge meneth : I require mercy and not sacrifice : ye wold never have condened innocetes .
40012008	For ye sonne of man is lord even of ye saboth daye .
40012009	And he departed thence and went into their synagoge :
40012010	and beholde ther was a man whiche had his hande dryed vp . And they axed him sayinge : ys it lawfull to heale apon ye saboth dayes ? because they myght acuse him .
40012011	And he sayde vnto the : whiche of you wolde it be yf he had a shepe fallen into a pitte on ye saboth daye that wolde not take him and lyft him out ?
40012012	And how moche is a man better the a shepe ? Wherfore it is lefull to do a good dede on the saboth dayes .
40012013	Then sayde he to ye ma : stretch forth thy had . And he stretched it forthe . And it was made whole agayne lyke vnto ye other .
40012014	Then ye Pharyses wet out and helde a cousell agaynst hym how they myght destroye hym .
40012015	When Iesus knewe yt he departed thece and moche people folowed him and he healed the all
40012016	and charged the that they shuld not make him knowe :
40012017	to fulfyll that which was spoden by Esay ye Prophet which sayeth .
40012018	Beholde my chylde who I have chosen my beloved in who my soule deliteth . I wyll put my sprete on hym and he shall shewe iudgemet to ye gentyls .
40012019	He shall not stryve he shall not crye nether shall eny man heare his voyce in ye streetes
40012020	a brosed rede shall he not breacke and flaxe that begynneth to burne he shall not queche tyll he sende forth iudgement vnto victory
40012021	and in hys name shall the gentyls truste .
40012022	Then was brought to hym one possessed with a devyll which was both blynde and domme : and he healed hym insomoch that he which was blynd and domme both spake and sawe .
40012023	And all the people were amased and sayde : Ys not this that sonne of David ?
40012024	But when the Pharises hearde that they sayde : This felow dryveth ye devyls no nother wyse oute but by the helpe of Belzebub ye chefe of the devyls .
40012025	But Iesus knewe their thoughtes and sayde to the . Every kingdome devided wt in it sylfe shalbe brought to naught . Nether shall eny cite or housholde devyded agest it sylfe cotynue .
40012026	So if sata cast out sata the is he devyded agenst him sylfe . How shall then his kyngdome endure ?
40012027	Also if I by ye helpe of Belzebub cast oute devyls : by whose helpe do youre chyldren cast them out ? Therfore they shalbe youre iudges .
40012028	But if I cast out the devyls by the sprite of God : then is the kyngdome of god come on you ?
40012029	Ether how can a ma enter into a stroge manes housse and violently take awaye his goodes : excepte he fyrst binde ye stroge man and the spoyle his housse ?
40012030	He that is not wt me is agaynst me . And he yt gaddereth not wt me scattereth abrode .
40012031	Wherfore I say vnto you all maner of synne and blasphemy shalbe forgeven vnto men : but the blasphemy of ye sprite shall not be forgeven vnto men .
40012032	And whoso ever speaketh a worde agaynst the sonne of man it shalbe forgeven him . But whosoever speaketh agaynst the holy goost it shall not be forgeven hym : no nether in this worlde nether in the worlde to come .
40012033	Ether make ye tree good and his frute good also : or els make ye tree evyll and his frute evyll also . For ye tree is knowe by his frute .
40012034	O generacio of viperes how can ye saye well whe ye youre selves are evyll ? For of ye aboundace of the hert ye mouthe speaketh .
40012035	A good ma oute of ye good treasure of his hert bringeth forth good thynges . And an evyll man out of his evyll treasure bringeth forth evyll thinges .
40012036	But I say vnto you that of every ydell worde that men shall have spoken : they shall geve acountes at the daye of iudgement .
40012037	For by thy wordes thou shalt be iustifyed : and by thy wordes thou shalt be condemned .
40012038	Then answered certeyne of the scribes and of the Pharises sayinge : Master we wolde fayne se a sygne of ye .
40012039	He answered and sayde to the : The evyll and advoutrous generacio seketh a signe but ther shall no signe be geve to the saue the signe of the Prophete Ionas .
40012040	For as Ionas was thre dayes and thre nyghtes in the whales belly : soo shall ye sonne of man be thre dayes and thre nyghtes in ye hert of ye erth .
40012041	The men of Ninivie shall rise at the daye of iugdement with this nacion and condemne them : for they amended at ye preachinge of Ionas . And beholde a greater then Ionas is here .
40012042	The quene of ye south shall ryse at ye daye of iudgement with this generacion and shall condemne the : for she came fro the vtmost parties of the worlde to heare the wysdome of Salomon . And beholde a greater then Salomo is here .
40012043	When the vnclene sprite is gone out of a man he walketh throughout dry places seking reest and fyndeth none .
40012044	Then he sayeth : I will retourne ageyne into my housse fro whece I came oute . And when he is come he fyndeth the housse empty and swepte and garnisshed .
40012045	Then he goeth his waye and taketh vnto him seven other spretes worsse then himsilfe and so entre they in and dwell there . And the ende of that man is worsse then the beginning . Even so shall it be with this evell nacion .
40012046	Whill he yet talked to the people : beholde his mother and his brethren stode without desyringe to speake with him .
40012047	Then one sayde vnto hym : beholde thy mother and thy brethre stonde without desiringe to speke wt the .
40012048	He answered and sayd to him that tolde hym : Who is my mother ? or who are my brethren ?
40012049	And he stretched forth his hond over his disciples and sayd : behold my mother and my brethren .
40012050	For whosoever dothe my fathers will which is in heve the same is my brother suster and mother .
40013001	The same daye wet Iesus out of ye house and sat by the seesyde
40013002	and moch people resorted vnto him so gretly yt he wet and sat in a shippe and all the people stode on ye shoore .
40013003	And he spake many thynges to the in similitudes sayinge : Beholde ye sower wet forth to sowe .
40013004	And as he sowed some fell by ye wayessyde and the fowlles came and devoured it vp .
40013005	Some fell apo stony groude where it had not moche erth and a none it sproge vp because it had no depth of erth :
40013006	and when ye sunne was vp it cauht heet and for lake of rotynge wyddred awaye .
40013007	Some fell amoge thornes and the thornes sproge vp and chooked it .
40013008	Parte fell in good groud and brought forth good frute : some an hudred fold some sixtie fold some thyrty folde .
40013009	Whosoever hath eares to heare let him heare .
40013010	And the disciples came and sayde to him : Why speakest thou to the in parables ?
40013011	He answered and sayde vnto them : it is geve vnto you to knowe ye secretes of the kyngdome of heve but to the it is not geve .
40013012	For whosoever hath to him shall be geven : and he shall have aboundance . But whosoever hath not : fro hym shalbe takyn awaye even that he hath .
40013013	Therfore speake I to them in similitudes : for though they se they se not : and hearinge they heare not : nether vnderstonde .
40013014	And in the is fulfilled ye Prophesie of Esayas which prophesie sayth : with the eares ye shall heare and shall not vnderstonde and with the eyes ye shall se and shall not perceave .
40013015	For this peoples hertes are wexed grosse and their eares were dull of herynge and their eyes have they closed lest they shulde se with their eyes and heare with their eares and shuld vnderstonde with their hertes and shuld tourne that I myght heale them .
40013016	But blessed are youre eyes for they se : and youre eares for they heare .
40013017	Verely I say vnto you that many Prophetes and perfaicte me have desired to se tho thinges which ye se and have not sene the : and to heare tho thinges which ye heare and have not herde the .
40013018	Heare ye therfore ye similitude of the sower .
40013019	Whosoever heareth the worde of ye kingdome and vnderstondeth it not ther cometh the evyll ma and catcheth awaye yt which was sowne in his hert . And this is he which was sowne by the wayesyde .
40013020	But he yt was sowne in ye stony groude is he which heareth the worde of God and anone wt ioye receaveth it
40013021	yet hath he no rottes in him selfe and therfore dureth but a season : for assone as tribulacion or persecucion aryseth because of the worde by and by he falleth .
40013022	He yt was sowne amoge thornes is he yt heareth ye worde of God : but the care of this worlde and the dissaytfulnes of ryches choke ye worde and so is he made vnfrutfull .
40013023	He which is sowne in ye good grounde is he yt heareth ye worde and vnderstodeth it which also bereth frute and bringeth forth some an . C . folde some sixtie folde and some . xxx . folde .
40013024	Another similitude put he forth vnto the sayinge : The kyngdome of heve is lyke vnto a man which sowed good seed in his felde .
40013025	But whyll men slepte ther came his foo and sowed tares amoge ye wheate and wet his waye .
40013026	When ye blade was sproge vp and had brought forth frute the appered ye tares also .
40013027	The servauntes came to the housholder and sayde vnto him : Syr sowedest not thou good seed in thy closse fro whece the hath it tares ?
40013028	He sayde to the the envious ma hath done this . Then ye servauntes sayde vnto him : wilt thou then yt we go and gader them ?
40013029	But he sayde nay lest whill ye go aboute to wede out ye tares ye plucke vppe also wt them ye wheate by ye rottes :
40013030	let bothe growe to gether tyll harvest come and in tyme of harvest I wyll saye to the repers gather ye fyrst ye tares and bind the in sheves to be bret : but gather the wheete into my barne .
40013031	Another parable he put forthe vnto the sayinge . The kyngdome of heve is lyke vnto a grayne of mustard seed which a ma taketh and soweth in his felde
40013032	which is ye leest of all seedes . But when it is groune it is the greatest amoge yerbes and it is a tree : so yt the bryddes of the ayer come and bylde in the brauches of it .
40013033	Another similitude sayde he to them . The kyngdome of heven is lyke vnto leve which a woman taketh and hydeth in . iii . peckes of meele tyll all be levended .
40013034	All these thynge spake Iesus vnto the people by similitudes and with oute similitudes spake he nothinge to them
40013035	to fulfyll that which was spoke by the Prophet sayinge : I wyll ope my mouth in similitudes and wyll speake forth thinges which have bene kepte secrete from the begynninge of the worlde .
40013036	Then sent Iesus ye people awaye and came to housse . And his disciples came vnto him sayinge : declare vnto vs the similitude of the tares of the felde .
40013037	Then answered he and sayde to them . He that soweth the good seed is the sonne of man .
40013038	And ye felde is the worlde . And the chyldre of the kingdome they are ye good seed . And the tares are the chyldren of ye wicked .
40013039	And the enemye that soweth the is ye devell . The harvest is ye end of the worlde . And the repers be ye angels .
40013040	For eve as the tares are gaddred and bret in ye fyre : so shall it be in ye ende of this worlde .
40013041	The sonne of man shall send forth his angels and they shall gather out of his kyngdome all thinges that offende and them which do iniquite
40013042	and shall cast them into a furnes of fyre . There shalbe waylynge and gnasshing of teth .
40013043	Then shall the iuste men shyne as bryght as the sunne in ye kyngdome of their father . Whosoever hath eares to heare let him heare .
40013044	Agayne ye kyngdome of heve is lyke vnto treasure hidde in the felde ye which a man fyndeth and hideth : and for ioy therof goeth and selleth all that he hath and byeth that felde .
40013045	Agayne ye kyngdome of heve is lyke vnto a marchaunt that seketh good pearles
40013046	which when he had founde one precious pearle wet and solde all that he had and bought it .
40013047	Agayne the kyngdome of heve is lyke vnto a neet cast into ye see yt gadereth of all kyndes of fysshes :
40013048	which whe it is full men drawe to londe and sitte and gadre the good into vessels and cast the bad awaye .
40013049	So shall it be at the ende of the worlde . The angels shall come oute and sever the bad from the good
40013050	and shall cast them into a furnes of fyre : there shalbe waylinge and gnasshynge of teth .
40013051	Iesus sayde vnto them : vnderstonde ye all these thynges ? They sayde ye Lorde .
40013052	The sayde he vnto them : Therfore every scribe which is taught vnto the kyngdome of heve is lyke an housholder which bryngeth forth out of hys treasure thynges bothe new and olde .
40013053	And it came to passe when Iesus had finisshed these similitudes yt he departed thece
40013054	and came in to his awne coutre and taught them in their synagoges in so moche yt they were astonyed and sayde : whece cometh all this wysdome and power vnto him ?
40013055	Is not this the carpeters sonne ? Is not his mother called Mary ? and his brethre be called Iames and Ioses and Simo and Iudas ?
40013056	And are not his susters all here wt vs ? Whece hath he all these thynge .
40013057	And they were offended by him . The Iesus sayd to the a Prophet is not wt out honoure save in hys awne countre and amoge his awne kynne .
40013058	And he dyd not many miracles there for there vnbelefes sake .
40014001	At that tyme Herod the tetrarcha hearde of the fame of Iesu
40014002	and sayde vnto his servautes : This is Ihon ye baptist . He is risen agayne from deeth and therfore are soche myracles wrought by him .
40014003	For Herod had taken Ihon and bounde him and put him in preson for Herodias sake his brother Philips wyfe .
40014004	For Ihon sayde vnto him : Yt is not lawfull for the to have her .
40014005	And when he wold have put him to deeth he feared the people because they counted him as a prophet .
40014006	But when Herodes birth daye was come the doughter of Herodias daunsed before them and pleased Herod .
40014007	Wherfore he promised wt an oth that he wolde geve hir whatsoever she wolde axe .
40014008	And she beinge informed of her mother before sayde : geve me here Ihon baptistes heed in a platter .
40014009	And ye kynge sorowed . Neverthelesse for his othes sake and for their sakis which sate also at ye table he comaunded yt to be geven hir :
40014010	and sent and beheeded Ihon in the preson
40014011	and his heed was brought in a platter and geven to the damsell and she brought it to her mother .
40014012	And his disciples came and toke vp his body and buryed it : and went and tolde Iesus .
40014013	When Iesus hearde that he departed thence by shippe in to a desert place out of ye waye . And when the people had hearde therof they folowed him afote out of their cities .
40014014	And Iesus went forth and sawe moche people and his herte did melte vpon them and he healed of them those that were sicke .
40014015	When even was come his disciples came to him sayinge . This is a deserte place and the daye is spent : let the people departe yt they maye go into ye tounes and bye them vytayllis .
40014016	But Iesus sayde vnto them . They have no neade to go awaye . Geve ye the to eate .
40014017	Then sayde they vnto him : we have here but . v . loves and two fysshes .
40014018	And he sayde : bringe the hyther to me .
40014019	And he comaunded ye people to syt downe on ye grasse : and toke ye . v . loves and the . ii . fysshes and loked vp to heven and blessed and brake and gave the loves to his disciples and the disciples gave them to ye people .
40014020	And they dyd all eate and were suffised . And they gadered vp of ye gobbetes that remayned vii . basketes full .
40014021	And they yt ate werein nobre about . v . M . men besyde wemen and chyldren .
40014022	And strayght waye Iesus made his disciples enter into a shippe and to goo over before him whill he sent ye people awaye .
40014023	And assone as he had sent the people awaye he went vp into a moutayne alone to praye . And when nyght was come he was there himsilf alone .
40014024	And the shippe was now in the middes of the see and was toost with waves for it was a cotrary wynde .
40014025	In the fourthe watche of ye night Iesus came vnto them walkynge on the see .
40014026	And when his disciples sawe him walkynge on the see they were troubled sayinge : it is some spirite and cryed out for feare .
40014027	And streyght waye Iesus spake vnto them sayinge : be of god cheare it is I be not afrayed .
40014028	Peter answered him and sayde : master if thou be he bid me come vnto the on the water .
40014029	And he sayde come . And when Peter was come doune out of ye shippe he walked on ye water to go to Iesus .
40014030	But when he sawe a myghty wynde he was afrayed . And as he beganne to synke he cryed sayinge : master save me .
40014031	And immediatly Iesus stretched forth his hode and caught him and sayde to him : O thou of lytell faith wherfore diddest thou dout ?
40014032	And assone as they were come in to ye shippe ye wynde ceassed .
40014033	Then they that were in the shippe came and worshipped him sayinge : of a truth thou arte ye sonne of God .
40014034	And when they were come over they went in to ye londe of Genazareth .
40014035	And when ye men of yt place had knowledge of him they sent out in to all yt countre rounde about and brought vnto him all that were sicke
40014036	and besought him that they myght touche the hemme of his vesture only . And as many as touched it were made safe .
40015001	Then came to Iesus scribes and pharises from Ierusalem sayinge :
40015002	why do thy disciples transgresse the tradicios of ye elders ? for they wesshe not their hondes when they eate breed .
40015003	He answered and sayde vnto them : why do ye also transgresse ye comaundment of God thorowe youre tradicions ?
40015004	For God comaunded sayinge : honoure thy father and mother and he that cursseth father or mother shall suffer deeth .
40015005	But ye saye every ma shall saye to his father or mother : That which thou desyrest of me to helpe ye with : is geven God :
40015006	and so shall he not honoure his father or his mother . And thus haue ye made yt the comaundment of God is with out effecte through youre tradicios .
40015007	Ypocrites well prophesyed of you Esay sayinge :
40015008	This people draweth nye vnto me with their mouthes and honoureth me with their lippes howbe it their hertes are farre from me :
40015009	but in vayne they worshippe me teachinge doctrines whiche are nothing but mens precepts .
40015010	And he called the people vnto him and sayde to them : heare and vnderstande .
40015011	That which goeth into the mouth defyleth not ye man : but that which commeth out of the mouth defyleth the man .
40015012	Then came his disciples and sayde vnto him . Perceavest thou not how that the pharises are offended in hearinge thys sayinge ?
40015013	He answered and sayde : all plantes which my hevely father hath not planted shalbe plucked vp by the rotes .
40015014	Let them alone they be the blynde leaders of the blynde . If the blynde leede the blynde boothe shall fall into the dyche .
40015015	Then answered Peter and sayd to him : declare vnto vs this parable .
40015016	Then sayde Iesus : are ye yet with oute vnderstondinge ?
40015017	perceave ye not that what soever goeth in at the mouth descendeth doune in to the bely and is cast out into the draught ?
40015018	But those thingis which procede out of the mouth come from the herte and they defyle the man .
40015019	For out of the herte come evyll thoughtis murder breakyng of wedlocke whordo theefte falce witnes berynge blasphemye .
40015020	These are the thingis which defyle a man . But to eate with vnwesshen hondes defyleth not a man .
40015021	And Iesus went thence and departed in to the costis of Tyre and Sidon .
40015022	And beholde a woman which was a Cananite came out of ye same coostis and cryed vnto him sayinge : have mercy on me Lorde the sonne of David my doughter is pytiously vexed with a devyll .
40015023	And he gave her never a worde to answer . Then came to him his disciples and besought him sayinge : sende her awaye for she foloweth vs cryinge .
40015024	He answered and sayde : I am not sent but vnto ye loost shepe of ye housse of Israel .
40015025	Then she came and worshipped him sayinge : master helpe me .
40015026	He answered and sayde : it is not good to take the chyldrens breed and to cast it to whelpes .
40015027	She answered and sayde : truthe Lorde : neverthelesse the whelpes eate of the cromes which fall from their masters table .
40015028	Then Iesus answered and sayde vnto her . O woman greate is thy faith be it to the even as thou desyrest . And her doughter was made whole even at that same houre .
40015029	Then Iesus went awaye from thence and came nye vnto the see of Galile and went vp in to a mountayne and sat doune there .
40015030	And moche people came vnto him havinge with the halt blynde domme maymed and other many : and cast them doune at Iesus fete . And he healed them
40015031	in so moche that the people wondred to se the dome speake the maymed whole the halt to go and ye blynde to se . And they glorified the God of Israel .
40015032	Then Iesus called his disciples to him and sayde : I have compassion on ye people becau se they have cotynued with me now . iii . dayes and have nought to eate : and I wyll not let them departe fastinge leste they perisshe in ye waye .
40015033	And his disciples sayd vnto him : whece shuld we get so moche breed in ye wildernes as shuld suffise so greate a multitude ?
40015034	And Iesus sayde vnto them : how many loves have ye ? And they sayde : seven and a feawe litle fysshes .
40015035	And he comaunded ye people to syt doune on ye grounde :
40015036	and toke the seven loves and the fysshes and gave thankes and brake them and gave to his disciples and the disciples gave them to the people .
40015037	And they dyd all eate and were suffised . And they toke vp of the broke meate that was lefte . vii . basketes full .
40015038	And yet they that ate were . iiii . M . men besyde wemen and chyldren .
40015039	And he sent awaye the people and toke shippe and came into the parties of Magdala .
40016001	Then came the pharises and saduces and did tempte him desyringe him to shewe them some signe from heve .
40016002	He answered and sayde vnto the . At even ye saye we shall have fayre wedder and yt because ye skye is reed :
40016003	and in the morninge ye saye to daye shalbe foule wedder and that because the skye is cloudy and reed . O ye ypocrites ye can discerne ye fassion of the skye : and can ye not discerne ye signes of the tymes ?
40016004	The frowarde nacion and advoutrous seketh a signe and there shall non other signe be geven vnto them but the signe of the prophet Ionas . So lefte he them and departed .
40016005	And when his disciples were come to the other side of the water they had forgotte to take breed with the .
40016006	Then Iesus sayd vnto them : Take hede and beware of the leve of ye Pharises and of ye Saduces .
40016007	And they thought in them selves sayinge : because we have brought no breed with vs .
40016008	When Iesus vnderstode that he sayd vnto the . O ye of lytell faith why are youre mindes cumbred because ye have brought no breed ?
40016009	Do ye not yet perceave nether remeber those . v . loves when there were . v . M . men and how many baskettes toke ye vp ?
40016010	Nether the . vii . loves when there were . iiiii . M . and how many baskettes toke ye vp ?
40016011	Why perceave ye not then yt I spake not vnto you of breed whe I sayde beware of the leven of the Pharises and of the Saduces ?
40016012	The vnderstode they how that he bad not them beware of the leven of breed : but of the doctrine of the Pharises and of the Saduces .
40016013	When Iesus cam in to the costes of the cite which is called Cesarea Philippi he axed his disciples sayinge : whom do men saye yt I the sonne of ma am ?
40016014	They saide some saye yt thou arte Ihon Baptist some Helias some Ieremias or one of ye prophetes .
40016015	He sayde vnto the : but who saye ye yt I am ?
40016016	Simo Peter answered and sayde : Thou arte Christ ye sonne of the lyvinge God .
40016017	And Iesus answered and sayde to him : happy arte thou Simon the sonne of Ionas for fleshe and bloud hath not opened vnto the yt but my father which is in heve .
40016018	And I saye also vnto the yt thou arte Peter : and apon this rocke I wyll bylde my congregacion . And the gates of hell shall not prevayle ageynst it .
40016019	And I wyll geve vnto the the keyes of the kyngdom of heven : and whatsoever thou byndest vpon erth shall be bounde in heven : and whatsoever thou lowsest on erthe shalbe lowsed in heven .
40016020	Then he charged his disciples yt they shulde tell no man yt he was Iesus Christ .
40016021	From yt tyme forth Iesus began to shewe vnto his disciples how yt he must go vnto Ierusalem and suffer many thinges of ye Elders and of ye hye prestes and of the scribes and must be killed and ryse agayne ye thirde daye .
40016022	But Peter toke him asyde and began to rebuke him sayinge : master faver thy sylfe this shall not come vnto the .
40016023	Then tourned he aboute and sayde vnto Peter : come after me Satan thou offendest me because thou sauourest not godly thinges but wordly thinges
40016024	Iesus then sayde to his disciples . If eny man wyll folowe me leet him forsake him sylfe and take vp his crosse and folowe me .
40016025	For who soever wyll save his lyfe shall loose it . And whosoever shall loose his lyfe for my sake shall fynde it .
40016026	What shall it proffet a man though he shulde wynne all the whoole worlde : yf he loose his owne soule ? Or els what shall a man geve to redeme his soule agayne with all ?
40016027	For the sonne of man shall come in the glory of his father wt his angels : and then shall he rewarde every man accordinge to his dedes .
40016028	Verely I saye vnto you some ther be amonge them that here stonde which shall not taste of deeth tyll they shall have sene the sonne of man come in his kyngdomen .
40017001	And after . vi . dayes Iesus toke Peter and Iames and Ihon his brother and brought them vp into an hye mountayne out of the waye
40017002	and was transfygured before them : and his face did shyne as the sunne and his clothes were as whyte as the light .
40017003	And beholde ther appered vnto the Moses and Helyas talkinge with him .
40017004	Then answered Peter and sayde to Iesus : master here is good beinge for vs . If thou wylt leet vs make here . iii . tabernacles one for the and one for Moses and one for Helyas .
40017005	Whyll he yet spake beholde a bright cloude shadowed them . And beholde there came a voyce out of ye cloude sayinge : this is my deare sonne in whom I delite heare him .
40017006	And when the disciples hearde that they fell on their faces and were soore afrayed .
40017007	And Iesus came and touched them and sayde : aryse and be not afrayed .
40017008	And when they looked vp they saw no man saue Iesus onely .
40017009	And as they came doune from the mountayne Iesus charged them sayinge : se yt ye shewe the vision to no man vntyll the sonne of man be rysen ageyne from deeth .
40017010	And his disciples axed of him sayinge : Why then saye the scribes yt Helyas muste fyrst come ?
40017011	Iesus answered and sayd vnto them : Helyas shall fyrst come and restore all thinges .
40017012	And I saye vnto you yt Helyas is come alredy and they knewe him not : but have done vnto him whatsoever they lusted . In lyke wyse shall also the sonne of man suffre of the .
40017013	Then ye disciples perceaved that he spake vnto them of Ihon baptist .
40017014	And when they were come to ye people ther cam to him a certayne man and kneled doune to him and sayde :
40017015	Master have mercy on my sonne for he is franticke : and is sore vexed . And oft tymes he falleth into the fyre and oft into ye water
40017016	And I brought him to thy disciples and they coulde not heale him .
40017017	Iesus answered and sayde : O generacion faythles and croked : how longe shall I be with you ? how longe shall I suffre you ? bring him hidder to me .
40017018	And Iesus rebuked the devyll and he ca out of him . And ye child was healed even yt same houre .
40017019	Then came the disciples to Iesus secretly and sayde : Why could not we cast him out ?
40017020	Iesus sayd vnto the : Because of youre vnbelefe For I saye veryly vnto you : yf ye had faythe as a grayne of musterd seed ye shuld saye vnto this moutayne remove hence to yonder place and he shuld remove : nether shuld eny thinge be vnpossible for you to do .
40017021	How be it this kynde goeth not oute but by prayer and fastinge .
40017022	As they passed the tyme in Galile Iesus sayde vnto them : the sonne of man shalbe betrayed into the hondes of men
40017023	and they shall kill him and the thyrd daye he shall ryse agayne . And they sorowed greatly .
40017024	And when they were come to Capernau they yt were wont to gadre poll money came to Peter and sayde : Doth youre master paye tribute ?
40017025	He sayd : ye . And when he was come into the house Iesus spake fyrst to him saying What thinkest thou Simon ? of whome do ye kynges of the erth take tribute or poll money ? of their chyldren or of straungers ?
40017026	Peter sayde vnto him : of straungers . Then sayd Iesus vnto him agayne : Then are the chyldren fre .
40017027	Neverthelesse lest we shuld offende the : goo to ye see and cast in thyne angle and take the fysshe yt fyrst cometh vp : and when thou hast opened his mouthe thou shalt fynde a pece of twentie pence : yt take and paye for me and the .
40018001	The same tyme the disciples came vnto Iesus saying : who is ye greatest in the kyngdome of heve ?
40018002	Iesus called a chylde vnto him and set him in the middes of them :
40018003	and sayd . Verely I say vnto you : except ye tourne and become as chyldren ye cannot enter into the kyngdom of heven .
40018004	Whosoever therfore humble him sylfe as this chylde the same is the greatest in ye kyngdome of heve .
40018005	And who soever receaveth suche a chylde in my name receaveth me .
40018006	But whosoever offende one of these lytelons which beleve in me : it were better for him that a milstone were hanged aboute his necke and that he were drouned in the depth of the see .
40018007	Wo be vnto the world because of offences . How be it it cannot be avoided but yt offences shalbe geven . Neverthelesse woo be to ye man by who the offence cometh .
40018008	Wherfore yf thy honde or thy fote offende the cut him of and cast him from the . It ys better for the to enter into lyfe halt or maymed rather then thou shuldest havinge two hondes or two fete be cast into everlasting fyre .
40018009	And yf also thyne eye offende the plucke him oute and caste him from the . It is better for the to enter into lyfe with one eye then havyng two eyes to be cast into hell fyre .
40018010	Se that ye despise not one of these litelons . For I saye vnto you yt in heven their angels alwayes behold the face of my father which is in heven .
40018011	Ye and the sonne of man is come to saue that which is lost .
40018012	How thinke ye ? Yf a man have an hondred shepe and one of them be gone astray dothe he not leve nynty and nyne in ye moutains and go and seke that one which is gone astray ?
40018013	If it happen that he fynd him veryly I say vnto you : he reioyseth more of that shepe then of the nynty and nyne which went not astray .
40018014	Even so it is not the wyll of youre father in heven that one of these lytelons shulde perishe .
40018015	Moreover yf thy brother treaspace agenst the . Go and tell him his faute betwene him and the alone . Yf he heare the thou hast wone thy brother :
40018016	But yf he heare the not then take yet with the one or two that in the mouth of two or thre witnesses all thinges maye be stablisshed .
40018017	If he heare not them tell it vnto the congregacion . If he heare not ye congregacion take him as an hethen man and as a publican .
40018018	Verely I say vnto you what soever ye bynde on erth shalbe bounde in heven . And what soever ye lowse on erth shalbe lowsed in heven .
40018019	Agayn I say vnto you that yf two of you shall agre in erth apon eny maner thynge what soever they shall desyre : it shalbe geven them of my father which is in heven .
40018020	For where two or thre are gathered togedder in my name there am I in the myddes of them .
40018021	Then came Peter to him and sayde : master howe ofte shall I forgeve my brother yf he synne agaynst me seven tymes ?
40018022	Iesus sayd vnto him : I saye not vnto the seven tymes : but seventy tymes seven tymes .
40018023	Therfore is ye kingdome of heven lykened vnto a certayne kynge which wolde take a countis of his servauntis .
40018024	And when he had begone to recken one was broughte vnto him whiche ought him ten thousande talentis :
40018025	whome be cause he had nought to paye his master commaunded him to be solde and his wyfe and his chyldren and all that he had and payment to be made .
40018026	The servaunt fell doune and besought him sayinge : Sir geve me respyte and I wyll paye it every whit .
40018027	Then had the Lorde pytie on that servaunt and lowsed him and forgave him the det .
40018028	And ye sayde servaut wet oute and founde one of his felowes which ought him an hundred pence and leyed hondes on him and toke him by the throote sayinge : paye me yt thou owest .
40018029	And his felowe fell doune and besought him sayinge : have pacience with me and I wyll paye the all .
40018030	And he wolde not but went and cast him into preson tyll he shulde paye the det .
40018031	When his other felowes sawe what was done they were very sory and came and tolde vnto their lorde all yt had happened .
40018032	Then his lorde called him and sayde vnto him . O evyll servaut I forgave the all that det because thou prayedst me : was it not mete also yt thou
40018033	shuldest have had copassion on thy felow even as I had pitie on ye ?
40018034	And his lorde was wrooth and delyuered him to the iaylers tyll he shnld paye all that was due to him .
40018035	So lyke wyse shall my hevenly father do vnto you except ye forgeve with youre hertes eache one to his brother their treaspases .
40019001	And it came to passe when Iesus had fynisshed those sayinges he gat him from Galile and came into the coostes of Iewry beyonde Iordan
40019002	and moche people folowed him and he healed them theare .
40019003	Then came vnto him the pharises temtinge him and sayinge to him : Ys it lawfull for a man to put awaye his wyfe for all maner of causes ?
40019004	He answered and sayd vnto them : Have ye not redde how that he which made man at the beginninge made them man and woman
40019005	and sayde : for this thinge shall a ma leve father and mother and cleve vnto his wyfe and they twayne shalbe one flesshe .
40019006	Wherfore now are they not twayne but one flesshe . Let not man therfore put a sunder that which God hath cuppled to gedder .
40019007	The sayde they to him : why did Moses comaunde to geve a testimoniall of divorsemet and to put hyr awaye ?
40019008	He sayde vnto them : Moses because of the hardnes of youre hertes suffred you to put awaye youre wyfes : But from ye beginnynge it was not so .
40019009	I saye therfore vnto you whosoever putteth awaye his wyfe ( except it be for fornicacion ) and maryeth another breaketh wedlocke . And whosoever maryeth her which is divorsed doeth commyt advoutry .
40019010	Then sayde his disciples to him : yf the mater be so betwene man and wyfe then is it not good to mary .
40019011	He sayde vnto them : all me can not awaye with that sayinge save they to whom it is geve .
