40019012	Ther are chaste which were so borne out of their mothers belly . And ther are chaste which be made of men . And ther be chaste which have made them selves chaste for the kyngdome of heves sake . He that can take it let him take it .
40019013	Then were brought to him yonge chyldre that he shuld put his hondes on them and praye And the disciples rebuked them .
40019014	But Iesus sayde : suffre the chyldren and forbid them not to come to me : for of suche is the kyngdome of heven .
40019015	And when he had put his hondes on them he departed thence .
40019016	And beholde one came and sayde vnto him : good master what good thinge shall I do that I maye have eternall lyfe ?
40019017	He sayde vnto him : why callest thou me good ? there is none good but one and that is God . But yf thou wylt entre in to lyfe kepe the commaundementes .
40019018	The other sayde to him Which ? And Iesus sayde : breake no wedloke kill not steale not : beare not falce witnes :
40019019	honoure father and mother : and love thyne neighbour as thy sylfe .
40019020	And the younge man sayde vnto him : I have observed all these thingis from my youth what lacke I yet ?
40019021	And Iesus sayde vnto him yf thou wylt be perfecte goo and sell that thou hast and geve it to the povre and thou shalt have treasure in heven and come and folowe me .
40019022	When ye younge ma hearde yt sayinge he wet awaye mourninge . For he had greate possessions .
40019023	Then Iesus sayde vnto his disciples : Verely I saye vnto you : yt is harde for a ryche ma to enter into ye kyngdome of heaven .
40019024	And moreover I saye vnto you : it is easier for a camell to go through the eye of a nedle then for a ryche man to enter into the kyngdome of God .
40019025	When his disciples hearde that they were excedingly amased sayinge : who then can be saved ?
40019026	Iesus behelde the and sayde vnto them : with men this is vnpossible but with God all thinges are possible .
40019027	Then answered Peter and sayde to him : Beholde we have forsaken all and folowed the what shall we have ?
40019028	Iesus sayde vnto them : verely I saye to you : when the sonne of man shall syt in ye seate of his maieste ye which folowe me in ye seconde generacion shall syt also vpon . xii . seates and iudge ye . xii . tribes of Israel .
40019029	And whosoever forsaketh housses or brethren or systers other father or mother or wyfe or chyldren or landes for my names sake ye same shall receave an hundred folde and shall inheret everlastynge lyfe .
40019030	Many that are fyrste shalbe laste and the laste shalbe fyrste .
40020001	For the kyngdome of heven ys lyke vnto an houssholder which went out erly in the morninge to hyre labourers into hys vyneyarde .
40020002	And he agreed wt the labourers for a peny a daye and sent them into his vyneyarde .
40020003	And he went out about the thyrde houre and sawe other stonding ydell in the marketplace
40020004	and sayd vnto them go ye also into my vyneyarde : and whatsoever is right I will geve you . And they went there waye .
40020005	Agayne he wet out about the sixte and nynthe houre and dyd lyke wyse .
40020006	And he went out aboute the eleventhe houre and founde other stondynge ydell and sayde vnto them : Why stonde ye here all the daye ydell ?
40020007	They sayde vnto hym : because no man hath hyred vs . He sayde to them : goo ye alsoo into my vyneyarde and whatsoever is right that shall ye receave .
40020008	When even was come the lorde of the vyneyarde sayde vnto hys steward : call the labourers and geve them their hyre beginnyng at ye laste tyll thou come to ye fyrste .
40020009	And they whiche were hyred aboute the eleventhe houre came and receaved every man a peny .
40020010	Then came ye fyrst supposyng yt they shuld receave moare : and they likewyse receaved every man a peny .
40020011	And when they had receaved it they murmured agaynst the good man of the housse
40020012	saying : These laste have wrought but one houre and thou hast made them equall vnto vs which have born ye burthe and heet of the daye .
40020013	He answered to one of the sayinge : frende I do the no wronge : dyddest thou not agre wt me for a peny ?
40020014	Take that which is thy duty and go thy waye . I will geve vnto this last as moche as to the .
40020015	Ys it not lawfull for me to do as me listeth with myne awne ? Ys thyne eye evyll because I am good ?
40020016	Soo the laste shalbe fyrste and the fyrste shalbe laste . For many are called and feawe be chosen .
40020017	And Iesus ascended to Ierusalem and toke the . xii . disciples a parte in the waye and sayde to the .
40020018	Beholde we goo vp to Ierusalem and the sonne of ma shalbe betrayed vnto ye chefe prestes and vnto the scribes and they shall condene him to deeth
40020019	and shall delyvre him to the getils to be mocked to be scourged and to be crucified : and ye thyrd daye he shall ryse agayne .
40020020	Then came to hym the mother of zebedes chyldren with her sonnes worshippynge him and desyringe a certayne thinge of him .
40020021	And he sayd vnto her : what wilt thou have ? She sayde vnto him : Gravnte that these my two sonnes may sit ye one on thy right hond and the other on ye lifte hond in thy kyngdome .
40020022	Iesus answered and sayd : Ye wot not what ye axe . Are ye able to drynke of the cuppe yt I shall drynke of and to be baptised wt the baptyme that I shalbe baptised with ? They answered to him that we are .
40020023	And he sayd vnto the : Ye shall drinke of my cvp and shalbe baptised with the baptyme that I shalbe baptised with . But to syt on my ryght hond and on my lyst hond is not myne to geve : but to them for whom it is prepared of my father .
40020024	And when the ten hearde this they disdayned at ye two brethre :
40020025	But Iesus called them vnto him and sayde : Ye knowe yt the lordes of the gentyls have dominacio over them . And they that are great exercise power over the .
40020026	It shall not be so amoge you . But whosoever wyll be greate amoge you let him be youre minister :
40020027	and whosoever wil be chefe let him be youre servaut
40020028	eve as the sonne of man came not to be ministred vnto but to minister and to geve his lyfe for the redempcion of many .
40020029	And as they departed fro Hierico moche people folowed him .
40020030	And beholde two blinde men sittinge by ye waysyde whe they hearde Iesus passe by cryed sayinge : Thou Lorde ye sonne of David have mercy on vs .
40020031	And ye people rebuked them be cause they shulde holde their peace . But they cryed ye moare sayinge : have mercy on vs thou Lorde which arte ye sonne of David .
40020032	Then Iesus stode styll and called the and sayde : what will ye that I shulde do to you :
40020033	They sayd to him : Lorde that oure eyes maye be opened .
40020034	Iesus had copassion on the and touched their eyes . And immediatly their eyes receaved syght . And they folowed him .
40021001	When they drewe neye vnto Ierusalem and were come to Betphage vnto mounte olivete : then sent Iesus two of his disciples
40021002	saiynge to the . Go in to the toune that lyeth over agaynste you and anone ye shall fynde an asse bounde and her colte with her : lose them and bringe them vnto me .
40021003	And if eny man saye ought vnto you saye ye yt the lorde hath neade of them : and streyght waye he will let them go .
40021004	All this was done to fulfyll that which was spoken by the Prophet sayinge :
40021005	Tell ye the doughter of Sion : beholde thy kynge cometh vnto the meke and sittinge vpon an asse and a colte the fole of an asse vsed to the yooke .
40021006	The disciples went and dyd as Iesus comaunded them
40021007	and brought ye asse and the colte and put on them their clothes and set him theron .
40021008	And many of the people spreed their garmentes in ye waye . Other cut doune braunches fro the trees and strawed them in the waye .
40021009	Moreover the people that went before and they also that came after cryed sayinge : Hosanna to ye sonne of David . Blessed be he that cometh in the name of the Lorde Hosanna in the hyest .
40021010	And when he was come in to Ierusalem all the cyte was moved sayinge : who is this ?
40021011	And the people sayde : this is Iesus the Prophet of Nazareth a cyte of Galile .
40021012	And Iesus went in to the temple of God and cast out all them that soulde and bought in the temple and overthrew the tables of the mony chaugers and the seates of them that solde doves
40021013	and sayde to them : It is wrytten my housse shalbe called the housse of prayer . But ye have made it a denne of theves .
40021014	And the blinde and the halt came to him in ye teple and he healed the .
40021015	When the chefe prestes and scribes sawe the marveylles that he dyd and the chyldren cryinge in the teple and sayinge Hosanna to the sonne of David they disdayned
40021016	and sayde vnto him : hearest thou what these saye ? Iesus sayde vnto them yee : have ye never redde of the mouth of babes and suckelinges thou haste ordeyned prayse ?
40021017	And he lefte the and wet out of ye cite vnto Bethanie and had his abydige there .
40021018	In the mornynge as he returned in to the cyte ageyne he hungred
40021019	and spyed a fygge trre in the waye and came to it and founde nothinge theron but leves only and sayd to it never frute growe on the hence forwardes . And ano the fygge tree wyddered awaye .
40021020	And when his disciples sawe that they marveled sayinge : Howe sone is the fygge tree wyddered awaye ?
40021021	Iesus answered and sayde vnto the : Verely I saye vnto you yf ye shall have faith and shall not dout ye shall not only do that which I have done to the fygge tree : but also yf ye shall saye vnto this moutayne take thy silfe awaye and cast thy silfe into the see it shalbe done .
40021022	And whatsoever ye shall axe in prayer ( if ye beleve ) ye shall receave it .
40021023	And when he was come into the teple the chefe prestes and the elders of the people came vnto him as he was teachinge and sayde : by what auctorite doest thou these thinges ? and who gave the this power ?
40021024	Iesus answered and sayde vnto them : I also will axe of you a certayne question which if ye assoyle me I in lyke wyse wyll tell you by what auctorite I do these thinges .
40021025	The baptime of Iohn : whence was it ? fro heve or of men ? Then they reasoned amoge them selves sayinge : yf we shall saye fro heven he will saye vnto vs : why dyd ye not then beleve hym ?
40021026	But and if we shall saye of men then feare we the people . For all men helde Iohn as a Prophet .
40021027	And they answered Iesus and sayde : we cannot tell . And he lyke wyse sayd vnto them : nether tell I you by what auctorite I do these thinges .
40021028	What saye ye to this ? A certayne man had two sonnes and came to ye elder and sayde : sonne go and worke to daye in my vineyarde .
40021029	He answered and sayde I will not : but afterwarde repented and went .
40021030	Then came he to the second and sayde lyke wyse . And he answered and sayde : I will syr : yet wet not .
40021031	Whether of the twayne dyd the will of the father ? And they sayde vnto hym : the fyrst . Iesus sayde vnto the : verely I saye vnto you that the publicans and the harlotes shall come into ye kyngdome of God before you .
40021032	For Iohn came vnto you in the waye of rightewesnes and ye beleved hym not . But the publicans and the harlotes beleved him . And yet ye ( though ye sawe it ) were not yet moved with repentaunce that ye myght afterwarde have beleved hym .
40021033	Herken another similitude . Ther was a certayne housholder which planted a vineyarde and hedged it roude about and made a wynpresse in it and bilt a tower and let it out to husbandmen and wet in to a straunge coutre .
40021034	And when the tyme of the frute drewe neare he sent his servauntes to the husbandmen to receave the frutes of it .
40021035	And ye husbandme caught his servauntes and bet one kylled another and stoned another .
40021036	Agayne he sent other servantes moo then the fyrst : and they served them lyke wyse .
40021037	But last of all he sent vnto the his awne sonne sayinge : they will feare my sonne .
40021038	But when the husbandmen sawe the sonne they sayde amoge the selves : This is the heyre : come let vs kyll him and let vs take his inheritaunce to oure selves .
40021039	And they caught him and thrust him out of the vineyarde and slewe him .
40021040	When the lorde of the vyneyarde commeth what will he do wt those husbandme ?
40021041	They sayde vnto him : he will cruellye destroye those evyll persons and wyll let out his vyneyarde vnto other husbandmen which shall delyver him the frute at tymes convenient
40021042	Iesus sayde vnto the : dyd ye never redde in the scriptures ? The stone which ye bylders refused ye same is set in ye principall parte of ye corner : this was the lordes doinge and yt is mervelous in oure eyes .
40021043	Therfore saye I vnto you the kyngdome of God shalbe take from you and shalbe geve to the getyls which shall brynge forth the frutes of it .
40021044	And whosoever shall fall on this stone he shalbe broken but on whosoever it shall fall vpon it will grynde him to powder .
40021045	And when the chefe prestes and Pharises hearde these similitudes they perceaved yt he spake of the .
40021046	And they wet about to laye hondes on him but they feared ye people because they tooke him as a Prophet .
40022001	And Iesus answered and spake vnto them agayne in similitudes sayinge .
40022002	The kingdome of heve is lyke vnto a certayne kynge which maryed his sonne
40022003	and sent forth his servantes to call them that were byd to the weddinge and they wolde not come .
40022004	Ageyne he sent forth other servauntes sayinge : Tell them which are bydden : beholde I have prepared my dynner myne oxen and my fatlinges are kylled and all thinges are redy come vnto the mariage .
40022005	But they made light of it and went their wayes : one to his ferme place another about his marchaundise
40022006	the remnaunt toke his seruantes and intreated them vngodly and slewe them .
40022007	When the kinge hearde that he was wroth and send forth his warryers and distroyed those murtherers and brent vp their cyte .
40022008	Then sayde he to his servauutes : the weddinge was prepared . But they which were bydden were not worthy .
40022009	Go ye therfore out into ye hyewayes and as many as ye finde byd them to the mariage .
40022010	The seruauntes wet out into the hiewayes and gaddered to gedder as many as they coulde fynde both good and bad and ye weddinge was furnysshed with gestes .
40022011	Then the kynge came in to viset the gestes and spyed there a ma which had not on a weddinge garment
40022012	and sayde vnto him : frende how fortuned it that thou camest in hither and hast not on a weddyng garment ? And he was eve spechlesse .
40022013	Then sayde the kynge to his ministers : take and bynde hym hand and fote and caste hym into vtter darcknes there shalbe wepinge and gnasshinge of teth .
40022014	For many are called and feawe be chosen .
40022015	Then wet the Pharises and toke counsell how they might tagle him in his wordes .
40022016	And they sent vnto him their disciples with Herodes servauntes sayinge : Master we knowe yt thou are true and teachest the waye of god trulie nether carest for eny man for thou consydrest not menes estate .
40022017	Tell vs therfore : how thynkest thou ? Is it lawfull to geve tribute vnto Cesar or not ?
40022018	Iesus perceaved their wikednes and sayde : Why tempte ye me ye ypocrites ?
40022019	Let me se ye tribute money . And they toke hym a peny .
40022020	And he sayde vnto them : whose is this ymage and superscripcion ?
40022021	They sayde vnto him : Cesars . Then sayde he vnto them . Geve therfore to Cesar that which is Cesars : and geve vnto god that which is goddes .
40022022	When they hearde that they marveled and lefte hym and went there waye .
40022023	The same daye the Saduces came to him ( which saye that there is no resurrcecion ) and axed him
40022024	sayinge : Master Moses bade yf a man dye havinge no chyldre that the brother mary his wyfe and reyse vp seed vnto his brother .
40022025	Ther were wt vs seven brethre and the fyrste maried and deceased wt oute yssue and lefte his wyfe vnto his brother .
40022026	Lykewise the seconde and ye thryd vnto the sevethe .
40022027	Laste of all the woman dyed also .
40022028	Now in the resurreccion whose wyfe shall she be of the seven ? For all had her .
40022029	Iesus answered and sayde vnto the : ye are deceaved and vnderstonde not the scriptures nor yet the power of God .
40022030	For in the resurreccion they nether mary nor are maryed : but are as the angels of God in heven .
40022031	As touchynge the resurreccion of the deed : have ye not redde what is sayde vnto you of God which sayeth :
40022032	I am Abrahams God and Ysaacks God and the God of Iacob ? God is not the God of the deed : but of the lyvinge .
40022033	And when the people hearde that they were astonyed at his doctrine .
40022034	When the Pharises had hearde how yt he had put the Saduces to silence they drewe to gedder
40022035	and one of them which was a doctoure of lawe axed a question teptinge h m and sayinge :
40022036	Master which is ye chefe comaundment in the lawe ?
40022037	Iesus sayde vnto him : love the Lorde thy God wt all thine herte with all thy soule and with all thy mynde .
40022038	This is the fyrst and the chefe comaundement .
40022039	And ther is another lyke vnto this . Love thyne neghbour as thy selfe .
40022040	In these two commaundemetes hange all the lawe and the Prophetes .
40022041	Whyll the Pharises were gaddered togeder Iesus axed
40022042	the sayinge : what thinke ye of Christ ? Whose sonne is he ? They sayde vnto him : the sonne of David .
40022043	He sayde vnto the : how then doeth David in spirite call him Lorde sayinge ?
40022044	The Lorde sayde to my Lorde syt on my right honde : tyll I make thyne enemyes thy fote stole .
40022045	Yf David call him Lorde : how is he then his sonne ?
40022046	And none coulde answere him ageyne one worde : nether dueste eny from that daye forth axe him eny moo questions .
40023001	Then spake Iesus to the people and to his disciples
40023002	sayinge . The Scribes and the Pharises sit in Moses seate .
40023003	All therfore whatsoever they byd you observe that observe and do : but after their workes do not :
40023004	For they saye and do not . Ye and they bynde hevy burthes and grevous to be borne and ley the on menes shulders : but they themsylfes will not heave at them with one of their fyngers .
40023005	All their workes they do for to be sene of me . They set abroade their philateries and make large borders on there garmetes
40023006	and love to sit vppermooste at feastes and to have the chefe seates in the synagoges
40023007	and gretinges in the marketes and to be called of men Rabi .
40023008	But ye shall not suffre youre selves to be called Rabi . For one is youre master that is to wyt Christ and all ye are brethre .
40023009	And call no man youre father vpon the erth for there is but one youre father and he is in heven .
40023010	Be not called masters for there is but one youre master and he is Christ .
40023011	He that is greatest amoge you shalbe youre seruaunte .
40023012	But whosoever exalteth himsilfe shalbe brought lowe . And he yt hubleth himsilfe shalbe exalted .
40023013	Wo be vnto you Scribes and Pharises ypocrites for ye shutte vp the kyngdome of heve before men : ye youre selves goo not in nether suffre ye them that come to enter in .
40023014	Wo be vnto you Scribes and Pharises ypocrites : ye devoure widdowes houses and that vnder a coloure of praying longe prayers : wherfore ye shall receave greater damnacion .
40023015	Wo be vnto you Scribes and Pharises ypocrites which compasse see and londe to bringe one in to youre belefe : and when he ys brought ye make him two folde more the chylde of hell then ye youre selves are .
40023016	Wo be vnto you blynd gides which saye whosoever sweare by the teple it is no thinge : but whosoever sweare by the golde of the temple he offendeth .
40023017	Ye foles and blinde ? whether is greater the golde or the teple that sanctifieth ye golde .
40023018	And whosoever sweareth by the aulter it is nothinge : but whosoever sweareth by ye offeringe yt lyeth on ye aultre offendeth .
40023019	Ye foles and blinde : whether is greater ye offeringe or ye aultre which sanctifieth ye offeringe ?
40023020	Whosoever therfore sweareth by ye aultre sweareth by it and by all yt there on is .
40023021	And whosoever sweareth by the teple sweareth by it and by hym yt dwelleth therin .
40023022	And he that sweareth by heve swereth by the seate of God and by hym that sytteth theron .
40023023	Wo be to you Scribes and Pharises ypocrites which tythe mynt annyse and comen and leave the waygthtyer mattres of ye lawe vndone : iudgemet mercy and fayth . These ought ye to have done and not to have left the othre vndone .
40023024	Ye blinde gydes which strayne out a gnat and swalowe a cammyll .
40023025	Wo be to you scribes and pharises ypocrites which make clene ye vtter syde of the cuppe and of the platter : but within they are full of brybery and excesse .
40023026	Thou blinde Pharise clense fyrst the outsyde of the cup and platter that the ynneside of them maye be clene also .
40023027	Wo be to you Scribe and Pharises ypocrite for ye are lyke vnto paynted tombes which appere beautyfull outwarde : but are wt in full of deed bones and of all fylthynes .
40023028	So are ye for outwarde ye appere righteous vnto me when within ye are full of ypocrisie and iniquite .
40023029	Wo be vnto you Scribes and Pharises ypocrites : ye bylde the tombes of the Prophetes and garnisshe the sepulchres of the righteous
40023030	and saye : Yf we had bene in the dayes of oure fathers we wolde not have bene parteners with them in the bloud of the Prophetes .
40023031	So then ye be witnesses vnto youre selfes that ye are the chyldren of them which killed the prophetes .
40023032	Fulfill ye lyke wyse the measure of youre fathers .
40023033	Yee serpentes and generacion of vipers how shuld ye scape ye dapnacio of hell ?
40023034	Wherfore beholde I sende vnto you prophetes wyse men and scribes and of the ye shall kyll and crucifie : and of the ye shall scourge in youre synagoges and persecute from cyte to cyte
40023035	that vpon you maye come all the righteous bloude that was sheed vpon the erth fro the bloud of righteous Abell vnto ye bloud of zacharias the sonne of Barachias who ye slewe betwene the teple and ye altre .
40023036	Verely I say vnto you all these thinges shall light vpon this generacion .
40023037	Hierusalem hierusalem which kyllest prophetes and stonest the which are sent to the : how often wolde I have gadered thy chyldren to gether as the henne gadreth her chickes vnder her winges but ye wolde not :
40023038	Beholde youre habitacio shalbe lefte vnto you desolate .
40023039	For I saye to you ye shall not se me heceforthe tyll that ye saye : blessed is he that cometh in the name of ye Lorde .
40024001	And Iesus went out and departed fro the teple : and his disciples came to hym for to shewe him the byldinge of the teple .
40024002	Iesus sayde vnto the : se ye not all these thinges ? Verely I saye vnto you : ther shall not be here lefte one stone vpon another that shall not be cast doune .
40024003	And as he sat vpon the mout Olivete his disciples came vnto hym secretely sayinge . Tell vs when these thinges shalbe ? And what signe shalbe of thy comynge and of the ende of the worlde ?
40024004	And Iesus answered and sayde vnto them : take hede that no ma deceave you .
40024005	For many shall come in my name sayinge : I am Christ and shall deceave many .
40024006	Ye shall heare of warres and of the fame of warres : but se yt ye be not troubled . For all these thinges must come to passe but the ende is not yet .
40024007	For nacio shall ryse ageynste nacio and realme ageynste realme : and ther shalbe pestilence honger and erthquakes in all quarters .
40024008	All these are the beginninge of sorowes .
40024009	Then shall they put you to trouble and shall kyll you : and ye shalbe hated of all nacions for my names sake .
40024010	And then shall many be offended and shall betraye one another and shall hate one the other .
40024011	And many falce Prophetes shall aryse and shall deceave many .
40024012	And because iniquite shall have the vpper hande the love of many shall abate .
40024013	But he that endureth to the ende the same shalbe safe .
40024014	And this gladtidingees of the kyngdome shalbe preached in all the worlde for a witnes vnto all nacions : and then shall the ende come .
40024015	When ye therfore shall se ye abhominacio that betokeneth desolacion spoken of by Daniell the Prophet stonde in ye holy place : let him that redeth it vnderstonde it .
40024016	Then let them which be in Iury flye into the moutaynes .
40024017	And let him which is on ye housse toppe not come downe to fet eny thinge out of his housse .
40024018	Nether let him which is in ye felde returne backe to fetche his clothes .
40024019	Wo be in those dayes to the that are wt chylde and to the yt geve sucke .
40024020	But praye yt youre flight be not in ye winter nether on ye saboth daye .
40024021	For then shalbe greate tribulacio suche as was not fro the beginninge of the worlde to this tyme ner shalbe .
40024022	Ye and except those dayes shuld be shortened there shuld no fleshe be saved : but for ye chosens sake those dayes shalbe shortened .
40024023	Then yf eny ma shall saye vnto you : lo here is Christ or there is Christ : beleve it not .
40024024	For there shall arise false christes and false prophete and shall do great myracles and wondres . In so moche yt if it were possible ye verie electe shuld be deceaved .
40024025	Take hede I have tolde you before .
40024026	Wherfore if they shall saye vnto you : beholde he is in ye desert go not forth : beholde he is in ye secret places beleve not .
40024027	For as ye lightninge cometh out of ye eest and shyneth vnto the weest : so shall the comynge of the sonne of ma be .
40024028	For wheresoever a deed karkas is eve thyther will the egles resorte .
40024029	Immediatly after the tribulacios of those dayes shall the sunne be derkened : and ye mone shall not geve hir light and the starre shall fall from heve and the powers of heve shall move .
40024030	And then shall appere the sygne of the sonne of man in heven . And then shall all the kynreddes of the erth morne and they shall se the sonne of man come in the cloudes of heven with power and greate glorie .
40024031	And he shall sende his angeles with the greate voyce of a trope and they shall gader to gether his chosen from the fower wyndes and from the one ende of the worlde to the other .
40024032	Learne a similitude of the fygge tree : when his braunches are yet tender and his leves sproge ye knowe that sommer is nye .
40024033	So lyke wyse ye when ye see all these thynges be ye sure that it is neare even at the dores .
40024034	Verely I saye vnto you that this generacion shall not passe tyll all these be fulfilled .
40024035	Heven and erth shall perisshe : but my wordes shall abyde .
40024036	But of that daye and houre knowith no man no not ye angels of heve but my father only .
40024037	As the tyme of Noe was so lyke wyse shall the cominge of ye sonne of man be .
40024038	For as in ye dayes before ye floud : they dyd eate and drynke mary and were maried eve vnto ye daye that Noe entred into the shyppe
40024039	and knewe of nothynge tyll the floude came and toke them all awaye . So shall also the commynge of the sonne of man be .
40024040	Then two shalbe in the feldes the one shalbe receaved and the other shalbe refused
40024041	two shalbe gryndinge at ye myll : ye oue shalbe receaved and ye other shalbe refused .
40024042	Wake therfore because ye knowe not what houre youre master wyll come .
40024043	Of this be sure that yf the good man of the housse knewe what houre the thefe wolde come : he wolde suerly watche and not suffre his housse to be broke vppe .
40024044	Therfore be ye also redy for in ye houre ye thinke he wolde not : wyll the sonne of ma come .
40024045	If there be any faithfull servaut and wyse whome his master hath made ruler over his housholde to geve the meate in season covenient :
40024046	happy is that servaunt whom his master ( when he cometh ) shall finde so doinge .
40024047	Verely I saye vnto you he shall make him ruler over all his goodes .
40024048	But and yf that evill servaut shall saye in his herte my master wyll defer his comynge
40024049	and beginne to smyte his felowes ye and to eate and to drinke with the dronke :
40024050	that servauntes master wyll come in adaye when he loketh not for him and in an houre yt he is not ware of
40024051	and wyll devyde him and geve him his rewarde with ypocrites . There shalbe wepinge and gnasshinge of tethe .
40025001	Then ye kyngdome of heven shalbe lykened vnto . x . virgins which toke their lampes and wet to mete the brydgrome :
40025002	fyve of them were folysshe and fyve were wyse .
40025003	The folysshe toke their lampes but toke none oyle wt the .
40025004	But ye wyse tooke oyle wt the in their vesselles wt their lampes also .
40025005	Whill the brydgrome taryed all slombred and slepte .
40025006	And even at mydnyght there was a crye made : beholde the brydgrome cometh goo out against him .
40025007	Then all those virgins arose and prepared their lampes .
40025008	And ye folysshe sayde to ye wyse : geve vs of youre oyle for our lampes goo out ?
40025009	but ye wyse answered sayinge . Not so lest ther be not ynough for vs and you : but goo rather to them yt sell and by for youre selves .
40025010	And whill they went to bye ye brydgrome came : and they yt were redy went in with him to ye weddinge and the gate was shett vp :
40025011	Afterwardes came also ye other virgins sayinge : master master open to vs .
40025012	But he answered and sayde : verely I saye vnto you : I knowe not you .
40025013	Watche therefore : for ye knowe nether the daye nor yet the houre when the sonne of man shall come .
40025014	Lykwyse as a certeyne ma redy to take his iorney to a straunge coutre called his servautes and delivered to them his gooddes .
40025015	And vnto one he gave . v . talentes to another . ii . and to another one : to every man after his abilite and streyght waye departed .
40025016	Then he that had receaved the fyve talentes went and bestowed them and wanne other fyve talentes .
40025017	Lykwyse he that receaved . ii . gayned other . ii .
40025018	But he yt receaved ye one went and digged a pit in the erth and hyd his masters money .
40025019	After a longe season ye lorde of those servauntes came and rekened with the .
40025020	Then came he yt had receaved fyve talentes and brought other fyve talentes sayinge : master thou deliveredst vnto one fyve talentes : beholde I have gayned wt the fyve talentes moo .
40025021	The his master sayde vnto him : well good servaut and faithfull . Thou hast bene faithfull in lytell I will make the ruler over moche : entre in into thy masters ioye .
40025022	Also he that receaved . ii . talentes came and sayde : master thou deliveredest vnto me . ii . talentes : beholde I have wone . ii . other talentes with them .
40025023	And his master sayde vnto him well good servaunt and faithfull . Thou hast bene faithfull in lytell I wyll make the ruler over moche : go in into thy masters ioye .
40025024	Then he which had receaved ye one talent came and sayd : master I considered yt thou wast an harde man which repest where thou sowedst not and gadderest where thou strawedst not
40025025	and was therfore afrayde and went and hyd thy talent in ye erth : Beholde thou hast thyn awne .
40025026	His master answered and sayde vnto him : thou evyll servaut and slewthfull thou knewest yt I repe where I sowed not and gaddre where I strawed not :
40025027	thou oughtest therfore to have had my money to ye chaugers and then at my comynge shulde I have receaved myne awne with vauntage .
40025028	Take therfore the talent from him and geve it vnto him which hath . x . talentes .
40025029	For vnto every man that hath shalbe geven and he shall have aboundance : and from him that hath not shalbe taken awaye even that he hath .
40025030	And cast yt vnprofitable servaunt into vtter dercknes : there shalbe wepynge and gnasshinge of teeth .
40025031	When the sonne of ma cometh in his glorie and all the holy angels wt him then shall he syt vpon the seate of his glorie
40025032	and before him shalbe Gaddred all nacions . And he shall seperate the one from a nother as a shepherde deuideth the shepe from the gootes .
40025033	And he shall set the shepe on his right honde and the gotes on the lyfte .
40025034	Then shall the kynge saye to them on his right honde : Come ye blessed chyldren of my father inheret ye the kyngdo prepared for you from the beginninge of the worlde .
40025035	For I was anhongred and ye gave me meate . I thursted and ye gave me drinke . I was herbourlesse and ye lodged me .
40025036	I was naked and ye clothed me . I was sicke and ye visited me . I was in preson and ye came vnto me .
40025037	Then shall ye righteous answere him sayinge master whe sawe we ye anhongred and feed the ? or a thurst and gave ye drinke ?
40025038	when sawe we ye herbourlesse and lodged the ? or naked and clothed the ?
40025039	or when sawe we the sicke or in preson and came vnto the ?
40025040	And ye kynge shall answere and saye vnto them : verely I saye vnto you : in as moche as ye have done it vnto one of ye leest of these my brethren ye have done it to me .
40025041	Then shall the kynge saye vnto them that shalbe on the lyfte hande : departe from me ye coursed into everlastinge fire which is prepared for the devyll and his angels .
40025042	For I was an hungred and ye gave me no meate . I thursted and ye gave me no drinke .
40025043	I was herbourlesse and ye lodged me not . I was naked and ye clothed me not . I was sicke and in preson and ye visited me not .
40025044	Then shall they also answere him sayinge : master when sawe we the an hungred or a thurst or herbourlesse or naked or sicke or in preson and did not ministre vnto the ?
40025045	Then shall he answere the and saye : Verely I saye vnto you in as moche as ye did it not to one of ye leest of these ye did it not to me .
40025046	And these shall go into everlastinge payne : And the righteous into lyfe eternall .
40026001	And it came to passe when Iesus had fynisshed all these sayinges he sayd vnto his disciples :
40026002	Ye knowe that after ii . dayes shalbe ester and the sonne of man shalbe delyvered to be crucified .
40026003	Then assembled togedder the chefe prestes and the scribes and the elders of the people to the palice of the hye preste called Cayphas
40026004	and heelde a counsell how they mygt take Iesus by suttelte and kyll him .
40026005	But they sayd not on the holy daye lest eny vproure aryse amonge the people .
40026006	When Iesus was in Bethany in the house of Symon the leper
40026007	ther came vnto him a woman which had an alablaster boxe of precious oyntment and powred it on his heed as he sate at the bourde .
40026008	When his disciples sawe that they had indignacion sayinge : what neded this wast ?
40026009	This oyntmet myght have bene well solde and geven to the povre .
40026010	When Iesus vnderstod that he sayde vnto the : why trouble ye the woman ? She hath wrought a good worke apon me .
40026011	For ye shall have povre folcke alwayes with you : but me shall ye not have all wayes .
40026012	And in yt she casted this oyntment on my bodye she dyd it to burye me wt all .
40026013	Verely I saye vnto you wheresoever this gospell shalbe preached throughoute all the worlde there shall also this that she hath done be tolde for a memoriall of her .
40026014	Then one of the twelve called Iudas Iscarioth went vnto the chefe prestes
40026015	and sayd : what will ye geve me and I will deliver him vnto you ? And they apoynted vnto him thirty peces of sylver .
40026016	And from that tyme he sought oportunite to betraye him .
40026017	The fyrst daye of swete breed ye disciples cam to Iesus sayinge vnto him : where wylt thou that we prepare for ye to eate ye paschall lambe ?
40026018	And he sayd : Go into the cite vnto soche a man and saye to him : the master sayeth my tyme is at hande I will kepe myne ester at thy housse with my disciples .
40026019	And the disciples did as Iesus had apoynted them and made redy the esterlambe .
40026020	When the even was come he sate doune wt the . xii .
40026021	And as they dyd eate he sayde : Verely I saye vnto you that one of you shall betraye me .
40026022	And they were excedinge sorowfull and beganne every one of the to saye vnto him : is it I master ?
40026023	He answered and sayde : he yt deppeth his honde wt me in ye disshe the same shall betraye me .
40026024	The sonne of ma goeth as it is written of him : but wo be to yt ma by whom ye sonne of man shalbe betrayed . It had bene good for that man yf he had never bene borne .
40026025	Then Iudas wich betrayed him answered and sayde : is it I master ? He sayde vnto him : thou hast sayde .
40026026	As they dyd eate Iesus toke breed and gave thankes brake it and gave it to the disciples and sayde : Take eate this is my body .
40026027	And he toke the cup and thanked and gave it them sayinge : drinke of it every one .
40026028	For this is my bloude of the new testament that shalbe shedde for many for the remission of synnes .
40026029	I saye vnto you : I will not drinke hence forth of this frute of the vyne tree vntyll that daye when I shall drinke it new with you in my fathers kyngdome .
40026030	And when they had sayde grace they went out into mounte olyvete .
40026031	Then sayd Iesus vnto them : all ye shall be offended by me this night . For it is wrytten . I will smyte ye shepe herde and the shepe of ye flocke shalbe scattered abroode .
40026032	But after I am rysen ageyne I will goo before you into Galile .
40026033	Peter answered and sayde vnto him : though all men shulde be offended by ye yet wolde I never be offended .
40026034	Iesus sayde vnto him . Verely I saye vnto ye that this same night before the cocke crowe thou shalt denye me thryse .
40026035	Peter sayde vnto him : Yf I shulde dye with ye yet wolde I not denye ye Lyke wyse also sayde all ye disciples .
40026036	Then went Iesus with them into a place which is called Gethsemane and sayde vnto the disciples syt ye here whyll I go and praye yonder .
40026037	And he toke with him Peter and the two sonnes of zebede and began to wexe sorowfull and to be in an agonye .
40026038	Then sayd Iesus vnto them : my soule is hevy even vnto the deeth . Tary ye here and watche wt me .
40026039	And he went a lytell aparte and fell flat on his face and prayed sayinge : O my father yf it be possible let this cuppe passe from me : neverthelesse not as I wyll but as thou wylt .
40026040	And he came vnto the disciples and founde them a slepe and sayde to Peter : what coulde ye not watche with me one houre :
40026041	watche and praye that ye fall not into temptacion . The spirite is willynge but the flesshe is weake .
40026042	He went awaye once moare and prayed sayinge : O my father yf this cuppe can not passe away from me but yt I drinke of it thy wyll be fulfylled .
40026043	And he came and founde the a slepe agayne . For their eyes were hevy .
40026044	And he lefte them and went agayne and prayed ye thrid tyme sayinge ye same wordes .
40026045	Then came he to his disciples and sayd vnto them : Slepe hence forth and take youre reest . Take hede the houre is at honde and ye sonne of man shalbe betrayed into ye hondes of synners .
40026046	Ryse let vs be goinge : beholde he is at honde yt shall betraye me .
40026047	Whyll he yet spake : lo Iudas one of ye xii . came and wt him a greate multitude wt sweardes and staves sent from the chefe prestes and elders of the people .
40026048	And he that betrayed him had geven the a token sayinge : whosoever I kysse yt same is he ley hondes on him .
40026049	And forth wt all he came to Iesus and sayde : hayle master and kyssed him .
40026050	And Iesus sayde vnto him : frende wherfore arte thou come ? Then came they and layed hondes on Iesus and toke him .
40026051	And beholde one of them which were with Iesus stretched oute his honde and drue his swearde and stroke a servaunt of the hye preste and smote of his eare .
40026052	Then sayde Iesus vnto him : put vp thy swearde into his sheathe . For all that ley hond on ye swearde shall perisshe with ye swearde .
40026053	Ether thinkest thou that I cannot now praye to my father and he shall geve me moo then . xii . legions of angelles ?
40026054	But how then shuld the scriptures be fulfylled : for so must it be .
40026055	The same tyme sayd Iesus to the multitude : ye be come out as it were vnto a thefe with sweardes and staves for to take me . I sate daylie teachinge in the temple amoge you and ye toke me not .
40026056	All this was done that the scriptures of the Prophetes myght be fulfilled .
40026057	Then all the disciples forsoke him and fleed . And they toke Iesus and leed him to Cayphas the hye preeste where the Scribes and the Elders where assembled .
40026058	And Peter folowed him a farre of vnto the hye prestes place : and went in and sate with the servauntes to se the ende .
40026059	The chefe prestes and the elders and all the counsell sought false witnes agenste Iesus for to put him to deeth
40026060	but founde none : in somoche that when many false witnesses cam yet founde they none . At the last came two false witnesses
40026061	and sayd : This felowe sayde : I can distroye the temple of God and bylde it agayne in . iii . dayes .
40026062	And the chefe preste arose and sayde to him : answerest thou nothinge ? How is it yt these beare witnes ageynst the ?
40026063	But Iesus helde his peace : And the chefe Preeste answered and sayd to him : I charge the in the name of the lyvinge God that thou tell vs whether thou be Christ the sonne of God .
40026064	Iesus sayd to him : thou haste sayd . Neverthelesse I saye vnto you hereafter shall ye se the sonne of ma syttinge on the right honde of power and come in the clowddes of the skye .
40026065	Then the hye preste rent his clothes sayinge : He hath blasphemed : what nede we of eny moo witnesses ? Behold now ye have hearde his blasphemy :
40026066	what thinke ye ? They answered and sayd : he his worthy to dye .
40026067	Then spat they in his face and boffeted him with fistes . And other smote him with the palme af their hondes
40026068	on ye face sayinge : tell vs thou Christ who is he that smote the ?
40026069	Peter sate with out in the palice . And a damsell came to him sayinge : Thou also waste wt Iesus of Galilee :
40026070	but he denyed before the all sayinge : I woot not what thou sayst .
40026071	When he was goone out into the poorche another wenche sawe him and sayde vnto them that were there : This felowe was also with Iesus of Nazareth .
40026072	And agayne he denyed with an oothe that he knew the man .
40026073	And after a whyle came vnto him they yt stode bye and sayde vnto Peter : suerly thou arte even one of the for thy speache bewreyeth ye .
40026074	Then beganne he to course and to sweare that he knewe not the man . And immedyatly the cocke krewe .
40026075	And Peter remembred the wordes of Iesu which sayde vnto him : before the cocke crowe thou shalt deny me thryse : and went out at the dores and wepte bitterly .
40027001	When the mornynge was come all ye chefe prestes and the elders of ye people helde a counsayle agenst Iesu to put him to deeth
40027002	and brought him bounde and delivered him vnto Poncius Pilate the debite .
40027003	Then when Iudas which betrayed him sawe that he was condempned he repented him sylfe and brought ageyne the . xxx . plattes of sylver to ye chefe prestes and elders
40027004	sayinge : I have synned betrayinge the innocent bloud . And they sayde : what is that to vs ? Se thou to that .
40027005	And he cast doune the sylver plattes in the temple and departed and went and hounge him sylfe .
40027006	And the chefe prestes toke the sylver plattes and sayd : it is not lawfull for to put them in to the treasury because it is the pryce of bloud .
40027007	And they toke counsell and bought with them a potters felde to bury strangers in .
40027008	Wherfore that felde is called the felde of bloud vntyll this daye .
40027009	Then was fulfylled that which was spoken by Ieremy the Prophet sayinge : and they toke . xxx . sylver plattes the prise of him that was valued whom they bought of the chyldren of Israel
40027010	and they gave them for the potters felde as the Lorde appoynted me .
40027011	Iesus stode before the debite : and the debite axed him sayinge : Arte thou the kynge of ye Iues ? Iesus sayd vnto him : Thou sayest
40027012	and when he was accused of ye chefe prestes and elders he answered nothinge .
40027013	Then sayd Pilate vnto him : hearest thou not how many thinges they laye ageynste ye ?
40027014	And he answered him to never a worde : in so moche that the debite marveylled greatlie .
40027015	At that feest the debite was wonte to deliver vnto ye people a presoner whom they wolde desyer .
40027016	He had then a notable presoner called Barrabas .
40027017	And when they were gadered together Pilate sayde vnto the : whether wyll ye that I geve losse vnto you Barrabas or Iesus which is called Christ ?
40027018	For he knewe well that for envie they had delivred him .
40027019	When he was set doune to geve iudgemet his wyfe sent to him sayinge : have thou nothinge to do with that iuste man . For I have suffered many thinges this daye in a dreame about him .
40027020	But the chefe preestes and the elders had parswaded the people that they shulde axe Barrabas and shulde destroye Iesus .
40027021	Then the debite answered and sayde vnto them : whether of the twayne wyll ye that I let loosse vnto you ? And they sayde Barrabas .
40027022	Pilate sayde vnto them : what shall I do then with Iesus which is called Christ ? They all sayde to him : let him be crucified .
40027023	Then sayde the debite : what evyll hath he done ? And they cryed the more sayinge : let him be crucified .
40027024	When Pilate sawe that he prevayled nothinge but that moare busines was made he toke water and wasshed his hondes before ye people sayinge : I am innocent of the bloud of this iuste person and that ye shall se .
40027025	Then answered all the people and sayde : his bloud be on vs and on oure chyldren .
40027026	Then let he Barrabas loose vnto them and scourged Iesus and delivered him to be crucified .
40027027	Then the soudeours of the debite toke Iesus vnto the comen hall and gaddered vnto him all the company .
40027028	And they stripped him and put on him a purpyll roobe
40027029	and platted a croune of thornes and put vpon his heed and a rede in his ryght honde : and bowed their knees before him and mocked him saying : hayle kinge of the Iewes :
40027030	and spitted vpon him and toke the rede and smoote him on the heed .
40027031	And when they had mocked him they toke the robe of him ageyne and put his awne reymet on him and leed him awaye to crucify him .
40027032	And as they came out they fonnde a man of Cyren named Simon : him they compelled to beare his crosse .
40027033	And whe they cam vnto ye place called Golgotha ( that is to saye a place of deed mens sculles )
40027034	they gave him veneger to drinke mengled with gall . And when he had tasted therof he wolde not drinke .
40027035	When they had crucified him they parted his garmentes and did cast lottes : to fulfyll that was spoken by the prophet . They deuyded my garmetes amonge them : and apon my vesture did cast loottes .
40027036	And they sate and watched him there .
40027037	And they set vp over his heed the cause of his deeth written . This is Iesus the kynge of the Iewes .
40027038	And ther were two theves crucified with him one on ye right honde and another on the lyfte .
40027039	They that passed by revyled him waggynge ther heeddes
40027040	and sayinge : Thou that destroyest the temple of God and byldest it in thre dayes save thy sylfe . If thou be ye sonne of God come doune from the crosse .
40027041	Lykwyse also the hye prestes mockinge him with the scribes aud elders sayde :
40027042	He saved other him sylfe he can not save . If he be ye kynge of Israel : let him now come doune from the crosse and we will beleve him .
40027043	He trusted in God let him deliver him now yf he will have him : for he sayde I am the sonne of God .
40027044	That same also the theves which were crucified with him cast in his tethe .
40027045	From the sixte houre was there dercknes over all the londe vnto the nynth houre .
40027046	And about ye nynth houre Iesus cryed with a loude voyce sayinge : Eli Eli lama asbathani . That is to saye my God my God why hast thou forsaken me ?
40027047	Some of them that stode there when they herde that sayde : This man calleth for Helyas .
40027048	And streyght waye one of them ranne and toke a sponge and filled it full of veneger and put it on a rede and gave him to drinke .
40027049	Other sayde let be : let vs se whyther Helyas will come and deliver him .
40027050	Iesus cryed agayne with a lowde voyce and yelded vp the goost .
40027051	And beholde the vayle of the temple dyd rent in twayne from ye toppe to the bottome and the erth dyd quake and the stones dyd rent
40027052	and graves dyd open : and the bodies of many sainctes which slept arose
40027053	and came out of ye graves after his resurreccion and came into the holy cite and appered vnto many .
40027054	When the Centurion and they that were with him watchinge Iesus sawe ye erth quake and those thinges which hapened they feared greatly sayinge . Of a surete this was the sonne of God .
40027055	And many wemen were there beholdinge him a farre of which folowed Iesus fro Galile ministringe vnto him .
40027056	Amonge which was Mary Magdalen and Mary the mother of Iames and Ioses and ye mother of zebedes chyldren .
40027057	When the even was come there came a ryche man of Aramathia named Ioseph which same also was Iesus disciple .
40027058	He went to Pilate and begged the body of Iesus . Then Pilate commaunded the body to be delivered .
40027059	And Ioseph toke the body and wrapped it in a clene lynnyn clooth
40027060	and put it in his newe tombe which he had hewen out even in the roke and rolled a greate stone to the dore of ye sepulcre and departed .
40027061	And there was Mary Magdalene and the other Mary sittynge over ageynste the sepulcre .
40027062	The nexte daye that foloweth good frydaye the hye prestes and pharises got them selves to Pilate
40027063	and sayde : Syr we remember yt this deceaver sayde whyll he was yet alyve After thre dayes I will aryse agayne .
40027064	Commaunde therfore that the sepulcre be made sure vntyll ye thyrd daye lest paraventure his disciples come and steale him awaye and saye vnto the people he is rysen from deeth and the laste erroure be worsse then the fyrst .
40027065	Pilate sayde vnto them . Take watche men : Go and make it as sure as ye can .
40027066	And they went and made the sepulcre sure with watche men and sealed the stone .
40028001	The Sabboth daye at even which dauneth the morowe after the Sabboth Mary Magdalene and the other Mary came to se the sepulcre .
40028002	And beholde ther was a greate erth quake . For the angell of ye lorde descended from heven : and came and rowlled backe the stone from the dore and sate apon it .
40028003	His countenaunce was lyke lyghtnynge and his raymet whyte as snowe .
40028004	And for feare of him the kepers were astunnyed and became as deed men .
40028005	The angell answered and sayde to the wemen feare ye not . I knowe yt ye seke Iesus which was crucified :
40028006	he is not here : he is rysen as he sayde . Come and se the place where the lorde was put :
40028007	and goo quickly and tell his disciples yt he is rysen from deeth . And beholde he will go before you into Galile there ye shall se him . Lo I have tolde you .
40028008	And they departed quickly from the sepulcre with feare and greate Ioye : and did runne to bringe his disciples worde .
40028009	And as they went to tell his disciples : beholde Iesus met them sayinge : All hayle . And they came and held him by the fete and worshipped him .
40028010	The sayde Iesus vnto them : be not afrayde . Go and tell my brethren that they goo in to Galile and there shall they se me .
40028011	When they were gone : beholde some of the kepers came into the cyte and shewed vnto the hie prestes all the thinges that were hapened .
40028012	And they gaddered them to gedder with the elders and toke counsell and gave large money vnto the soudiers
40028013	sayinge : Saye that his disciples came by nyght and stole him awaye whill ye slept .
40028014	And if this come to the rulers cares we wyll pease him and save you harmeles .
40028015	And they toke the money and dyd as they were taught . And this sayinge is noysed amoge the Iewes vnto this daye .
40028016	Then the . xi . disciples went awaye into Galile in to a mountayne where Iesus had appoynted them .
40028017	And when they sawe hym they worshipped him . But some of them douted .
40028018	And Iesus came and spake vnto them sayinge : All power ys geve vnto me in heve and in erth .
40028019	Go therfore and teache all nacions baptysinge them in the name of the father and the sonne and the holy goost :
40028020	Teachinge them to observe all thynges what soever I comcommaunded you . And lo I am with you all waye even vntyll the ende of the worlde .
41001001	The beginnynge of the Gospell of Iesu Christ the sonne of God
41001002	as yt is wrytten in the Prophetes : beholde I sende my messenger before thy face which shall prepared thy waye before ye .
41001003	The voyce of a cryer in the wildernes : prepare ye the waye of the Lorde make his paches streyght .
41001004	Iohn dyd baptise in the wyldernes and preche the baptyme of repentauce for the remission of synnes .
41001005	And all the londe of Iurie and they of Ierusalem went out vnto him and were all baptised of him in the ryver Iordan confessynge their synnes .
41001006	Iohn was clothed with cammylles heer and with a gerdyll of a skyn a bout hys loynes . And he dyd eate locustes and wylde hony
41001007	and preached sayinge : a stronger then I commeth after me whose shue latchet I am not worthy to stoupe doune and vnlose .
41001008	I have baptised you with water : but he shall baptise you with the holy goost .
41001009	And yt came to passe in those dayes that Iesus cam from Nazareth a cyte of Galile : and was baptised of Iohn in Iordan .
41001010	And assone as he was come out of the water Iohn sawe heaven open and the holy goost descendinge vpon him lyke a dove .
41001011	And ther came a voyce from heaven : Thou arte my dere sonne in whom I delyte .
41001012	And immediatly the sprete drave him into wildernes :
41001013	and he was there in the wildernes xl dayes and was tempted of Satan and was with wilde beestes . And the aungels ministred vnto him .
41001014	After Iohn was taken Iesus came in to Galile preachinge the gospell of the kyngdome of God
41001015	and sayinge : the tyme is come and the kyngdome of God is at honde repent and beleve the gospell .
41001016	As he walked by the see of Galile he sawe Simon and Andrew his brother castinge nettes into ye see for they were fysshers .
41001017	And Iesus sayde vnto them : folowe me and I will make you fisshers of men .
41001018	And strayght waye they forsoke their nettes and folowed him .
41001019	And when he had gone a lytell further thence he sawe Iames the sonne of zebede and Ihon his brother even as they were in the shyppe mendinge their nettes .
41001020	And anone he called them . And they leeft their father zebede in the shippe with his hyred servauntes and went their waye after him .
41001021	And they entred into Capernau : and streight waye on ye Saboth dayes he entred in to ye synagoge and taught .
41001022	And they merveled at his learninge . For he taught them as one that had power with him and not as the Scribes .
41001023	And there was in their synagoge a ma vexed wt an vnclene spirite yt cried
41001024	sayinge : let be : what have we to do with the thou Iesus of Nazareth ? Arte thou come to destroye vs ? I knowe the what thou arte eue that holy of god .
41001025	And Iesus rebuked him sayinge : hoolde thy peace and come out of him .
41001026	And ye vnclene spirite tare him and cryed with a loude voyce and came out of him .
41001027	And they were all amased in so moche that they demaunded one of another amoge them selves saying : what thinge is this ? what newe doctryne is this ? For he comaundeth the foule spirites with power and they obeye him .
41001028	And immediatly his fame spreed abroade throughoute all the region borderinge on Galile .
41001029	And forth with as sone as they were come out of the synagoge they entred into ye housse of Symon and Andrew with Iames and Ihon .
41001030	And Symons mother in lawe lay sicke of a fever . And anone they tolde him of her .
41001031	And he came and toke her by the honde and lifte her vp : and the fever forsoke hir by and by : and she ministred vnto them .
41001032	And at even when the sunne was downe they brought to him all that were diseased and them that were possessed with devyls .
41001033	And all the cite gaddred to gedder at the dore
41001034	and he healed many yt were sicke of divers deseases . And he cast out many devyls and suffred not ye devyls to speake because they knewe him .
41001035	And in the morninge very erly Iesus arose and went out into a solitary place and there prayed .
41001036	And Simon and they that were with him folowed after him .
41001037	And when they had founde him they sayde vnto him : all men seke for the .
41001038	And he sayd vnto them : let vs go into the next tounes that I maye preache there also : for truly I cam out for that purpose .
41001039	And he preached in their synagoges throughout all Galile and cast the devyls out .
41001040	And there came a leper to him besechinge him and kneled doune vnto him and sayde to him : yf thou wilt thou canest make me clene .
41001041	And Iesus had copassion on him and put forth his honde touched him and sayde to him : I will be thou clene .
41001042	And assone as he had spoke immediatly ye leprosy departed fro him and was clensed .
41001043	And he charged him and sent him awaye forthwith
41001044	and sayd vnto him : Se thou saye no thinge to any man : but get the hence and shewe thy silfe to ye preste and offer for thy clensinge those thinges which Moses comaunded for a testimoniall vnto them .
41001045	But he ( assone as he was departed ) beganne to tell many thinges and to publyshe the dede : in so moche that Iesus coulde no more opely entre in to the cite but was with out in desert places . And they came to him fro every quarter .
41002001	After a feawe dayes he entred into Capernaum agayne and it was noysed that he was in a housse .
41002002	And anone many gadered to geder in so moche that now there was no roume to receave them : no not so moche as about the dore . And he preached the worde vnto them .
41002003	And there came vnto him that brought one sicke of the palsie borne of fower men .
41002004	And because they coulde not come nye vnto him for preace they vncovered ye rofe of the housse where he was . And when they had broken it ope they let doune ye beed where in ye sicke of the palsie laye .
41002005	When Iesus sawe their fayth he sayde to the sicke of the palsie sonne thy sinnes are forgeven the .
41002006	And ther were certayne of ye scribes sittinge there and reasoninge in their hertes :
41002007	how doeth this felowe so blaspheme ? Who can forgeve synnes but God only ?
41002008	And immediatly whe Iesus perceaved in his sprete yt they so reasoned in the selves he sayde vnto them : why thynke ye soche thinges in youre hertes ?
41002009	Whether is it easyer to saye to ye sicke of ye palsie thy synnes are forgeven the or to saye aryse take vp thy beed and walke ?
41002010	That ye maye knowe yt the sonne of man hath power in erth to forgeve synnes he spake vnto ye sicke of the palsie :
41002011	I saye vnto ye aryse and take vp thy beed and get ye hense into thyne awne housse .
41002012	And by and by he arose toke vp the beed and went forth before them all : in so moche that they were all amased and glorified God sayinge : we never sawe it on this fassion .
41002013	And he went agayne vnto the see and all the people resorted vnto him and he taught the .
41002014	And as Iesus passed by he sawe Levy ye sonne of Alphey syt at the receyte of custome and sayde vnto him : folowe me . And he arose and folowed him .
41002015	And it came to passe as Iesus sate at meate in his housse many publicans and synners sate at meate also with Iesus and his disciples . For there were many that folowed him .
41002016	And when the Scribes and Pharises sawe him eate with publicas and synnere they sayde vnto his disciples : how is it that he eateth and drynketh with publicas and synners ?
41002017	When Iesus hearde yt he sayde vnto them . The whole have no nede of the phisicio but the sicke . I came not to call the rightwise but the synners to repentaunce .
41002018	And the disciples of Iohn and the Pharises dyd faste : and therfore came and sayde vnto him . Why do ye disciples of Iohn and of the Pharises faste and thy disciples fast not .
41002019	And Iesus sayde vnto them : can the chyldren of a weddinge faste while the brydgrome is wt them . As longe as they have the brydgrome with them they cannot faste .
41002020	But the dayes will come when the brydgrome shalbe taken from them and then shall they faste in those dayes .
41002021	Also no ma soweth a pece of newe cloth vnto an olde garmet for then taketh he awaye ye newe pece fro the olde and so is the rent worsse .
41002022	In lyke wyse no man poureth newe wyne into olde vessels : for yf he do the newe wyne breaketh the vessels and the wyne runneth out and the vessels are marred . But new wyne must be poured into new vessels .
41002023	And it chaunsed that he wet thorow ye corne feldes on the Saboth daye : and his disciples as they went on their waye beganne to plucke the eares of corne .
41002024	And the Pharises sayde vnto him : beholde why do they on the Saboth dayes yt which is not laufull ?
41002025	And he sayde to them : have ye never rede what David dyd when he had nede and was anhogred bothe he and they that were with him ?
41002026	How he went into the housse of God in the dayes of Abiathar ye hye preste and dyd eate ye halowed loves which is not laufull to eate but for ye prestes only : and gave also to the which were with him ?
41002027	And he sayde to them : the Saboth daye was made for man and not man for the Saboth daye .
41002028	Wherfore the sonne of man is Lorde eve of the Saboth daye .
41003001	And he entred agayne into ye synagoge and there was a man there which had a widdred honde .
41003002	And they watched him to se whether he wolde heale him on the Saboth daye yt they might accuse him .
41003003	And he sayde vnto ye man which had ye wyddred honde : arise and stonde in ye middes .
41003004	And he sayd to them : whether is it laufull to do a good dede on ye Saboth dayes or an evyll ? to save life or kyll ? But they helde their peace .
41003005	And he loked round aboute on them angerly mournyge on the blindnes of their hertes and sayde to the man : stretch forth thyne honde . And he stretched it oute . And his honde was restored even as whole as the other .
41003006	And ye Pharises departed and streyght waye gaddred a counsell with the that belonged to Herode agaynst him yt they might destroye him .
41003007	And Iesus auoyded wt his disciples to ye sea . And a greate multitude folowed him fro Galile and fro Iurie
41003008	and fro Hierusalem and fro Idumea and fro beyonde Iordane : and they yt dwelled about Tyre and Sidon a greate multitude : which whe they had herde what thinges he dyd came vnto him .
41003009	And he comaunded his disciples yt a shippe shuld wayte on him because of the people leste they shuld througe him .
41003010	For he had healed many in somoche that they preased apon him for to touche him as many as had plages .
41003011	And when the vnclene sprites sawe him they fell doune before him and cryed sayinge : thou arte the sonne of God .
41003012	And he straygtly charged them that they shuld not vtter him .
41003013	And he wet vp into a mountayne and called vnto him whom he wolde and they came vnto him .
41003014	And he ordeyned ye . xii . that they shuld be wt him and that he myght sende the to preache :
41003015	and that they might have power to heale syknesses and to cast out devyls .
41003016	And he gave vnto Simon to name Peter .
41003017	And he called Iames the sonne of zebede and Iohn Iames brother and gave them Bonarges to name which is to saye the sonnes of thounder .
41003018	And Andrew and Philip and Bartlemew and Mathew and Thomas and Iames the sonne of Alphey and Taddeus and Symon of Cane
41003019	and Iudas Iscarioth which same also betrayed him . And they came vnto housse
41003020	and the people assembled togedder agayne so greatly that they had not leesar so moche as to eate breed .
41003021	And when they that longed vnto him hearde of it they went out to holde him . For they thought he had bene beside him selfe .
41003022	And ye Scribes which came fro Ierusalem sayde : he hath Belzebub and by ye power of the chefe devyll casteth out devyls .
41003023	And he called them vnto him and sayde vnto them in similitudes . How can Satan drive out Satan ?
41003024	For yf a realme be devided ageynste it silfe that realme cannot endure .
41003025	Or yf a housse be devided agaynste it silfe that housse cannot continue :
41003026	So yf Sata make insurreccion agaynste himsilfe and be devided he cannot continue but is at an ende .
41003027	No man can entre into a stronge mans housse and take awaye hys gooddes excepte he fyrst bynde that stronge man and then spoyle hys housse .
41003028	Verely I saye vnto you all synnes shalbe forgeven vnto mens chyldren and blasphemy wherwith they blaspheme .
41003029	But he that blasphemeth ye holy goost shall never have forgevenes : but is in dauger of eternall dapnacion :
41003030	because they sayde he had an vnclene sprete .
41003031	Then came his mother and his brethre and stode with out and sent vnto him and called him .
41003032	And the people sate aboute hym and sayde vnto him : beholde thy mother and thy brethre seke for the with out .
41003033	And he answered them sayinge : who is my mother and my brethre ?
41003034	And he loked rounde about on his disciples which sate in compasse about hym and sayde : beholde my mother and my brethren .
41003035	For whosoever doeth ye will of God he is my brother my syster and mother .
41004001	And he began agayne to teache by the seesyde . And there gadered to gedder vnto him moche people so greatly yt he entred into a ship and sate in the see and all the people was by the seeside on the shoore .
41004002	And he taught them many thynges in similitudes and sayde vnto them in his doctrine :
41004003	Herken to . Beholde There wet out a sower to sowe .
41004004	And it fortuned as he sowed that some fell by the waye syde and the fowles of the ayre came and devoured it vp .
41004005	Some fell on stony grounde where it had not moche erth : and by and by sprange vp because it had not deepth of erth :
41004006	but as sone as the sunne was vp it caught heet and because it had not rotynge wyddred awaye .
41004007	And some fell amonge the thornes and the thornes grewe vp and choked it so that it gave no frute .
41004008	And some fell vpon good grounde and dyd yelde frute that sproge and grewe and brought forthe : some thirty folde some sixtie folde and some an hundred folde .
41004009	And he sayde vnto them : he that hath eares to heare let him heare .
41004010	And when he was alone they yt were aboute him with ye . xii . axed him of ye similitude .
41004011	And he sayde vnto the . To you it is geve to knowe the mistery of the kyngdome of God . But vnto them that are wt out shall all thinges be done in similitudes :
41004012	yt when they se they shall se and not discerne : and when they heare they shall heare and not vnderstonde : leste at any tyme they shulde tourne and their synnes shuld be forgeve the .
41004013	And he sayde vnto the : Perceave ye not this similitude ? how then shulde ye vnderstonde all other similitudes ?
41004014	The sower soweth ye worde .
41004015	And they that are by the wayes syde where the worde is sowen are they to whom assone as they have herde it Satha cometh immediatly and takith awaye the worde that was sowe in their hertes .
41004016	And likewise they that are sowen on the stonye groude are they : which when they have harde the worde at once receave it wt gladnes
41004017	yet have no rotes in them selves and so endure but a tyme : and anone as trouble and persecucion aryseth for ye wordes sake they fall immediatly .
41004018	And they that are sowe amoge the thornes are soche as heare ye worde :
41004019	and ye care of this worlde and ye disseytfulnes of ryches and the lustes of other thinges entre in and choocke ye worde and it is made vnfrutfull .
41004020	And those that weare sowe in good grounde are they that heare the worde and receave it and bringe forth frute some thirty folde some sixty folde some an hundred folde .
41004021	And he sayde vnto them : is ye candle lighted to be put vnder a busshell or vnder ye table and not rather to be put on a cadelstick ?
41004022	For there is nothinge so prevy that shall not be opened : nether so secreet but that it shall come abroade .
41004023	Yf eny man have eares to heare let him heare .
41004024	And he sayde vnto them : take hede what ye heare . With what measure ye mete with the same shall it be measured vnto you agayne . And vnto you that heare shall more be geve .
41004025	For vnto him yt hath shall it be geven : and from him that hath not shalbe taken awaye even that he hath .
41004026	And he sayde : so is the kyngdome of God even as yf a man shuld sowe seed in ye groude
41004027	and shulde slepe and ryse vp night and daye : and the seede shuld springe and growe vp he not ware .
41004028	For ye erth bringeth forthe frute of her silfe : fyrst the blade then the eares after that full corne in the eares .
41004029	And as sone as the frute is brought forth anone he throusteth in ye sykell because the hervest is come .
41004030	And he sayde : where vnto shall we lyke the kyngdome of God ? or with what copareson shall we copare it ?
41004031	It is lyke a grayne of mustard seed which when it is sowe in the erth is the leest of all seedes that be in the erth :
41004032	but after that it is sowen it groweth vp and is greatest of all yerbes : and bereth greate brauches so that ye fowles of the ayre maye dwell vnder the shadowe of it .
41004033	And with many soche similitudes he preached the worde vnto the after as they myght heare it .
41004034	And with out similitude spake he no thinge vnto them . But when they were aparte he expounded all thinges to his disciples .
41004035	And the same daye when even was come he sayde vnto them : let vs passe over vnto the other syde .
41004036	And they lefte the people and toke him even as he was in the shyp . And ther were also with him other shippes .
41004037	And ther arose a great storme of wynde and dasshed ye waves into the ship so that it was full .
41004038	And he was in the sterne a slepe on a pelowe . And they awoke him and sayde to him : Master carest thou not yt we perisshe ?
41004039	And he rose vp and rebuked the wynde and sayde vnto the see : peace and be still . And the winde alayed and ther folowed a greate calme .
41004040	And he sayde vnto them : why are ye so fearfull ? How is it that ye have no fayth ?
41004041	And they feared excedingly and sayde one to another : what felowe is this ? For booth winde and see obey him .
41005001	And they cam over to the other syde of ye see in to the coutre of ye Gaderenites .
41005002	And when he was come out of ye shippe there met him out of the graves a man possessyd of an vncleane sprete
41005003	which had his abydinge amoge the graves . And no man coulde bynde him : no not with cheynes
41005004	because that when he was often bounde wt fetters and cheynes he plucked ye chaynes asundre and brake the fetters in peaces . Nether coulde eny man tame him .
41005005	And alwayes bothe nyght and daye he cryed in ye moutaynes and in ye graves and bet himsilfe wt stones .
41005006	When he had spied Iesus afarre of he rane and worshipped him
41005007	and cryed wt a lowde voyce and sayde : what have I to do wt the Iesus ye sonne of the moost hyest God ? I requyre ye in the name of God yt thou tormet me not .
41005008	For he had sayd vnto hym : come out of the man thou fowle sprete .
41005009	And he axed him : what is thy name ? And he answered sayinge : my name is Legion for we are many .
41005010	And he prayd him instantly that he wolde not sende the awaye out of the countre .
41005011	And ther was there nye vnto ye moutayns a greate heerd of swyne fedinge
41005012	and all the devyls besought him sayinge : sende vs into the heerde of swyne yt we maye enter in to them .
41005013	And anone Iesus gave them leave . And the vnclene spretes wet out and entred into ye swyne . And the heerd starteled and ran hedling into the see . They were about . ii . M . swyne and they were drouned in the see .
41005014	And the swyne heerdes fleed and tolde it in ye cyte and in the countre . And they came out for to se what had hapened :
41005015	and came to Iesus and sawe hym that was vexed wt the fende and had the legio syt both clothed and in his right mynde and were afrayed .
41005016	And they that sawe it tolde them how it had happened vnto him that was possessed with the devyll : and also of the swyne .
41005017	And they begane to praye him that he wolde departe fro their coostes .
41005018	And when he was come in to the shyppe he that had ye devyll prayed him that he myght be with him .
41005019	Howbeit Iesus wolde not suffre him but sayde vnto him : goo home in to thyne awne housse and to thy frendes and shewe the what great thinges ye Lorde hath done vnto the and how he had copassion on the .
41005020	And he departed and begane to publisshe in ye ten cyties what greate thinges Iesus had done vnto him and all me dyd merveyle .
41005021	And when Iesus was come over agayne by shyp vnto the other syde moche people gadered vnto him and he was nye vnto the see .
41005022	And beholde ther came one of the rulers of ye Synagoge whose name was Iairus : and when he sawe him he fell doune at his fete
41005023	and besought hym greatly sayinge : my doughter lyith at poynt of deeth I wolde thou woldest come and laye thy honde on her that she myght be safe and live .
41005024	And he wet with him and moche people folowed him and thronged him .
41005025	And ther was a certen woman which was diseased of an yssue of bloude . xii . yeres
41005026	and had suffred many thinges of many phisicios and had spet all yt she had and felte none amendmet at all but wexed worsse and worsse .
41005027	When she had herde of Iesus : she came into the preace behynde him and touched his garmet .
41005028	For she thought : yf I maye but touche his clothes I shall be whole .
41005029	And streyght waye her foutayne of bloude was dryed vp aud she felt in her body that she was healed of the plage .
41005030	And Iesus immediatly felt in him silfe ye vertue that wet out of him and tourned him roude aboute in the preace and sayde : who touched my clothes ?
41005031	And his disciples sayde vnto him : seist thou ye people thrust the and yet axest who dyd touche me ?
41005032	And he loked roud about for to se her that had done that thinge .
41005033	The woman feared and trembled ( for she knew what was done with in her ) and she came and fell doune before him and tolde him ye truth of everythinge .
41005034	And he sayde to her : Doughter thy fayth hath made the whoale : goo in peace and be whole of thy plage .
41005035	Whyll he yet spake ther came fro the ruler of ye synagoges housse certayne which sayde : thy doughter is deed : why diseasest thou ye master eny further ?
41005036	Assone as Iesus herde that worde spoke he sayde vnto the ruler of ye synagoge : be not afrayed only beleve .
41005037	And he suffred no man to folowe him moo then Peter and Iames and Ihon the brother of Iames .
41005038	And he came vnto the housse of the ruler of ye synagoge and sawe ye wondrynge and them that wepte and wayled greatly
41005039	and went in and sayde vnto them : why make ye this adoo and wepe ? The mayde is not deed but slepith .
41005040	And they lawght him to scorne . Then he put them all out and toke ye father and the mother of ye mayden and them that were with him and entred in where the mayden laye
41005041	and toke the mayden by the honde and sayde vnto hyr : Tabitha cumi : which is by interpretacion : mayde I saye vnto the aryse .
41005042	And streyght the mayden arose and went on her fete . For she was of the age of twelve yeres . And they were astonied at it out of measure .
41005043	And he charged the straytely that no man shuld knowe of it and comaunded to geve her meate .
41006001	And he departed thence and cam into his awne countre and his disciples folowed him .
41006002	And whe the saboth daye was come he beganne to teache in ye synagsge . And many that hearde him were astonyed and sayde : From whens hath he these thinges ? and what wysdo is this that is geve vnto him ? and suche vertues yt are wrought by his hondes ?
41006003	Is not this that carpeter Maryes sonne ye brother of Iames and Ioses and of Iuda and Simon ? and are not his systers here with vs ? And they were offended by him .
41006004	And Iesus sayde vnto the : a prophet is not despysed but in his awne coutre and amonge his awne kynne and amonge the that are of the same housholde .
41006005	And he coulde there shewe no miracles but leyd his hondes apon a feawe sicke foolke and healed the .
41006006	And he merveyled at their vnbelefe . And he went aboute by ye tounes yt laye on every syde teachynge .
41006007	And he called ye twelve and beganne to sende them two and two and gave them power over vnclene spretes .
41006008	And comaunded the that they shuld take nothinge vnto their Iorney save a rodde only : Nether scrippe nether breed nether mony in their pourses :
41006009	but shuld be shood with sandals . And that they shuld not put on two coottes .
41006010	And he sayd vnto the : whersoever ye entre in to an house there abyde tyll ye departe thence
41006011	And whosoever shall not receave you nor heare you when ye departe thence shake of the duste that is vnder youre fete for a witnesse vnto them . I saye verely vnto you it shalbe easyer for Zodom and Gomor at the daye of iudgement then for that cite .
41006012	And they went out and preached that they shuld repent :
41006013	and they caste out many devylles . And they annoynted many that were sicke with oyle and healed them .
41006014	And kynge Herode herde of him ( for his name was spreed abroade ) and sayd : Iohn Baptiste is rysen agayne from deeth and therfore miracles are wrought by him .
41006015	Wother sayd it is Helyas : and some sayde : it is a Prophet or as one of ye Prophetes .
41006016	But when Herode hearde of him he sayd : it is Iohn whom I beheded he is rysen from deeth agayne .
41006017	For Herode him sylfe had sent forth and had taken Iohn and bounde him and cast him into preson for Herodias sake which was his brother Philippes wyfe . For he had maried her .
41006018	Iohn sayd vnto Herode : It is not laufull for the to have thy brothers wyfe .
41006019	Herodias layd wayte for him and wolde have killed him but she coulde not .
