41006020	For Herode feared Iohn knowynge yt he was a iuste man and an holy : and gave him reverence : and when he hearde him he dyd many thinges and hearde him gladly .
41006021	But when a couenient daye was come : Herode on his birth daye made a supper to ye lordes captayns and chefe estates of Galile .
41006022	And ye doughter of ye sayde Herodias came in and daused and pleased Herode and them that sate at bourde also . Then ye kynge sayd vnto ye mayden : axe of me what thou wilt and I will geve it ye
41006023	And he sware vnto hyr whatsoever thou shalt axe of me I will geve it ye even vnto ye one halfe of my kyngdome .
41006024	And she wet forth and sayde to her mother : what shall I axe ? And she sayde : Iohn Baptistes heed .
41006025	And she cam in streygth waye with haste vnto ye kynge and axed sayinge : I will that thou geve me by and by in a charger ye heed of Iohn Baptist .
41006026	And ye kynge was sory : howbe it for his othes sake and for their sakes which sate at supper also he wolde not put her besyde her purpose .
41006027	And immediatly ye kynge sent ye hangma and comaunded his heed to be brought in . And he went and beheeded him in the preson
41006028	and brought his heed in a charger and gave it to the mayden and the mayden gave it to her mother .
41006029	And when his disciples hearde of it they came and toke vp his body and put it in a toumbe .
41006030	And the apostels gaddered them selves to ggedre to Iesus and tolde him all thinges booth what they had done and what they had taught .
41006031	And he sayd vnto them : come ye aparte into the wyldernes and rest awhyle . For there were many comers and goers that they had no leasure so moche as to eate .
41006032	And he wet by ship out of the waye into a deserte place .
41006033	But the people spyed them when they departed : and many knewe him and ranne afote thyther out of all cities and cam thyther before them and came togedder vnto him .
41006034	And Iesus went out and sawe moche people and had compassion on them because they were lyke shepe which had no shepeherde . And he beganne to teache them many thinges .
41006035	And when ye daye was nowe farre spet his disciples came vnto him sayinge : this is a desert place and now the daye is farre passed
41006036	let the departe that they maye goo into the countrey rounde about and into the tounes and bye the breed : for they have nothinge to eate .
41006037	He answered and sayde vnto them : geve ye the to eate . And they sayde vnto him : shall we goo and bye ii . C . penyworth of breed and geve the to eate ?
41006038	He sayde vnto the : how many loves have ye ? Goo and loke . And when they had serched they sayde : v . and . ii . fysshes .
41006039	And he comaunded them to make them all syt doune by companyes apon the grene grasse .
41006040	And they sate doune here a rowe and there arowe by houndredes and by fyfties .
41006041	And he toke ye . v . loves and ye ii . fysshes and loked vp to heven and blessed and brake the loves and gave them to his disciples to put before the : and the . ii . fysshes he devyded amonge them all .
41006042	And they all dyd eate and were satisfied .
41006043	And they toke vp twelve baskettesfull of the gobbettes and of ye fysshes .
41006044	And they that ate were about fyve thousand men .
41006045	And streyght waye he caused his disciples to goo into the shipe and to goo over the water before vnto Bethsaida whyll he sent awaye the people .
41006046	And assone as he had sent them away he departed into a moutayne to praye .
41006047	And when even was come the ship was in the middes of the see and he alone on the londe
41006048	and he sawe the troubled in rowynge for the wynde was cotrary vnto them . And aboute ye fourth quartre of ye nyght he came vnto the walkinge apon the see and wolde have passed by the .
41006049	When they sawe him walkinge apon the see they supposed it had bene a sprete and cryed oute :
41006050	For they all sawe him and were afrayed . And anon he talked with them and sayde vnto them : be of good chere it is I be not afrayed .
41006051	And he went vp vnto them into the shippe and the wynde ceased and they were sore amased in them selves beyonde measure and marveyled .
41006052	For they remembred not of the loves because their hertes were blynded .
41006053	And they came over and went into the londe of Genezareth and drue vp into the haven .
41006054	And assone as they were come out of ye shippe streyght they knewe him
41006055	and ran forth throughout all ye region rounde about and began to cary aboute in beeddes all yt were sicke to the place where they heard tell yt he was .
41006056	And whyther soever he entred into tounes cities or villages they layde their sicke in the stretes and prayed him that they myght touche and it were but the edge of his vesture . And as many as touched him were safe .
41007001	And ye pharises came togedder vnto him and dyvers of ye scribes which came from Ierusalem .
41007002	And whe they sawe certayne of his disciples eate breed wt comen hondes ( that is to saye wt vnwesshen hondes ) they coplayned .
41007003	For the pharises and all the Iewes excepte they washe their hondes ofte eate not observinge the tradicions of the elders .
41007004	And whe they come from the market except they washe they eate not . And many other thinges ther be which they have taken apon them to observe as the wasshinge of cuppes and cruses and of brasen vessels and of tables .
41007005	Then axed him the pharises and sribes why walke not thy disciples accordinge to ye tradicions of the elders but eate breede with vnweshen hondes ?
41007006	He answered and sayde vnto them : well prophesied Esaias of you ypocrites as it is writte : This people honoreth me with their lyppes but their hert is farre from me :
41007007	In vayne they worshippe me teachinge doctryns which are nothinge but ye comaundementes of men .
41007008	For ye laye the commaundement of God aparte and observe the tradicions of men as the wesshinge of cruses and of cuppes and many other suche lyke thinges ye do .
41007009	And he sayde vnto them : well ye cast asyde the comaundement of God to mayntayne youre owne tradicios .
41007010	For Moses sayde : Honoure thy father and thy mother : and whosoever cursseth father or mother let him dye for it .
41007011	But ye saye : a man shall saye to father or mother Corban : which is : that thou desyrest of me to helpe the with is geven God .
41007012	And so ye soffre him no more to do ought for his father or his mother
41007013	makinge the worde of God of none effecte through youre awne tradicions which ye have ordeyned . And many soche thinges ye do .
41007014	And he called all the people vnto him and sayde vnto them : Herken vnto me every one of you and vnderstonde .
41007015	There is no thinge with out a man that can defyle him when it entreth into him : but thoo thinges which procede out of him are those which defyle ye man .
41007016	If eny man have eares to heare let him heare
41007017	And whe he came to house awaye fro the people his disciples axed him of the similitude .
41007018	And he sayd vnto the : Are ye so without vnderstondinge ? Do ye not yet perceave yt whatsoever thinge from wt out entreth into a man it can not defyle him
41007019	because it entrith not in to his hert but into ye belly : and goeth out into the draught that porgeth oute all meates .
41007020	And he sayde : yt defileth a ma which cometh oute of a man .
41007021	For fro wt in even oute of the herte of men proceade evill thoughtes : advantry fornicacion murder
41007022	theeft coveteousnes wickednes diceyte vnclennes and a wicked eye blasphemy pryde folysshnes :
41007023	all these evyll thinges come from with in and defile a man .
41007024	And from thence he rose and went into ye borders of Tyre and Sidon and entred into an housse and wolde that no man shnld have knowen : But he coulde not be hyd .
41007025	For a certayne woma whose doughter had a foule sprete hearde of him and came and fell at his fete .
41007026	The woman was a Greke oute of Syrophenicia and she besought him yt he wolde caste out ye devyll oute of her doughter .
41007027	And Iesus sayde vnto her : let the chyldren fyrst be feed . For it is not mete to take the chyldres breed and to caste it vnto whelppes .
41007028	She answered and sayde vnto him : even soo master neverthelesse the whelppes also eate vnder the table of the chyldrens cromes .
41007029	And he sayde vnto her : for this sayinge goo thy waye the devyll is gone out of thy doughter .
41007030	And when she was come home to her housse she founde the devyll departed and her doughter lyinge on the beed .
41007031	And he departed agayne from the coostes of Tyre and Sidon and came vnto the see of Galile thorowe ye middes of the coostos of ye . x . cities .
41007032	And they brought vnto him one yt was deffe and stambred in his speche and prayde him to laye his honde apon him .
41007033	And he toke him asyde from ye people and put his fyngers in his eares and dyd spyt and touched his tounge
41007034	and loked vp to heven and sygthed and sayde vnto him : ephatha that is to saye be openned .
41007035	And streyght waye his eares were openned and the stringe of his tounge was loosed and he spake playne .
41007036	And he comaunded them that they shuld tell no man . But the more he forbad them soo moche the more a greate deale they publesshed it :
41007037	and were beyonde measure astonyed sayinge : He hath done all thinges well and hath made booth the deffe to heare and the dome to speake .
41008001	In those dayes whe ther was a very greate companye and had nothinge to eate Iesus called his disciples to him and sayd vnto the :
41008002	I have copassion on this people because they have nowe bene with me . iii . dayes and have nothinge to eate :
41008003	And yf I shuld sende the awaye fastinge to their awne houses they shulde faynt by the waye . For dyvers of the came from farre .
41008004	And his disciples answered him : where shuld a man have breade here in the wildernes to satisfie these ?
41008005	And he axed them : how many loves have ye ? They sayde : seven .
41008006	And he commaunded the people to syt doune on the grounde . And he toke the . vii . loves gave thankes brake and gave to his disciples to set before them . And they dyd set the before the people .
41008007	And they had a feawe smale fysshes . And he blessed them and comaunded them also to be set before them .
41008008	And they ate and were suffysed : And they toke vp yf the broken meate that was lefte . vii . baskettes full .
41008009	And they yt ate were in nomber aboute fowre thousand . And he sent them awaye .
41008010	And a none he entred into a ship wt his disciples and came into the parties of Dalmanutha .
41008011	And the pharises cam forth and begane to dispute with him sekinge of him a signe fro heven and temptinge him .
41008012	And he sygthed in his sprete and sayde : why doth this generacion seke a signe ? Verely I saye vnto you ther shall no signe be geven vnto this generacion .
41008013	And he lefte the and went into the ship agayne and departed over the water .
41008014	And they had forgotte to take breed wt the nether had they in the ship with them more then one loofe .
41008015	And he charged the sayinge . Take hede and beware of ye leven of ye pharises and of ye leve of Herode .
41008016	And they reasoned amonge the selves sayinge : we have no breed
41008017	And whe Iesus knewe yt he sayde vnto the : why take ye thought because ye have no bread ? perceave ye not yet nether vnderstonde ? Have ye youre hertes yet blynded ?
41008018	Have ye eyes and se not ? and have ye eares and heare not ? Do ye not remember ?
41008019	When I brake v . loves amonge . v . M . How many baskettes full of broke meate toke ye vp ? They sayde vnto him twelve .
41008020	When I brake . vii . amonge . iiii . M . How many basketes of the levinges of broken meate toke ye vp ? they sayde . vii .
41008021	And he sayde vnto the : how is it yt ye vnderstonde not ?
41008022	And he came to Bethsaida and they brought a blynde man vnto him and desyred him to touche him .
41008023	And he caught the blynde by the honde and leade him out of the toune and spat in his eyes and put his hondes apon him and axed him whether he saw ought .
41008024	And he loked vp and sayde : I se ye men : For I se the walke as they were trees .
41008025	After that he put his hondes agayne apon his eyes and made him see . And he was restored to his sight and sawe every ma clerly .
41008026	And he sent him home to his housse sayinge : nether goo into the toune nor tell it to eny in the toune .
41008027	And Iesus went out and his disciples into the tounes that longe to the cite called Cesarea Philippi . Aud by the waye he axed his disciples sayinge : whom do men saye yt I am ?
41008028	And they answered : some saye that thou arte Iohn Baptiste : some saye Helyas : and some one of the Prophetes .
41008029	And he sayde vnto the : But whom saye ye that I am ? Peter answered and sayd vnto him : Thou arte very Christe .
41008030	And he charged them that they shuld tell no man of it .
41008031	And he beganne to teache them how that the sonne of man must suffre many thinges and shuld be reproved of the elders and of the hye prestes and scribes and be kylled and after thre dayes aryse agayne .
41008032	And he spake that sayinge openly . And Peter toke him asyde and began to chyde him .
41008033	Then he tourned aboute and looked on his disciples and rebuked Peter sayinge : Goo after me Satan . For thou saverest not ye thinges of God but the thinges of men .
41008034	And he called the people vnto him with his disciples also and sayd vnto them : Whosoever will folowe me let him forsake him sylfe and take vp his crosse and folowe me .
41008035	For whosoever will save his lyfe shall lose it But whosoever shall lose his lyfe for my sake and ye gospels ye same shall save it .
41008036	What shall it profet a ma yf he shuld wynne all ye worlde and loose his awne soule ?
41008037	or els what shall a ma geve to redeme his soule agayne ?
41008038	Whosoever therfore shall be asshamed of me and of my wordes amonge this advoutrous and sinfull generacion : of him shall the sonne of man be ashamed when he cometh in the glory of his father wt the holy angels .
41009001	And he sayde vnto them : Verely I saye vnto you : There be some of the that stonde here which shall not taste of deeth tyll they have sene the kyngdome of God come wt power .
41009002	And after . vi . dayes Iesus toke Peter Iames and Iohn and leede them vp into an hye mountayne out of ye waye alone and he was transfigured before them .
41009003	And his rayment dyd shyne and was made very whyte even as snowe : so whyte as noo fuller can make apon the erth .
41009004	And ther apered vnto them Helyas with Moses : and they talked with Iesu .
41009005	And Peter answered and sayde to Iesu : Master here is good beinge for vs let vs make . iii . tabernacles one for the one for Moses and one for Helyas .
41009006	And yet he wist not what he sayde : for they were afrayde .
41009007	And ther was a cloude that shaddowed the . And a voyce came out of the cloude sayinge : This is my dere sonne here him .
41009008	And sodenly they loked rounde aboute them and sawe no man more then Iesus only wt the .
41009009	And as they came doune from the hyll he charged the that they shuld tell no ma what they had sene tyll the sonne of man were rysen fro deeth agayne .
41009010	And they kepte that sayinge with them and demaunded one of a nother what yt rysinge from deeth agayne shuld meane ?
41009011	And they axed him sayinge : why then saye ye scribe that Helyas muste fyrste come ?
41009012	He answered and sayde vnto them : Helyas verelye shall fyrst come and restore all thinges . And also ye sonne of ma as it is wrytte shall suffre many thinges and shall be set at nought .
41009013	Moreouer I saye vnto you that Helyas is come and they have done vnto him whatsoever pleased them as it is wrytten of him .
41009014	And he came to his disciples and sawe moche people aboute them and the scribes disputinge with them .
41009015	And streyght waye all the people when they behelde him were amased and ran to him and saluted him .
41009016	And he sayde vnto the Scribes : what dispute ye with them ?
41009017	And one of the copanye answered and sayde : Master I have brought my sonne vnto the which hath a dome spirite .
41009018	And whensoever he taketh him he teareth him and he fometh and gnassheth with his tethe and pyneth awaye . And I spake to thy disciples that they shuld caste him out and they coulde not .
41009019	He answered him and sayd : O generacion wt out faith how longe shall I be with you ? How longe shall I suffre you ? Bringe him vnto me .
41009020	And they brought him vnto him . And assone as ye sprete sawe him he tare him . And he fell doune on the grounde walowinge and fomynge .
41009021	And he axed his father : how longe is it a goo sens this hath happened him ? And he sayde of a chylde :
41009022	and ofte tymes casteth him into the fyre and also into the water to destroye him . But yf thou canste do eny thinge have mercy on vs and helpe vs .
41009023	And Iesus sayde vnto him : ye yf thou couldest beleve all thinges are possible to him yt belevith .
41009024	And streygth waye the father of the chylde cryed with teares sayinge : Lorde I beleve helpe myne vnbelefe .
41009025	When Iesus sawe that the people came runnynge togedder vnto him he rebuked the foule sprete sayinge vnto him : Thou domme and deffe sprete I charge the come out of him and entre no more into him .
41009026	And the sprete cryed and rent him sore and came out : And he was as one that had bene deed in so moche yt many sayde he is deed .
41009027	But Iesus caught his honde and lyfte him vp : and he roose .
41009028	And when he was come into the housse his disciples axed him secretly : why coulde not we caste him out ?
41009029	And he sayde vnto them : this kynde can by no nother meanes come forth but by prayer and fastynge .
41009030	And they departed thens and toke their iorney thorow Galile and he wolde not that eny man shuld have knowen it .
41009031	For he taught his disciples and sayde vnto them : The sonne of man shalbe delyvered into ye hondes of men and they shall kyll him and after that he is kylled he shall aryse agayne the thryd daye .
41009032	But they wiste not what that sayinge meat and were affrayed to axe him .
41009033	And he came to Capernaum . And when he was come to housse he axed the : what was it that ye disputed bytwene you by the waye ?
41009034	And they helde their peace : for by the waye they reasoned amonge the selves who shuld be the chefest .
41009035	And he sate doune and called the twelve vnto him and sayd to them : yf eny man desyre to be fyrst the same shalbe last of all and servaunt vnto all .
41009036	And he toke a chylde and set him in ye middes of them and toke him in his armes and sayde vnto them .
41009037	Whosoever receave eny soche a chylde in my name receaveth me . And whosoever receaveth me receaveth not me but him that sent me .
41009038	Iohn answered him sayinge : Master we sawe one castynge out devyls in thy name which foloweth not vs and we forbade him because he foloweth vs not .
41009039	But Iesus sayde forbid him not . For ther is no ma that shall do a miracle in my name that can lightlyge speake evyll of me .
41009040	Whosoever is not agaynste you is on youre parte .
41009041	And whosoever shall geve you a cuppe of water to drinke for my names sake because ye belonge to Christe verely I saye vnto you he shall not loose his rewarde .
41009042	And whosoever shall offende one of these lytelons yt beleve in me it were better for him yt a mylstone were hanged aboute his necke and yt he he were cast into ye see :
41009043	wherfore yf thy hande offende ye cut him of . It is better for ye to entre into lyffe maymed then havynge two hondes goo into hell into fire yt never shalbe quenched
41009044	where there worme dyeth not and the fyre never goeth oute .
41009045	Lykewyse yf thy fote offende the cut him of . For it is better for the to goo halt into lyfe then havynge two fete to be cast into hell into fyre that never shalbe quenched :
41009046	where there worme dyeth not and the fyre never goeth oute .
41009047	Even so yf thyne eye offende the plucke him oute . It is better for the to goo into the kyngdom of god with one eye then havynge two eyes to be caste into hell fyre :
41009048	where there worme dyeth not and the fyre never goeth oute .
41009049	Every man therfore shalbe salted wt fyre : And every sacrifise shalbe seasoned with salt .
41009050	Salt is good . But yf ye salt be vnsavery : what shall ye salte therwith ? Se yt ye have salt in youre selves : and have peace amonge youre selves one with another .
41010001	And he rose from thence and went into ye coostes of Iurie through the region yt is beyonde Iordan . And ye people resorted vnto him afresshe : and as he was wont he taught them agayne .
41010002	And the pharises came and axed him a question : whether it were laufull for a ma to put awaye his wyfe : to prove him .
41010003	And he answered and sayd vnto the : what dyd Moses byd you do ?
41010004	And they sayde : Moses suffred to wryte a testimoniall of devorsement and to put hyr awaye .
41010005	And Iesus answered and sayd vnto the : For ye hardnes of youre hertes he wrote this precept vnto you .
41010006	But at the fyrste creacion God made the man and woman .
41010007	And for this thinges sake shall ma leve his father and mother and bide by his wyfe
41010008	and they twayne shalbe one flesshe . So then are they now not twayne but one flesshe .
41010009	Therfore what God hath cuppled let not ma separat .
41010010	And in the housse his disciples axed him agayne of yt matter .
41010011	And he sayde vnto them : Whosoever putteth awaye his wyfe and maryeth another breaketh wedlocke to her warde .
41010012	And yf a woman forsake her husband and be maryed to another she comitteth advoutrie .
41010013	And they brought chyldren to him that he should touche the . And his disciples rebuked thoose that brought the .
41010014	When Iesus sawe that he was displeased and sayd to the : Suffre the chyldre to come vnto me and forbid the not . For of suche is ye kyngdome of God .
41010015	Verely I saye vnto you whosoever shall not receave ye kyngdome of God as a chylde he shall not entre therin .
41010016	And he toke the vp in his armes and put his hondes vpon them and blessed the .
41010017	And when he was come in to the waye ther came one runninge and kneled to him and axed him : good master what shall I do that I maye enheret eternall lyfe ?
41010018	Iesus sayde to him : why callest thou me good ? There is no ma good but one which is God .
41010019	Thou knowest the comaundementes : breake not matrimony : kyll not : steale not : bere not falce wytnes : defraude no man : honoure thy father and mother .
41010020	He answered and sayde to him : master all these I have observed fro my youth .
41010021	Iesus behelde him and had a favour to him and sayde vnto him : one thynge is lackinge vnto the . Goo and sell all that thou hast and geve to the povre and thou shalt have treasure in heven and come and folowe me and take vp thy crosse .
41010022	But he was discuforted with yt sayinge and wet awaye morninge for he had greate possessions .
41010023	And Iesus loked rounde aboute and sayde vnto his disciples : what an harde thinge is it for them that have riches to entre into the kyngdome of God .
41010024	And his disciples were astonneyd at his wordes . But Iesus answered agayne and sayde vnto them : chyldre how harde is it for them that trust in riches to entre in to the kyngdome of God .
41010025	It is easyer for a camell to go thorowe ye eye of an nedle then for a riche man to entre into the kyngdome of God .
41010026	And they were astonnyed out of measure sayinge betwene them selves : who then can be saved ?
41010027	Iesus loked vpon them and sayde : with men it is vnpossible but not with God : for with God all thynges are possible .
41010028	And Peter begane to saye vnto him : Lo we have forsaken all and have folowed the .
41010029	Iesus answered and sayde : Verely I saye vnto you ther is no man that forsaketh housse or brethren or sisters or father or mother or wyfe other chyldren or londes for my sake and the gospelles
41010030	which shall not receave an houndred foolde nowe in this lyfe : houses and brethren and sisters and mothers and chyldren and londes with persecucions : and in the worlde to come eternall lyfe .
41010031	Many that are fyrst shalbe last : and the last fyrst .
41010032	And they were in ye waye goinge vp to Ierusalem . And Iesus wet before them : and they were amased and as they folowed were affrayde . And Iesus toke ye . xii . agayne and begane to tell the what thinges shuld happe vnto him .
41010033	Beholde we goo vp to Ierusalem and the sonne of man shalbe delyvered vnto the hye preestes and vnto the Scribes : and they shall condempne him to deeth and shall delyvre him to the gentyls :
41010034	and they shall mocke hym and scourge him and spit vpo hym and kyll him . And the thirde daye he shall ryse agayne .
41010035	And then Iames and Iohn ye sonnes of zebede came vnto him sayinge : master we wolde that thou shuldest do for vs what soever we desyre .
41010036	He sayde vnto them : what wolde ye I shuld do vnto you ?
41010037	They sayd to him : graut vnto vs that we maye sitte one on thy right honde and the other on thy lyfte honde in thy glory .
41010038	But Iesus sayd vnto the : Ye wot not what ye axe . Can ye dryncke of the cup that I shall dryncke of and be baptised in ye baptime that I shalbe baptised in ?
41010039	And they sayde vnto him : that we can . Iesus sayde vnto them : ye shall dryncke of the cup that I shall dryncke of and be baptised with the baptyme that I shalbe baptised in :
41010040	but to sit on my right honde and on my lyfte honde ys not myne to geve but to them for whom it is prepared .
41010041	And when the . x . hearde that they bega to disdayne at Iames and Iohn .
41010042	But Iesus called the vnto him and sayde to them : ye knowe that they which seme to beare rule amonge the gentyls raygne as lordes over the . And they that be greate amoge them exercyse auctorite over them .
41010043	So shall it not be amonge you but whosoever of you wilbe greate amoge you shalbe youre minister .
41010044	And whosoever wilbe chefe shalbe servaunt vnto all .
41010045	For eve the sonne of man came not to be ministred vnto : but to minister and to geve his lyfe for the redempcion of many .
41010046	And they came to Hierico . And as he went oute of Hierico with his disciples and a greate nobre of people : Barthimeus ye sonne of Thimeus which was blinde sate by ye hye wayes syde begginge .
41010047	And when he hearde that it was Iesus of Nazareth he began to crye and to saye : Iesus the sonne of David have mercy on me .
41010048	And many rebuked him yt he shuld holde is peace . But he cryed the moore a greate deale thou sonne of David have mercy on me .
41010049	And Iesus stode still and commaunded hym to be called . And they called the blinde sayinge vnto him : Be of good conforte : ryse he calleth the .
41010050	And he threwe awaye his clooke and roose and came to Iesus .
41010051	And Iesus answered and sayde vnto hym : what wilt thou that I do vnto the ? The blynde sayde vnto hym : master that I myght see .
41010052	Iesus sayde vnto him : goo thy waye thy faith hath saved the . And by and by he receaved his sight and folowed Iesus in the waye .
41011001	And when they came nye to Hierusalem vnto Bethphage and Bethanie besydes mout olivete he sent forth two of his hisciples
41011002	and sayde vnto the : Goo youre wayes into the toune that is over agaynst you . And assone as ye be entred into it ye shall fynde a coolte bounde wheron never man sate : loose him and bringe him .
41011003	And if eny man saye vnto you : why do ye soo ? Saye that the Lorde hath neade of him : and streight waye he will sende him hidder .
41011004	And they wet their waye and foud a coolte tyed by the dore with out in a place where two wayes met and they losed him .
41011005	And divers of the that stode there sayde vnto the : what do ye loosinge ye coolte ?
41011006	And they sayd vnto them eve as Iesus had comaunded the . And they let them goo .
41011007	And they brought ye coolte to Iesus and caste their garmetes on him : and he sate vpo him .
41011008	And many sprede there garmetes in the waye . Other cut doune brauches of the trees and strawed them in ye waye .
41011009	And they yt went before and they that folowed cryed sayinge : Hos anna : blessed be he that cometh in ye name of ye Lorde .
41011010	Blessed be ye kingdome that cometh in ye name of him yt is Lorde of oure father David . Hos anna in ye hyest .
41011011	And ye Lorde entred in to Ierusalem and into the teple . And when he had loked roudabout vpon all thinges and now ye eve tyde was come he went out vnto Bethany with ye twelve .
41011012	And on the morowe when they were come out fro Bethany he hungred
41011013	and spyed a fygge tree a farre of havinge leves and wet to se whether he myght finde eny thinge ther on . But when he came therto he foude no thinge but leves : for the tyme of fygges was not yet .
41011014	And Iesus answered and sayde to it : never man eate frute of the here after whill ye worlde stondith . And his disciples hearde it .
41011015	And they came to Ierusalem . And Iesus wet into the teple and begane to cast out ye sellers and byers in the teple and overthrewe the tables of the money chaungers and the stoles of them that solde doves :
41011016	and wolde not suffre that eny man caried a vessell thorow the temple .
41011017	And he taught sayinge vnto them is it not written : my housse shalbe called the housse of prayer vnto all nacions ? But ye have made it a deen of theves .
41011018	And the Scribes and hye prestes hearde yt and sought howe to distroye him . For they feared him because all the people marveled at his doctrine .
41011019	And when eve was come he went out of the cite .
41011020	And in the mornynge as they passed by they sawe the fygge tree dryed vp by ye rotes .
41011021	And Peter remembred and sayde vnto him : master beholde the fygge tree which thou cursedest is widdred awaye .
41011022	And Iesus answered and sayde vnto them : Have confides in God .
41011023	Verely I saye vnto you that whosoever shall saye vnto this mountayne : take awaye thy silfe and cast thy silfe in to the see and shall not waver in his herte but shall beleve yt those thinges which he sayeth shall come to passe what soever he sayeth shalbe done to him .
41011024	Therfore I saye vnto you what soever ye desyre when ye praye beleve yt ye shall have it and it shalbe done vnto you .
41011025	And when ye stod and praye forgeve yf ye have eny thinge agaynste eny man yt youre father also which is in heve maye forgeve you youre trespases .
41011027	And they came agayne to Hierusalem . And as he walked in the teple ther came to him ye hye prestes and the Scribes and the elders
41011028	and sayd vnto him : by what auctorite doest thou these thinges ? and who gave the this auctorite to do these thinges ?
41011029	Iesus answered and sayde vnto them : I will also axe of you a certayne thinge : and answere ye me and I wyll tell you by what auctorite I do these thinges .
41011030	The baptyme of Iohn was it from heven or of men ? Answer me .
41011031	And they thought in them selves sayinge : yf we shall saye from heven : he will saye why then dyd ye not beleve him ?
41011032	but if we shall saye of me : then feare we ye people . For all men counted Iohn that he was a verie Prophete .
41011033	And they answered and sayd vnto Iesu : we cannot tell . And Iesus answered and sayd vnto them : nether wyll I tell you by what auctorite I do these thynges .
41012001	And he beganne to speake vnto them in similitudes . A certayne man planted a vineyarde and copased it with an hedge and ordeyned a wyne presse and bylt a toure in yt . And let yt out to hyre vnto husbandme and went into a straunge countre .
41012002	And when the tyme was come he sent to the tennauntes a servaunt that he myght receave of the tenauntes of the frute of the vyneyarde .
41012003	And they caught him and bet him and sent him agayne emptye .
41012004	And moreoever he sent vnto them another servaunt and at him they cast stones and brake his heed and sent him agayne all to revyled .
41012005	And agayne he sent another and him they kylled : and many other beetynge some and kyllinge some .
41012006	Yet had he one sonne whom he loved tenderly him also he sent at the last vnto them sayinge : they wyll feare my sonne .
41012007	But the tenauntes sayde amongest them selves : this is the heyre : come let vs kyll hym and ye inheritauce shalbe oures .
41012008	And they toke him and kyllid him and cast him out of the vyneyarde .
41012009	What shall then the lorde of the vyneyarde do ? He will come and destroye ye tenauntes and let out the vyneyarde to other .
41012010	Have ye not redde this scripture ? The stoone which ye bylders dyd refuse is made ye chefe stoone in ye corner :
41012011	this was done of ye Lorde and is mervelous in oure eyes .
41012012	And they went about to take him but they feared the people . For they perceaved that he spake that similitude agaynst them . And they left him and went their waye .
41012013	And they sent vnto him certayne of ye Pharises with Herodes servantes to take him in his wordes .
41012014	And assone as they were come they sayd vnto him : master we knowe yt thou arte true and carest for no man : for thou consyderest not the degre of men but teachest the waye of God truly : Ys it laufull to paye tribute to Cesar or not ?
41012015	Ought we to geve or ought we not to geve ? He vnderstode their simulacion and sayde vnto them : Why tepte ye me ? Brynge me a peny that I maye se yt .
41012016	And they brought . And he sayde vnto them : Whose ys thys ymage and superscripcion ? And they sayde vnto him Cesars .
41012017	And Iesus answered and saide vnto the : Then geve to Cesar that which belongeth to Cesar : and to God that which perteyneth to God . And they mervelled at him .
41012018	Then came the Saduces vnto him which saye ther is no resurreccion . And they axed hym sayinge :
41012019	Master Moses wroote vnto vs yf eny mans brother dye and leve his wyfe behinde him and leve no chyldren : that then hys brother shuld take his wyfe and reyse vp seed vnto his brother .
41012020	Ther were seven brethren : and the fyrst toke a wyfe and when he dyed leeft no seed behynde him .
41012021	And the seconde toke hir and dyed : nether leeft eny seed . And the thyrde lyke wyse .
41012022	And seve had her and leeft no seed behynde them . Last of all the wyfe dyed also .
41012023	In the resurreccio then when they shall ryse agayne : whose wyfe shall she be of them ? For seven had her to wyfe .
41012024	Iesus answered and sayde vnto them : Are ye not therfore deceaved and vnderstonde not the scryptures nether the power of God ?
41012025	For when they shall ryse agayne fro deeth they nether mary nor are maryed : but are as the angels which are in heven .
41012026	As touchynge the deed that they shall ryse agayne : have ye not redde in the boke of Moses howe in the busshe God spake vnto him sayinge : I am the God of Abraham and God of Ysaac and the God of Iacob ?
41012027	He is not the God of the deed but the God of the livynge . Ye are therfore greatly deceaved .
41012028	And ther came one of the scribes that had hearde them disputynge to gedder and perceaved that he had answered them well and axed him : Which is the fyrste of all the commaundemetes ?
41012029	Iesus answered him : the fyrste of all the comaundementes is . Heare Israel : The Lorde God is one Lorde .
41012030	And thou shalt love the Lorde thy God with all thy hert and with all thy soule and with all thy mynde and with all thy strength . This is the fyrste commaundement .
41012031	And the seconde is lyke vnto this : Thou shalt love thy neghbour as thy silfe . Ther is none other commaundement greater then these .
41012032	And the Scribe sayde vnto him : well master thou hast sayd ye truthe that ther ys one God and that ther is none but he .
41012033	And to love him with all the herte and with all the mynde and with all the soule and with all the stregth : and to love a mans neghbour as him silfe ys a greater thinge then all burntofferings and sacrifices .
41012034	And when Iesus sawe that he answered discretly he sayde vnto him : Thou arte not farre from the kyngdome of God . And no man after that durst axe him eny questio .
41012035	And Iesus answered and sayde teachynge in the temple : how saye the Scribes yt Christ is the sonne of David ?
41012036	for David him selfe inspyred with the holy goost sayde : The Lorde sayde to my Lorde syt on my right honde tyll I make thyne enemyes thy fote stole .
41012037	Then David hym silfe calleth him Lorde : and by what meanes is he then his sonne ? And moche people hearde him gladly .
41012038	And he sayde vnto them in his doctrine : beware of the Scribes which love to goo in longe clothinge : and love salutacions in ye market places
41012039	and the chefe seates in the synagoges and to syt in the vppermost roumes at feastes
41012040	and devoure widowes houses and that vnder coloure of longe prayinge . These shall receave greater dampnacion .
41012041	And Iesus sat over agaynst the treasury and behelde how the people put money in to the treasury . And many that were ryche cast in moch .
41012042	And ther cam a certayne povre widowe and she threwe in two mytes which make a farthynge .
41012043	And he called vnto him his disciples and sayde vnto them : Verely I saye vnto you that this pover widowe hath cast moare in then all they which have caste into the treasury .
41012044	For they all dyd cast in of their superfluyte : but she of her poverte dyd cast in all that she had eve all her livynge .
41013001	And as he went out of the teple one of his disciples sayde vnto him : Master se what stones and what byldynges are here .
41013002	And Iesus answered and sayde vnto him : Seist thou these greate byldinges ? There shall not be leefte one stone vpon a another that shall not be throwen doune .
41013003	And as he sate on moute olivete over agest the teple Peter and Iames and Iohn and Andrew axed him secretly :
41013004	tell vs when shall these thinges be ? And what is ye signe whe all these thinges shalbe fulfilled ?
41013005	And Iesus answered the and bega to saye : take hede lest eny man deceave you .
41013006	For many shall come in my name sayinge : I am Christ and shall deceave many .
41013007	When ye shall heare of warre and tydinges of warre be ye not troubled . For soche thinges muste nedes be . But the ende is not yet .
41013008	For ther shall nacion aryse agaynste nacion and kyngdome agaynst kyngdome . And ther shalbe erth quakes in all quarters and famyshment and troubles . These are the begynnynge of sorowes .
41013009	But take ye hede to youre selves . For they shall bringe you vp to ye counsels and into ye synagoges and ye shalbe beaten : ye and shalbe brought before rulers and kynges for my sake for a testimoniall vnto them .
41013010	And the gospell must fyrste be publysshed amoge all nacions .
41013011	But when they leade you and present you toke noo thought afore honde what ye shall saye nether ymagion : but whatsoever is geve you at the same tyme that speake . For it shall not be ye that shall speake but ye holy goost .
41013012	Ye and the brother shall delyvre the brother to deeth and the father the sonne and the chyldre shall ryse agaynste their fathers and mothers and shall put them to deeth .
41013013	And ye shalbe hated of all men for my names sake . But whosoever shall endure vnto the ende the same shalbe safe .
41013014	Moreover whe ye se the abhominacio that betokeneth desolacion wherof is spoken by Daniel the Prophet stonde where it ought not let him that redeth vnderstonde . Then let them that be in Iurie fle to the mountaynes .
41013015	And let him that is on the housse toppe not descende doune into the housse nether entre therin to fetche eny thinge oute of his housse .
41013016	And let hym that is in the felde not tourne backe agayne vnto the thinges which he leeft behynde him for to take his cloothes with him .
41013017	Woo is then to them that are wt chylde and to them that geve soucke in thoose dayes .
41013018	But praye that youre flyght be not in the wynter .
41013019	For ther shalbe in those dayes suche tribulacion as was not from the begynninge of creatures which God created vnto this tyme nether shalbe .
41013020	And excepte yt the Lorde shuld shorten those dayes no ma shuld be saved . But for the electes sake which he hath chosen he hath shortened those dayes .
41013021	And then yf eny man saye to you : loo here is Christ : loo he is there beleve not .
41013022	For falce Christes shall aryse and falce Prophetes and shall shewe myracles and wondres to deceave yf it were possible evyn the electe .
41013023	But take ye hede : beholde I have shewed you all thinges before .
41013024	Moreover in thoose dayes after that tribulacio the sunne shall wexe darke and the mone shall not geve her light
41013025	and the starres of heven shall fall : and the powers wich are in heven shall move .
41013026	And then shall they se the sonne of man comynge in the cloudes with greate power and glory .
41013027	And then shall he sende his angels and shall gaddre to gedder his electe from the fower wyndes and from the one ende of the worlde to the other .
41013028	Learne a similitude of ye fygge tree . When his braunches are yet tender and hath brought forthe leves ye knowe that sommer is neare .
41013029	So in lyke maner when ye se these thinges come to passe : vnderstond that it ys nye even at the dores .
41013030	Verely I saye vnto you yt this generacion shall not passe tyll all these thinges be done .
41013031	Heven and erth shall passe but my wordes shall not passe .
41013032	But of the daye and the houre knoweth no ma : no not the angels which are in heven : nether the sonne him silfe save the father only .
41013033	Take hede watche and praye for ye knowe not when the tyme ys .
41013034	As a man which is gone in to a straunge countrey and hath lefte hys housse and geven auctorite to his servautes and to every man hys worke and commaunded the porter to watche .
41013035	Watche therfore for ye knowe not when the master of ye housse will come whether at eve or at mydnyght whether at the cocke crowynge or in the daunynge :
41013036	lest yf he come sodenly he shuld fynde you slepynge .
41013037	And that I saye vnto you I saye vnto all men watche .
41014001	After two dayes folowed ester and the dayes of swete breed . And the hye prestes and the Scrybes sought meanes how they myght take hym by crafte and put him to deeth .
41014002	But they sayde : not in the feast daye leest eny busynes aryse amonge the people .
41014003	When he was in Bethania in the housse of Simon the leper even as he sate at meate ther came a woma hauynge an alablaster boxe of oyntment called narde that was pure and costly : and she brake the boxe and powred it on is heed .
41014004	And ther were some that were not content in them selves and sayde : what neded this waste of oyntment ?
41014005	For it myght have bene soolde for more then thre hundred pens and bene geve vnto the poore . And they grudged agaynste hir .
41014006	And Iesus sayde : let hir be in reest why trouble ye hir ? She hath done a good worke on me .
41014007	For ye shall have poore with you all wayes : and when soever ye will ye maye do them good : but me ye shall not have alwayes .
41014008	She hath done that she coulde : she came a fore honde to anoynt my boddy to his buryinge warde .
41014009	Verely I saye vnto you : wheresoever this gospell shalbe preached thorowout the whole worlde : thys also that she hath done shalbe rehearsed in remembraunce of her .
41014010	And Iudas Iscarioth one of the twelve went awaye vnto the hye prestes to betraye hym vnto them .
41014011	When they herde that they were gladde and promised yt they wolde geve him money . And he sought howe he myght conveniently betraye him .
41014012	And the fyrste daye of swete breed when men offer ye pascall lambe his disciples sayd vnto him : where wilt thou that we goo and prepare that thou mayst eate the ester lambe ?
41014013	And he sent forth two of his disciples and sayde vnto them : Goo ye into the cyte and ther shall a man mete you beringe a pitcher of water folowe him .
41014014	And whither soever he goeth in saye ye to ye good man of ye housse : the master axeth where is the geest chambre where I shall eate ye ester lambe with my disciples .
41014015	And he will shewe you a greate parlour paved and prepared : there make ready for vs .
41014016	And his disciples went forth and came to the cyte and founde as he had sayd vnto them : and made ready the ester lambe .
41014017	And at even he came with the . xii .
41014018	And as they sate at borde and ate Iesus sayde : Verely I saye vnto you : that one of you shall betraye me which eateth with me .
41014019	And they begane to morne and to saye to him one by one : ys it I ? And a nother sayde : ys it I ?
41014020	He answered and sayde vnto them : It ys one of the . xii . and the same deppeth with me in the platter .
41014021	The sonne of man goeth as it ys written of him : but woo be to that man by whome the sonne of man is betrayed . Good were it for him if that man had never bene borne .
41014022	And as they ate Iesus toke breede blessed and brake and gave to them and sayde : Take eate this ys my body .
41014023	And he toke the cup gave thankes and gave it to them and they all dranke of it .
41014024	And he sayde vnto them : This is my bloude of the new testament which is sheed for many .
41014025	Verely I saye vnto you : I will drinke no moore of this frute of the vyne vntyll that daye that I drinke it new in the kyngdome of God .
41014026	And when they had sayd grace they went out to mount Olyvete .
41014027	And Iesus sayde vnto them : All ye shalbe offended thorow me this nyght . For it is wrytte : I will smyte ye shepeherd and the shepe shalbe scattered .
41014028	But after that I am rysen agayne I will goo into Galile before you .
41014029	Peter sayde vnto him : And though all men shuld be offended yet wolde not I .
41014030	And Iesus sayd vnto him : Verely I saye vnto ye this daye even in this nyght before ye cocke crowe twyse thou shalt denye me thryse .
41014031	And he spake boldlyer : no yf I shulde dye wt the I will not deny the . Lyke wyse also sayd they all .
41014032	And they came into a place named Gethsemani . And he sayde to his disciples : Syt ye here whyll I goo aparte and praye .
41014033	And he toke with him Peter Iames and Iohn and he began to waxe abasshed and to be in an agonye
41014034	and sayde vnto the : My soule is very hevy even vnto the deeth tary here and watche .
41014035	And he went forth a lytle and fell doune on ye grounde and prayed : that yf it were possible the houre myght passe from him .
41014036	And he sayd : Abba father all thinges are possible vnto the take awaye this cup from me . Neverthelesse not that I will but that thou wilt be done .
41014037	And he cam and founde the slepinge and sayd to Peter : Simon slepest thou ? Couldest not thou watche with me one houre ?
41014038	watche ye and praye leest ye entre into temptacion : ye sprete is redy but ye flessh is weeke .
41014039	And agayne he went awaye and prayde and spake ye same wordes .
41014040	And he returned and founde them a slepe agayne for their eyes were hevy : nether wist they what to answere him .
41014041	And he cam the thyrde tyme and sayd vnto the : slepe hens forth and take youre ease it is ynough . The houre is come beholde ye sonne of man shalbe delyvered into ye hondes of synners .
41014042	Ryse vp let vs goo . Loo he that betrayeth me is at hande .
41014043	And immediatly whyll he yet spake came Iudas one of the twelve and with him a greate nomber of people with sweardes and staves from the hye prestes and scribes and elders .
41014044	And he that betrayed him had geven them a generall toke sayinge : whosoever I do kisse he it is : take him and leade him awaye warely .
41014045	And assone as he was come he went streyght waye to him and sayd vnto him : master master and kissed him .
41014046	And they layde their hondes on him and toke him .
41014047	And one of them that stode by drue out a swearde and smote a servaunt of the hye preste and cut of his eare .
41014048	And Iesus answered and sayd vnto the : ye be come out as vnto a thefe wt sweardes and with staves for to take me .
41014049	I was dayly with you in ye temple teachinge and ye toke me not : but yt the scriptures shuld be fulfilled .
41014050	And they all forsoke him and ranne awaye .
41014051	And ther folowed him a certeyne yonge man cloothed in lynnen apon ye bare and the yongemen caught him
41014052	and he lefte his lynnen and fleed from them naked .
41014053	And they leed Iesus awaye to ye hyest preste of all and to him came all the hye prestes and the elders and the scribes .
41014054	And Peter folowed him a greate waye of even into the pallys of the hye preste and sat with the servauntes and warmed him sylfe at the fyre .
41014055	And the hye prestes and all ye counsell sought for witnes agaynste Iesu to put him to death and founde noone .
41014056	Yet many bare falce witnes agaynste him but their witnes aggreed not to geder .
41014057	And ther aroose certayne and brought falce witnes agaynste him sayinge .
41014058	We herde him saye : I will destroye this temple made with hondes and with in thre dayes I will bylde another made with out hondes .
41014059	But their witnes agreed not to geder .
41014060	And the hyeste preste stode up amongest them and axed Iesus sayinge : answerest thou nothinge ? How is it that these beare witnes agaynst the ?
41014061	And he helde his peace and answered noothinge . Agayne the hyeste Preste axed him and sayde vnto him : Arte thou Christ the sonne of the blessed ?
41014062	And Iesus sayde : I am . And ye shall se the sonne of man syt on the ryght honde of power and come in the cloudes of heven .
41014063	Then the hyest preste rent his cloothes and sayd : what nede we eny further of witnes ?
41014064	Ye have herde the blasphemy what thinke ye ? And they all gave sentence yt he was worthy of deeth .
41014065	And some begane to spit at him and to cover his face and to bete him with fistes and to saye vnto him arede vnto vs . And the servauntes boffeted him on the face .
41014066	And as Peter was beneeth in ye pallys ther came one of ye weches of ye hyest preste :
41014067	and whe she saw Petre warmynge him sylfe she loked on him and sayd : wast not thou also wt Iesus of Nazareth ?
41014068	And he denyed it sayinge : I knowe him not nether wot I what thou sayest . And he went out into ye poorche and the cocke crewe .
41014069	And a damsell sawe him and agayne beganne to saye to the that stode by this is one of the .
41014070	And he denyed it agayne . And anone after they that stode by sayde agayne to Peter : suerly thou arte one of the for thou arte of Galile and thy speache agreth therto .
41014071	And he beganne to cursse and to sweare sayinge : I knowe not this man of whom ye speake .
41014072	And agayne the cocke krewe and Peter remembred the worde that Iesus sayd vnto him : before the cocke crowe twyse thou shalt deny me thryse and beganne to wepe .
41015001	And anone in ye dawnynge the hye prestes helde counsell wt ye elders and ye scribes and ye whoole cogregacion and bounde Iesus and ledde him awaye and delivered him to Pilate .
41015002	And Pilate axed him : arte thou the kynge of the Iewes ? And he answered and sayde vnto him : thou sayest it .
41015003	And the hye prestes accused him of many thinges .
41015004	Wherfore Pilate axed him agayne sayinge : Answerest thou nothinge ? Beholde how many thinges they lay vnto thy charge .
41015005	Iesus yet answered never aworde so that Pilate merveled .
41015006	At that feast Pilate was wont to delivre at their pleasure a presoner : whomsoever they wolde desyre .
41015007	And ther was one named Barrabas which laye bounde with the that made insurreccion and in the insurreccion comitted murther .
41015008	And ye people called vnto him and began to desyre accordinge as he had ever done vnto them .
41015009	Pylate answered them and sayd : Will ye that I lowse vnto you the kynge of the Iewes ?
41015010	For he knewe that the hye Prestes had delyvered him of envy .
41015011	But the hye prestes had moved the people that he shuld rather delyvre Barrabas vnto them .
41015012	And Pylate answered agayne and sayd vnto the : What will ye then that I do wt him whom ye call ye kynge of ye Iewes ?
41015013	And they cryed agayne : crucifie him .
41015014	Pylate sayde vnto them : What evell hath he done ? And they cryed ye moore fervently : crucifie him .
41015015	And so Pylate willinge to content the people lowsed them Barrabas and delyvered Iesus when he had scourged him for to be crucified .
41015016	And the souddeers ledde him awaye into ye commen hall and called togedder the whoole multitude
41015017	and they clothed him with purple and they platted a croune of thornes and crouned him with all
41015018	and beganne to salute him . Hayle kynge of the Iewes .
41015019	And they smoote him on the heed wt a rede and spat apon him and kneled doune and worsheped him .
41015020	And when they had moocked him they toke the purple of him and put his awne cloothes on him and ledde him oute to crucifie him .
41015021	And they compelled one that passed by called Symon of Cyrene ( which cam oute of the felde and was father of Alexander and Rufus ) to beare his crosse .
41015022	And they brought him to a place named Golgotha ( which is by interpretacion the place of deed mens scoulles )
41015023	and they gave him to drinke wyne myngled with myrte but he receaved it not .
41015024	And when they had crucified him they parted his garmentes castinge loottes for them what every man shulde have .
41015025	And it was aboute ye thyrde houre and they crucified him .
41015026	And the tytle of his cause was wrytten : The kynge of the Iewes .
41015027	And they crucified with him two theves : the one on the ryght honde and the other on his lyfte .
41015028	And the scripture was fulfilled which sayeth : he was counted amonge the wicked .
41015029	And they that went by rayled on him : waggynge their heedes and sayinge : A wretche that destroyest the temple and byldest it in thre dayes :
41015030	save thy sylfe and come doune from the crosse .
41015031	Lyke wyse also mocked him ye hye preestes amonge them selves with the scribes and sayde : He saved other men him sylfe he cannot save .
41015032	Let Christ the kynge of Israel now descende from the crosse that we maye se and beleve . And they that were crucified with him checked him also .
41015033	And when the sixte houre was come darknes aroose over all the erth vntyll ye nynthe houre .
41015034	And at the nynthe houre Iesus cryed with a loude voyce sayinge : Eloi Eloi lamaasbathani which is yf it be interpreted : my God my God why hast thou forsaken me ?
41015035	And some of them that stode by when they hearde yt sayde : beholde he calleth for Helyas
41015036	And one ran and filled a sponge full of veneger and put it on a rede and gave him to drinke sayinge : let him alone let vs se whether Helyas will come and take him doune .
41015037	But Iesus cryed with aloude voyce and gave vp the gooste .
41015038	And the vayle of the temple dyd rent in two peces from the toppe to the boottome .
41015039	And when the Centurion which stode before him sawe that he so cryed and gave vp the gooste he sayd : truly this man was the sonne of God .
41015040	Ther were also wemen a good waye of beholdinge him : amonge whom was Mary Magdalen and Mary the mother of Iames the lytle and of Ioses and Mary Salome
41015041	which also when he was in Galile folowed him and ministred vnto him and many other wemen which came vp with him to Hierusalem .
41015042	And now when nyght was come ( because it was ye even that goeth before ye saboth )
41015043	Ioseph of Arimathia a noble councelour which also loked for ye kyngdome of God came and went in booldly vnto Pylate and begged ye boddy of Iesu .
41015044	And Pylate merveled that he was alredy deed and called vnto him ye Centurion and axed of him whether he had bene eny whyle deed .
41015045	And when he knewe the trueth of the Centurion he gave ye body to Ioseph .
41015046	And he bought a lynnen cloothe and toke him doune and wrapped him in ye lynnen cloothe and layde him in a tombe yt was hewen oute of ye rocke and rolled a stone vnto the doze of the sepulcre .
41015047	And Mary Magdalen and Mary Ioses beheld where he was layde .
41016001	And when ye saboth daye was past Mary Magdalen and Mary Iacobi and Salome bought odures that they myght come and anoynt him .
41016002	And erly in the morninge the nexte daye after the saboth day they came vnto the sepulcre when the sunne was rysen .
41016003	And they sayd one to another : who shall rolle vs awaye the stone from the dore of the sepulcre ?
41016004	And when they looked they sawe how the stone was rolled awaye : for it was a very greate one .
41016005	And they went into the sepulcre and sawe a yonge man syttinge on the ryght syde cloothed in a longe whyte garmet and they were abasshed .
41016006	And he sayd vnto the be not afrayed : ye seke Iesus of Nazareth which was crucified . He is rysen he is not here . Beholde the place where they put him .
41016007	But go youre waye and tell his disciples and namely Peter : he will goo before you into Galile : there shall ye se him as he sayde vnto you .
41016008	And they went oute quickly and fleed from the sepulcre . For they trembled and were amased . Nether sayd they eny thinge to eny man for they were afrayed .
41016009	When Iesus was rysen the morow after ye saboth daye he appered fyrst to Mary Magdalen oute of whom he cast seven devyls .
41016010	And she wet and toolde them that were with him as they morned and weapte .
41016011	And when they herde that he was alyve and he had appered to hyr they beleved it not .
41016012	After that he appered vnto two of them in a straunge figure as they walked and went into the country .
41016013	And they went and toolde it to the remnaunt . And they beleved them nether .
41016014	After that he appered vnto the eleve as they sate at meate : and cast in their tethe their vnbelefe and hardnes of herte : be cause they beleued not them which had sene him after his resurreccio .
41016015	And he sayd vnto them : Goo ye in to all the worlde and preache the glad tyges to all creatures
41016016	he that beleueth and is baptised shall be saved . But he that beleveth not shalbe dampned .
41016017	And these signes shall folowe them that beleve : In my name they shall cast oute devyls and shall speake with newe tonges
41016018	and shall kyll serpentes . And yf they drinke eny dedly thinge yt shall not hurte the . They shall laye their hondes on ye sicke and they shall recover .
41016019	So then when the lorde had spoken vnto them he was receaued into heauen and is set doune on the ryght honde of God .
41016020	And they went forth and preached every where . And the Lorde wrought with them and confirmed the worde with miracles that folowed .
42001001	For as moche as many have take in hand to compyle a treates of thoo thinges which are surely knowen amonge vs
42001002	even as they declared them vnto vs which from the beginnynge sawe them their selves and were ministers at the doyng :
42001003	I determined also assone as I had searched out diligently all thinges from the beginnynge that then I wolde wryte vnto the good Theophilus :
42001004	that thou myghtest knowe the certente of thoo thinges wher of thou arte informed .
42001005	There was in the dayes of Herode kynge of Iurie a certayne prest named Zacharias of ye course of Abia . And his wyfe was of ye doughters of Aaron : And her name was Elizabeth .
42001006	Booth were perfect before God and walked in all the lawes and ordinaces of the Lorde that no man coulde fynde fawte with them .
42001007	And they had no chylde because that Elizabeth was barre and booth were well stricken in age .
42001008	And it cam to passe as he executed the prestes office before god as his course came
42001009	( accordinge to the custome of the prestes office ) his lot was to bourne incece .
42001010	And wet into ye teple of ye Lorde and the whoale multitude of ye people were with out in prayer whill the incense was aburnynge .
42001011	And ther appered vnto him an angell of the lorde stondinge on the ryght syde of the altare of incense .
42001012	And when Zacharias sawe him he was abasshed and feare came on him .
42001013	And the angell sayde vnto him : feare not Zachary for thy prayer is hearde : And thy wyfe Elizabeth shall beare ye a sonne and thou shalt call his name Iohn
42001014	and thou shalt have ioye and gladnes and many shall reioyce at his birth .
42001015	For he shalbe greate in the sight of the lorde and shall nether drinke wyne ner stronge drinke . And he shalbe filled with the holy goost even in his mothers wombe :
42001016	and many of the chyldren of Israel shall he tourne to their Lorde God .
42001017	And he shall goo before him in the sprete and power of Helyas to tourne the hertes of the fathers to the chyldren and the vnbelevers to the wysdom of the iuste men : to make the people redy for the Lorde .
42001018	And Zacharias sayde vnto ye angell : Wher by shall I knowe this ? seinge that I am olde and my wyfe well stricken in yeares .
42001019	And the angell answered and sayde vnto him : I am Gabriell that stonde in the presens of God and am sent to speake vnto the : and to shewe the these glad tydinges .
42001020	And beholde thou shalt be domme and not able to speake vntyll the tyme that these thinges be performed because thou belevedst not my wordes which shalbe fulfilled in their season .
42001021	And the people wayted for Zacharias and mervelled that he taryed in the temple .
42001022	And whe he cam oute he could not speake vnto them . Wherby they perceaved that he had sene some vision in the temple . And he beckened vnto them and remayned speachlesse .
42001023	And it fortuned assone as ye tyme of his office was oute he departed home into his awne housse .
42001024	And after thoose dayes his wyfe Elizabeth coceaved and hyd her sylfe . v . monethes sayinge :
42001025	This wyse hath God dealte wt me in ye dayes when he loked on me to take from me the rebuke yt I suffred amonge men .
42001026	And in ye . vi . moneth ye angell Gabriel was sent fro god vnto a cite of Galile named Nazareth
42001027	to a virgin spoused to a man whose name was Ioseph of ye housse of David and ye virgins name was Mary .
42001028	And ye angell went in vnto her and sayde : Hayle full of grace ye Lorde is with ye : blessed arte thou amonge wemen .
42001029	When she sawe him she was abasshed at his sayinge : and cast in her mynde what maner of salutacion yt shuld be .
42001030	And ye angell sayde vnto her : feare not Mary : for thou hast founde grace wt god .
42001031	Loo : thou shalt coceave in thy wombe and shalt beare a sonne and shalt call his name Iesus .
42001032	He shalbe greate and shalbe called the sonne of the hyest . And ye lorde God shall geve vnto him the seate of his father David
42001033	and he shall raygne over ye housse of Iacob forever and of his kyngdome shalbe none ende .
42001034	Then sayd Mary vnto ye angell : How shall this be seinge I knowe not a man ?
42001035	And ye angell answered and sayd vnto her : The holy goost shall come apon the and ye power of ye hyest shall over shaddowe ye . Therfore also yt holy thinge which shalbe borne shalbe called ye sonne of god .
42001036	And beholde thy cosen Elizabeth she hath also conceaved a sonne in her age . And this is hyr sixte moneth though she be called barren :
42001037	for wt god can nothinge be vnpossible .
42001038	And Mary sayd : beholde ye honde mayden of ye lorde be it vnto me even as thou hast sayde . And the angell departed from her .
42001039	And Mary arose in thoose dayes and went into ye mountayns wt hast into a cite of Iurie
42001040	and entred into the housse of zachary and saluted Elizabeth .
42001041	And it fortuned as Elizabeth hearde ye salutacion of Mary the babe spronge in her belly . And Elizabeth was filled with the holy goost
42001042	and cryed with a loude voyce and sayde : Blessed arte thou amonge wemen and blessed is the frute of thy wombe .
42001043	And whence hapeneth this to me that the mother of my Lorde shuld come to me ?
42001044	For loo assone as the voyce of thy salutacion sownded in myne eares the babe sprange in my belly for ioye .
42001045	And blessed arte thou that belevedst : for thoose thinges shalbe performed wich were tolde ye from the lorde .
42001046	And Mary sayde . My soule magnifieth the Lorde .
42001047	And my sprete reioyseth in god my savioure
42001048	For he hath loked on the povre degre of his honde mayde . Beholde now from hence forth shall all generacions call me blessed .
42001049	For he that is myghty hath done to me greate thinges and holye is his name .
42001050	And his mercy is on them that feare him thorow oute all generacions .
42001051	He sheweth strength with his arme he scattereth them that are proude in the ymaginacion of their hertes .
42001052	He putteth doune the myghty from their seates and exalteth them of lowe degre .
42001053	He filleth the hongry with good thinges : and sendeth awaye the ryche emptye .
42001054	He remenbreth mercy : and helpeth his servaunt Israel .
42001055	Even as he promised to oure fathers Abraham and to his seede for ever .
42001056	And mary aboode with hyr aboute a . iii . monethes and retourned agayne to hyr awne housse .
42001057	Elizabethes tyme was come that she shuld be delyvered and she brought forth a sonne .
42001058	And her neghboures and her cosins hearde tell how the lorde had shewed great mercy vpon her and they reioysed with her .
42001059	And it fortuned ye eyght daye : they cam to circumcise the chylde : and called his name zacharias after the name of his father .
42001060	How be it his mother answered and sayd : not so but he shalbe called Ihon .
42001061	And they sayd vnto hyr : Ther is none of thy kynne that is named wt this name .
42001062	And they made signes to his father how he wolde have him called .
42001063	And he axed for wrytynge tables and wroote saying : his name is Iohn . And they marvelled all .
42001064	And his mouthe was opened immediatly and his tonge also and he spake lawdynge God .
42001065	And feare came on all the that dwelt nye vnto them . And all these sayinges were noysed abroade throughout all ye hyll coutre of Iurie
42001066	and all they yt herde the layde them vp in their hertes saying : What maner chylde shall this be ? And the honde of ye lorde was with him .
42001067	And his father zacharias was filled with the holy goost and prophisyed sayinge :
42001068	Blessed be the Lorde God of Israel for he hath visited and redemed his people .
42001069	And hath reysed vp an horne of salvacion vnto vs in the housse of his servaunt David .
42001070	Even as he promised by ye mouth of his holy prophetes which were sens ye worlde began
42001071	That we shuld be saved from oure enemies and from the hondis of all that hate vs :
42001072	To fulfill the mercy promised to oure fathers and to remember his holy covenaunt .
42001073	And to performe the oothe which he sware to oure father Adraham
42001074	for to geve vs . That we delyvered oute of ye hondes of oure enemyes myght serve him with oute feare
42001075	all the dayes of oure lyfe in suche holynes and ryghtewesnes that are accept before him .
42001076	And thou chylde shalt be called the Prophet of the hyest : for thou shalt goo before the face of the lorde to prepare his wayes :
42001077	And to geve knowlege of salvacion vnto his people for the remission of synnes :
42001078	Through the tender mercy of oure God wherby the daye springe from an hye hath visited vs .
42001079	To geve light to the that sate in darcknes and in shadowe of deth and to gyde oure fete into the waye of peace .
42001080	And the chylde grew and wexed stronge in sprete and was in wyldernes tyll the daye cam when he shuld shewe him sylfe vnto the Israhelites .
42002001	And it chaunced in thoose dayes : yt ther went oute a comaundment from Auguste the Emperour that all the woorlde shuld be taxed .
42002002	And this taxynge was ye fyrst and executed when Syrenius was leftenaut in Syria .
42002003	And every man went vnto his awne citie to be taxed .
42002004	And Ioseph also ascended from Galile oute of a cite called Nazareth into Iurie : vnto ye cite of David which is called Bethleem because he was of the housse and linage of David
42002005	to be taxed with Mary his spoused wyfe which was with chylde .
42002006	And it fortuned whyll they were there her tyme was come that she shuld be delyvered .
42002007	And she brought forth her fyrst begotten sonne and wrapped him in swadlynge cloothes and layed him in a manger because ther was no roume for them within in the ynne .
42002008	And ther were in the same region shepherdes abydinge in the felde and watching their flocke by nyght .
42002009	And loo : the angell of ye lorde stode harde by the and the brightnes of ye lorde shone rounde aboute them and they were soare afrayed .
42002010	But the angell sayd vnto them : Be not afrayed . For beholde I bringe you tydinges of greate ioye yt shal come to all ye people :
42002011	for vnto you is borne this daye in the cite of David a saveoure which is Christ ye lorde .
42002012	And take this for a signe : ye hall fynde ye chylde swadled and layed in a mager .
42002013	And streight waye ther was with the angell a multitude of hevenly sowdiers laudynge God and sayinge :
42002014	Glory to God an hye and peace on the erth : and vnto men reioysynge .
42002015	And it fortuned assone as the angels were gone awaye fro them in to heven the shepherdes sayd one to another : let vs goo eve vnto Bethleem and se this thynge that is hapened which the Lorde hath shewed vnto vs .
42002016	And they cam with haste and founde Mary and Ioseph and the babe layde in a mager .
42002017	And when they had sene it they publisshed a brode the sayinge which was tolde them of that chylde .
42002018	And all that hearde it wondred at those thinges which were tolde the of the shepherdes .
42002019	But Mary kept all thoose sayinges and pondered them in hyr hert .
42002020	And the shepherdes retourned praysinge and laudinge God for all that they had herde and sene evyn as it was told vnto them .
42002021	And when ye eyght daye was come yt the chylde shuld be circucised his name was called Iesus which was named of the angell before he was conceaved in the wombe .
42002022	And when the tyme of their purificacio ( after the lawe of Moyses ) was come they brought him to Hierusalem to present hym to ye Lorde
42002023	( as yt is written in the lawe of the Lorde : every man that fyrst openeth the matrix shalbe called holy to the Lorde )
42002024	and to offer ( as it ys sayde in the lawe of the Lorde ) a payre of turtle doves or two yonge pigions .
42002025	And beholde ther was a ma in Hierusalem whose name was Simeon . And the same ma was iuste and feared God and longed for the consolacion of Israel and the holy goost was in him .
42002026	And an answer was geven him of the holy goost that he shulde not se deethe before he had sene the lordes Christ .
42002027	And he came by inspiracion into the temple . And when the father and mother brought in the chylde Iesus to do for him after the custome of the lawe
42002028	then toke he him vp in his armes and sayde .
42002029	Lorde Now lettest thou thy seruaut departe in peace accordinge to thy promes .
42002030	For myne eyes have sene ye saveour sent fro ye
42002031	Wich thou hast prepared before the face of all people .
42002032	A light to lighten the gentyls and the glory of thy people Israel .
42002033	And his father and mother mervelled at those thinges which were spoke of him .
42002034	And Simeon blessed them and sayde vnto Mary his mother : beholde this chyld shalbe the fall and resurreccio of many in Israel and a signe which shalbe spoke agaynste .
42002035	And morover the swearde shall pearce thy soule yt the thoughtes of many hertes maye be opened .
42002036	And ther was a Prophetesse one Anna the doughter of Phanuel of the tribe of Aser : which was of a greate age and had lyved with an husbande . vii . yeres from her virginite .
42002037	And she had bene a wedowe aboute . iiii . scoore and . iiii . yere which went never oute of the temple but served God with fastinge and prayer nyght and daye .
42002038	And the same came forth that same houre and praysed the Lorde and spake of him to all that loked for redempcion in Hierusalem .
42002039	And assone as they had performed all thinges accordinge to the lawe of the Lorde they returned into Galile to their awne cite Nazareth .
42002040	And the chylde grewe and wexed stronde in sprete and was filled with wysdome and the grace of God was with hym .
42002041	And his father and mother went to Hierusalem every yeare at the feeste of ester .
42002042	And when he was . xii . yere olde they went vp to Hierusalem after the custome of the feeste .
42002043	And when they had fulfilled the dayes as they returned home the chylde Iesus boode styll in Hierusalem vnknowynge to his father and mother .
42002044	For they supposed he had bene in the copany and therfore came a days iorney and sought him amoge their kynsfolke and acquayntaunce .
42002045	And when they founde hym not they went backe agayne to Hierusalem and sought him .
42002046	And it fortuned after . iii . dayes that they founde him in the teple sittinge in the middes of the doctours both hearynge them and posinge them .
42002047	And all that hearde him mervelled at his wit and answers .
42002048	And when they sawe him they were astonyed . And his mother sayde vnto him : sonne why hast thou thus dealte with vs ? Beholde thy father and I have sought the sorowenge .
42002049	And he sayde vnto the : how is it yt ye sought me ? Wist ye not that I must goo aboute my fathers busines ?
42002050	And they vnderstode not ye sayinge that he spake to them .
42002051	And he went with them and came to Nazareth and was obedient to the . But his mother kept all these thinges in her hert .
42002052	And Iesus increased in wisdom and age and in favoure with god and man .
42003001	In the fiftenthe yeare of the raygne of Tiberius the Emperoure Pontius Pylate beinge leftenaut of Iurie and Herode beinge Tetrach of Galile and his brother Philip Tetrach in Iturea and in the region of Traconites and Lysanias the Tetrach of Abyline
42003002	when Anna and Cayphas were the hye prestes : the worde of God came vnto Iohn ye sonne of zacharias in the wildernes .
42003003	And he came in to all the coostes aboute Iordan preachynge the baptyme of repentaunce for the remission of synnes
42003004	at it is written in the boke of the sayinges of Esaias ye Prophet which sayeth : The voyce of a cryar in wyldernes prepare the waye of the Lorde make hys pathes strayght .
42003005	Every valley shalbe fylled and every moutayne and hyll shalbe brought lowe . And crocked thinges shalbe made streight : and the rough wayes shalbe made smoth :
42003006	and all flesshe shall se the saveour sent of God .
42003007	Then sayde he to the people that were come to be baptysed of him : O generacion of vipers who hath taught you to flye from the wrath to come ?
42003008	Bringe forth due frutes of repentaunce and begynne not to saye in youre selves we have Abraham to oure father . For I saye vnto you : God is able of these stones to reyse vp chyldren vnto Abraham .
42003009	Now also ys the axe leyd vnto the rote of the trees : so yt every tree which bringeth not forth good frute shalbe hewe doune and caste in to ye fyre .
42003010	And the people axed him sayinge : What shall we do then ?
42003011	He answered and sayde vnto them : He that hath two coottes let him parte with him that hath none : and he that hath meate let him do lyke wyse .
42003012	Then came ther Publicans to be baptised and sayde vnto him : Master what shall we do ?
42003013	And he sayde vnto the : requyre no more then that which ys appoynted vnto you .
42003014	The soudyoures lyke wyse demaunded of hym sayinge : and what shall we do ? And he sayde to them : Do violence to noo ma : nether trouble eny man wrongfully : but be content with youre wages .
42003015	As the people were in a doute and all men disputed in their hertes of Iohn whether he were very Christ :
42003016	Ihon answered and sayde to them all : I baptyse you wt water but a stronger then I cometh after me whose shue latchet I am not worthy to vnlouse : he will baptise you with the holy goost and with fyre :
42003017	which hath his fanne in his hond and will pourge his floore and will gader the corne into his barne : but the chaffe wyll he bourne with fyre that never shalbe quenched .
42003018	And many other thinges in his exhortacion preached he vnto the people .
42003019	Then Herode the Tetrach ( when he was rebuked of him for Herodias his brother Philippes wyfe and for all the evyls which Herod had done )
42003020	added this above all and leyd Iohn in preson .
42003021	And yt fortuned as all the people receaved baptyme ( and when Iesus was baptised and dyd praye ) that heave was opened
42003022	and the holy goost came doune in a bodely shape lyke a dove vpo him and a voyce came fro heve sayinge : Thou arte my dere sonne in the do I delyte .
42003023	And Iesus him silfe was about thirty yere of age when he begane beinge as men supposed the sonne of Ioseph . which Ioseph was the sonne of Heli
42003024	which was the sonne of Mathat which was the sonne of Levi : which was the sonne of Melchi : which was the sonne of Ianna : which was the sonne of Ioseph :
42003025	which was the sonne of Matatthias : which was the sonne of Amos : which was the sonne of Nahum : which was the sonne of Esli : which was the sonne of Nagge :
42003026	which was the sonne of Maath : which was the sonne of Matathias : which was the sonne of Semei : which was the sonne of Ioseph : which was the sonne of Iuda :
42003027	which was the sonne of Iohanna : which was the sonne of Rhesya : which was the sonne of zorobabel : which was the sonne of Salathiel : which was the sonne of Neri :
42003028	which was the sonne of Melchi : which was the sonne of Addi : which was the sonne of Cosam : which was the sonne of Helmadam : which was the sonne of Her :
42003029	which was the sonne of Ieso : which was the sonne of Helieser : which was the sonne of Ioram : which was the sonne of Mattha : which was the sonne of Levi :
42003030	which was the sonne of Simeon : which was the sonne of Iuda : which was the sonne of Ioseph : which was the sonne of Ionam : which was the sonne of Heliachim :
42003031	which was the sonne of Melea : which was the sonne of Menam : which was the sonne of Mathathan : which was the sonne of Nathan : which was the sonne of David :
42003032	which was the sonne of Iesse : which was the sonne of Obed : which was the sonne of Boos : which was the sonne of Salmon : which was the sonne of Naason :
42003033	which was the sonne of Aminadab : which was the sonne of Aram : which was the sonne of Esrom : which was the sonne of Phares : which was the sonne of Iuda :
42003034	which was the sonne of Iacob : which was the sonne of Ysaac : which was the sonne of Abraham : which was the sonne of Tharra : which was the sonne of Nachor :
