42003035	which was the sonne of Saruch : which was the sonne of Ragau : which was the sonne of Phalec : which was the sonne of Heber : which was the sonne of Sala :
42003036	which was the sonne of Cainan : which was the sonne of Arphaxat : which was the sonne of Sem : which was the sonne of Noe : which was the sonne of Lameth :
42003037	which was the sonne of Mathusala : which was the sonne of Enoch : which was the sonne of Iareth : which was the sonne of Malalehel . which was the sonne of Cainan :
42003038	which was the sonne of Enos : which was the sonne of Seth : which was the sonne of Adam : which was the sonne of God .
42004001	Iesus then full of the holy goost returnyd fro Iordan and was caryed of ye sprete into wildernes
42004002	and was . xl . dayes tempted of the devyll . And in thoose dayes ate he no thinge . And when they were ended he afterward hongred .
42004003	And the devyll sayde vnto him : yf thou be the sonne of God comaunde this stone yt it be breed .
42004004	And Iesus answered hym sayinge : It is writte : man shall not live by breed only but by every worde of God .
42004005	And ye devyll toke him vp into an hye moutayne and shewed him all the kyngdoms of the worlde eve in ye twincklinge of an eye .
42004006	And ye devyll sayde vnto him : all this power will I geve ye every whit and the glory of the : for yt is delyvered to me and to whosoever I will I geve it .
42004007	Yf thou therfore wilt worshippe me they shalbe all thyne .
42004008	Iesus answered him and sayde : hence from me Sathan . For it is written : Thou shalt honour the Lorde thy God and him only serve .
42004009	And he caryed him to Ierusalem and set him on a pynacle of the temple and sayd vnto him : Yf thou be the sonne of God cast thy silfe doune from hens .
42004010	For it is written he shall geve his angels charge over the to kepe the
42004011	and with there hondis they shall stey the vp that thou dasshe not thy fote agaynst a stone .
42004012	Iesus answered and sayde to him it is sayd : thou shalt not tempte the Lorde thy God .
42004013	Assone as the devyll had ended all his temptacions he departed from him for a season .
42004014	And Iesus retourned by the power of ye sprete in to Galile and there went a fame of him thorowe oute all the regio roude aboute .
42004015	And he taught in their synagoges and was commended of all men .
42004016	And he came to Nazareth where he was noursed and as hys custome was went in to the synagoge on the Saboth dayes and stode vp for to rede .
42004017	And ther was delyvered vnto him ye boke of ye Prophete Esaias . And when he had opened the boke he founde the place where it was written .
42004018	The sprete of the lorde vpon me because he hath annoynted me : to preache ye gospell to ye poore he hath sent me : and to heale the broken harted : to preache delyverauce to the captive and sight to the blinde and frely to set at lyberte them that are brused
42004019	and to preache the acceptable yeare of the Lorde .
42004020	And he cloosed the booke and gave it agayne to the minister and sate doune . And the eyes of all that were in the synagoge were fastened on him .
42004021	And he began to saye vnto them . This daye is this scripture fulfilled in youre eares .
42004022	And all bare him witnes and wondred at the gracious wordes which proceded oute of his mouth and sayde : Is not this Iosephs sonne ?
42004023	And he sayde vnto them : Ye maye very well saye vnto me this proverbe : Phisicion heale thy silfe . Whatsoever we have heard done in Capernaum do the same here lyke wyse in thyne awne countre .
42004024	And he sayde verely I saye vnto you : No Prophet is accepted in his awne countre .
42004025	But I tell you of a truth many wyddowes were in Israell in the dayes of Helias when hevyn was shet thre yeres and syxe monethes when greate fammisshemet was throughoute all the londe
42004026	and vnto none of them was Helias sent save in to Sarephta besydes Sidon vnto a woma that was a widow .
42004027	And many lepers were in Israel in the tyme of Heliseus the Prophete : and yet none of them was healed savinge Naaman of Siria .
42004028	And as many as were in ye sinagoge when they herde that were filled with wrath :
42004029	and roose vp and thrust him oute of the cite and ledde him eve vnto the edge of the hill wher on their cite was bilte to cast him doune hedlynge .
42004030	But he went his waye eve thorow the myddes of them :
42004031	and came in to Capernaum a cyte of Galile and there taught the on the Saboth dayes .
42004032	And they were astonyed at his doctrine : for his preachige was wt power .
42004033	And in the synagoge ther was a ma which had a sprete of an vncleane devell and cryed with aloude voyce
42004034	sayinge : let me alone what hast thou to do with vs thou Iesus of Nazareth ? Arte thou come to destroye vs ? I knowe the what thou arte eve the holy of God .
42004035	And Iesus rebuked him sayinge : holde thy peace and come oute of him . And the devyll threwe him in the myddes of them and came oute of him and hurt him not .
42004036	And feare came on them all and they spake amonge them selves sayinge : what maner a thinge is this ? For with auctorite and power he commaundeth the foule spretes and they come out ?
42004037	And ye fame of him spreed abroode thorowoute all places of the countre round aboute .
42004038	And he roose vp and came oute of ye sinagoge and entred in to Simons housse . And Simos motherelawe was take with a greate fever and they made intercession to him for her .
42004039	And he stode over her and rebuked the fever : and it leeft her . And immediatly she arose and ministred vnto them .
42004040	When the sonne was doune all they that had sicke take with divers deseases brought them vnto him : and he layde his hondes on every one of them and healed them .
42004041	And devils also cam out of many of them crying and saying : thou arte Christ the sonne of God . And he rebuked them and suffered them not to speake : for they knewe that he was Christ .
42004042	Assone as it was daye he departed and went awaye into a desert place and ye people sought him and came to him and kept him that he shuld not departe from the .
42004043	And he sayde vnto the : I muste to other cities also preache the kyngdome of God : for therfore am I sent .
42004044	And he preached in the synagoges of Galile .
42005001	It came to passe as the people preased vpon him to heare the worde of God that he stoode by the lake of Genezareth :
42005002	and sawe two shippes stonde by the lake syde but the fisshermen were gone out of the and were wasshynge their nettes .
42005003	And he entred in to one of the shippes which perteyned to Simon and prayed him that he wolde thrust out a litell from the londe . And he sate doune and taught the people out of the ship .
42005004	When he had leeft speakynge he sayde vnto Simon : Launche out in to the depe and let slippe youre nettes to make a draught
42005005	And Simon answered and sayde to him : Master we have labored all nyght and have taken nothinge . Neverthelater at thy worde I will loose forthe the net .
42005006	And when they had so done they inclosed a greate multitude of fisshes . And their net brake :
42005007	but they made signes to their felowes which were in the other ship that they shuld come and helpe the And they came : and filled bothe the shippes that they soncke agayne .
42005008	When Simon Peter sawe that he fell doune at Iesus knees sayinge : Lorde goo
42005009	fro me for I am a synfull man . For he was vtterly astonyed and all that were wt him at ye draught of fisshe which they toke :
42005010	and so was also Iames and Iohn ye sonnes of zebede which were parteners wt Simon . And Iesus sayde vnto Simon : feare not fro hence forthe thou shalt catche men .
42005011	And they brought the shippes to londe and forsoke all and folowed him .
42005012	And it fortuned as he was in a certayne cite : beholde ther was a man full of leprosy : and when he had spied Iesus he fell on his face and besought him sayinge : Lorde yf thou wilt thou canst make me cleane .
42005013	And he strethed forth ye hond and touched him sayinge : I will be thou cleane . And immediatly the leprosy departed from him .
42005014	And he warned him that he shuld tell no man : but that he shuld goo and shewe him selfe to the Preste and offer for his clensynge accordinge as Moses commaundement was for a witnes vnto them .
42005015	But so moche the moare went ther a fame abroade of him and moche people cam to geder to heare and to be healed of him of their infirmities .
42005016	And he kepte him silfe aparte in ye wildernesses and gave him silfe to prayer .
42005017	And it happened on a certayne daye that he taught : and ther sate the pharises : and docturs of lawe which were come out of all ye tounes of Galile Iurie and Hierusalem . And the power of the Lorde was to heale the .
42005018	And beholde me brought a man lyinge in his beed which was taken with a palsie : and sought meanes to brynge him in and to laye him before him .
42005019	And whe they coulde not finde by what waye they might bringe him in be cause of ye prease they wet vp on the toppe of ye housse and let him doune thorowe the tylinge beed and all in the middes before Iesus .
42005020	When he sawe their fayth he sayde vnto him : man thy synnes are forgeven the .
42005021	And the Scribes and the Parises begane to thinke sayinge : What felow is this which speaketh blasphemy ? Who can forgeve synnes but God only ?
42005022	When Iesus perceaved their thoughtes he answered and sayde vnto them : What thinke ye in youre hertes ?
42005023	Whether is easyar to saye thy synnes are forgeve the or to saye : rise and walke ?
42005024	But that ye maye knowe that the sonne of ma hath power to forgeve synnes on erth he sayde vnto ye sicke of the palsie : I saye to the aryse take vp thy beed and go home to thy housse .
42005025	And immediatly he rose vp before them and toke vp his beed where on he laye and departed to his awne housse praysinge God .
42005026	And they were all amased and they lauded God and were filled with feare sayinge : We have sene straunge thynges to daye .
42005027	And after that he went forthe and sawe a Publican named Levi sittinge at the receyte of custome and sayde vnto him : folow me .
42005028	And he leeft all roose vp and folowed him .
42005029	And that same Levi made him a greate feaste at home in his awne housse . And ther was a greate copany of publicans and of other that sate at meate with him .
42005030	And the Scribes and Pharises murmured agaynst his disciples sayinge : Why eate ye and drinke ye with publicas and synners ?
42005031	Iesus answered and sayde vnto the : They yt are whole nede not of ye phisicion : but they yt are sicke .
42005032	I came not to call ye rightewes but synners to repentauce .
42005033	Then they sayde vnto him : Why do the disciples of Iohn fast often and praye and the disciples of ye Pharises also : and thine eate and drinke ?
42005034	And he sayde vnto them : Can ye make ye chyldren of the weddinge fast as longe as ye brydgrome is present with the ?
42005035	The dayes will come whe the brydgrome shalbe take awaye from them : then shall they fast in those dayes
42005036	Then he spake vnto them in a similitude : No ma putteth a pece of a newe garment in to an olde vesture : for yf he do : then breaketh he the newe and the pece that was taken out of the newe agreeth not wt the olde .
42005037	Also no ma poureth newe wyne into olde vessels . For yf he do the newe wyne breaketh the vessels and runneth out it silfe and the vessels perisshe :
42005038	But newe wyne must be poured into newe vessels and bothe are preserved .
42005039	Also no man yt drinketh olde wine strayght waye can awaye with newe for he sayeth ye olde is plesauter .
42006001	It happened on an after saboth that he went thorow the corne felde and that his disciples plucked the eares of corne and ate and rubbed them in their hondes .
42006002	And certayne of the Pharises sayde vnto them : Why do ye that which is not laufull to do on the saboth dayes ?
42006003	And Iesus answered them and sayde : Have ye not redde what David dyd when he him sylfe was anhungred and they which were with him :
42006004	how he went into the housse of God and toke and ate the loves of halowed breed and gave also to them which were with him : which was not laufull to eate but for the prestes only .
42006005	And he sayde vnto them : The sonne of man is Lorde of the saboth daye .
42006006	And it fortuned in a nother saboth also that he entred in to ye sinagoge and taught . And ther was a ma whose right honde was dryed vp .
42006007	And ye Scribes and Pharises watched him to se whether he wolde heale on the Saboth daye that they myght fynde an accusacion agaynst him .
42006008	But he knewe their thoughtes and sayde to the man which had ye wyddred honde : Ryse vp and stonde forthe in the myddes . And he arose and stepped forthe .
42006009	Then sayde Iesus vnto them : I will axe you a question : Whether is it laufull on the saboth dayes to do good or to do evill ? to save lyfe or for to destroye it ?
42006010	And he behelde them all in copasse and sayd vnto ye man : Stretche forth thy honde . And he dyd so and his honde was restored and made as whoole as the other .
42006011	And they were filled full of madnes and comuned one with another what they myght do to Iesu .
42006012	And it fortuned in thoose dayes that he went out into a mountayne for to praye and cotinued all nyght in prayer to god .
42006013	And assone as it was daye he called his disciples and of the he chose twelve which also he called apostles .
42006014	Simon who he named Peter : and Andrew his brother . Iames and Iho Philip and Bartlemew
42006015	Mathew and Thomas Iames the sonne of Alpheus and Simon called zelotes
42006016	and Iudas Iames sonne and Iudas Iscarioth which same was the traytour .
42006017	And he came doune with them and stode in the playne felde with the company of his disciples and agreate multitude of people out of all parties of Iurie and Ierusalem and from the see cooste of Tire and Sidon which came to heare hym and to be healed of their diseases :
42006018	and they also that were vexed with foule spretes and they were healed .
42006019	And all the people preased to touche him : for there went vertue out of him and healed them all .
42006020	And he lifted vp his eyes apon the disciples and sayde : Blessed be ye poore : for yours is the kyngdome of God .
42006021	Blessed are ye that honger now : for ye shalbe satisfied . Blessed are ye yt wepe now : for ye shall laugh .
42006022	Blessed are ye when men hate you and thrust you oute of their companye and rayle and abhorre youre name as an evyll thinge for the sonne of manes sake .
42006023	Reioyse ye then and be gladde : for beholde youre rewarde is greate in heven . After this manner their fathers entreated the Prophetes .
42006024	But wo be to you that are ryche : for ye have therin youre consolacion .
42006025	Wo be to you yt are full : for ye shall honger . Wo be to you that now laugh : for ye shall wayle and wepe .
42006026	Wo be to you when all men prayse you : for so dyd their fathers to the false prophetes .
42006027	But I saye vnto you which heare : Love youre enemyes . Do good to the which hate you .
42006028	Blesse the that course you . And praye for the which wrongfully trouble you .
42006029	And vnto him that smyteth the on the one cheke offer also ye other . And him that taketh awaye thy goune forbid not to take thy coote also .
42006030	Geve to every man that axeth of the . And of him that taketh awaye thy goodes axe them not agayne .
42006031	And as ye wolde that men shuld doo to you : so do ye to them lyke wyse .
42006032	If ye love the which love you : what thanke are ye worthy of ? For the very synners love their lovers .
42006033	And yf ye do for them which do for you : what thanke are ye worthy of ? For the very synners do even the same .
42006034	If ye lende to them of whome ye hoope to receave : what thanke shall ye have : for the very synners lende to synners to receave as moch agayne .
42006035	Wherfore love ye youre enemys do good and lende lokynge for nothinge agayne and youre rewarde shalbe greate and ye shalbe the chyldren of the hyest : for he is kynde vnto the vnkynde and to the evyll .
42006036	Be ye therfore mercifull as youre father is mercifull .
42006037	Iudge not and ye shall not be Iudged . Condemne not : and ye shall not be condemned . Forgeve and ye shalbe forgeven .
42006038	Geve and yt shalbe geven vnto you : good measure pressed doune shaken to geder and runnynge over shall men geve into youre bosomes . For with what measure ye mete with ye same shall men mete to you agayne .
42006039	And he put forthe a similitude vnto the : Can the blynde leade ye blynde ? Do they not both then fall into ye dyche ?
42006040	The disciple is not above his master . Every ma shalbe perfecte even as his master is .
42006041	Why seyst thou a moote in thy brothers eye considerest not ye beame yt is in thyne awne eye ?
42006042	Ether how canest thou saye to thy brother : Brother let me pull out ye moote that is in thyne eye : when thou perceavest not the beame that is in thyne awne eye ? Ypocrite cast out ye beame out of thyne awne eye fyrst and then shalt thou se perfectly to pull out the moote out of thy brothers eye .
42006043	It is not a good tree that bringeth forthe evyll frute : nether is that an evyll tree that bringeth forthe good frute
42006044	For every tree is knowen by his frute . Nether of thornes gader men fygges nor of busshes gader they grapes .
42006045	A good man out of the good treasure of his hert bringeth forthe that which is good . And an evyll man out of the evyll treasure of his hert bringeth forthe that which ys evyll . For of the aboundaunce of ye her his mouthe speakethe .
42006046	Why call ye me Master Master : and do not as I bid you ?
42006047	whosoever cometh to me and heareth my sayinges and dothe the same I will shewe you to whome he ys lyke .
42006048	He is like a man which bilt an housse : and digged depe and layde the foundacio on a rocke . Whe the waters arose the fludde bet apo that housse and coulde not move yt . For it was grounded apon a rocke .
42006049	But he that heareth and doth not is lyke a man that with out foundacion bylt an housse apon the erth agaynst which the fludde did bet : and it fell by and by . And ye fall of yt housse was greate .
42007001	When he had ended all his sainges in the audience of the people he entred into Capernau .
42007002	And a certayne Centurions seruaunte was sicke and redy to dye whom he made moche of .
42007003	And when he hearde of Iesu he sent vnto him the elders of the Iewes besechinge him yt he wolde come and heale his servaunt .
42007004	And they came to Iesus and besought him instantly sayinge : He is worthi that thou shuldest do this for him .
42007005	For he loveth oure nacion and hath bilt vs a sinagoge
42007006	And Iesus went with them . And when he was not farre fro the housse the Centurio sent frendes to him sayinge vnto him : Lorde trouble not thy silfe : for I am not worthy yt thou shuldest enter vnder my roffe .
42007007	Wherfore I thought not my silfe worthy to come vnto the : but saye the worde and my servaunt shalbe whoole .
42007008	For I lyke wyse am a man vnder power and have vnder me soudiers and I saye vnto won goo : and he goeth . And to another come : and he cometh . And to my servaunt do this : and he doeth it .
42007009	When Iesus herde this he merveyled at him and turned him about and sayd to the people that folowed him : I saye vnto you I have not founde so greate faith noo not in Israel .
42007010	And they yt were sent turned backe home agayne and founde the servaunt that was sicke whoole .
42007011	And it fortuned after that that he went into a cite called Naim and many of his disciples went wt him and moche people .
42007012	When he came nye to the gate of the cite : beholde ther was a deed man caried out which was ye only sonne of his mother and she was a widowe and moche people of the cite was with her .
42007013	And when ye lorde sawe her he had compassion on her and sayde vnto her : wepe not .
42007014	And he went and touched the coffyn and they yt bare him stode still . And he sayde : Yonge man I saye vnto the aryse .
42007015	And ye deed sate vp and beganne to speake . And he delyvered him to his mother .
42007016	And ther ca a feare on the all . And they glorified god sayinge : a greate prophet is rysen amoge vs and god hath visited his people
42007017	And this rumor of him wet forthe throughout all Iurie and thorowout all the regions which lye rounde about .
42007018	And ye disciples of Iohn shewed him of all these thinges .
42007019	And Iohn called vnto him . ii . of his disciples and sent the to Iesus sayinge : Arte thou he that shall come : or shall we loke for another ?
42007020	When the men were come vnto him they sayde : Iohn baptiste sent vs vnto ye sayinge : Arte thou he that shall come : or shall we wayte for another ?
42007021	And at yt same tyme he cured many of their infirmites and plages and of evyll spretes and vnto many that were blynde he gave sight
42007022	And Iesus answered and sayd vnto them : Goo youre wayes and shewe Iohn what thinges ye have sene and harde : how yt the blynde se the halt goo the lepers are clensed the deafe heare the deed aryse to the poore is the glad tydinges preached
42007023	and happy is he that is not offended by me .
42007024	When ye messengers of Iohn were departed he began to speake vnto ye people of Iohn What wet ye oute into ye wildernes for to se ? went ye to se arede shaken wt ye wynde ?
42007025	But what went ye out for tose ? A ma clothed in soofte rayment ? Beholde they which are gorgeously apparelled and lyve delicatly are in kynges courtes .
42007026	But what went ye forth to se ? A prophete ? Ye I saye to you and moare then a prophete
42007027	This is he of who it is wrytte : Beholde I sende my messenger before thy face to prepare thy waye before the .
42007028	For I saye vnto you : a greater prophete then Iohn amoge wemes chyldre is ther none . Neverthelesse one yt is lesse in ye kyngdo of god is greater the he
42007029	And all the people that hearde and the publicans iustified God and were baptised with the baptim of Iohn .
42007030	But the pharises and scribes despised ye counsell of god agaynst them selves and were not baptised of him .
42007031	And ye lorde sayd : Wher vnto shall I lyke the men of this generacion and what thinge are they lyke ?
42007032	They are lyke vnto chyldre sittynge in ye market place and cryinge one to another and sayinge : We have pyped vnto you and ye hahave not daunsed : we have mourned to you and ye have not wept .
42007033	For Iohn baptist cam nether eatynge breed ner drinkynge wyne and ye saye : he hath the devyll .
42007034	The sonne of man is come and eateth and drinketh and ye saye : beholde a man which is a glotton and a drinker of wyne a frende of publicans and synners .
42007035	Yet is wysdome iustified of all her chyldren .
42007036	And one of the pharises desyred him that he wolde eate with him . And he went into ye pharises housse and sate doune to meate .
42007037	And beholde a woman in that cite which was a synner assone as she knewe that . Iesus sate at meate in the pharises housse she brought an alablaster boxe of oyntmet
42007038	and she stode at his fete behynde him wepynge and beganne to wesshe his fete with teares and dyd wipe the with the heares of her heed and kyssed his fete and anoynted them with oyntment .
42007039	When the pharise which bade him sawe that he spake with in him sylfe sayinge : If this man were a prophete he wolde surely have knowen who and what maner woman this is which toucheth him for she is a synner .
42007040	And Iesus answered and sayde vnto him : Simon I have some what to saye vnto ye . And he sayd master saye on .
42007041	There was a certayne lender which had two detters ye one ought five hondred pence and the other fyfty .
42007042	When they had nothinge to paye he forgave the boothe . Which of them tell me will love him moost ?
42007043	Simon answered and sayde : I suppose that he to whom he forgave moost . And he sayde vnto him : Thou hast truly iudged .
42007044	And he turned to the woman and sayde vnto Simon : Seist thou this woman ? I entred into thy housse and thou gavest me noo water to my fete but she hath wesshed my fete with teares and wiped the with the heeres of her heed .
42007045	Thou gavest me no kysse : but she sence ye tyme I came in hath not ceased to kysse my fete
42007046	Myne heed wt oyle thou dydest not anoynte : but she hath annoynted my fete wt oyntmet .
42007047	Wherefore I saye vnto the : many synnes are forgeve her for she loved moche . To whom lesse is forgeven the same doeth lesse love .
42007048	And he sayde vnto her thy synnes are forgeven ye
42007049	And they yt sate at meate with him beganne to saye within them selves : Who is this which forgeveth synnes also ?
42007050	And he sayde to ye woman : Thy faith hath saved the Goo in peace .
42008001	And it fortuned after that that he him sylfe went throughout cities and tounes preachynge and shewinge ye kyngdom of God and the twelve with him .
42008002	And also certayne wemen which wer healed of evell spretes and infirmities : Mary called Magdalen out of whom went seven devyls
42008003	and Ioanna ye wyfe of Chusa Herodees stewarde and Susanna and many other : which ministred vnto the of their substaunce .
42008004	When moch people were gadred to gether and were come to him out of all cities he spake by a similitude .
42008005	A sower went out to sowe his seede : and as he sowed some fell by the waye syde and it was troden vnder fete and the foules of the ayre devoured it vp .
42008006	And some fell on ston and assone as it was spronge vp it widdred awaye because it lacked moystnes .
42008007	And some fell amonge thornes and ye thornes spronge vp with it and choked it .
42008008	And some fell on good grounde and sproge vp and bare frute an hondred foolde . And as he sayde these thinges he cryed : He that hath eares to heare let him heare .
42008009	And his disciples axed him sayinge : what maner similitude is this ?
42008010	And he sayde : vnto you is it geven to knowe the secretes of the kyngdom of God : but to other in similitudes that when they se they shuld not se : and when they heare they shuld not vnderstonde .
42008011	The similitude is this . The seede is ye worde of God .
42008012	Thoose yt are besyde the waye are they that heare and afterwarde cometh ye devyll and taketh awaye the worde out of their hertes lest they shuld beleve and be saved .
42008013	They on the stonnes are they which when they heare receave the worde with ioye . But these have noo rootes which for a whyle beleve and in tyme of temtacio goo awaye .
42008014	And yt which fell amonge thornes are they which heare and goo forth and are choked wt cares and wt riches and volupteous lyvinge and bringe forth noo frute .
42008015	That in ye good grounde are they which with a good and pure hert heare the worde and kepe it and bringe forth frute with pacience .
42008016	No man lyghteth a candell and covereth it vnder a vessell nether putteth it vnder ye table : but setteth it on a candelsticke that they that enter in maye se ye lyght .
42008017	No thinge is in secret yt shall not come abroode : Nether eny thinge hyd that shall not be knowen and come to lyght .
42008018	Take hede therfore how ye heare . For whosoever hath to him shalbe geve : And whosoever hath not fro him shalbe take even that same which he supposeth that he hath .
42008019	Then came to him his mother and his brethren and coulde not come at him for prease .
42008020	And they tolde him sayinge : Thy mother and thy brethren stonde with out and wolde se the .
42008021	He answered and sayd vnto them : my mother and my brethren are these which heare the worde of God and do it .
42008022	And it chaunsed on a certayne daye that he went into a shippe and his disciples also and he sayde vnto them : Let vs goo over vnto the other syde of the lake . And they Lanched forthe .
42008023	And as they sayled he fell a slepe and there arose a storme of wynde in ye lake and they were fylled with water and were in ieopardy .
42008024	And they went to him and awoke him sayinge : Master Master we are loost . Then he arose and rebuked the wynde and the tempest of water and they ceased and it wexed calme .
42008025	And he sayd vnto the : where is youre faith ? They feared and wondred sayinge one to another : what felowe is this ? for he comaundeth bothe the wyndes and water and they obey him ?
42008026	And they sayled vnto the region of ye Gaderenites which is over agaynst Galile .
42008027	And as he went out to londe ther met him a certayne man out of ye cite which had a devyll longe tyme and ware noo clothes nether aboode in eny housse : but amonge graves .
42008028	When he sawe Iesus he cryed and fell doune before him and with a loude voyce sayde : What have I to do with the Iesus the sonne of the God moost hyest ? I beseche the torment me not .
42008029	Then he comaunded ye foule sprete to come out of the man . For ofte tymes he caught him and he was bounde with chaynes and kept with fetters : and he brake the bondes and was caryed of the fende into wyldernes .
42008030	And Iesus axed him sayinge : what is thy name ? And he sayde : Legion because many devyls were entred into him .
42008031	And they besought him yt he wolde not comaunde the to goo out into ye depe .
42008032	And ther was there by an heerde of many swyne fedynge on an hyll : and they besought him yt he wolde soffre the to enter into the . And he soffred the .
42008033	Then went the devyls out of the man and entred into the swyne : And the heerd toke their course and ran heedlynge into the lake and were choked .
42008034	When the herdmen sawe what had chaunsed they fleed and tolde it in the cite and in the villages .
42008035	And they came out to se what was done : and came to Iesus and founde ye man out of who the devyls were departed sittynge at the fete of Iesus clothed and in his right mynde and they were afrayde .
42008036	They also wich sawe it tolde the by what meanes he yt was possessed of ye devyll was healed .
42008037	And all the whole multitude of ye cotrye of the Gaderenites besought him yt he wolde departe from the : for they were taken wt greate feare . And he gate him into the shippe and returned backe agayne .
42008038	Then the man out of whom the devyls were departed besought him yt he myght be wt him : But Iesus sent him awaye sayinge :
42008039	Goo home agayne into thyne awne housse and shewe what great thinges God hath done to ye . And he went his waye and preached thorow out all the cite what great thinges Iesus had done vnto him .
42008040	And it fortuned when Iesus was come agayne that ye people receaved him . For they all wayted for him .
42008041	And beholde ther came a man named Iairus ( and he was a ruler of ye synagoge ) and he fell doune at Iesus fete and besought him yt he wolde come into his housse
42008042	for he had but a doughter only apon a twelve yere of age and she laye a dyinge . And as he went the people thronged him .
42008043	And a woman havynge an issue of bloud twelve yeres ( which had spent all her substance amonge phisicios nether coulde be holpen of eny )
42008044	came behinde him and touched the hem of his garmet and immediatly her issue of bloud staunched .
42008045	And Iesus sayde : Who is it that touched me ? when every man denyed Peter and they yt were with him sayde : Master the people thrust the and vexe the : and sayest thou who touched me ?
42008046	And Iesus sayd : Some body touched me . For I perceave that vertue is gone out of me .
42008047	When the woman sawe that she was not hid she came trimblynge and fell at is fete and tolde him before all the people for what cause she had touched him and how she was healed immediatly .
42008048	And he sayde vnto hyr : Doughter be of good comforte Thy faith hath made the hoale goo in peace .
42008049	Whyll he yet spake there came one from ye rulers of the synagogis housse which sayde to him : thy doughter is deed disease not the master .
42008050	When Iesus hearde that He answered the father sayinge : Feare not beleve only and she shalbe made whole .
42008051	And when he came to ye housse he suffred no man to goo in with him save Peter Iames and Iohn and the father and the mother of the mayden .
42008052	Every body weept and sorowed for her . And he sayde : Wepe not : for she is not deed but slepeth .
42008053	And they lewgh him to scorne . For they knew that she was deed .
42008054	And he thrust the all out and caught her by the honde and cryed sayinge : Mayde aryse .
42008055	And hyr sprete came agayne and she roose strayght waye . And he commaunded to geve her meate .
42008056	And the father and the mother of hyr were astonyed . But he warned the that they shuld tell noo man what was done .
42009001	Then called he the . xii . to gether and gave them power and auctorite over all devyls and that they myght heale diseases .
42009002	And he sent them to preache the kyngdome of God and to cure the sick .
42009003	And he sayd to them : Take nothinge to sucker you by ye waye : nether staffe nor scripe nether breed nether money nether have twoo cootes .
42009004	And whatsoever housse ye enter into there abyde and thence departe .
42009005	And whosoever will not receave you when ye go out of that cite shake of the very dust from youre fete for a testimony agaynst them .
42009006	And they went out and went thorow the tounes preachinge the gospell and healynge every wheare .
42009007	And Herod the tetrarch herde of all that was done of him and douted because that it was sayde of some that Iohn was rysen agayne from deeth :
42009008	and of some that Helyas had apered : and of other that one of the olde prophetes was rysen agayne .
42009009	And Herod sayde : Iohn have I behedded : who then is this of whom I heare suche thinges ? And he desyred to se him .
42009010	And the Apostles retourned and tolde him what great thinges they had done . And he toke them and went a syde into a solitary place nye to a citie called Bethsaida .
42009011	And ye people knewe of it and folowed him . And he receaved them and spake vnto them of the kyngdome of God and healed them that had nede to be healed .
42009012	And when ye daye beganne to weare awaye then came the twelve and sayde vnto him : sende ye people awaye that they maye goo into the tounes and villages roundabout and lodge and get meate for we are here in a place of wyldernes .
42009013	But he sayde vnto them : Geve ye the to eate . And they sayde . We have no moo but fyve loves and two fisshes except we shuld goo and bye meate for all this people .
42009014	And they were about a fyve thousand men . And he sayde to his disciples : Cause them to syt doune by fyfties in a company .
42009015	And they dyd soo and made them all syt doune .
42009016	And he toke the fyve loves and the two fisshes and loked vp to heven and blessed them and brake and gave to the disciples to set before ye people .
42009017	And they ate and were all satisfied . And ther was taken vp of that remayned to the twelve baskettes full of broken meate .
42009018	And it fortuned as he was alone prayinge his disciples were wt him and he axed the sayinge : Who saye ye people yt I am ?
42009019	They answered and sayd : Iohn Baptist . Some saye Helyas . And some saye one of the olde prophetes is rysen agayne .
42009020	He sayde vnto the : Who saye ye that I am ? Peter answered and sayde : thou arte the Christ of god .
42009021	And he warned and commaunded them that they shuld tell no man yt thinge
42009022	sayinge : that the sonne of man must suffre many thinges and be reproved of the elders and of the hye prestes and scribes and be slayne and the thirde daye ryse agayne .
42009023	And he sayde to them all yf eny man will come after me let him denye him sylfe and take vp his crosse dayly and folowe me .
42009024	Whosoever will save his lyfe shall lose it . And who soever shall lose his lyfe for my sake the same shall save it .
42009025	For what avauntageth it a man to wynne the whole worlde yf he loose him sylfe or runne in domage of him sylfe ?
42009026	For whosoever is ashamed of me and of my sayinges : of him shall the sonne of man be ashamed when he cometh in his awne glorie and in the glorie of his father and of the holy angels .
42009027	And I tell you of a surety : There be some of the yt stonde here which shall not tast of deeth tyll they se ye kyngdome of god .
42009028	And it folowed about an . viii . dayes after thoose sayinges that he toke Peter Iames and Iohn and went vp into a moutayne to praye .
42009029	And as he prayed ye facion of his countenaunce was changed and his garment was whyte and shoone .
42009030	And beholde two men talked wt him and they were Moses and Helyas
42009031	which appered gloriously and spake of his departinge which he shuld ende at Ierusalem .
42009032	Peter and they that were with him were hevy with slepe . And when they woke they sawe his glorie and two men stondinge with him .
42009033	And it chaunsed as they departed fro him Peter sayde vnto Iesus : Master it is good beinge here for vs . Let vs make thre tabernacles one for the and one for Moses and one for Helyas : and wist not what he sayde .
42009034	Whyll he thus spake ther came a cloude and shadowed them : and they feared when they were come vnder the cloude .
42009035	And ther came a voyce out of the cloude sayinge : This is my deare sonne heare him .
42009036	And assone as ye voyce was past Iesus was founde alone . And they kept it cloose and tolde noo man in thoose dayes eny of those thinges which they had sene .
42009037	And it chaunsed on the nexte daye as they came doune from the hyll moche people met him .
42009038	And beholde a man of the copany cryed out sayinge : Master I beseche ye beholde my sonne for he is all that I have :
42009039	and se a sprete taketh him and sodenly he cryeth and he teareth him that he fometh agayne and with moche payne departeth fro him when he hath rent him and
42009040	I besought thy disciples to cast him out and they coulde not .
42009041	Iesus answered and sayde : O generacion with oute fayth and croked : how longe shall I be with you ? and shall suffre you ? Bringe thy sonne hidder .
42009042	As he yet was a cominge the fende ret him and tare him . And Iesus rebuked ye vnclene sprete and healed the childe and delivered him to his father .
42009043	And they were all amased at ye mighty power of God . Whyll they wondred every one at all thinges which he dyd he sayd vnto his disciples :
42009044	Let these sayinges synke doune into youre eares . The tyme will come when the sonne of man shalbe delivered into the hondes of men .
42009045	But they wist not what yt worde meant and yt was hyd fro the that they vnderstode yt not . And they feared to axe him of that sayinge .
42009046	Then ther arose a disputacion amoge the : who shuld be the greatest .
42009047	When Iesus perceaved ye thoughtes of their hertes he toke a chylde and set him hard by him
42009048	and sayd vnto the : Whosoever receaveth this chylde in my name receaveth me . And whosoever receaveth me receaveth him yt sent me . For he yt is least amonge you all the same shalbe greate .
42009049	And Iohn answered and sayde : Master we sawe one castinge out devyls in thy name and we forbade him because he foloweth not with vs .
42009050	And Iesus sayde vnto him : forbyd ye him not . For he that is not agaynst vs is wt vs .
42009051	And it folowed when the tyme was come yt he shulde be receaved vp then he set his face to goo to Hierusalem
42009052	and sent messengers before him . And they went and entred into a citie of the Samaritans to make redy for him .
42009053	But they wolde not receave him be cause his face was as though he wolde goo to Ierusalem .
42009054	When his disciples Iames and Iohn sawe yt they sayde : Lorde wilt thou that we comaunde that fyre come doune from heven and consume them even as Helias dyd ?
42009055	Iesus turned about and rebuked them sayinge : ye wote not what maner sprete ye are of .
42009056	The sonne of ma ys not come to destroye mennes lives but to save them . And they went to another toune .
42009057	And it chaunsed as he went in the waye a certayne man sayd vnto him : I will folowe the whither soever thou goo .
42009058	Iesus sayd vnto him : foxes have holes and bryddes of ye ayer have nestes : but the sonne of man hath not where on to laye his heed .
42009059	And he sayde vnto another : folowe me . And the same sayde : Lorde suffre me fyrst to goo and bury my father .
42009060	Iesus sayd vnto him : Let the deed bury their deed : but goo thou and preache the kyngdome of God .
42009061	And another sayde : I wyll folowe the Lorde : but let me fyrst goo byd them fare well which are at home at my housse .
42009062	Iesus sayde vnto him : No man that putteth his honde to the plowe and loketh backe is apte to the kyngdome of God .
42010001	After these thinges the Lorde apoynted other seventie also and sent them two and two before him into every citie and place whither he him silfe wolde come .
42010002	And he sayde vnto them the harvest is greate : but the laborers are feawe . Praye therfore the Lorde of ye harvest to send forth laborers into his hervest .
42010003	Goo youre wayes : beholde I sende you forthe as lambes amonge wolves .
42010004	Beare noo wallet nether scryppe nor shues and salute noo man by the waye .
42010005	Into whatsoever housse ye enter fyrst saye : Peace be to this housse .
42010006	And yf ye sonne of peace be theare youre peace shall rest vpon him : yf not yt shall returne to you agayne .
42010007	And in ye same housse tary still eatinge and drinkinge soche as they have . For the laborer is worthy of his ewarde . Go not fro housse to housse :
42010008	and in to whatso ever citye ye enter yf they receave you eate soche thinges as are set before you
42010009	and heale the sicke yt are theare and saye vnto them : the kyngdome of God is come nye vpon you .
42010010	But into whatsoever citie ye shall enter yf they receave you not goo youre wayes out into the stretes of ye same and saye :
42010011	even the very dust which cleaveth on vs of your citie we wipe of agaynst you : Not withstondinge marke this that ye kyngdome of God was come nie vpon you .
42010012	Ye and I saye vnto you : that it shalbe easier in that daye for Sodom then for yt cytie .
42010013	Wo be to the Chorazin : wo be to ye Bethsaida . For yf ye miracles had bene done in Tyre and Sido which have bene done in you they had a greate whyle agone repeted sitting in heere and asshes .
42010014	Neverthelesse it shalbe easier for Tyre and Sidon at the iudgement then for you .
42010015	And thou Capernau which art exalted to heave shalt be thrust doune to hell .
42010016	He yt heareth you heareth me : and he that dispiseth you despiseth me : and he that dispiseth me despiseth him that sent me .
42010017	And the sevetie returned agayne with ioye sayinge : Lorde even the very devyls are subdued to vs thorowe thy name .
42010018	And he sayde vnto them : I sawe satan as it had bene lightenyng faule doune fro heave .
42010019	Beholde I geve vnto you power to treade on serpetes and scorpions and over all maner power of the enimye and no thinge shall hurte you .
42010020	Neverthelesse in this reioyse not that ye spretes are vnder youre power : but reioyse be cause youre names are wrytten in heaven .
42010021	That same tyme reioysed Iesus in ye sprete and sayde : I confesse vnto ye father Lorde of heaven and erth yt thou hast hyd these thynges from the wyse and prudent and hast opened them to the babes . Even so father for soo pleased it the .
42010022	All thinges are geven me of my father . And no man knoweth who the sonne is but the father : nether who the father is save the sonne and he to who the sonne wyll shewe him .
42010023	And he turned to his disciples and sayde secretly : Happy are ye eyes which se yt ye se .
42010024	For I tell you that many prophetes and kynges have desired to se those thinges which ye se and have not sene them : and to heare those thinges which ye heare and have not hearde them .
42010025	And beholde a certayne Lawere stode vp and tempted him sayinge : Master what shall I do to inheret eternall life ?
42010026	He sayd vnto him : What is written in the lawe ? How redest thou ?
42010027	And he answered and sayde : Loue thy Lorde God with all thy hert and with all thy soule and with all thy stregthe and with all thy mynde : and thy neghbour as thy sylfe .
42010028	And he sayde vnto him : Thou hast answered right . This do and thou shalt live .
42010029	He willinge to iustifie him silfe sayde vnto Iesus : Who is then my neghbour ?
42010030	Iesus answered and sayde : A certayne ma descended fro Hierusalem into Hierico and fell in to the hondes of theves which robbed him of his raymet and wounded him and departed levynge him halfe deed .
42010031	And by chaunce ther came a certayne preste that same waye and when he sawe him he passed by .
42010032	And lykewyse a Levite when he was come nye to the place wet and loked on him and passed by .
42010033	Then a certayne Samaritane as he iornyed came nye vnto him and when he sawe him had compassion on him
42010034	and went to and bounde vp his woundes and poured in oyle and wyne and put him on his awne beaste and brought him to a comen ynne and made provision for him .
42010035	And on the morowe when he departed he toke out two pece and gave them to the host and sayde vnto him . Take cure of him and whatsoever thou spedest moare when I come agayne I will recompence the .
42010036	Which now of these thre thynkest thou was neighbour vnto him yt fell into ye theves hondes ?
42010037	And he sayde : he that shewed mercy on him . Then sayde Iesus vnto him . Goo and do thou lyke wyse .
42010038	It fortuned as they wet that he entred in to a certayne toune . And a certayne woman named Martha receaved him into her housse .
42010039	And this woman had a sister called Mary which sate at Iesus fete and hearde his preachinge .
42010040	And Martha was combred about moche servinge and stode and sayde : Master doest thou not care that my sister hath leeft me to minister alone ? Byd her therfore that she helpe me .
42010041	And Iesus answered and sayde vnto her : Martha Martha thou carest and arte troubled about many thinges :
42010042	verely one is nedfull . Mary hath chosen her that good parte which shall not be taken awaye from her .
42011001	And it fortuned as he was prayinge in a certayne place : when he ceased one of his disciples sayde vnto him : Master teache vs to praye as Iohn taught his disciples .
42011002	And he sayd vnto the : When ye praye saye : O oure father which arte in heave halowed be thy name . Thy kyngdome come . Thy will be fulfilled even in erth as it is in heaven .
42011003	Oure dayly breed geve vs evermore .
42011004	And forgeve vs oure synnes : For eve we forgeve every man yt treaspaseth vs . And ledde vs not into teptacio . But deliver vs fro evill .
42011005	And he sayde vnto them : if any of you shuld have a frede and shuld goo to him at mid nyght and saye vnto him : frende lende me thre loves
42011006	for a frende of myne is come out of the waye to me and I have nothinge to set before him :
42011007	and he within shuld answere and saye trouble me not the dore is now sheet and my servautes are with me in the chamber I canot ryse and geve them to the .
42011008	I saye vnto you though he wold not aryse and geve him because he is his frede : yet because of his importunite he wold rise and geve him as many as he neded .
42011009	And I saye vnto you : axe and it shalbe geven you . Seke and ye shall fynde . knocke and it shalbe opened vnto you .
42011010	For every one that axeth receaveth : and he that seketh fyndeth : and to him that knocketh shall it be openned .
42011011	Yf the sonne shall axe breed of eny of you that is a father : wyll he geve him a stone ? Or yf he axe fisshe wyll he for a fysshe geve him a serpent ?
42011012	Or yf he axe an egge : wyll he offer him a scorpion ?
42011013	Yf ye then which are evyll canne geve good giftes vnto youre chyldren how moche more shall the father of heaven geve an holy sprete to them that desyre it of him ?
42011014	And he was a castynge out a devyll which was dome . And it folowed when the devyll was gone out the domme spake and the people wondred .
42011015	But some of the sayde : he casteth out devyls by the power of Belzebub the chefe of the devyls .
42011016	And other tempted him sekinge of him a signe fro heave .
42011017	But he knewe their thoughtes and sayde vnto them : Every kingdome devided with in it silfe shalbe desolate : and one housse shall fall vpon another .
42011018	So if Satan be devided with in him silfe : how shall his kyngdome endure ? Because ye saye that I cast out devyls by the power of Belzebub .
42011019	Yf I by the power of Belzebub caste oute devyls : by whome do youre chyldren cast them out ? Therfore shall they be youre iudges .
42011020	But if I with ye finger of God cast out devyls noo doute the kyngdome of God is come vpon you .
42011021	When a stronge man armed watcheth his housse : yt he possesseth is in peace .
42011022	But when a stronger then he cometh vpo him and overcometh him : he taketh from him his harnes wherin he trusted and devideth his gooddes .
42011023	He that is not with me is agaynst me . And he that gadereth not with me scattereth .
42011024	When the vnclene sprete is gone out of a man he walketh through waterlesse places sekinge reest . And when he fyndeth none he sayeth : I will returne agayne vnto my housse whence I came out .
42011025	And when he cometh he fyndeth it swept and garnissed .
42011026	Then goeth he and taketh to him seve other spretes worsse then himsilfe : and they enter in and dwell there . And the ende of that man is worsse then the begynninge .
42011027	And it fortuned as he spake those thinges a certayne woman of the copany lyfte vp her voyce and sayde vnto him : Happy is the wombe that bare the and the pappes which gave the sucke .
42011028	But he sayde : Ye happy are they that heare the worde of God and kepe it .
42011029	When the people were gadered thicke to geder : he began to saye . This is an evyll nacion : they seke a signe and ther shall no signe be geven them but the signe of Ionas the Prophet .
42011030	For as Ionas was a signe to the Ninivites so shall ye sonne of ma be to this nacio .
42011031	The quene of the southe shall ryse at iudgement with the men of this generacio and condempne them : for she came fro the ende of the worlde to heare the wysdome of Salomon . And beholde a greater then Salomon is here .
42011032	The men of Ninive shall ryse at the iudgement wt this generacio and shall condepne the : for they repented at the preachinge of Ionas . And beholde a greater then Ionas is here .
42011033	Noo man lighteth a candell and putteth it in a previe place nether vnder a busshell : But on a candelsticke that they that come in maye se ye light .
42011034	The light of thy body is the eye . Therfore when thine eye is single : then is all thy body full of light . But if thine eye be evyll : then shall thy body also be full of darknes .
42011035	Take hede therfore that the light which is in the be not darknes .
42011036	For if all thy body shalbe light havynge noo parte darke : then shall all be full of light even as when a candell doeth light the with his brightnes .
42011037	And as he spake a certayne Pharise besought him to dyne with him : and he went in and sate doune to meate .
42011038	When the Pharise sawe that he marveylled yt he had not fyrst wesshed before dyner .
42011039	And ye Lorde sayde to him : Now do ye Pharises make clene the out side of the cup and of the platter : but youre inwarde parties are full of raveninge and wickednes .
42011040	Ye foles dyd not he that made that which is without : make that which is within also ?
42011041	Neverthelesse geve almose of that ye have and beholde all is clene to you .
42011042	But wo be to you Pharises for ye tithe the mynt and rewe and all manner erbes and passe over iudgment and the love of God . These ought ye to have done and yet not to have left the other vndone .
42011043	Wo be to you Pharises : for ye love the vppermost seates in the synagoges and gretinges in the markets .
42011044	Wo be to you scribes and pharises ypocrites for ye are as graves which appere not and the men yt walke over the are not ware of the .
42011045	Then answered one of the lawears and sayd vnto him : Master thus sayinge thou puttest vs to rebuke also .
42011046	Then he sayde : Wo be to you also ye lawears : for ye lade men with burthens greveous to be borne and ye youre selves touche not ye packes wt one of youre fyngers .
42011047	Wo be to you : ye bylde the sepulchres of the Prophetes and youre fathers killed the :
42011048	truly ye beare witnes that ye alowe the dedes of youre fathers for they kylled them and ye bylde their sepulchres .
42011049	Therfore sayde ye wisdome of God : I will send them Prophetes and Apostles and of them they shall slee and persecute :
42011050	that the bloude of all Prophetes which was sheed fro the beginninge of the worlde maye be requyred of this generacion
42011051	from the bloud of Abell vnto the bloud of zachary which perisshed bitwene the aulter and the temple . Verely I saye vnto you : it shalbe requyred of this nacion .
42011052	Wo be to you lawears : for ye have taken awaye ye keye of knowledge ye entred not in youre selves and them that came in ye forbade .
42011053	When he thus spake vnto them the lawears and the Pharises began to wexe busye about him and to stop his mouth with many questions
42011054	layinge wayte for him and sekinge to catche somethinge of his mought wherby they might accuse him .
42012001	As ther gadered together an innumerable multitude of people ( in so moche that they trood one another ) he began to saye vnto his disciples : Fyrst of all beware of the leve of the Pharises which is ypocrisy .
42012002	For ther is no thinge covered that shall not be vncovered : nether hyd that shall not be knowen .
42012003	For whatsoever ye have spoken in in darknes : that same shalbe hearde in light . And that which ye have spoken in the the eare eve in secret places shalbe preached even on the toppe of the housses .
42012004	I saye vnto you my fredes : Be not afrayde of them that kyll the body and after that have no moare that they can do .
42012005	But I will shewe you whom ye shall feare . Feare him which after he hath killed hath power to cast into hell . Ye I saye vnto you him feare .
42012006	Are not five sparowes bought for two farthinges ? And yet not one of them is forgotten of God .
42012007	Also even the very heres of youre heedes are nombred . Feare not therfore : ye are moare of value then many sparowes .
42012008	I saye vnto you : Whosoever confesseth me before men eve him shall ye sonne of man confesse also before ye angels of God .
42012009	And he that denyeth me before men : shalbe denyed before ye angels of God .
42012010	And whosoever speaketh a worde agaynst ye sonne of ma it shalbe forgeven him . But vnto him yt blasphemeth the holy goost it shall not be forgeven .
42012011	When they bringe you vnto the synagoges and vnto the rulers and officers take no thought how or what thinge ye shall answer or what ye shall speake .
42012012	For the holy goost shall teache you in the same houre what ye ought to saye .
42012013	One of the company sayde vnto hym : Master byd my brother devide the enheritauce with me .
42012014	And he sayde vnto him : Man who made me a iudge or a devider over you ?
42012015	Wherfore he sayde vnto them : take hede and beware of covetousnes . For no mannes lyfe stondeth in the aboundaunce of the thinges which he possesseth .
42012016	And he put forth a similitude vnto them sayinge : The groude of a certayne riche ma brought forth frutes plenteously
42012017	and he thought in himsilfe sayinge : what shall I do ? because I have noo roume where to bestowe my frutes ?
42012018	And he sayde : This will I do . I will destroye my barnes and bilde greater and therin will I gadder all my frutes and my goodes :
42012019	and I will saye to my soule : Soule thou hast moch goodes layde vp in stoore for many yeares take thyne ease : eate drinke and be mery .
42012020	But God sayde vnto him : Thou fole this night will they fetche awaye thy soule agayne from the . Then whose shall thoose thinges be which thou hast provyded ?
42012021	So is it with him that gadereth ryches and is not ryche in God .
42012022	And he spake vnto his disciples : Therfore I saye vnto you : take no thought for youre lyfe what ye shall eate nether for youre body what ye shall put on .
42012023	The lyfe is moare then meate and the bodye is moare then rayment .
42012024	Considre the ravens for they nether sowe nor repe which nether have stoorehousse ner barne and yet God fedeth them . How moche are ye better then the foules .
42012025	Which of you with takynge thought can adde to his stature one cubit ?
42012026	Yf ye then be not able to do that thinge which is least : why take ye thought for the remmaunt ?
42012027	Considre the lylies how they growe : They laboure not : they spyn not : and yet I saye vnto you that Salomon in all this royalte was not clothed lyke to one of these .
42012028	Yf the grasse which is todaye in the felde and tomorowe shalbe cast into the fornace God so clothe : how moche moore will he clothe you o ye endued wt litell faith ?
42012029	And axe not what ye shall eate or what ye shall drinke nether clyme ye vp an hye
42012030	for all suche thinges the hethen people of the worlde seke for . Youre father knoweth that ye have nede of suche thinges .
42012031	Wherfore seke ye after the kyngedome of God and all these thinges shalbe ministred vnto you .
42012032	Feare not litell floocke for it is youre fathers pleasure to geve you a kingdome .
42012033	Sell that ye have and geve almes . And make you bagges which wexe not olde and treasure that fayleth not in heaven where noo these commeth nether moth corrupteth .
42012034	For where youre treasure is there will youre hertes be also .
42012035	Let youre loynes be gerdde about and youre lightes brennynge
42012036	and ye youre selves lyke vnto men that wayte for their master when he will returne fro a weddinge : that assone as he cometh and knocketh they maye ope vnto him .
42012037	Happy are those servauntes which the Lorde when he cometh shall fynde wakynge . Verely I saye vnto you he will gerdde him selfe about and make them sit doune to meate and walke by and minister vnto them .
42012038	And yf he come in the seconde watche ye if he come in the thyrde watche and shall fynde them soo happy are those servauntes .
42012039	This vnderstonde that yf the good man of the housse knewe what houre ye these wolde come he wolde suerly watche : and not suffer his housse to be broken vp .
42012040	Be ye prepared therfore : for the sonne of man will come at an houre when ye thinke not .
42012041	Then Peter sayde vnto him : Master tellest thou this similitude vnto vs or to all men ?
42012042	And the Lorde sayde : If there be any faith full servaut and wise whom his Lorde shall make ruler over his housholde to geve them their duetie of meate at due season :
42012043	happy is that servaunt whom his master when he cometh shall finde soo doinge .
42012044	Of a trueth I saye vnto you : that he will make him ruler over all that he hath .
42012045	But and yf the evyll servaunt shall saye in his hert : My master wyll differre his cominge and shall beginne to smyte the servauntes and maydens and to eate and drinke and to be dronken :
42012046	the Lorde of that servaunt will come in a daye when he thinketh not and at an houre when he is not ware and will devyde him and will geve him his rewarde with the vnbelevers .
42012047	The servaut that knewe his masters will and prepared not him selfe nether dyd accordinge to his will shalbe bete with many strypes .
42012048	But he that knewe not and yet dyd committe thinges worthy of strypes shalbe beaten with feawe strypes . For vnto whom moche is geven of him shalbe moche requyred . And to whom men moche commyt the moare of him will they axe .
42012049	I am come to sende fyre on erth : and what is my dysyre but that it were all redy kyndled ?
42012050	Not with stondinge I must de baptised with a baptyme : and how am I payned till it be ended ?
42012051	Suppose ye that I am come to sende peace on erth ? I tell you naye : but rather debate .
42012052	For fro hence forthe ther shalbe five in one housse devided thre agaynst two and two agaynst thre .
42012053	The father shalbe devided agaynst the sonne and the sonne agaynst the father . The mother agaynst the doughter and the doughter agaynst the mother . The motereleawe agaynst hir doughterelawe and the doughterelawe agaynst hir motherelawe .
42012054	Then sayde he to the people : when ye se a cloude ryse out of the west strayght waye ye saye : we shall have a shower and soo it is .
42012055	And when ye se the south wynde blow ye saye : we shall have heet and it cometh to passe .
42012056	Ypocrites ye can skyll of the fassion of the erth and of the skye : but what is ye cause that ye canot skyll of this time ?
42012057	Ye and why iudge ye not of youre selves what is righte ?
42012058	Whill thou goest with thyne adversary to the ruler : as thou arte in the waye geve diligence that thou mayst be delivered fro him least he bringe the to the iudge and the iudge delyver the to the iaylar and the iaylar cast the in to preson .
42012059	I tell ye thou departest not thence tyll thou have made good ye vtmost myte .
42013001	Ther were present at the same season that shewed him of ye Galileas whose bloude Pylate mengled with their awne sacrifice .
42013002	And Iesus answered and sayde vnto them : Suppose ye that these Galileans were greater synners then all the other Galileas because they suffred suche punisshmet ?
42013003	I tell you naye : but except ye repent ye shall all in lyke wyse perysshe .
42013004	Or those . xviii . apon which ye toure in Syloe fell and slewe the thinke ye that they were synners above all men yt dwell in Ierusalem ?
42013005	I tell you naye : But excepte ye repent ye all shall lykewyse perisshe .
42013006	He put forthe this similiiude A certayne man had a fygge tree planted in his veneyarde and he came and sought frute theron and founde none .
42013007	Then sayde he to ye dresser of his vyneyarde : Beholde this thre yeare have I come and sought frute in this fygge tree and fynde none : cut it doune : why combreth it the grounde ?
42013008	And he answered and sayde vnto him : lorde let it alone this yeare also till I digge rounde aboute it and doge it to se
42013009	whether it will beare frute : and if it beare not then after yt cut it doune
42013010	And he taught in one of their sinagoges on ye saboth dayes .
42013011	And beholde ther was a woma which had a sprete of infirmite . xviii . yeares : and was bowed to gether and coulde not lifte vp hersilfe at all .
42013012	When Iesus sawe her he called her to him and sayde to her : woman thou arte delyvered from thy disease .
42013013	And he layde his hondes on her and immediatly she was made strayght and glorified God .
42013014	And the ruler of the sinagoge answered with indignacion ( be cause that Iesus had healed on the saboth daye ) and sayde vnto the people . Ther are sixe dayes in which men ought to worke : in them come and be healed and not on the saboth daye .
42013015	Then answered him the Lorde and sayd : Ypocrite doth not eache one of you on the saboth daye lowse his oxe or his asse from the stall and leade him to the water ?
42013016	And ought not this doughter of Abraham whom Sathan hath bounde loo . xviii . yeares be lowsed from this bonde on the saboth daye ?
42013017	And when he thus sayde all his adversaries were ashamed and all the people reioysed on all the excellent dedes that were done by him .
42013018	Then sayde he : What is the kyngdome of God lyke ? or wherto shall I compare it ?
42013019	It is lyke a grayne of mustard seede which a man toke and sowed in his garden : and it grewe and wexed a greate tree and the foules of the ayer made nestes in the braunches of it .
42013020	And agayne he sayde : wher vnto shall I lyken ye kyngdome of god ?
42013021	it is lyke leve which a woman toke and hidde in thre busshels of floure tyll all was thorow levended .
42013022	And he went thorow all maner of cities and tounes teachinge and iorneyinge towardes Ierusalem .
42013023	Then sayde one vnto him : Lorde are ther feawe that shalbe saved ? And he sayde vnto them :
42013024	stryve with youre selves to enter in at ye strayte gate : For many I saye vnto you will seke to enter in and shall not be able .
42013025	When the good man of ye housse is rysen vp and hath shett to the dore ye shall beginne to stonde with out and to knocke at the dore sayinge : Lorde lorde open vnto vs : and he shall answer and saye vnto you : I knowe you not whence ye are .
42013026	Then shall ye begin to saye . We have eaten in thy presence and dronke and thou hast taught in oure stretes .
42013027	And he shall saye : I tell you I knowe you not whence ye are : departe from me all ye workers of iniquite .
42013028	There shalbe wepinge and gnasshinge of teth when ye shall se Abraham and Isaac and Iacob and all the prophetes in the kyngdom of God and youre selves thrust oute at dores .
42013029	And they shall come from the eest and from the weest and from the northe and from the southe and shall syt doune in the kyngdome of God .
42013030	And beholde ther are last which shalbe fyrst : And ther are fyrst which shalbe last .
42013031	The same daye there came certayne of the pharises and sayd vnto him : Get the out of the waye and departe hence : for Herode will kyll ye .
42013032	And he sayd vnto them . Goo ye and tell that foxe beholde I cast oute devyls and heale the people to daye and to morowe and the third daye I make an ende .
42013033	Neverthelesse I must walke todaye and tomorowe and the daye folowinge : For it cannot be that a Prophet perishe eny other where save at Ierusalem .
42013034	O Ierusalem Ierusalem which kyllest prophetes and stonest them that are sent to ye : how often wolde I have gadered thy childre to gedder as the hen gathereth her nest vnder her wynges but ye wolde not .
42013035	Beholde youre habitacion shalbe left vnto you desolate . For I tell you ye shall not se me vntill the tyme come that ye shall saye blessed is he that commeth in the name of the Lorde .
42014001	And it chaunsed that he went into the housse of one of ye chefe pharises to eate breed on a saboth daye : and they watched him .
42014002	And beholde ther was a man before him which had the dropsye .
42014003	And Iesus answered and spake vnto the lawears and pharises sayinge : is it laufull to heale on the saboth daye ?
42014004	And they helde their peace . And he toke him and healed him and let him goo :
42014005	and answered the sayinge whiche of you shall have an asse or an oxe fallen into a pitt and will not strayght waye pull him out on the Saboth daye ?
42014006	And they coulde not answer him agayne to that .
42014007	He put forthe a similitude to ye gestes whe he marked how they preased to the hyest roumes and sayd vnto the :
42014008	When thou arte bidde to a weddynge of eny man syt not doune in ye hyest roume lest a more honorable man then thou be bidden of him
42014009	and he that bade bothe him and the come and saye to the : geve this man roume and thou then beginne with shame to take the lowest roume .
42014010	But rather when thou arte bidden goo and syt in the lowest roume that when he that bade the cometh he maye saye vnto the : frende syt vp hyer . Then shalt thou have worshippe in the presence of them that syt at meate with the .
42014011	For whosoever exalteth him sylfe shalbe brought lowe . And he yt hubleth him sylfe shalbe exalted
42014012	Then sayde he also to him that had desyred him to diner : When thou makest a diner or a supper : call not thy frendes nor thy brethre nether thy kinsmen nor yet ryche neghbours : lest they bidde the agayne and a recompence be made the .
42014013	But when thou makest afeast call the poore the maymed the lame and the blynde
42014014	and thou shalt be happy for they cannot recompence the . But thou shalt be recompensed at the resurreccion of the iuste men .
42014015	When one of them that sate at meate also hearde that he sayde vnto him : happy is he that eateth breed in the kyngdome of God .
42014016	Then sayd he to him . A certayne man ordened a greate supper and bade many
42014017	and sent his servaunt at supper tyme to saye to them that wer bidden come : for all thinges are now redy .
42014018	And they all atonce begane to make excuse . The fyrst sayd vnto him : I have bought a ferme and I must nedes goo and se it I praye the have me excused .
42014019	And another sayd : I hove bought fyve yooke of oxen and I goo to prove them I praye the have me excused .
42014020	The thyrde sayd : I have maried a wyfe and therfore I cannot come .
42014021	And the servaunt went and brought his master worde therof . Then was the good man of the housse displeased and sayd to his servaut : Goo out quickly into ye stretes and quarters of the cite and bringe in hidder the poore and the maymed and the halt and the blynde .
42014022	And the servaut sayd : lorde it is done as thou comaundedst and yet ther is roume .
42014023	And the lorde sayd to the servaunt : Go out into ye hye wayes and hedges and compell the to come in that my housse maye be filled .
42014024	For I saye vnto you that none of those men which were bidde shall tast of my supper .
42014025	Ther went agreate copany with him and he turned and sayde vnto them :
42014026	If a man come to me and hate not his father and mother and wyfe and chyldren and brethren and sisters more over and his awne lyfe he cannot be my disciple .
42014027	And whosoever beare not his crosse and come after me cannot be my disciple .
42014028	Which of you disposed to bilde a toure sytteth not doune before and counteth ye cost whether he have sufficient to performe it ?
42014029	lest after he hath layde ye foundacion and is not able to performe it all yt beholde it beginne to mocke him
42014030	sayinge : this man beganne to bilde and was not able to make an ende .
42014031	Or what kynge goeth to make batayle agaynst another kinge and sitteth not doune fyrst and casteth in his mynde whether he be able wt ten thousande to mete him that cometh agaynst him wt . xx thousand .
42014032	Or els whyll ye other is yet a greate waye of he will sende embasseatours and desyre peace .
42014033	So lykewyse none of you yt forsaketh not all yt he hath can be my disciple .
42014034	Salt is good but yf salt have loste hyr saltnes what shall be seasoned ther with ?
42014035	It is nether good for ye londe nor yet for ye donge hill but men cast it out at ye dores . He yt hath eares to heare let him heare .
42015001	Then resorted vnto him all ye publicas and synners for to heare him .
42015002	And the pharises and scribes murmured sayinge : He receaved to his copany synners and eateth with them .
42015003	Then put he forthe this similitude to the sayinge :
42015004	What man of you havynge an hundred shepe yf he loose one of thee doth not leve nynty and nyne in the wyldernes and goo after yt which is loost vntyll he fynde him ?
42015005	And whe he hath founde him he putteth him on his shulders with ioye :
42015006	And assone as he cometh home he calleth to gedder his lovers and neghbours sayinge vnto them : reioyse with me for I have founde my shepe which was loost .
42015007	I say vnto you yt lyke wyse ioye shalbe in heven over one synner yt repenteth moore then over nynety and nyne iuste persons whiche nede noo repentauce .
42015008	Ether what woman havynge . x . grotes yf she loose one doth not lyght a candell and swepe ye housse and seke diligently tyll she fynde it ?
42015009	And when she hath founde it she calleth her lovers and her neghbours sayinge : Reioyce wt me for I have founde the groate which I had loost .
42015010	Lykwyse I saye vnto you ioye is made in ye presence of ye angels of god over one synner yt repenteth .
42015011	And he sayde : a certayne man had two sonnes
42015012	and the yonger of them sayde to his father : father geve me my parte of the goodes yt to me belongeth . And he devided vnto them his substaunce .
42015013	And not longe after ye yonger sonne gaddered all that he had to gedder and toke his iorney into a farre countre and theare he wasted his goodes with royetous lyvinge .
42015014	And when he had spent all that he had ther rose a greate derth thorow out all yt same londe and he began to lacke .
42015015	And he went and clave to a citesyn of yt same countre which sent him to his felde to kepe his swyne .
42015016	And he wold fayne have filled his bely with the coddes that ye swyne ate : and noo man gave him .
42015017	Then he came to him selfe and sayde : how many hyred servauntes at my fathers have breed ynough and I dye for honger .
42015018	I will aryse and goo to my father and will saye vnto him : father I have synned agaynst heven and before ye
42015019	and am no moare worthy to be called thy sonne make me as one of thy hyred servauntes .
42015020	And he arose and went to his father . And when he was yet a greate waye of his father sawe him and had compassion and ran and fell on his necke and kyssed him .
42015021	And the sonne sayd vnto him : father I have synned agaynst heven and in thy sight and am no moare worthy to be called thy sonne .
42015022	But his father sayde to his servautes : bringe forth that best garment and put it on him and put a rynge on his honde and showes on his fete .
42015023	And bringe hidder that fatted caulfe and kyll him and let vs eate and be mery :
42015024	for this my sonne was deed and is alyve agayne he was loste and is now founde . And they began to be merye .
42015025	The elder brother was in the felde and when he cam and drewe nye to ye housse he herde minstrelcy and daunsynge
42015026	and called one of his servauntes and axed what thoose thinges meate .
42015027	And he sayd vnto him : thy brother is come and thy father had kylled ye fatted caulfe because he hath receaved him safe and sounde .
42015028	And he was angry and wolde not goo in . Then came his father out and entreated him .
42015029	He answered and sayde to his father : Loo these many yeares have I done the service nether brake at eny tyme thy commaundment and yet gavest thou me never soo moche as a kyd to make mery wt my lovers :
42015030	but assone as this thy sonne was come which hath devoured thy goodes with harlootes thou haste for his pleasure kylled ye fatted caulfe .
42015031	And he sayd vnto him : Sonne thou wast ever with me and all that I have is thyne :
42015032	it was mete that we shuld make mery and be glad : for this thy brother was deed and is a lyve agayne : and was loste and is founde .
42016001	And he sayd also vnto his disciples . Ther was a certayne rych man which had a stewarde that was acused vnto him that he had wasted his goodes .
42016002	And he called him and sayd vnto him : How is it that I heare this of the ? Geve a comptes of thy steward shippe : For thou mayste be no longer stewarde .
42016003	The stewarde sayd wt in him selfe : what shall I do ? for my master will take awaye fro me ye stewarde shippe . I canot digge and to begge I am ashamed .
42016004	I woote what to do yt when I am put out of ye stewardshippe they maye receave me into their houses .
42016005	Then called he all his masters detters and sayd vnto ye fyrst : how moche owest thou vnto my master ?
42016006	And he sayd : an hondred tonnes of oyle . And he sayd to him : take thy bill and syt doune quickly and wryte fiftie .
42016007	Then sayd he to another : what owest thou ? And he sayde : an hondred quarters of wheate . He sayd to him : Take thy bill and write foure scoore .
42016008	And the lorde comended the vniust stewarde because he had done wysly . For ye chyldren of this worlde are in their kynde wyser then ye chyldren of lyght .
42016009	And I saye also vnto you : make you frendes of the wicked mammon that when ye shall departe they may receave you into everlastinge habitacions .
42016010	He that is faithfull in that which is leste ye same is faithfull in moche . And he yt is vnfaithfull in ye least : is vnfaithfull also in moche .
42016011	So then yf ye have not ben faithfull in ye wicked mamon ? who will beleve you in that which is true ?
42016012	And yf ye have not bene faithfull in another manes busines : who shall geve you youre awne ?
42016013	No servaunt can serve . ii . masters for other he shall hate ye one and love ye other or els he shall lene to the one and despyse the other . Ye can not serve God and mammon .
42016014	All these thinges herde the pharises also which were coveteous and they mocked him .
42016015	And he sayd vnto the : Ye are they which iustifie youre selves before me : but God knoweth youre hertes . For ye which is highlie estemed amoge me is abhominable in yt sight of god
42016016	The lawe and the Prophetes raygned vntyll the tyme of Iohn : and sence that tyme the kyngdom of God is preached and every man stryveth to goo in .
42016017	Soner shall heven and erth perisshe then one tytle of the lawe shall perisshe .
42016018	Whosoever forsaketh his wyfe and marieth another breaketh matrimony . And every man which marieth her that is devorsed from her husbande committeth advoutry also .
42016019	Ther was a certayne ryche man which was clothed in purple and fyne bysse and fared deliciously every daye .
42016020	And ther was a certayne begger named Lazarus whiche laye at his gate full of soores
42016021	desyringe to be refresshed with the cromes whiche fell from the ryche manes borde . Neverthelesse the dogges came and licked his soores .
42016022	And yt fortuned that the begger dyed and was caried by the angelles into Abrahas bosome . The riche man also died and was buried .
42016023	And beinge in hell in tormetes he lyfte vp his eyes and sawe Abraham a farre of and Lazarus in his bosome
42016024	and he cryed and sayd : father Abraham have mercy on me and sende Lazarus that he maye dippe the tippe of his fynger in water and cole my tonge : for I am tourmented in this flame .
42016025	But Abraha sayd vnto him Sonne remembre that thou in thy lyfe tyme receavedst thy pleasure and contrary wyse Lazarus payne . Now therfore is he comforted and thou art punysshed .
42016026	Beyonde all this bitwene you and vs ther is a greate space set so that they which wolde goo from thence to you cannot : nether maye come from thence to vs .
42016027	Then he sayd : I praye the therfore father send him to my fathers housse .
42016028	For I have fyve brethren : for to warne the left they also come into this place of tourmet .
42016029	Abraha sayd vnto him : they have Moses and the Prophetes let them heare them .
42016030	And he sayd : naye father Abraham but yf one came vnto the from the ded they wolde repent .
42016031	He sayd vnto him : If they heare not Moses and ye prophetes nether will they beleve though one roose from deeth agayne .
42017001	Then sayde he to ye disciples it can not be avoyded but that offences will come . Neverthelesse wo be to him thorow whom they come .
42017002	It were better for him that a mylstone were hanged aboute his necke and that he were cast into ye see then that he shuld offende one of this lytleons .
42017003	Take hede to youre selves . If thy brother trespas agaynst the rebuke him :
