42017004	and yf he repent forgeve him . And though he sinne agest ye . vii . tymes in a daye and seve tymes in a daye tourne agayne to ye sayinge : it repenteth me forgeve him
42017005	And the apostles sayde vnto the Lorde : increase oure faith .
42017006	And the Lorde sayde : yf ye had faith lyke a grayne of mustard sede and shuld saye vnto this sycamine tree plucke thy selfe vp by the rootes and plant thy selfe in the see : he should obey you .
42017007	Who is it of you yf he had a servaute plowinge or fedinge catell that wolde saye vnto him when he were come from the felde Goo quickly and syt doune to meate :
42017008	and wolde not rather saye to him dresse wherwith I maye sup and gyrde vp thy selfe and serve me tyll I have eaten and dronken : and afterwarde eate thou and drinke thou ?
42017009	Doeth he thanke that servaunt because he dyd that which was commaunded vnto him ? I trowe not .
42017010	Soo lyke wyse ye when ye have done all thoose thinges which are commaunded you : saye we are vnprofitable servautes . We have done : ye which was oure duetye to do .
42017011	And it chaunsed as he went to Ierusalem that he passed thorow Samaria and Galile .
42017012	And as he entred into a certayne toune ther met him ten men yt were lepers . Which stode a farre of
42017013	and put forth their voyces and sayde : Iesu master have mercy on vs .
42017014	When he sawe the he sayde vnto them : Goo and shewe youre selves to the prestes . And it chaunsed as they went they were clensed .
42017015	And one of them when he sawe that he was clensed turned backe agayne and with a loude voyce praysed God
42017016	and fell doune on his face at his fete and gave him thankes . And the same was a Samaritane .
42017017	And Iesus answered and sayde : are ther not ten clensed ? But where are those nyne ?
42017018	Ther are not founde that returned agane to geve God prayse save only this straunger .
42017019	And he sayde vnto him : aryse and goo thy waye thy faith hath made the whoale .
42017020	When he was demaunded of ye pharises when the kyngdome of God shuld come : he answered them and sayde : The kyngdome of God cometh not with waytinge for .
42017021	Nether shall men saye : Loo here loo there . For beholde the kyngdome of God is with in you .
42017022	And he sayde vnto the disciples : The dayes will come when ye shall desyre to se one daye of the sonne of man and ye shall not se it .
42017023	And they shall saye to you : Se here Se there . Goo not after them nor folowe them
42017024	for as the lyghtenynge that apereth out of the one parte of the heven and shyneth vnto the other parte of heven : Soo shall the sonne of man be in his dayes .
42017025	But fyrst must he suffre many thinges and be refused of this nacion .
42017026	As it happened in ye tyme of Noe : So shall it be in the tyme of the sonne of man .
42017027	They ate they dranke they maryed wyves and were maryed even vnto yt same daye yt Noe went into ye arke : and ye floud cam and destroyed the all .
42017028	Lykewyse also as it chaunsed in the dayes of Lot . They ate they dranke they bought they solde they planted they bilte .
42017029	And even the same daye that Lot went out of Zodom it rayned fyre and brymstone from heven and destroyed them all .
42017030	After these ensamples shall it be in the daye when the sonne of man shall appere .
42017031	At that daye he that is on the housse toppe and his stuffe in the housse : let him not come doune to take it out . And lykewyse let not him that is in the feldes turne backe agayne to that he lefte behynde .
42017032	Remember Lottes wyfe .
42017033	Whosoever will goo about to save his lyfe shall loose it : And whosoever shall loose his lyfe shall save it .
42017034	I tell you : In that nyght ther shalbe two in one beed the one shalbe receaved and the other shalbe forsaken .
42017035	Two shalbe also a grindynge to gedder : the one shalbe receaved and the other forsaken .
42017036	And they answered and sayde to him : wheare Lorde ? And he sayd vnto the : whersoever ye body shalbe thyther will the egles resoorte .
42017037	And they answered and sayde to him : wheare Lorde ? And he sayd vnto the : whersoever ye body shalbe thyther will the egles resoorte .
42018001	And he put forth a similitude vnto the signifyinge that men ought alwayes to praye and not to be wery
42018002	sayinge : Ther was a Iudge in a certayne cite which feared not god nether regarded man .
42018003	And ther was a certayne wedowe in the same cite which came vnto him sayinge : avenge me of myne adversary .
42018004	And he wolde not for a whyle . But afterwarde he sayd vnto him selfe : though I feare not God nor care for man
42018005	yet because this wedowe troubleth me I will avenge her lest at the laste she come and hagge on me .
42018006	And the lorde sayd : heare what the vnrightewes Iudge sayeth .
42018007	And shall not god avenge his electe which crye daye and nyght vnto him ye though he differre them ?
42018008	I tell you he will avenge them and that quickly . Neverthelesse when the sonne of man cometh suppose ye that he shall fynde faithe on the erthe .
42018009	And he put forthe this similitude vnto certayne which trusted in the selves yt they were perfecte and despysed other .
42018010	Two men went vp into ye teple to praye : ye one a pharise and the other a publican .
42018011	The pharise stode and prayed thus wt him selfe . God I thanke the yt I am not as other men are extorsioners vniuste advoutrers or as this publican .
42018012	I fast twyse in ye weke . I geve tythe of all that I possesse .
42018013	And the publican stode afarre of and wolde not lyfte vp his eyes to heven but smote his brest sayinge : God be mercyfull to me a synner .
42018014	I tell you : this ma departed hoe to his housse iustified moore then the other . For every man that exalteth him selfe shalbe brought low : And he yt hubleth him selfe shalbe exalted
42018015	They brought vnto him also babes yt he shuld touche the . When his disciples sawe that they rebuked the .
42018016	But Iesus called the vnto him and sayde : Suffre chyldren to come vnto me and forbidde the not . For of soche is ye kyngdome of God .
42018017	Verely I saye vnto you : whosoever receaveth not the kyngdome of God as a chylde : he shall not enter therin .
42018018	And a certayne ruler axed him sayinge : Good Master : what ought I to do to obtayne eternall lyfe ?
42018019	Iesus sayd vnto him : Why callest thou me good ? No man is good save God only .
42018020	Thou knowest ye comaundmentes : Thou shalt not commit advoutry : thou shalt not kyll : thou shalt not steale : thou shalt not beare false witnes : Honoure thy father and thy mother .
42018021	And he sayde : all these have I kept from my youthe .
42018022	When Iesus hearde that he sayde vnto him : Yet lackest thou one thinge . Sell all that thou hast and distribute it vnto the poore and thou shalt have treasure in heven and come and folowe me .
42018023	When he heard that he was hevy : for he was very ryche .
42018024	When Iesus sawe him morne he sayde : with what difficulte shall they that have ryches enter into the kyngdome of God :
42018025	it is easyer for a camell to goo thorow a nedles eye then for a ryche man to enter into the kyngdome of God .
42018026	Then sayde they that hearde that : And who shall then be saved ?
42018027	And he sayde : Thinges which are vnpossible with men are possible with God .
42018028	Then Peter sayde : Loo we have lefte all and have folowed the .
42018029	And he sayde vnto them : Verely I saye vnto you ther is noo man that leaveth housse other father and mother other brethren or wyfe or chyldren for the kyngdome of Goddes sake
42018030	which same shall not receave moche moore in this worlde : and in the worlde to come lyfe everlastinge .
42018031	He toke vnto him twelve and sayde vnto them . Beholde we go vp to Ierusalem and all shalbe fulfilled that are written by ye Prophetes of the sonne of man .
42018032	He shalbe delivered vnto the gentils and shalbe mocked and shalbe despytfully entreated and shalbe spetted on :
42018033	and when they have scourged him they will put him to deeth and the thyrde daye he shall aryse agayne .
42018034	But they vnderstode none of these thinges . And this sayinge was hid fro them . And they perceaved not the thinges which were spoken .
42018035	And it came to passe as he was come nye vnto Hierico a certayne blynde man sate by the waye syde begginge .
42018036	And when he hearde the people passe by he axed what it meant .
42018037	And they sayde vnto him yt Iesus of Nazareth passed by .
42018038	And he cryed sayinge : Iesus ye sonne of David have thou mercy on me .
42018039	And they which went before rebuked him that he shuld holde his peace . But he cryed so moche the moare thou sonne of David have mercy on me .
42018040	And Iesus stode styll and commaunded him to be brought vnto him . And when he was come neare he axed him
42018041	sayinge : What wilt thou that I do vnto the ? And he sayde : Lorde yt I maye receave my sight .
42018042	Iesus sayde vnto him : receave thy sight : thy faith hath saved the .
42018043	And immediatly he sawe and folowed him praysinge God . And all the people when they sawe it gave laude to God .
42019001	And he entred in and went thorow Hierico .
42019002	And beholde ther was a ma named Zacheus which was a ruler amoge the Publicans and was riche also .
42019003	And he made meanes to se Iesus what he shuld be : and coulde not for the preace because he was of a lowe stature .
42019004	Wherfore he ran before and asceded vp into a wilde fygge tree to se him : for he shulde come that same waye .
42019005	And when Iesus cam to the place he loked vp and sawe him and sayd vnto him : zache attonce come doune for to daye I must abyde at thy housse .
42019006	And he came doune hastelye and receaved him ioyfully .
42019007	And when they sawe that they all groudged sayinge : He is gone in to tary with a man that is a synner .
42019008	And zache stode forth and sayd vnto ye Lorde : beholde Lorde ye haulfe of my gooddes I geve to the povre and if I have done eny ma wroge I will restore him fower folde .
42019009	And Iesus sayd to him : this daye is healthe come vnto this housse for as moche as it also is become the chylde of Abraha .
42019010	For the sonne of ma is come to seke and to save that which was looste .
42019011	As they hearde these thinges he added ther to a similitude be cause he was nye to Hierusalem and because also they thought that the kyngdome of God shuld shortely appere .
42019012	He sayde therfore : a certayne noble man wet into a farre countre to receave him a kyngdome and then to come agayne .
42019013	And he called his ten servauntes and delyvered them ten pounde sayinge vnto them : by and sell till I come .
42019014	But his citesens hated him and sent messengers after him sayinge : We will not have this man to raygne over vs .
42019015	And it came to passe when he was come agayne and had receaved his kyngdome he comaunded these servautes to be called to him ( to whom he gave his money ) to witt what every man had done .
42019016	Then came ye fyrst sayinge : Lorde thy pounde hath encreased ten poude .
42019017	And he sayde vnto him : Well good servaute because thou wast faithfull in a very lytell thynge take thou auctorite over ten cities .
42019018	And the other came sayinge : Lorde thy poude hath encreased fyve pounde .
42019019	And to ye same he sayde : and be thou also ruler ouer fyve cities .
42019020	And the thyrde came and sayde : Lorde beholde here thy pounde which I have kepte in a napkyn
42019021	for I feared the because thou arte a strayte man : thou takest vp that thou laydest not doune and repest that thou dyddest not sowe .
42019022	And he sayde vnto him : Of thine awne mouth iudge I the thou evyll servaunt . knewest thou that I am a strayte man takinge vp that I layde not doune and repinge that I dyd not sowe ?
42019023	Wherfore then gavest not thou my money into the banke that at my cominge I might have required myne awne with vauntage ?
42019024	And he sayde to them that stode by : take fro him that pounde and geve it him that hath ten poude .
42019025	And they sayd vnto him : Lorde he hath ten pounde .
42019026	I saye vnto you that vnto all the that have it shalbe geve : and from him yt hath not eve that he hath shalbe taken from him .
42019027	Moreover those myne enemys which wolde not that I shuld raigne over them bringe hidder and slee them before me .
42019028	And when he had thus spoken he proceded forthe before a ssendinge vp to Ierusalem .
42019029	And it fortuned when he was come nye to Bethphage and Bethany besydes moute olivete he sent two of his disciples
42019030	sayinge : Goo ye in to the toune which is over agaynste you . In the which assone as ye are come ye shall finde a colte tyed wheron yet never man sate . Lowse him and bringe him hider .
42019031	And if eny man axe you why that ye loowse him : thus saye vnto him ye lorde hath nede of him .
42019032	They that were sent went their waye and founde eve as he had sayde vnto the .
42019033	And as they were aloosinge ye coolte the owners sayde vnto the : why lowse ye ye coolte ?
42019034	And they sayde : for ye Lorde hath nede of him .
42019035	And they brought him to Iesus . And they cast their raymet on ye colte and set Iesus thero .
42019036	And as he wet they spredde their clothes in ye waye .
42019037	And when he was now come wheare he shuld goo doune fro the moute olivete ye whole multitude of ye disciples began to reioyce and to lawde God with a loude voyce for all ye miracles yt they had sene
42019038	sayinge : Blessed be the kynge that cometh in the name of the Lorde : peace in heave and glory in the hyest .
42019039	And some of ye Pharises of the copany sayde vnto him : Master rebuke thy disciples .
42019040	He answered and sayde vnto the : I tell you yf these shuld holde their peace the stones wold crye .
42019041	And when he was come neare he behelde the citie and wept on it
42019042	sayinge : Yf thou haddest dest knowen those thinges which belonge vn thy peace eve at this thy tyme . But now are they hydde from thyne eyes .
42019043	For the dayes shall come vpo the that thy enemys shall cast a banke aboute the and copasse the rounde and kepe the in on every syde
42019044	and make the even with the grounde with thy chyldren which are in the . And they shall not leve in the one stone vpo another because thou knewest not the tyme of thy visitacion .
42019045	And he went in to the temple and begane to cast out them that solde therin and them that bought
42019046	sayinge vnto them yt is written : my housse is the housse of prayer : but ye have made it a den of theves .
42019047	And he taught dayly in the temple . The hye Prestes and the Scribes and the chefe of the people went about to destroye him :
42019048	but coulde not finde what to do . For all the people stacke by him and gave him audience .
42020001	And yt fortuned in one of those dayes as he taught the people in the temple and preached the gospell : the hye prestes and the scribes came with the elders
42020002	and spake vnto him sayinge . Tell vs by what auctorite thou doest these thinges ? Ether who is he yt gave ye this auctorite ?
42020003	He answered and saide vnto the : I also will axe you a questio and answer me .
42020004	The baptyme of Iohn : was it from heaven or of men ?
42020005	And they thought with in them selves sayinge : yf we shall saye from heave : he will saye : why then beleved ye him not ?
42020006	But and yf we shall saye of men all ye people will stone vs . For they be persuaded that Ihon is a Prophet .
42020007	And they answered that they coulde not tell whence it was .
42020008	And Iesus sayde vnto them : nether tell I you by what auctorite I do these thinges .
42020009	Then begane he to put forthe to the people this similitude . A certayne man planted a vyneyarde and let it forthe to fermers and went him selfe into a straunge countre for a greate season .
42020010	And when the tyme was come he sent a servaut to his tennauntes that they shuld geve him of the frutes of the vyneyarde . And the tennauntes dyd bet him and sent him awaye empty .
42020011	And agayne he sent yet another servaunt . And they dyd bet him and foule entreated him also and sent him awaye emptye .
42020012	Moreover he sent the thyrde to and him they wouded and cast out .
42020013	Then sayde the lorde of the vyneyarde : what shall I do ? I will sende my deare sonne him peradventure they will reverence when they se him .
42020014	But when the fermers sawe him they thought in them selves sayinge : this is the heyre come let vs kyll him that the inheritaunce maye be oures .
42020015	And they cast him out of the vyneyarde and kylled him . Now what shall the Lorde of the vyneyarde do vnto them ?
42020016	He will come and destroye those fermers and will let out his vyneyarde to other . When they hearde that they sayde : God forbyd .
42020017	And he behelde them and sayde : what meaneth this then yt is wrytten : The stone that the bylders refused the same is made ye heed corner stone ?
42020018	whosoever stomble at that stone shalbe broken : but on whosoever it faul vpon it wyll grynde him to powder .
42020019	And the hye Prestes and the Scribes the same howre went about to laye hondes on him but they feared the people . For they perceaved that he had spoken this similitude agaynst them .
42020020	And they watched him and sent forth spies which shuld fayne them selves perfecte to take him in his wordes and to delyvre him vnto the power and auctorite of the debite .
42020021	And they axed him sayinge : Master we knowe that thou sayest and teachest ryght nother cosiderest thou eny manes degre but teachest the waye of God truly .
42020022	Ys it laufull for vs to geve Cesar tribute or no ?
42020023	He perceaved their craftynes and sayde vnto them : why tept ye me ?
42020024	Shewe me a peny . Whose ymage and superscripcio hath it ? They answered and sayde : Cesars .
42020025	And he sayde vnto them : Geve then vnto Cesar that which belongeth vnto Cesar : and to God that which pertayneth to God .
42020026	And they coulde not reprove his sayinge before the people . But they marvayled at his answer and helde their peace .
42020027	Then came to him certayne of the Saduces which denye that ther is eny resurreccio . And they axed him
42020028	sayinge : Master Moses wrote vnto vs if eny mannes brother dye havinge a wyfe and the same dye with out yssue : that then his brother shuld take his wyfe and reyse vp seede vnto his brother .
42020029	Ther were seven brethren and the fyrste toke a wyfe and dyed with out children .
42020030	And the seconde toke the wyfe and he dyed chyldlesse .
42020031	And the thyrde toke her and in lyke wyse the resydue of the seven and leeft no chyldren be hynde them and dyed .
42020032	Last of all the woma dyed also .
42020033	Now at the resurreccio whose wyfe of them shall she be ? For seven had her to wyfe .
42020034	Iesus answered and sayde vnto them . The chyldre of this worlde mary wyves and are maryed
42020035	but they which shalbe made worthy to enioye that worlde and the resurreccion from deeth nether mary wyves nether are maryed
42020036	nor yet can dye eny moare . For they are equall vnto the angels : and are the sonnes of God in as moche as they are the chyldre of the resurreccion .
42020037	And that the deed shall ryse agayne even Moses signified besydes the busshe when he sayde : the Lorde God of Adraham and the God of Isaac and the God of Iacob .
42020038	For he is not the God of the deed but of them which live . For all live in him .
42020039	Then certayne of the Pharises answered and sayde : Master thou hast well sayde .
42020040	And after that durst they not axe him eny question at all .
42020041	Then sayde he vnto them : how saye they that Christ is Davids sonne ?
42020042	And David him selfe sayth in the boke of the Psalmes : The Lorde sayde vnto my Lorde syt on my right honde
42020043	tyll I make thine enemys thy fothe stole .
42020044	Seinge David calleth him Lorde : How is he then his sonne .
42020045	Then in the audience of all the people he sayde vnto his disciples
42020046	beware of the Scribes which desyre to goo in longe clothinge : and love gretynges in the markets and the hyest seates in the synagoges and chefe roumes at feastes
42020047	which devoure widdowes houses and that vnder a coloure of longe prayinge : the same shall receave greater damnacion .
42021001	As he behelde he sawe the ryche men how they cast in their offeringes into the treasury .
42021002	And he sawe also a certayne povre widdowe which cast in thyther two mites .
42021003	And he sayde : of a trueth I saye vnto you this poore wyddowe hath put in moare then they all .
42021004	For they all have of their superfluyte added vnto the offerynge of God : but she of her penury hath cast in all the substaunce that she had .
42021005	As some spake of the teple how it was garnesshed with goodly stones and iewels he sayde .
42021006	The dayes will come whe of these thynges which ye se shall not be lefte stone apon stone that shall not be throwen doune .
42021007	And they axed him sayinge : Master whe shall these thinges be and what signe will therbe whe suche thinges shall come to passe .
42021008	And he sayd : take hede that ye be not deceaved . For many will come in my name saying : I am he : and the tyme draweth neare . Folowe ye not them therfore .
42021009	But when ye heare of warre and of dissencion : be not afrayd . For these thinges must fyrst come : but the ende foloweth not by and by .
42021010	Then sayd he vnto the : Nacion shall ryse agaynst nacion and kingdom agaynst kyngdome
42021011	and greate erthquakes shall be in all quarters and honger and pestilence : and fearfull thinges . And greate signes shall therbe from heven .
42021012	But before all these they shall laye their hondes on you and persecute you delyueringe you vp to the sinagoges and into preson and bringe you before kynges and rulers for my names sake .
42021013	And this shall chaunce you for a testimoniall .
42021014	Let it sticke therfore faste in youre hertes not once to stody before what ye shall answere :
42021015	for I will geve you a mouth and wisdome where agaynste all youre adversarys shall not be able to speake nor resist .
42021016	Ye and ye shalbe betrayed of youre fathers and mothers and of youre brethren and kynsmen and lovers aud some of you shall they put to deeth .
42021017	And hated shall ye be of all men for my names sake .
42021018	Yet ther shall not one heer of youre heedes perisshe .
42021019	With youre pacience possesse youre soules .
42021020	And when ye se Ierusalem beseged with an hoste then vnderstonde that the desolacio of the same is nye .
42021021	Then let them which are in Iewrye flye to the mountaynes . And let them which are in the middes of it departe oute . And let not them that are in other countreis enter ther in .
42021022	For these be the dayes of vengeance to fulfill all that are writte .
42021023	But wo be to them that be with chylde and to them that geve sucke in those dayes : for ther shalbe greate trouble in the londe and wrath over all this people .
42021024	And they shall fall on the edge of the swearde and shalbe leed captive into all nacions . And Ierusalem shalbe trooden vnder fote of the gentyls vntyll the tyme of the gentyls be fulfilled .
42021025	And ther shalbe signes in the sunne ad in the mone and in the starres : and in ye erth the people shalbe in soche perplexite yt they shall not tell which waye to turne them selves . The see and the waters shall roore
42021026	and menes hertes shall fayle them for feare and for lokinge after thoose thinges which shall come on the erth . For the powers of heve shall move .
42021027	And then shall they se the sonne of ma come in a clowde with power and greate glory .
42021028	When these thinges begyn to come to passe : then loke vp and lifte vp youre heddes for youre redemcion draweth neye .
42021029	And he shewed the a similitude : beholde ye fygge tree and all other trees
42021030	when they shute forth their buddes ye se and knowe of youre awne selves that sommer is then nye at hod .
42021031	So lyke wyse ye ( when ye se these thinges come to passe ) vnderstonde that the kyngdome of God is neye .
42021032	Verely I saye vnto you : this generacion shall not passe tyll all be fulfilled .
42021033	Heaven and erth shall passe : but my wordes shall not passe .
42021034	Take hede to youre selves lest youre hertes be overcome with surfettinge and dronkennes and cares of this worlde : and that that daye come on you vnwares .
42021035	For as a snare shall it come on all them that sit on the face of the erthe .
42021036	Watche therfore continually and praye that ye maye obtayne grace to flye all this that shall come and that ye maye stonde before the sonne of man .
42021037	In the daye tyme he taught in the temple and at night he went out and had abydinge in the mount olivete .
42021038	And all the people came in the morninge to him in the temple for to heare him .
42022001	The feaste of swete breed drue nye whiche is called ester
42022002	and the hye prestes and Scribes sought how to kyll him but they feared the people .
42022003	Then entred Satan into Iudas whose syr name was Iscariot ( which was of the nombre of the twelve )
42022004	and he went his waye and comuned with the hye Prestes and officers how he might betraye him to them .
42022005	And they were glad : and promysed to geve him money .
42022006	And he consented and sought oportunite to betraye him vnto them when the people were awaye .
42022007	Then came ye daye of swete breed when of necessite the esterlambe must be offered .
42022008	And he sent Peter and Iohn sayinge : Goo and prepare vs the ester lambe that we maye eate .
42022009	They sayde to him . Where wilt thou yt we prepare ?
42022010	And he sayd vnto them . Beholde when ye be entred into the cite ther shall a man mete you bearinge a pitcher of water him folowe into the same housse yt he entreth in
42022011	and saye vnto ye good ma of ye housse . The master sayeth vnto ye : where is ye gest chamber where I shall eate myne ester lambe wt my disciples ?
42022012	And he shall shew you a greate parloure paved . Ther make redy .
42022013	And they wet and foude as he had sayd vnto the : and made redy ye ester lambe .
42022014	And when the houre was come he sate doune and the twelve Apostles with him .
42022015	And he sayde vnto them : I have inwardly desyred to eate this ester lambe with you before yt I suffre .
42022016	For I saye vnto you : hence forthe I will not eate of it eny moore vntill it be fulfilled in the kingdome of God .
42022017	And he toke the cup and gave thankes and sayde . Take this and devyde it amonge you .
42022018	For I saye vnto you : I will not drinke of the frute of the vyne vntill the kingdome of God be come .
42022019	And he toke breed gave thankes and gave to them sayinge : This is my body which is geven for you . This do in the remembraunce of me .
42022020	Lykewyse also when they had supped he toke the cup sayinge : This cup is the newe testament in my bloud which shall for you be shedde .
42022021	Yet beholde the honde of him that betrayeth me is with me on the table .
42022022	And ye sonne of man goeth as it is appoynted : But wo be to yt man by whom he is betrayed .
42022023	And they began to enquyre amoge them selves which of them it shuld be that shuld do that .
42022024	And ther was a stryfe amoge the which of them shuld be taken for the greatest .
42022025	And he sayde vnto them : the kynges of the getyls raygne over them and they that beare rule over them are called gracious lordes .
42022026	But ye shall not be so . But he that is greatest amonge you shalbe as the yongest : and he that is chefe shalbe as the minister .
42022027	For whether is greater he that sitteth at meate : or he that serveth ? Is not he that sitteth at meate ? And I am amoge you as he that ministreth .
42022028	Ye are they which have bidden with me in my temptacions .
42022029	And I apoynt vnto you a kyngdome as my father hath appoynted to me :
42022030	that ye maye eate and drynke at my table in my kyngdome and sit on seates and iudge the twelve tribes of Israell .
42022031	And the Lorde sayde : Simon Simon beholde Satan hath desired you to sifte you as it were wheate :
42022032	bnt I have prayed for the that thy faith fayle not . And when thou arte converted strengthe thy brethre .
42022033	And he sayd vnto him . Lorde I am redy to go with the in to preson and to deth .
42022034	And he sayde : I tell the Peter the cocke shall not crowe this daye tyll thou have thryse denyed yt thou knewest me .
42022035	And he sayde vnto them : when I sent you with out wallet and scripe and shoes ? lacked ye eny thinge ? And they sayd no .
42022036	And he sayde to them : but nowe he that hath a wallet let him take it vp and lykewyse his scrippe . And he that hath no swearde let him sell his coote and bye one .
42022037	For I saye vnto you that yet that which is written must be performed in me : even with the wycked was he nombred . For those thinges which are written of me have an ende .
42022038	And they sayde : Lorde beholde here are two sweardes . And he sayde vnto them : it is ynough .
42022039	And he came out and went as he was wote to mounte olivete . And the disciples folowed him .
42022040	And when he came to the place he sayde to the : praye lest ye fall into temptacio .
42022041	And he gate him selfe from them about a stones cast and kneled doune and prayed
42022042	sayinge : Father yf thou wilt withdrawe this cup fro me . Neverthelesse not my will but thyne be be fulfilled .
42022043	And ther appered an angell vnto him from heaven confortinge him .
42022044	And he was in an agonye and prayed somwhat longer . And hys sweate was lyke droppes of bloud tricklynge doune to the grounde .
42022045	And he rose vp from prayer and came to his disciples and foude them slepinge for sorowe
42022046	and sayde vnto them : Why slepe ye ? Ryse and praye lest ye fall into temptacion .
42022047	Whill he yet spake : beholde ther came a company and he that was called Iudas one of the twelve wet before them and preased nye vnto Iesus to kysse him .
42022048	And Iesus sayd vnto him : Iudas betrayest thou ye sonne of man with a kysse ?
42022049	When they which were about him sawe what wolde folow they sayde vnto him . Lorde shall we smite with swearde .
42022050	And one of them smote a servaut of ye hiest preste of all and smote of his right eare .
42022051	And Iesus answered and sayd : Soffre ye thus farre forthe . And he touched his eare and healed him .
42022052	Then Iesus sayde vnto the hye prestes and rulers of the temple and the elders which were come to him . Be ye come out as vnto a thefe with sweardes and staves ?
42022053	When I was dayly with you in the teple ye stretched not forth hondes agaynst me . But this is even youre very houre and the power of darcknes .
42022054	Then toke they him and ledde him and brought him to the hye prestes housse . And peter folowed a farre of .
42022055	When they had kyndled a fyre in the middes of the palys and were set doune to geder Peter also sate doune amonge them .
42022056	And wone of the wenches behelde him as he sate by the fyer and set good eyesight on him and sayde : this same was also with him .
42022057	Then he denyed hym sayinge : woman I knowe him not
42022058	And after a lytell whyle another sawe him and sayde : thou arte also of them . And Peter sayd man I am not .
42022059	And aboute the space of an houre after another affirmed sayinge : verely even this felowe was with hym for he is of Galile
42022060	and Peter sayde : ma I woote not what thou sayest . And immediatly whyll he yet spake the cocke crewe .
42022061	And the Lorde tourned backe and loked apon Peter . And Peter remembred the wordes of the Lorde how he sayde vnto him before ye cocke crowe thou shalt denye me thryse .
42022062	And Peter went out and wepte bitterly .
42022063	And the men that stode about Iesus mocked him and smoote him
42022064	and blyndfolded him and smoote his face . And axed him sayinge : arede who it is that smoote ye ?
42022065	And many other thinges despytfullye sayd they agaynst him .
42022066	And assone as it was daye the elders of the people and the hye prestes and scribes came to gedder and ledde him into their counsell sayinge :
42022067	arte thou very Christ ? tell vs . And he sayde vnto the : yf I shall tell you ye will not beleve
42022068	And yf also I axe you ye will not answere me or let me goo .
42022069	Herafter shall the sonne of man sit on the ryght honde of the power of God .
42022070	Then sayde they all : Arte thou then the sonne of God ? He sayd to them : ye saye yt I am .
42022071	Then sayde they : what nede we eny further witnes ? We oure selves have herde of his awne mouthe .
42023001	And the whole multitude of them arose and ledde him vnto Pylate .
42023002	And they beganne to accuse him sayinge : We have founde this felowe pervertynge the people and forbiddynge to paye tribute to Cesar : sayinge that he is Christ a kynge .
42023003	And Pylate apposed him sayinge : arte thou the kynge of the iewes ? He answered him and sayde : thou sayest it .
42023004	Then sayde Pylate to the hye prestes and to the people : I fynde noo faute in this man .
42023005	And they were the moore fearce sayinge . He moveth the people teachynge thorowout all Iewry and beganne at Galile even to this place .
42023006	When Pilate hearde mencion of Galile he axed whether the ma were of Galile .
42023007	And assone as he knewe that he was of Herodes iurisdiccion he sent him to Herode which was also at Ierusalem in those dayes .
42023008	And when Herode sawe Iesus he was excedinglie gladde . For he was desyrous to se him of a longe season because he had hearde many thinges of him and trusted to have sene some myracle done by him .
42023009	Then questeoned he with him of many thinges . But he answered him not one worde .
42023010	The hye prestes and scribes stode forthe and accused him straytly .
42023011	And Herod wt his men of warre despysed him and mocked him and arayed him in whyte and sent him agayne to Pylate .
42023012	And the same daye Pylate and Herod were made frendes togeder . For before they were at variaunce .
42023013	And Pylate called to geder the hye prestes and the rulers and the people
42023014	and sayde vnto them : Ye have brought this man vnto me as one that perverted the people . And beholde I have examined him before you and have founde no faute in this man of those thinges where of ye accuse him .
42023015	No nor yet Herode . For I sent you to him : and lo no thinge worthy of deeth is done to him .
42023016	I will therfore chasten him and let him lowsse .
42023017	For of necessite he must have let one lowse vnto them at that feast .
42023018	And all the people cryed at once sayinge : awaye with him and delyvre to vs Barrabas :
42023019	which for insurrccion made in the cite and morther was cast into preson .
42023020	Pylate spake agayne to them willynge to let Iesus lowse .
42023021	And they cryed sayinge : Crucify him Crucify him
42023022	He sayde vnto them the thyrde tyme . What evyll hath he done ? I fynde no cause of deeth in him . I will therfore chasten him and let him lowse .
42023023	And they cryed with loude voyce and required that he myght be crucifyed . And the voyce of them and of the hye Prestes prevayled .
42023024	And Pylate gave sentence that it shuld be as they required
42023025	and let lowse vnto them him that for insurreccion and morther was cast into preson whom they desyred : and delyvered Iesus to do with him what they wolde .
42023026	And as they ledde him awaye they caught one Symon of Syrene commynge out of the felde : and on him layde they the crosse to beare it after Iesus .
42023027	And ther folowed him a greate company of people and of wemen which weme bewayled and lamented him .
42023028	But Iesus turned backe vnto them and sayde : Doughters of Ierusalem wepe not for me : but wepe for youre selves and for youre chyldren .
42023029	For beholde the dayes will come when men shall saye : happy are the baren and the wombes that never bare and the pappes which never gave sucke .
42023030	Then shall they beginne to saye to the mountaynes fall on vs : and to the hilles cover vs .
42023031	For yf they do this to a grene tree what shalbe done to the drye ?
42023032	And ther were two evyll doers ledde with him to be slayne .
42023033	And when they were come to the place which is called Calvary there they crucified him and the evyll doers one on ryght honde and the other on the lefte .
42023034	Then sayde Iesus : father forgeve them for they woot not what they do . And they parted his rayment and cast loottes .
42023035	And the people stode and behelde . And the rulers mocked him with thee saying : he holpe other men let him helpe him selfe yf he be Christ the chosen of god .
42023036	The soudiers also mocked him and came and gave him veneger
42023037	and sayde : yf thou be that kynge of ye Iewes save thy silfe .
42023038	And his superscripcio was writte over him in greke in latine and Ebreu : This is the kynge of the Iewes .
42023039	And one of the evyll doers which hanged rayled on him sayinge : If thou be Christ save thy selfe and vs .
42023040	The other answered and rebuked him sayinge . Net herfearest thou god because thou arte in the same damnacion ?
42023041	We are ryghteously punesshed for we receave accordynge to oure dedes : But this man hath done nothinge amysse .
42023042	And he sayde vnto Iesus : Lorde remember me when thou comest into thy kyngdome .
42023043	And Iesus sayde vnto him : Verely I saye vnto the to daye shalt thou be with me in Paradyse .
42023044	And it was about the sixt houre . And ther came a darcknes over all the londe vntyll ye nynth houre
42023045	and the sonne was darckened . And the vayle of the temple dyd rent even thorow the myddes .
42023046	And Iesus cryed with a greate voyce and sayd : Father into thy hondes I comende my sprete . And when he thus had sayd he gave vp the goost .
42023047	When ye Centurion sawe what had happened he glorified God sayinge : Of a surtie this man was perfecte .
42023048	And all the people that came to geder to that sight beholdynge the thinges which were done : smoote their bestes and returned home .
42023049	And all his acquayntaunce and the wemen that folowed him from Galile stode a farre of beholdynge these thinges .
42023050	And beholde ther was a man named Ioseph a councelloure and was a good man and a iuste
42023051	and dyd not consent to the counsell and dede of them which was of Aramathia a cite of the Iewes : which same also wayted for ye kyngdome of God :
42023052	he went vnto Pilate and begged the boddy of Iesus
42023053	and toke it doune and wrapped it in a lynnen clooth and layed it in an hewen toumbe wherin was never man before layed .
42023054	And that daye was ye Saboth even and the Saboth drue on .
42023055	The wemen that folowed after which came with him from Galile behelde the sepulcre and how his body was layed .
42023056	And they returned and prepared odoures and oyntmetes : but rested the Saboth daye accordynge to the commaundement .
42024001	On the morowe after the saboth erly in the morninge they came vnto the toumbe and brought the odoures which they had prepared and other wemen with them
42024002	And they founde the stone rouled awaye fro the sepulcre
42024003	and went in : but founde not the body of the Lorde Iesu .
42024004	And it happened as they were amased therat : Beholde two men stode by them in shynynge vestures .
42024005	And as they were a frayde and bowed doune their faces to the erth : they sayd to them : why seke ye the lyvinge amonge the deed ?
42024006	He is not here : but is rysen . Remember how he spake vnto you when he was yet with you in Galile
42024007	sayinge : that the sonne of man must be delyvered into the hondes of synfull men and be crucified and the thyrde daye ryse agayne .
42024008	And they remembred his wordes
42024009	and returned from the sepulcre and tolde all these thinges vnto the eleven and to all the remanaunt .
42024010	It was Mary Magdalen and Ioanna and Mary Iacobi and other that were with the which tolde these thinges vnto the Apostles
42024011	and their wordes semed vnto them fayned thinges nether beleved they them .
42024012	Then aroose Peter and ran vnto the sepulcre and stouped in and sawe the lynnen cloothes layde by them selfe and departed wondrynge in him selfe at that which had happened .
42024013	And beholde two of them went that same daye to a toune which was fro Ierusalem about thre scoore for longes called Emaus :
42024014	and they talked togeder of all these thinges that had happened .
42024015	And it chaunsed as they comened togeder and reasoned that Iesus him selfe drue neare and went with them .
42024016	But their eyes were holden that they coulde not knowe him .
42024017	And he sayde vnto them : What maner of comunicacions are these that ye have one to another as ye walke and are sadde .
42024018	And the one of them named Cleophas answered and sayd vnto him : arte thou only a straunger in Ierusalem and haste not knowen the thinges which have chaunsed therin in these dayes ?
42024019	To whom he sayd : what thinges ? And they sayd vnto him : of Iesus of Nazareth which was a Prophet myghtie in dede and worde before god and all the people .
42024020	And how the hye prestes and oure rulers delyvered him to be condempned to deeth : and have crucified him .
42024021	But we trusted that it shuld have bene he that shuld have delyvered Israel . And as touchynge all these thinges to daye is even the thyrd daye that they were done .
42024022	Ye and certayne wemen also of oure company made vs astonyed which came erly vnto the sepulcre
42024023	and founde not his boddy : and came sayinge that they had sene a vision of angels which sayde that he was alyve .
42024024	And certayne of them which were with vs went their waye to the sepulcre and founde it even so as the wemen had sayde : but him they sawe not .
42024025	And he sayde vnto the : O foles and slowe of herte to beleve all yt the prophetes have spoken .
42024026	Ought not Christ to have suffred these thinges and to enter into his glory ?
42024027	And he began at Moses and at all the prophetes and interpreted vnto them in all scriptures which were wrytten of him .
42024028	And they drue neye vnto the toune wich they went to . And he made as though he wolde have gone further .
42024029	But they constrayned him sayinge : abyde with vs for it draweth towardes nyght and the daye is farre passed . And he went in to tary with the .
42024030	And it came to passe as he sate at meate wt them he toke breed blessed it brake and gave to them .
42024031	And their eyes were openned and they knewe him : and he vnnisshed out of their syght .
42024032	And they sayde betwene them selves : dyd not oure hertes burne with in vs whyll he talked with vs by the waye and as he opened to vs the scriptures ?
42024033	And they roose vp the same houre and returned agayne to Ierusalem and founde the eleven gadered to geder and them that were with them which
42024034	sayde : the Lorde is rysen in dede and hath apered to Simon .
42024035	And they tolde what thinges was done in the waye and how they knewe him in breakynge of breed .
42024036	As they thus spake Iesus him selfe stode in ye myddes of them and sayde vnto them : peace be with you .
42024037	And they were abasshed and afrayde supposinge yt they had sene a sprete
42024038	And he sayde vnto the : Why are ye troubled and why do thoughtes aryse in youre hertes ?
42024039	Beholde my hondes and my fete that it is even my selfe . Handle me and se : for spretes have not flesshe and bones as ye se me have .
42024040	And when he had thus spoken he shewed them his hondes and his fete .
42024041	And whyll they yet beleved not for ioye and wondred he sayde vnto the : Have ye here eny meate ?
42024042	And they gave him a pece of a broyled fisshe and of an hony combe .
42024043	And he toke it and ate it before them .
42024044	And he sayde vnto the . These are the wordes which I spake vnto you whyll I was yet with you : that all must be fulfilled which were written of me in the lawe of Moses and in the Prophetes and in the Psalmes .
42024045	Then openned he their wyttes that they myght vnderstond the scriptures
42024046	and sayde vnto them . Thus is it written and thus it behoved Christ to suffre and to ryse agayne from deeth the thyrde daye
42024047	and that repentaunce and remission of synnes shuld be preached in his name amonge all nacions and must beginne at Ierusalem .
42024048	And ye are witnesses of these thinges .
42024049	And beholde I will sende the promes of my father apon you . But tary ye in ye cite of Ierusalem vntyll ye be endewed with power from an hye .
42024050	And he ledde the out into Bethany and lyfte vp his hondes and blest them .
42024051	And it cam to passe as he blessed the he departed from the and was caryed vp in to heven .
42024052	And they worshipped him and returned to Ierusalem with greate ioye
42024053	and were continually in the temple praysinge and laudinge God . Amen .
43001001	In the beginnynge was the worde and the worde was with God : and the worde was God .
43001002	The same was in the beginnynge with God .
43001003	All thinges were made by it and with out it was made nothinge that was made .
43001004	In it was lyfe and the lyfe was ye lyght of men
43001005	and the lyght shyneth in the darcknes but the darcknes comprehended it not .
43001006	There was a man sent from God whose name was Iohn .
43001007	The same cam as a witnes to beare witnes of the lyght that all men through him myght beleve .
43001008	He was not that lyght : but to beare witnes of the lyght .
43001009	That was a true lyght which lyghteth all men that come into the worlde .
43001010	He was in ye worlde and the worlde was made by him : and yet the worlde knewe him not .
43001011	He cam amonge his ( awne ) and his awne receaved him not .
43001012	But as meny as receaved him to them he gave power to be the sonnes of God in yt they beleved on his name :
43001013	which were borne not of bloude nor of the will of the flesshe nor yet of the will of man : but of God .
43001014	And the worde was made flesshe and dwelt amonge vs and we sawe the glory of it as the glory of the only begotten sonne of ye father which worde was full of grace and verite .
43001015	Iohn bare witnes of him and cryed sayinge : This was he of whome I spake he that cometh after me was before me because he was yer then I .
43001016	And of his fulnes have all we receaved even ( grace ) for grace .
43001017	For the lawe was geven by Moses but grace and truthe came by Iesus Christ .
43001018	No ma hath sene God at eny tyme . The only begotte sonne which is in ye bosome of ye father he hath declared him .
43001019	And this is the recorde of Iohn : When the Iewes sent Prestes and Levites from Ierusalem to axe him what arte thou ?
43001020	And he confessed and denyed not and sayde playnly : I am not Christ .
43001021	And they axed him : what then ? arte thou Helyas ? And he sayde : I am not . Arte thou a Prophete ? And he answered no .
43001022	Then sayd they vnto him : what arte thou that we maye geve an answer to them that sent vs : What sayest thou of thy selfe ?
43001023	He sayde : I am the voyce of a cryar in the wyldernes make strayght the waye of the Lorde as sayde the Prophete Esaias .
43001024	And they which were sent were of the pharises .
43001025	And they axed him and sayde vnto him : why baptisest thou then yf thou be not Christ nor Helyas nether a Prophet ?
43001026	Iohn answered them sayinge : I baptise with water : but one is come amonge you whom ye knowe not
43001027	he it is that cometh after me whiche was before me whose sho latchet I am not worthy to vnlose .
43001028	These thinges were done in Bethabara beyonde Iordan where Iohn dyd baptyse .
43001029	The nexte daye Iohn sawe Iesus commyge vnto him and sayde : beholde the lambe of God which taketh awaye the synne of the worlde .
43001030	This is he of whom I sayde . After me cometh a man which was before me for he was yer then I
43001031	and I knew him not : but that he shuld be declared to Israell therfore am I come baptisynge with water .
43001032	And Iohn bare recorde sayinge : I sawe the sprete descende from heven lyke vnto a dove and abyde apon him
43001033	and I knewe him not . But he that sent me to baptise in water the same sayde vnto me : apon whom thou shalt se the sprete descende and tary styll on him the same is he which baptiseth with the holy goost .
43001034	And I sawe and bare recorde that this is the sonne of God .
43001035	The next daye after Iohn stode agayne and two of his disciples .
43001036	And he behelde Iesus as he walked by and sayde : beholde the lambe of God .
43001037	And the two disciples hearde him speake and folowed Iesus .
43001038	And Iesus turned about and sawe them folowe and sayde vnto them : what seke ye ? They sayde vnto him : Rabbi ( which is to saye by interpretacion Master ) where dwellest thou ?
43001039	He sayde vnto them : come and se . They came and sawe where he dwelt : and abode with him that daye . For it was about the tenthe houre .
43001040	One of the two which hearde Iohn speake and folowed Iesus was Andrew Simon Peters brother .
43001041	The same founde his brother Simon fyrst and sayde vnto him : we have founde Messias which is by interpretacion annoynted :
43001042	and brought him to Iesus . And Iesus behelde him and sayde : thou arte Simon the sonne of Ionas thou shalt be called Cephas : which is by interpretacion a stone .
43001043	The daye folowynge Iesus wolde goo into Galile and founde Philip and sayde vnto him folowe me .
43001044	Philip was of Bethsaida the cite of Andrew and Peter .
43001045	And Philip founde Nathanael and sayde vnto him . We have founde him of whom Moses in the lawe and the prophetes dyd wryte . Iesus the sonne of Ioseph of Nazareth .
43001046	And Nathanael sayde vnto him : can ther eny good thinge come out of Nazareth ? Philip sayde to him : come and se .
43001047	Iesus sawe Nathanael commynge to him and sayde of him . Beholde a ryght Israelite in who is no gyle .
43001048	Nathanael sayd vnto him : where knewest thou me ? Iesus answered and sayde vnto him : Before that Philip called the when thou wast vnder ye fygge tree I sawe the .
43001049	Nathanael answered and sayde vnto him : Rabbi thou arte the sonne of God thou arte the kynge of Israel .
43001050	Iesus answered and sayd vnto him : Because I sayde vnto the I sawe the vnder the fygge tree thou belevest . Thou shalt se greater thinges then these .
43001051	And he sayde vnto him : Verely verely I saye vnto you : herafter shall ye se heven open and the angels of God ascendynge and descendynge over the sonne of man .
43002001	And the thryde daye was ther a mariage in Cana a cite of Galile : and the mother of Iesus was there .
43002002	And Iesus was called also and his disciples vnto the mariage .
43002003	And when the wyne fayled the mother of Iesus sayde vnto him : they have no wyne .
43002004	Iesus sayde vnto her : woman what have I to do with the ? myne houre is not yet come .
43002005	His mother sayde vnto the ministres : whatsoever he sayeth vnto you do it .
43002006	And therwere stondynge theare sixe water pottes of stone after ye maner of the purifyinge of ye Iewes contaynynge two or thre fyrkins a pece .
43002007	And Iesus sayde vnto them : fyll the water pottes with water . And they fylled them vp to the brym .
43002008	And he sayde vnto them : drawe out now and beare vnto the governer of the feaste . And they bare it .
43002009	When the ruler of the feast had tasted the water that was turned vnto wyne and knewe not whence it was ( but the ministres which drue the water knew ) . He called the brydegrome
43002010	and sayde vnto him . All men at the beginnynge set forth good wyne and when men be dronke then that which is worsse . But thou hast kept backe the good wyne vntyll now .
43002011	This beginnynge of miracles dyd Iesus in Cana of Galile and shewed his glory and his disciples beleved on him .
43002012	After that he descended in to Capernaum and his mother and his brethren and his disciples : but contynued not manye dayes there .
43002013	And the Iewes ester was even at honde and Iesus went vp to Ierusalem
43002014	and founde syttynge in the temple those that solde oxen and shepe and doves and chaungers of money .
43002015	And he made a scourge of small cordes and drave them all out of the temple with the shepe and oxen and powred oute the changers money and overthrue the tables
43002016	and sayde vnto them that solde doves : Have these thinges hence and make not my fathers housse an housse of marchaundyse .
43002017	And his disciples remembred how yt it was wrytten : the zele of thyne housse hath even eaten me .
43002018	Then answered the Iewes and sayde vnto him : what token shewest thou vnto vs seynge that thou dost these thinges ?
43002019	Iesus answered and sayd vnto them : destroye this temple and in thre dayes I will reare it vp agayne .
43002020	Then sayde the Iewes : xlvi . yeares was this temple abuyldinge : and wylt thou reare it vp in thre dayes ?
43002021	But he spake of the temple of his body .
43002022	Assone therfore as he was rysen from deeth agayne his disciples remembred that he thus sayde . And they beleved the scripture and the wordes which Iesus had sayde .
43002023	When he was at Ierusalem at ester in the feaste many beleved on his name when they sawe his miracles which he dyd .
43002024	But Iesus put not him selfe in their hondes because he knewe all men
43002025	and neded not that eny man shuld testify of man . For he knewe what was in man .
43003001	Ther was a man of the pharises named Nicodemus a ruler amonge ye Iewes .
43003002	The same cam to Iesus by nyght and sayde vnto him : Rabbi we knowe that thou arte a teacher whiche arte come from God . For no man coulde do suche miracles as thou doest except God were with him .
43003003	Iesus answered and sayde vnto him : Verely verely I saye vnto the : except a man be boren a newe he cannot se the kyngdom of God .
43003004	Nicodemus sayde vnto him : how can a man be boren when he is olde ? can he enter into his moders wombe and be boren agayne ?
43003005	Iesus answered : verely verely I saye vnto the : except that a man be boren of water and of ye sprete he cannot enter into the kyngdome of god .
43003006	That which is boren of the flesshe is flesshe : and that which is boren of the sprete is sprete .
43003007	Marvayle not that I sayd to the ye must be boren a newe .
43003008	The wynde bloweth where he listeth and thou hearest his sounde : but canst not tell whence he cometh and whether he goeth . So is every man that is boren of the sprete .
43003009	And Nicodemus answered and sayde vnto him : how can these thinges be ?
43003010	Iesus answered and sayde vnto him : arte thou a master in Israel and knowest not these thinges ?
43003011	Verely verely I saye vnto the we speake that we knowe and testify that we have sene : and ye receave not oure witnes .
43003012	Yf when I tell you erthely thinges ye beleve not : how shuld ye beleve yf I shall tell you of hevenly thinges ?
43003013	And no man ascendeth vp to heaven but he that came doune from heaven that is to saye the sonne of man which is in heaven .
43003014	And as Moses lifte vp the serpent in the wyldernes even so must the sonne of man be lifte vp
43003015	that none that beleveth in him perisshe : but have eternall lyfe .
43003016	For God so loveth the worlde yt he hath geven his only sonne that none that beleve in him shuld perisshe : but shuld have everlastinge lyfe .
43003017	For God sent not his sonne into the worlde to condepne the worlde : but that the worlde through him might be saved .
43003018	He that beleveth on him shall not be condepned . But he that beleveth not is condempned all redy be cause he beleveth not in the name of the only sonne of God .
43003019	And this is the condempnacion : that light is come into the worlde and the me loved darcknes more then light because their dedes were evill .
43003020	For every man that evyll doeth hateth the light : nether commeth to light lest his dedes shuld be reproved .
43003021	But he that doth truth commeth to the light that his dedes might be knowen how that they are wrought in God .
43003022	After these thinges cam Iesus and his disciples into the Iewes londe and ther he haunted with them and baptised .
43003023	And Iohn also baptised in Enon besydes Salim because ther was moche water there and they came and were baptised .
43003024	For Iohn was not yet cast into preson .
43003025	And ther arose a questio bitwene Iohns disciples and the Iewes about purifiynge .
43003026	And they came vnto Iohn and sayde vnto him : Rabbi he that was with the beyonde Iordan to whom thou barest witnes . Beholde the same baptyseth and all me come to him .
43003027	Iohn answered and sayde : a man can receave no thinge at all except it be geve him fro heaven .
43003028	Ye youre selves are witnesses how that I sayde : I am not Christ but am sent before him .
43003029	He that hath the bryde is the brydegrome . But the frende of the brydegrome which stondeth by and heareth him reioyseth greately of the brydgromes voyce . Tis my ioye is fulfilled .
43003030	He must increace : and I muste decreace .
43003031	He that commeth from an hye is above all : He that is of ye erth is of the erth and speaketh of the erth . He that cometh from heaven is above all
43003032	and what he hath sene and hearde : that he testifieth : but no man receaveth his testimonye .
43003033	How be it he that hath receaved hys testimonye hath set to his seale that God is true .
43003034	For he whom God hath sent speaketh the wordes of God . For God geveth not the sprete by measure .
43003035	The father loveth the sonne and hath geven all thinges into his honde .
43003036	He that beleveth on the sonne hath everlastynge lyfe : and he that beleveth not the sonne shall not se lyfe but the wrathe of God abydeth on him .
43004001	Assone as the Lorde had knowledge how the Pharises had hearde that Iesus made and baptised moo disciples then Iohn
43004002	( though that Iesus him selfe baptised not : but his disciples )
43004003	he lefte Iewry and departed agayne into Galile .
43004004	And it was so that he must nedes goo thorowe Samaria .
43004005	Then came he to a cyte of Samaria called Sichar besydes the possession that Iacob gave to his sonne Ioseph .
43004006	And there was Iacobs well . Iesus then weryed in his iorney sate thus on the well . And it was about the sixte houre :
43004007	and there came a woman of Samaria to drawe water . And Iesus sayde vnto her : geve me drynke .
43004008	For his disciples were gone awaye vnto the toune to bye meate .
43004009	Then sayde the woman of Samaria vnto him : how is it that thou beinge a Iewe axest drinke of me which am a Samaritane ? for the Iewes medle not with the Samaritans .
43004010	Iesus answered and sayde vnto hir : yf thou knewest the gyfte of God and who it is that sayeth to the geve me drynke thou woldest have axed of him and he wolde have geven the water of lyfe .
43004011	The woman sayde vnto him . Syr thou hast no thinge to drawe with and the well is depe : from whence then hast thou yt water of lyfe ?
43004012	Arte thou greater then oure father Iacob which gave vs the well and he him silfe dranke therof and his chyldren and his catell ?
43004013	Iesus answered and sayde vnto hir : whosoever drinketh of this water shall thurst agayne .
43004014	But whosoever shall drinke of ye water yt I shall geve him shall never be more a thyrst : but the water that I shall geve him shalbe in him a well of water springinge vp in to everlastinge lyfe .
43004015	The woma sayd vnto him : Syr geve me of that water that I thyrst not nether come hedder to drawe .
43004016	Iesus sayde vnto her . Go and call thy husband and come hydder .
43004017	The woman answered and sayde to him : I have no husband .
43004018	Iesus sayde to her . Thou hast well sayd I have no husbande . For thou haste had five husbandes and he whom thou now hast is not thy husband . That saydest thou truely .
43004019	The woman sayde vnto him : Syr I perceave yt thou arte a prophet .
43004020	Oure fathers worshipped in this mountayne : and ye saye that in Hierusalem is the place where men ought to worshippe .
43004021	Iesus sayde vnto her : woman beleve me the houre cometh when ye shall nether in this moutayne nor yet at Ierusalem worshippe the father .
43004022	Ye worshippe ye wot not what : we knowe what we worshippe . For salvacion cometh of the Iewes .
43004023	But the houre commeth and nowe is when the true worshippers shall worshippe the father in sprete and in trouthe . For verely suche the father requyreth to worshippe him .
43004024	God is a sprete and they that worshippe him must worshippe him in sprete and trouthe .
43004025	The woman sayde vnto him : I wot well Messias shall come which is called Christ . When he is come he will tell vs all thinges .
43004026	Iesus sayde vnto hir : I that speake vnto the am he .
43004027	And eve at that poynte came his disciples and marvelled that he talked with the woman . Yet no man sayde vnto him : what meanest thou or why talkest thou with her ?
43004028	The woma then lefte her waterpot and went her waye into the cite and sayde to the men .
43004029	Come se a man which tolde me all thinges yt ever I dyd . Is not he Christ ?
43004030	Then they went ont of the cite and came vnto him .
43004031	And in ye meane while his disciples prayed him sayinge : Master eate .
43004032	He sayde vnto the : I have meate to eate that ye knowe not of .
43004033	Then sayd ye disciples bitwene them selves : hath eny ma brought him meate ?
43004034	Iesus sayde vnto them : my meate is to doo the will of him that sent me . And to fynnysshe his worke .
43004035	Saye not ye : there are yet foure monethes and then cometh harvest ? Beholde I saye vnto you lyfte vp youre eyes and loke on ye regios : for they are whyte all redy vnto harvest .
43004036	And he ye repeth receaveth rewarde and gaddereth frute vnto life eternall : that bothe he that soweth and he yt repeth myght reioyse to gether .
43004037	And herin is the sayinge true yt one soweth and another repeth .
43004038	I sent you to repe yt whero ye bestowed no laboure . Other men laboured and ye are entred into their labours .
43004039	Many of the Samaritas of that cyte beleved on him for ye sayinge of the woma which testified : he tolde me all thinges yt ever I dyd .
43004040	Then when the Samaritas were come vnto him they besought him yt he wolde tary wt the . And he aboode there two dayes .
43004041	And many moo beleved because of his awne wordes
43004042	and sayd vnto the woman : Now we beleve not because of thy sayinge . For we have herde him oure selves and knowe that this is even in dede Christ the savioure of the worlde .
43004043	After two dayes he departed thence and wet awaye into Galile .
43004044	And Iesus him selfe testified that a Prophete hath none honoure in his awne countre .
43004045	Then assone as he was come into Galile the Galileans receaved him which had sene all the thinges yt he dyd at Ierusalem at ye feast . For they wet also vnto ye feast daye .
43004046	And Iesus came agayne into Cana of Galile wher he turned water into wyne . And ther was a certayne ruler whose sonne was sicke at Capernaum .
43004047	Assone as the same herde that Iesus was come out of Iewry into Galile he wet vnto him and besought him yt he wolde descende and heale his sonne : For he was eve readie to dye .
43004048	Then sayde Iesus vnto him : excepte ye se signes and wodres ye canot beleve .
43004049	The ruler sayd vnto him : Syr come awaye or ever yt my chylde dye .
43004050	Iesus sayde vnto him goo thy waye thy sonne liveth . And the ma beleved ye wordes yt Iesus had spoke vnto him and wet his waye .
43004051	And anone as he went on his waye his servantes met him and tolde him sayinge : thy chylde liveth .
43004052	Then enquyred he of the the houre when he begane to amende . And they sayde vnto him : Yester daye the sevethe houre the fever lefte him .
43004053	And the father knew that it was the same houre in which Iesus sayde vnto him : Thy sonne liveth . And he beleved and all his housholde .
43004054	Thys is agayne the seconde myracle yt Iesus dyd after he was come oute of Iewry into Galile .
43005001	After that ther was a feast of the Iewes and Iesus went vp to Ierusalem .
43005002	And ther is at Ierusalem by ye slaughterhousse a pole called in ye Ebrue toge Bethseda havinge five porches
43005003	in which laye a greate multitude of sicke folke of blinde halt and wyddered waytinge for the movinge of the water .
43005004	For an angell wet doune at a certayne ceason into ye pole and troubled ye water . Whosoever then fyrst after the steringe of the water stepped in was made whoale of what soever disease he had .
43005005	And a certayne ma was theare which had bene diseased . xxxviii . yeares .
43005006	When Iesus sawe him lye and knewe that he now longe tyme had bene diseased he sayde vnto him . Wilt thou be made whoale ?
43005007	The sicke answered him : Syr I have no man whe the water is troubled to put me into the pole . But in the meane tyme whill I am about to come another steppeth doune before me .
43005008	And Iesus sayde vnto him : ryse take vp thy beed and walke .
43005009	And immediatly the man was made whole and toke vp his beed and went . And the same daye was the Saboth daye .
43005010	The Iewes therfore sayde vnto him that was made whole . It is ye Saboth daye it is not laufull for the to cary thy beed .
43005011	He answered them : he that made me whole sayde vnto me : take vp thy beed and get the hence .
43005012	Then axed they him : what man is that which sayde vnto the take vp thy beed and walke .
43005013	And he yt was healed wist not who it was . For Iesus had gotte him selfe awaye be cause yt ther was preace of people in ye place .
43005014	And after that Iesus founde him in the teple and sayd vnto him : beholde thou arte made whole synne no moore lest a worsse thinge happe vnto the .
43005015	The man departed and tolde ye Iewes that yt was Iesus whiche had made him whole .
43005016	And therfore the Iewes dyd persecute Iesus and sought the meanes to slee him because he had done these thinges on the Saboth daye .
43005017	And Iesus answered them : my father worketh hidder to and I worke .
43005018	Therfore the Iewes sought the moare to kill him not only because he had broken the Saboth : but sayde also that God was his father and made him selfe equall with God .
43005019	Then answered Iesus and sayde vnto them : verely verely I saye vnto you : the sonne can do no thinge of him selfe but that he seeth ye father do . For whatsoever he doeth yt doeth the sonne also .
43005020	For the father loveth ye sonne and sheweth him all thinges whatsoever he him selfe doeth . And he will shewe him greter workes then these because ye shoulde marvayle .
43005021	For lykwyse as the father rayseth vp ye deed and quickeneth them even so the sonne quyckeneth whom he will .
43005022	Nether iudgeth ye father eny ma : but hath comitted all iudgemet vnto the sonne
43005023	because that all men shuld honoure the sonne eve as they honoure the father . He that honoureth not ye sonne the same honoureth not the father which hath sent him .
43005024	Verely verely I saye vnto you : He that heareth my wordes and beleveth on him that sent me hath everlastinge lyfe and shall not come into damnacion : but is scaped fro deth vnto lyfe .
43005025	Verely verely I saye vnto you : the tyme shall come and now is when the deed shall heare the voyce of the sonne of God . And they yt heare shall live .
43005026	For as the father hath life in him silfe : so lyke wyse hath he geven to ye sonne to have lyfe in him silfe :
43005027	and hath geven him power also to iudge in that he is the sonne of man .
43005028	Marvayle not at this ye houre shall come in the which all yt are in the graves shall heare his voice
43005029	and shall come forthe : they that have done good vnto the resurreccion of lyfe : and they that have done evyll vnto the resurreccion of dampnacion .
43005030	I can of myne awne selfe do nothinge at all . As I heare I iudge and my iudgemet is iust because I seke not myne awne will but the will of ye father which hath sent me .
43005031	Yf I beare witnes of my selfe my witnes is not true .
43005032	Ther is a nother that beareth witnes of me and I am sure that the witnes whiche he beareth of me is true .
43005033	Ye sent vnto Iohn and he bare witnes vnto the truthe .
43005034	But I receave not the recorde of man . Neverthelesse these thinges I saye that ye might be safe .
43005035	He was a burninge and a shyninge light and ye wolde for a season have reioysed in his light .
43005036	But I have greater witnes then the witnes of Iohn . For ye workes which ye father hath geve me to fynisshe : the same workes which I do beare witnes of me that ye father sent me .
43005037	And the father him silfe which hath sent me beareth witnes of me . Ye have not hearde his voyce at eny tyme nor ye have sene his shape :
43005038	therto his wordes have ye not abydinge in you . For whome he hath sent : him ye beleve not .
43005039	Searche the scriptures for in them ye thinke ye have eternall lyfe : and they are they which testify of me .
43005040	And yet will ye not come to me that ye might have lyfe .
43005041	I receave not prayse of men .
43005042	But I knowe you that ye have not the love of God in you
43005043	I am come in my fathers name and ye receave me not . Yf another shall come in his awne name him will ye receave .
43005044	How can ye beleve which receave honoure one of another and seke not the honoure that commeth of God only ?
43005045	Doo not thinke that I wyll accuse you to my father . Ther is one that accuseth you eve Moses in whom ye trust .
43005046	For had ye beleved Moses ye wold have beleved me : for he wrote of me .
43005047	But now ye beleve not his writinge : how shall ye beleve my wordes .
43006001	After these thinges Iesus wet his waye over the see of Galile nye to a cyte called Tiberias .
43006002	And a greate multitude folowed him because they had sene his myracles which he dyd on them that were diseased .
43006003	And Iesus went vp into a mountayne and there he sate with his disciples .
43006004	And ester a feast of ye Iewes was nye .
43006005	Then Iesus lifte vp his eyes and sawe a greate copany come vnto him and sayde vnto Philip : whence shall we bye breed yt these might eate .
43006006	This he sayde to prove him : for he him sylfe knewe what he wolde do .
43006007	Philip answered him two hondred peny worthe of breed are not sufficient for them yt every ma have a litell .
43006008	Then sayde vnto him one of his disciples Andrew Simon Peters brother .
43006009	There ys a lad here which hath fyve barly loves and two fisshes : but what is that amoge so many ?
43006010	And Iesus sayde . Make the people sit doune : Ther was moche grasse in the place . And the men sate doune in nombre about five thousande .
43006011	And Iesus toke the breed and gave thankes and gave to the disciples and his disciples to them that were set doune . And lykwyse of the fysshes as moche as they wolde .
43006012	When they had eate ynough he sayd vnto his disciples : gadder vp the broke meate that remayneth : that nothinge be loost .
43006013	And they gadered it to geder and fylled twelve baskettes with the broken meate of the five barly loves which broken meate remayned vnto the that had eaten .
43006014	Then the men when they had sene the myracle that Iesus dyd sayde : This is of a trueth the Prophet that shuld come into the worlde .
43006015	When Iesus perceaved that they wolde come and take him vp to make him kinge he departed agayne into a mountayne him silfe a lone .
43006016	And when eve was come his disciples wet vnto the see
43006017	and entred into a shyppe and went over the see vnto Capernaum . And anone it was darcke and Iesus was not come to them .
43006018	And ye see arose with a greate winde yt blew .
43006019	And when they had rowe aboute a . xxv . or a xxx . furlonges they sawe Iesus walke on ye see and drawe nye vnto the shyp and they were afrayed .
43006020	And he sayde vnto them : It is I be not a frayde .
43006021	Then wolde they have receaved him into the shyp and the ship was by and by at the londe whyther they went .
43006022	The daye folowynge the people which stode on the other syde of the see sawe that ther was none other shyp theare save yt one wher in his disciples were entred and that Iesus went not in with his disciples into the ship : but that his disciples were gone awaye alone .
43006023	How be it ther came other shippes from Tiberias nye vnto the place where they ate breed when the Lorde had blessed .
43006024	Then whe the people sawe that Iesus was not there nether his disciples they also toke shippinge and came to Caparnaum sekinge for Iesus .
43006025	And when they had founde him on ye other syde of ye see they sayd vnto him : Rabbi whe camest thou hidder ?
43006026	Iesus answered them and sayde : verely verely I saye vnto you : ye seke me not because ye sawe the myracles : but because ye ate of the loves and were filled .
43006027	Laboure not for ye meate which perissheth but for ye meate that endureth vnto everlastynge lyfe whiche meate ye sonne of ma shall geve vnto you . For him hath god ye father sealed .
43006028	Then sayd they vnto him : what shall we do that we myght worke ye workes of God ?
43006029	Iesus answered and sayde vnto them . This is ye worke of God that ye beleve on him who he hath sent .
43006030	They sayde vnto him : what signe shewest thou then that we maye se and beleve the ? What doest thou worke ?
43006031	Oure fathers dyd eate Manna in the desert as yt is writte : He gave them breed fro heaven to eate .
43006032	Iesus sayde vnto the : verely verely I saye vnto you : Moses gave you breed fro heave : but my father geveth you the true breed fro heave .
43006033	For the breed of God is he which cometh doune from heave and geveth lyfe vnto the worlde .
43006034	Then sayde they vnto him : Lorde ever moore geve vs this breed .
43006035	And Iesus sayde vnto them : I am that breed of life . He that cometh to me shall not honger : and he that beleveth on me shall never thurst .
43006036	But I sayed vnto you : that ye have sene me aud yet beleve not .
43006037	All that the father geveth me shall come to me : and him yt cometh to me I cast not awaye .
43006038	For I came doune fro heaven : not to do myne awne will but his will which hath sent me .
43006039	And this is the fathers will which hath sent me that of all which he hath geven me I shuld loose no thinge : but shuld rayse it vp agayne at the last daye .
43006040	And this is the wyll of him yt sent me : yt every man which seith ye sonne and beleveth on him have everlastinge lyfe . And I will rayse him vp at ye last daye .
43006041	The Iewes then murmured at him because he sayde : I am that breed which is come doune from heaven .
43006042	And they sayde : Is not this Iesus ye sonne of Ioseph whose father and mother we knowe ? How ys yt then that he sayeth I came doune from heave ?
43006043	Iesus answered and sayde vnto them . Murmur not betwene youre selves .
43006044	No man can come to me except the father which hath sent me drawe him . And I will rayse him vp at the last daye .
43006045	It is written in the Prophetes yt they shall all be taught of God . Every man therfore that hath hearde and hath learned of the father commeth vnto me .
43006046	Not that eny man hath sene ye father save he which is of God : the same hath sene the father .
43006047	Verely verely I saye vnto you he that beleveth on me hath everlastinge lyfe .
43006048	I am that breed of lyfe .
43006049	Youre fathers dyd eate Mana in ye wildernes and are deed .
43006050	This is that breed which cometh fro heave yt he which eateth of it shuld also not dye .
43006051	I am that lyvinge breed which came doune from heave . Yf eny man eate of this breed he shall live forever . And the breed that I will geve is my flesshe which I will geve for the lyfe of ye worlde
43006052	And the Iewes strove amoge them selves sayinge : How can this felowe geve vs his flesshe to eate ?
43006053	Then Iesus sayde vnto them : Verely verely I saye vnto you except ye eate ye flesshe of ye sonne of man and drinke his bloude ye shall not have lyfe in you .
43006054	Whosoever eateth my flesshe and drinketh my bloude hath eternall lyfe : and I will rayse him vp at the last daye .
43006055	For my flesshe is meate in dede : and my bloude is drynke in dede .
43006056	He that eateth my flesshe and drynketh my bloude dwelleth in me and I in him .
43006057	As the lyvinge father hath sent me even so lyve I by my father : and he that eateth me shall live by me .
43006058	This is the breed which cam from heave : not as youre fathers have eaten Manna and are deed . He that eateth of this breed shall live ever .
43006059	These thinges sayd he in the synagoge as he taught in Capernaum .
43006060	Many of his disciples when they had herde this sayde : this is an herde sayinge : who can abyde the hearinge of it ?
43006061	Iesus knew in him selfe that his disciples murmured at it and sayde vnto them : Doth this offende you ?
43006062	What and yf ye shall se the sonne of man ascede vp where he was before ?
43006063	It is the sprete that quyckeneth the flesshe proffeteth nothinge . The wordes that I speake vnto you are sprete and lyfe .
43006064	But ther are some of you that beleve not . For Iesus knewe from the begynnynge which they were that beleved not and who shuld betraye him .
43006065	And he sayde : Therfore sayde I vnto you : that no man can come vnto me except it were geven vnto him of my father .
43006066	From that tyme many of his disciples wet backe and walked no moore with him .
43006067	Then sayde Iesus to the twelve : will ye alsoo goo awaye ?
43006068	Then Simon Peter answered : Master to whom shall we goo ? Thou haste the wordes of eternall lyfe
43006069	and we beleve and knowe yt thou arte Christ the sonne of the lyvinge God .
43006070	Iesus answered them : Have not I chosen you twelve and yet one of you is the devyll ?
43006071	He spake it of Iudas Iscariot the sonne of Simon . For he it was yt shuld betraye him and was one of the twelve .
43007001	After that Iesus wet about in Galile and wolde not go about in Iewry for the Iewes sought to kill him .
43007002	The Iewes tabernacle feast was at honde .
43007003	His brethren therfore sayde vnto him : get ye hence and go into Iewry yt thy disciples maye se thy workes yt thou doest .
43007004	For ther is no man yt doeth eny thing secretly and he him selfe seketh to be knowen . Yf thou do soche thinges shewe thy selfe to the worlde .
43007005	For as yet his brethre beleved not in him .
43007006	Then Iesus sayd vnto them : My tyme is not yet come youre tyme is all waye redy .
43007007	The worlde canot hate you . Me it hateth : because I testify of it that the workes of it are evyll .
43007008	Go ye vp vnto this feast . I will not go vp yet vnto this feast for my tyme is not yet full come .
43007009	These wordes he sayde vnto them and abode still in Galile .
43007010	But assone as his brethren were goone vp then went he also vp vnto the feast : not openly but as it were prevely .
43007011	Then sought him the Iewes at ye feast and sayde : Where is he ?
43007012	And moche murmurynge was ther of him amonge the people . Some sayde : He is good . Wother sayde naye but he deceaveth the people .
43007013	How be it no ma spake openly of him for feare of the Iewes
