43007014	In ye middes of the feast Iesus went vp into the temple and taught .
43007015	And the Iewes marveylled sayinge : How knoweth he ye scriptures seynge yt he never learned ?
43007016	Iesus answered them and sayde : My doctrine is not myne : but his that sent me .
43007017	If eny man will do his will he shall knowe of the doctrine whether it be of God or whether I speake of my selfe .
43007018	He that speaketh of him selfe seketh his awne prayse . But he that seketh his prayse that sent him the same is true and no vnrightewesnes is in him .
43007019	Dyd not Moses geve you a lawe and yet none of you kepeth ye lawe ? Why goo ye aboute to kyll me ?
43007020	The people answered and sayde : thou hast the devyll : who goeth aboute to kyll the ?
43007021	Iesus answered and sayde to them : I have done one worke and ye all marvayle .
43007022	Moses therfore gave vnto you circumcision : not because it is of Moses but of the fathers . And yet ye on the Saboth daye circumcise a man .
43007023	If a man on the Saboth daye receave circumcision without breakinge of the lawe of Moses : disdayne ye at me because I have made a man every whit whoale on the saboth daye ?
43007024	Iudge not after the vtter aperaunce : but iudge rightewes iudgement .
43007025	Then sayd some of them of Ierusalem : Is not this he who they goo aboute to kyll ?
43007026	Beholde he speaketh boldly and they saye nothinge to him . Do the rulars knowe in dede that this is very Christ ?
43007027	How be it we knowe this man whence he is : but when Christ cometh no man shall knowe whence he is .
43007028	Then cryed Iesus in ye temple as he taught sayinge : ye knowe me and whence I am ye knowe . And yet I am not come of my selfe but he yt sent me is true whom ye knowe not .
43007029	I knowe him : for I am of him and he hath sent me .
43007030	Then they sought to take him : but no ma layde hondes on him because his tyme was not yet come .
43007031	Many of the people beleved on him and sayde : when Christ cometh will he do moo miracles then this man hath done ?
43007032	The pharises hearde that the people murmured suche thinges about him . Wherfore ye pharises and hye prestes sent ministres forthe to take him .
43007033	Then sayde Iesus vnto the : Yet am I a lytell whyle with you and then goo I vnto him that sent me .
43007034	Ye shall seke me and shall not fynde me : and where I am thyther can ye not come .
43007035	Then sayde the Iewes bitwene the selves : whyther will he goo that we shall not fynde him ? Will he goo amonge the gentyls which are scattered all a broade and teache the gentyls ?
43007036	What maner of sayinge is this that he sayde : ye shall seke me and shall not fynde me : and where I am thyther can ye not come ?
43007037	In the last daye that great daye of the feaste Iesus stode and cryed sayinge : If eny man thyrst let him come vnto me and drinke .
43007038	He that beleveth on me as sayeth the scripture out of his belly shall flowe ryvers of water of lyfe .
43007039	This spak he of the sprete which they that beleved on him shuld receave . For the holy goost was not yet there because that Iesus was not yet glorifyed .
43007040	Many of the people when they hearde this sayinge sayd : of a truth this is a prophet
43007041	Other sayde : this is Christ . Some sayde : shall Christ come out of Galile ?
43007042	Sayeth not the scripture that Christ shall come of the seed of David : and out of the toune of Bethleem where David was ?
43007043	So was ther dissencion amonge the people aboute him .
43007044	And some of them wolde have taken him : but no man layed hondes on him .
43007045	Then came ye ministres to ye hye prestes and pharises . And they sayde vnto the : why have ye not brought him ?
43007046	The servautes answered never man spake as this man doeth .
43007047	Then answered the the pharises : are ye also disceaved ?
43007048	Doth eny of the rulers or of the pharises beleve on him ?
43007049	But the comen people whiche knowe not ye lawe are cursed .
43007050	Nicodemus sayde vnto them : He that came to Iesus by nyght and was one of them .
43007051	Doth oure lawe iudge eny man before it heare him and knowe what he hath done ?
43007052	They answered and sayde vnto him : arte thou also of Galile ? Searche and loke for out of Galile aryseth no Prophet .
43007053	And every man went vnto his awne housse .
43008001	And Iesus went vnto mounte Olivete
43008002	and erly in ye mornynge came agayne into ye temple and all the people came vnto him and he sate doune and taught them .
43008003	And the scribes and ye pharises brought vnto him a woman taken in advoutry and set hyr in the myddes
43008004	and sayde vnto him : Master this woman was taken in advoutry even as the dede was a doyng .
43008005	Moses in the lawe comaunded vs yt suche shuld be stoned . What sayest thou therfore ?
43008006	And this they sayde to tempt him : that they myght have wherof to accuse him . Iesus stouped doune and with his fynger wrote on the grounde .
43008007	And whyll they continued axynge him he lyfte him selfe vp and sayde vnto them : let him yt is amoge you wt out synne cast the fyrst stone at her .
43008008	And agayne he stouped doune and wrote on ye grounde .
43008009	And assone as they hearde that they went out one by one the eldest fyrst . And Iesus was lefte a lone and the woman stondynge in ye myddes .
43008010	When Iesus had lyfte vp him selfe agayne and sawe no man but the woman he sayde vnto hyr . Woman where are those thyne accusars ? Hath no man condempned the ?
43008011	She sayde : No man Lorde . And Iesus sayde : Nether do I condempne the . Goo and synne no moare .
43008012	Then spake Iesus agayne vnto them sayinge : I am the light of the worlde . He that foloweth me shall not walke in darcknes : but shall have the light of lyfe .
43008013	The pharises sayde vnto him : thou bearest recorde of thy sylfe thy recorde is not true .
43008014	Iesus answered and sayde vnto them : Though I beare recorde of my selfe yet my recorde is true : for I knowe whece I came and whyther I goo . But ye cannot tell whece I come and whyther I goo .
43008015	Ye iudge after ye flesshe . I iudge no man
43008016	though I iudge yet is my iudgmet true . For I am not alone : but I and the father that sent me .
43008017	It is also written in youre lawe that the testimony of two men is true .
43008018	I am one yt beare witnes of my selfe and the father that sent me beareth witnes of me .
43008019	Then sayde they vnto him : where is thy father ? Iesus answered : ye nether knowe me nor yet my father . Yf ye had knowen me ye shuld have knowen my father also .
43008020	These wordes spake Iesus in the tresury as he taught in the temple and no man layde hondes on him for his tyme was not yet come .
43008021	Then sayde Iesus agayne vnto them . I goo my waye and ye shall seke me and shall dye in youre synnes . Whyther I goo thyther can ye not come .
43008022	Then sayde the Iewes : will he kyll him selfe because he sayth : whyther I goo thyther can ye not come ?
43008023	And he sayde vnto the : ye are fro beneth I am from above . Ye are of this worlde I am not of this worlde .
43008024	I sayde therfore vnto you that ye shall dye in youre synnes . For except ye beleve that I am he ye shall dye in youre synnes .
43008025	Then sayde they vnto him who arte thou ? And Iesus sayde vnto them : Even ye very same thinge yt I saye vnto you .
43008026	I have many thinges to saye and to iudge of you . But he yt sent me is true . And I speake in ye worlde those thinges which I have hearde of him .
43008027	They understode not that he spake of his father .
43008028	Then sayde Iesus vnto them : when ye have lyft vp an hye the sonne of man then shall ye knowe that I am he and that I do nothinge of my selfe : but as my father hath taught me even so I speake :
43008029	and he that sent me is with me . The father hath not lefte me alone for I do alwayes those thinges that please him .
43008030	As he spake these wordes many beleved on him .
43008031	Then sayde Iesus to those Iewes which beleved on him . If ye cotinue in my wordes then are ye my very disciples
43008032	and shall knowe the trueth : and the trueth shall make you free .
43008033	They answered him : We be Abrahams seede and were never bonde to eny man : why sayest thou then ye shalbe made fre .
43008034	Iesus answered them : verely verely I saye vnto you that whosoever committeth synne is the servaunt of synne .
43008035	And the servaunt abydeth not in the housse for ever : But ye sonne abydeth ever .
43008036	If the sonne therfore shall make you fre then are ye fre in dede .
43008037	I knowe that ye are Abrahams seed : But ye seke meanes to kyll me because my sayinges have no place in you .
43008038	I speake that I have sene with my father : and ye do that which ye have sene with youre father .
43008039	They answered and sayde vnto him : Abraham is oure father . Iesus sayde vnto them . If ye were Abrahams chyldren ye wolde do the dedes of Abraham .
43008040	But now ye goo about io kyll me a man that have tolde you the truthe which I have herde of god : this dyd not Abraham .
43008041	Ye do the dedes of youre father . Then sayde they vnto him : we were not borne of fornicacion . We have one father which is God .
43008042	Iesus sayde vnto them : yf God were youre father then wolde ye love me . For I proceaded forthe and come from God . Nether came I of my selfe but he sent me .
43008043	Why do ye not knowe my speache ? Even because ye cannot abyde the hearynge of my wordes .
43008044	Ye are of youre father the devyll and the lustes of youre father ye will folowe . He was a murtherer from the beginnynge and aboode not in the trueth because ther is no trueth in him . When he speaketh a lye then speaketh he of his awne . For he is a lyar and the father therof .
43008045	And because I tell you ye trueth therfore ye beleve me not .
43008046	Which of you can rebuke me of synne ? If I saye ye trueth why do not ye beleve me ?
43008047	He that is of God heareth goddes wordes Ye therfore heare them not because ye are not of God .
43008048	Then answered the Iewes and sayde vnto him : Saye we not well that thou arte a Samaritane and hast the devyll ?
43008049	Iesus answered : I have not the devyll : but I honour my father and ye have dishonoured me .
43008050	I seke not myne awne prayse : but ther is one that seketh and iudgeth .
43008051	Verely verely I saye vnto you yf a man kepe my sayinges he shall never se deeth .
43008052	Then sayde the Iewes to him : Now knowe we that thou hast the devyll . Abraha is deed and also the Prophetes : and yet thou sayest yf a man kepe my sayinge he shall never tast of deeth .
43008053	Arte thou greater then oure father Abraham which is deed ? and the Prophetes are deed . Whome makest thou thy selfe ?
43008054	Iesus answered : Yf I honoure my selfe myne honoure is nothinge worth . It is my father that honoureth me which ye saye is youre God
43008055	and ye have not knowen him : but I knowe him . And yf I shuld saye I knowe him not I shuld be a lyar lyke vnto you . But I knowe him and kepe his sayinge .
43008056	Youre father Abraham was glad to se my daye and he sawe it and reioysed .
43008057	Then sayde the Iewes vnto him : thou arte not yet . l . yere olde and hast thou sene Abraham ?
43008058	Iesus sayd vnto them : Verely verely I saye vnto you : yer Abraham was I am .
43008059	Then toke they vp stones to caste at him . But Iesus hid him selfe and went out of ye temple .
43009001	And as Iesus passed by he sawe a man which was blynde from his birth .
43009002	And his disciples axed him sayinge . Master who dyd synne : this man or his father and mother that he was borne blynde ?
43009003	Iesus answered : Nether hath this man synned nor yet his father and mother : but that the workes of God shuld be shewed on him .
43009004	I must worke the workes of him that sent me whyll it is daye . The nyght cometh when no man can worke .
43009005	As longe as I am in the worlde I am the lyght of the worlde .
43009006	Assone as he had thus spoken he spate on the grounde and made claye of the spetle and rubbed the claye on the eyes of the blynde
43009007	and sayde vnto him : Goo wesshe the in ye pole of Syloe which by interpretacion signifieth sent . He went his waye and wasshed and cam agayne seinge .
43009008	The neghboures and they that had sene him before how that he was a begger sayde : is not this he that sate and begged ?
43009009	Some sayde : this is he . Other sayd : he is lyke him . But he him selfe sayde : I am even he .
43009010	They sayde vnto him : How are thyne eyes opened then ?
43009011	He answered and sayde . The ma that is called Iesus made claye and anoynted myne eyes and sayd vnto me : Goo to the pole Syloe and wesshe . I went and wesshed and receaved my syght .
43009012	They sayde vnto him : where is he ? He sayde : I cannot tell .
43009013	Then brought they to ye pharises him that a lytell before was blynde :
43009014	for it was the Saboth daye when Iesus made the claye and opened his eyes .
43009015	Then agayne the pharises also axed him how he had receaved his syght . He sayde vnto the : He put claye apon myne eyes and I wasshed and do se .
43009016	Then sayde some of the pharises : this man is not of God because he kepeth not the saboth daye . Other sayde : how can a man yt is a synner do suche myracles ? And ther was stryfe amonge the .
43009017	Then spake they vnto the blynde agayne : What sayst thou of him because he hath openned thyne eyes ? And he sayd : He is a Prophet .
43009018	But the Iewes dyd not beleve of the felowe how that he was blynde and receaved his syght vntyll they had called the father and mother of him that had receaved his syght .
43009019	And they axed the saying : Is this youre sonne whome ye saye was borne blynde ? How doth he now se then ?
43009020	His father and mother answered them and sayde : we wote well that this is oure sonne and that he was borne blynde :
43009021	but by what meanes he now seith that can we not tell or who hath opened his eyes can we not tell . He is olde ynough axe him let him answer for him selfe .
43009022	Suche wordes spake his father and mother because they feared the Iewes . For the Iewes had conspyred all redy that yf eny man dyd confesse that he was Christ he shuld be excommunicat out of the synagoge .
43009023	Therefore sayde his father and mother : he is olde ynough axe him .
43009024	Then agayne called they the man that was blynde and sayd vnto him : Geve God the prayse : we knowe that this man is a synner .
43009025	He answered and sayde : Whyther he be a synner or noo I cannot tell : One thinge I am sure of that I was blynde and now I se .
43009026	Then sayde they to him agayne . What dyd he to the ? How opened he thyne eyes ?
43009027	He answered them I tolde you yerwhyle and ye dyd not heare . Wherfore wolde ye heare it agayne ? Will ye also be his disciples ?
43009028	Then rated they him and sayde : Thou arte his disciple . We be Moses disciples .
43009029	We are sure that God spake with Moses . This felowe we knowe not from whence he is .
43009030	The man answered and sayde vnto them : this is a merveleous thinge that ye wote not whence he is seinge he hath opened myne eyes .
43009031	For we be sure that God heareth not synners . But yf eny man be a worshipper of God and do his will him heareth he .
43009032	Sence ye worlde beganne was it not hearde yt eny man opened the eyes of one that was borne blynd .
43009033	If this man were not of God he coulde have done no thinge .
43009034	They answered and sayd vnto him : thou arte altogeder borne in synne : and dost thou teache vs ? And they cast him out .
43009035	Iesus hearde that they had excommunicate him : and assone as he had founde him he sayd vnto him : doest thou beleve on the sonne of God ?
43009036	He answered and sayde : Who is it Lorde that I myght beleve on him ?
43009037	And Iesus sayde vnto him : Thou hast sene him and he it is that talketh with the .
43009038	And he sayde : Lorde I beleve : and worshipped him .
43009039	Iesus sayde : I am come vnto iudgement into this worlde : that they which se not myght se and they which se myght be made blynde .
43009040	And some of the pharises which were with him hearde these wordes and sayde vnto him : are we then blynde ?
43009041	Iesus sayde vnto them : yf ye were blynde ye shuld have no synne . But now ye saye we se therfore youre synne remayneth .
43010001	Verely verely I saye vnto you : he that entreth not in by ye dore into the shepefolde but clymeth vp some other waye : the same is a thefe and a robber .
43010002	He that goeth in by ye dore is the shepeherde of ye shepe :
43010003	to him the porter openeth and the shepe heare his voyce and he calleth his awne shepe by name and leadeth them out .
43010004	And when he hath sent forthe his awne shepe he goeth before them and the shepe folowe him : for they knowe his voyce .
43010005	A straunger they will not folowe but will flye from him : for they knowe not the voyce of straungers .
43010006	This similitude spake Iesus vnto them . But they vnderstode not what thinges they were which he spake vnto them .
43010007	Then sayde Iesus vnto them agayne . Verely verely I saye vnto you : I am the dore of the shepe .
43010008	All even as many as came before me are theves and robbers : but the shepe dyd not heare them .
43010009	I am the dore : by me yf eny man enter in he shalbe safe and shall goo in and out and fynde pasture .
43010010	The thefe cometh not but forto steale kyll and destroye . I am come that they myght have lyfe and have it more aboundantly .
43010011	I am ye good shepeheerd . The good shepeheerd geveth his lyfe for ye shepe .
43010012	An heyred servaut which is not ye shepeherd nether ye shepe are his awne seith the wolfe comynge and leveth the shepe and flyeth and the wolfe catcheth them and scattereth ye shepe .
43010013	The heyred servaut flyeth because he is an heyred servaunt and careth not for the shepe .
43010014	I am that good shepeheerd and knowe myne and am knowe of myne .
43010015	As my father knoweth me : even so knowe I my father . And I geve my lyfe for the shepe :
43010016	and other shepe I have which are not of this folde . Them also must I bringe that they maye heare my voyce and that ther maye be one flocke and one shepeherde .
43010017	Therfore doth my father love me because I put my lyfe from me that I myght take it agayne .
43010018	No man taketh it from me : but I put it awaye of my selfe . I have power to put it from me and have power to take it agayne : This comaundment have I receaved of my father .
43010019	And ther was a dissencion agayne amoge the Iewes for these sayinges
43010020	and many of them sayd . He hath the devyll and is mad : why heare ye him ?
43010021	Other sayde these are not the wordes of him that hath the devyll . Can the devyll open the eyes of the blynde ?
43010022	And it was at Ierusalem ye feaste of the dedicacion and it was wynter :
43010023	and Iesus walked in Salomons porche .
43010024	Then came the Iewes rounde aboute him and sayde vnto him : How longe dost thou make vs doute ? Yf thou be Christ tell vs playnly .
43010025	Iesus answered them : I tolde you and ye beleve not . The workes yt I do in my fathers name they beare witnes of me .
43010026	But ye beleve not because ye are not of my shepe . As I sayde vnto you :
43010027	my shepe heare my voyce and I knowe them and they folowe me
43010028	and I geve vnto the eternall lyfe and they shall never perisshe nether shall eny man plucke the oute of my honde .
43010029	My father which gave the me is greatter then all and no man is able to take them out of my fathers honde .
43010030	And I and my father are one .
43010031	Then the Iewes agayne toke up stones to stone him with all .
43010032	Iesus answered them : many good workes have I shewed you from my father : for which of them will ye stone me ?
43010033	The Iewes answered him sayinge . For thy good workes sake we stone ye not : but for thy blasphemy and because that thou beinge a man makest thy selfe God .
43010034	Iesus answered them : Is it not written in youre lawe : I saye ye are goddes ?
43010035	If he called the goddes vnto whom the worde of God was spoken ( and the scripture can not be broken )
43010036	saye ye then to him whom the father hath sainctified and sent into the worlde thou blasphemest because I sayd I am the sonne of God ?
43010037	If I do not the workes of my father beleve me not .
43010038	But if I do though ye beleve not me yet beleve the workes that ye maye knowe and beleve that the father is in me and I in him .
43010039	Agayne they went aboute to take him : but he escaped out of their hondes
43010040	and went awaye agayne beyonde Iordan into the place where Iohn before had baptised and there aboode .
43010041	And many resorted vnto him and sayd . Iohn dyd no miracle : but all thinges that Iohn spake of this man are true .
43010042	And many beleved on him theare .
43011001	A certayne man was sicke named Lazarus of Bethania the toune of Mary and her sister Martha .
43011002	It was that Mary which annoynted Iesus with oyntment and wyped his fete with her heere whose brother Lazarus was sicke
43011003	and his sisters sent vnto him sayinge . Lorde behold he whom thou lovest is sicke .
43011004	When Iesus hearde yt he sayd : this infirmite is not vnto deth but for ye laude of God that the sonne of God myght be praysed by the reason of it .
43011005	Iesus loved Martha and her sister and Lazarus .
43011006	After he hearde that he was sicke then aboode he two dayes still in the same place where he was .
43011007	Then after that sayd he to his disciples : let us goo into Iewry agayne .
43011008	His disciples sayde vnto him . Master the Iewes lately sought meanes to stone the and wilt thou goo thyther agayne ?
43011009	Iesus answered : are ther not twelve houres in ye daye ? Yf a man walke in ye daye he stombleth not because he seith the lyght of this worlde .
43011010	But yf a ma walke in ye nyght he stombleth because ther is no lyght in him .
43011011	This sayde he and after yt he sayde vnto the : oure frende Lazarus slepeth but I goo to wake him out of slepe .
43011012	Then sayde his disciples : Lorde yf he slepe he shall do well ynough .
43011013	How be it Iesus spake of his deeth : but they thought yt he had spoke of ye naturall slepe .
43011014	Then sayde Iesus vnto the playnly Lazarus is deed
43011015	and I am glad for youre sakes yt I was not there because ye maye beleve . Neverthelesse let vs go vnto him .
43011016	Then sayde Thomas which is called Dydimus vnto ye disciples : let vs also goo that we maye dye wt him
43011017	Then went Iesus and founde that he had lyne in his grave foure dayes already .
43011018	Bethanie was nye vnto Ierusalem aboute . xv . furlonges of
43011019	and many of the Iewes were come to Martha and Mary to comforte them over their brother .
43011020	Martha assone as she hearde yt Iesus was comynge went and met him : but Mary sate still in the housse .
43011021	Then sayde Martha vnto Iesus : Lorde yf thou haddest bene here my brother had not bene deed :
43011022	but neverthelesse I knowe that whatsoever thou axest of God God will geve it the .
43011023	Iesus sayde vnto her : Thy brother shall ryse agayne .
43011024	Martha sayde vnto him : I knowe that he shall ryse agayne in the resurreccion at the last daye .
43011025	Iesus sayde vnto her : I am the resurreccion and the lyfe : He that beleveth on me ye though he were deed yet shall he lyve .
43011026	And whosoever lyveth and belevest on me shall never dye . Beleveth thou this ?
43011027	She sayde vnto him : ye Lorde I beleve that thou arte Christ the sonne of god which shuld come into the worlde .
43011028	And assone as she had so sayde she went her waye and called Marie her sister secretly sayinge : The master is come and calleth for the
43011029	And she assone as she hearde that arose quickly and came vnto him .
43011030	Iesus was not yet come into the toune : but was in the place where Martha met him .
43011031	The Iewes then which were with her in the housse and comforted her when they sawe Mary that she rose vp hastely and went out folowed her saying : She goeth vnto the grave to wepe there .
43011032	Then when Mary was come where Iesus was and sawe him she fell doune at his fete sayinge vnto him : Lorde yf thou haddest bene here my brother had not bene deed .
43011033	When Iesus sawe her wepe and ye Iewes also wepe which came wt her he groned in ye sprete and was troubled in him selfe
43011034	and sayde : Where have ye layed him ? They sayde vnto him : Lorde come and se .
43011035	And Iesus wept .
43011036	Then sayde the Iewes : Beholde howe he loved him .
43011037	And some of the sayde : coulde not he which openned the eyes of the blynde have made also that this man shuld not have dyed ?
43011038	Iesus agayne groned in him selfe and came to the grave . It was a caue and a stone layde on it .
43011039	And Iesus sayd : take ye awaye the stone . Martha the sister of him that was deed sayd vnto him : Lorde by this tyme he stinketh . For he hath bene deed foure dayes :
43011040	Iesus sayde vnto her : Sayde I not vnto the yt if thou didest beleve thou shuldest se ye glory of God .
43011041	Then they toke awaye ye stone from ye place where the deed was layde . And Iesus lyfte vp his eyes and sayde : Father I thanke the because that thou hast hearde me .
43011042	I wot that thou hearest me all wayes : but because of the people that stonde by I sayde it yt they maye beleve that thou hast sent me .
43011043	And when he thus had spoken he cryed wt a loud voyce . Lazarus come forthe .
43011044	And he that was deed came forth bounde hand and fote with grave bondes and his face was bounde with a napkin . Iesus sayde vnto the : loowse him and let him goo .
43011045	Then many of the Iewes which came to Mary and had sene the thinges which Iesus dyd beleved on him .
43011046	But some of them went their wayes to the Pharises and tolde them what Iesus had done .
43011047	Then gadered the hye prestes and the Pharises a counsell and sayde : what do we ? This ma doeth many miracles .
43011048	Yf we let him scape thus all men will beleve on him and ye Romaynes shall come and take awaye oure countre and the people .
43011049	And one of them named Cayphas which was the hieprest yt same yeare sayde vnto them : Ye perceave nothinge at all
43011050	nor yet consider that it is expedient for vs that one man dye for the people and not that all the people perisshe .
43011051	This spake he not of him selfe but beinge hye preste that same yeare he prophesied that Iesus shulde dye for the people
43011052	and not for the people only but that he shuld gader to geder in one the chyldren of God which were scattered abroode .
43011053	From that daye forth they held a counsell to geder for to put him to deeth .
43011054	Iesus therfore walked no more opely amoge the Iewes : but wet his waye thence vnto a coutre nye to a wildernes into a cite called Ephraim and there hauted with his disciples .
43011055	And the Iewes ester was nye at hand and many went out of the countre vp to Ierusalem before the ester to purify them selves .
43011056	Then sought they for Iesus and spake bitwene the selves as they stode in the teple : What thinke ye seynge he cometh not to the feast .
43011057	The hye prestes and Pharises had geven a comaundemet that yf eny man knew where he were he shuld shewe it that they myght take him .
43012001	Then Iesus sixe dayes before ester came to Bethany where Lazarus was which was deed and who Iesus raysed from deeth .
43012002	There they made him a supper and Martha served : But Lazarus was one of them that sate at the table with him .
43012003	Then toke Mary a pounde of oyntmet called Nardus perfecte and precious and anoynted Iesus fete and wipt his fete with her heer and the housse was filled of the savre of the oyntmet .
43012004	Then sayde one of his disciples name Iudas Iscariot Simos sonne which afterwarde betrayed him :
43012005	why was not this oyntmet solde for thre hondred pence and geve to the poore ?
43012006	This sayde he not that he cared for the pooer : but because he was a thefe and kept the bagge and bare that which was geven .
43012007	Then sayde Iesus : Let her alone agaynst the daye of my buryinge she kept it .
43012008	The poore all wayes shall ye have with you but me shall ye not all wayes have .
43012009	Moche people of the Iewes had knowledge that he was there . And they came not for Iesus sake only but yt they myght se Lazarus also whom he raysed from deeth .
43012010	The hye prestes therfore held a counsell that they myght put Lazarus to deeth also
43012011	because that for his sake many of the Iewes went awaye and beleved on Iesus .
43012012	On the morowe moche people that were come to the feast when they hearde yt Iesus shuld come to Ierusalem
43012013	toke braunches of palme trees and went and met him and cryed : Hosanna blessed is he that in the name of the Lorde commeth kynge of Israel .
43012014	And Iesus got a yonge asse and sate thero accordinge to that which was writte :
43012015	feare not doughter of Sio beholde thy kynge cometh sittinge on an asses coolte .
43012016	These thinges vnderstode not his disciples at ye fyrst : but when Iesus was gloryfied then remembryd they that soche thinges were written of him and that soche thinges they had done vnto him .
43012017	The people that was with him when he called Lazarus out of his grave and raysed him from deeth bare recorde .
43012018	Therfore met him the people be cause they hearde yt he had done soche a myracle .
43012019	The Pharises therfore sayde amonge them selves : perceave ye how we prevayle no thinge ? beholde the worlde goth awaye after him .
43012020	Ther were certayne Grekes amoge them that came to praye at the feast :
43012021	the same cam to Philip which was of Bethsayda a cyte in Galile and desired him sayinge : Syr we wolde fayne se Iesus .
43012022	Philip came and tolde Andrew . And agayne Andrew and Philip tolde Iesus .
43012023	And Iesus answered them sayinge : the houre is come yt the sonne of ma must be glorified .
43012024	Verely verely I saye vnto you except ye wheate corne fall into the grounde and dye it bydeth alone . Yf it dye it brengeth forth moche frute .
43012025	He that loveth his lyfe shall destroye it : and he yt hateth his lyfe in this worlde shall kepe it vnto lyfe eternall .
43012026	If eny man mynister vnto me let him folowe me and where I am there shall also my minister be . And yf eny man minister vnto me him will my father honoure .
43012027	Now is my soule troubled and what shall I saye ? Father delyver me from this houre : but therfore came I vnto this houre
43012028	Father glorify thy name . Then came ther a voyce fro heaven : I have glorified it and will glorify it agayne .
43012029	Then sayd the people yt stode by and hearde : it thoundreth . Other sayde an angell spake to him .
43012030	Iesus answered and sayde : this voyce cam not because of me but for youre sakes .
43012031	Now is the iudgement of this worlde : now shall ye prince of this worlde be cast out .
43012032	And I yf I were lifte vp from the erthe will drawe all men vnto me .
43012033	This sayde Iesus signifyinge what deeth he shuld dye .
43012034	The people answered him : We have hearde of ye lawe yt Christ bydeth ever : and how sayest thou then that the sonne of man must be lifte vp ? who is yt sonne of ma ?
43012035	Then Iesus sayde vnto them : yet a lytell whyle is the light wt you . Walke whill ye have light lest the darcknes come on you . He that walketh in the darke wotteth not whither he goeth .
43012036	Whyll ye have light beleve on the light that ye maye be the chyldren of light . These thinges spake Iesus and departed and hyd him silfe fro them .
43012037	And though he had done so many myracles before them yet beleved not they on him
43012038	yt the sayinge of Esayas the Prophet myght be fulfilled yt he spake . Lorde who shall beleve oure sayinge ? And to whom ys the arme of ye Lorde opened ?
43012039	Therfore coulde they not beleve because yt Esaias sayth agayne :
43012040	he hath blinded their eyes and hardened their hertes that they shuld not se with their eyes and vnderstonde with their hertes and shuld be converted and I shuld heale the .
43012041	Soche thinges sayde Esaias when he sawe his glory and spake of him .
43012042	Neverthelesse amoge ye chefe rulers many beleved on him . But because of the pharises they wolde not be a knowen of it lest they shuld be excommunicate .
43012043	For they loved the prayse yt is geven of men more then the prayse that cometh of God .
43012044	And Iesus cryed and sayde : he that beleveth on me beleveth not on me but on him yt sent me .
43012045	And he that seeth me seeth him that sent me .
43012046	I am come a light into the worlde that whosoever beleveth on me shuld not byde in darcknes .
43012047	And yf eny man heare my wordes and beleve not I iudge him not . For I came not to iudge the worlde : but to save ye worlde .
43012048	He that refuseth me and receaveth not my wordes hath one that iudgeth him . The wordes that I have spoken they shall iudge him in ye last daye .
43012049	For I have not spoken of my selfe : but the father which sent me he gave me a commaundemet what I shuld saye and what I shuld speake .
43012050	And I knowe that this comaundement is lyfe everlastinge . Whatsoever I speake therfore eve as the father bade me so I speake .
43013001	Before the feast of ester whe Iesus knewe that his houre was come that he shuld departe out of this worlde vnto the father . When he loved his which were in the worlde vnto the ende he loved the .
43013002	And when supper was ended after that the devyll had put in the hert of Iudas Iscariot Simos sonne to betraye him :
43013003	Iesus knowinge that the father had geve all thinges into his hondes . And that he was come from God and went to God
43013004	he rose from supper and layde a syde his vpper garmentes and toke a towell and gyrd him selfe .
43013005	After that poured he water into a basyn and beganne to wash his disciples fete and to wype them with the towell wherwith he was gyrde .
43013006	Then came he to Simon Peter . And Peter sayde to him : Lorde shalt thou wesshe my fete ?
43013007	Iesus answered and sayde vnto him : what I do thou wotest not now but thou shalt knowe herafter .
43013008	Peter sayd vnto him : thou shalt not wesshe my fete whill ye worlde stondeth . Iesus answered him : yf I wasshe ye not thou shalt have no part with me .
43013009	Simon Peter sayde vnto him : Lorde not my fete only : but also my handes and my heed .
43013010	Iesus sayde to him : he that is wesshed nedeth not save to wesshe his fete and is clene every whit . And ye are clene : but not all .
43013011	For he knewe his betrayer . Therfore sayde he : ye are not all clene .
43013012	After he had wesshed their fete and receaved his clothes and was set doune agayne he sayde vnto them ? wot ye what I have done to you ?
43013013	Ye call me master and Lorde and ye saye well for so am I .
43013014	If I then youre Lorde and master have wesshed youre fete ye also ought to wesshe one anothers fete .
43013015	For I have geven you an ensample that ye shuld do as I have done to you .
43013016	Verely verely I saye vnto you the servaunt is not greater then his master nether the messenger greater then he that sent him .
43013017	If ye vnderstonde these thinges happy are ye yf ye do them .
43013018	I speake not of you all I knowe whom I have chosen . But that ye scripture be fulfilled : he that eateth breed wt me hath lyfte vp his hele agaynste me .
43013019	Now tell I you before it come : that when it is come to passe ye might beleve that I am he .
43013020	Verely verely I saye vnto you . He that receaveth who soever I sende receaveth me . And he that receaveth me receaveth him that sent me .
43013021	When Iesus had thus sayd he was troubled in the sprete and testified sayinge : verely verely I saye vnto you that one of you shall betraye me .
43013022	And then the disciples loked one on another doutinge of who he spake .
43013023	Ther was one of his disciples which leaned on Iesus bosome whom Iesus loved .
43013024	To him beckened Simo Peter that he shuld axe who it was of whom he spake .
43013025	He then as he leaned on Iesus brest sayde vnto him : Lorde who ys it ?
43013026	Iesus answered he yt ys to whom I geve a soppe when I have dept it . And he wet a soppe and gave it to Iudas Iscarioth Simons sonne .
43013027	And after the soppe Satan entred into him . Then sayd Iesus vnto him : that thou dost do quickly .
43013028	That wist no ma at the table for what intent he spake vnto him .
43013029	Some of the thought because Iudas had the bagge that Iesus had sayd vnto him bye those thinges that we have nede af agaynst ye feast : or that he shulde geve some thinge to the poore .
43013030	Assone then as he had receaved the soppe he wet immediatly out . And it was night .
43013031	Whe he was gone out Iesus sayde : now is the sonne of man glorified . And God is glorified by him .
43013032	Yf God be glorified by him God shall also glorify him in him selfe : and shall strayght waye glorify him .
43013033	Deare chyldren yet a lytell whyle am I with you . Ye shall seke me and as I sayde vnto the Iewes whither I goo thither can ye not come . Also to you saye I nowe .
43013034	A newe commaundment geve I vnto you that ye love to gedder as I have loved you that even so ye love one another .
43013035	By this shall all me knowe yt ye are my disciples yf ye shall have love one to another .
43013036	Simon Peter sayd vnto him : Lorde whither goest thou ? Iesus answered him : whither I goo thou canst not folowe me now but thou shalt folowe me afterwardes .
43013037	Peter sayd vnto him : Lorde why canot I folowe the now ? I will geve my lyfe for thy sake ?
43013038	Iesus answered him : wilt thou geve thy lyfe for my sake ? Verely verely I saye vnto the the cocke shall not crowe tyll thou have denyed me thryse .
43014001	And he sayd vnto his disciples : Let not youre hertes be troubled . Beleve in god and beleve in me .
43014002	In my fathers housse are many mansions . If it were not so I wolde have tolde you . I go to prepare a place for you .
43014003	And yf I go to prepare a place for you I will come agayne and receave you eve vnto my selfe yt where I am there maye ye be also .
43014004	And whither I go ye knowe and ye waye ye knowe .
43014005	Thomas sayde vnto him : Lorde we knowe not whyther thou goest . Also how is it possible for vs to knowe the waye ?
43014006	Iesus sayd vnto him : I am ye waye ye truthe and ye life . And no man cometh vnto the father but by me .
43014007	Yf ye had knowe me ye had knowe my father also . And now ye knowe him and have sene him .
43014008	Philip sayd vnto him : Lorde shew vs the father and it suffiseth vs .
43014009	Iesus sayde vnto him : have I bene so longe tyme wt you : and yet hast thou not knowen me ? Philip he yt hath sene me hath sene ye father . And how sayest thou then : shew vs the father ?
43014010	Belevest thou not that I am in ye father and the father in me ? The wordes that I speake vnto you I speakee not of my selfe : but ye father that dwelleth in me is he that doeth ye workes .
43014011	Beleve me that I am the father and ye father in me . At the leest beleve me for the very workes sake .
43014012	Verely verely I saye vnto you : he that beleveth on me the workes that I doo the same shall he do and greater workes then these shall he do because I go vnto my father .
43014013	And what soever ye axe in my name yt will I do yt the father might be glorified by the sonne .
43014014	Yf ye shall axe eny thige in my name I will do it
43014015	If ye love me kepe my comaundementes
43014016	and I will praye the father and he shall geve you a nother comforter yt he maye byde with you ever
43014017	which is the sprete of truthe whome the worlde canot receave because the worlde seyth him not nether knoweth him . But ye knowe him . For he dwelleth with you and shalbe in you .
43014018	I will not leave you comfortlesse : but will come vnto you .
43014019	Yet a litell whyle and the worlde seith me no moare : but ye shall se me . For I live and ye shall live .
43014020	That daye shall ye knowe that I am in my father and you in me and I in you
43014021	He that hath my comaundemetes and kepeth them the same is he that loveth me . And he yt loveth me shall be loved of my father : and I will love him and will shewe myne awne selfe vnto him .
43014022	Iudas sayde vnto him ( not Iudas Iscarioth ) Lorde what is the cause that thou wilt shewe thy selfe vnto vs and not vnto the worlde ?
43014023	Iesus answered and sayde vnto him : yf a man love me and wyll kepe my sayinges my father also will love him and we will come vnto him and will dwelle with him .
43014024	He that loveth me not kepeth not my sayinges . And the wordes which ye heare are not myne but the fathers which sent me .
43014025	This have I spoken vnto you beynge yet present with you .
43014026	But that coforter which is the holy gost ( whom my father will sende in my name ) he shall teache you all thinges and bringe all thinges to youre remembraunce whatsoever I have tolde you .
43014027	Peace I leve with you my peace I geve vnto you . Not as the worlde geveth geve I vnto you . Let not youre hertes be greved nether feare ye .
43014028	Ye have hearde how I sayde vnto you : I go and come agayne vnto you . If ye loved me ye wolde verely reioyce because I sayde I go vnto ye father . For ye father is greater then I
43014029	And now have I shewed you before it come yt whe it is come to passe ye might beleve .
43014030	Here after will I not talke many mordes vnto you . For the rular of this worlde commeth and hath nought in me .
43014031	But that the worlde maye knowe that I love the father : therfore as the father gave me comaundment even so do I . Ryse let vs go hence .
43015001	I am the true vyne and my father ys an husbande man .
43015002	Every braunche that beareth not frute in me he will take awaye . And every braunche that beareth frute will he pourge yt it maye bringe moare frute .
43015003	Now are ye cleane thorow ye wordes which I have spoke vnto you .
43015004	Byde in me and let me byde in you . As ye braunche canot beare frute of it sylfe excepte it byde in the vyne : no more can ye excepte ye abyde in me .
43015005	I am the vyne and ye are the braunches . He that abydeth in me and I in him the same bringeth forth moche frute . For with out me can ye do nothinge .
43015006	Yf a man byde not in me he ys cast forthe as a braunche and is wyddered : and men gadder it and cast it into the fyre and it burneth .
43015007	Yf ye byde in me and my wordes also byde in you : axe what ye will and it shalbe done to you .
43015008	Heare in is my father glorified that ye beare moche frute and be made my disciples .
43015009	As the father hath loved me eve so have I leved you . Continue in my love .
43015010	Yf ye shall kepe my comaudemetes ye shall byde in my love eve as I have kept my fathers comaundementes and byde in his love .
43015011	These thinges have I spoken vnto you yt my ioye myght remayne in you and that youre ioye might be full .
43015012	This is my commaundement that ye love togedder as I have loved you .
43015013	Gretter love then this hath no man then that a man bestowe his lyfe for his frendes .
43015014	Ye are my fredes yf ye do whatsoever I commaunde you .
43015015	Hence forth call I you not servauntes : for the servaunt knoweth not what his Lorde doeth . But you have I called frendes : for all thinges that I have hearde of my father I have opened to you .
43015016	Ye have not chosen me but I have chosen you and ordeyned you that ye go and bringe forthe frute and that youre frute remayne that whatsoever ye shall axe of the father in my name he shulde geve it you .
43015017	This comaunde I you that ye love to gedder .
43015018	Yf ye worlde hate you ye knowe that he hated me before he hated you .
43015019	Yf ye were of the worlde ye worlde wolde love his awne . How be it because ye are not of ye worlde but I have chosen you out of the worlde therfore hateth you the worlde .
43015020	Remember the sayinge that I sayde vnto you : the servaute is not greater then his lorde . Yf they have persecuted me so will they persecute you Yf they have kept my sayinge so will they kepe youres .
43015021	But all these thinges will they do vnto you for my names sake because they have not knowen him that sent me .
43015022	If I had not come and spoken vnto them they shulde not have had synne : but now have they nothinge to cloke their synne with all .
43015023	He that hateth me hateth my father .
43015024	If I had not done workes amoge the which none other ma dyd they had not had synne . But now have they sene and yet have hated bothe me and my father :
43015025	eve that the sayinge myght be fulfilled that is written in theyr lawe : they hated me wtout a cause .
43015026	But when the comforter is come whom I will sende vnto you fro the father which is the sprete of truthe which proceadeth of the father he shall testifie of me .
43015027	And ye shall beare witnes also because ye have bene with me from the begynninge .
43016001	These thinges have I sayde vnto you because ye shuld not be offended .
43016002	They shall excomunicat you : ye ye tyme shall come that whosoever killeth you will thinke that he doth God service .
43016003	And suche thinges will they do vnto you because they have not knowen the father nether yet me .
43016004	But these thinges have I tolde you that when that houre is come ye myght remember them that I tolde you so . These thinges sayde I not unto you at the begynninge because I was present with you .
43016005	But now I goo my waye to him that sent me and none of you axeth me : whither goest thou ?
43016006	But because I have sayde suche thinges vnto you youre hertes are full of sorowe .
43016007	Neverthelesse I tell you the trueth it is expedient for you that I goo awaye . For yf I goo not awaye that comforter will not come vnto you . But yf I departe I will sende him vnto you .
43016008	And when he is come he will rebuke ye worlde of synne and of rightwesnes and of iudgement .
43016009	Of synne because they beleve not on me :
43016010	Of rightwesnes because I go to my father and ye shall se me no moare :
43016011	and of iudgement because the chefe ruler of this worlde is iudged all ready .
43016012	I have yet many thinges to saye vnto you : but ye canot beare them awaye now .
43016013	How be it when he is come ( I meane the sprete of truthe ) he will leade yon into all trueth . He shall not speake of him selfe : but whatsoever he shall heare that shall he speake and he will shewe you thinges to come .
43016014	He shall glorify me for he shall receave of myne and shall shewe vnto you .
43016015	All thinges that ye father hath aremyne . Therfore sayd I vnto you that he shall take of myne and shewe vnto you .
43016016	After a whyle ye shall not se me and agayne after a whyle ye shall se me : For I goo to the father .
43016017	Then sayd some of his disciples bitwene them selves : what is this yt he sayth vnto vs after a whyle ye shall not se me and agayne after a whyle ye shall se me : and that I go to the father .
43016018	They sayd therfore : what is this that he sayth after a whyle ? we canot tell what he sayth .
43016019	Iesus perceaved yt they wolde axe him and sayd vnto them : This is it that ye enquyre of bitwene youre selves that I sayd after a whyle ye shall not se me and agayne after a whyle ye shall se me .
43016020	Verely verely I saye vnto you : ye shall wepe and lamet and the worlde shall reioyce . Ye shall sorowe : but youre sorowe shalbe tourned to ioye .
43016021	A woman when she traveyleth hath sorowe because her houre is come : but assone as she is delivered of the chylde she remembreth no moare the anguysshe for ioye that a man is borne in to the worlde .
43016022	And ye now are in sorowe : but I will se you agayne and youre hertes shall reioyce and youre ioye shall no ma take fro you .
43016023	And in that daye shall ye axe me no question . Verely verely I saye vnto you whatsoever ye shall axe the father in my name he will geve it you .
43016024	Hitherto have ye axed nothinge in my name . Axe and ye shall receave it : that youre ioye maye be full .
43016025	These thinges have I spoken vnto you in proverbes . The tyme will come when I shall no moare speake to you in proverbes : but I shall shewe you playnly from my father .
43016026	At that daye shall ye axe in myne name . And I saye not vnto you that I will speake vnto my father for you
43016027	For ye father him selfe loveth you because ye have loved me and have beleved that I came out from God .
43016028	I went out from the father and came into the worlde : and I leve the worlde agayne and go to ye father .
43016029	His disciples sayd vnto him : loo now speakest thou playnly and thou vsest no proverbe .
43016030	Nowe knowe we that thou vnderstondest all thinges and nedest not yt eny man shuld axe the eny question . Therfore beleve we that thou camst fro god .
43016031	Iesus answered them : Now ye do beleve .
43016032	Beholde ye houre draweth nye and is already come yt ye shalbe scatered every man his wayes and shall leave me alone . And yet am I not alone . For ye father is with me .
43016033	These wordes have I spoke vnto you yt in me ye might have peace . For in ye worlde shall ye have tribulacio : but be of good cheare I have over come the worlde .
43017001	These wordes spake Iesus and lyfte vp his eyes to heven and sayde : father the houre is come : glorify thy sonne that thy sonne maye glorify the :
43017002	as thou hast geve him power over all fleshe that he shuld geve eternall lyfe to as many as thou hast geven him .
43017003	This is lyfe eternall that they myght knowe the that only very God and whom thou hast sent Iesus Christ .
43017004	I have glorified ye on the erth . I have fynysshed ye worke which thou gavest me to do .
43017005	And now glorify me thou father wt thyn awne selfe with the glory which I had with ye yerre ye worlde was .
43017006	I have declared thy name vnto ye men which thou gavest me out of the worlde . Thyne they were and thou gavest them me and they have kept thy sayinges .
43017007	Now they knowe that all thinges whatsoever thou hast geven me are of the .
43017008	For I have geven vnto them the wordes which thou gavest me and they have receaved them and knowe surely that I came out from the : and doo beleve that thou dyddest send me .
43017009	I praye for them and praye not for the worlde : but for the which thou hast geve me for they are thyne .
43017010	And all myne are thyne and thyne are myne and I am glorified in the .
43017011	And now am I no moare in the worlde but they are in the worlde and I come to ye . Wholy father kepe in thyne awne name the which thou hast geven me that they maye be one as we are .
43017012	Whyll I was with the in ye worlde I kepte the in thy name . Those yt thou gavest me have I kepte and none of the is lost but that lost chylde that the scripture myght be fulfilled .
43017013	Now come I to the and these wordes speake I in the worlde that they myght have my ioye full in the .
43017014	I have geven them thy wordes and the worlde hath hated them because they are not of the worlde even as I am not of the worlde .
43017015	I desyre not that thou shuldest take the out of the worlde : but that thou kepe them from evyll .
43017016	They are not of the worlde as I am not of the worlde .
43017017	Sanctify the wt thy truth . Thy sayinge is truth .
43017018	As thou dyddest send me into the worlde even so have I sent them into the worlde
43017019	and for their sakes sanctify I my selfe that they also myght be sanctified thorowe the trueth .
43017020	I praye not for them alone : but for them also which shall beleve on me thorowe their preachynge
43017021	that they all maye be one as thou father arte in me and I in the that they maye be also one in vs that the worlde maye beleve that thou hast sent me .
43017022	And that glory that thou gavest me I have geven them that they maye be one as we are wone .
43017023	I in them and thou in me that they maye be made perfecte in one and that the worlde maye knowe that thou hast sent me and hast loved them as thou hast loved me .
43017024	Father I will that they which thou hast geven me be with me where I am that they maye se my glory which thou hast geven me . For thou lovedest me before the makynge of the worlde .
43017025	O ryghteous father ye very worlde hath not knowen the : but I have knowen the and these have knowen that thou hast sent me .
43017026	And I have declared vnto them thy name and will declare it that the love wher wt thou hast loved me be in them and that I be in them .
43018001	When Iesus had spoken these wordes he wet forth with his disciples over the broke Cedron where was a garden into the which he entred with his disciples .
43018002	Iudas also which betrayed him knewe the place : for Iesus ofte tymes resorted thyther with his disciples .
43018003	Iudas then after he had receaved abonde of men and ministres of the hye Prestes and Pharises came thyther with lanterns and fyerbrondes and wepens .
43018004	Then Iesus knowynge all thinges that shuld come on him went forth and sayde vnto them : whom seke ye ?
43018005	They answered him : Iesus of Nazareth . Iesus sayde vnto them : I am he . Iudas also which betrayed him stode with them .
43018006	But assone as he had sayd vnto them I am he they went backe wardes and fell to the grounde .
43018007	And he axed the agayne : whome seke ye ? They sayde : Iesus of Nazareth .
43018008	Iesus answered I sayde vnto you I am he . If ye seke me let these goo their waye .
43018009	That ye sayinge might be fulfilled which he spake : of the which thou gavest me have I not lost one .
43018010	Simon Peter had a swearde and drue it and smote the hye prestes servaunt and cut of his ryght eare . The servauntes name was Malchas .
43018011	Then sayde Iesus vnto Peter : put vp thy swearde into ye sheath : shall I not drinke of ye cup which my father hath geven me ?
43018012	Then the copany and the captayne and the ministres of of the Iewes toke Iesus and bounde him
43018013	and led him awaye to Anna fyrst : For he was fatherelawe vnto Cayphas which was ye hye preste that same yeare .
43018014	Cayphas was he that gave counsell to ye Iewes that it was expediet that one man shuld dye for the people .
43018015	And Simon Peter folowed Iesus and another disciple : that disciple was knowen of ye hye preste and went in with Iesus into the pallys of the hye preste .
43018016	But Peter stode at the dore with out . Then went out that other disciple which was knowen vnto the hye preste and spake to the damsell that kept the dore and brought in Peter .
43018017	Then sayde ye damsell that kept the dore vnto Peter : Arte not thou one of this mannes disciples ? He sayde : I am not .
43018018	The servauntes and the ministres stode there and had made a fyre of coles : for it was colde : and they warmed them selves . Peter also stode amonge them and warmed him selfe .
43018019	The hye preste axed Iesus of his disciples and of his doctrine .
43018020	Iesus answered him : I spake openly in ye worlde . I ever taught in ye synagoge and in the temple whyther all ye Iewes resorted and in secrete have I sayde nothynge :
43018021	Why axest thou me ? Axe them whiche hearde me what I sayde vnto the . Beholde they can tell what I sayde .
43018022	Whe he had thus spoken one of ye ministres which stode by smote Iesus on the face sayinge : answerest thou the hyepreste so ?
43018023	Iesus answered him . If I have evyll spoke beare witnes of ye evyll : yf I have well spoke why smytest thou me ?
43018024	And Annas sent him bounde vnto Caiphas ye hye preste .
43018025	Simon Peter stode and warmed him selfe . And they sayde vnto him : arte not thou also one of his disciples ? He denyed it and sayde : I am not .
43018026	One of the servauntes of the hye preste ( his cosyn whose eare Peter smote of ) sayde vnto him : dyd not I se the in the garden with him ?
43018027	Peter denyed it agayne : and immediatly the cocke crewe .
43018028	Then led they Iesus fro Cayphas into the hall of iudgement . It was in the mornynge and they them selves went not into the iudgement hall lest they shuld be defyled but that they myght eate the paschall lambe .
43018029	Pylate then went out vnto the and sayde : what accusacion bringe ye agaynste this man ?
43018030	They answered and sayd vnto him . If he were not an evyll doar we wolde not have delyvered him vnto the .
43018031	Then sayd Pylate vnto the : take ye him and iudge him after youre awne lawe . Then the Iewes sayde vnto him . It is not lawfull for vs to put eny ma to deeth .
43018032	That ye wordes of Iesus myght be fulfilled which he spake signifyinge what deeth he shuld dye .
43018033	Then Pylate entred into the iudgemet hall agayne and called Iesus and sayd vnto him : arte thou the kynge of ye Iewes ?
43018034	Iesus answered : sayst thou that of thy selfe or dyd other tell it the of me ?
43018035	Pylate answered : Am I a Iewe ? Thyne awne nacion and hye prestes have delyvered ye vnto me . What hast thou done ?
43018036	Iesus answered : my kyngdome is not of this worlde . Yf my kyngdome were of this worlde then wolde my ministres suerly fight yt I shuld not be delyvered to ye Iewes but now is my kyngdome not fro hence .
43018037	Pylate sayde vnto him : Arte thou a kynge then ? Iesus answered : Thou sayst yt I am a kynge . For this cause was I borne and for this cause came I into ye worlde yt I shuld beare witnes vnto the trueth . And all that are of ye trueth heare my voyce .
43018038	Pilate sayde vnto him : what thinge is trueth ? And when he had sayd yt he went out agayne vnto the Iewes and sayde vnto them : I fynde in him no cause at all .
43018039	Ye have a custome that I shuld delyver you one lowsse at ester . Will ye that I lowse vnto you the kynge of ye Iewes .
43018040	Then cryed they all agayne sayinge : Not him but Barrabas that Barrabas was a robber .
43019001	Then Pylate toke Iesus and scourged him .
43019002	And ye soudiers wounde a croune of thornes and put it on his heed . And they dyd on him a purple garment
43019003	and sayd : hayll kynge of the Iewes : and they smote him on the face .
43019004	Pylate went forthe agayne and sayde vnto them : beholde I bringe him forth to you that ye maye knowe that I fynde no faute in him .
43019005	Then came Iesus forthe wearynge a croune of thorne and a robe of purple . And Pylate sayd vnto them : beholde ye man .
43019006	When the hye Prestes and ministres sawe him they cryed sayinge : crucify him crucify him . Pylate sayde vnto them . Take ye him and crucify him : for I fynde no cause in him .
43019007	The Iewes answered him . We have a lawe and by oure lawe he ought to dye : because he made him selfe the sonne of God .
43019008	When Pylate hearde that sayinge he was the moare afrayde
43019009	and went agayne into ye iudgment hall and sayde vnto Iesus : whence arte thou ? But Iesus gave him none answere .
43019010	Then sayde Pylate vnto him . Speakest thou not vnto me ? knowest thou not that I have power to crucify the and have power to lowse the ?
43019011	Iesus answered : Thou couldest have no power at all agaynst me except it were geven the from above . Therfore he yt delyvered me vnto the is moare in synne .
43019012	And from thence forthe sought Pylate meanes to lowse him : but the Iewes cryed sayinge : yf thou let him goo thou arte not Cesars frende . For whosoever maketh hi selfe a kynge is agaynst Cesar
43019013	When Pylate hearde yt sayinge he brought Iesus forthe and sate doune to geve sentece in a place called the pavement : but in the Hebrue tonge Gabbatha .
43019014	It was the Saboth even which falleth in the ester fest and aboute the sixte houre . And he sayde vnto the Iewes : beholde youre kynge .
43019015	They cryed awaye with him awaye with him crucify him . Pylate sayde vnto them . Shall I crucify youre kynge ? The hye Prestes answered : we have no kynge but Cesar .
43019016	Then delyvered he him vnto them to be crucified . And they toke Iesus and led him awaye .
43019017	And he bare his crosse and went forthe into a place called the place of deed mens sculles which is named in Hebrue Golgatha .
43019018	Where they crucified him and two other with him on ether syde one and Iesus in the myddes .
43019019	And Pylate wrote his tytle and put it on the crosse . The writynge was Iesus of Nazareth kynge of the Iewes .
43019020	This tytle reed many of the Iewes . For the place where Iesus was crucified was nye to the cite . And it was written in Hebrue Greke and Latyn .
43019021	Then sayde the hye prestes of ye Iewes to Pylate : wryte not kynge of the Iewes : but that he sayde I am kynge of the Iewes .
43019022	Pylate answered : what I have written that have I written .
43019023	Then the soudiers when they had crucified Iesus toke his garmentes and made foure partes to every soudier a parte and also his coote . The coote was with out seme wrought vpon thorowe out .
43019024	And they sayde one to another . Let vs not devyde it : but cast loostes who shall have it That the scripture myght be fulfilled which sayth . They parted my rayment amonge them and on my coote dyd cast lottes . And the soudiers dyd soche thinges in dede .
43019025	Ther stode by the crosse of Iesus his mother and his mothers sister Mary the wyfe of Cleophas and Mary Magdalene .
43019026	When Iesus sawe his mother and the disciple stondynge whom he loved he sayde vnto his mother : woman beholde thy sonne .
43019027	Then sayde he to ye disciple : beholde thy mother . And fro that houre the disciple toke her for his awne .
43019028	After that when Iesus perceaved that all thinges were performed : that the scripture myght be fulfilled he sayde : I thyrst .
43019029	Ther stode a vessell full of veneger by . And they filled a sponge with veneger and wounde it about with ysope and put it to his mouth .
43019030	Assone as Iesus had receaved of the veneger he sayd : It is fynesshed and bowed his heed and gaue vp the goost .
43019031	The Iewes then because it was the saboth eve that ye bodyes shuld not remayne apon ye crosse on ye saboth daye ( for that saboth daye was an hye daye ) besought Pylate that their legges myght be broken and that they myght be taken doune .
43019032	Then came the soudiers and brake the legges of the fyrst and of the other which was crucified with Iesus .
43019033	But when they came to Iesus and sawe that he was deed already they brake not his legges :
43019034	but one of the soudiers with a speare thrust him into the syde and forthwith came ther out bloud and water .
43019035	And he that sawe it bare recorde and his recorde is true . And he knoweth that he sayth true that ye myght beleve also .
43019036	These thinges were done that the scripture shuld be fulfilled : Ye shall not breake a boone of him .
43019037	And agayne another scripture sayth : They shall looke on him whom they pearsed .
43019038	After that Ioseph of Aramathia ( which was a disciple of Iesus : but secretly for feare of ye Iewes ) besought Pylate that he myght take doune the body of Iesus . And Pylate gave him licence .
43019039	And ther cam also Nicodemus which at the beginnynge came to Iesus by nyght and brought of myrre and aloes mingled to gether aboute an hundred pounde wayght
43019040	Then toke they the body of Iesu and wounde it in lynnen clothes with the odoures as ye maner of the Iewes is to bury .
43019041	And in the place where Iesus was crucified was a garden and in ye garden a newe sepulchre wherin was never man layd .
43019042	There layde they Iesus because of the Iewes saboth even for the sepulcre was nye at honde .
43020001	The morow after the saboth daye came Mary Magdalene erly when it was yet darcke vnto ye sepulcre and sawe the stone taken awaye from ye toumbe .
43020002	Then she ranne and came to Simon Peter and to the other disciple whome Iesus loved and sayde vnto them . They have taken awaye the Lorde out of the toumbe and we cannot tell where they have layde him .
43020003	Peter went forth and that other disciple and came vnto the sepulcre .
43020004	They ranne bothe to gether and that other disciple dyd out runne Peter and came fyrst to the sepulcre .
43020005	And he stouped doune and sawe the lynnen clothes lyinge yet wet he not in .
43020006	Then came Simon Peter folowynge him and went into ye sepulcre and sawe the lynnen clothes lye
43020007	and the napkyn that was aboute his heed not lyinge with the lynnen clothe but wrapped togeder in a place by it selfe .
43020008	Then went in also that other disciple which came fyrst to the sepulcre and he sawe and beleved .
43020009	For as yet they knew not the scriptures that he shuld ryse agayne from deeth .
43020010	And the disciples wet awaye agayne vnto their awne home .
43020011	Mary stode with out at the sepulcre wepynge . And as she wept she bowed her selfe into the sepulcre
43020012	and sawe two angels in whyte sittyng the one at the heed and the other at the fete where they had layde the body of Iesus .
43020013	And they sayde vnto her : woman why wepest thou ? She sayde vnto the : For they have taken awaye my lorde and I wote not where they have layde him .
43020014	When she had thus sayde she turned her selfe backe and sawe Iesus stondynge and knewe not that it was Iesus .
43020015	Iesus sayde vnto her : woman why wepest thou ? Whom sekest thou ? She supposynge that he had bene the gardener sayde vnto him . Syr yf thou have borne him hece tell me where thou hast layde him that I maye fet him .
43020016	Iesus sayde vnto her : Mary . She turned her selfe and sayde vnto him : Rabboni which is to saye master .
43020017	Iesus sayde vnto her touche me not for I am not yet ascended to my father . But goo to my brethren and saye vnto them I ascende vnto my father and youre father to : my god and youre god .
43020018	Mary Magdalene came and tolde the disciples yt she had sene the lorde and yt he had spoken soche thinges vnto her .
43020019	The same daye at nyght which was the morowe after ye saboth daye when the dores were shut where the disciples were assembled to geder for feare of the Iewes came Iesus and stode in the myddes and sayd to the : peace be with you .
43020020	And when he had so sayde he shewed vnto them his hondes and his syde . Then were the disciples glad when they sawe the Lorde .
43020021	Then sayde Iesus to them agayne : peace be with you . As my father sent me even so sende I you .
43020022	And when he had sayde that he brethed on them and sayde vnto the : Receave ye holy goost .
43020023	Whosoevers synnes ye remyt they are remitted vnto the . And whosoevers synnes ye retayne they are retayned .
43020024	But Thomas one of ye twelve called Didymus was not with the when Iesus came .
43020025	The other disciples sayd vnto him : we have sene ye lorde . And he sayde vnto the : except I se in his hondes the prent of the nayles and put my fynger in the holes of the nayles and thrust my honde into his syde I will not beleve .
43020026	And after . viii . dayes agayne his disciples were with in and Thomas with them . Then came Iesus when the dores were shut and stode in the myddes and sayde : peace be with you .
43020027	After that sayde he to Thomas : bringe thy fynger hether and se my hondes and bringe thy honde and thrust it into my syde and be not faythlesse but belevynge .
43020028	Thomas answered and sayde vnto him : my Lorde and my God .
43020029	Iesus sayde vnto him . Thomas because thou hast sene me therfore thou belevest : Happy are they that have not sene and yet beleve .
43020030	And many other signes dyd Iesus in the presence of his disciples which are not written in this boke .
43020031	These are written that ye myght beleve that Iesus is Christ the sonne of God and that in belevynge ye myght have lyfe thorowe his name .
43021001	After that Iesus shewed him selfe agayne at the see of Tyberias . And on this wyse shewed he him selfe .
43021002	There were to geder Simon Peter and Thomas which is called Didymus : and Nathanael of Cana a citie of Galile and the sonnes of Zebedei and two other of the disciples .
43021003	Simon Peter sayde vnto them : I goo a fysshynge . They sayde vnto him : we also will goo with the . They wet their waye and entred into a shippe strayght waye and that nyght caught they nothinge .
43021004	But when the mornynge was now come Iesus stode on the shore : neverthelesse the disciples knewe not yt it was Iesus .
43021005	Iesus sayde vnto the : syrs have ye eny meate ? They answered him no .
43021006	And he sayde vnto them : cast out ye net on the ryght syde of the ship and ye shall fynde . They cast out and anone they were not able to drawe it for ye multitude of fysshes
43021007	Then sayde the disciple whom Iesus loved vnto Peter : It is the Lorde . When Simon Peter hearde that it was ye lorde he gyrde his mantell to him ( for he was naked ) and sprange into the see
43021008	The other disciples came by ship : for they were not farre from londe but as it were two hondred cubites and they drewe the net with fysshes .
43021009	Assone as they were come to londe they sawe hoot coles and fysshe layd ther on and breed .
43021010	Iesus sayde vnto them : bringe of the fysshe which ye have now caught .
43021011	Simon Peter stepped forthe and drewe the net to londe full of greate fysshes an hondred and . liii . And for all ther were so many yet was not the net broken .
43021012	Iesus sayde vnto them : come and dyne . And none of the disciples durste axe him : what arte thou ? For they knewe that it was the lorde .
43021013	Iesus then came and toke breed and gave them and fysshe lykwyse
43021014	And this is now the thyrde tyme that Iesus appered to his disciples after that he was rysen agayne from deeth .
43021015	When they had dyned Iesus sayde to Simon Peter : Simon Ioana lovest thou me more then these ? He sayde vnto him : ye Lorde thou knowest that I love the . He sayde vnto him : fede my lambes .
43021016	He sayde to him agayne the seconde tyme : Simo Ioana lovest thou me ? He sayde vnto him : ye lorde thou knowest that I love ye . He sayde vnto him : fede my shepe .
43021017	He sayde vnto him ye thyrde tyme : Simon Ioanna lovest thou me ? And Peter sorowed because he sayde to him ye thyrde tyme lovest thou me and sayde vnto him : Lorde thou knowest all thinge thou knowest that I love the . Iesus sayde vnto him : fede my shepe .
43021018	Verely verely I saye vnto the when thou wast yonge thou gerdedst thy selfe and walkedst whyther thou woldest : but when thou arte olde thou shalt stretche forthe thy hondes and a nother shall gyrde ye and leade the whyther thou woldest not .
43021019	That spake he signifyinge by what deeth he shuld glorify God . And whe he had sayde thus he sayd to him folowe me .
43021020	Peter turned about and sawe that disciple who Iesus loved folowynge : which also lened on his brest at supper and sayde : Lorde which is he yt shall betraye the ?
43021021	When Peter sawe him he sayde to Iesus : Lorde what shall he here do ?
43021022	Iesus sayd vnto him Yf I will have him to tary tyll I come what is that to the ? folowe thou me .
43021023	Then went this sayinge a broode amonge the brethren that that disciple shulde not dye . Yet Iesus sayde not to him he shall not dye : but yf I will that he tary tyll I come what is that to the ?
43021024	The same disciple is he which testifieth of these thinges and wrote these thinges . And we knowe that his testimony is true .
43021025	There are also many other thinges which Iesus dyd : the which yf they shuld be written every won I suppose the worlde coulde not cotayne the bokes that shuld be written .
44001001	In the former treatise ( Deare frende Theophilus ) I have written of all that Iesus beganne to do and teache
44001002	vntyll the daye in the which he was taken vp after that he thorowe the holy goost had geven commaundementes vnto the Apostles which he had chosen :
44001003	to whom also he shewed him selfe alyve after his passion by many tokens apperynge vnto them fourty dayes and speakynge of the kyngdome of god
44001004	and gaddered them togeder and commaunded the that they shuld not departe from Ierusalem : but to wayte for ye promys of the father whereof ye have herde of me .
44001005	For Iohn baptised wt water : but ye shalbe baptised with the holy goost and that with in this feawe dayes .
44001006	When they were come togeder they axed of him sayinge : Lorde wilt thou at this tyme restore agayne ye kyngdome to Israel ?
44001007	And he sayde vnto them : It is not for you to knowe the tymes or the seasons which ye father hath put in his awne power :
44001008	but ye shall receave power of the holy goost which shall come on you . And ye shall be witnesses vnto me in Ierusalem and in all Iewrye and in Samary and even vnto the worldes ende .
44001009	And when he had spoken these thinges whyll they behelde he was take vp and a cloude receaved him vp out of their sight .
44001010	And while they looked stedfastly vp to heaven as he went beholde two men stode by them in white apparell
44001011	which also sayde : ye men of Galile why stonde ye gasinge vp into heave ? This same Iesus which is taken vp fro you in to heaven shall so come even as ye haue sene him goo into heaven .
44001012	Then returned they vnto Ierusalem from mount olivete which is nye to Ierusalem coteyninge a Saboth dayes iorney .
44001013	And when they were come in they went vp into a parler where abode both Peter and Iames Iohn and Andrew Philip and Thomas Bartlemew and Mathew Iames the sonne of Alpheus and Simo Zelotes and Iudas Iames sonne .
44001014	These all cotinued with one acorde in prayer and supplicacion with the wemen and Mary the mother of Iesu and with his brethren .
44001015	And in those dayes Peter stode vp in the myddes of the disciples and sayde ( the noumbre of names that were to gether were aboute an hondred and twenty )
44001016	Ye men and brethren this scripture must have nedes ben fulfilled which the holy goost thorow ye mouth of David spake before of Iudas which was gyde to them that tooke Iesus .
44001017	For he was noubred with vs and had obtayned fellouship in this ministracion .
44001018	And the same hath now possessed a plot of grounde with the rewarde of iniquite and when he was hanged brast a sondre in ye myddes and all his bowels gusshed oute .
44001019	And it is knowe vnto all the inhabiters of Ierusalem : in so moche that that felde is called in their mother tonge Acheldama that is to saye the bloud felde .
44001020	It is written in the boke of Psalmes : His habitacio be voyde and no man be dwellinge therin : and his bisshoprycke let another take .
44001021	Wherfore of these me which have copanyed with vs all ye tyme that the Lorde Iesus wet in and out amonge vs
44001022	begynninge at the baptyme of Iohn vnto that same daye that he was taken vp from vs must one be ordeyned to be are witnes with vs of his resurreccion .
44001023	And they appoynted two Ioseph called Barsabas ( whose syr name was Iustus ) and Mathias .
44001024	And they prayed sayinge : thou Lorde which knowest the hertes of all me shewe whether of these two thou hast chosen
44001025	that the one maye take the roume of this ministracion and apostleshippe from the which Iudas by transgression fell that he myght go to his awne place .
44001026	And they gave forthe their lottes and the lot fell on Mathias and he was counted with the eleven Apostles .
44002001	Whe the fyftith daye was come they were all with one accorde togeder in one place .
44002002	And sodenly ther cam a sounde from heaven as it had bene the comminge of a myghty wynde and it filled all the housse where they sate .
44002003	And ther appered vnto them cloven tonges lyke as they had bene fyre and it sate vpon eache of them :
44002004	and they were all filled with the holy goost and beganne to speake with other tonges even as the sprete gave them vtteraunce .
44002005	And ther were dwellinge at Ierusalem Iewes devoute men which were of all nacions vnder heaven .
44002006	When this was noysed aboute the multitude came to gether and were astonyed because that every man hearde the speake his awne touge .
44002007	They wondred all and marveyled sayinge amoge them selves : Beholde are not all these which speake of Galile ?
44002008	And how heare we every man his awne touge wherein we were boren ?
44002009	Parthians Medes and Elamytes and the inhabiters of Mesopotamia of Iury and of Capadocia of Ponthus and Asia
44002010	Phrigia Pamphilia and of Egypte and of the parties of Libia which is besyde Syrene and straungers of Rome Iewes and convertes
44002011	Grekes and Arabians : we have herde them speake with oure awne tonges the greate workes of God .
44002012	They were all amased and wondred sayinge one to another : what meaneth this ?
44002013	Other mocked the sayinge : they are full of newe wyne .
44002014	But Peter stepped forth with the eleve and lift vp his voyce and sayde vnto them : Ye men of Iewrye and all ye that inhabite Ierusalem : be this knowe vnto you and with youre eares heare my wordes .
44002015	These are not dronken as ye suppose : for it is yet but the thyrde houre of ye daye .
44002016	But this is that which was spoken by ye Prophete Iohel :
44002017	It shalbe in the last dayes sayth God : of my sprete I will powre out vpon all flesshe . And youre sonnes and youre doughters shall prophesy and youre yoge men shall se visions and youre olde me shall dreme dremes .
44002018	And on my servauts and on my honde maydens I will powre out of my sprete in those dayes and they shall prophesye .
44002019	And I will shewe wonders in heaven a bove and tokens in the erth benethe bloud and fyre and the vapour of smoke .
44002020	The sunne shalbe turned into darknes and the mone into bloud before that greate and notable daye of the Lorde come .
44002021	And it shalbe that whosoever shall call on the name of the Lorde shalbe saved .
44002022	Ye men of Israel heare these wordes . Iesus of Nazareth a ma approved of God amoge you with myracles wondres and signes which God dyd by him in ye myddes of you as ye youre selves knowe :
44002023	him have ye taken by the hondes of vnrightewes persones after he was delivered by the determinat counsell and foreknoweledge of God and have crucified and slayne :
44002024	whom God hath raysed vp and lowsed the sorowes of deeth because it was vnpossible that he shuld be holden of it .
44002025	For David speaketh of him : Afore honde I sawe God alwayes before me : For he is on my ryght honde that I shuld not be moved .
44002026	Therfore dyd my hert reioyce and my tonge was glad . Moreover also my flesshe shall rest in hope
44002027	because thou wilt not leve my soul in hell nether wilt suffre thyne holye to se corrupcio .
44002028	Thou hast shewed me the wayes of lyfe and shalt make me full of ioye with thy countenaunce .
44002029	Men and brethren let me frely speake vnto you of the partriarke David : For he is both deed and buryed and his sepulcre remayneth with vs vnto this daye .
44002030	Therfore seinge he was a Prophet and knewe that God had sworne with an othe to him that the frute of his loynes shuld sit on his seat ( in that Christ shulde ryse agayne in the flesshe )
44002031	he sawe before : and spake in the resurreccion of Christ that his soule shulde not be left in hell : nether his flesse shuld se corrupcio .
44002032	This Iesus hath God raysyd vp wherof we all are witnesses .
44002033	Sence now that he by the right honde of God exalted is and hath receaved of the father the promyse of the holy goost he hath sheed forthe that which ye nowe se and heare .
44002034	For David is not ascendyd into heave : but he sayde . The Lorde sayde to my Lorde sit on my right honde
