44002035	vntill I make thy fooes thy fote stole .
44002036	So therfore let all the housse of Israel knowe for a suerty yt God hath made ye same Iesus whom ye have crucified lorde and Christ .
44002037	When they hearde this they were pricked in their hertes and sayd vnto Peter and vnto the other Apostles : Ye men and brethre what shall we do ?
44002038	Peter sayde vnto them : repent and be baptised every one of you in the name of Iesus Christ for the remission of synnes and ye shall receave the gyfte of the holy goost .
44002039	For ye promyse was made vnto you and to youre chyldre and to all that are afarre even as many as ye Lorde oure God shall call .
44002040	And with many other wordes bare he witnes and exhorted them sayinge : Save youre selves from this vntowarde generacion .
44002041	Then they that gladly receaved his preachynge were baptised : and the same daye ther were added vnto them aboute thre thousande soules .
44002042	And they continued in the Apostles doctrine and felloushippe and in breakinge of breed and in prayer .
44002043	And feare came over every soule . And many wondres and signes were shewed by the Apostles .
44002044	And all that beleved kept them selves to gedder and had all thinges comen
44002045	and solde their possessions and goodes and departed them to all men as every man had nede .
44002046	And they continued dayly with one acorde in the teple and brake breed in every housse and dyd eate their meate to gedder with gladnes and singlenes of hert
44002047	praysinge God and had faveour with all the people . And the Lorde added to ye congregacion dayly soche as shuld be saved .
44003001	Peter and Iohn went up togedder into the teple at the nynthe houre of prayer .
44003002	And ther was a certayne man halt from his mothers wobe who they brought and layde at the gate of the temple called beutifull to axe almes of them that entred into the temple .
44003003	Which same when he sawe Peter and Iohn that they wolde in to the teple desyred to receave an almes .
44003004	And Peter fastened his eyes on him with Iohn and sayde : looke on vs .
44003005	And he gaue hede vnto the trustinge to receave somthinge of them .
44003006	Then sayd Peter : Silver and golde have I none suche as I have geve I the . In the name of Iesu Christ of Nazareth ryse vp and walke .
44003007	And he toke him by the right honde and lifte him vp . And immediatly his fete and ancle bones receaved strenght .
44003008	And he sprage stode and also walked and entred with them into the temple walkinge and leapinge and laudynge God .
44003009	And all the people sawe him walke and laude God .
44003010	And they knewe him that it was he which sate and begged at the beutifull gate of the temple . And they wondred and were sore astonnyed at that which had happened vnto him .
44003011	And as ye halt which was healed helde Peter and Iohn all the people ranne amased vnto them in Salomons porche .
44003012	When Peter sawe that he answered vnto the people . Ye men of Israel why marvayle ye at this or why looke ye so stedfastly on vs as though by oure awne power or holynes we had made this man goo ?
44003013	The God of Abraham Isaac and Iacob the God of oure fathers hath glorified his sonne Iesus whom ye delyvered and denyed in the presence of Pylate whe he had iudged him to be lowsed .
44003014	But ye denyed the holy and iust and desyred a mortherar to be geven you
44003015	and kylled the Lorde of lyfe whom God hath raysed from deeth of the which we are wytnesses .
44003016	And his name thorow the fayth of his name hath made this man sound whom ye se and knowe . And the fayth which is by him hath geven to him this health in the presence of you all .
44003017	And now brethre I wote well that thorow ignorauce ye did it as dyd also youre heddes .
44003018	But those thinges which God before had shewed by the mouth of all his Prophetes how yt Christ shuld suffre he hath thus wyse fulfilled .
44003019	Repent ye therfore and turne yt youre synnes maye be done awaye when the tyme of refresshinge commeth which we shall have of the presence of the Lorde
44003020	and when God shall sende him which before was preached vnto you that is to wit Iesus Christ
44003021	which must receave heave vntyll the tyme yt all thinges which God hath spoken by the mouth of all his holy Prophetes sence the worlde began be restored agayne .
44003022	For Moses sayd vnto the fathers : A Prophet shall the Lorde youre God rayse vp vnto you even of youre brethren lyke vnto me : him shall ye heare in all thinges whatsoever he shall saye vnto you .
44003023	For the tyme will come yt every soule which shall not heare that same Prophet shalbe destroyed from amonge the people .
44003024	Also all the Prophetes from Samuel and thence forth as many as have spoken have in lykwyse tolde of these dayes .
44003025	Ye are the chyldren of the Prophetes and of the covenaunt which God hath made vnto oure fathers sayinge to Abraham : Eve in thy seede shall all the kinredes of the erth be blessed .
44003026	Fyrst vnto you hath God raysed vp his sonne Iesus and him he hath sent to blysse you that every one of you shuld turne from youre wickednes .
44004001	As they spake vnto the people the prestes and the rular of the teple and the Saduces came vpon them
44004002	takynge it grevously that they taught ye pople and preached in Iesus the resurreccion fro deeth .
44004003	And they layde hondes on them and put them in holde vntill the nexte daye : for it was now even tyde .
44004004	How be it many of them which hearde the wordes beleved and the noumbre of the men was aboute fyve thousande .
44004005	And it chaunsed on the morowe that their rulars and elders and Scribes
44004006	as Annas the chefe Prest and Cayphas and Iohn and Alexander and as many as were of ye kynred of the hye prestes gadered to geder at Ierusalem
44004007	and set the other before them and axed : by what power or what name have ye done this syrs ?
44004008	Then Peter full of ye holy goost sayd vnto them : ye rulars of the people and elders of Israel
44004009	yf we this daye are examined of the good dede done to the sycke man by what meanes he is made whoale :
44004010	be yt knowen vnto you all and to the people of Israel that in the name of Iesus Christ of Nazareth whom ye crucified and whom God raysed agayne from deeth : even by him doth this man stonde here present before you whoale .
44004011	This is ye stone cast a syde of you bylders which is set in the chefe place of the corner .
44004012	Nether is ther salvacio in eny other . Nor yet also is ther eny other name geven to men wherin we must be saved .
44004013	When they sawe the boldnes of Peter and Iohn and vnderstode that they were vnlerned men and laye people they marveyled and they knew them that they were with Iesu :
44004014	and beholdinge also the ma which was healed stondinge with the they coulde not saye agaynst it .
44004015	But they comaunded them to go a syde out of the counsell and counceled amoge them selves
44004016	sayinge : what shall we do to these men ? For a manifest signe is done by the and is openly knowen to all them that dwell in Ierusalem and we canot denye it .
44004017	But that it be noysed no farther amoge the people let us threaten and charge them that they speake hence forth to no man in this name .
44004018	And they called them and comaunded them that in no wyse they shuld speake or teache in the name of Iesu .
44004019	But Peter and Iohn answered vnto them and sayde : whether it be right in the syght of God to obeye you moare then God iudge ye .
44004020	For we canot but speake that which we have sene and hearde .
44004021	So threatened they them and let them goo and founde no thinge how to punysshe them because of the people . For all me lauded God for the myracle which was done :
44004022	for the man was above fourty yeare olde on whom this myracle of healinge was shewed .
44004023	Assone as they were let goo they came to their felowes and shewed all that the hye prestes and elders had sayde to them .
44004024	And when they hearde that they lyfte vp their voyces to God with one accorde and sayde : Lorde thou arte God which hast made heaven and erth the see and all that in them is
44004025	which by the mouth of thy servaunt David hast sayd : Why dyd the hethen rage and the people immagen vayne thinges .
44004026	The kynges of the erth stode vp and the rulars came to gedder agaynst the Lorde and agaynst his Christ .
44004027	For of a trueth agaynst thy holy chylde Iesus whom thou hast annoynted bothe Herode and also Poncius Pylate with the Gentils and the people of Israel gaddered them selves to gedder
44004028	for to do whatsoever thy honde and thy counsell determined before to be done .
44004029	And now Lorde beholde their threatenynges and graunte vnto thy servauntes with all confidence to speake thy worde .
44004030	So that thou stretche forth thy honde that healynge and signes and wonders be done by the name of thy holy chylde Iesus .
44004031	And assone as they had prayed the place moved wheare they were assembled to gedder and they were all filled with the holy goost and they spake the worde of God boldely .
44004032	And the multitude of them that beleved were of one hert and of one soule . Also none of them sayde that eny of the thinges which he possessed was his awne : but had all thinges commen .
44004033	And with greate power gave the Apostles witnes of the resurreccion of the Lorde Iesu . And greate grace was with them all .
44004034	Nether was ther eny amonge them that lacked . For as many as were possessers of londes or housses solde them and brought the pryce of the thinges that were solde
44004035	and layed yt doune at the Apostles fete . And distribucion was made vnto every man accordinge as he had nede .
44004036	And Ioses which was also called of the Apostles Barnabas ( that is to saye the sonne of consolacion ) beynge a Levite and of the countre of Cipers
44004037	had londe and solde it . and layde the pryce doune at the Apostles fete .
44005001	A certayne man named Ananias with Saphira his wyfe solde a possession
44005002	and kepte awaye parte of the pryce ( his wyfe also beynge of counsell ) and brought a certayne parte and layde it doune at the Apostles fete .
44005003	Then sayde Peter : Ananias how is it that Satan hath filled thyne hert that thou shuldest lye vnto the holy goost and kepe awaye parte of the pryce of the lyvelod :
44005004	Pertayned it not vnto the only and after it was solde was not the pryce in thyne awne power ? How is it that thou hast coceaved this thinge in thyne herte ? Thou hast not lyed vnto men but vnto God .
44005005	When Ananias herde these wordes . he fell doune and gave vp the goost . And great feare came on all the that these thinges hearde .
44005006	And the yonge men roose vp and put him a parte and caryed him out and buryed him .
44005007	And it fortuned as it were aboute the space of . iii . houres after that his wyfe came in ignoraunt of that which was done .
44005008	And Peter sayde vnto her : Tell me gave ye the londe for so moche ? And she sayde : ye for so moche
44005009	Then Peter sayde vnto her : why have ye agreed to gether to tept the sprete of the Lorde ? Beholde the fete of them which have buryed thy husbande are at the dore and shall cary the out .
44005010	Then she fell doune strayght waye at his fete and yelded vp the goost . And the yonge men came in and founde her ded and caryed her out and buryed her by her husbande .
44005011	And great feare came on all the congregacion and on as many as hearde it .
44005012	By the hondes of the Apostles were many signes and wondres shewed amoge the people . And they were all together with one acorde in Salomons porche .
44005013	And of other durst no man ioyne him selfe to them : neverthelater the people magnyfied them .
44005014	The noumbre of them that beleved in the Lorde bothe of men and wemen grewe moare and moare :
44005015	in so moche that they brought the sicke into the strettes and layde them on beddes and palettes that at the lest waye the shadowe of Peter when he came by myght shadowe some of them .
44005016	There came also a multitude out of ye cities roud about vnto Ierusalem bringynge sicke folkes and them which were vexed with vnclene spretes . And they were healed every one .
44005017	Then ye chefe preste rose vp and all they that were with him ( which is the secte of the Saduces ) and were full of indignacion
44005018	and layde hondes on the Apostles and put them in the comen preson .
44005019	But the angell of the Lorde by nyght openned the preson dores and brought them forthe and sayde :
44005020	goo steppe forthe and speake in the temple to the people all the wordes of this lyfe .
44005021	When they hearde that they entred into the temple erly in the morninge and taught . The chefe prest came and they that were with him and called a counsell to gedder and all the elders of the chyldren of Israel and sent to the preson to fet them .
44005022	When the ministres came and founde them not in the preson they returned and tolde
44005023	sayinge : the preson founde we shut as sure as was possible and the kepers stondynge with out before ye dores . But whe we had opened we founde no man with in .
44005024	When the chefe prest of all and the ruler of the temple and the hye prestes hearde these thinges they douted of them whervnto this wolde growe .
44005025	Then came one and shewed them : beholde ye men yt ye put in preson stonde in the teple and teache the people . .
44005026	Then went the ruler of the teple with ministers and brought the with out violence . For they feared the people lest they shuld have bene stoned .
44005027	And when they had brought them they set them before the counsell . And ye chefe preste axed the
44005028	sayinge : dyd not we straytely comaunde you that ye shuld not teache in this name ? And beholde ye have filled Ierusalem with youre doctrine and ye intende to brynge this mans bloud vpon vs .
44005029	Peter and the other Apostles answered and sayde : We ought moare to obey God then men .
44005030	The God of oure fathers raysed vp Ie Iesus whom ye slewe and hanged on tre .
44005031	Him hath god lifte vp with his right hand to be a ruler and a savioure for to geve repetauce to Israell and forgevenes of synnes .
44005032	And we are his recordes concernynge these thinges and also the holy goost whom God hath geve to them yt obey him .
44005033	When they hearde yt they clave asunder : and sought meanes to slee them .
44005034	Then stode ther vp one in ye counsell a Pharisey named Gamaliel a doctoure of lawe had in auctorite amoge all the people and commaunded to put the Apostles a syde a lytell space
44005035	and sayde vnto them : Men of Israel take hede to youre selves what ye entende to do as touchinge these men
44005036	Before these dayes rose vp one Theudas bostinge him selfe to whom resorted a nombre of men about a foure hondred which was slayn and they all which beleved him were scatred a broode and brought to nought .
44005037	After this man arose ther vp one Iudas of Galile in the tyme when tribute began and drewe awaye moche people after him . He also perisshed : and all even as many as harkened to him are scattered a brood .
44005038	And now I saye vnto you : refrayne youre selves from these men let them alone . For yf ye cousell or this worke be of men it will come to nought .
44005039	But and yf it be of God ye can not destroye it lest haply ye be founde to stryve agaynst God .
44005040	And to him they agreed and called the Apostles and bet them and comaunded that they shuld not speake in ye name of Iesu and let them goo .
44005041	And they departed from the counsell reioysynge yt they were counted worthy to soffre rebuke for his name .
44005042	And dayly in the teple and in every housse they ceased not teachinge and preachinge Iesus Christ .
44006001	In those dayes as the nombre of the disciples grewe ther arose a grudge amonge the Grekes agaynst the Ebrues be cause their wyddowes were despysed in the dayly mynystracion .
44006002	Then the twelve called the multitude of the disciples to gether and sayde : it is not mete that we shuld leave the worde of God and serve at the tables .
44006003	Wherfore brethren loke ye out amoge you seven men of honest reporte and full of the holy goost and wysdome which we maye apoynte to this nedfull busynes .
44006004	But we will geve oure selves cotinually to prayer and to the ministracion of ye worde .
44006005	And the sayinge pleased the whoale multitude . And they chose Steven a man full of fayth and of the holy goost and Philip and Prochorus and Nichanor and Timon and Permenas and Nicholas a converte of Antioche .
44006006	Which they set before the Apostles and they prayed and layde their hondes on them .
44006007	And the worde of God encreased and the noubre of the disciples multiplied in Ierusalem greatly and a great company of the prestes were obedient to the faythe .
44006008	And Steven full of faythe and power dyd great wondres and myracles amoge ye people .
44006009	Then ther arose certayne of the synagoge which are called Lybertines and Syrenites and of Alexandria and of Cilicia and Asia and disputed with Steven .
44006010	And they coulde not resist the wysdome and the sprete with which he spake .
44006011	Then sent they in men which sayd : we have hearde him speake blasphemous wordes agaynst Moses and agaynst God .
44006012	And they moved ye people and the elders and the scribes : and came apon him and caught him and brought him to the counsell
44006013	and brought forth falce witnesses which sayde . This ma ceasith not to speake blasphemous wordes agaynst this holy place and the lawe :
44006014	for we hearde him saye : this Iesus of Nazareth shall destroye this place and shall chaunge the ordinaunces which Moses gave vs .
44006015	And all that sate in ye counsell loked stedfastly on him and sawe his face as it had bene the face of an angell .
44007001	Then sayde ye chefe prest : is it even so ?
44007002	And he sayde : ye men brethren and fathers harken to . The God of glory appered vnto oure father Abraha whyll he was yet in Mesopotamia before he dwelt in Charran
44007003	and sayd vnto him : come out of thy contre and from thy kynred and come into the londe which I shall shewe the .
44007004	Then came he out of the londe of Chaldey and dwelt in Charran . And after that assone as his father was deed he brought him into this lande in which ye now dwell
44007005	and he gave him none inheritaunce in it no not the bredeth of a fote : but promised yt he wolde geve it to him to possesse and to his seed after him when as yet he had no chylde .
44007006	God verely spake on this wyse that his seade shulde be a dweller in a straunge londe and that they shulde kepe them in bondage and entreate them evyll . iiii . C . yeares .
44007007	But the nacion to whom they shalbe in bondage will I iudge sayde God . And after that shall they come forthe and serve me in this place .
44007008	And he gave him the covenaunt of circumcision . And he begat Isaac and circumcised him the viii . daye and Isaac begat Iacob and Iacob the twelve patriarkes
44007009	And the patriarkes havinge indignacio solde Ioseph into Egipte . And God was with him
44007010	and delivered him out of all his adversities . And gave him faveour and wisdome in the sight of Pharao kynge of Egipte which made him governer over Egipte and over all his housholde .
44007011	Then came ther a derth over all the londe of Egipt and Canaan and great affliccion that our fathers founde no sustenauce .
44007012	But when Iacob hearde that ther was corne in Egipte he sent oure fathers fyrst
44007013	and at the seconde tyme Ioseph was knowen of his brethren and Iosephs kynred was made knowne vnto Pharao .
44007014	Then sent Ioseph and caused his father to be brought and all his kynne thre score and xv . soules .
44007015	And Iacob descended into Egipte and dyed bothe he and oure fathers
44007016	and were translated into Sichem ond were put in ye sepulcre that Abraham bought for money of the sonnes of Emor at Sichem .
44007017	When ye tyme of ye promes drue nye ( which God had sworme to Abraham ) the people grewe and multiplied in Egipte
44007018	till another kynge arose which knewe not of Ioseph .
44007019	The same dealte suttelly with oure kynred and evyll intreated oure fathers and made them to cast oute their younge chyldren that they shuld not remayne alyve .
44007020	The same tyme was Moses borne and was a proper childe in ye sight of God which was norisshed vp in his fathers housse thre monethes .
44007021	When he was cast out Pharoes doughter toke him vp and norisshed him vp for her awne sonne .
44007022	And Moses was learned in all maner wisdome of the Egipcians and was mighty in dedes and in wordes .
44007023	And when he was full forty yeare olde it came into his hert to visit his brethren the chyldren of Israhel .
44007024	And when he sawe one of them suffre wronge he defended him and avenged his quarell that had the harme done to him and smote the Egypcian .
44007025	For he supposed hys brethren wolde have vnderstonde how yt God by his hondes shuld save them But they vnderstode not .
44007026	And the next daye he shewed him selfe vnto the as they strove and wolde have set the at one agayne sayinge : Syrs ye are brethren why hurte ye one another ?
44007027	But he that dyd his neghbour wronge thrust him awaye sayinge : who made ye a rular and a iudge amonge vs ?
44007028	What wilt thou kyll me as thou dyddest the Egyptian yester daye ?
44007029	Then fleed Moses at that sayenge and was a stranger in the londe of Madian where he begat two sonnes .
44007030	And when . xl . yeares were expired ther appered to him in the wyldernes of mounte Syna an angell of the Lorde in a flamme of fyre in a busshe .
44007031	When Moses sawe it he wondred at the syght . And as he drue neare to beholde the voyce of the Lorde came vnto him :
44007032	I am ye God of thy fathers the God of Abraham the God of Isaac and the God of Iacob . Moses trembled and durst not beholde .
44007033	Then sayde ye Lorde to him : Put of thy showes from thy fete for the place where thou stondest is holy grounde .
44007034	I have perfectly sene the affliccion of my people which is in Egypte and I have hearde their gronynge and am come doune to delyver them . And now come and I will sende the into Egypte .
44007035	This Moses whom they forsoke sayinge : who made the a ruelar and a iudge : the same God sent bothe a ruler and delyverer by ye hondes of the angell which appered to him in the busshe .
44007036	And the same brought them out shewynge wonders and signes in Egypte and in the reed see and in the wyldernes . xl . yeares .
44007037	This is that Moses which sayde vnto the chyldre of Israel : A Prophet shall the Lorde youre God rayse vp vnto you of youre brethren lyke vnto me him shall ye heare .
44007038	This is he that was in ye congregacion in the wyldernes with the angell which spake to him in ye moute Syna and with oure fathers . This man receaved the worde of lyfe to geve vnto vs
44007039	to who oure fathers wolde not obeye but cast it from them and in their hertes turned backe agayne into Egypte
44007040	sayinge vnto Aaron : Make vs goddes to goo before vs . For this Moses that brought vs out of the londe of Egypte we wote not what is become of him .
44007041	And they made a calfe in those dayes and offered sacrifice vnto the ymage and reioysed in the workes of their awne hondes .
44007042	Then God turned him selfe and gave them vp that they shuld worship the starres of the skye as it is written in the boke of the prophetes . O ye of ye housse of Israel gave ye to me sacrefices and meate offerynges by the space of xl . yeares in the wildernes ?
44007043	And ye toke vnto you the tabernacle of Moloch and the starre of youre god Remphan figures which ye made to worshippe them . And I will translate you beyonde Babylon .
44007044	Oure fathers had the tabernacle of witnes in ye wyldernes as he had apoynted the speakynge vnto Moses that he shuld make it acordynge to the fassion that he had sene .
44007045	Which tabernacle oure fathers receaved and brought it in with Iosue into the possession of the gentyls which God drave out before the face of oure fathers vnto the tyme of David
44007046	which founde favour before God and desyred that he myght fynde a tabernacle for the God of Iacob .
44007047	But Salomon bylt him an housse .
44007048	How be it he that is hyest of all dwelleth not in teple made with hondes as saith the Prophete :
44007049	Heven is my seate and erth is my fote stole what housse will ye bylde for me sayth the Lorde ? or what place is it that I shuld rest in ?
44007050	hath not my honde made all these thinges ?
44007051	Ye stiffenecked and of vncircumcised hertes and eares : ye have all wayes resisted the holy goost : as youre fathers dyd so do ye .
44007052	Which of the prophetes have not youre fathers persecuted ? And they have slayne them which shewed before of the commynge of that iust whom ye have now betrayed and mordred .
44007053	And ye also have receaved a lawe by the ordinaunce of angels and have not kept it .
44007054	When they hearde these thinges their hertes clave a sunder and they gnasshed on him with their tethe .
44007055	But he beynge full of the holy goost loked vp stedfastlye with his eyes into heven and sawe the glorie of God and Iesus stondynge on the ryght honde of God
44007056	and sayde : beholde I se the hevens open and the sonne of man stondynge on the ryght honde of god .
44007057	Then they gave a shute with a loude voyce and stopped their eares and ranne apon him all at once
44007058	and caste him out of the cite and stoned him . And the witnesses layde doune their clothes at a yonge mannes fete named Saul .
44007059	And they stoned Steven callynge on and sayinge : Lorde Iesu receave my sprete .
44007060	And he kneled doune and cryed with a loude voyce : Lorde laye not this synne to their charge . And when he had thus spoken he fell a slepe .
44008001	Saul had pleasure in his deeth . And at yt tyme there was a great persecucion agaynst the congregacion which was at Ierusalem and they were all scattered abroade thorowout the regions of Iury and Samaria except the Apostles
44008002	Then devout men dressed Steven aud made great lamentacion over him .
44008003	But Saul made havocke of the congregacion entrynge into every housse and drewe out bothe man and woman and thrust the into preson .
44008004	They that were scattered abroade went every where preachyng the worde .
44008005	Then came Philip into a cite of Samaria and preached Christ vnto them .
44008006	And the people gave hede vnto those thinges which Philip spake with one acorde in that they hearde and sawe the miracles which he dyd .
44008007	For vnclene spretes cryinge with loude voyce came out of many that were possessed of them . And manye taken with palsies and many yt halted were healed
44008008	And ther was great ioye in that cite .
44008009	And ther was a certayne man called Simon which before tyme in the same cite vsed witche crafte and bewitched the people of Samarie sayinge that he was a man yt coulde do greate thinges
44008010	Whom they regarded from ye lest to the greatest sayinge : this felow is the great power of God .
44008011	And him they set moche by because of longe tyme with sorcery he had mocked the .
44008012	But assone as they beleved Philippes preachynge of the kyngdome of God and of the name of Iesu Christ they were baptised bothe men and wemen .
44008013	Then Simon him selfe beleved also and was baptised and cotinued with Phillip and wondered beholdynge the miracles and signes which were shewed .
44008014	When ye Apostles which were at Ierusalem hearde saye that Samaria had receaved ye worde of God : they sent vnto the Peter and Iohn
44008015	which when they were come prayed for the that they myght receave ye holy goost
44008016	For as yet he was come on none of them : But they were baptised only in the name of Christ Iesu .
44008017	Then layde they their hondes on them and they receaved the holy goost .
44008018	When Simo sawe that thorowe layinge on of the Apostles hondes on them the holy goost was geven : he offered the money
44008019	sayinge : Geve me also this power that on whom soever I put the hondes he maye receave the holy goost .
44008020	Then sayde Peter vnto him : thy monye perysh with the because thou wenest that the gifte of God maye be obteyned wt money .
44008021	Thou hast nether parte nor felloushippe in this busines . For thy hert is not ryght in the syght of God .
44008022	Repent therfore of this thy wickednes and praye God that ye thought of thyne hert maye be forgeven the .
44008023	For I perceave that thou arte full of bitter gall and wrapped in iniquite .
44008024	Then answered Simon and sayde : Praye ye to the lorde for me yt none of these thinges whiche ye have spoken fall on me .
44008025	And they whe they had testified and preached the worde of the lorde returned toward Ierusalem and preached the gospell in many cities of the Samaritas .
44008026	Then the angell of the lorde spake vnto Phillip sayinge : aryse and goo towardes mydde daye vnto ye waye yt goeth doune fro Ierusalem vnto Gaza which is in ye desert .
44008027	And he arose and wet on . And beholde a man of Ethiopia which was a chaberlayne and of grete auctorite wt Cadace quene of ye Ethiopias and had ye rule of all her treasure came to Ierusalem for to praye .
44008028	And as he returned home agayne sittynge in his charet he rede Esay ye prophet
44008029	Then ye sprete sayde vnto Phillip : Goo neare and ioyne thy selfe to yonder charet .
44008030	And Philip ranne to him and hearde him rede ye prophet Esayas and sayde : Vnderstondest thou what thou redest ?
44008031	And he sayd : how can I except I had a gyde ? And he desyred Philip that he wold come vp and sit wt him .
44008032	The tenoure of ye scripture which he redde was this . He was ledde as a shepe to be slayne : and lyke a lambe dome before his sherer so opened he not his mouth .
44008033	Because of his humblenes he was not estemed : who shall declare his generacio ? for his lyfe is taken fro the erthe .
44008034	The chamberlayne answered Philip and sayde : I praye the of whom speaketh the Prophet this ? of him selfe or of some other man ?
44008035	And Philip opened his mouth and beganne at ye same scripture and preached vnto him Iesus .
44008036	And as they went on their waye they came vnto a certayne water and the chamberlayne sayde : Se here is water what shall let me to be baptised ?
44008037	Philip sayde vnto him : Yf thou beleve with all thyne hert thou mayst . He answered and sayde : I beleve that Iesus Christe is the sonne of God .
44008038	And he comaunded the charet to stonde still . And they went doune bothe into the water : bothe Philip and also the chamberlayne and he baptised him .
44008039	And assone as they were come out of the water the sprete of the lorde caught awaye Philip yt the chamberlayne sawe him no moore . And he wet on his waye reioysinge :
44008040	but Philip was founde at Azotus . And he walked thorow out ye countre preachynge in their cities tyll he came to Cesarea .
44009001	And Saul yet brethynge oute threatnynges and slaughter agaynst ye disciples of the lorde went vnto ye hye preste
44009002	and desyred of him letters to Damasco to ye synagoges : that yf he founde eny of this waye whether they were men or wemen he myght bringe them bounde vnto Ierusalem .
44009003	But as he went on his iorney it fortuned yt he drue nye to Damasco and sodenly ther shyned rounde about him a lyght fro heven .
44009004	And he fell to ye erth and hearde a voyce sayinge to him : Saul Saul why persecutest thou me ?
44009005	And he sayde what arte thou lorde ? And the lorde sayd I am Iesus whom thou persecutest it shalbe harde for ye to kycke agaynst ye pricke .
44009006	And he bothe tremblynge and astonyed sayde : Lorde what wilt thou have me to do ? And ye Lorde sayde vnto him : aryse and goo into the cite and it shalbe tolde the what thou shalt do .
44009007	The men which iornayed with him stode amased for they herde a voyce but sawe no man .
44009008	And Saul arose from the erth and opened his eyes but sawe no man . Then ledde they him by the honde and brought him into Damasco .
44009009	And he was . iii . dayes with out syght and nether ate nor dranke .
44009010	And ther was a certayne disciple at Damasco named Ananias and to him sayde the lorde in a vision : Ananias . And the he sayde : beholde I am here lorde .
44009011	And the lorde sayde to him : aryse and goo into the strete which is called strayght and seke in the housse of Iudas after one called Saul of Tharsus . For beholde he prayeth
44009012	and hath sene in a vision a man named Ananias comynge in to him and puttynge his hondes on him that he myght receave his syght .
44009013	Then Ananias answered : Lorde I have hearde by many of this man how moche evell he hath done to thy sainctes at Ierusalem
44009014	and here he hath auctorite of the hye prestes to bynde all that call on thy name .
44009015	The lorde sayde vnto him : Goo thy wayes : for he is a chosen vessell vnto me to beare my name before the gentyls and kynges and the chyldren of Israel .
44009016	For I will shewe him how great thinges he must suffre for my names sake .
44009017	Ananias went his waye and entryd into ye housse and put his hondes on him and sayde : brother Saul the lorde that apperyd vnto the in the waye as thou camst hath sent me that thou myghtest receave thy syght and be filled with the holy goost .
44009018	And immediatly ther fell from his eyes as it had bene scales and he receaved syght and arose and was baptised
44009019	and receaved meate and was comforted . Then was Saul a certayne daye wt the disciples which were at Damasco .
44009020	And streyght waye he preached Christ in the synagoges how that he was the sonne of God .
44009021	All that hearde him were amased and sayde : is not this he that spoyled the which called on this name in Ierusalem and came hyther for ye entent that he shuld bringe the bounde vnto the hye prestes ?
44009022	But Saul encreased in stregth and confounded the Iewes which dwelte at Damasco affirminge that this was very Christ .
44009023	And after a good whyle ye Iewes toke counsell to gether to kyll him .
44009024	But their layinge awayte was knowen of Saul . And they watched at the gates daye and nyght to kyll him .
44009025	Then ye disciples toke him by night and put him thorow the wall and let him doune in a basket .
44009026	And when Saul was come to Ierusalem he assayde to cople him silfe with ye discyples and they were all afrayde of hym and beleued not that he was a disciple .
44009027	But Bernabas toke hym and brought hym to ye apostles and declared to the how he had sene ye Lorde in ye waye and had spoke wyth hym : and how he had done boldely at damasco in the name of Iesu .
44009028	And he had his conuersacion with them at Ierusalem
44009029	and quit hym silfe boldly in the name of the lorde Iesu . And he spake and disputed wyth the grekes : and they went aboute to slee hym .
44009030	But when the brethren knew of that they brought hym to cesarea and sent hym forth to Tharsus .
44009031	Then had ye congregacios rest thorowoute all Iewry and galile and Samary and were edified and walked in the feare of the lorde and multiplied by the comforte of the holy gost .
44009032	And it chaunsed yt as Peter walked throughoute all quarters he ca to ye saynctes which dwelt at Lydda
44009033	and there he foude a certayne ma namyd Eneas whych had kepte hys bed viii . yere sicke of the palsie .
44009034	Then sayde Peter vnto hym : Eneas Iesus Christ make ye whole . Aryse and make thy beed . And he arose immedyatly .
44009035	And all that dwelt at lydda and assaron sawe hym and tourned to the lorde .
44009036	Ther was at Ioppe a certayne woma ( whiche was a disciple named Tabitha which by interpretacion is called dorcas ) the same was full of good workes and almes dedes which she did .
44009037	And it chaunsed in those dayes that she was sicke and dyed . When they had wesshed her and layd her in a chamber :
44009038	Because Lydda was nye to Ioppa and the disciples had hearde that Peter was there they sent vnto hym desyrynge him that he wolde not be greved to come vnto them .
44009039	Peter arose and came with them and when he was come they brought him in to ye chamber . And all ye wydowes stode roude aboute hym wepynge and shewynge the cotes and garmentes which Dorcas made whill she was with the .
44009040	And Peter put the all forth and kneled doune and prayde and turned him to ye body and sayde : Tabitha aryse . And she opened her eyes and whe she sawe Peter she sat vp .
44009041	And he gave her ye honde and lyft her up and called the sainctes and wydowes and shewed her alyve .
44009042	And it was knowne throwout all Ioppa and many beleved on the Lorde .
44009043	And it fortuned that he taryed many dayes in Ioppa with one Simon a tanner .
44010001	Ther was a certayne man in Cesarea called Cornelius a captayne of ye soudiers of Italy
44010002	a devoute man and one yt feared God wt all his housholde which gave moche almes to the people and prayde God alwaye .
44010003	The same man sawe in a vision evydetly aboute ye nynthe houre of ye daye an angell of god comynge into him and sayinge vnto him : Cornelius .
44010004	When he looked on him he was afrayde and sayde : what is it lorde ? He sayde vnto him . Thy prayers and thy almeses ar come vp into remembraunce before God .
44010005	And now sende men to Ioppa and call for one Simon named also Peter .
44010006	He lodgeth with one Simon a tanner whose housse is by ye see syde . He shall tell the what thou oughtest to doo .
44010007	When the angell which spake vnto Cornelius was departed he called two of his housholde servauntes and a devoute soudier of them that wayted on him
44010008	and tolde them all the mater and sent them to Ioppa .
44010009	On the morowe as they wet on their iorney and drewe nye vnto the cite Peter went vp into the toppe of ye housse to praye aboute the . vi . houre .
44010010	Then wexed he an hongred and wolde have eate . But whyll they made redy . He fell into a trauce
44010011	and sawe heven opened and a certayne vessell come doune vnto him as it had bene a greate shete knyt at the . iiii . corners and was let doune to the erth
44010012	where in wer all maner of . iiii . foted beastes of the erth and vermen and wormes and foules of the ayer .
44010013	And ther came a voyce to him : ryse Peter kyll and eate .
44010014	But Peter sayde : God forbyd Lorde for I have never eaten eny thinge that is comen or vnclene .
44010015	And the voyce spake vnto him agayne the seconde tyme : what God hath clensed that make thou not comen .
44010016	This was done thryse and the vessell was receaved vp agayne into heven .
44010017	Whyle Peter mused in him selfe what this vision which he had sene meant beholde the men which were sent from Cornelius had made inquirance for Simons housse and stode before the dore .
44010018	And called out won and axed whether Simon which was also called Peter were lodged there .
44010019	Whyll Peter thought on this vision the sprete sayde vnto him : Beholde men seke the :
44010020	aryse therfore get the doune and goo with them and doute not . For I have sent them .
44010021	Peter went doune to ye men which were sent vnto him from Cornelius and sayde Beholde I am he whom ye seke what is the cause wherfore ye are come ?
44010022	And they sayde vnto him : Cornelius the captayne a iust man and won that feareth God and of good reporte amonge all the people of the Iewes was warned by an holy angell to sende for the into his housse and to heare wordes of the .
44010023	Then called he them in and lodged them . And on ye morowe Peter wet awaye with them and certayne brethren from Ioppa accompanyed hym .
44010024	And the thyrd daye entred they into Cesaria . And Cornelius wayted for them and had called to gether his kynsmen and speciall frendes .
44010025	And as it chaunsed Peter to come in Cornelius met hym and fell doune at his fete and worshipped hym .
44010026	But Peter toke him vp sayinge : stonde vp : for evyn I my silfe am a ma .
44010027	And as he talked with him he cam in and founde many that were come to gether .
44010028	And he sayde vnto them : Ye do knowe how that yt ys an vnlawfull thynge for a man that is a Iewe to company or come vnto an alient : But god hath shewed me that I shuld not call eny man commen or vnclene :
44010029	therfore came I vnto you with oute sayege naye assone as I was sent for . I axe therfore for what intent have ye sent for me ?
44010030	And Cornelius sayde : This daye now . iiii . dayes I fasted and at the nynthe houre I prayde in my housse : and beholde a man stode before me in bright clothynge
44010031	and sayde : Cornelius thy prayer is hearde and thyne almes dedes are had in remembraunce in the sight of God .
44010032	Sende therfore to Ioppa and call for Simon which is also called Peter . He is lodged in the housse of one Simon a tanner by the see syde ye wich assone as he is come shall speake vnto ye .
44010033	Then sent I for ye immediatly and thou hast well done for to come . Now are we all here present before god to heare all thynges yt are commaunded vnto the of God .
44010034	Then Peter opened his mouth and sayde : Of a trueth I perseave that God is not parciall
44010035	but in all people he that feareth him and worketh rightewesnes is accepted with him .
44010036	Ye knowe the preachynge that God sent vnto the chyldren of Israel preachinge peace by Iesus Christe ( which is Lorde over all thinges ) :
44010037	Which preachinge was published thorow oute all Iewrye and begane in Galile after the baptyme which Iohn preached
44010038	how God had annoynted Iesus of Nazareth with the holy goost and with power which Iesus went aboute doinge good and healynge all yt were oppressed of the develles for God was with him .
44010039	And we are witnesses of all thinges which he dyd in the londe of the Iewes and at Ierusalem whom they slew and honge on tree .
44010040	Him God reysed vp ye thyrde daye and shewed him openly
44010041	not to all the people but vnto vs witnesses chosyn before of God which ate and dronke with him after he arose from deeth .
44010042	And he comaunded vs to preache vnto the people and testifie that it is he that is ordened of God a iudge of quycke and deed .
44010043	To him geve all the Prophetes witnes that thorowe his name shall receave remission of synnes all that beleve in him .
44010044	Whyle Peter yet spake these wordes the holy gost fell on all them which hearde the preachinge .
44010045	And they of ye circucision which beleved were astonyed as many as came wt Peter because that on the Gentyls also was sheed oute ye gyfte of the holy gost .
44010046	For they hearde them speake with tonges and magnify God . Then answered Peter :
44010047	can eny man forbyd water that these shuld not be baptised which have receaved the holy goost as well as we ?
44010048	And he comaunded them to be baptysed in the name of the Lorde . Then prayde they him to tary a feawe dayes .
44011001	And the Apostles and the brethren that were thorowout Iewry harde saye that the hethen had also receaved the worde of God .
44011002	And when Peter was come vp to Ierusalem they of the circumcision reasoned wyth him
44011003	sayinge : Thou wentest in to men vncircumcised and atest with them .
44011004	Then Peter began and expounded ye thinge in order to the sayinge :
44011005	I was in the cyte of Ioppa prayinge and in a traunce I sawe a vision a certen vessell descende as it had bene a large lynnyn clothe let doune from hevin by the fower corners and it cam to me .
44011006	Into the which when I had fastened myn eyes I consydered and sawe fowerfoted beastes of ye erth and vermen and wormes and foules of the ayer .
44011007	And I herde a voyce sayinge vnto me : aryse Peter sley and eate .
44011008	And I sayd : God forbyd lorde for nothinge comen or vnclene hath at eny tyme entred into my mouth .
44011009	But the voyce answered me agayne from heven cout not thou those thinges come which god hath clensed .
44011010	And this was done thre tymes . And all were takin vp agayne into heven .
44011011	And beholde immediatly ther were thre men come vnto the housse where I was sent from Cesarea vnto me .
44011012	And the sprete sayde vnto me that I shuld go with them with out doutinge . Morover the sixe brethren accompanyed me : and we entred into the mas housse .
44011013	And he shewed vs how he had sene an angell in his housse which stod and sayde to him : Send men to Ioppa and call for Symon named also Peter :
44011014	he shall tell the wordes wherby both thou and all thyne housse shalbe saved .
44011015	And as I begane to preach ye holy goost fell on them as he dyd on vs at the begynninge .
44011016	Then came to my remembrauce ye wordes of the Lorde how he sayde : Iohn baptised with water but ye shalbe baptysed with the holy goost .
44011017	For as moche then as God gave the lyke gyftes as he dyd vnto vs when we beleved on the Lorde Iesus Christ : what was I that I shuld have with stonde God ?
44011018	when they hearde this they helde their peace and gloryfied God sayinge : then hath God also to the gentyls graunted repentaunce vnto lyfe .
44011019	They which were scattryd abroade thorow the affliccion that arose aboute Steven walked thorow oute tyll they came vnto Phenices and Cypers and Antioche preachynge ye worde to no man but vnto the Iewes only .
44011020	Some of them were men of Cypers and Syrene which when they were come into Antioche spake vnto the Grekes and preched the Lorde Iesus .
44011021	And the honde of the Lorde was with them and a greate nombre beleved and turned vnto the Lorde .
44011022	Tydinges of these thinges came vnto ye eares of the congregacion which was in Ierusalem . And they sente forth Barnabas that he shuld go vnto Antioche .
44011023	Which when he was come and had sene the grace of God was glad and exhorted them all that with purpose of hert they wolde continually cleave vnto ye Lorde .
44011024	For he was a good man and full of the holy goost and of faythe : and moche people was added vnto the Lorde .
44011025	Then departed Barnabas to Tarsus for to seke Saul .
44011026	And when he had founde him he brought him vnto Antioche . And it chaunsed yt a whole yere they had their conversacion with the congregacio there and taught moche people : in so moche that the disciples of Antioche were the fyrst that were called Christen .
44011027	In those dayes came Prophetes fro Ierusalem vnto Antioche .
44011028	And ther stode vp one of them named Agabus and signified by the sprete that ther shuld be great derth throughoute all the worlde which came to passe in ye Emproure Claudius dayes .
44011029	Then the disciples every man accordinge to his abilite purposed to sende socoure vnto the brethren which dwelt in Iewry .
44011030	Which thinge they also dyd and sent it to the elders by the hondes of Barnabas and Saul .
44012001	In that tyme Herode the kynge stretched forthe his handes to vexe certayne of the congregacion .
44012002	And he kylled Iames the brother of Iohn with the swerde :
44012003	and because he sawe that it pleased ye Iewes he proceded forther and toke Peter also . Then were the dayes of swete breed .
44012004	And when he had caught him he put him in preson and delyvered him to . iiii . quaternios of soudiers to be kepte entendynge after ester to brynge him forth to the people .
44012005	Then was Peter kepte in preson . But prayer was made with out ceasynge of the congregacion vnto God for him .
44012006	And when Herode wolde have brought him oute vnto the people the same nyght slepte Peter bitwene two soudiers bounde with two chaynes and the kepers before the dore kepte the preson .
44012007	And beholde the angell of ye Lorde was there present and a lyght shyned in the lodge . And smote Peter on the syde and steryd him vp sayinge : aryse vp quyckly . And his cheynes fell of fro his hondes .
44012008	And the angell sayd vnto him : gyrde thy selfe and bynde on thy sandales . And so he dyd . And he sayde vnto him : cast thy mantle aboute the and folowe me .
44012009	And he came oute and folowed him and wist not that it was truthe which was done by the angell but thought he had sene a vision .
44012010	When they were past ye fyrst and ye seconde watche they came vnto yt yron gate yt ledeth vnto the cyte which opened to them by his awne accorde . And they went out and passed thorowe one strete and by and by the angell departed fro him .
44012011	And when Peter was come to him selfe he sayde : now I knowe of a surety that the Lorde hath sent his angell and hath delyvered me out of the honde of Herode and from all the waytynge for of the people of ye Iewes .
44012012	And as he consydred the thinge he cam to ye housse of Mary the mother of one Iohn which was called Marke also where many were gaddered to gedder in prayer .
44012013	As Peter knocked at the entry dore a damsell cam forth to herken named Rhoda .
44012014	And when she knew Peters voyce she opened not the entrey for gladnes but ran in and told how Peter stode before the entrey .
44012015	And they sayde vnto her : thou arte mad . And she bare them doune yt it was even so . Then sayde they : it is his angell .
44012016	Peter cotynued knockinge . When they had opened the dore and sawe him they were astonyed .
44012017	And he beckened vnto them with ye honde to holde their peace and tolde them by what meanes ye Lorde had brought him oute of the preson . And sayde : goo shew these thinges vnto Iames and to the brethren . And he departed and went into a nother place .
44012018	Assone as it was daye ther was no lyttell a doo amoge the soudyers what was becum of Peter .
44012019	When Herode had called for him and founde him not he examined the kepers and comaunded to departe . And he descended from Iewry to Cesarea and ther abode .
44012020	Herode was displeased with them of Tyre and Sydon . And they came all at once and made intercession vnto Blastus the kynges chamberlen and desyred peace because their countrey was norysshed by the kynges londe .
44012021	And upon a daye appoynted Herode arayed him in royall apparell and set him in his seate and made an oraycon vnto them .
44012022	And the people gave a shoute sayinge : it is ye voyce of a God and not of a man .
44012023	And immediatly the angell of ye Lorde smote him because he gave not God the honoure and he was eatyn of wormes and gave vp the goost .
44012024	And ye worde of God grewe and multiplied .
44012025	And Barnabas and Paul returned to Ierusalem when they had fulfilled their office and toke with them Iohn which was also called Marcus .
44013001	There were at Antioche in the congregacion certayne Prophetes and teachers : as Barnabas and Simon called Niger and Lucius of Cerene and Manahen Herode the Tetrarkes norsfelowe and Saul .
44013002	As they mynistred to the Lorde and fasted the holy goost sayde : separate me Barnabas and Saul for ye worke where vnto I have called them .
44013003	Then fasted they and prayed and put their hondes on them and let them goo .
44013004	And they after they were sent of the holy goost came vnto Seleutia and from thence they sayled to Cyprus .
44013005	And when they were come to Salamine they shewed ye worde of God in ye synagoges of ye Iewes . And they had Iohn to their minister .
44013006	When they had gone thorowout ye yle vnto ye cite of Paphos they foude a certayne sorserer a falce prophet which was a Iewe named Bariesu
44013007	which was with ye ruler of the countre won Sergius Paulus a prudet man . The same ruler called vnto him Barnabas and Saul and desyred to heare the worde of God .
44013008	But Elemas the sorcerar ( for so was his name by interpretacion ) wt stode them and sought to turne awaye the ruler fro the fayth .
44013009	Then Saul which also is called Paul beinge full of the holy goost set his eyes on him
44013010	and sayde : O full of all sutteltie and disseytfulnes the chylde of the devyll and ye enemye of all righteousnes thou ceasest not to pervert the strayght wayes of the Lorde .
44013011	And now beholde the honde of the Lorde is vpon the and thou shalt be blinde and not se the sunne for a season . And immediatly ther fell on him a myste and a darcknes and he went aboute sekinge them that shuld leade him by the honde .
44013012	Then the rular when he sawe what had happened beleved and wodred at the doctryne of the Lorde .
44013013	When they that were with Paule were departed by shyppe fro Paphus they cam to Perga a cite of Pamphilia : and there Iohn departed from them and returned to Ierusalem .
44013014	But they wandred thorowe the countres fro Perga to Antioche a cite of the coutre of Pisidia and wet in to the synagoge on the saboth daye and sate doune .
44013015	And after the lawe and ye Prophetes were redde ye rulers of the synagoge sent vnto them sayinge : Ye men and brethren yf ye have eny sermo to exhorte ye people saye on .
44013016	Then Paul stode vp and beckened with the honde and sayde : Men of Israel and ye that feare God geve audiece .
44013017	The God of this people chose oure fathers and exalted the people whe they dwelt as straugers in ye londe of Egypt and with a mighty arme brought them oute of it
44013018	and aboute the tyme of . xl . yeares suffred he their maners in the wyldernes .
44013019	And he destroyed . vii nacios in the londe of Canaan and devided their londe to them by lot .
44013020	And after warde he gave vnto them iudges aboute the space of . iiii . C . and . l . yeres vnto the tyme of Samuel ye Prophet .
44013021	And after that they desyred a kinge and God gave vnto them Saul the sonne of Cis a man of the tribe of Beniamin by the space of . xl . yeres .
44013022	And after he had put him doune he set vp David to be their kynge of whome he reported sayinge : I have founde David the sonne of Iesse a man after myne awne hert he shall fulfill all my will .
44013023	Of this manes seed hath God ( accordinge to his promes ) brought forth to the people of Israel a saviour one Iesus
44013024	when Iohn had fyrst preached before his cominge the baptyme of repentauce to Israel .
44013025	And when Iohn had fulfylled his course he sayde : whome ye thinke that I am the same am I not . But beholde ther cometh one after me whose shewes of his fete I am not worthy to lowse .
44013026	Ye men and brethren chyldren of the generacion of Abraham and whosoever amoge you feareth God to you is this worde of salvacio sent .
44013027	The inhabiters of Ierusalem and their rulers because they knewe him not nor yet the voyces of the Prophetes which are redde every Saboth daye they have fulfilled them in condepninge him .
44013028	And when they founde no cause of deeth in him yet desyred they Pylate to kyll him .
44013029	And when they had fulfilled all that were written of him they toke him doune from the tree and put him in a sepulcre .
44013030	But God raysed him agayne from deeth
44013031	and he was sene many dayes of them which came wt him fro Galile to Ierusalem . Which are his witnesses vnto the people .
44013032	And we declare vnto you how that ye promes made vnto the fathers
44013033	God hath fulfilled vnto vs their chyldre in that he reysed vp Iesus agayne eve as it is written in the fyrste psalme : Thou arte my sonne this same daye begat I the .
44013034	As concernynge that he reysed him vp from deeth now no more to returne to corrupcion he sayde on this wyse : The holy promyses made to David I will geve them faithfully to you .
44013035	Wherfore he saith also in another place : Thou shalt not soffre thyne holye to se corrupcion .
44013036	Howbe it David after he had in his tyme fulfilled the will of God he slepte and was layde with his fathers and sawe corrupcion .
44013037	But he whom God reysed agayne sawe no corrupcion .
44013038	Be it knowne vnto you therfore ye men and brethre that thorow this man is preached vnto you the forgevenes of synnes
44013039	and yt by him are all yt beleve iustified fro all thinges fro the which ye coulde not be iustified by ye lawe of Moses .
44013040	Beware therfore lest that fall on you which is spoken of in the Prophetes :
44013041	Beholde ye despisers and wonder and perishe ye : for I do aworke in youre dayes which ye shall not beleve yf a ma wolde declare it you .
44013042	When they were come out of the Synagoge of the Iewes the getyls besought yt they wolde preache the worde to them bitwene the Saboth dayes .
44013043	When the congregacion was broken vp many of the Iewes and verteous covertes folowed Paul and Barnabas which spake to them and exhorted them to cotinue in the grace of God .
44013044	And ye nexte Saboth daye came almoste the whole cite to gether to heare the worde of God .
44013045	When ye Iewes sawe the people they were full of indignacion and spake agaynst those thinges which were spoken of Paul spekinge agaynst it and raylinge on it .
44013046	Then Paul and Barnabas wexed bolde and sayde : it was mete that the worde of God shulde fyrst have bene preached to you . But seinge ye put it from you and thinke youre selfes onworthy of everlastinge lyfe : lo we turne to the gentyls .
44013047	For so hath the Lorde comaunded vs : I have made ye a light to the getyls yt thou be salvacio vnto ye ende of ye worlde .
44013048	The getyls hearde and were glad and glorified the worde of ye Lorde and beleved : eve as many as were ordeyned vnto eternall lyfe .
44013049	And ye worde of the Lorde was publisshed thorowe oute all the region .
44013050	But the Iewes moved ye worshypfull and honorable wemen and the chefe men of the cyte and reysed persecucio agaynst Paul and Barnabas and expelled them oute of their costes .
44013051	And they shouke of ye duste of their fete agaynst them and came vnto Iconiu .
44013052	And the disciples were filled with ioye and with the holy goost .
44014001	And it fortuned in Iconium that they went both to gether into the synagoge of ye Iewes and so spake that a gret multitude both of ye Iewes and also of the Grekes beleved .
44014002	But the unbelevinge Iewes steryd vp and vnquyeted the myndes of the Gentyls agaynste the brethre .
44014003	Longe tyme a bode they there and quyt them selves boldly with the helpe of the Lorde the which gave testimony vnto ye worde of his grace and caused signes and wondres to be done by their hondes .
44014004	The people of the cyte were devided : and parte helde with the Iewes and parte with the Apostles .
44014005	When ther was a saute made both of the gentyls and also of the Iewes with their rulers to put them to shame and to stone
44014006	the they were ware of it and fled vnto Listra and Derba cities of Licaonia and vnto the region that lyeth round aboute
44014007	and there preached the gospell .
44014008	And ther sate a certayne man at Listra weake in his fete beinge creple from his mothers wombe and never walkyd .
44014009	The same hearde Paul preache . Which behelde him and perceaved that he had fayth to be whole
44014010	and sayd with a loude voyce : stond vp right on thy fete . And he stert vp and walked .
44014011	And when the people sawe what Paul had done they lifte vp their voyces sayinge in the speache of Lycaonia : Goddes are come doune to vs in the lyknes of men .
44014012	And they called Barnabas Iupiter and Paul Mercurius because he was the preacher .
44014013	Then Iupiters Preste which dwelt before their cite brought oxe and garlondes vnto the churche porche and wolde have done sacrifise with the people .
44014014	But when the Apostles Barnabas and Paul herde that they rent their clothes and ran in amonge the people cryinge
44014015	and sayinge : syrs why do ye this ? We are mortall men lyke vnto you and preache vnto you that ye shuld turne from these vanyties vnto ye lyvinge God which made heaven and erth and the see and all that in them is :
44014016	the which in tymes past suffred all nacions to walke in their awne wayes .
44014017	Neverthelesse he lefte not him selfe with outen witnes in that he shewed his benefites in gevinge vs rayne from heaven and frutefull ceasons fyllinge oure hertes with fode and gladnes .
44014018	And with these sayinges scase refrayned they the people that they had not done sacrifice vnto them .
44014019	Thither came certayne Iewes fro Antioche and Iconium and optayned the peoples consent and stoned Paul and drewe him oute of the cyte supposynge he had bene deed .
44014020	How be it as the disciples stode rounde about him he arose vp and cam into the cyte . And the nexte daye he departed with Barnabas to Derba .
44014021	After they had preached to that cite and had taught many they returned agayne to Lisira and to Iconium and Antioche
44014022	and strengthed the disciples soules exhortinge them to continue in the faith affyrminge yt we must thorowe moche tribulacion entre into the kyngdome of God .
44014023	And when they had ordened them elders by eleccion in every congregacio after they had yrayde and fasted they comended them to God on whom they beleved .
44014024	And they went thorow out Pisidia and came into Paphilia
44014025	and when they had preached the worde of God in Perga they descended in to Attalia
44014026	and thence departed by shippe to Antioche fro whence they were delivered vnto the grace of God to the worke which they had fulfilled .
44014027	When they were come and had gaddered the congregacion to gedder they rehersed all that God had done by them and how he had opened the dore of faith vnto the getyls .
44014028	And ther they abode longe tyme with the disciples .
44015001	Then cam certayne from Iewrie and taught the brethren : excepte ye be circumcysed after the maner of Moses ye cannot be saved .
44015002	And when ther was rysen dissencion and disputinge not a litle vnto Paul and Barnabas agaynst them . They determined that Paul and Barnabas and certayne other of them shuld ascende to Ierusalem vnto the Apostles and elders aboute this question .
44015003	And after they were brought on their waye by the congregacion they passed over Phenices and Samaria declarynge the conuersion of the getyls and they brought great ioye vnto all ye brethren .
44015004	And when they were come to Ierusalem they were receaved of the congregacion and of the Apostles and elders . And they declared what thinges God had done by them .
44015005	Then arose ther vp certayne that were of the secte of the Pharises and dyd beleve sayinge that it was nedfull to circucise them and to enioyne the to kepe ye lawe of Moses .
44015006	And ye Apostles and elders came to geder to reason of this matter .
44015007	And when ther was moche disputinge Peter rose vp and sayde vnto them : Ye men and brethren ye knowe how that a good whyle agoo God chose amoge vs that the getyls by my mouth shuld heare the worde of the gospell and beleve .
44015008	And God which knoweth the herte bare them witnes and gave vnto them the holy goost eve as he dyd vnto vs
44015009	and he put no difference bitwene them and vs but with fayth purified their hertes .
44015010	Now therfore why tempte ye God that ye wolde put a yoke on the disciples neckes which nether oure fathers nor we were able to beare .
44015011	But we beleve that thorowe the grace of the Lorde Iesu Christ we shalbe saved as they doo .
44015012	Then all the multitude was peased and gave audience to Barnabas and Paul which tolde what signes and wondres God had shewed amonge the gentyls by them .
44015013	And when they helde their peace Iames answered sayinge : Men and brethren herken vnto me .
44015014	Simeon tolde how God at the begynnynge dyd visit the gentyls and receaved of them people vnto his name .
44015015	And to this agreith ye wordes of ye Prophetes as it is written .
44015016	After this I will returne and wyll bylde agayne the tabernacle of David which is fallen doune and that which is fallen in dekey of it will I bilde agayne and I will set it vp
44015017	that the residue of men might seke after the Lorde and also the gentyls vpo whom my name is named saith ye Lorde which doth all these thinges :
44015018	knowne vnto God are all his workes from the begynninge of the worlde .
44015019	Wherfore my sentece is yt we trouble not them which fro amonge the gentyls are turned to God :
44015020	but yt we write vnto them yt they abstayne them selves fro filthynes of ymages fro fornicacio from straglyd and fro bloude .
44015021	For Moses of olde tyme hath in every cite that preache him and he is rede in the synagoges every saboth daye .
44015022	Then pleased it the Apostles and elders wt the whole congregacio to sende chosyn men of their owne copany to Antioche with Paul and Barnabas . They sent Iudas called also Barsabas and Silas which were chefe men amonge the brethre
44015023	and gave them lettres in their hondes after this maner . The Apostles elders and brethren send gretynges vnto the brethre which are of the gentyls in Antioche Siria and Celicia .
44015024	For as moche as we have hearde yt certayne which departed fro vs have troubled you with wordes and combred youre myndes sayinge : Ye must be circumcised and kepe the lawe to whom we gave no soche comaundemet .
44015025	It semed therfore to vs a good thinge when we were come to gedder with one accorde to sende chosyn men vnto you with oure beloved Barnabas and Paul
44015026	men that have ieoperded their lyves for the name of oure Lorde Iesus Christ .
44015027	We have sent therfore Iudas and Sylas which shall also tell you the same thinges by mouth .
44015028	For it semed good to the holy gost and to vs to put no grevous thinge to you more then these necessary thinges :
44015029	that is to saye that ye abstayne from thinges offered to ymages from bloud from strangled and fornicacion . From which yf ye kepe youre selves ye shall do well . So fare ye well .
44015030	When they were departed they came to Antioche and gaddred the multitude togeder and delyvered ye pistle .
44015031	When they had redde it they reioysed of that consolacion .
44015032	And Iudas and Sylas beinge prophetes exhorted the brethren with moche preachynge and strengthed them .
44015033	And after they had taryed there a space they were let goo in peace of the brethren vnto the Apostles .
44015034	Not with stondynge it pleasyd Sylas to abyde there still .
44015035	Paul and Barnabas continued in Antioche teachynge and preachynge the worde of the Lorde with other many .
44015036	But after a certayne space Paul sayde vnto Barnabas : Let vs goo agayne and visite oure brethren in every cite where we have shewed the worde of the Lorde and se how they do .
44015037	And Barnabas gave counsell to take wt them Iohn called also Marke .
44015038	But Paul thought it not mete to take him vnto their company whiche departed from them at Pamphylia and went not with them to the worke .
44015039	And the dissencion was so sharpe bitwene them that they departed a sunder one from the other : so that Barnabas toke Marke and sayled vnto Cypers .
44015040	And Paul chose Sylas and departed delyvered of ye brethren vnto the grace of god .
44015041	And he went thorowe all Cyria and Cilicia stablisshynge the congregacions .
44016001	Then came he to Derba and to Lystra . And beholde a certayne disciple was there named Timotheus a womans sonne which was a Iewas and beleved : but his father was a Greke .
44016002	Of whom reported well the brethren of Lystra and of Iconium .
44016003	The same Paul wolde yt he shuld goo forth with him and toke and circumcised him because of the Iewes which were in those quarters : for they knewe all that his father was a Greke .
44016004	As they went thorow ye cities they delyvered the the decrees for to kepe ordeyned of the Apostles and elders which were at Ierusalem .
44016005	And so were the congregacions stablisshed in the fayth and encreased in noumbre dayly .
44016006	When they had goone thorow out Phrigia and the region of Galacia and were forbydde of the holy gost to preach the worde in Asia
44016007	they came to Misia and sought to goo into Bethinia . But the sprete soffered the not .
44016008	Then they went over Misia and cam doune to Troada .
44016009	And a vision appered to Paul in ye nyght . There stode a man of Macedonia and prayed him sayinge : come into Macedonia and helpe vs .
44016010	After he had sene ye vision immediatly we prepared to goo into Macedonia certified yt the lorde had called vs for to preache the gospell vnto them .
44016011	Then lowsed we forth from Troada and with a strayght course came to Samothracia and the nexte daye to Neapolim
44016012	and from thence to Philippos which is the chefest citie in ye partes of Macedonia and a fre cite . We were in that cite abydynge a certayne dayes .
44016013	And on the saboth dayes we went out of the cite besydes a ryver where men were wont to praye and we sate doune and spake vnto the wemen which resorted thyther .
44016014	And a certayne woman named Lydia a seller of purple of the cite of Thiatira which worshipped God gave vs audience . Whose hert the Lorde opened that she attended vnto the thinges which Paul spake .
44016015	When she was baptised and her housholde she besought vs sayinge : Yf ye thinke that I beleve on the Lorde come into my housse and abyde there . And she constrayned vs .
44016016	And it fortuned as we went to prayer a certayn damsell possessed with a sprete that prophesied met vs which brought her master and mastres moche vauntage with prophesyinge .
44016017	The same folowed Paul and vs and cryed sayinge : these men are the servauntes of the most hye God which shewe vnto vs the waye of salvacion .
44016018	And this dyd she many dayes . But Paul not cotent turned about and sayd to the sprete : I commaunde the in the name of Iesu Christ that thou come out of her . And he came out the same houre .
44016019	And when her master and mastres sawe yt the hope of their gaynes was gone they caught Paul and Sylas and drue the into the market place vnto the rulars
44016020	and brought them to the officers sayinge : These men trouble oure cite which are Iewes
44016021	and preache ordinaunces which are not laufull for vs to receave nether to observe seinge we are Romayns .
44016022	And the people ranne on them and the officers rent their clothes and comaunded them to be beaten with roddes .
44016023	And when they had beaten them sore they cast them into preson comaundynge the iayler to kepe them surely .
44016024	Which iayler when he had receaved suche comaundment thrust them into the ynner preson and made their fete fast in the stockes .
44016025	At mydnyght Paul and Sylas prayed and lauded God . And the presoners hearde them .
44016026	And sodenly ther was a greate erth quake so that ye fonndacion of the preson was shaken and by and by all the dores opened and every mannes bondes were lowsed .
44016027	When the keper of ye preson waked out of his slepe and sawe the preson dores open he drue out his swearde and wolde have kylled him selfe supposynge the presoners had bene fledde .
44016028	But Paul cryed with a lowde voyce sayinge : Do thy selfe no harme for we are all heare .
44016029	Then he called for a lyght and sprange in and came tremblynge and fell doune before Paul and Sylas
44016030	and brought them out and sayde : Syrs what must I do to be saved ?
44016031	And they sayde : beleve on the Lorde Iesus and thou shalt be saved and thy housholde .
44016032	And they preached vnto him the worde of the Lorde and to all that were in his housse .
44016033	And he toke them the same houre of the nyght and wasshed their woundes and was baptised with all that belonged vnto him strayght waye .
44016034	Whe he had brought them into his housse he set meate before them and ioyed that he with all his housholde boleved on God .
44016035	And when it was daye the officers sent the ministres sayinge : Let those men goo .
44016036	The keper of ye preson tolde this sayinge to Paul the officiers have sent worde to lowse you . Now therfore get you hence and goo in peace .
44016037	Then sayde Paul vnto them : they have beaten vs openly vncomdempned for all yt we are Romayns and have cast vs into preson : and now wolde they sende vs awaye prevely ? Naye not so but let them come the selves and set vs out .
44016038	When the ministres tolde these wordes vnto the officers they feared when they hearde that they were Romayns
44016039	and came and besought them and brought them out and desyred them to departe out of the cite .
44016040	And they wet out of ye preson and entred into the housse of Lidia and whe they had sene the brethren they comforted them and departed .
44017001	As they made their iorney thorow Amphipolis and Appolonia they came to Thessalonica where was a synagoge of the Iewes .
44017002	And Paul as his maner was went in vnto them and thre saboth doyes declared oute of the scripture vnto them
44017003	openynge and allegynge that Christ must nedes have suffred and rysen agayne from deeth and that this Iesus was Christ whom ( sayde he ) I preache to you .
44017004	And some of them beleved and came and companyed with Paul and Sylas : also of the honourable Grekes a greate multitude and of the chefe wemen not a feawe .
44017005	But the Iewes which beleved not havynge indignacio toke vnto the evyll men which were vagabondes and gadered a company and set all the cite on a roore and made asaute vnto the housse of Iason and sought to bringe the out to the people .
44017006	But when they founde them not they drue Iason and certayne brethren vnto the heedes of the cite cryinge : these that trouble the worlde are come hydder also
44017007	which Iason hath receaved prevely . And these all do contrary to the elders of Cesar affirmynge another kynge one Iesus .
44017008	And they troubled the people and the officers of the cite when they hearde these thinges .
44017009	And when they were sufficiently answered of Iason and of the other they let the goo .
44017010	And the brethren immediatly sent awaye Paul and Sylas by nyght vnto Berrea . Which when they were come thyther they entred into ye synagoge of the Iewes .
44017011	These were the noblest of byrthe amonge the of Thessalonia which receaved the worde wt all diligence of mynde and searched ye scriptures dayly whether those thinges were even so .
44017012	And many of the beleved : also of worshipfull weme which were Grekes and of men not a feawe .
44017013	When the Iewes of Thessalonia had knowledge that ye worde of God was preached of Paul at Berrea they came there and moved the people .
44017014	And then by and by ye brethre sent awaye Paul to goo as it were to ye see : but Sylas and Timotheus abode there still .
44017015	And they that gyded Paul brought him vnto Attens and receaved a comaundment vnto Sylas and Timotheus for to come to him at once and came their waye .
44017016	Whyll Paul wayted for them at Attens his sprete was moved in him to se the cite geven to worshippinge of ymages .
44017017	Then he disputed in the synagoge wt the Iewes and with the devout persones and in the market dayly with the that came vnto him .
44017018	Certayne philosophers of ye Epicures and of ye stoyckes disputed with him . And some ther were which sayde : what will this babler saye . Other sayd : he semeth to be a tydynges bringer of newe devyls because he preached vnto them Iesus and the resurreccion .
44017019	And they toke him and brought him into Marsestrete sayinge : maye we not knowe what this newe doctrine wher of thou speakest is ?
44017020	For thou bringest straunge tydynges to oure eares . We wolde knowe therfore what these thinges meane .
44017021	For all the Attenians and straungers which were there gave the selves to nothinge els but ether to tell or to heare newe tydynges .
44017022	Paul stode in the myddes of Marse strete and sayde : ye men of Attens I perceave that in all thinges ye are to supersticious .
44017023	For as I passed by and behelde the maner how ye worship youre goddes I founde an aultre wher in was written : vnto ye vnknowen god . Whom ye then ignoratly worship him shewe I vnto you .
44017024	God that made the worlde and all that are in it seynge that he is Lorde of heven and erth he dwelleth not in temples made with hondes
44017025	nether is worshipped with mennes hondes as though he neded of eny thinge seinge he him selfe geveth lyfe and breeth to all men every where
44017026	and hath made of one bloud all nacions of men for to dwell on all the face of the erthe and hath assigned before how longe tyme and also the endes of their inhabitacion
44017027	that they shuld seke God yf they myght fele and fynde him though he be not farre from every one of vs .
44017028	For in him we lyve move and have oure beynge as certayne of youre awne Poetes sayde . For we are also his generacion .
44017029	For as moche then as we are the generacion of God we ought not to thynke that the godhed is lyke vnto golde silver or stone graven by crafte and ymaginacion of man .
44017030	And the tyme of this ignoraunce God regarded not : but now he byddeth all men every where repent
44017031	because he hath apoynted a daye in the which he will iudge the worlde acordynge to ryghtewesses by that man whom he hath apoynted and hath offered faith to all men after that he had raysed him from deeth .
44017032	When they hearde of ye resurreccion from deeth some mocked and other sayde : we will heare the agayne of this matter .
44017033	So Paul departed from amonge them .
44017034	Howbeit certayne men clave vnto Paul and beleved amonge the which was Dionysius a senatour and a woman named Damaris and other with them .
44018001	After that Paul departed from Attens and came to Corinthu
44018002	and founde a certayne Iewe named Aquila borne in Ponthus latly come from Italie wt his wyfe Priscilla ( because that the Emperour Claudius had comaunded all Iewes to departe fro Rome ) and he drewe vnto them .
44018003	And because he was of the same crafte he abode with them and wrought : their crafte was to make tentes .
44018004	And he preached in ye synagoge every saboth daye and exhorted the Iewes and the gentyls .
44018005	When Sylas and Timotheus were come from Macedonia Paul was constrayned by the sprete to testifie to the Iewes that Iesus was very Christ .
44018006	And whe they sayde cotrary and blasphemed he shoke his rayment and sayde vnto the : youre bloud apon youre awne heeddes and fro hence forth I goo blamelesse vnto ye gentyls .
44018007	And he departed thence and entred into a certayne manes housse named Iustus a worshiper of god whose housse ioyned harde to ye synagoge .
44018008	How be it one Crispus ye chefe rular of the synagoge beleved on ye lorde with all his housholde and many of the Corinthias gave audience and beleved and were baptised .
44018009	Then spake the lorde to Paul in the nyght by a vision : be not afrayde but speake and holde not thy peace :
44018010	for I am with the and no man shall invade the that shall hurte the . For I have moche people in this cite .
44018011	And he continued there a yeare and sixe monethes and taught them the worde of God .
44018012	When Gallio was rular of the countre of Acaia the Iewes made insurreccion with one accorde agaynst Paul and brought him to the iudgement seate
44018013	saying : this felow counceleth men to worship God contrary to ye lawe .
44018014	And as Paul was about to open his mouth Gallio sayde vnto ye Iewes : yf it were a matter of wronge or an evyll dede ( o ye Iewes ) reason wolde that I shuld heare you :
44018015	but yf it be a question of wordes or of names or of youre lawe loke ye to it youre selves . For I wilbe no iudge in soche maters
44018016	and he drave them from the seate .
44018017	Then toke all the Grekes Sostenes the chefe rular of the synagoge and smote him before the iudges seate . And Gallio cared for none of tho thinges .
