44018018	Paul after this taryed there yet a good whyle and then toke his leave of the brethren and sayled thence into Ciria Priscilla and Aquila accompanyinge him . And he shore his heed in Cenchrea for he had a vowe .
44018019	And he came to Ephesus and lefte them there : but he him selfe entred into the synagoge and reasoned with the Iewes .
44018020	When they desyred him to tary longer tyme with the he consented not
44018021	but bad the fare well sayinge . I must nedes at this feast that cometh be in Ierusalem : but I will returne agayne vnto you yf God will . And he departed from Ephesus
44018022	and came vnto Cesarea : and ascended and saluted the congregacion and departed vnto Antioche
44018023	and when he had taryed there a whyle he departed . And went over all the countre of Galacia and Phrigia by order strengthynge all the disciples .
44018024	And a certayne Iewe named Apollos borne at Alexandria came to Ephesus an eloquent man and myghty in the scriptures .
44018025	The same was informed in the waye of the Lorde and he spake fervently in the sprete and taught diligently the thinges of the Lorde and knewe but the baptim of Iohn only .
44018026	And the same began to speake boldely in the synagoge . And when Aquila and Priscilla had hearde him : they toke him vnto them and expounded vnto him the waye of God more perfectly .
44018027	And when he was disposed to goo into Acaia the brethren wrote exhortynge the disciples to receave him . After he was come thyther he holpe them moche which had beleved thorowe grace .
44018028	And myghtely he overcame the Iewes and that openly shewynge by the scriptures that Iesus was Christ .
44019001	It fortuned whyll Appollo was at Corinthum that Paul passed thorow the vpper costes and came to Ephesus and foude certayne disciples
44019002	and sayd vnto them : have ye receaved the holy gost sence ye beleved ? And they sayde vnto him : no we have not hearde whether ther be eny holy goost or no .
44019003	And he sayd vnto them : wher wt were ye then baptised ? And they sayd : with Iohns baptim
44019004	Then sayde Paul : Iohn verely bapiised with the baptim of repentaunce sayinge vnto the people that they shuld beleve on him which shuld come after him : that is on Christ Iesus .
44019005	When they hearde that they were baptised in the name of the lorde Iesu .
44019006	And Paul layde his hondes apon them and the holy gost came on them and they spake with tonges and prophesied
44019007	and all the men were aboute . xii .
44019008	And he went into the synagoge and behaved him selfe boldely for the space of thre monethes disputynge and gevynge them exhortacions of the kyngdome of God .
44019009	When dyvers wexed harde herted and beleved not but spake evyll of the waye and that before the multitude : he departed from them and seperated the disciples . And disputed dayly in ye scole of one called Tyranus .
44019010	And this contynued by the space of two yeares : so yt all they which dwelt in Asia hearde the worde of the lorde Iesu bothe Iewes and Grekes .
44019011	And god wrought no small miracles by the hondes of Paul :
44019012	so that from his body were brought vnto the sicke napkyns or partlettes and the diseases departed from the and the evyll spretes went out of them .
44019013	Then certayne of the vagabounde Iewes exorcistes toke apon them to call over them which had evyll spretes the name of the lorde Iesus sayinge : We adiure you by Iesu who Paul preacheth .
44019014	And ther were seven sonnes of one Sceva a Iewe and chefe of the prestes which dyd so .
44019015	And the evyll sprete answered and sayde : Iesus I knowe and Paul I knowe : but who are ye ?
44019016	And ye man in who the evyll sprete was ranne on the and overcame the and prevayled agaynst them so that they fledde out of that housse naked and wouded .
44019017	And this was knowen to all ye Iewes and Grekes also which dwelt at Ephesus and feare came on them all and they magnified the name of ye lorde Iesus .
44019018	And many yt beleved came and confessed and shewed their workes .
44019019	Many of the which vsed curious craftes brought their bokes and burned the before all men and they counted the price of the and foude it fifty thousande silverlynges .
44019020	So myghtely grewe ye worde of god and prevayled .
44019021	After these thinges were ended Paul purposed in the sprete to passe over Macedonia and Achaia and to goo to Ierusalem saying : After I have bene there I must also se Rome .
44019022	So sent he into Macedonia two of the that ministred vnto him Timotheus and Erastus : but he him selfe remayned in Asia for a season .
44019023	The same tyme ther arose no lytell a do aboute that waye .
44019024	For a certayne man named Demetrius a silvermyth which made silver schrynes for Diana was not a lytell beneficiall vnto the craftes men .
44019025	Which he called to geder with the worke men of lyke occupacion and sayd : Syrs ye knowe that by this crafte we have vauntage .
44019026	Moreover ye se and heare that not alone at Ephesus but almost thorowe oute all Asia this Paul hath persuaded and turned awaye moche people saying yt they be not goddes which are made wt hondes .
44019027	So that not only this oure crafte cometh into parell to be set at nought : but also that ye temple of ye greate goddas Diana shuld be despysed and her magnificence shuld be destroyed which all Asia and the worlde worshippeth .
44019028	When they hearde these sayinges they were full of wrathe and cryed out saying : Greate is Diana of the Ephesians .
44019029	And all the cite was on a roore and they russhed in to the comen hall with one assent and caught Gayus and Aristarcus men of Macedonia Pauls companios .
44019030	When Paul wolde have entred in vnto the people ye disciples suffered him not .
44019031	Certayne also of ye chefe of Asia which were his frendes sent vnto him desyrynge him that he wolde not preace into the comen hall .
44019032	Some cryed one thinge and some another and the congregacion was all out of quiet and ye moare parte knewe not wherfore they were come togeder .
44019033	Some of the company drue forth Alexander the Iewes thrustynge him forwardes . Alexander beckened with the honde and wolde have geven ye people an answer .
44019034	When they knewe ye he was a Iewe ther arose a shoute almost for the space of two houres of all men cryinge greate is Diana of the Ephesians .
44019035	When the toune clarcke had ceased the people he sayd : ye men of Ephesus what man is it that knoweth not how that the cite of the Ephesians is a worshipper of the great goddas Diana and of ye ymage which came fro heven .
44019036	Seinge then yt no man sayth here agaynst ye ought to be content and to do nothinge rasshly :
44019037	For ye have brought hyther these me whiche are nether robbers of churches nor yet despisers of youre goddes .
44019038	Wherfore yf Demetrius and the craftes men which are wt him have eny sayinge to eny man the lawe is open and ther are ruelars let the accuse one another .
44019039	Yf ye goo about eny other thinge it maye be determined in a lawfull cogregacion
44019040	For we are in ieoperdy to be accused of this dayes busines : for as moche as ther is no cause wherby we maye geve a rekenynge of this concourse of people .
44019041	And when he had thus spoken he let the congregacion departe .
44020001	After the rage was ceased Paul called the disciples vnto him and toke his leave of them and departed for to goo into Macedonia .
44020002	And when he had gone over those parties and geven them large exhortacions he came into Grece
44020003	and there abode . iii . monethes . And when the Iewes layde wayte for him as he was about to sayle into Syria he purposed to returne thorowe Macedonia .
44020004	Ther acompanied him into Asia Sopater of Berrea and of Thessalonia Aristarcus and Secundus and Gayus of Derba and Timotheus : and out of Asia Tychicus and Trophimos .
44020005	These went before and taryed vs at Troas .
44020006	And we sayled awaye fro Philippos after the ester holydayes and came vnto them to Troas in five dayes where we abode seven dayes .
44020007	And on the morowe after the saboth daye the disciples came to geder for to breake breed and Paul preached vnto them ( redy to departe on the morowe ) and cotinued the preachynge vnto mydnyght .
44020008	And there were many lyghtes in the chamber where thy were gaddered to geder
44020009	and there sate in a wyndowe a certayne yonge man named Eutichos fallen into a depe slepe . And as Paul declared he was the moare overcome with slepe and fell doune from the thyrde lofte and was taken vp deed .
44020010	Paul went doune and fell on him and embrased him and sayde : make nothinge ado for his lyfe is in him .
44020011	When he was come vp agayne he brake breed and tasted and comened a longe whyle even tyll the mornynge and so departed .
44020012	And they brought the youge man a lyve and were not alytell comforted .
44020013	And we went a fore to shippe and lowsed vnto Asson there to receave Paul . For so had he apoynted and wolde him selfe goo a fote .
44020014	When he was come to vs vnto Asson we toke him in and came to Mytelenes .
44020015	And we sayled thence and came the nexte daye over agaynst Chios . And the nexte daye we aryved at Samos and taryed at Trogilion . The nexte daye we came to Myleton :
44020016	for Paul had determined to leave Ephesus as they sayled because he wolde not spende ye tyme in Asia . For he hasted to be ( yf he coulde possible ) at Ierusalem at the daye of pentecoste .
44020017	Wherfore from Myleton he sent to Ephesus and called the elders of the cogregacion .
44020018	And when they were come to him he sayde vnto the : Ye knowe fro the fyrst daye yt I came vnto Asia after what maner I have bene wt you at all ceasons
44020019	servynge the lorde with all humblenes of mynde and with many teares and temptacions which happened vnto me by the layinges awayte of the Ieues
44020020	and how I kept backe no thinge that was profitable : but that I have shewed you and taught you openly and at home in youre houses
44020021	witnessinge bothe to the Iewes and also to the Grekes the repentaunce toward God and faith towarde oure Lorde Iesu .
44020022	And now beholde I goo bounde in the sprete vnto Ierusalem and knowe not what shall come on me there
44020023	but that the holy goost witnesseth in every cite sayinge : yt bondes and trouble abyde me .
44020024	But none of tho thinges move me : nether is my lyfe dere vnto my selfe that I myght fulfill my course wt ioye and the ministracio which I have receaved of ye Lorde Iesu to testify the gospell of ye grace of god .
44020025	And now beholde I am sure yt hence forth ye all ( thorow who I have gone preachinge ye kyngdome of God ) shall se my face no moore .
44020026	Wherfore I take you to recorde this same daye that I am pure fro the bloude of all me .
44020027	For I have kepte nothinge backe : but have shewed you all the counsell of God .
44020028	Take hede therfore vnto youre selves and to all the flocke wherof the holy goost hath made you oversears to rule the congregacion of God which he hath purchased with his bloud .
44020029	For I am sure of this that after my departynge shall greveous wolves entre in amonge you which will not spare the flocke .
44020030	Moreover of youre awne selves shall men aryse speakinge perverse thinges to drawe disciples after the .
44020031	Therfore awake and remember that by the space of . iii . yeares I ceased not to warne every one of you both nyght and daye with teares .
44020032	And now brethren I comende you to God and to the worde of his grace which is able to bylde further and to geve you an inheritaunce amoge all them which are sanctified .
44020033	I have desyred no mas silver golde or vesture .
44020034	Ye knowe well yt these hondes have ministred vnto my necessities and to them that were wt me .
44020035	I have shewed you all thinges how that so laborynge ye ought to receave the weake and to remember the wordes of the Lorde Iesu howe that he sayde : It is more blessed to geve then to receave .
44020036	When he had thus spoken he kneled doune and prayed with them all .
44020037	And they wept all aboundantly and fell on Pauls necke and kissed him
44020038	sorowinge most of all for the wordes which he spake that they shuld se his face no moore . And they acompanyed him vnto the shyppe .
44021001	And it chaunsed that assone as we had launched forth and were departed from them we came with a strayght course vnto Choon and the daye folowinge vnto the Rhodes and from thence vnto Patara .
44021002	And we founde a shippe redy to sayle vnto Phenices and went a borde and set forthe .
44021003	Then appered vnto vs Cyprus and we lefte it on the lefte honde and sayled vnto Syria and came vnto Tyre . For there the shyppe vnladed her burthen .
44021004	And when we had founde brethren we taryed there . vii . dayes . And they tolde Paul thorowe ye sprete that he shuld not goo vp to Ierusalem .
44021005	And when the dayes were ended we departed and went oure wayes and they all brought vs on oure waye wt their wyves and chyldren tyll we were come out of the cyte . And we kneled doune in the shore and prayde .
44021006	And when we had taken oure leave one of another we toke shyppe and they returned home agayne .
44021007	When we had full ended the course fro Tyre we aryved at Ptolomaida and saluted the brethren and abode with the one daye .
44021008	The nexte daye we that were of Pauls copany departed and came vnto Cesarea . And we entred into the housse of Philip ye Evagelist which was one of the seve deacones and abode with him .
44021009	The same man had fower doughters virges which dyd prophesy .
44021010	And as we taried there a good many dayes there came a certayne prophete from Iurie named Agabus .
44021011	When he was come vnto vs he toke Pauls gerdell and bounde his hondes and fete and sayde : thus saith the holy goost : so shall ye Iewes at Ierusalem bynde the man yt oweth this gerdell and shall delyver him into the hondes of the gentyls .
44021012	When we hearde this both we and other of the same place besought him that he wolde not goo vp to Ierusalem .
44021013	Then Paul answered and sayde : what do ye wepynge and breakinge myne hert ? I am redy not to be bound only but also to dye at Ierusalem for ye name of ye Lorde Iesu .
44021014	When we coulde not turne his mynde we ceased sayinge : the will of ye Lorde be fulfilled .
44021015	After those dayes we made oure selfes redy and went vp to Ierusalem .
44021016	There went with vs also certayne of his disciples of Cesarea and brought with them one Mnason of Cyprus an olde disciple with whom we shuld lodge .
44021017	And when we were come to Ierusalem the brethren receaved vs gladly .
44021018	And on the morowe Paul wet in with vs vnto Iames . And all the elders came to geder .
44021019	And when he had saluted them he tolde by order all thinges that God had wrought amoge the getyls by his ministracion .
44021020	And when they hearde it they glorified the Lorde and sayde vnto him : thou seist brother how many thousande Iewes ther are which beleve and they are all zelous over ye lawe .
44021021	And they are informed of the that thou teachest all the Iewes which are amoge the gentyls to forsake Moses and sayst that they ought not to circumcise their chyldren nether to live after the customes .
44021022	What is it therfore ? The multitude must nedes come togeder . For they shall heare that thou arte come .
44021023	Do therfore this that we saye to the . We have . iiii . men which have a vowe on them .
44021024	Them take and purifye thy selfe with them and do cost on them that they maye shave their heeddes and all shall knowe yt tho thinges which they have hearde concerninge the are nothinge : but that thou thy selfe also walkest and kepest the lawe .
44021025	For as touchinge the gentyls which beleve we have written and concluded yt they observe no soche thinges : but that they kepe them selves from thinges offred to ydoles from bloud fro strangled and fro fornicacion .
44021026	Then the nexte daye Paul toke the men and purified him selfe with them and entred into the teple declaringe that he observed the dayes of ye purificacio vntyll that an offeringe shuld be offred for every one of them .
44021027	And as the seven dayes shuld have bene ended ye Iewes which were of Asia when they sawe him in the teple they moved all the people and layde hondes on him
44021028	cryinge : men of Israel helpe . This is the man that teacheth all men every where agaynst the people and the lawe and this place . Moreover also he hath brought Grekes into the teple and hath polluted this holy place .
44021029	For they sawe one Trophimus an Ephesian with him in the cyte . Him they supposed Paul had brought into the teple .
44021030	And all the cyte was moved and the people swarmed to geder . And they toke Paul and drue him out of the teple and forthwith the dores were shut to .
44021031	As they went about to kyll him tydinges came vnto the hye captayne of the soudiers that all Ierusalem was moved .
44021032	Which immediatly toke soudiers and vndercaptaynes and ranne doune vnto them . When they sawe ye vpper captayne and the soudiers they lefte smytinge of Paul .
44021033	Then the captayne came neare and toke him and comaunded him to be bounde with two chaynes and demaunded what he was and what he had done .
44021034	And one cryed this another that amoge the people . And whe he coulde not knowe the certayntie for ye rage he comaunded him to be caryed into the castle .
44021035	And whe he came vnto a grece it fortuned that he was borne of the soudiers of the violence of the people .
44021036	For the multitude of the people folowed after cryinge : awaye wt him .
44021037	And as Paul shuld have bene caryed into the castle he sayde vnto the hye Captayne : maye I speake vnto the ? Which sayde : canst thou speake Greke ?
44021038	Arte not thou that Egypcian which before these dayes made an vproure and ledde out into the wildernes . iiii . thousande men that were mortherers ?
44021039	But Paul sayde : I am a ma which am a Iewe of Tharsus a cite in Cicill a Citesyn of no vyle cite I beseche ye soffre me to speake vnto ye people .
44021040	When he had geve him licece Paul stode on ye steppes and beckned with the honde vuto the people and ther was made a greate silence . And he spake vnto the in ye Ebrue tonge sayinge :
44022001	Ye men brethre and fathers heare myne answere which I make vnto you .
44022002	Whe they hearde that he spake in ye Ebrue tonge to them they kept the moore silence . And he sayde :
44022003	I am verely aman which am a Iewe borne in Tharsus a cite in Cicill : neverthelesse yet brought vp in this cite at ye fete of Gamaliel and informed diligently in the lawe of the fathers and was fervent mynded to Godwarde as ye all are this same daye
44022004	and I persecuted this waye vnto the deeth byndynge and delyveringe into preson bothe men and wemen
44022005	as the chefe prest doth beare me witnes and all the elders : of whom also I receaved letters vnto the brethren and wet to Damasco to bringe them which were there bounde vnto Ierusalem for to be punysshed .
44022006	And it fortuned as I made my iorney and was come nye vnto Damasco aboute none yt sodenly ther shone fro heaven a greate lyght rounde aboute me
44022007	and I fell vnto the erth and hearde a voyce sayinge vnto me : Saul Saul why persecutest thou me ?
44022008	And I answered : what arte thou Lorde ? And he sayd vnto me : I am Iesus of Nazareth whom thou persecutest .
44022009	And they that were with me sawe verely a lyght and were a frayde : but they hearde not the voyce of him that spake with me .
44022010	And I sayde : what shall I do Lorde ? And the Lorde sayde vnto me : Aryse and goo into Damasco and there it shalbe tolde the of all thinges which are apoynted for the to do .
44022011	And when I sawe nothynge for the brightnes of that light I was ledde by the honde of them that were with me and came into Damasco .
44022012	And one Ananias a perfect man and as pertayninge to the lawe havinge good reporte of all the Iewes which there dwelt
44022013	came vnto me and stode and sayd vnto me : Brother Saul loke vp . And that same houre I receaved my sight and sawe him .
44022014	And he sayde the God of oure fathers hath ordeyned the before that thou shuldest knowe his will and shuldest se that which is rightfull and shuldest heare the voyce of his mouth :
44022015	for thou shalt be his witnes vnto all men of tho thinges which thou thou hast sene and hearde .
44022016	And now : why tariest thou ? Aryse and be baptised and wesshe awaye thy synnes in callinge on ye name of ye Lorde .
44022017	And it fortuned when I was come agayne to Ierusalem and prayde in the teple yt I was in a trauce
44022018	and sawe him sayinge vnto me . Make haste and get the quickly out of Ierusalem : for they will not receave thy witnes yt thou bearest of me .
44022019	And I sayde : Lorde they knowe that I presoned and bet in every synagoge them that beleved on the .
44022020	And when the bloud of thy witnes Steven was sheed I also stode by and consented vnto his deeth and kept the rayment of them that slewe him .
44022021	And he sayde vnto me : departe for I will sende the a farre hence vnto the Gentyls .
44022022	They gave him audience vnto this worde and then lifte vp their voyces and sayde : a waye wt soche a felowe fro the erth : yt is pitie that he shuld live .
44022023	And as they cryed and cast of their clothes and thrue dust into ye ayer
44022024	ye captayne bade him to be brought into the castle and commaunded him to be scourged and to be examined that he myght knowe wherfore they cryed on him .
44022025	And as they bounde him with thoges Paul sayde vnto the Centurion that stode by : Ys it laufull for you to scourge a man that is a Romain and vncondempned ?
44022026	When the Centurion hearde that he went and tolde the vpper captayne sayinge : What intendest thou to do ? This man is a Romayne .
44022027	Then the vpper captayne came and sayde to him : tell me art thou a Romayne ? He sayde : Yee .
44022028	And the captayne answered : with a greate some obtayned I this fredome . And Paul sayde : I was fre borne .
44022029	Then strayght waye departed from him they which shuld have examyned him . And the hye captayne also was a frayde after he knewe that he was a Romayne : because he had bounde him .
44022030	On the morowe because he wolde have knowen the certayntie wherfore he was accused of the Iewes he lowsed him from his bondes and commaunded the hye Prestes and all the counsell to come together and brought Paul and set him before them .
44023001	Paul behelde the counsell and sayde : men and brethre I have lived in all good coscience before God vntill this daye .
44023002	The hye prest Ananias comaunded the that stode by to smyte him on the mouth .
44023003	Then sayde Paul to him : God smyte the thou payntyd wall . Sittest thou and iudgest me after the lawe : and commaundest me to be smytten contrary to the lawe ?
44023004	And they that stode by sayde : revylest thou Goddes hye preste ?
44023005	Then sayd Paul : I wist not brethren that he was the hye preste . For it is writte thou shalt not curse the rular of thy people .
44023006	When Paul perceaved that the one parte were Saduces and the other Pharises : he cryed oute in the counsell . Men and brethren I am a Pharisaye the sonne of a Pharisaye . Of the hope and resurreccion fro deeth I am iudged .
44023007	And when he had so sayde ther arose a debate bitwene the Pharisayes and ye Saduces and the multitude was devided .
44023008	For ye Saduces saye that ther is no resurreccio nether angell nor sprete . But the Pharisayes graunt bothe .
44023009	And ther arose a great crye and the Scribes which were of the Pharisayes parte arose and strove sayinge : we fynde none evyll in this man . Though a sprete or an angell hath apered to him let vs not stryve agaynst God .
44023010	And when ther arose greate debate the captayne fearynge lest Paul shuld have bene pluckt asondre of them comaunded the soudiers to goo doune and to take him from amonge them and to bringe him into the castle .
44023011	The nyght folowyng God stode by him and sayde : Be of good cheare Paul : for as thou hast testified of me in Ierusalem so must thou beare witnes at Rome .
44023012	When daye was come certayne of the Iewes gaddered them selves to geder and made a vowe sayinge that they wolde nether eate nor drinke till they had killed Paul .
44023013	They were aboute . xl . which had made this conspiracio .
44023014	And they cam to ye chefe prestes and elders and sayde : we have boude oure selves with a vowe that we will eate nothinge vntill we have slayne Paul .
44023015	Now therfore geve ye knowlege to the vpper captayne and to the counsell that he bringe him forth vnto vs to morow as though we wolde knowe some thinge more perfectly of him . But we ( or ever he come neare ) are redy in ye meane season to kill him .
44023016	When Pauls sisters sonne hearde of their layinge awayte he wet and entred into the castle and tolde Paul .
44023017	And Paul called one of ye vnder captaynes vnto him and sayde : bringe this younge man vnto ye hye captayne : for he hath a certayne thinge to shewe him .
44023018	And he toke him and sayd : Paul ye presoner called me vnto him and prayed me to brige this youge ma vnto ye which hath a certayne matter to shewe ye .
44023019	The hye captayne toke him by the hond and wet a parte with him out of the waye : and axed him : what hast thou to saye vnto me ?
44023020	And he sayd : the Iewes are determined to desyre the yt thou woldest brynge forth Paul to morowe into the counsell as though they wolde enquyre somwhat of him more parfectly .
44023021	But folowe not their mindes : for ther lyein wayte for him of the moo then . xl . men which have boude the selves wt a vowe that they will nether eate ner drinke till they have killed him . And now are they redy and loke for thy promes .
44023022	The vpper captayne let ye yoge man departe and charged : se thou tell it out to no man that thou hast shewed these thinges to me .
44023023	And he called vnto him two vnder captaynes sayinge : make redy two hondred soudiers to goo to Cesarea and horsmen threscore and ten and speare men two houndred at the thyrde houre of the nyght .
44023024	And delyvre them beastes that they maye put Paul on and bringe him safe vnto Felix the hye debite
44023025	and wrote a letter in this maner .
44023026	Claudius Lisias vnto ye most mighty rular Felix sendeth gretinges .
44023027	This man was take of the Iewes and shuld have bene killed of them . Then cam I with soudiers and rescued him and perceaved that he was a Romayne .
44023028	And when I wolde have knowen the cause wherfore they accused him I brought him forth into their cousell .
44023029	There perceaved I yt he was accused of questios of their lawe : but was not giltye of eny thinge worthy of deeth or of bondes .
44023030	Afterwarde when it was shewed me how that ye Iewes layde wayte for ye man I sent him strayght waye to the and gave commaundmet to his accusars yf they had ought agaynst him to tell it vnto ye : fare well .
44023031	Then ye soudiers as it was comaunded the toke Paul and brought him by nyght to Antipatras .
44023032	On the morowe they lefte horsmen to goo with him and returned vnto the castle .
44023033	Which when they cam to Cesarea they delivered the epistle to the debite and presented Paul before him .
44023034	When the debite had redde the letter he axed of what countre he was and when he vnderstode that he was of Cicill
44023035	I will heare the ( sayde he ) whe thyne accusars are come also : and commaunded him to be kepte in Herodes pallys .
44024001	After . v . dayes Ananias the hye preste descended with elders and with a certayne Oratour named Tartullus and enformed the ruelar of Paul .
44024002	When Paul was called forth Tartullus beganne to accuse him saying : Seynge yt we live in great quyetnes by the meanes of the and that many good thinges are done vnto this nacion thorow thy providence :
44024003	that alowe we ever and in all places most myghty Felix with all thankes .
44024004	Notwithstondinge that I be not tedeous vnto the I praye the that thou woldest heare vs of thy curtesy a feawe wordes .
44024005	We have founde this ma a pestilent felowe and a mover of debate vnto all the Iewes thorowe out the worlde and a mayntayner of ye secte of the Nazarites
44024006	and hath also enforsed to pollute the temple . Whom we toke and wolde have iudged acordinge to oure lawe :
44024007	but the hye captayne Lisias came vpon vs and with great violence toke him awaye out of oure hodes
44024008	comaundinge his accusars to come vnto the . Of who thou mayst ( yf thou wilt enquyre ) knowe the certayne of all these thinges where of we accuse him .
44024009	The Iewes lyke wyse affermed sayinge that it was even so .
44024010	Then Paul ( after that the rular him selfe had beckened vnto him that he shuld speake ) answered : I shall with a moare quyet minde answere for my selfe for as moche as I vnderstonde yt thou hast bene of many yeares a iudge vnto this people
44024011	because that thou mayst knowe yt there are yet . xii . dayes sence I went vp to Ierusalem for to praye
44024012	and that they nether founde me in the teple disputinge with eny man other raysinge vp the people nether in the Synagoges nor in the cite .
44024013	Nether can they prove ye thinges wher of they accuse me .
44024014	But this I confesse vnto ye that after that waye ( which they call heresy ) so worshippe I the God of my fathers belevinge all thinges which are writte in the lawe and ye Prophetes
44024015	and have hope towardes God that ye same resurreccion from deeth ( which they them selves loke for also ) shalbe both of iust and vniust .
44024016	And therfore stody I to have a cleare consciece towarde God and toward man also .
44024017	But after many yeres I came and brought almes to my people and offeringes
44024018	in the which they founde me purified in the teple nether with multitude nor yet wt vnquyetnes How beit there were certayne Iewes out of Asia
44024019	which ought to be here present before the and accuse me yf they had ought agaynst me :
44024020	or els let these same here saye if they have founde eny evyll doinge in me whill I stonde here in ye counsell :
44024021	except it be for this one voyce yt I cryed stondinge amoge the of the resurreccion fro deeth am I iudged of you this daye .
44024022	When Felix hearde these thinges he deferde them for he knewe very well of yt waye and sayde : when Lisias the captayne is come I will know the vtmost of youre matters .
44024023	And he commaunded an vndercaptayne to kepe Paul and that he shuld have rest and that he shuld forbyd none of his aquayntauce to minister vnto him or to come vnto him .
44024024	And after a certayne dayes ca Felix and his wyfe Drusilla which was a Iewas and called forth Paul and hearde him of the fayth which is toward Christ .
44024025	And as he preached of righteousnes temperauce and iudgement to come Felix trembled and answered : thou hast done ynough at this tyme departe when I have a conveniet tyme I will sende for the .
44024026	He hoped also that money shuld have bene geven him of Paul that he myght lowse him : wherfore he called him ye oftener and comened with him .
44024027	But after two yeare Festus Porcius came into Felix roume . And Felix willinge to shewe ye Iewes a pleasure lefte Paul in preson bounde .
44025001	When Festus was come into the province after thre dayes he ascended fro Cesarea vnto Ierusalem .
44025002	Then enformed him the hye prestes and the chefe of the Iewes of Paul . And they besought him
44025003	and desired faveour agaynst him that he wold sende for him to Ierusalem : and layde awayte for him in the waye to kill him .
44025004	Festus answered that Paul shuld be kept at Cesarea : but that he him selfe wold shortly departe thither .
44025005	Let the therfore ( sayd he ) which amoge you are able to do it come doune with vs and accuse him if ther be eny faute in the man .
44025006	When he had taried there moare then ten dayes he departed vnto Cesarea and the nexte daye sate doune in the iudgemet seate and commaunded Paul to be brought .
44025007	When he was come the Iewes which were come fro Ierusalem came aboute him and layde many and greveous complayntes agaynst Paul which they coulde not prove
44025008	as longe as he answered for him selfe that he had nether agaynst the lawe of the Iewes nether agaynst the temple nor yet agaynst Cesar offended eny thinge at all .
44025009	Festus willinge to do the Iewes a pleasure answered Paul and sayde : wilt thou goo to Ierusalem and there be iudged of these thinges before me ?
44025010	Then sayd Paul : I stonde at Cesars iudgemet seate where I ought to be iudged . To ye Iewes have I no harme done as thou verely well knowest .
44025011	If I have hurte them or comitted eny thinge worthy of deeth I refuse not to dye . If none of these thinges are where of they accuse me no man owght to delyver me to them . I appeale vnto Cesar .
44025012	Then spake Festus with deliberacion and answered . Thou hast appealed vnto Cesar : vnto Cesar shalt thou goo .
44025013	After a certayne dayes kinge Agrippa and Bernice came vnto Cesarea to salute Festus .
44025014	And when they had bene there a good ceason Festus rehersed Paules cause vnto ye kynge sayinge : ther is a certayne man left in preson of Felix
44025015	about whom when I came to Ierusalem the hye prestes and elders of the Iewes enformed me and desyred to have iudgement agaynst him .
44025016	To whom I answered : It is not the maner of the Romayns to delyver eny man that he shuld perisshe before that he which is accused have the accusars before him and have licence to answer for him selfe concerninge ye cryme layde agaynst him :
44025017	whe they were come hidder wt out delaye on the morowe I sate to geve iudgement and comaunded ye ma to be brought forthe .
44025018	Agaynst who when ye accusers stode vp they brought none accusacion of soche thinges as I supposed :
44025019	but had certayne questions agaynst him of their awne supersticion and of one Iesus which was ded : whom Paul affirmed to be alyve .
44025020	And be cause I douted of soche maner questions I axed him whyther he wolde goo to Ierusalem and there be iudged of these matters .
44025021	Then when Paul had appealed to be kept vnto the knowledge of Cesar I commaunded him to be kept tyll I myght sende him to Cesar .
44025022	Agrippa sayd vnto Festus : I wolde also heare ye man my selfe . To morowe ( sayde he ) thou shalt heare him .
44025023	And on ye morowe when Agrippa was come and Bernice with greate pompe and were entred into the counsell housse with the captaynes and chefe men of the cite at Festus commaundement Paul was brought forth .
44025024	And Festus sayde : kynge Agrippa and all men which are heare present wt vs : ye se this man about whom all the multitude of the Iewes have bene with me both at Ierusalem and also here cryinge that he ought not to lyve eny lenger .
44025025	Yet founde I nothinge worthy of deeth that he had comitted . Neverthelesse seinge that he hath appealed to Cesar I have determined to sende him .
44025026	Of whom I have no certayne thinge to wryte vnto my lorde . Wherfore I have brought him vnto you and specially vnto the kynge Agrippa that after examinacion had I myght have sumwhat to wryte .
44025027	For me thynketh it vnreasonable for to sende a presoner and not to shewe the causes which are layde agaynst him .
44026001	Agrippa sayde vnto Paul : thou arte permitted to speake for thy selfe . Then Paul stretched forth the honde and answered for him selfe .
44026002	I thynke my selfe happy kynge Agrippa because I shall answere this daye before the of all the thinges wherof I am accused of ye Iewes
44026003	namely because thou arte experte in all customes and questions which are amonge the Iewes . Wherfore I beseche the to heare me paciently .
44026004	My lyvynge of a chylde which was at the fyrst amoge myne awne nacion at Ierusalem knowe all the Iewes
44026005	which knew me from ye beginnynge yf they wolde testifie it . For after the most straytest secte of oure laye lyved I a pharisaye .
44026006	And now I stond and am iudged for the hope of the promes made of God vnto oure fathers :
44026007	vnto which promes oure . xii . tribes instantly servynge God daye and nyght hope to come . For which hopes sake kynge Agrippa am I accused of the Iewes .
44026008	Why shuld it be thought a thinge vncredible vnto you that god shuld rayse agayne the deed ?
44026009	I also verely thought in my selfe that I ought to do many cotrary thinges clene agaynst the name of Iesus of Nazareth :
44026010	which thinge I also dyd in Ierusalem . Where many of the sainctes I shut vp in preson and had receaved auctorite of ye hye prestes . And whe they were put to deeth I gave the sentence .
44026011	And I punysshed them ofte in every synagoge and compelled them to blaspheme : and was yet more mad apon them and persecuted the even vnto straunge cities .
44026012	About the which thinges as I went to Damasco with auctorite and licence of the hye Prestes
44026013	even at myddaye ( o kynge ) I sawe in ye waye a lyght from heven above the brightnes of the sunne shyne rounde about me and them which iorneyed with me .
44026014	When we were all fallen to the erth I hearde a voyce speakynge vnto me and sayinge in ye Hebrue tonge : Saul Saul why persecutest thou me ? It is harde for the to kicke agaynste the pricke .
44026015	And I sayde : Who arte thou lorde ? And he sayde I am Iesus whom thou persecutest .
44026016	But ryse and stond vp on thy fete . For I have apered vnto the for this purpose to make the a minister and a witnes both of tho thinges which thou hast sene and of tho thinges in the which I will appere vnto the
44026017	delyverynge the from the people and from ye gentyls vnto which nowe I sende the
44026018	to open their eyes that they myght turne from darcknes vnto lyght and from the power of Satan vnto God that they maye receave forgevenes of synnes and inheritauce amonge the which are sanctified by fayth in me .
44026019	Wherfore kynge Agrippa I was not disobedient vnto the hevenly vision :
44026020	but shewed fyrst vnto them of Damasco and at Ierusalem and thorow out all the costes of Iewry and to the gentyls that they shuld repent and turne to God and do the ryght workes of repentaunce .
44026021	For this cause the Iewes caught me in the temple and went about to kyll me .
44026022	Neverthelesse I obtayned helpe of God and cotynew vnto this daye witnessyng bothe to small and to greate saying none other thinges then those which the prophetes and Moses dyd saye shuld come
44026023	that Christ shulde suffre and that he shuld be the fyrst that shulde ryse from deeth and shuld shewe lyght vnto the people and the gentyls .
44026024	As he thus answered for him selfe : Festus sayde with a lowde voyce : Paul thou arte besides thy selfe . Moche learnynge hath made the mad .
44026025	And Paul sayde : I am not mad most dere Festus : but speake the wordes of trueth and sobernes .
44026026	The kynge knoweth of these thinges before whom I speke frely : nether thynke I that eny of these thinges are hydden fro him . For this thinge was not done in a corner .
44026027	Kynge Agrippa belevest thou ye prophetes ? I wote well thou belevest .
44026028	Agrippa sayde vnto Paul : Sumwhat thou bringest me in mynde for to be come a Christen .
44026029	And Paul sayd : I wolde to God that not only thou : but also all that heare me to daye were not sumwhat only but altogeder soche as I am except these bondes .
44026030	And when he had thus spoken the kynge rose vp and the debite and Bernice and they that sate with them .
44026031	And when they were gone aparte they talked betwene them selves sayinge : This man doeth nothinge worthy of deeth nor of bondes .
44026032	Then sayde Agrippa vnto Festus : This man myght have bene lowsed yf he had not appealed vnto Cesar .
44027001	When it was cocluded that we shuld sayle into Italy they delivered Paul and certayne other presoners vnto one named Iulius an vnder captayne of Cesars soudiars .
44027002	And we entred into a ship of Adramicium and lowsed from lond apoynted to sayle by the costes of Asia one Aristarcus out of Macedonia of the contre of Thessalia beinge with vs .
44027003	And the nexte daye we came to Sidon . And Iulius courteously entreated Paul and gave him liberte to goo vnto his frendes and to refresshe him selfe .
44027004	And from thence lanched we and sayled harde by Cypers because the wyndes were contrarye .
44027005	Then sayled we over the see of Cilicia and Pamphylia and came to Myra a cite in Lycia .
44027006	And there ye vnder captayne founde a shippe of Alexander redy to sayle into Italy and put vs therin .
44027007	And when we had sayled slowly many dayes and scace were come over agaynst Gnydon ( because the wynde with stode vs ) we sayled harde by the costes of Candy over agaynste Salmo
44027008	and with moche worke sayled beyonde yt and came vnto a place called good porte . Nye whervnto was a citie called Lasea .
44027009	When moche tyme was spent and saylinge was now ieoperdeous because also that we had overlonge fasted Paul put them in remembraunce
44027010	and sayde vnto them Syrs I perceave that this vyage wilbe with hurte and moche domage not of the ladynge and ship only : but also of oure lyves .
44027011	Neverthelather the vndercaptayne beleved the governer and the master better then tho thinges which were spoken of Paul .
44027012	And because the haven was not comodius to wynter in many toke counsell to departe thence yf by eny meanes they myght attayne to Phenices and there to wynter which is an haven of Candy and servith to the southwest and northwest wynde .
44027013	When the south wynde blewe they supposynge to obtayne their purpose lowsed vnto Asson and sayled paste all Candy .
44027014	But anone after ther arose agaynste their purpose a flawe of wynde out of the northeeste .
44027015	And when the ship was caught and coulde not resist the wynde we let her goo and drave with the wether .
44027016	And we came vnto an yle named Clauda and had moche worke to come by abote
44027017	which they toke vp and vsed helpe vndergerdynge the shippe fearynge lest we shuld have fallen into Syrtes and we let doune a vessell and so were caryed .
44027018	The nexte daye when we were tossed wt an exceadynge tempest they lyghtened ye ship
44027019	and the thyrde daye we cast out with oure awne hondes the tacklynge of the shippe .
44027020	When at the last nether sunne nor starre in many dayes appered and no small tempest laye apon vs all hope that we shuld be saved was then taken awaye .
44027021	Then after longe abstinence Paul stode forth in the myddes of them and sayde : Syrs ye shulde have harkened to me and not have lowsed from Candy nether to have brought vnto vs this harme and losse .
44027022	And nowe I exhorte you to be of good chere . For ther shalbe no losse of eny mas lyfe amonge you save of the ship only .
44027023	For ther stode by me this nyght the angell of God whose I am and whom I serve
44027024	sayinge : feare not Paul for thou must be brought before Cesar . And lo God hath geven vnto the all that sayle with ye .
44027025	Wherfore Syrs be of good chere : for I beleve God that so it shalbe even as it was tolde me .
44027026	How be it we must be cast into a certayne ylonde .
44027027	But when ye fourtethe nyght was come as we were caryed in Adria about mydnyght the shipmen demed that ther appered some countre vnto the :
44027028	and sounded and founde it . xx . feddoms . And when they had gone a lytell further they sounded agayne and founde . xv . feddoms .
44027029	Then fearinge lest they shuld have fallen on some Rocke they cast . iiii . ancres out of the sterne and wysshed for ye daye .
44027030	As the shipmen were about to fle out of the ship and had let doune the bote into the see vnder a coloure as though they wolde have cast ancres out of the forshippe :
44027031	Paul sayd vnto ye vnder captayne and the soudiers : excepte these abyde in the ship ye cannot be safe .
44027032	Then the soudiers cut of the rope of the bote and let it fall awaye .
44027033	And in ye meane tyme betwixt that and daye Paul besought them all to take meate sayinge : this is ye fourtenthe daye that ye have taried and continued fastynge receavinge nothinge at all .
44027034	Wherfore I praye you to take meate : for this no dout is for youre helth : for ther shall not an heere fall fro the heed of eny of you .
44027035	And when he had thus spoke he toke breed and gave thankes to God in presence of the all and brake it and begane to eate .
44027036	Then were they all of good cheare and they also toke meate .
44027037	We were all together in ye ship two hundred thre score and sixtene soules .
44027038	And whe they had eate ynough they lightened ye ship and cast out the wheate into the see .
44027039	Whe yt was daye they knew not ye lande but they spied a certayne haven with a banke into ye which they were mynded ( yf yt were possible ) to thrust in the ship .
44027040	And when they had taken vp the ancres they comytted them selves vnto the see and lowsed the rudder bondes and hoysed vp ye mayne sayle to the wynde and drue to londe .
44027041	But they chaunsed on a place which had the see on bothe the sydes and thrust in the ship . And the foore parte stucke fast and moved not but ye hynder brake with the violence of the waves .
44027042	The soudears counsell was to kyll ye presoners lest eny of them when he had swome out shulde fle awaye .
44027043	But the vndercaptayne willinge to save Paul kept the from their purpose and commaunded that they yt could swyme shulde cast the selves first in to ye see and scape to londe .
44027044	And the other he comaunded to goo some on bordes and some on broken peces of the ship . And so it came to passe that they came all safe to londe .
44028001	And when they were scaped then they knewe that the yle was called Milete .
44028002	And the people of the countre shewed vs no lytell kyndnes : for they kyndled a fyre and receaved vs every one because of the present rayne and because of colde .
44028003	And when Paul had gaddered a boundle of stickes and put them into the fyre ther came a viper out of the heet and lept on his honde .
44028004	When the men of the contre sawe the worme hange on his honde they sayde amonge the selves : this man must nedes be a mortherer . Whome ( though he have escaped the see ) yet vengeaunce suffreth not to lyve .
44028005	But he shouke of the vermen into the fyre and felt no harme .
44028006	Howbeit they wayted when he shuld have swolne or fallen doune deed sodenly . But after they had loked a greate whyle and sawe no harme come to him they chaunged their myndes and sayde that he was a God .
44028007	In the same quarters the chefe man of the yle whose name was Publius had a lordshippe : the same receaved vs and lodged vs thre dayes courteously .
44028008	And it fortuned that the father of Publius laye sicke of a fiever and of a bluddy flixe . To who Paul entred in and prayde and layde his hondes on him and healed him .
44028009	When this was done other also which had diseases in the yle came and were healed .
44028010	And they dyd vs gret honoure . And when we departed they laded vs with thinges necessary .
44028011	After thre monethes we departed in a ship of Alexandry which had wyntred in the yle whose badge was Castor and Pollux .
44028012	And whe we came to Cyracusa we taryed there . iii . dayes .
44028013	And from thence we set a compasse and came to Regium . And after one daye the south wynde blewe and we came the next daye to Putiolus :
44028014	where we founde brethren and were desyred to tary with them seven dayes and so came to Rome .
44028015	And from thence when ye brethren hearde of vs they came agaynst vs to Apiphorum and to ye thre taverns . When Paul sawe the he thanked God and wexed bolde .
44028016	And when he came to Rome ye vnder captayne delyvered ye presoners to ye chefe captayne of ye host : but Paul was suffered to dwell by him selfe with one soudier that kept him .
44028017	And it fortuned after thre dayes that Paul called ye chefe of ye Iewes together . And whe they were come he sayde vnto the : Men and brethren though I have comitted nothinge agaynst the people or lawes of oure fathers : yet was I delyvered presoner from Ierusalem in to the hondes of ye Romayns .
44028018	Which when they had examined me wolde have let me goo because they founde no cause of deeth in me .
44028019	But when ye Iewes cryed cotrary I was constrayned to appeale vnto Cesar : not because I had ought to accuse my people of .
44028020	For this cause have I called for you eve to se you and to speake with you : because that for the hope of Israel I am bounde with this chayne .
44028021	And they sayde vnto him : We nether receaved letters out of Iewry pertayninge vnto ye nether came eny of the brethren that shewed or spake eny harme of the .
44028022	But we will heare of the what thou thynkest . For we have hearde of this secte that every wheare it is spoken agaynst .
44028023	And when they had apoynted him a daye ther came many vnto him into his lodgynge . To whom he expounded and testifyed the kyngdome of God and preached vnto the of Iesu : both out of the lawe of Moses and also out of the prophetes even from mornynge to nyght .
44028024	And some beleved ye thinges which were spoken and some beleved not .
44028025	When they agreed not amonge the selves they departed after that Paul had spoken one worde . Well spake the holy goost by Esay ye prophet vnto oure fathers
44028026	sayinge : Goo vnto this people and saye : with youre eares shall ye heare and shall not vnderstonde : and with youre eyes shall ye se and shall not perceave .
44028027	For the hert of this people is wexed grosse and their eares were thycke of hearynge and their eyes have they closed : lest they shuld se with their eyes and heare with their eares and vnderstonde with their hertes and shuld be converted and I shulde heale them .
44028028	Be it knowen therfore vnto you that this salvacion of God is sent to the gentyls and they shall heare it .
44028029	And when he had sayde that the Iewes departed and had grete despicios amonge them selves .
44028030	And Paul dwelt two yeares full in his lodgynge and receaved all that came to him
44028031	preachyng the kyngdome of God and teachynge those thinges which concerned the lorde Iesus with all confidence vnforboden .
45001001	Paul the seruaut of Iesus Christ called to be an Apostle put a parte to preache the Gospell of God
45001002	which he promysed afore by his Prophetes in the holy scriptures
45001003	that make mension of his sonne the which was begotte of the seed of David as pertayninge to the flesshe :
45001004	and declared to be the sonne of God with power of the holy goost that sanctifieth sence ye tyme that Iesus Christ oure Lorde rose agayne from deeth
45001005	by whom we have receaved grace and apostleshyppe to bringe all maner hethe people vnto obedience of the fayth that is in his name :
45001006	of the which hethen are ye a part also which are Iesus christes by vocacio .
45001007	To all you of Rome beloved of God and saynctes by callinge . Grace be with you and peace from God oure father and from the Lorde Iesus Christ .
45001008	Fyrst verely I thanke my God thorow Iesus Christ for you all because youre fayth is publisshed through out all the worlde .
45001009	For God is my witnes whom I serve with my sprete in the Gospell of his sonne that with out ceasinge I make mencion of you alwayes in my prayers
45001010	besechinge that at one tyme or another a prosperous iorney ( by ye will of god ) myght fortune me to come vnto you .
45001011	For I longe to see you that I myght bestowe amoge you some spirituall gyfte to strength you with all :
45001012	that is that I myght have consolacion together with you through the commen fayth which bothe ye and I have .
45001013	I wolde that ye shuld knowe brethre how that I have often tymes purposed to come vnto you ( but have bene let hitherto ) to have some frute amonge you as I have amonge other of ye Gentyls .
45001014	For I am detter both to the Grekes and to them which are no Grekes vnto the learned and also vnto the vnlearned .
45001015	Lykewyse as moche as in me is I am redy to preache the Gospell to you of Rome also .
45001016	For I am not ashamed of the Gospell of Christ because it is ye power of God vnto salvacio to all yt beleve namely to the Iewe and also to ye getyle .
45001017	For by it ye rightewesnes which cometh of god is opened fro fayth to fayth . As it is written : The iust shall live by fayth .
45001018	For the wrath of God apereth from heven agaynst all vngodlynes and vnrightewesnes of me which withholde ye trueth in vnrightewesnes
45001019	seynge what maye be knowen of God that same is manifest amoge them . For God dyd shewe it vnto them .
45001020	So that his invisible thinges : that is to saye his eternall power and godhed are vnderstonde and sene by the workes from the creacion of the worlde . So that they are without excuse
45001021	in as moche as when they knewe god they glorified him not as God nether were thakfull but wexed full of vanities in their imaginacions and their folisshe hertes were blynded .
45001022	When they couted them selves wyse they became foles
45001023	and turned the glory of the immortall god vnto the similitude of the ymage of mortall man and of byrdes and foure foted beastes and of serpentes .
45001024	Wherfore god lykewyse gave the vp vnto their hertes lustes vnto vnclennes to defyle their awne boddyes bitwene them selves :
45001025	which tourned his truthe vnto a lye and worshipped and served the creatures more then ye maker which is blessed for ever . Ame .
45001026	For this cause god gave them vp vnto shamfull lustes . For even their wemen did chaunge the naturall vse vnto the vnnaturall .
45001027	And lyke wyse also the men lefte the naturall vse of the woma and bret in their lustes one on another . And man with man wrought filthynes and receaved in them selves the rewarde of their erroure as it was accordinge .
45001028	And as it semed not good vnto them to be aknowen of God even so God delivered them vp vnto a leawde mynd yt they shuld do tho thinges which were not comly
45001029	beinge full of all vnrighteous doinge of fornicacio wickednes coveteousnes maliciousnes full of envie morther debate disseyte evill codicioned whisperers
45001030	backbyters haters of God doers of wroge proude bosters bringers vp of evyll thinges disobedient to father and mother
45001031	with out vnderstondinge covenaunte breakers vnlovinge trucebreakers and merciles .
45001032	Which me though they knew the rightewesnes of God how that they which soche thinges commyt are worthy of deeth yet not only do the same but also have pleasure in them that do them .
45002001	Therfore arte thou inexcusable o man whosoever thou be yt iudgest . For in ye same wherin thou iudgest another thou condemnest thy selfe . For thou that iudgest doest eve the same selfe thinges
45002002	But we are sure that the iudgement of God is accordinge to trueth agaynst them which commit soche thinges .
45002003	Thikest thou this O thou ma that iudgest them which do soche thinges and yet doest eve the very same yt thou shalt escape ye iudgemet of God ?
45002004	Ether despisest thou the riches of his goodnes paciece and longe sufferaunce ? and remembrest not how that the kyndnes of God ledith the to repentaunce ?
45002005	But thou after thyne harde herte yt canot repet heapest ye togedder the treasure of wrath agaynste the daye of vengeauce when shalbe opened ye rightewes iudgemet of god
45002006	which will rewarde every ma accordinge to his dedes :
45002007	that is to saye prayse honoure and immortalite to them which cotinue in good doynge and seke eternall lyfe .
45002008	But vnto them that are rebellious and disobey the trueth yet folowe iniquytie shall come indignacion and wrath
45002009	tribulacion and anguysshe vpon the soule of every man that doth evyll : of the Iewe fyrst and also of the gentyll .
45002010	To every man that doth good shall come prayse honoure and peace to ye Iewe fyrst and also to the gentyll .
45002011	For ther is no parcialyte with god . But whosoever hath synned with out lawe shall perisshe wt out lawe .
45002012	And as many as haue synned vnder the lawe shalbe iudged by the lawe .
45002013	For before god they are not ryghteous which heare ye lawe : but the doers of the lawe shalbe iustified .
45002014	For if the gentyls which have no lawe do of nature the thynges contayned in the lawe : then they havynge no lawe are a lawe vnto them selves
45002015	which shewe the dede of the lawe wrytten in their hertes : whyll their conscience beareth witnes vnto them and also their thoughtes accusynge one another or excusynge
45002016	at the daye when god shall iudge the secretes of men by Iesus Christ accordinge to my Gospell .
45002017	Beholde thou arte called a Iewe and trustest in the lawe and reioysist in God
45002018	and knowest his will and hast experience of good and bad in that thou arte informed by the lawe :
45002019	and belevest that thou thy silfe arte a gyde vnto the blynde a lyght to them which are in darcknes
45002020	an informer of them which lacke discrecio a teacher of vnlearned which hast the ensample of that which ought to be knowen and of the truth in the lawe .
45002021	But thou which teachest another teachest not thy selfe . Thou preachest a man shuld not steale : and yet thou stealest .
45002022	Thou sayst a man shuld not commit advoutry : and thou breakest wedlocke . Thou abhorrest ymages and robbest God of his honoure .
45002023	Thou reioysest in the lawe and thorow breakinge the lawe dishonourest God .
45002024	For the name of god is evyll spoken of amonge the Gentyls thorowe you as it is written .
45002025	Circumcisio verely avayleth if thou kepe the lawe . But if thou breake the lawe thy circumcision is made vncircumcision .
45002026	Therfore if the vncircumcised kepe the ryght thinges contayned in the lawe : shall not his vncircumcision be counted for circumcision ?
45002027	And shall not vncircumcision which is by nature ( yf it kepe the lawe ) iudge the which beynge vnder the letter and circumcision dost transgresse the lawe ?
45002028	For he is not a Iewe which is a Iewe out warde . Nether is that thynge circumcision which is outwarde in the flesshe .
45002029	But he is a Iewe which is hid wythin and the circucisio of ye herte is the true circumcision which is in the sprete and not in ye letter whose prayse is not of men but of god .
45003001	What preferment then hath the Iewe ? other what a vauntageth circumcision ?
45003002	Surely very moche . Fyrst vnto them was committed the worde of God
45003003	What then though some of them did not beleve ? shall their vnbeleve make the promes of god with out effecte ?
45003004	God forbid . Let god be true and all men lyars as it is written : That thou myghtest be iustifyed in thy sayinge and shuldest overcome when thou arte iudged .
45003005	Yf oure vnrightewesnes make the rightewesnes of God more excellent : what shall we saye ? Is God vnrighteous which taketh vengeauce ? I speake after the maner of me .
45003006	God forbid . For how then shall God iudge the worlde ?
45003007	Yf the veritie of God appere moare excellent thorow my lye vnto his prayse why am I hence forth iudged as a synner ?
45003008	and saye not rather ( as men evyll speake of vs and as some affirme that we saye ) let vs do evyll that good maye come therof . Whose damnacion is iuste .
45003009	What saye we then ? Are we better then they ? No in no wyse . For we have all ready proved how that both Iewes and Gentils are all vnder synne
45003010	as it is writte : There is none righteous no not one :
45003011	There is none that vnderstondith there is none yt seketh after God
45003012	they are all gone out of ye waye they are all made vnprofytable ther is none that doeth good no not one .
45003013	Their throte is an open sepulchre with their tounges they have disceaved : the poyson of Aspes is vnder their lippes .
45003014	Whose mouthes are full of coursynge and bitternes .
45003015	Their fete are swyfte to sheed bloud .
45003016	Destruccion and wretchednes are in their wayes .
45003017	And the waye of peace they have not knowen .
45003018	There is no feare of God before their eyes .
45003019	Ye and we knowe that whatsoever ye lawe sayth he sayth it to them which are vnder the lawe . That all mouthes maye be stopped and all the worlde be subdued to god
45003020	because that by ye dedes of the lawe shall no flesshe be iustified in the sight of God . For by the lawe commeth the knowledge of synne .
45003021	Now verely is ye rigtewesnes that cometh of God declared without the fulfillinge of ye lawe havinge witnes yet of ye lawe and of the Prophetes .
45003022	The rightewesnes no dout which is good before God cometh by ye fayth of Iesus Christ vnto all and vpon all that beleve . Ther is no differece :
45003023	for all have synned and lacke the prayse yt is of valoure before God :
45003024	but are iustified frely by his grace through the redemcion that is in Christ Iesu
45003025	whom God hath made a seate of mercy thorow faith in his bloud to shewe ye rightewesnes which before him is of valoure in yt he forgeveth ye synnes yt are passed which God dyd suffre
45003026	to shewe at this tyme ye rightewesnes yt is alowed of him yt he myght be couted iuste and a iustifiar of him which belevith on Iesus .
45003027	Where is then thy reioysinge ? It is excluded . By what lawe ? by ye lawe of workes ? Naye : but by the lawe of fayth .
45003028	For we suppose that a man is iustified by fayth without the dedes of ye lawe .
45003029	Is he the God of the Iewes only ? Is he not also the God of the Gentyls ? Yes eve of the Gentyles also .
45003030	For it is God only which iustifieth circumcision which is of fayth and vncircumcision thorow fayth .
45003031	Do we then destroye the lawe thorow fayth ? God forbid . But we rather mayntayne the lawe .
45004001	What shall we saye then that Abraham oure father as pertayninge to ye flesshe dyd finde ?
45004002	If Abraham were iustified by dedes the hath he wherin to reioyce : but not with god .
45004003	For what sayth the scripture ? Abraham beleved god and it was counted vnto him for rightewesnes .
45004004	To him that worketh is the rewarde not reckened of favour : but of duty .
45004005	To him that worketh not but beleveth on him that iustifieth the vngodly is his fayth counted for rightewesnes .
45004006	Even as David describeth the blessedfulnes of the man vnto whom god ascribeth rihgtewesnes without dedes .
45004007	Blessed are they whose vnrightewesnes are forgeven and whose synnes are covered .
45004008	Blessed is that ma to whom the Lorde imputeth not synne .
45004009	Came this blessednes then vpon the circumcised or vpon the vncircucised ? We saye verely how that fayth was rekened to Abraham for rightewesnes .
45004010	How was it rekened ? in the tyme of circumcision ? or in the tyme before he was circumcised ? Not in tyme of circucision : but when he was yet vncircumcised .
45004011	And he receaved the signe of circumcision as a seale of yt rightewesnes which is by fayth which fayth he had yet beynge vncircucised : that he shuld be the father of all them that beleve though they be not circumcised that rightewesnes myght be imputed to them also :
45004012	and that he myght be the father of the circumcised not because they are circumcised only : but because they walke also in the steppes of that fayth yt was in oure father Abraham before the tyme of circumcision .
45004013	For the promes that he shuld be the heyre of the worlde was not geven to Abraha or to his seed thorow the lawe : but thorow ye rightewesnes which cometh of fayth .
45004014	For yf they which are of the lawe be heyres then is fayth but vayne and the promes of none effecte .
45004015	Because the lawe causeth wrathe . For where no lawe is there is no trasgression .
45004016	Therfore by fayth is the inheritauce geven that it myght come of faveour : and the promes myght be sure to all the seed . Not to them only which are of the lawe : but also to them which are of the fayth of Abraham which is the father of vs all .
45004017	As it is wrytten : I have made the a father to many nacions even before god whom thou hast beleved which quyckeneth the deed and called those thinges which be not as though they were .
45004018	Which Abraham contrary to hope beleved in hope that he shuld be the father of many nacions accordynge to that which was spoken :
45004019	So shall thy seed be . And he faynted not in the fayth nor yet consydered hys awne body which was now deed even when he was almost an hondred yeare olde : nether yet that Sara was past chyldeberinge .
45004020	He stackered not at the promes of God thorow vnbelefe : but was made stronge in the fayth and gave honour to God
45004021	full certifyed that what he had promised that he was able to make good .
45004022	And therfore was it reckened to him for rightewesnes .
45004023	It is not written for him only that it was reckened to him for rightewesnes :
45004024	but also for vs to whom it shalbe counted for rightewesnes so we beleve on him that raysed vp Iesus oure Lorde from deeth .
45004025	Which was delivered for oure synnes and rose agayne forto iustifie vs .
45005001	Because therfore that we are iustified by fayth we are at peace with god thorow oure Lorde Iesue Christ :
45005002	by who we have awaye in thorow fayth vnto this grace wherin we stonde aud reioyce in hope of the prayse that shalbe geven of God .
45005003	Nether do we so only : but also we reioyce in tribulacion . For we know that tribulacion bringeth pacience
45005004	pacience bringeth experience experience bringeth hope .
45005005	And hope maketh not ashamed for the love of God is sheed abrod in oure hertes by the holy goost which is geven vnto vs .
45005006	For when we were yet weake accordynge to ye tyme : Christ dyed for vs which were vngodly .
45005007	Yet scace will eny man dye for a rightewes man . Paraventure for a good ma durst a man dye .
45005008	But God setteth out his love that he hath to vs seinge that whyll we were yet synners Christ dyed for vs .
45005009	Moche more then now ( seynge we are iustifyed in his bloud ) shall we be saved from wrath thorow him .
45005010	For yf when we were enemyes we were reconciled to God by the deeth of his sonne : moche more seinge we are reconciled we shal be preservid by his lyfe .
45005011	Not only so but we also ioye in God by the meanes of oure Lorde Iesus Christ by whom we have receavyd the attonment .
45005012	Wherfore as by one ma synne entred into the worlde and deeth by the meanes of synne . And so deeth went over all men in somoche that all men synned .
45005013	For even vnto the tyme of the lawe was synne in the worlde : but synne was not regarded as longe as ther was no lawe :
45005014	neverthelesse deeth rayned fro Adam to Moses eve over them also that synned not wt lyke transgression as dyd Adam : which is ye similitude of him that is to come .
45005015	But the gyfte is not lyke as the synne . For yf thorow the synne of one many be deed : moche more plenteous vpon many was the grace of God and gyfte by grace : which grace was geven by one man Iesus Christ .
45005016	And ye gifte is not over one synne as deeth cam thorow one synne of one yt synned . For damnacion cam of one synne vnto condemnacion : but the gyft cam to iustify fro many synnes .
45005017	For yf by the synne of one deeth raigned by the meanes of one moche more shall they which receave aboundance of grace and of the gyfte of rightewesnes raygne in lyfe by the meanes of one ( that is to saye ) Iesus Christ .
45005018	Lykewyse then as by the synne of one condemnacion cam on all men : eve so by the iustifyinge of one cometh the rightewesnes that bringeth lyfe vpo all men .
45005019	For as by one manes disobediece many be cam synners : so by ye obediece of one shall many be made righteous .
45005020	But ye lawe in the meane tyme entred in yt synne shuld encreace . Neverthelater where aboundaunce of synne was there was more plenteousnes of grace .
45005021	That as synne had raigned vnto deeth even so might grace raygne thorow rightewesnes vnto eternall lyfe by the helpe of Iesu Christ .
45006001	What shall we saye then ? Shall we continue in synne that there maye be aboundaunce of grace ?
45006002	God forbyd . How shall we that are deed as touchynge synne live eny lenger therin ?
45006003	Remember ye not that all we which are baptysed in the name of Iesu Christ are baptysed to dye with him ?
45006004	We are buryed with him by baptim for to dye that lykewyse as Christ was raysed vp from deeth by the glorye of the father : eve so we also shuld walke in a newe lyfe .
45006005	For yf we be graft in deeth lyke vnto him : even so must we be in the resurreccio .
45006006	This we must remeber that oure olde man is crucified with him also that the body of synne myght vtterly be destroyed that hence forth we shuld not be servauntes of synne .
45006007	For he that is deed ys iustified from synne .
45006008	Wherfore yf we be deed with Christ we beleve that we shall live with him :
45006009	remembringe that Christ once raysed fro deeth dyeth no more . Deeth hath no moare power over him .
45006010	For as touchynge that he dyed he dyed concernynge synne once . And as touchinge that he liveth he liveth vnto God .
45006011	Lykewyse ymagen ye also that ye are deed concernynge synne : but are alive vnto God thorow Iesus Christ oure Lorde .
45006012	Let not synne raygne therfore in youre mortall bodyes that ye shuld thervnto obey in the lustes of it .
45006013	Nether geve ye youre members as instrumentes of vnrightewesnes vnto synne : but geve youre selves vnto God as they that are alive from deeth . And geve youre membres as iustrumetes of rightewesnes vnto God .
45006014	Let not synne have power over you . For ye are not vnder the lawe but vnder grace .
45006015	What then ? Shall we synne because we are not vnder the lawe : but vnder grace ? God forbyd .
45006016	Remember ye not how yt to whom soever ye comit youre selves as servautes to obey his servauntes ye are to whom ye obey : whether it be of synne vnto deeth or of obedience vnto rightewesnes ?
45006017	God be thanked yt though ye were once the servauntes of synne ye have yet obeyed with herte vnto the forme of doctryne wher vnto ye were delyvered .
45006018	Ye are then made fre from synne and are be come the servauntes of rightewesnes .
45006019	I will speake grossly because of the infirmitie of youre flesshe . As ye have geve youre membres servauntes to vnclennes and to iniquitie fro iniquitie vnto iniquitie : even so nowe geve youre membres servantes vnto rightewesnes yt ye maye be sanctified .
45006020	For when ye were the servauntes of synne ye were not vnder rightewesnes .
45006021	What frute had ye then in tho thinges wher of ye are now ashamed . For the ende of tho thynges is deeth .
45006022	But now are ye delivered from synne and made the servauntes of God and have youre frute that ye shuld be sanctifyed and the ende everlastinge lyfe .
45006023	For the rewarde of synne is deeth : but eternall lyfe is the gyfte of God thorow Iesus Christ oure Lorde .
45007001	Remember ye not brethren ( I speake to them yt know the lawe ) how that the lawe hath power over a man as longe as it endureth ?
45007002	For the woman which is in subieccion to a man is bounde by the lawe to the man as longe as he liveth . Yf the man be deed she is lowsed from the lawe of the man .
45007003	So then yf whill the man liveth she couple her selfe with another man she shalbe counted a wedlocke breaker . But yf the man be deed she is fre fro the lawe : so that she is no wedlocke breaker though she couple her selfe with another man .
45007004	Even so ye my brethren are deed concerninge the lawe by the body of Christ yt ye shuld be coupled to another ( I meane to him that is rysen agayne fro deeth ) that we shuld bringe forth frute vnto God .
45007005	For when we were in the flesshe the lustes of synne which were stered vppe by ye lawe raygned in oure membres to bringe forth frute vnto deeth .
45007006	But now are we delivered fro the lawe and deed fro that whervnto we werein bondage that we shuld serve in a newe conversacion of ye sprete and not in ye olde conversacion of the letter .
45007007	What shall we saye then ? is ye lawe synne ? God forbid : but I knewe not what synne meant but by the lawe . For I had not knowne what lust had meant excepte the lawe had sayde thou shalt not lust .
45007008	But synne toke an occasion by the meanes of the commaundement and wrought in me all manner of concupiscece . For with out the lawe synne was deed .
45007009	I once lived with out lawe . But when the commaundement came synne revyved and I was deed .
45007010	And the very same comaundement which was ordeyned vnto lyfe was founde to be vnto me an occasion of deeth .
45007011	For synne toke occasion by the meanes of the comaundement and so disceaved me and by the selfe commaundement slewe we .
45007012	Wherfore the lawe is holy and the commaundement holy iust and good .
45007013	Was that then which is good made deeth vnto me ? God forbyd . Naye synne was deeth vnto me that it myght appere how that synne by the meanes of that which is good had wrought deeth in me : that synne which is vnder the commandemet myght be out of measure synfull .
45007014	For we knowe that the lawe is spirituall : but I am carnall solde vnder synne
45007015	because I wote not what I doo . For what I wold that do I not : but what I hate that do I .
45007016	Yf I do now that which I wolde not I graute to the lawe that it is good .
45007017	So then nowe it is not I that do it but synne that dwelleth in me .
45007018	For I knowe that in me ( that is to saye in my flesshe ) dwelleth no good thinge . To will is present with me : but I fynde no meanes to performe that which is good .
45007019	For I doo not yt good thinge which I wold : but that evill do I which I wolde not .
45007020	Finally yf I do that I wolde not then is it not I that doo it but synne that dwelleth in me doeth it .
45007021	I fynde then by the lawe that when I wolde do good evyll is present with me .
45007022	I delite in the lawe of God concerninge the inner man .
45007023	But I se another lawe in my membres rebellinge agaynst the lawe of my mynde and subduynge me vnto the lawe of synne which is in my membres .
45007024	O wretched man yt I am : who shall delyver me fro this body of deeth ?
45007025	I thanke God thorow Iesus Christ oure Lorde . So then I my silfe in my mynde serve the lawe of God and in my flesshe the lawe of synne .
45008001	Ther is then no damnacion to them which are in Christ Iesu which walke not after ye flesshe : but after ye sprete .
45008002	For the lawe of the sprete yt bringeth life thorowe Iesus Christ hath delivered me fro the lawe of synne and deeth .
45008003	For what the lawe coulde not doo in as moche it was weake because of the flesshe : that performed God and sent his sonne in the similitude of synfull flesshe and by synne daned synne in ye flesshe :
45008004	that the rightewesnes requyred of the lawe myght be fulfilled in vs which walke not after the flesshe but after the sprete .
45008005	For they that are carnall are carnally mynded . But they that are spirituall are gostly mynded .
45008006	To be carnally mynded is deeth . But to be spiritually mynded is lyfe and peace .
45008007	Because that the flesshly mynde is emnyte agaynst God : for it is not obedient to the lawe of God nether can be .
45008008	So then they yt are geven to the flesshe canot please God .
45008009	But ye are not geven to the flesshe but to the sprete : yf so be that ye sprite of God dwell in you . If ther be eny man yt hath not ye sprite of Christ ye same is none of his .
45008010	Yf Christ be in you the body is deed because of synne : but the sprite is lyfe for rightewesnes sake .
45008011	Wherfore if the sprite of him that raysed vppe Iesus fro deeth dwell in you : even he that raysed vp Christ from deeth shall quycken youre mortall bodyes because that this sprite dwelleth in you .
45008012	Therfore brethren we are nowe detters not to the flesshe to live after the flesshe .
45008013	For if ye live after the flesshe ye must dye . But yf ye mortifie the dedes of the body by the helpe of the sprite ye shall lyve .
45008014	For as many as are led by the sprete of God : they are the sonnes of god .
45008015	For ye have no receaved the sprete of bondage to feare eny moare but ye have receaved the sprite of adopcion wherby we crye Abba father .
45008016	The same sprete certifieth oure sprete yt we are the sonnes of God .
45008017	Yf we be sonnes we are also heyres the heyres I meane of God and heyres anexed with Christ : if so be that we suffer togedder that we maye be glorified to gedder .
45008018	For I suppose that the affliccions of this lyfe are not worthy of the glory which shalbe shewed vpon vs .
45008019	Also the fervent desyre of the creatures abideth lokynge when the sonnes of God shall appere
45008020	because the creatures are subdued to vanyte agaynst their will : but for his will which subdueth them in hope .
45008021	For ye very creatures shalbe delivered from the bondage of corrupcion into the glorious lybertie of the sonnes of God .
45008022	For we knowe that every creature groneth with vs also and travayleth in payne even vnto this tyme .
45008023	Not they only but even we also which have the fyrst frutes of the sprite morne in oureselves and wayte for the ( adopcio ) and loke for the delivraunce of oure bodyes .
45008024	For we are savyd by hope . But hope that is sene is no hope . For how can a ma hope for that which he seyth ?
45008025	But and yf we hope for that we se not then do we with pacience abyde for it .
45008026	Lyke wyse ye sprite also helpeth oure infirmities . For we knowe not what to desyre as we ought : but the sprete maketh intercession mightely for vs with gronynges which canot be expressid with tonge .
45008027	And he that searcheth the hertes knoweth what is ye meaninge of the sprite : for he maketh intercession for the sayntes accordinge to ye pleasure of god .
45008028	For we knowe that all thinges worke for the best vnto them yt love God which also are called of purpose .
45008029	For those which he knewe before he also ordeyned before yt they shuld be lyke fassioned vnto the shape of his sonne that he myght be ye fyrst begotten sonne amoge many brethren .
45008030	Morover which he apoynted before them he also called . And which he called them also he iustified which he iustified them he also glorified .
45008031	What shall we then saye vnto these thinges ? yf god be on oure syde : who can be agaynst vs ?
45008032	which spared not his awne sonne but gave him for vs all : how shall he not wt him geve vs all thinges also ?
45008033	Who shall laye eny thinge to ye charge of goddes chosen ? it is god that iustifieth :
45008034	who then shall condempne ? it is Christ which is deed ye rather which is rysen agayne which is also on the ryght honde of God and maketh intercession for vs .
45008035	Who shall seperate vs fro the love of god ? shall tribulacion ? or anguysshe ? or persecucion ? other honger ? other nakednesse ? other parell ? other swearde ?
45008036	As it is written : For thy sake are we kylled all daye longe and are counted as shepe apoynted to be slayne .
45008037	Neverthelesse in all these thinges we overcome strongly thorow his helpe that loved vs .
