45008038	Ye and I am sure that nether deeth nether lyfe nether angels nor rule nether power nether thinges present nether thinges to come
45008039	nether heyth nether loweth nether eny other creature shalbe able to departe vs fro ye love of God shewed in Christ Iesu oure lorde .
45009001	I saye the trueth in Christ and lye not in that wherof my conscience beareth me witnes in the holy gost
45009002	that I have gret hevynes and continuall sorowe in my hert .
45009003	For I have wysshed my selfe to be cursed from Christ for my brethren and my kynsmen as pertayninge to the flesshe
45009004	which are the Israelites . To whom pertayneth the adopcion and the glorie and the covenauntes and the law that was geven and the service of God and the promyses :
45009005	whose also are the fathers and they of whome ( as concernynge the flesshe ) Christ came which is God over all thinges blessed for ever Amen .
45009006	I speake not these thinges as though the wordes of god had take none effecte . For they are not all Israelites which came of Israel :
45009007	nether are they all chyldren strayght waye because they are the seed of Abraham . But in Isaac shall thy seede be called :
45009008	that is to saye they which are the chyldren of the flesshe are not the chyldren of god . But the chyldren of promes are counted the seede .
45009009	For this is a worde of promes aboute this tyme will I come and Sara shall have a sonne .
45009010	Nether was it so wt her only : but also when Rebecca was with chylde by one I meane by oure father Isaac
45009011	yeer the chyldren were borne when they had nether done good nether bad : that the purpose of God which is by election myght stonde
45009012	it was sayde vnto her not by the reason of workes but by grace of ye caller : the elder shall serve the yonger .
45009013	As it is written : Iacob he loved but Esau he hated .
45009014	What shall we saye then ? is there eny vnrightewesses with God ? God forbyd .
45009015	For he sayth to Moses : I will shewe mercye to who I shewe mercy : and will have compassion on whom I have copassion .
45009016	So lieth it not then in a mans will or cunnynge but in ye mercye of god .
45009017	For the scripture sayth vnto Pharao : Even for this same purpose have I stered ye vp to shewe my power on ye and that my name myght be declared thorow out all the worlde .
45009018	So hath he mercye on whom he will and whom he will he maketh hearde herted .
45009019	Thou wilt saye then vnto me : why then blameth he vs yet ? For who can resist his will ?
45009020	But o man what arte thou which disputest with God ? Shall the worke saye to the workeman : why hast thou made me on this fassion ?
45009021	Hath not the potter power over the claye even of the same lompe to make one vessell vnto honoure and a nother vnto dishonoure ?
45009022	Even so God willynge to shewe his wrath and to make his power knowen suffered with longe pacience the vessels of wrath ordeyned to damnacion
45009023	that he myght declare ye ryches of his glory on the vessels of mercye which he had prepayred vnto glorie :
45009024	that is to saye vs which he called not of the Iewes only but also of ye gentyls .
45009025	As he sayth in Osee : I will call them my people which were not my people : and her beloved which was not beloved .
45009026	And it shall come to passe in the place where it was sayd vnto them ye are not my people : that there shalbe called the chyldren of the lyvynge God .
45009027	But Esaias cryeth concernynge Israel though the nomber of the chyldren of Israel be as the sonde of the see yet shall a remnaut be saved .
45009028	He finyssheth the worde verely and maketh it short in ryghtwesses . For a short worde will god make on erth .
45009029	And as Esaias sayd before : Except the Lorde of sabaoth had left us seede we had bene made as Zodoma and had bene lykened to Gomorra .
45009030	What shall we saye then ? We saye that the gentyls which followed not rightewesnes have overtaken rightewesnes : I meane the rightewesnes which cometh of fayth .
45009031	But Israel which folowed the lawe of rightewesnes coulde not attayne vnto ye lawe of rightewesnes .
45009032	And wherfore ? Because they sought it not by fath : but as it were by the workes of the lawe . For they have stombled at the stomblynge stone .
45009033	As it is written : Beholde I put in Syon a stomblynge stone and a rocke which shall make men faule . And none yt beleve on him shalbe a shamed .
45010001	Brethren my hertes desyre and prayer to God for Israel is that they might be saved .
45010002	For I beare them recorde that they have a fervet mynde to God warde but not accordinge to knowledge .
45010003	For they are ignoraut of the rightewesnes which is alowed before God and goo about to stablisshe their awne rightewesnes and therfore are not obedient vnto the rightewesnes which is of valew before God .
45010004	For Christ is the ende of the lawe to iustifie all that beleve .
45010005	Moses describeth the rightewesnes which cometh of ye lawe howe that the man which doth the thinges of the lawe shall lyve therin .
45010006	But ye rightewesnes which cometh of fayth speaketh on this wyse . Saye not in thyne hert who shall ascende into heven ? ( that is nothinge els then to fetch Christ doune )
45010007	Other who shall descende into the depe ? ( that is nothinge els but to fetch vp Christ from deeth )
45010008	But what sayth the scripture ? The worde is nye the even in thy mouth and in thyn herte . This worde is the worde of fayth which we preache .
45010009	For yf thou shalt knowledge wt thy mouth that Iesus is the lorde and shalt beleve with thyn hert that God raysed him up from deeth thou shalt be safe .
45010010	For the belefe of the hert iustifieth : and to knowledge with the mouth maketh a man safe .
45010011	For the scripture sayth : whosoever beleveth on him shall not be ashamed .
45010012	Ther is no difference bitwene the Iewe and the gentyll . For one is Lorde of all which is ryche vnto all that call on him .
45010013	For whosoever shall call on the name of the lorde shalbe safe .
45010014	But how shall they call on him on who they beleved not ? how shall they beleve on him of whom they have not herde ? how shall they heare with out a preacher ?
45010015	And how shall they preach except they be sent ? As it is written : how beautifull are the fete of them which bringe glad tydynges of peace and bringe glad tydynges of good thinges .
45010016	But they have not all obeyed to ye gospell . For Esaias sayth : Lorde who shall beleve oure sayinges ?
45010017	So then fayth cometh by hearynge and hearynge cometh by the worde of God .
45010018	But I axe : have they not herde ? No dout their sounde went out into all londes : and their wordes in to the endes of the worlde .
45010019	But I demaunde whether Israel dyd knowe or not ? Fyrst Moses sayth : I will provoke you for to envy by the that are no people and by a folisshe nacion I will anger you .
45010020	Esaias after that is bolde and sayth . I am founde of the that sought me not and have appered to them that axed not after me .
45010021	And agaynst Israel he sayth : All daye longe have I stretched forth my hondes vnto a people yt beleveth not but speaketh agaynst me .
45011001	I saye then : hath god cast awaye his people ? God forbyd . For even I verely am an Israelite of the seed of Abraha and of ye tribe of Beniamin
45011002	god hath not cast awaye his people which he knew before . Ether wote ye not what the scripture sayth by the mouth of Helias how he maketh intercession to god agaynst Israel sayinge :
45011003	Lorde they have kylled thy prophetes and dygged doune thyn alters : and I am lefte only and they seke my lyfe .
45011004	But what sayth the answer of god to him agayne ? I have reserved vnto me seven thousande men which have not bowed the knee to Baal .
45011005	Even so at this tyme ys ther a remnanaunt lefte thorow the eleccion of grace .
45011006	Yf it be of grace the is it not of workes . For then were grace no moare grace . Yf it be of workes then is it no moare grace . For then were deservyng no lenger deservynge .
45011007	What then ? Israel hath not obtayned that that he sought . No but yet the election hath obtayned it . The remnaunt are blynded
45011008	accordynge as it is written : God hath geven the the sprete of vnquyetnes : eyes that they shuld not se and eares that they shuld not heare even vnto this daye .
45011009	And David sayth : Let their table be made a snare to take them with all and an occasion to faule and a rewarde vnto them .
45011010	Let their eyes be blynded that they se not : and ever bowe doune their backes .
45011011	I saye then : Have they therfore stombled that they shulde but faule only ? God forbyd : but thorowe their faule is salvacio happened vnto the gentyls for to provoke the with all .
45011012	Wherfore yf the faule of them be the ryches of the worlde : and the mynysshynge of them the ryches of the gentyls : How moche more shuld it be so yf they all beleved .
45011013	I speake to you gentyls in as moche as I am the Apostle of ye gentyls I will magnify myn office
45011014	that I myght provoke them which are my flesshe and myght save some of them .
45011015	For yf the castynge awaye of them be the reconcylynge of the worlde : what shall the receavynge of them be but lyfe agayne from deeth ?
45011016	For yf one pece be holy the whole heepe is holy . And yf the rote be holy the braunches are holy also .
45011017	Though some of the brauuches be broken of and thou beynge a wylde olyue tree arte graft in amonge them and made parttaker of ye rote and fatnes of the olyve tree
45011018	bost not thy selfe agaynst the brauches . For yf thou bost thy selfe remember that thou bearest not the rote but the rote the .
45011019	Thou wilt saye then : the brauches are broken of that I myght be grafte in .
45011020	Thou sayest well : because of vnbeleve they are broken of and thou stondest stedfast in fayth .
45011021	Be not hye mynded but feare seynge that God spared not the naturall braunches lest haply he also spare not the .
45011022	Beholde ye kyndnes and rigorousnes of God : on the which fell rigorousnes : but towardes the kyndnes yf thou cotinue in his kyndnes . Or els thou shalt be hewen of
45011023	and they yf they byde not still in vnbelefe shalbe graffed in agayne . For God is of power to graffe them in agayne .
45011024	For yf thou wast cut out of a naturall wilde olyve tree and wast graffed contrary to nature in a true olyve tree : how moche more shall the naturall brauches be graffed in their awne olyve tree agayne .
45011025	I wolde not that this secrete shuld be hyd fro you my brethren ( lest ye shuld be wyse in youre awne consaytes ) that partly blyndnes is happened in Israel vntyll ye fulnes of the gentyls be come in :
45011026	and so all Israel shalbe saved . As it is writte : There shall come oute of Sion he yt doth delyver and shall turne awaye the vngodlynes of Iacob .
45011027	And this is my covenaunt vnto them when I shall take awaye their synnes .
45011028	As cocernynge the gospell they are enemies for youre sakes : but as touchinge the election they are loved for ye fathers sakes .
45011029	For verely the gyftes and callynge of god are soche that it cannot repent him of them :
45011030	for loke as ye in tyme passed have not beleved God yet have now obtayned mercy thorow their vnbelefe :
45011031	even so now have they not beleved the mercy which is happened vnto you that they also maye obtayne mercy .
45011032	God hath wrapped all nacions in vnbeleve that he myght have mercie on all .
45011033	O the depnes of the aboundaunt wysdome and knowledge of God : how vnserchable are his iudgementes and his wayes past findyng out .
45011034	For who hath knowen the mynde of the lorde ? or who was his counseller ?
45011035	other who hath geven vnto him fyrst that he myght be recompensed agayne ?
45011036	For of him and thorow him and for him are all thinges To him be glorye for ever Amen .
45012001	I beseche you therfore brethre by ye mercyfulnes of God that ye make youre bodyes aquicke sacrifise holy and acceptable vnto God which is youre resonable seruynge of god .
45012002	And fassion not youre selves lyke vnto this worlde : But be ye chaunged in youre shape by the renuynge of youre wittes that ye maye fele what thynge that good yt acceptable and perfaycte will of god is .
45012003	For I saye ( thorowe the grace that vnto me geve is ) to every man amonge you that noman esteme of him selfe moare then it becometh him to esteme : but that he discretely iudge of him selfe accordynge as God hath dealte to every man the measure of fayth .
45012004	As we have many members in one body and all members have not one office :
45012005	so we beynge many are one body in Christ and every man ( amoge oure selves ) one anothers mebers Seynge
45012006	that we have dyvers gyftes accordynge to the grace that is geven vnto vs : yf eny man have ye gyft of prophesye let him have it that it be agreynge vnto the fayth .
45012007	Let him that hath an office wayte on his office . Let him that teacheth take hede to his doctrine .
45012008	Let him that exhorteth geve attendaunce to his exhortacion . Yf eny man geve let him do it with singlenes . Let him that ruleth do it with diligence . Yf eny man shewe mercy let him do it with cherfulnes .
45012009	Let love be wt out dissimulacion . Hate that which is evyll and cleave vnto that which is good .
45012010	Be kynde one to another with brotherly love . In gevynge honoure goo one before another .
45012011	Let not yt busynes which ye have in honde be tedious to you . Be fervet in ye sprete . Applye youre selves to ye tyme .
45012012	Reioyce in hope . Be paciet in tribulacion . Continue in prayer .
45012013	Distribute vnto the necessite of the saynctes and diligently to harboure .
45012014	Blesse the which persecute you : blesse but course not .
45012015	Be mery with the that are mery . Wepe wt them that wepe .
45012016	Be of lyke affeccion one towardes another . Be not hye mided : but make youreselves equall to the of ye lower sorte . Be not wyse in youre awne opinios .
45012017	Recopence to no ma evyll fore evyll . Provyde afore honde thinges honest in ye syght of all men .
45012018	Yf it be possible howbe it of youre parte have peace with all men .
45012019	Derly beloued avenge not youre selves but geve roume vnto the wrath of God . For it is written : vengeaunce is myne and I will rewarde saith the lorde .
45012020	Terfore yf thyn enemy honger fede him : yf he thurst geve him drinke . For in so doynge thou shalt heape coles of fyre on his heed :
45012021	Be not overcome of evyll : But overcome evyll wt goodnes .
45013001	Let every soule submit him selfe vnto the auctorite of ye hyer powers . For there is no power but of God .
45013002	The powers that be are ordeyned of God . Whosoever therfore resysteth power resisteth the ordinaunce of God . And they that resist shall receave to the selfe damnacio .
45013003	For rulars are not to be feared for good workes but for evyll Wilt thou be with out feare of the power ? Do well then : and so shalt thou be praysed of the same .
45013004	For he is the minister of God for thy welth . But and yf thou do evyll then feare : for he beareth not a swearde for nought : but is the minister of God to take vengeaunce on them that do evyll .
45013005	Wherfore ye must nedes obeye not for feare of vengeaunce only : but also because of conscience .
45013006	And even for this cause paye ye tribute . For they are goddes ministers servynge for the same purpose .
45013007	Geve to every man therfore his duetie : Tribute to whom tribute belongeth : Custome to whom custome is due : feare to whom feare belongeth : Honoure to who honoure pertayneth
45013008	Owe nothinge to eny man : but to love one another . For he that loveth another fulfylleth the lawe .
45013009	For these commaundementes : Thou shalt not comit advoutry : Thou shalt not kyll : Thou shalt not steale : Thou shalt not beare false witnes : Thou shalt not desyre and so forth ( yf there be eny other comaundement ) they are all comprehended in this sayinge : Love thyne neghbour as thy selfe .
45013010	Love hurteth not his neghbour . Therfore is love the fulfillynge of the lawe .
45013011	This also we knowe I mean the season howe that it is tyme that we shuld now awake oute of slepe . For now is oure salvacion nearer then when we beleved .
45013012	The nyght is passed and the daye is come nye . Let us therfore cast awaye the dedes of darcknes and let vs put on the ( Armoure ) of lyght .
45013013	Let vs walke honestly as it were in the daye lyght : not in eatynge and drinkynge : nether in chamburynge and wantannes : nether in stryfe and envyinge :
45013014	but put ye on the Lorde Iesus Christ . And make not provision for the flesshe to fulfyll ye lustes of it .
45014001	Him that is weake in the fayth receave vnto you not in disputynge and troublynge his conscience .
45014002	One beleveth that he maye eate all thinge . Another which is weake eateth earbes .
45014003	Let not him that eateth despise him that eateth not . And let not him whiche eateth not iudge him that eateth . For God hath receaved him .
45014004	What arte thou that iudgest another manes servaut ? Whether he stonde or faule that pertayneth vnto his master : ye he shall stonde . For God is able to make him stonde .
45014005	This man putteth difference bitwene daye and daye . Another man counteth all dayes alyke . Se that no man waver in his awne meanynge .
45014006	He that observeth one daye more then another doth it for ye lordes pleasure . And he that observeth not one daye moare then another doeth it to please ye lorde also . He that eateth doth it to please the lorde for he geveth god thankes .
45014007	And he yt eateth not eateth not to please ye lorde wt all and geveth god thankes .
45014008	For none of vs lyveth his awne servaut : nether doeth anye of vs dye his awne servaunt . Yf we lyve we lyve to be at ye lordes will . And yf we dye we dye at ye lordes will . Whether we lyve therfore or dye we are the lordes .
45014009	For Christ therfore dyed and rose agayne and revived that he myght be lorde both of deed and quicke .
45014010	But why doest thou then iudge thy brother ? Other why doest thou despyse thy brother ? We shall all be brought before the iudgement seate of Christ .
45014011	For it is written : as truely as I lyve sayth ye lorde all knees shall bowe to me and all tonges shall geve a knowledge to God .
45014012	So shall every one of vs geve accomptes of him selfe to God .
45014013	Let vs not therfore iudge one another eny more . But iudge this rather that no man put a stomblynge blocke or an occasion to faule in his brothers waye .
45014014	For I knowe and am full certified in the Lorde Iesus that ther is nothinge comen of it selfe : but vnto him that iudgeth it to be comen : to him is it comen .
45014015	If thy brother be greved with thy meate now walkest thou not charitablye . Destroye not him with thy meate for whom Christ dyed .
45014016	Cause not youre treasure to be evyll spoken of .
45014017	For the kyngdome of God is not meate and drinke : but rightewesnes peace and ioye in the holy goost .
45014018	For whosoever in these thinges serveth Christ pleaseth well God and is commended of men .
45014019	Let vs folowe tho thinges which make for peace and thinges wherwith one maye edyfie another .
45014020	Destroye not ye worke of god for a lytell meates sake . All thinges are pure : but it is evyll for that man which eateth with hurte of his conscience .
45014021	It is good nether to eate flesshe nether to drincke wyne nether eny thinge wherby thy brother stombleth ether falleth or is made weake .
45014022	Hast thou fayth ? have it with thy selfe before god . Happy is he yt condempneth not him selfe in that thinge which he aloweth .
45014023	For he yt maketh conscience is dampned yf he eate : because he doth it not of fayth . For whatsoever is not of fayth that same is synne .
45015001	We which are stronge ought to beare the fraylnes of them which are weake and not to stonde in oure awne cosaytes .
45015002	Let every man please his neghbour vnto his welth and edyfyinge .
45015003	For Christ pleased not him selfe : but as it is written . The rebukes of the which rebuked the fell one me .
45015004	Whatsoever thinges are written afore tyme are written for oure learnynge that we thorow pacience and comforte of the scripture myght have hope .
45015005	The God of pacience and consolacion geve vnto every one of you that ye be lyke mynded one towardes another after the insample of Christ :
45015006	that ye all agreynge together maye with one mouth prayse God the father of oure Lorde Iesus .
45015007	Wherfore receave ye one another as Christ receaved vs to the prayse of God .
45015008	And I saye that Iesus Christ was a minister of the circumcision for the trueth of god to conferme the promyses made vnto the fathers .
45015009	And let the gentyls prayse god for his mercy as it is written : For this cause I will prayse the amonge the gentyls and synge in thy name .
45015010	And agayne he sayth : reioyse ye gentyles with his people .
45015011	And agayne prayse the Lorde all ye gentyls and laude him all nacions .
45015012	And in another place Esaias sayth : ther shalbe the rote of Iesse and he that shall ryse ro raygne over the gentyls : in him shall the gentyls trust .
45015013	The God of hope fyll you with all ioye and peace in belevynge : that ye maye be ryche in hope thorowe the power of the holy goost .
45015014	I my selfe am full certified of you my brethren that ye youre selves are full of goodnes and filled with all knowledge and are able to exhorte one another .
45015015	Neverthelesse brethren I have some what boldly written vnto you as one that putteth you in remembrauce thorow the grace that is geven me of God
45015016	that I shuld be the minister of Iesu Christ amonge the gentyls and shuld minister the gladde tydynges of God that the gentyls myght be an acceptable offerynge sanctyfied by the holy goost .
45015017	I have therfore wherof I maye reioyse in Christ Iesu in tho thinges which pertayne to God .
45015018	For I dare not speake of eny of tho thinges which Christ hath not wrought by me to make the gentyls obedient with worde and dede
45015019	in myghty signes and wonders by the power of the sprete of God : so that from Ierusalem and the costes rounde aboute vnto Illyricum I have fylled all countres with the gladde tydynges of Christ .
45015020	So have I enforsed my selfe to preache the gospell not where Christ was named lest I shuld have bylt on another mannes foundacion :
45015021	but as it is written : To whom he was not spoken of they shall se : and they that hearde not shall vnderstonde .
45015022	For this cause I have bene ofte let to come vnto you :
45015023	but now seynge I have no moare to do in these countres and also have bene desyrous many yeares to come vnto you
45015024	when I shall take my iorney into spayne I will come to you . I trust to se you in my iorney and to be brought on my waye thither warde by you after that I have somwhat enioyed you .
45015025	Now go I vnto Ierusalem and minister vnto the saynctes .
45015026	For it hath pleased them of Macedonia and Achaia to make a certayne distribucio vpo the poore saynctes which are at Ierusalem .
45015027	It hath pleased them verely and their detters are they . For yf the getils be made partetakers of their spirituall thinges their dutie is to minister vnto the in carnall thinges .
45015028	When I have performed this and have brought them this frute sealed . I will come backe agayne by you into Spayne .
45015029	And I am sure when I come that I shall come with aboundaunce of the blessinge of the gospell of Christ .
45015030	I beseche you brethre for oure Lorde Iesus Christes sake and for the love of the sprete that ye helpe me in my busynes with youre prayers to God for me
45015031	that I maye be delyvered from them which beleve not in Iewry and that this my service which I have to Ierusalem maye be accepted of ye saynctes
45015032	that I maye come vnto you with ioye by the will of God and maye with you be refresshed .
45015033	The God of peace be with you . Amen .
45016001	I commede vnto you Phebe oure sister ( which is a minister of the congregacion of Chenchrea )
45016002	that ye receave her in the Lorde as it becommeth saynctes and that ye assist her in whatsoever busynes she neadeth of youre ayde . For she hath suckered many and myne awne selfe also .
45016003	Grete Prisca and Aquila my helpers in Christ Iesu
45016004	which have for my lyfe layde doune their awne neckes . Vnto which not I only geve thankes but also the congregacion of the getyls .
45016005	Lyke wyse grete all the copany that is in thy housse . Salute my welbeloved Epenetos which is the fyrst frute amoge them of Achaia .
45016006	Grete Mary which bestowed moche labour on vs .
45016007	Salute Andronicus and Iunia my cosyns which were presoners with me also which are wele taken amoge the Apostles and were in Christ before me .
45016008	Grete Amplias my beloved in ye Lorde .
45016009	Salute Vrban oure helper in Christ and Stachys my beloved .
45016010	Salute Appelles approved in Christ . Salute them which are of Aristobolus housholde .
45016011	Salute Herodion my kynsma . Grete them of the housholde of Narcissus which are in the Lorde .
45016012	Salute Triphena and Triphosa which wemen dyd labour in ye Lorde . Salute ye beloved Persis which laboured in the Lorde .
45016013	Salute Rufus chosen tn the Lorde and his mother and myne .
45016014	Grete Asincritus Phlegon Herman Patrobas Hermen and the brethren which are wt them .
45016015	Salute Philologus and Iulia Nereus and his sister and Olimpha and all the saynctes which are with them .
45016016	Salute one another with an holy kysse . The congregacions of Christ salute you .
45016017	I beseche you brethre marke them which cause division and geve occasions of evyll contrary to the doctrine which ye have learned : and avoyde them .
45016018	For they yt are suche serve not ye Lorde Iesus Christ : but their awne bellyes and with swete preachinges and flatteringe wordes deceave the hertes of the innocetes .
45016019	For youre obedience extendeth to all men . I am glad no dout of you . But yet I wolde have you wyse vnto yt which is good and to be innocetes concerninge evyll .
45016020	The God of peace treade Satan vnder youre fete shortly . The grace of oure Lorde Iesu Christ be with you .
45016021	Thimotheus my worke felow and Lucius and Iason and Sopater my kynsmen salute you .
45016022	I Tertius salute you which wrote this epistle in the Lorde .
45016023	Gaius myne hoste and the hoste of all the congregacions saluteth you . Erastus the chamberlayne of ye cite saluteth you . And Quartus a brother saluteth you .
45016024	The grace of oure Lorde Iesu Christ be wt you all . Ame
45016025	To him that is of power to stablisshe you accordinge to my gospell and preachinge of Iesus Christ in vtteringe of the mistery which was kept secret sence the worlde begane
45016026	but now is opened by ye scriptures of prophesie at the commaundement of the everlastinge god to stere vp obedience to the faith publisshed amonge all nacions :
45016027	To the same God which alone is wyse be prayse thorowe Iesus Christ for ever . Amen .
46001001	Paul by vocacion an Apostle of Iesus Christ thorow the will of God and brother Sostenes .
46001002	Vnto the congregacion of God which is at Corinthum . To them that are sanctified in Christ Iesu sainctes by callynge with all that call on the name of oure lorde Iesus Christ in every place both of theirs and of oures
46001003	Grace be with you and peace fro God oure father and from the lorde Iesus Christ .
46001004	I thanke my God all wayes on youre behalfe for ye grace of God which is geuen you by Iesus Christ
46001005	that in all thinges ve are made riche by him in all lerninge and in all knowledge
46001006	even as the testimony of Iesus Christ was confermed in you )
46001007	so that ye are behynde in no gyft and wayte for the apperynge of oure lorde Iesus Christ
46001008	which shall streght you vnto ye ende that ye maye be blamelesse in ye daye of oure lorde Iesus Christ .
46001009	ffor god is faythfull by whom ye are called vnto ye fellishyppe of his sonne Iesus Christe oure lorde
46001010	I beseche you brethre in ye name of oure lorde Iesus Christ that ye all speake one thynge and that there be no dissencion amoge you : but be ye knyt together in one mynde and in one meaynge .
46001011	It is shewed vnto me ( my brethren ) of you by them that are of the housse of Cloe that ther is stryfe amonge you . And this is it that I meane :
46001012	how that comelie amonge you one sayeth : I holde of Paul : another I holde of Apollo : ye thyrde I holde of Cephas : ye four ye I holde of Christ .
46001013	Ys Christ devided ? was Paul crucified for you ? ether were ye baptised in ye name of Paul ?
46001014	I thanke God that I christened none of you but Crispus and Gayus
46001015	lest eny shulde saye that I had baptised in myne awne name .
46001016	I baptised also the housse of Stephana . Forthermore knowe I not whether I baptised eny man or no .
46001017	For Christ sent me not to baptyse but to preache ye gospell not with wysdome of wordes lest the crosse of Christ shuld have bene made of none effecte .
46001018	For ye preachinge of the crosse is to them yt perisshe folishnes : but vnto vs which are saved it is ye power of God .
46001019	For it is written : I will destroye the wysdome of the wyse and will cast awaye the vnderstondinge of the prudet .
46001020	Where is the wyse ? Where is the scrybe ? Where is the searcher of this worlde ?
46001021	Hath not God made the wysdome of this worlde folisshnes ? For when the worlde thorow wysdome knew not God in ye wysdome of God : it pleased God thorow folisshnes of preachinge to save them yt beleve .
46001022	For ye Iewes requyre a signe and the Grekes seke after wysdome .
46001023	But we preache Christ crucified vnto the Iewes an occasion of fallinge and vnto the Grekes folisshnes :
46001024	but vnto the which are called both of Iewes and Grekes we preache Christ ye power of God and the wysdome of God .
46001025	For the folishnes of God is wyser then me : and the weakenes of God is stronger then men .
46001026	Brethren loke on youre callinge how that not many wyse men after the flesshe not many myghty not many of hye degre are called :
46001027	but God hath chosen the folysshe thinges of the worlde to confounde the wyse . And God hath chosyn the weake thinges of the worlde to confounde thinges which are mighty .
46001028	And vile thinges of the worlde and thinges which are despysed hath God chosen yee and thinges of no reputacion for to brynge to nought thinges of reputacion
46001029	that no flesshe shulde reioyce in his presence .
46001030	And vnto him partayne ye in Christ Iesu which of God is made vnto vs wysdome and also rightewesnes and saunctifyinge and redempcion .
46001031	That accordinge as it is written : he which reioyseth shulde reioyce in the Lorde .
46002001	And I brethren when I came to you came not in gloriousnes of wordes or of wysdome shewynge vnto you the testimony of God .
46002002	Nether shewed I my selfe that I knewe eny thinge amonge you save Iesus Christ eve the same that was crucified .
46002003	And I was amoge you in weaknes and in feare and in moche treblinge .
46002004	And my wordes and my preachinge were not with entysynge wordes of manes wysdome : but in shewinge of ye sprete and of power
46002005	that youre fayth shuld not stonde in ye wysdome of me but in yt power of God .
46002006	That we speake of is wysdome amonge them that are perfecte : not the wysdome of this worlde nether of the rulars of this worlde ( which go to nought )
46002007	but we speake ye wysdome of God which is in secrete and lieth hyd which God ordeyned before the worlde vnto oure glory :
46002008	which wysdome none of ye rulars of the worlde knewe . For had they knowe it they wolde not have crucified the Lorde of glory .
46002009	But as it is written : The eye hath not sene and the eare hath not hearde nether have entred into the herte of man ye thinges which God hath prepared for them that love him .
46002010	But God hath opened them vnto vs by his sprete . For ye sprete searcheth all thinges ye the bottome of Goddes secretes .
46002011	For what man knoweth the thinges of a ma : save ye sprete of a man which is with in him ? Even so ye thinges of God knoweth no man but ye sprete of god .
46002012	And we have not receaved the sprete of ye worlde : but the sprete which cometh of god for to knowe the thinges that are geve to vs of god
46002013	which thinges also we speake not in the conynge wordes of manes wysdome but with the conynge wordes of the holy goost makynge spretuall coparesons of spretuall thinges .
46002014	For ye naturall man perceaveth not the thinges of the sprete of god . For they are but folysshnes vnto him . Nether can he perceave them because he is spretually examined .
46002015	But he that is spretuall discusseth all thinges : yet he him selfe is iudged of no ma .
46002016	For who knoweth the mynde of the Lorde other who shall informe him ? But we vnderstonde the mynde of Christ .
46003001	And I coulde not speake vnto you brethre as vnto spretuall : but as vnto carnall even as it were vnto babes in Christ .
46003002	I gave you mylke to drinke and not meate . For ye then were not stronge no nether yet are .
46003003	For ye are yet carnall . As longe verely as ther is amoge you envyige stryfe and dissencio : are ye not carnall and walke after ye manner of me ?
46003004	As loge as one sayth I holde of Paul and another I am of Apollo are ye not carnall ?
46003005	What is Paul ? What thinge is Apollo ? Only miministers are they by who ye beleved even as the Lorde gave every ma grace .
46003006	I have planted : Apollo watred : but god gave increace .
46003007	So then nether is he that planteth eny thinge nether he yt watreth : but god which gave the increace .
46003008	He that planteth and he that watreth are nether better then the other . Every man yet shall receave his rewarde accordynge to his laboure .
46003009	We are goddis labourers ye are goddis husbandrye ye are goddis byldynge .
46003010	Accordynge to the grace of god geven vnto me as a wyse bylder have I layde the foundacio And another bylt thero But let every ma take hede how he bildeth apo .
46003011	For other foundacion can no man laye then yt which is layde which is Iesus Christ .
46003012	Yf eny man bilde on this foundacion golde silver precious stones tymber haye or stoble :
46003013	every mannes worke shall appere . For the daye shall declare it and it shalbe shewed in fyre . And ye fyre shall trye euery mannes worke what it is .
46003014	Yf eny mannes worke yt he hath bylt apon byde he shall receave a rewarde .
46003015	If eny manes worke burne he shall suffre losse : but he shalbe safe him selfe : neverthelesse yet as it were thorow fyre .
46003016	Are ye not ware that ye are the temple of god and how that the sprete of god dwelleth in you ?
46003017	Yf eny man defyle the temple of god him shall god destroye . For the temple of god is holy which temple ye are .
46003018	Let no man deceave him silfe . Yf eny man seme wyse amonge you let him be a fole in this worlde that he maye be wyse .
46003019	For ye wisdome of this worlde is folysshnes with god . For it is writte : he compaseth the wyse in their craftynes .
46003020	And agayne God knoweth the thoughtes of the wyse that they be vayne .
46003021	Therfore let no ma reioyce in men . For all thinges are youres
46003022	whether it be Paul other Apollo other Cephas : whether it be ye worlde other lyfe other deeth whether they be present thinges or thinges to come : all are youres
46003023	and ye are Christes and Christ is goddis .
46004001	Let men this wyse esteme vs eve as the ministers of Christ and disposers of ye secretes of God .
46004002	Furthermore it is requyred of the disposers that they be founde faithfull .
46004003	With me is it but a very smal thinge that I shuld be iudged of you ether of ( mans daye ) No I iudge not myn awne selfe .
46004004	I know nought by my selfe : yet am I not therby iustified . It is the Lorde that iudgeth me .
46004005	Therfore iudge no thinge before the tyme vntill the Lorde come which will lighten thinges that are hyd in darcknes and ope the counsels of the hertes . And then shall every man have prayse of God .
46004006	These thinges brethre I have described in myn awne person and Apollos for youre sakes that ye myght learne by vs that no man coute of him selfe beyonde that which is above written : that one swell not agaynst another for eny mans cause .
46004007	For who preferreth the ? What hast thou that thou hast not receaved ? Yf thou have receaved it why reioysest thou as though thou haddest not receaved it ?
46004008	Now ye are full : now ye are made rych : ye raygne as kinges with out vs : and I wold to god ye dyd raygne that we might raygne with you .
46004009	Me thinketh that God hath set forth vs which are Apostles for the lowest of all as it were me appoynted to deeth . For we are a gasyngestocke vnto the worlde and to ye angels and to men .
46004010	We are foles for Christes sake and ye are wyse thorow Christ . We are weake and ye are stroge . Ye are honorable and we are despised .
46004011	Eve vnto this daye we honger and thyrst and are naked and are boffetted wt fistes and have no certayne dwellinge place
46004012	and laboure workinge with oure awne hondes . We are revysed and yet we blesse . We are persecuted and suffer it .
46004013	We are evyll spoken of and we praye . We are made as it were the filthynes of the worlde the ofscowringe of all thinges even vnto this tyme .
46004014	I write not these thinges to shame you : but as my beloved sonnes I warne you .
46004015	For though ye have ten thousande instructours in Christ : yet have ye not many fathers . In Christ Iesu I have begotten you thorowe ye gospell .
46004016	Wherfore I desyre you to folowe me .
46004017	For this cause have I sent vnto you Timotheus which is my deare sonne and faithfull in the Lorde which shall put you in remembrauce of my wayes which I have in Christ eve as I teache every where in all congregacios .
46004018	Some swell as though I wolde come no more at you .
46004019	But I will come to you shortely yf God will : and will knowe not ye wordes of the which swell but ye power :
46004020	for ye kyngdome of God is not in wordes but in power .
46004021	What will ye ? Shall I come vnto you with a rodde or els in love and in the sprete of mekenes ?
46005001	There goeth a comen sayinge that ther is fornicacion amoge you and soche fornicacion as is not once named amonge the gentyls : that one shuld have his fathers wyfe .
46005002	And ye swell and have not rather sorowed yt he which hath done this dede myght be put fro amoge you .
46005003	For I verely as absent in body even so present in sprete have determyned all redy ( as though I were present ) of him that hath done this dede
46005004	in the name of oure Lorde Iesu Christ when ye are gaddered togedder and my sprete with the power of the Lorde Iesus Christ
46005005	to deliver him vnto Satan for ye destruccio of the flesshe yt the sprete maye be saved in ye daye of ye Lorde Iesus .
46005006	Youre reioysinge is not good : knowe ye not that a lytle leve sowreth the whole lompe of dowe .
46005007	Pourge therfore the olde leven that ye maye be newe dowe as ye are swete breed . For Christ oure esterlambe is offered vp for vs .
46005008	Therfore let vs kepe holy daye not with olde leve nether with the leven of maliciousnes and wickednes : but with the swete breed of purenes and truth .
46005009	I wrote vnto you in a pistle that ye shuld not company with fornicatours .
46005010	And I meat not at all of the fornicatours of this worlde ether of the coveteous or of extorsioners ether of the ydolaters : for then must ye nedes have gone out of ye worlde .
46005011	But now I write vnto you that ye company not togedder yf eny that is called a brother be a fornicator or coveteous or a worshipper of ymages ether a raylar ether a dronkard or an extorcionar : with him that is soche se that ye eate not .
46005012	For what have I to do to iudge them which are with out ? Do ye not iudge them that are with in ?
46005013	Them that are with out God shall iudge . Put awaye from amonge you that evyll parson .
46006001	How dare one of you havinge busines with another goo to lawe vnder the wicked and not rather vnder the sainctes ?
46006002	Do ye not know that the sainctes shall iudge the worlde ? If the worlde shalbe iudged by you : are ye not good ynough to iudge smale trifles :
46006003	knowe ye not how that we shall iudge the angles ? How moche more maye we iudge thinges that partayne to ye lyfe ?
46006004	If ye have iudgementes of worldely matters take them which are despised in ye congregacio and make them iudges .
46006005	This I saye to youre shame . Is ther vtterly no wyse man amoge you ? What not one at all yt can iudge bitwene brother and brother
46006006	but one brother goeth to lawe with another : and that vnder the vnbelevers ?
46006007	Now therfore ther is vtterly a faute amonge you because ye goo to lawe one with another . Why rather suffer ye not wronge ? why rather suffre ye not youre selves to be robbed ?
46006008	Naye ye youre selves do wronge and robbe : and that the brethren .
46006009	Do ye not remember how that the vnrighteous shall not inheret the kyngdome of God ? Be not deceaved . For nether fornicators nether worshyppers of ymages nether whormongers nether weaklinges nether abusars of them selves with the mankynde
46006010	nether theves nether the coveteous nether dronkardes nether cursed speakers nether pillers shall inheret the kyngdome of God .
46006011	And soche ware ye verely : but ye are wesshed : ye are sanctified : ye are iustified by the name of the Lorde Iesus and by the sprete of oure God .
46006012	All thinges are lawfull vnto me : but all thinges are not proffitable . I maye do all thinges : but I will be brought vnder no mans power .
46006013	Meates are ordeyned for the belly and the belly for meates : but God shall destroy bothe it and them . Let not the body be applied vnto fornicacion but vnto the Lorde and the Lorde vnto the body .
46006014	God hath raysed vp the Lorde and shall rayse vs vp by his power .
46006015	Ether remember ye not that youre bodyes are the members of Christ ? Shall I now take the members of Christ and make them the members of an harlot ? God forbyd .
46006016	Do ye not vnderstonde that he which coupleth him selfe with an harlot is become one body ? For two ( saith he ) shalbe one flesshe .
46006017	But he that is ioyned vnto the Lorde is one sprete .
46006018	Fle fornicacion . All synnes that a man dothe are with out ye body . But he yt is a fornicator synneth agaynst his awne body .
46006019	Ether knowe ye not how that youre bodyes are the temple of ye holy goost which is in you who ye have of God and how that ye are not youre awne ?
46006020	For ye are dearly bought . Therfore glorifie ye God in youre bodyes and in youre spretes for they are goddes .
46007001	As concerninge the thinges wherof ye wrote vnto me : it is good for a ma not to touche a woman .
46007002	Neverthelesse to avoyde fornicacio let every man have his wyfe : and let every woman have her husbande .
46007003	Let the man geve vnto the wyfe due benevolence . Lykwyse also the wyfe vnto the man .
46007004	The wyfe hath not power over her awne body : but the husbande . And lykewyse the man hath not power over his awne body : but the wyfe .
46007005	Withdrawe not youre selves one from another excepte it be with consent for a tyme for to geve youre selves to fastynge and prayer . And afterwarde come agayne to the same thynge lest Satan tempt you for youre incontinencye .
46007006	This I saye of faveour not of comaundement .
46007007	For I wolde that all men were as I my selfe am : but every man hath his proper gyfte of God one after this maner another after that .
46007008	I saye vnto the vnmaried men and widdowes : it is good for them yf they abyde eve as I do .
46007009	But and yf they canot abstayne let them mary . For it is better to mary then to burne .
46007010	Vnto the maryed comaunde not I but the Lorde : that the wyfe separate not her selfe from the man .
46007011	Yf she separate her selfe let her remayne vnmaryed or be reconciled vnto her husbande agayne . And let not the husbande put awaye his wyfe from him .
46007012	To the remnaunt speake I and not the lorde . Yf eny brother have a wyfe that beleveth not yf she be content to dwell with him let him not put her awaye .
46007013	And ye woma which hath to her husbande an infidell yf he consent to dwell with her let her not put him awaye .
46007014	For ye vnbelevynge husbande is sanctified by the wyfe : and the vnbelevynge wyfe is sanctified by the husbande . Or els were youre chyldren vnclene : but now are they pure .
46007015	But and yf the vnbelevynge departe let him departe . A brother or a sister is not in subiection to soche . God hath called vs in peace .
46007016	For how knowest thou o woman whether thou shalt save that man or no ? Other how knowest thou o man whether thou shalt save that woman or no ?
46007017	but even as God hath distributed to every man . As the lorde hath called every person so let him walke : and so orden I in all congregacios .
46007018	Yf eny man be called beynge circumcised let him adde nothinge therto . Yf eny be called vncircumcised : let him not be circucised .
46007019	Circumcision is nothinge vncircumcision is nothinge : but the kepyng of the comaundmentes of god is altogether .
46007020	Let every man abyde in the same state wherin he was called .
46007021	Arte thou called a servaut ? care not for it . Neverthelesse yf thou mayst be fre vse it rather .
46007022	For he that is called in the lorde beynge a servaunt is the lordes freman . Lykwyse he that is called beynge fre is Christes servaut .
46007023	Ye are dearly bought be not mennes seruauntes .
46007024	Brethren let everye man wherin he is called therin abyde with God .
46007025	As concernynge virgins I have no comaundment of the lorde : yet geve I counsell as one that hath obtayned mercye of the lorde to be faythfull .
46007026	I suppose that it is good for the present necessite . For it is good for a ma so to be .
46007027	Arte thou bounde vnto a wyfe ? seke not to be lowsed . Arte thou lowsed from a wyfe ? seke not a wyfe .
46007028	But and yf thou take a wyfe thou synnest not . Lykwyse if a virgin mary she synneth not . Neverthelesse soche shall have trouble in their flesshe : but I faver you .
46007029	This saye I brethre the tyme is shorte . It remayneth that they which have wives be as though they had none
46007030	and they that wepe be as though thy wept not : and they that reioyce be as though they reioysed not : and they that bye be as though they possessed not :
46007031	and they yt vse this worlde be as though they vsed it not . For the fassion of this worlde goeth awaye .
46007032	I wolde have you without care : the single man careth for the thinges of the lorde how he maye please the lorde .
46007033	But he that hath maried careth for the thinges of the worlde howe he maye please his wyfe .
46007034	There is differece bitwene a virgin and a wyfe . The single woman careth for the thinges of the lorde that she maye be pure both in body and also in sprete But she that is maryed careth for the thinges of the worlde how she maye please her husband .
46007035	This speake I for youre proffit not to tangle you in a snare : but for that which is honest and comly vnto you and that ye maye quyetly cleave vnto the lorde wt out separacion .
46007036	If eny man thinke that it is vncomly for his virgin if she passe the tyme of mariage ad if so nede requyre let him do what he listeth he synneth not : let the be coupled in mariage .
46007037	Neverthelesse he yt purposeth surely in his herte havynge none nede : but hath power over his awne will : and hath so decreed in his herte that he will kepe his virgin doth well .
46007038	So then he that ioyneth his virgin in maryage doth well . But he that ioyneth not his virgin in mariage doth better .
46007039	The wyfe is bounde to the lawe as longe as her husband liveth If her husbande slepe she is at liberte to mary with whom she wyll only in the lorde .
46007040	But she is happiar yf she so abyde in my iudgmet And I thinke verely that I have the sprete of God .
46008001	To speake of thinges dedicate vnto ydols we are sure that we all have knowledge . knowledge maketh a man swell : bnt love edifieth .
46008002	If eny man thinke that he knoweth eny thinge he knoweth nothynge yet as he ought to knowe .
46008003	But yf eny man love god the same is knowen of him .
46008004	To speake of meate dedicat vnto ydols we are sure that ther is none ydoll in the worlde and that ther is none other god but one .
46008005	And though ther be yt are called goddes whether in heven other in erth ( as ther be goddes many and lordes many )
46008006	yet vnto vs is there but one god which is the father of whom are all thinges and we in him : and one lorde Iesus Christ by whom are all thinges and we by him .
46008007	But every man hath not knowledge . For some suppose that ther is an ydoll vntyll this houre and eate as of a thinge offered vnto ye ydole and so their consciences beynge yet weake are defyled .
46008008	Meate maketh vs not acceptable to god . Nether yf we eate are we ye better . Nether yf we eate not are we the worsse .
46008009	But take hede that youre libertie cause not ye weake to faule .
46008010	For yf some man se ye which hast knowledge sit at meate in the ydoles teple shall not the conscience of hym which is weake be boldened to eate those thinges which are offered vnto ye ydole ?
46008011	And so thorow thy knowledge shall ye weake brother perisshe for whom christ dyed .
46008012	Whe ye synne so agaynst the brethren and wounde their weake consciences ye synne agaynst Christ .
46008013	Wherfore yf meate hurt my brother I will eate no flesshe whill the worlde stondeth because I will not hurte my brother .
46009001	Am I not an Apostle ? am I not fre ? have I not sene Iesus Christ oure lorde ?
46009002	Are not ye my worke in the lorde . Yf I be not an Apostle vnto other yet am I vnto you . For the seale of myne Apostleshippe are ye in the lorde .
46009003	Myne answer to them that axe me is this .
46009004	Have we not power to eate and to drynke ?
46009005	Ether have we not power to leade about a sister to wyfe as wel as other Apostles and as the brethren of the lorde and Cephas ?
46009006	Ether only I and Barnabas have not power this to do ?
46009007	who goeth a warfare eny tyme at his awne cost ? who planteth a vynearde and eateth not of the frute ? Who fedeth a flocke and eateth not of the mylke ?
46009008	Saye I these thinges after the manner of men ? Or sayth not the lawe the same also ?
46009009	For it ys written in the lawe of Moses . Thou shall not mosell the mouth of the oxe that treadeth out the corne . Doth God take thought for oxen ?
46009010	Ether sayth he it not all to gedder for oure sakes ? For oure sakes no doute this is written : that he which eareth shuld eare in hope : and that he which thressheth in hope shuld be parttaker of his hope .
46009011	Yf we sowe vnto you spirituall thynges : is it a greate thynge yf we reepe youre carnall thynges
46009012	Yf other be parttakers of this power over you ? wherfore are not we rather . Neverthelesse we have not vsed this power : but suffre all thinges lest we shuld hynder the gospell of Christ .
46009013	Do ye not vnderstoder how that they which minister in the temple have their fyndynge of the temple ? And they which wayte at the aulter are partakers with ye aultre ?
46009014	Even so also dyd ye lorde ordayne that they which preache ye gospell shuld live of the gospell .
46009015	But I have vsed none of these thinges . Nether wrote I these thinges that it shuld be so done vnto me . For it were better for me to dye the yt eny man shnld take this reioysinge from me .
46009016	In that I preache the gospell I have nothinge to reioyce of . For necessite is put vnto me . Wo is it vnto me yf I preache not the gospell .
46009017	If I do it with a good will I have a rewarde . But yf I do it agaynst my will an office is committed vnto me .
46009018	What is my rewarde then ? Verely that whe I preache the gospell I make the gospell of Christ fre yt I misvse not myne auctorite in ye gospel
46009019	For though I be fre from all men yet have I made my silfe servaunt vnto all men that I myght wynne the moo .
46009020	Vnto the Iewes I became as a Iewe to winne ye Iewes . To the that were vnder the lawe was I made as though I had bene vnder the lawe to wynne the that were vnder the lawe .
46009021	To them that were without lawe be ca I as though I had bene without lawe ( whe I was not without lawe as perteyninge to god but vnder a lawe as concerninge Christ ) to wynne the that were without lawe .
46009022	To the weake became I as weake to wynne the weake . In all thinge I fassioned my silfe to all men to save at ye lest waye some .
46009023	And this I do for the gospels sake that I might have my parte therof .
46009024	Perceave ye not how that they which runne in a course runne all yet but one receaveth the rewarde . So runne that ye maye obtayne .
46009025	Euery man yt proveth masteryes abstaineth from all thinges . And they do it to obtayne a corruptible croune : but we to obtayne an vncorruptible croune :
46009026	I therfore so runne not as at an vncertayne thinge . So fyght I not as one yt beateth the ayer :
46009027	but I tame my body and bringe it into subieccio lest after that I have preached to other I my silfe shuld be a castawaye .
46010001	Brethren I wolde not that ye shuld be ignoraunt of this how yt oure fathers were all vnder a cloude and all passed thorow the see
46010002	and were all baptised vnder Moses in the cloude and in the see :
46010003	and dyd all eate of one spirituall meate
46010004	and did all drincke of one maner of spirituall drincke . And they dranke of that spretuall rocke that folowed them which rocke was Christ .
46010005	But in many of them had god no delite . For they were overthrowen in the wildernes .
46010006	These are ensamples to vs that we shuld not lust after evyll thinges as they lusted
46010007	Nether be ye worshippers of Images as were some of them accordynge as it is written : The people sate doune to eate and drynke and rose vp agayne to playe .
46010008	Nether let vs comit fornicacion as some of them committed fornicacion and were destroyed in one daye . xxiii . thousande .
46010009	Nether let vs tempte Christ as some of them tempted and were destroyed of serpentes .
46010010	Nether murmure ye as some of them murmured and were destroyed of ye destroyer
46010011	All these thinges happened vnto them for ensamples and were written to put vs in remembraunce whom the endes of the worlde are come apon .
46010012	Wherfore let hym that thynketh he stodeth take hede least he fall .
46010013	There hath none other temptacion taken you but soche as foloweth ye nature of ma . But God is faythfull which shall not suffer you to be tempted above youre strenght : but shall in the myddes of the temptacion make awaye to escape out .
46010014	Wherfore my deare beloued fle from worshippynge of ydols .
46010015	I speake as vnto them which have discrecion Iudge ye what I saye .
46010016	Ys not the cuppe of blessinge which we blesse partakynge of ye bloude of Christ ? ys not the breed which we breake partetakynge of the body of Christ ?
46010017	because that we ( though we be many ) yet are one breed and one bodye in as moch as we all are partetakers of one breed .
46010018	Beholde Israhell which walketh carnally . Are not they which eate of the sacrifyse partetakers of the aultre ?
46010019	What saye I then ? that the ymage is eny thinge ? or that it which is offered to ymages is eny thinge ?
46010020	Nay but I saye that those thinges which the gentyle offer they offer to devyls and not to god . And I wolde not that ye shuld have fellishippe with ye devils
46010021	Ye canot drincke of the cup of the lorde and of yt cup of ye deuyls . Ye cnanot be partetakers of the lordes table and of the table of deuelles .
46010022	Ether shall we provoke the lorde ? Or are we stronger then he ? All thynges are laufull vnto me but all thynges are not expedient .
46010023	All thynges are lawfull to me but all thinges edifye not .
46010024	Let no man seke his awne proffet : but let every man seke anothers welthe .
46010025	What soever is solde in the market that eate and axe no questions for conscience sake
46010026	For the erth is the lordis and all that therein is .
46010027	Yf eny of them which beleve not bid you to a feest and yf ye be disposed to goo what soever is seet before you : eate axinge no question for conscience sake .
46010028	But and yf eny man saye vnto you : this is dedicate vnto ydols eate not of it for his sake that shewed it and for hurtynge of conscience . The erth is the lordes and all that there in is .
46010029	Conscience I saye not thyne : but the coscieuce of that other . For why shuld my liberte be iudged of another manes conscience :
46010030	For yf I take my parte with thakes : why am I evell spoken of for that thynge wherfore I geve thankes .
46010031	Whether therfore ye eate or dryncke or what soever ye do do all to the prayse of God .
46010032	Se that ye geve occasion of evell nether to ye Iewes nor yet to the gentyls nether to ye cogregacion of god :
46010033	euen as I please all men in all thinges not sekynge myne awne proffet but the proffet of many that they myght be saved . Folowe me as I do Christ .
46011001	I commende you
46011002	brethren that ye remeber me in all thinges and kepe the ordinaunces even as I delyvered them to you .
46011003	I wolde ye knew that Christ is the heed of every man . And the man is the womans heed . And God is Christes heed .
46011004	Eevery ma prayinge or prophesyinge havynge eny thynge on his heed shameth his heed .
46011005	Every woman that prayeth or prophisieth bare hedded dishonesteth hyr heed . For it is even all one and the very same thinge even as though she were shaven .
46011006	If the woman be not covered lett her also be shoren . If it be shame for a woma to be shorne or shave let her cover her heed .
46011007	A man ought not to cover his heed for as moche as he is the image and glory of God . The woman is the glory of the man .
46011008	For the man is not of the woman but the woman of the ma .
46011009	Nether was the man created for ye womas sake : but the woma for the mannes sake
46011010	For this cause ought the woma to have power on her heed for the angels sakes .
46011011	Neverthelesse nether is the ma with oute the woma nether the woma with out the man in the lorde .
46011012	For as the woman is of the man eve so is the man by the woman : but all is of God .
46011013	Iudge in youre selves whether it be coly yt a woman praye vnto god bare heeded .
46011014	Or els doth not nature teach you that it is a shame for a man
46011015	if he have longe heere : and a prayse to a woman yf she have longe heere ? For her heere is geven her to cover her with all .
46011016	If there be eny man amonge you yt lusteth to stryve let him knowe that we have no soche custome nether the congregacions of God .
46011017	This I warne you of and commende not that ye come to gedder : not after a better maner but after a worsse .
46011018	Fyrst of all when ye come togedder in the cogregacion I heare that ther is dissencion amonge you : and I partly beleve it .
46011019	For ther must be sectes amonge you that they which are perfecte amonge you myght be knowen .
46011020	When ye come to gedder a man cannot eate the lordes supper . For every man begynneth a fore to eate his awne supper .
46011021	And one is hongrye and another is dronken . Have ye not houses to eate and to drinke in ?
46011022	Or els despyse ye the congregacion of god and shame them that have not ? What shall I saye vnto you ? shall I prayse you : In this prayse I you not .
46011023	That which I delyvered vnto you I receaved of ye lorde . For ye lorde Iesus the same nyght in which he was betrayed toke breed :
46011024	and thanked and brake and sayde . Take ye and eate ye : this is my body which is broken for you . This do ye in the remembraunce of me .
46011025	After the same maner he toke the cup when sopper was done sayinge . This cup is the newe testament in my bloude . This do as oft as ye drynke it in the remebraunce of me .
46011026	For as often as ye shall eate this breed and drynke this cup ye shall shewe the lordes deeth tyll he come .
46011027	Wherfore whosoevere shall eate of this bred or drynke of the cup vnworthely shalbe giltie of the body and bloud of the Lorde
46011028	Let a ma therfore examen him silfe and so let hi eate of the breed and drynke of the cup .
46011029	For he yt eateth or drinketh vnworthely eateth and drynketh his awne damnacion because he maketh no difference of the lordis body .
46011030	For this cause many are weake and sicke amoge you and many slepe .
46011031	Yf we had truly iudged oure selves we shuld not have bene iudged .
46011032	But when we are iudged of the lorde we are chastened because we shuld not be daned with the worlde .
46011033	Wherfore my brethren when ye come to gedder to eate tary one for another .
46011034	Yf eny ma hoger let hi eate at home yt ye come not togedder vnto condenacio . Other thinges will I set in order whe I come .
46012001	In spirituall thinges brethren I wolde not have you ignoraunt .
46012002	Ye knowe that ye were gentyls and went youre wayes vnto domme ydoles even as ye were ledde .
46012003	Wherfore I declare vnto you that no man speakynge in the sprete of god defieth Iesus . Also no man can saye that Iesus is the lorde : but by the holy goost .
46012004	Ther are diversities of gyftes verely yet but one sprete .
46012005	And ther are differences of administracions and yet but one lorde .
46012006	And ther are divers maners of operacions and yet but one God which worketh all thinges that are wrought in all creatures .
46012007	The gyftes of ye sprete are geven to every man to proffit ye congregacion .
46012008	To one is geven thorow the spirite the vtteraunce of wisdome ? To another is geven the vtteraunce of knowledge by ye same sprete .
46012009	To another is geuen fayth by ye same sprete . To another ye gyftes of healynge by the same sprete .
46012010	To another power to do myracles . To another prophesie ? To another iudgement of spretes . To another divers tonges . To another the interpretacion of toges .
46012011	And these all worketh eve ye silfe same sprete devydynge to every man severall gyftes even as he will .
46012012	For as the body is one and hath many mebres and all the membres of one body though they be many yet are but one body : even so is Christ .
46012013	For in one sprete are we all baptysed to make one body whether we be Iewes or getyls whether we be bonde or fre : and have all dronke of one sprete .
46012014	For the body is not one member but many .
46012015	Yf the fote saye : I am not the honde therfore I am not of the body : is he therfore not of ye body :
46012016	And if ye eare saye I am not the eye : therfore I am not of the body : is he therfore not of the body ?
46012017	If all the body were an eye where were then the eare ? If all were hearynge : where were the smellynge ?
46012018	But now hath god disposed the membres every one of them in the body at his awne pleasure .
46012019	If they were all one member : where were the body ?
46012020	Now are ther many membres yet but one body .
46012021	And the eye can not saye vnto the honde I have no nede of the : nor ye heed also to the fete . I have no nede of you .
46012022	Ye rather a greate deale those mebres of the body which seme to be most feble are most necessary .
46012023	And apo those mebres of yt body which we thinke lest honest put we most honestie on . And oure vngodly parties have most beauty on .
46012024	For oure honest members nede it not . But God hath so disposed the body ad hath geven most honoure to that parte which laked
46012025	lest there shuld be eny stryfe in the body : but that the members shuld indifferetly care one for another .
46012026	And yf one member suffer all suffer with him : yf one member be had in honoure all members be glad also .
46012027	Ye are the body of Christ and members one of another .
46012028	And God hath also ordeyned in the congregacion fyrst the Apostels secodarely prophetes thyrdly teachers then the that do miracles : after that the gyftes of healynge helpers governers diversite of tonges .
46012029	Are all Apostles ? Are all Prophetes ? Are all teachers ? Are all doars of miracles ?
46012030	Have all the gyftes of healinge ? Do all speake wt tonges ? Do all interprete ?
46012031	Covet after ye best giftes . Amd yet shewe I vnto you a moare excellent waye .
46013001	Though I spake with the tonges of me and angels and yet had no love I were eve as soundinge brasse : or as a tynklynge Cymball .
46013002	And though I coulde prophesy and vnderstode all secretes and all knowledge : yee yf I had all fayth so that I coulde move moutayns oute of ther places and yet had no love I were nothynge .
46013003	And though I bestowed all my gooddes to fede ye poore and though I gave my body even that I burned and yet had no love it profeteth me nothinge .
46013004	Love suffreth longe and is corteous . Love envieth not . Love doth not frowardly swelleth not dealeth
46013005	not dishonestly seketh not her awne is not provoked to anger thynketh not evyll
46013006	reioyseth not in iniquite : but reioyseth in ye trueth
46013007	suffreth all thynge beleveth all thynges hopeth all thynges endureth in all thynges .
46013008	Though that prophesyinge fayle other tonges shall cease ) or knowledge vanysshe awaye yet love falleth never awaye
46013009	For oure knowledge is vnparfect and oure prophesyinge is vnperfet .
46013010	But when yt which is parfect is come then yt which is vnparfet shall be done awaye .
46013011	When I was a chylde I spake as a chylde I vnderstode as a childe I ymagened as a chylde . But assone as I was a man I put awaye childesshnes .
46013012	Now we se in a glasse even in a darke speakynge : but then shall we se face to face . Now I knowe vnparfectly : but then shall I knowe even as I am knowen .
46013013	Now abideth fayth hope and love even these thre : but the chefe of these is love .
46014001	Labour for love and covet spretuall giftes : and most chefly forto prophesye .
46014002	For he that speaketh with toges speaketh not vnto men but vnto god for no man heareth him how be it in the sprete he speaketh misteries .
46014003	But he that prophesieth speaketh vnto men to edifyinge to exhortacion and to comforte .
46014004	He that speaketh with tonges proffiteth him silfe : he that prophesyeth edifieth the congregacion .
46014005	I wolde that ye all spake with tonges : but rather that ye prophesied . For greater is he that prophisieth ? then he yt speaketh with tonges except he expounde it also that the congregacion maye have edifyinge .
46014006	Now brehren if I come vnto you speakige wt tonges : what shall I profit you excepte I speake vnto you other by revelacio or knowledge or prophesyinge or doctrine .
46014007	Moreover whe thinges with out lyfe geve sounde : whether it be a pype or an harpe : except they make a distinccion in the soundes : how shall it be knowen what is pyped or harped ?
46014008	And also if the trope geve an vncertayne voyce who shall prepare him silfe to fyght ?
46014009	Eve so lykwyse whe ye speake with toges excepte ye speake wordes that have signification how shall yt be vnderstonde what is spoke ? For ye shall but speake in the ayer .
46014010	Many kyndes of voyces are in the worlde and none of them are with out signification .
46014011	If I knowe not what the voyce meaneth I shalbe vnto him that speaketh an alient : and and he that speaketh shalbe an alient vnto me
46014012	Eve so ye ( for as moche as ye covet spretuall giftes ) seke that ye maye have plentye vnto ye edifyinge of the congregacion .
46014013	Wherfore let him that speaketh with tonges praye that he maye interpret also .
46014014	If I praye with tonge my sprete prayeth : but my mynde is with out frute .
46014015	What is it then ? I will praye with the sprete ad will praye wt the mynde also . I will singe with the sprete and will singe with the mynde also .
46014016	For els when thou blessest with ye sprete how shall he that occupieth the roume of the vnlearned saye amen at thy gevinge of thankes seynge he vnderstondeth not what thou sayest .
46014017	Thou verely gevest thankes well but the other is not edyfied .
46014018	I thanke my god I speake with toges moare then ye all .
46014019	Yet had I lever in ye cogregacio to speake five wordes with my mynde to ye informacio of other rather then ten thousande wordes wt the tonge .
46014020	Brethre be not chyldre in witte . How be it as cocerninge maliciousnes be chyldre : but in witte be perfet .
46014021	In the lawe it is written with other toges and with other lyppes wyll I speake vnto this people and yet for all that will they not heare me sayth the Lorde .
46014022	Wherfore tonges are for a signe not to them that beleve : but to them that beleve not . Contrary wyse prophesyinge serveth not for them that beleve not : but for them which beleve .
46014023	Yf therfore when all the cogregacion is come to gedder and all speake with tonges ther come in they yt are vnlearned or they which beleve not : will they not saye that ye are out of youre wittes ?
46014024	But and yf all prophesy and ther come in one that beleveth not or one vnlearned he is rebuked of all men and is iudged of every man :
46014025	and so are ye secretes of his hert opened and so falleth he doune on his face and worshippeth God and sayth yt God is wt you in dede .
46014026	How is it then brethre ? When ye come to gedder every ma hath his songe hath his doctryne hath his toge hath his revelacio hath his interpretacio . Let all thinges be done vnto edifyinge .
46014027	If eny man speake wt tonges let it be two at once or at the most thre at once and that by course : and let another interprete it .
46014028	But yf ther be no interpreter let him kepe silence in the cogregacion and let him speake to him selfe and to God .
46014029	Let the Prophetes speake two at once or thre at once and let other iudge .
46014030	Yf eny revelacio be made to another that sitteth by let the fyrst holde his peace .
46014031	For ye maye all prophesy one by one that all maye learne and all maye have comforte .
46014032	For ye spretes of the Prophetes are in the power of the Prophetes .
46014033	For God is not causer of stryfe : but of peace as he is in all other congregacions of the saynctes .
46014034	Let youre wyves kepe silence in the cogregacions . For it is not permitted vnto them to speake : but let them be vnder obedience as sayth the lawe .
46014035	If they will learne enythinge let the axe their husbandes at home . For it is a shame for wemen to speake in the cogregacio .
46014036	Sproge ye worde of god fro you ? Ether came it vnto you only ?
46014037	Yf eny ma thinke him sylfe a prophet ether spirituall : let him vnderstonde what thinges I write vnto you . For they are the comaundementes of the Lorde .
46014038	But and yf eny man be ignorat let him be ignorant .
46014039	Wherfore brethren covet to prophesye and forbyd not to speake with tonges .
46014040	And let all thinges be done honestly and in order .
46015001	Brethren as pertayninge to the gospell which I preached vnto you which ye have also accepted and in the which ye continue
46015002	by which also ye are saved : I do you to wit after what maner I preached vnto you yf ye kepe it except ye have beleved in vayne .
46015003	For fyrst of all I delivered vnto you that which I receaved : how that Christ dyed for oure synnes agreinge to the scriptures :
46015004	and that he was buried and that he arose agayne the thyrd daye accordinge to the scriptures :
46015005	and that he he was sene of Cephas then of the twelve .
46015006	After that he was sene of moo the five hodred brethren at once : of which many remayne vnto this daye and many are fallen aslepe .
46015007	After that appered he to Iames then to all the Apostles .
46015008	And last of all he was sene of me as of one that was borne out of due tyme .
46015009	For I am the lest of all the Apostles which am not worthy to be called an Apostle because I persecuted the congregacion of God .
46015010	But by the grace of God I am that I am . And his grace which is in me was not in vayne : but I labored moare aboundauntly then they all not I but the grace of God which is with me .
46015011	Whether it were I or they so we preache and so have ye beleved .
46015012	If Christ be preached how that he rose fro deeth : how saye some that are amoge you that ther is no resurreccion from deeth ?
46015013	If ther be no rysynge agayne from deeth : then is Christ not rysen .
46015014	If Christ be not rysen then is oure preachinge vayne and youre faith is also in vayne .
46015015	Ye and we are founde falce witnesses of God . For we have testifyed of God how that he raysyd vp Christ whom he raysyd not vp yf it be so that the deed ryse not vp agayne .
46015016	For yf the deed ryse not agayne then is Christ not rysen agayne .
46015017	If it be so yt Christ rose not then is youre fayth in vayne and yet are ye in youre synnes .
46015018	And therto they which are fallen a slepe in Christ are perished .
46015019	If in this lyfe only we beleve on christ then are we of all men the miserablest .
46015020	But now is Christ rysen from deeth and is become the fyrst frutes of them that slept .
46015021	For by a man came deeth and by a man came resurreccion fro deeth .
46015022	For as by Adam all dye : eve so by Christ shall all be made alive
46015023	and every man in his awne order . The fyrst is Christ then they yt are Christis at his commynge .
46015024	Then cometh the ende when he hath delivered vp ye kyngdome to God ye father when he hath put doune all rule auctorite and power .
46015025	For he must raygne tyll he have put all his enemyes vnder his fete .
46015026	The last enemye that shalbe destroyed is deeth .
46015027	For he hath put all thinges vnder his fete . But when he sayth all thinges are put vnder him it is manyfest that he is excepted which dyd put all thinges vnder him .
46015028	When all thinges are subdued vnto him : then shall the sonne also him selfe be subiecte vnto him that put all thinges vnder him yt God maye be all in all thinges .
46015029	Ether els what do they which are baptised over ye deed yf the deed ryse not at all ? Why are they then baptised over the deed ?
46015030	Ye and why stonde we in ieoperdy every houre ?
46015031	By oure reioysinge which I have in Christ Iesu oure Lorde I dye dayly .
46015032	That I have fought with beastes at Ephesus after the maner of men what avautageth it me yf the deed ryse not agayne ? Let vs eate and drynke to morowe we shall dye .
46015033	Be not deceaved : malicious speakinges corrupte good maners .
46015034	Awake truely out of slepe and synne not . For some have not the knowlege of God . I speake this vnto youre rebuke .
46015035	But some ma will saye : how aryse ye deed ? with what bodyes come they in ?
46015036	Thou fole that which thou sowest is not quickened except it dye .
46015037	And what sowest thow ? Thow sowest not that body that shalbe : but bare corne ( I meane ether of wheet or of some other )
46015038	and God geveth it a body at his pleasure to every seed a severall body .
46015039	All flesshe is not one manner of flesshe : but ther is one maner flesshe of men another maner flesshe of beastes another maner flesshe of fysshes and another of byrdes .
46015040	Ther are celestiall bodyes and ther are bodyes terrestriall . But ye glory of ye celestiall is one and ye glory of the terrestriall is another .
46015041	Ther is one maner glory of the sonne and another glory of the mone and another glory of the starres . For one starre differth fro another in glory .
46015042	So is the resurreccio of ye deed . It is sowe in corrupcio and ryseth in incorrupcion .
46015043	It is sowen in dishonoure and ryseth in honoure . It is sowe in weaknes and ryseth in power . It is sowne a naturall body and ryseth a spretuall body .
46015044	Ther is a naturall bodye and ther is a spretuall body :
46015045	as it is written : the fyrste man Adam was made a livinge soule : and ye last Ada was made a quickeninge sprete .
46015046	How be it yt is not fyrst which is spirituall : but yt which is naturall and then yt which is spretuall .
46015047	The fyrst ma is of the erth erthy : the seconde man is ye Lorde fro heave .
46015048	As is the erthy soche are they that are erthye . And as is the hevely soche are they yt are hevenly .
46015049	And as we have borne the ymage of the erthy so shall we beare the ymage of the hevenly .
46015050	This saye I brethren that flesshe and bloud canot inheret the kyngdome of God . Nether corrupcion inhereth vncorrupcion .
46015051	Beholde I shewe you a mystery . We shall not all slepe : but we shall all be chaunged
46015052	and that in a moment and in the twinclinge of an eye at the sounde of the last trompe . For the trompe shall blowe and ye deed shall ryse incorruptible and we shalbe chaunged .
46015053	For this corruptible must put on incorruptibilite : and this mortall must put on immortalite .
46015054	When this corruptible hath put on incorruptibilite and this mortall hath put on immortalite : then shalbe brought to passe ye sayinge yt is writte . Deeth is consumed in to victory .
46015055	Deeth where is thy stynge ? Hell where is thy victory ?
46015056	The stynge of deeth is synne : and the strength of synne is the lawe .
46015057	But thankes be vnto God which hath geven vs victory thorow oure Lorde Iesus Christ .
46015058	Therfore my deare brethren be ye stedfast and unmovable alwayes ryche in the workes of the Lorde for as moch as ye knowe how yt youre labour is not in vayne in the Lorde .
46016001	Of the gadderynge for the saynctes as I have ordeyned in the congregacios of Galacia even so do ye .
46016002	Vpon some sondaye let every one of you put a syde at home and laye vp what soever he thinketh mete that ther be no gaderinges when I come .
46016003	When I am come whosoever ye shall alowe by youre letters them will I sende to bringe youre liberalite vnto Ierusalem .
46016004	And yf it be mete yt I goo they shall go with me .
46016005	I will come vnto you after I have gone over Macedonia . For I will goo thorowout Macedonia .
46016006	With you paraveture I wyll abyde awhyle : or els winter that ye maye brynge me on my waye whyther soever I goo .
46016007	I will not se you now in my passage : but I trust to abyde a whyle with you yf God shall suffre me .
46016008	I will tary at Ephesus untyll whit sontyde .
46016009	For a greate dore and a frutefull is opened vnto me : and ther are many adversaries .
46016010	If Timotheus come se yt he be with out feare with you . For he worketh the worke of the Lorde as I doo .
46016011	Let no man despyse him : but convaye him forthe in peace yt he maye come vnto me . For I loke for him with the brethre .
46016012	To speake of brother Apollo : I greatly desyred him to come vnto you with ye brethren but his mynde was not at all to come at this tyme . How be it he will come when he shall have conveniet tyme .
46016013	Watche ye stonde fast in the fayth auyte you lyke men and be stronge .
46016014	Let all youre busynes be done in love .
