46016015	Brethren ( ye knowe the housse of Stephana how yt they are the fyrst frutes of Achaia and that they have appoynted them selves to minister vnto the saynctes )
46016016	I beseche you yt ye be obedient vnto soche and to all that helpe and laboure .
46016017	I am gladde of the comynge of Stephana Fortunatus and Achaicus : for that which was lackinge on youre parte they have supplied .
46016018	They have comforted my sprete and youres . Loke therfore that ye knowe them that are soche .
46016019	The congregacions of Asia salute you . Aquila and Priscilla salute you moche in the Lorde and so doeth the congregacio that is in their housse .
46016020	All the brethren grete you . Grete ye one another with an holy kysse .
46016021	The salutacion of me Paul with myne awne hande .
46016022	Yf eny man love not the Lorde Iesus Christ the same be anathema maranatha .
46016023	The grace of ye Lorde Iesus Christ be with you all .
46016024	My love be with you all in Christ Iesu . Ame
47001001	Paul an Apostle of Iesu Christ by the will of God and brother Timotheus . Vnto the congregacion of God which is at Corinthu with all the saynctes which are in all Achaia .
47001002	Grace be with you and peace from God oure father and from the Lorde Iesus Christ .
47001003	Blessed be God ye father of oure Lorde Iesus Christ the father of mercy and the God of all comforte
47001004	which comforteth vs in all oure tribulacio in so moche yt we are able to coforte them which are troubled in whatsoever tribulacion it be with the same comforte wher with we oure selves are coforted of God .
47001005	For as ye affliccios of Christ are pleteous in vs eve so is oure consolacio plenteous by Christ .
47001006	Whether we be troubled for youre consolacion and salvacio which salvacion sheweth her power in yt ye soffre ye same affliccios which we also suffre : or whether we be coforted for youre consolacion and salvacion :
47001007	yet oure hope is stedfast for you in as moch as we know how that as ye have youre parte in affliccios so shall ye be parttakers of consolacion .
47001008	Brethren I wolde not have you ignoraut of oure trouble which happened vnto vs in Asia . For we were greved out of measure passynge strength so greatly that we despeared even of lyfe .
47001009	Also we receaved an answer of deeth in oure selves and that because we shuld not put oure trust in oure selves : but in God which rayseth the deed to lyfe agayne
47001010	and which delivered vs from so gret a deeth and doth delivre . On whom we trust yt yet hereafter he will deliver
47001011	by the helpe of youre prayer for vs : that by the meanes of many occasions thankes maye be geven of many on oure behalfe for the grace geven vnto vs .
47001012	Oure reioysynge is this the testimony of oure coscience yt in synglenes and godly purenes and not in flesshly wysdome but by the grace of God we have had oure conuersacion in the worlde and most of all to you wardes .
47001013	We write no nother thinges vnto you then that ye reade and also knowe . Yee and I trust ye shall fynde vs vnto the ende even as ye have founde vs partly :
47001014	for we are youre reioysynge even as ye are oures in the daye of the Lorde Iesus .
47001015	And in this confidence was I mynded the other tyme to have come vnto you that ye myght have had yet one pleasure moare :
47001016	and to have passed by you into Macedonia and to have come agayne out of Macedonia vnto you and to have bene ledde forth to Iewrye warde of you .
47001017	When I thus wyse was mynded : dyd I vse lightnes ? Or thinke I carnally those thinges which I thinke ? that with me shuld be ye ye and naye naye .
47001018	God is faythfull : For oure preachynge vnto you was not ye and naye .
47001019	For Goddis sonne Iesus Christ which was preached amonge you by vs ( that is to saye by me and Silvanus and Timotheus ) was not ye and naye : but in him it was ye .
47001020	For all the promyses of God in him are ye : and are in him Amen vnto the lawde of God thorow vs .
47001021	For it is God which stablissheth vs and you in Christ and hath annoynted vs
47001022	which hath also sealed vs and hath geven the ernest of the sprete into oure hertes .
47001023	I call God for a recorde vnto my soule that forto faver you with all I came not enymoare vnto Corinthum .
47001024	Not that we be lordes over youre fayth : but helpers of youre ioye . For by fayth ye stode .
47002001	But I determened this in my silfe yt I wolde not come agayne to you in hevines .
47002002	For yf I make you sorye who is it that shuld make me glad but the same which is made sory by me ?
47002003	And I wrote this same pistle vnto you lest yf I came I shuld take hevynes of them of whom I ought to reioyce . Certaynly this confidence have I in you all that my ioye is the ioye of you all .
47002004	For in great affliccion and anguysshe of hert I wrote vnto you with many teares : not to make you sory but that ye myght perceave the love which I have most specially vnto you .
47002005	If eny man hath caused sorow the same hath not made me sory but partely : lest I shuld greve you all .
47002006	It is sufficient vnto the same man that he was rebuked of many .
47002007	So that now contrary wyse ye ought to forgeve him and comforte him : lest that same persone shuld be swalowed vp with over moche hevines .
47002008	Wherfore I exhorte you that love maye have stregth over him .
47002009	For this cause verely dyd I write that I myght knowe the profe of you whether ye shuld be obediet in all thinges .
47002010	To whom ye forgeve enythinge I forgeve also . And verely if I forgeve enythinge to whom I forgave it for youre sakes forgave I it in the roume of Christ
47002011	lest Satan shuld prevet vs . For his thoughtes are not vnknowen vnto vs .
47002012	When I was come to Troada for Christes gospels sake ( and a great dore was openned vnto me of the Lorde )
47002013	I had no rest in my sprete because I founde not Titus my brother : but toke my leave of them and went awaye into Macedonia .
47002014	Thankes be vnto God which alwayes geveth vs the victorie in Christ and openeth the saver of his knowledge by vs in every place .
47002015	For we are vnto God the swete savoure of Christ both amoge them that are saved and also amoge them which perisshe .
47002016	To the one parte are we ye savoure of deeth vnto deeth . And vnto the other parte are we the savoure of lyfe vnto lyfe . And who is mete vnto these thinges ?
47002017	For we are not as many are which choppe and chaunge with the worde of God : but even oute of purenes and by the power of God and in the sight of God so speake we in Christ .
47003001	We begyn to prayse oure selves agayne . Nede we as some other of pistles of recommendacion vnto you ? or letters of recomendacion from you ?
47003002	Ye are oure pistle written in oure hertes which is vnderstonde and reed of all men
47003003	in that ye are knowen how that ye are the pistle of Christ ministred by vs and written not with ynke : but with the sprete of the livynge God not in tables of stone but in flesshly tables of ye herte .
47003004	Suche trust have we thorow Christ to god ward
47003005	not that we are sufficient of oure selves to thinke enythinge as it were of oure selves : but oure ablenes cometh of God
47003006	which hath made vs able to minister the newe testamet not of the letter but of the sprete . For the letter kylleth but the sprete geveth lyfe .
47003007	Yf the ministracion of deeth thorow the letters figured in stones was glorious so yt the chyldren of Israel coulde not beholde the face of Moses for the glory of his countenauce ( which glory neverthelesse is done awaye )
47003008	why shall not the ministracion of the sprete be moche more glorious ?
47003009	For if ye ministringe of condempnacio beglorious : moche more do the the ministracion of rightewesnes excede in glory .
47003010	For no dout that which was there glorified is not once glorified in respecte of this excedynge glory .
47003011	Then if that which is destroyed was glorious moche more shall that which remayneth be glorious .
47003012	Seynge then that we have soche trust we vse gret boldnes
47003013	and do not as Moses which put a vayle over his face that the children of Israel shuld not se for what purpose that served which is put awaye .
47003014	But their myndes were blinded . For untill this daye remayneth the same coveringe vntake awaye in the olde testamet when they reade it which in Christ is put awaye .
47003015	But even vnto this daye when Moses is redde ye vayle hangeth before their hertes .
47003016	Neverthelesse when they tourne to ye Lorde the vayle shalbe taken awaye .
47003017	The Lorde no dout is a sprete . And where the sprete of the Lorde is there is libertie .
47003018	But we all beholde the glorye of the Lorde with his face open and are chaunged vnto the same similitude from glory to glory even of the sprite of the Lorde .
47004001	Therfore seinge that we have soche an office eve as mercy is come on vs we faynte not :
47004002	but have cast from vs the clokes of vnhonestie and walke not in craftines nether corrupte we the worde of God : but walke in open trueth and reporte oure selves to every mannes conscience in the sight of God .
47004003	Yf oure Gospell be yet hyd it is hid amoge them that are lost
47004004	in whom ye god of this worlde hath blynded the myndes of them which beleve not lest the light of ye glorious gospell of Christ which is the ymage of god shuld shyne vnto them .
47004005	For we preache not oure selves but Christ Iesus to be the Lorde and oure selves youre servautes for Iesus sake .
47004006	For it is God that commauded the light to shyne out of darcknes which hath shyned in oure hertes for to geve the light of the knowledge of the glorie of God in the face of Iesus Christ .
47004007	But we have this treasure in erthe vessels that ye excellent power of it myght appere to be of God and not of vs .
47004008	We are troubled on every side yet are we not with out shyft . We are in povertie : but not vtterly without somwhat .
47004009	We are persecuted : but are not forsake . We are cast doune : neverthelesse we perisshe not .
47004010	And we all wayes beare in oure bodyes the dyinge of the Lorde Iesus that the lyfe of Iesu myght appere in oure bodyes .
47004011	For we which live are alwayes delyvered vnto deeth for Iesus sake yt the lyfe also of Iesu myght appere in oure mortall flesshe .
47004012	So then deeth worketh in vs and lyfe in you .
47004013	Seynge then yt we have ye same sprete of fayth accordinge as it is writte : I beleved and therfore have I spoken . We also beleve and therfore speake .
47004014	For we knowe that he which raysed vp the Lorde Iesus shall rayse vp vs also by the meanes of Iesus and shall seet vs with you .
47004015	For all thinges do I for youre sakes that the plenteous grace by thankes geve of many maye redounde to the prayse of god .
47004016	Wherfore we are not weried but though oure vttward man perisshe yet the inwarde man is renewed daye by daye .
47004017	For oure excedinge tribulacion which is momentany and light prepareth an excedinge and an eternall wayght of glorye
47004018	vnto vs whill we loke not on the thynges which are sene but on ye thynges which are not sene . For thinges which are sene are temporall : but thynges which are not sene are eternall
47005001	We knowe suerly yf oure erthy mancion wherin we now dwell were destroyed that we have a bildinge ordeyned of god an habitacion not made with hondes but eternall in heve .
47005002	And herefore sigh we desyringe to be clothed wt oure mansion which is from heven :
47005003	so yet if that we be founde clothed and not naked .
47005004	For as longe as we are in this tabernacle we sigh and are greved for we wold not be vnclothed but wolde be clothed apon that mortalite myght be swalowed vp of lyfe .
47005005	He that hath ordeyned vs for this thynge ys god which very same hath geven vnto vs the ernest of the sprete .
47005006	Therfore we are alwaye of good chere and knowe well that as longe as we are at home in the body we are absent from God .
47005007	For we walke in fayth and se not .
47005008	Neverthelesse we are of good comforte and had lever to be absent from the body and to be present with the lorde .
47005009	Wherfore whether we be at home or from home we endeuoure oure selves to please him .
47005010	For we must all appere before the iudgement seate of Christ that every man maye receave the workes of his body accordynge to that he hath done whether it be good or bad ?
47005011	Seynge then that we knowe how the lorde is to be feared we fare fayre with men . For we are knowen wel ynough vnto God . I trust also that we are knowen in youre consciences .
47005012	We prayse not oure selves agayne vnto you but geve you an occasion to reioyce of vs that ye maye have some what agaynst the whych reioyce in the face and not in the hert .
47005013	For yf we be to fervent to God are we to fervent . Yf we kepe measure for youre cause kepe we measure .
47005014	For the love of Christ costrayneth vs be cause we thus iudge yf one be deed for all yt then are all deed
47005015	and that he dyed for all that they which live shuld not hence forth live vnto them selves but vnto hym whith died for them and rose agayne .
47005016	Wherfore henceforth knowe we no man after the flesshe . In somoche though we have knowe Christ after the flesshe now hence forthe knowe we hym so no more .
47005017	Therfore yf eny man be in Christ he is a newe creature . Olde thynges are passed awaye beholde all thinges are be come newe .
47005018	Neverthelesse all thinges are of god which hath reconciled vs vnto him sylfe by Iesus Christ and hath geven vnto vs the office to preach the atonement .
47005019	For god was in Christ and made agrement bitwene the worlde and hym sylfe and imputed not their synnes vnto them : and hath comitted to vs the preachynge of ye atonmet .
47005020	Now then are we messengers in the roume of Christ : even as though God did beseche you thorow vs : So praye we you in Christes stede that ye be atone with God :
47005021	for he hath made him to be synne for vs which knewe no synne that we by his meanes shuld be that rightewesnes which before God is aloved .
47006001	We as helpers therfore exhorte you yt ye receave not the grace of god in ( vayne )
47006002	For he saith : I have hearde the in a tyme accepted : and in ye daye of saluacion have I suckered the . Beholde now is that well accepted tyme : beholde now is yt daye of saluacion .
47006003	Let vs geve no man occasion of evyll that in oure office be founde no faute :
47006004	but in all thynges let vs behave oure selves as the ministers of God . In moche pacience in afflicios in necessite in anguysshe
47006005	in strypes in presonmet in stryfe in laboure in watchinge in fastyng
47006006	in purenes in knowledge in longe sufferynge in kyndnes in the holy goost in love vnfayned
47006007	in ye wordes of trueth in the power of God by ye armoure of rightewesnes on ye right honde and on the lyfte
47006008	in honoure and dishonoure in evyll reporte and good reporte as desceauers and yet true
47006009	as unknowen and yet knowen : as dyinge and beholde we yet live : as chastened and not killed :
47006010	as sorowynge and yet alwaye mery : as poore and yet make many ryche : as havynge nothynge and yet possessynge all thynges .
47006011	O ye Corinthyans oure mouth is open vnto you . Oure herte is made large :
47006012	ye are in no strayte in vs but are in a strayte in youre awne bowelles :
47006013	I promyse you lyke rewarde with me as to my childre .
47006014	Set youreselues therfore at large and beare not a straugers yoke wyth the vnbelevers . For what fellishippe hath rightewesnes with vnrightewesnes ? What company hath light wt darcknes ?
47006015	What cocorde hath Christ with beliall ? Ether what parte hath he yt beleveth with an infidele ?
47006016	how agreeth the temple of god wt ymages ? And ye are the temple of yt lyuynge god as sayde god . I will dwell amonge the and walke amoge the and wilbe their god : and they shalbe my people .
47006017	Wherfore come out from amoge the and separate youreselues ( sayth the lorde ) and touche none vncleane thynge : so wyll I receave you
47006018	and wilbe a father vnto you and ye shalbe vnto me sonnes and doughters sayth the lorde almyghty .
47007001	Seynge that we have soche promeses derely beloved let vs clense oure selves from all fylthynes of the flesshe and sprete and growe vp to full holynes in ye feare of God .
47007002	Vnderstonde vs . we have hurte no man : we have corrupte no man : we have defrauded no man .
47007003	I speake not this to condempne you : for I have shewed you before yt ye are in oure hertes to dye and live with you .
47007004	I am very bolde over you and reioyce greatly in you . I am filled with comforte and am excadinge ioyouse in all oure tribulacions .
47007005	For when we were come into Macedonia oure flesshe had no rest but we were troubled on every syde . Outwarde was fightynge inwarde was feare .
47007006	Neverthelesse God that comfortith the abiecte comforted vs at the commynge of Titus .
47007007	And not with his commynge only : but also with the consolacion wherwith he was comforted of you . For he tolde vs youre desyre youre mornynge youre fervent mynde to me warde : so that I now reioyce the more .
47007008	Wherfore though I made you sory with a letter I repent not : though I did repent . For I perceave that ye same pistle made you sory though it were but for a ceason .
47007009	But I now reioyce not that ye were sory but that ye so sorowed that ye repented . For ye sorowed godly : so yt in nothynge ye were hurte by vs .
47007010	For godly sorowe causeth repentaunce vnto salvacion not to be repented of : when worldly sorow causeth deeth .
47007011	Beholde what diligence this godly sorowe that ye toke hath wrought in you : yee it caused you to cleare youre selves . It caused indignacion it caused feare yt caused desyre it caused a fervent mynde it caused punysshment . For in all thynges ye have shewed youreselues that ye were cleare in that matter .
47007012	Wherfore though I wrote vnto you I did it not for his cause that did hurte nether for his cause that was hurte : but that oure good mynde whych we have towarde you in the sight of god myght appere vnto you .
47007013	Therfore we are comforted because ye are comforted : yee and excedyngly the moare ioyed we for the ioye that Titus had : because his sprete was refresshed of you all .
47007014	I a therfor not now ashamed though I bosted my sylfe to hym of you . For as all thynges which I preached vnto you are true even so is oure bostynge that I bosted my silfe to Titus wt all founde true .
47007015	And now is his inwarde affection more aboundant towarde you when he remembreth the obedience of every one of you : how with feare and trymblynge ye receaved hym .
47007016	I reioyce that I maye be bolde over you in all thynges .
47008001	I do you to wit brethren of the grace of god which is geven in the congregacions of Macedonia
47008002	how that the aboundaunce of their reioysing is that they are tried wt moche tribulacio . And therto though they were excedinge poore yet haue they geue excedinge richly and that in singlenesse .
47008003	For to their powers ( I beare recorde ) yee and beyonde their power they were willynge of their owne accorde
47008004	and prayed vs with great instaunce that we wolde receave their benefite and suffre them to be parttakers with other in ministrynge to the saynctes .
47008005	And this they did not as we loked for : but gave their awne selves fyrst to the lorde and after vnto vs by the will of God :
47008006	so that we coulde not but desyre Titus to acomplysshe the same benivolence amonge you also even as he had begonne .
47008007	Now therfore as ye are ryche in all parties in fayth in worde in knowledge in all fervetnes and in love which ye have to vs : even so se that ye be plenteons in this benivolence .
47008008	Thys saye I not as commaundynge : but be cause other are so fervent therfore prove I youre love whether it be perfait or no .
47008009	Ye knowe the liberalitie of oure lorde Iesus Christ which though he were riche yet for youre sakes be came poore : that ye thorow his povertie myght be made ryche .
47008010	And I geve counsell hereto . For this is expedient for you which beganne not to do only : but also to will a yeare a goo .
47008011	Now therfore performe the dede : that as ther was in you a redines to will even so ye maye performe the dede of that which ye have .
47008012	For if ther be fyrst a willynge mynde it is accepted accordynge to that a man hath and not accordinge to that he hath not .
47008013	It is not my mynde that other be set at ease and ye brought into combraunce :
47008014	but that ther be egalnes now at this tyme that youre aboundaunce sucker their lacke : that their aboundaunce maye supplie youre lacke :
47008015	that ther maye be equalite agreynge to that which is written . He that gaddered moche had never the more aboundaunce and he yt gaddered lytell had never the lesse .
47008016	Thankes be vnto god which put in ye hert of Titus the same good mynde toward you .
47008017	For he accepted ye request yee rather he was so well willynge that of his awne accorde came vnto you .
47008018	We haue sent with him that brother whose laude is in the gospell thorow out all the congregacions :
47008019	and not so only but is also chosen of the congregacions to be a felowe with vs in oure iorney concerninge this benivolence that is ministred by vs vnto the prayse of ye lorde and to stere vp youre prompt mynde .
47008020	For thys we eschue that eny man shuld rebuke vs in this plenteous distribucion that is ministred by vs
47008021	and therfore make provision for honest thynges not in the sight of god only but also in the sight of men .
47008022	We have sent with them a brother of oures whom we have ofte tymes proved diliget in many thynges but now moche more diligent . The great confidence which I have in you .
47008023	hath caused me this to do : partly for Titus sake which is my felowe and helper as cocernynge you partly because of other which are oure brethren and the messengers of the congregacios and ye glory of Christ .
47008024	Wherfore shewe vnto them the proffe of youre love and of the reioysynge that we have of you that ye congregacions maye se it .
47009001	Of the ministrynge to ye saynctes it is but superfluous for me to write vnto you :
47009002	for I knowe youre redynes of mide wherof I bost my silfe vnto them of Macedonia and saye that Achaia was prepared a yeare a goo and youre ferventnes hath provoked many .
47009003	Never thelesse yet have I sent these brethren lest oure reioysynge over you shuld be in vayne in this behalfe and that ye ( as I have sayd ) preparare youre selues
47009004	lest paraveture yf they of Macedonia come with me and fynde you vnprepared the boost that I made in this matter shuld be a shame to vs : I saye not vnto you .
47009005	Wherfore I thought it necessary to exhorte the brethren to come before hode vnto you forto prepare youre good blessynge promysed afore that it myght be redy : so yt it be a blessynge and not a defraudynge .
47009006	This yet remember howe that he which soweth lytell shall reepe lytell : and he yt soweth plenteously shall reepe plenteously .
47009007	And let every man do accordynge as he hath purposed in his herte not groudgyngly or of necessite . For god loveth a chearfull gever .
47009008	God is able to make you ryche in all grace that ye in all thynges havynge sufficiet vnto the vttmoste maye be ryche vnto all manner good workes
47009009	as it is written : He yt sparsed abroade and hath geven to the povre his rightewesnes remayneth for ever .
47009010	He yt fyndeth the sower seed shall minister breed for fode and shall multiplie youre seed and increace the frutes of youre rightewesnes
47009011	that on all parties ye maye be made ryche in all synglenes which causeth thorowe vs thankes gevynge vnto god .
47009012	For the office of this ministracion not only supplieth the nede of the sayntes : but also is aboundaunt herein that for this laudable ministrynge thankes myght be geven to god
47009013	of many whiche prayse god for the obedience of youre professynge ye gospell of Christ and for youre synglenes in distributynge to them and to all me :
47009014	and in their prayers to God for you longe after you for the aboundauut grace of God geven vnto you .
47009015	Thankes be vnto God for his vn speakeable gyft .
47010001	I Paule my silfe beseche you by the mekenes and softnes of Christ which when I am present amoge you am of no reputacio but am bolde towarde you beinge absent .
47010002	I besech you that I nede not to be bolde when I am present ( with that same confidece wher with I am supposed to be bolde ) agaynst some which repute vs as though we walked carnally .
47010003	Neverthelesse though we walke compased with ye fleshe yet we warre not flesshlye
47010004	For the weapes of oure warre are not carnall thinges but thynges myghty in god to cast doune stronge holdes
47010005	wherwith we overthrowe ymaginacyons and every hye thynge that exalteh it silfe agaynst the knowledge of god and brynge into captivite all vnderstondynge to the obedience of Christ
47010006	and are redy to take vengeaunce on all disobedience when youre obedience is fulfilled .
47010007	Loke ye on thynges after ye vtter apparence ? Yf eny man trust in him silfe yt he is Christis let the same also considre of him silfe yt as he is Christis even so are we Christes .
47010008	And though I shuld bost my silfe somewhat moare of oure auctorite which the lorde hath geven vs to edifie and not to destroye you it shulde not be to my shame .
47010009	This saye I lest I shuld seme as though I went about to make you a frayde with letters .
47010010	For ye pistles ( sayth he ) are sore and stronge : but his bodyly presence is weake and his speache rude .
47010011	Let him yt is soche thynke on this wyse that as we are in wordes by letters when we are absent soche are we in dedes when we are present .
47010012	For we cannot fynde in oure hertes to make oure selves of ye nombre of them or to compare oure selves to them which laude the selves neuerthelesse whill they measure the selves wt them selves and copare the selves wt the selves they vnderstode nought .
47010013	But we wyll not reioyce above measure : but accordynge to the quantitie of ye measure which god hath distributed vnto vs a measure that reacheth even vnto you .
47010014	For we stretche uot out oure selves beyode measure as though we had not reached vnto you . For even vnto you have we come with the gospell of Christ
47010015	and we bost not oure selves out of measure in other mens labours . Ye and we hope when youre fayth is increased amoge you to be magnified acordynge to oure measure more largely
47010016	and to preache ye gospell in those regions which are beyode you : and not to reioyce of that which is by another mans measure prepared all redy .
47010017	Let him yt reioyseth reioyce in the lorde .
47010018	For he that prayseth him silfe is not alowed : but he whom the lorde prayseth .
47011001	Wolde to god ye coulde suffre me a lytell in my folysshnes : yee and I praye you forbeare me .
47011002	For I am gelous over you with godly gelousy . For I coupled you to one man to make you a chaste virgen to Christ .
47011003	But I feare lest as the serpent begyled Eve thorow his sutteltie even so youre wittes shuld be corrupte from the singlenes that is in Christ .
47011004	For if he that commeth preache another Iesus then hym whom we preached : or if ye receave another sprete then that which ye have receaved : other another gospell then that ye have receaved ye myght right wel have bene content .
47011005	I suppose that I was not behynde ye chefe apostles .
47011006	Though I be rude in speakynge yet I am not so in knowledge . How be it amonge you we are knowen to the vtmost what we are in all thynges .
47011007	Did I therin synne be cause I submitted my silfe that ye myght be exalted and because I preached to you the gospell of God fre ?
47011008	I robbed other congregacions and toke wages of the to do you service with all .
47011009	And when I was present with yov and had nede I was greuous to no man for that which was lackynge vnto me the brethren which came from Macedonia supplied : and in all thynges I kept my silfe that I shuld not be greveous to you : and so will I kepe my silfe .
47011010	Yf the trueth of Christ be in me this ieioysynge shall not be taken from me in the regions of Achaia .
47011011	Wherfore ? Be cause I love you not ? God knoweth .
47011012	Neverthe lesse what I doo that will I do to cut awaye occasion from them which desyre occasion that they myght be founde lyke vnto vs in that wherin they reioyce .
47011013	For these falce apostles are disceatefull workers and fassion them selves lyke vnto ye apostles of Christ .
47011014	And no marvayle for satan him silfe is chaunged into the fassion of an angell of light .
47011015	Therfore it is no great thynge though his ministers fassion them selves as though they were the ministers of rightewesnes : whose ende shalbe acordynge to their dedes .
47011016	I saye agayne lest eny man thynke yt I am folishe : or els eve now take me as a fole that I maye bost my silfe a lytell .
47011017	That I speake I speake it not after the wayes of the lorde : but as it were folysshly whill we are now come to bostynge .
47011018	Seynge that many reioyce after ye flesshe I will reioyce also .
47011019	For ye suffre foles gladly be cause that ye youre selves are wyse .
47011020	For ye suffre even if a man brynge you into bondage : yf a ma devoure : yf a man take : yf a man exalt hym silfe : yf a man smyte you on the face .
47011021	I speake as concernynge rebuke as though we had bene weake . How be it wherin soever eny man dare be bolde ( I speake folisshly ) I dare be bolde also
47011022	They are Ebrues so am I : They are Israelites eve so am I . They are ye seede of Abraha even so am I .
47011023	They are ye ministers of Christ ( I speake as a fole ) I am moare : In labours moare aboundat : In strypes above measure : In preson more plenteously : In deeth ofte .
47011024	Of the Iewes five tymes receaved I every tyme . xl . strypes saue one .
47011025	Thryse was I beten with roddes . I was once stoned . I suffered thryse shipwracke . Nyght and daye have I bene in the depe of the see .
47011026	In iorneyinge often : In parels of waters : In parels of robbers : In ieoperdies of myne awne nacion : In ieoperdies amoge the hethen . I have bene in parels in cities in parels in wildernes in parels in the see in parels amonge falce brethren
47011027	in laboure and travayle in watchynge often in honger in thirst in fastynges often in colde and in nakednes .
47011028	And besyde the thynges which outwardly happe vnto me I am cobred dayly and do care for all congregacions .
47011029	Who is sicke and I am not sicke ? Who is hurte in the fayth and my hert burneth not ?
47011030	Yf I must nedes reioyce I will reioyce of myne infirmities .
47011031	The God and father of oure lorde Iesus Christ which is blessed for evermore knoweth that I lye not
47011032	In ye citie of Damascon the governer of ye people vnder kynge Aretas layde watche in ye citie of the Damasces and wolde have caught me
47011033	and at a wyndowe was I let doune in a basket thorowe the wall and so scaped his hondes .
47012001	It is not expediet for me ( no dout to reioyce . Neverthelesse I will come to visions and revelacios of ye lorde .
47012002	I knowe a ma in Christ above . xiiij . yeares agone ( whether he weare in ye body I cannot tell or whether he were oute of ye body I canot tell god knoweth ) which was take vp into the thyrd heven .
47012003	And I knowe the same man ( whether in the body or out of the body I canot tell god knoweth )
47012004	howe yt he was take vp into paradise and hearde wordes not to be spoke which no man can vtter .
47012005	Of this man will I reioyce of my silfe will I not reioyce except it be of myne infirmities .
47012006	And yet though I wolde reioyce I shuld not be a fole : for I wolde saye the trouthe . Neverthe lesse I spare lest eny man shuld thynke of me above that he seith me to be or heareth of me .
47012007	And lest I shuld be exalted out of measure thorow the aboundance of revelacions ther was geven vnto me vnquyetnes of the flesshe the messenger of Satan to buffet me : be cause I shuld not be exalted out of measure
47012008	For this thynge besought I the lorde thryse that it myght departe from me .
47012009	And he sayde vnto me : my grace is sufficient for the . For my stregth is made perfact thorow weaknes . Very gladly therfore will I reioyce of my weaknes that the strength of Christ maye dwell in me
47012010	Therfore have I delectacion in infirmities in rebukes in nede in persecucions in anguyshe for Christis sake . For when I am weake then am I stronge .
47012011	I am made a fole in bostynge my silfe . Ye have copelled me : I ought to have bene comeded of you . For in nothinge was I inferior vnto ye chefe apostels Though I be nothynge
47012012	yet ye tokes of an apostle were wrought amoge you with all pacience : with signes and wonders and myghty dedes .
47012013	For what is it wherin ye were inferiors vnto other cogregacions except it be therin that I was not greveous vnto you . Forgeve me this wronge done vnto you .
47012014	Beholde now ye thyrde tyme I am redy to come vnto you : and yet will I not be grevous vnto you . For I seke not youres but you . Also the children ought not to laye vp for the fathers and mothers : but the fathers and mothers for the children .
47012015	I will very gladly bestowe and wilbe bestowed for youre soules : though the moare I love you ye lesse I am loved agayne .
47012016	But be it yt I greved you not : never the lesse I was crafty and toke you with gile .
47012017	Did I pill you by eny of the which I sent vnto you ?
47012018	I desyred Titus and wt him I sent a brother . Did Titus defraude you of eny thynge ? walked we not in one sprete ? walked we not in lyke steppes ?
47012019	Agayne thynke ye yt we excuse oure selves ? We speake in Christ in the sight of God . But we do all thynges dearly beloved for youre edifyinge .
47012020	For I feare lest it come to passe that when I come I shall not fynde you soche as I wolde : and I shalbe foude vnto you soche as ye wolde not : I feare lest ther be founde amoge you debate envyinge wrath stryfe backbytynges whisperynges swellynges and discorde .
47012021	I feare lest when I come agayne God brynge me lowe amoge you and I be constrayned to bewayle many of the which have synned all redy and have not repented of the vnclennes fornicacion and wantanes which they haue committed .
47013001	Now come I the thyrd tyme vnto you In the mouth of two or thre witnesses shall every thinge stonde .
47013002	I tolde you before and tell you before : and as I sayde whe I was present with you the seconde tyme so wryte I now beynge absent to them which in tyme past have synned and to all other : yt if I come agayne I will not spare
47013003	seynge yt ye seke experience of Christ which speaketh in me which amoge you is not weake but is myghty in you .
47013004	And verely though it came of weaknes that he was crucified yet liveth he thorow the power of God . And we no dout are weake in him : but we shall live with him by the myght of God amonge you .
47013005	Prove youre selves whether ye are in the fayth or not . Examen youre owne selves : knowe ye not youre awne selves how that Iesus Christ is in you excepte ye be castawayes ?
47013006	I trust that ye shall knowe yt we are not castawayes .
47013007	I desyre before God that ye do none evyll not that we shuld seme comendable : but that ye shuld do that which is honest : and let vs be counted as leawde persones .
47013008	We can do no thinge agaynst the trueth but for the trueth .
47013009	We are glad when we are weake and ye stronge . This also we wisshe for even that ye were perfect .
47013010	Therfore write I these thinges beynge absent lest when I am present I shuld vse sharpenes accordinge to the power which the Lorde hath geven me to edifie and not to destroye .
47013011	Finallye brethren fare ye well be perfect be of good comforte be of one mynde lyve in peace and the God of love and peace shalbe with you .
47013012	Grete one another in an holy kysse .
47013013	All ye saynctes salute you .
47013014	The grace of oure Lorde Iesus Christ and the love of God and the fellishippe of the holy goost be with you all . Ame
48001001	Paul an Apostle not of men nether by man but by Iesus Christ and by God the father which raysed him from deeth :
48001002	and all the brethren which are with me . Vnto the congregacios of Galacia .
48001003	Grace be with you and peace from God the father and from oure Lorde Iesus Christ
48001004	which gave him selfe for oure synnes to deliver vs from this present evyll worlde thorow the will of God oure father
48001005	to whom be prayse for ever and ever . Amen .
48001006	I marvayle that ye are so sone turned fro him that called you in the grace of Christ vnto another gospell :
48001007	which is nothinge els but that ther be some which trouble you and intende to pervert to gospell of Christ .
48001008	Neverthelesse though we oure selves or an angell fro heve preache eny other gospell vnto you the that which we have preached vnto you holde him as a cursed .
48001009	As I sayde before so saye I now agayne yf eny man preache eny other thinge vnto you then that ye have receaved holde him accursed .
48001010	Preache I mannes doctrine or Godes ? Ether go I about to please men ? If I stodyed to please men I were not the servaunt of Christ .
48001011	I certifie you brethren that the gospell which was preached of me was not after the maner of men
48001012	nether receaved I it of ma nether was I taught it : but receaved it by the revelacion of Iesus Christ .
48001013	For ye have hearde of my conversacion in tyme past in the Iewes wayes how that beyonde measure I persecuted the congregacion of God and spoyled it :
48001014	and prevayled in the Iewes laye above many of my companions which were of myne awne nacio and was a moche more fervet mayntener of the tradicions of the elders .
48001015	But whe it pleased God which seperated me from my mothers wombe and called me by his grace
48001016	forto declare his sonne by me that I shuld preache him amonge the hethen : immediatly I comened not of the matter with flesshe and bloud
48001017	nether returned to Ierusalem to them which were Apostles before me : but wet my wayes into Arabia and came agayne vnto Damasco .
48001018	Then after thre yeare I returned to Ierusalem to se Peter and abode with him . xv . dayes
48001019	no nother of the Apostles sawe I save Iames the Lordes brother .
48001020	The thinges which I write beholde God knoweth I lye not .
48001021	After that I went into the costes of Siria and Cilicia :
48001022	and was vnknowen as touchinge my person vnto ye cogregacios of Iewrye which were in Christ .
48001023	But they hearde only that he which persecuted vs in tyme past now preacheth the fayth which before he destroyed .
48001024	And they glorified God on my behalffe .
48002001	Then . xiiii . yeares after that I wet vp agayne to Ierusalem with Barnabas and toke with me Titus also .
48002002	Ye and I went vp by revelacion and comened with them of the Gospell which I preache amonge the gentyls : but apart with them which were couted chefe lest it shuld have bene thought yt I shuld runne or had runne in vayne .
48002003	Also Titus which was with me though he were a Greke yet was not compelled to be circumcised
48002004	and that because of incomers beynge falce brethren which came in amoge other to spye out oure libertie which we have in Christ Iesus that they might bringe vs into bondage .
48002005	To whom we gave no roume no not for the space of an houre as cocerninge to be brought into subieccio : and that because that the trueth of the gospell myght continue with you .
48002006	Of the which seme to be great ( what they were in tyme passed it maketh no matter to me : God loketh on no mans person ) neverthelesse they which seme great added nothynge to me .
48002007	But contrary wyse when they sawe that the gospell over the vncircumcision was comitted vnto me as the gospell over ye circucision was vnto Peter :
48002008	for he yt was myghty in Peter in the Apostleshippe over the circumcision the same was myghty in me amoge the gentyls :
48002009	and therfore when they perceaved the grace that was geve vnto me then Iames Cephas and Iohn which semed to be pilers gave to me and Barnabas the ryght hondes and agreed with vs that we shuld preache amonge the Hethen and they amonge the Iewes :
48002010	warnynge only that we shulde remember the poore . Which thinge also I was diligent to do .
48002011	And when Peter was come to Antioche I withstode him in the face for he was worthy to be blamed .
48002012	For yerr that certayne came fro Iames he ate with the gentyls . But when they were come he withdrue and separated him selfe fearinge them which were of ye circumcision .
48002013	And ye other Iewes dissembled lyke wyse in so moche that Barnabas was brought into their simulacio also .
48002014	But when I sawe that they went not the ryght waye after the trueth of the gospell I sayde vnto Peter before all men yf thou beynge a Iewe livest after the maner of the gentyls and not as do the Iewes : why causest thou the getyls to live as do the Iewes ?
48002015	We which are Iewes by nature and not synners of the getyls
48002016	knowe that a man is not iustified by ye dedes of the lowe : but by the fayth of Iesus Christ . And therfore we have beleved on Iesus Christ yt we myght be iustified by ye fayth of Christ and uot by the dedes of the lawe : because that by ye dedes of ye lawe no flesshe shalbe iustified .
48002017	Yf then whill we seke to be made rightewes by Christ we oure selves are founde synners is not then Christ ye minister of synne ? God forbyd .
48002018	For yf I bylde agayne yt which I destroyed . then make I my selfe a treaspaser .
48002019	But I thorow ye lawe ame deed to ye lawe : that I myght live vnto God .
48002020	I am crucified with Christ . I live verely : yet now not I but Christ liveth in me . For ye lyfe which I now live in ye flesshe I live by the fayth of ye sonne of God which loved me and gave him selne for me .
48002021	I despyse not the grace of God . For if rightewesnes come of the lawe then Christ dyed in vayne .
48003001	O folisshe Galathyas : who hath bewitched you that ye shuld not beleve the trueth ? To whom Iesus Christ was described before the eyes and amoge you crucified .
48003002	This only wolde I learne of you : receaved ye the sprete by the dedes of ye lawe or els by preachinge of ye faith ?
48003003	Are ye so vnwyse that after ye have begonne in the sprete ye wolde nowe ende in the flesshe ?
48003004	So many thinges there ye have suffred in vayne if yt be vayne .
48003005	Which ministered to you the sprete and worketh myracles amonge you doth he it thorow the dedes of the lawe or by preachinge of the fayth ?
48003006	Even as Abraham beleved God and it was asscribed to him for rightewesnes .
48003007	Vnderstonde therfore yt they which are of fayth the same are the chyldren of Abraham .
48003008	For the seripture sawe afore honde yt God wolde iustifie the hethen thorow fayth and therfore shewed before honde glad tydinges vnto Abraham : In the shall all nacions be blessed .
48003009	So then they which be of fayth are blessed with faythfull Abraham .
48003010	For as many as are vnder the dedes of the lawe are vnder malediccio . For it is written : cursed is every man yt cotinueth not in all thinges which are writte in ye boke of ye lawe to fulfill the .
48003011	That no ma is iustified by ye lawe in ye sight of God is evidet . For the iuste shall live by fayth .
48003012	The lawe is not of fayth : but the man that fulfilleth the thinges contayned in the lawe ( shall live in the . )
48003013	But Christ hath delivered vs fro the curse of the lawe and was made a cursed for vs . For it is writte : cursed is every one that hangeth on tree
48003014	that the blessynge of Abraham might come on the getyls thorow Iesus Christ and that we might receave the promes of the sprete thorow fayth .
48003015	Brethren I will speake after the maner of men . Though it be but a mans testament yet no ma despiseth it or addeth eny thinge therto when it is once alowed .
48003016	To Abraham and his seed were the promises made . He sayth not in the seedes as in many : but in thy sede as in one which is Christ .
48003017	This I saye that the lawe which beganne afterwarde beyonde . iiii . C and . xxx . yeares doth not disanull the testament that was confermed afore of God vnto Christ ward to make the promes of none effect .
48003018	For yf the inheritaunce come of the lawe it cometh not of promes . But God gave it vnto Abraham by promes .
48003019	Wherfore then serveth ye lawe ? The lawe was added because of transgression ( tyll the seed cam to which ye promes was made ) and it was ordeyned by angels in ye honde of a mediator .
48003020	A mediator is not a mediator of one . But God is one .
48003021	Ys the lawe then agaynst ye promes of God ? God forbid . How be it yf ther had bene a lawe geve which coulde have geven lyfe : then no doute rightewesnes shuld have come by ye lawe .
48003022	But ye scripture concluded all thinges vnder synne yt the promes by the fayth of Iesus Christ shuld be geve vnto them yt beleve .
48003023	Before yt fayth cam we were kept and shut vp vnder the lawe vnto the fayth which shuld afterwarde be declared .
48003024	Wherfore the lawe was oure scolemaster vnto the tyme of Christ yt we might be made rightewes by fayth .
48003025	But after yt fayth is come now are we no lenger vnder a scolemaster .
48003026	For ye are all the sonnes of God by ye fayth which is in Christ Iesus .
48003027	For all ye that are baptised have put on Christ .
48003028	Now is ther no Iewe nether getyle : ther is nether bonde ner fre : ther is nether man ner woman : but ye are all one thinge in Christ Iesu .
48003029	Yf ye be Christes then are ye Abrahams seed and heyres by promes .
48004001	And I saye that the heyre as longe as he is a chylde differth not from a servaunt though he be Lorde of all
48004002	but is vnder tuters and governers vntill the tyme appoynted of the father .
48004003	Even so we as longe as we were chyldren were in bondage vnder the ordinaunces of the worlde .
48004004	But when the tyme was full come God sent his sonne borne of a woman and made bonde vnto ye lawe
48004005	to redeme the which were vnder the lawe : yt we thorow eleccion myght receave the inheritauce yt belongeth vnto the naturall sonnes .
48004006	Be cause ye are sonnes God hath sent the sprete of his sonne in to oure hertes which cryeth Abba father .
48004007	Wherfore now thou art not a servaunt but a sonne . Yf thou be ye sonne thou arte also the heyre of God thorow Christ .
48004008	Notwithstondinge whe ye knewe not God ye dyd service vnto them which by nature were no goddes .
48004009	But now seinge ye knowe god ( yee rather are knowe of God ) how is it that ye tourne agayne vnto the weake and bedgarly cerimonies whervnto agayne ye desyre afresshe to be in bondage ?
48004010	Ye observe dayes and monethes and tymes and yeares .
48004011	I am in feare of you lest I have bestowed on you laboure in vayne .
48004012	Brethern I besech you be ye as I am : for I am as ye are . Ye have not hurte me at all .
48004013	Ye knowe how thorow infirmite of the flesshe I preached the gospell vnto you at the fyrst .
48004014	And my temptacion which I suffered by reason of my flesshe ye despysed not nether abhorred : but receaved me as an angell of god : ye as Christ Iesus .
48004015	How happy were ye then ? for I beare you recorde that yf it had bene possible ye wolde have plucked out youre awne eyes and have geven them to me .
48004016	Am I therfore become youre enemie because I tell you the truth ?
48004017	They are gelous over you amysse . Ye they intede to exclude you that ye shuld be feruet to them warde .
48004018	It is good alwayes to be fervent so it be in a good thinge and not only whe I am present with you .
48004019	My littel children ( of whom I travayle in birth againe vntill Christ be fassioned in you )
48004020	I wolde I were with you now and coulde chaunge my voyce : for I stonde in a doute of you
48004021	Tell me ye that desyre to be vnder the lawe have ye not hearde of the lawe ?
48004022	For it is written that Abraham had two sonnes ye one by a bonde mayde the other by a fre woman .
48004023	Yee and he which was of the bonde woman was borne after the flesshe : but he which was of the fre woman was borne by promes .
48004024	Which thinges betoken mystery . For these wemen are two testamentes the one fro the mounte Sina which gendreth vnto bondage which is Agar .
48004025	For mounte Sina is called Agar in Arabia and bordreth vpo the citie which is now Ierusalem and is in bondage with her chyldren .
48004026	But Ierusalem which is above is fre : which is the mother of vs all .
48004027	For it is written : reioyce thou bare that bearest no chyldre : breake forthe and crye thou that travelest not . For the desolate hath many moo chyldren then she which hath an husband .
48004028	Brethre we are after the maner of Isaac chyldren of promes .
48004029	But as then he yt was borne carnally persecuted him that was borne spiritually . Even so is it now .
48004030	Neverthelesse what sayth the scripture : put awaye the bonde woman and her sonne . For the sonne of the bonde woma shall not be heyre with the sonne of ye fre woman .
48004031	So then brethren we are not chyldre of the bonde woman : but of the fre woman .
48005001	Stond fast therfore in ye libertie wher with Christ hath made vs fre and wrappe not youre selves agayne in ye yoke of bondage .
48005002	Beholde I Paul saye vnto you that yf ye be circumcised Christ shall proffit you nothinge at all .
48005003	I testifie agayne to every man which is circumcised that he is bounde to kepe the whole lawe .
48005004	Ye are gone quyte fro Christ as many as are iustified by the lawe and are fallen from grace .
48005005	We loke for and hope in the sprite to be iustified thorow fayth .
48005006	For in Iesu Christ nether is circumcision enythinge worth nether yet vncircocision but faith which by love is mighty in operacion .
48005007	Ye did runne well : who was a let vnto you that ye shuld not obey the trueth ?
48005008	Eve that counsell that is not of him that called you .
48005009	A lytell leven doth leven the whole lompe of dowe .
48005010	I have trust towarde you in the Lorde yt ye wyll be none other wyse mynded . He that troubleth you shall beare his iudgemet what soever he be .
48005011	Brethren yf I yet preache circucision : why do I then yet suffre persecucion ? For then had the offence which the crosse geveth ceased .
48005012	I wolde to God they were seperated from you which trouble you .
48005013	Brethre ye were called in to ( libertie ) only let not youre libertie be an occasion vnto the flesshe but in love serve one another .
48005014	For all ye lawe is fulfilled in one worde which is this : thou shalt love thyne neghbour as thy selfe .
48005015	Yf ye byte and devoure one another : take hede lest ye be consumed one of another .
48005016	I saye walke in the sprete and fulfill not ye lustes of ye flesshe .
48005017	For ye flesshe lusteth contrary to ye sprete and ye sprete cotrary to ye flesshe . Tese are cotrary one to the other so yt ye canot do that which ye wolde .
48005018	But and yf ye be ledde of the sprete then are ye not vnder the lawe .
48005019	The dedes of the flesshe are manyfest whiche are these advoutrie fornicacio vnclenes wantannes
48005020	ydolatrye witchecraft hatred variaunce zele wrath stryfe sedicion sectes
48005021	envyinge murther dronkenes glottony and soche lyke : of the which I tell you before as I have tolde you in tyme past that they which comit soche thinges shall not inherite ye kyngdome of God .
48005022	But ye frute of sprete is loue ioye peace longesufferinge getlenes goodnes faythfulnes
48005023	meknes temperancye . Agaynst suche ther is no lawe .
48005024	They ye are Christis have crucified the flesshe with the appetites and lustes
48005025	Yf we lyve in the sprete let vs walke in the sprete .
48005026	Let vs not be vayne glorious provokinge one another and envyinge one another .
48006001	Brethren yf eny ma be fallen by chauce into eny faute : ye which are spirituall helpe to amende him in the sprete of meknes : consyderynge thy silfe lest thou also be tempted .
48006002	Beare ye one anothers burthe and so fulfill the lawe of Christ .
48006003	If eny ma seme to him silfe that he is somwhat whe in dede he is nothynge the same deceaveth hym silfe in his ymaginacion .
48006004	Let every man prove his awne worke and then shall he have reioysinge in his awne silfe and not in another
48006005	For every man shall beare his awne burthen .
48006006	Let him that is taught in ye worde minister vnto him yt teacheth him in all good thinges .
48006007	Be not deceaved God is not mocked . For what soever a man soweth yt shall he reepe .
48006008	He that soweth in his flesshe shall of ye flesshe reepe corrupcio . But he yt soweth in ye sprete shall of the sprete reepe lyfe everlastinge .
48006009	Let vs not be wery of well doynge . For when the tyme is come we shall repe with out werines .
48006010	Whill we have therfore tyme let vs do good vnto all men and specially vnto them which are of the housholde of fayth .
48006011	Beholde how large a letter I have written vnto you with myne awne honde .
48006012	As many as desyre with vtwarde apperauce to please carnally they constrayne you to be circumcised only be cause they wolde not suffre persecucion with the crosse of Christ .
48006013	For they them selves which are circumcised kepe not the lawe : but desyre to have you circumcised that they myght reioyce in youre flesshe .
48006014	God forbyd that I shuld reioyce but in the crosse of oure Lorde Iesu Christ wherby the worlde is crucified as touchinge me and I as concerninge the worlde .
48006015	For in Christ Iesu nether circucision avayleth eny thinge at all nor vncircumcisio : but a new creature .
48006016	And as many as walke accordinge to this rule peace be on them and mercy and vpon Israel that pertayneth to God .
48006017	From hence forth let no man put me to busynes . For I beare in my bodye ye markes of the Lorde Iesu .
48006018	Brethren the grace of oure Lorde Iesu Christe be with youre sprete . Amen .
49001001	Paul an Apostle of Iesu Christ by the will of God . To the saynctes which are at Ephesus and to them which beleve on Iesus Christ .
49001002	Grace be with you and peace from God oure father and from the Lorde Iesus Christ .
49001003	Blessed be God the father of oure lorde Iesus Christ which hath blessed vs with all maner of spirituall blessinges in hevely thynges by Chryst
49001004	accordynge as he had chosen vs in him before ye foudacio of ye worlde was layde that we shuld be saintes and without blame before him thorow loue .
49001005	And ordeyned vs before thorow Iesus Christ to be heyres vnto him silfe accordinge to the pleasure of his will
49001006	to ye prayse of the glorie of his grace where with he hath made vs accepted in the beloved .
49001007	By whom we have redemption thorow his bloude euen the forgevenes of synnes accordynge to the riches of his grace
49001008	which grace he shed on vs aboundantly in all wisdome and perceavaunce .
49001009	And hath openned vnto vs the mistery of his will accordinge to his pleasure and purposed the same in hym silfe
49001010	to have it declared when the tyme were full come yt all thynges bothe ye thynges which are in heven and also the thynges which are in erthe shuld be gaddered togedder even in Christ :
49001011	that is to saye in him in whom we are made heyres and were therto predestinate accordynge to the purpose of him which worketh all thinges after the purpose of his awne will :
49001012	that we which before beleved in Christ shuld be vnto the prayse of his glory .
49001013	In whom also ye ( after that ye hearde the worde of trueth I meane the gospell of youre saluacio wherin ye beleved ) were sealed with the holy sprete of promes
49001014	which is the ernest of oure inheritaunce to redeme the purchased possession and that vnto the laude of his glory .
49001015	Wherfore even I ( after that I hearde of the fayth which ye have in the lorde Iesu and love vnto all the saynctes )
49001016	cease not to geve thankes for you makynge mencion of you in my prayers
49001017	that ye God of oure lorde Iesus Christ and the father of glory myght geve vnto you the sprete of wisdome and open to you the knowledge of him silfe
49001018	and lighten the eyes of youre myndes yt ye myght knowe what that hope is where vnto he hath called you and what the riches of his glorious inheritaunce is apon the sainctes
49001019	and what is the excedynge greatnes of his power to vs warde which beleve accordynge to the workynge of that his mighty power
49001020	which he wrought in Christ when he raysed him from deeth and set him on his right honde in hevenly thynges
49001021	above all rule power and myght and dominacion and above all names that are named not in this worlde only but also in the worlde to come :
49001022	and hath put all thynges vnder his fete and hath made him aboue all thynges ye heed of ye congregacion
49001023	which is his body and the fulnes of him that filleth all in all thynges .
49002001	And hath quickened you also that were deed in treaspasse and synne
49002002	in ye which in tyme passed ye walked acordynge to the course of this worlde and after the governer that ruleth in the ayer the sprete yt now worketh in the children of vnbelefe
49002003	amonge which we also had oure conversacion in tyme past in the lustes of oure flesshe and fullfilled the will of the flesshe and of the mynde : and were naturally the children of wrath even as wel as other .
49002004	But God which is rich in mercy thorow his greate love wherwith he loved vs
49002005	even when we were deed by synne hath quickened vs together in Christ ( for by grace are ye saved )
49002006	and hath raysed vs vp together and made vs sitte together in hevenly thynges thorow Christ Iesus
49002007	for to shewe in tymes to come the excedynge ryches of his grace in kyndnes to vs warde in Christ Iesu .
49002008	For by grace are ye made safe thorowe fayth and that not of youre selves . For it is the gyfte of God
49002009	and commeth not of workes lest eny man shuld bost him silfe .
49002010	For we are his worckmanshippe created in Christ Iesu vnto good workes vnto the which god ordeyned vs before that we shuld walke in them .
49002011	Wherfore remeber yt ye beynge in tyme passed getyls in ye flesshe and were called vncircucision to the which are called circucisio in the flesshe which circucision is made by hondes :
49002012	Remeber I saye yt ye were at that tyme wt oute Christ and were reputed aliantes from the comen welth of Israel and were straugers fro the testamentes of promes and had no hope and were with out god in this worlde .
49002013	But now in Christ Iesu ye which a whyle agoo were farre of are made nye by ye bloude of Christ .
49002014	For he is oure peace whych hath made of both one and hath broken doune the wall yt was a stoppe bitwene vs
49002015	and hath also put awaye thorow his flesshe the cause of hatred ( that is to saye the lawe of commaundementes contayned in the lawe written ) for to make of twayne one newe ma in him silfe so makynge peace :
49002016	and to recocile both vnto god in one body thorow his crosse and slewe hatred therby :
49002017	and came and preached peace to you which were afarre of and to them that were nye .
49002018	For thorow him we both have an open waye in in one sprete vnto the father .
49002019	Now therfore ye are no moare straugers and foreners : but citesyns with the saynctes and of the housholde of god :
49002020	and are bilt apon the foundacion of the apostles and prophetes Iesus Christ beynge the heed corner stone
49002021	in whom every bildynge coupled togedder groweth vnto an holy temple in ye lorde
49002022	in who ye also are bilt togedder and made an habitacio for god in the sprete .
49003001	For this cause I Paul a in ye bodes of Iesus christ for youre sakes which are hethen :
49003002	Yf ye have hearde of the ministracion of the grace of god which is geven me to you warde .
49003003	For by revelacion shewed he this mistery vnto me as I wrote above in feawe wordes
49003004	wher by when ye rede ye maye knowe myne vnderstondynge in the mistery of Christ
49003005	which mistery in tymes passed was not opened vnto the sonnes of men as it is nowe declared vnto his holy apostles and prophetes by the sprete :
49003006	that the gentyls shuld be inheritours also and of the same body and partakers of his promis yt is in Christ by ye meanes of the gospell
49003007	whereof I am made a minister by the gyfte of the grace of god geve vnto me thorow ye workynge of his power .
49003008	Vnto me the lest of all sayntes is this grace geven that I shuld preache amonge the gentyls the unsearchable ryches of Christ
49003009	and to make all men se what the felyshippe of the mistery is which from the begynnynge of the worlde hath bene hid in God which made all thynges thorow Iesus Christ
49003010	to the intent that now vnto the rulars and powers in heven myght be knowe by the cogregacion ye many folde wisdome of god
49003011	accordinge to ye eternall purpose which he purposed in Christ Iesu oure lorde
49003012	by who we are bolde to drawe nye in ye trust which we have by faith on hi
49003013	Wherfore I desire yt ye faynt not because of my trybulacios for youre sakes : which is youre prayse .
49003014	For this cause I bowe my knees vnto the father of oure lorde Iesus Christ
49003015	which is father over all that ys called father In heven and in erth
49003016	that he wolde graunt you acordynge to the ryches of his glory that ye maye be strenghted with myght by his sprete in the inner man
49003017	yt Christ maye dwell in youre hertes by fayth yt ye beynge roted and grounded in loue
49003018	myght be able to comprehende with all sayntes what ys that bredth aud length deepth and heyth :
49003019	and to knowe what is the love of Christ which love passeth knowledge : that ye might be fulfilled with all manner of fulnes which commeth of God .
49003020	Vnto him that is able to do excedynge aboudantly above all that we axe or thynke accordynge to the power that worketh in vs
49003021	be prayse in the congregacion by Iesus Christ thorow out all generacios from tyme to tyme Amen .
49004001	I therfore which am in bondes for the lordes sake exhorte you that ye walke worthy of the vocacion wherwith ye are called
49004002	in all humblenes of mynde and meknes and longe sufferynge forbearinge one another thorowe love
49004003	and that ye be dyliget to kepe ye vnitie of ye sprete in the bonde of peace
49004004	beynge one body and one sprete eve as ye are called in one hope of youre callynge .
49004005	Let ther be but one lorde one fayth one baptim :
49004006	one god and father of all which is above all thorow all and in you all .
49004007	Vnto every one of vs is geven grace acordinge to the measure of ye gyft of christ .
49004008	Wherfore he sayth : He is gone vp an hye and hath ledde captivitie captive and hath geven gyftes vnto men .
49004009	That he ascended : what meaneth it but that he also descended fyrst into the lowest parties of the erth ?
49004010	He that descended is even the same also that ascended vp even above all hevens to fulfill all thinges .
49004011	And the very same made some Apostles some prophetes some Evangelistes some Sheperdes some Teachers :
49004012	yt the sainctes might have all thinges necessarie to worke and minister with all to the edifyinge of the body of christ
49004013	tyll we every one ( in the vnitie of fayth and knowledge of the sonne of god ) growe vp vnto a parfayte man after ye measure of age of the fulnes of Christ .
49004014	That we hence forth be no moare chyldren wauerynge and caryed with every wynde of doctryne by the wylynes of men and craftynes wherby they laye a wayte for vs to deceave vs .
49004015	But let vs folowe the trueth in loue and in all thynges growe in him which is the heed that ys to saye Christ
49004016	in whom all the body ys coupled and knet togedder in every ioynt wherwith one ministreth to another ( accordinge to the operacion as every parte hath his measure ) and increaseth the body vnto the edyfyinge of it silfe in love .
49004017	This I saye therfore and testifie in ye lorde that ye hence forth walke not as other gentyls walke in vanitie of their mynde
49004018	blynded in their vnderstondynge beynge straungers from the lyfe which is in god thorow the ignorancy that is in them because of the blyndnes of their hertes :
49004019	which beynge past repentaunce have geven them selves vnto wantannes to worke all manner of vnclennes even with gredynes .
49004020	But ye have not so learned Christ
49004021	if so be ye have hearde of him and are taught in him even as the trueth is in Iesu .
49004022	So then as concernynge the coversacion in tyme past laye from you that olde ma which is corrupte thorow the deceavable lustes
49004023	and be ye renued in the sprete of youre myndes
49004024	and put on that newe man which after the ymage of God is shapen in ryghtewesnes and true holynes .
49004025	Wherfore put awaye lyinge and speake every man truth vnto his neghbour for as moche as we are members one of another .
49004026	Be angrye but synne not let not the sonne go doune apon your wrathe
49004027	nether geue place vnto ye backbyter .
49004028	Let him yt stole steale no moare but let him rather laboure with his hondes some good thinge that he maye have to geve vnto him that nedeth .
49004029	Let no filthy comunicacion procede out of youre mouthes : but yt whych is good to edefye with all when nede ys : that it maye have faveour with the hearers .
49004030	And greve not the holy sprete of God by whome ye are sealed vnto the daye of redempcion .
49004031	Let all bitternes fearsnes and wrath rorynge and cursyd speakynge be put awaye from you with all maliciousnes .
49004032	Be ye courteouse one to another and mercifull forgevynge one another eve as god for Christes sake forgave you .
49005001	Be ye folowers of god as dere children
49005002	and walke in love even as Christ loved vs and gave him silfe for vs an offerynge and a sacrifyce of a swete saver to god .
49005003	So that fornicacion and all vnclennes or coveteousnes be not once named amonge you as it be commeth saynctes :
49005004	nether filthynes nether folishe talkyng nether gestinge which are not comly : but rather gevynge of thankes
49005005	For this ye knowe yt no whormonger other vnclene person or coveteous person which is the worshipper of ymages hath eny inheritaunce in the kyngdome of Christ and of God .
49005006	Let no ma deceave you with vayne wordes . For thorow soche thinges cometh the wrath of God vpon the chyldre of vnbelefe .
49005007	Be not therfore companions with them .
49005008	Ye were once dercknes but are now light in the Lorde . Walke as chyldren of light .
49005009	For the frute of the sprete is in all goodnes rightewesnes and trueth .
49005010	Accept that which is pleasinge to the Lorde :
49005011	and have no fellishippe with the vnfrutfull workes of dercknes : but rather rebuke them .
49005012	For it is shame even to name those thinges which are done of them in secrete :
49005013	but all thinges when they are rebuked of the light are manifest . For whatsoever is manifest that same is light .
49005014	Wherfore he sayth : awake thou that slepest and stond vp from deeth and Christ shall geve the light .
49005015	Take hede therfore that ye walke circuspectly : not as foles : but as wyse
49005016	redemynge the tyme : for ye dayes are evyll .
49005017	Wherfore be ye not vnwyse but vnderstonde what the will of the Lorde is
49005018	and be not dronke with wyne wherin is excesse : but be fulfilled with the sprete
49005019	speakynge vnto youre selves in psalmes and ymnes and spretuall songes synginge and makinge melodie to ye Lorde in youre hertes
49005020	gevinge thankes all wayes for all thinges vnto God the father in the name of oure Lorde Iesu Christ :
49005021	submittinge youre selves one to another in the feare of God .
49005022	Wemen submit youre selves vnto youre awne husbandes as vnto the Lorde .
49005023	For the husbande is the wyves heed even as Christ is the heed of the congregacion and the same is the saveoure of the body .
49005024	Therfore as the cogregacion is in subieccion to Christ lykwyse let the wyves be in subieccion to their husbandes in all thinges .
49005025	Husbandes love youre wyves even as Christ loved the congregacion and gave him silfe for it
49005026	to sanctifie it and clensed it in the fountayne of water thorow the worde
49005027	to make it vnto him selfe a glorious congregacion with oute spot or wrynckle or eny soche thinge : but that it shuld be holy and with out blame .
49005028	So ought men to love their wyves as their awne bodyes . He that loveth his wyfe loveth him sylfe .
49005029	For no ma ever yet hated his awne flesshe : but norissheth and cherisseth it even as the lorde doth the congregacion .
49005030	For we are members of his body of his flesshe and of his bones .
49005031	For this cause shall a man leave father and mother and shall cotinue with his wyfe and two shalbe made one flesshe .
49005032	This is a great secrete but I speake bitwene Christ and the cogregacion .
49005033	Neverthelesse do ye so that every one of you love his wyfe truely even as him silfe . And let ye wyfe se that she feare her husbade .
49006001	Chyldren obey youre fathers and mothers in the Lorde : for so is it right .
49006002	Honoure thy father and mother that is the fyrst commaundement that hath eny promes
49006003	that thou mayst be in good estate and lyve longe on the erthe .
49006004	And ye fathers move not youre children to wrath : but bringe the vp wt the norter and informacio of ye Lorde .
49006005	Servautes be obedient vnto youre carnall masters with feare and trimblinge in singlenes of youre hertes as vnto Christ :
49006006	not wt service in ye eye sight as men pleasars : but as the servautes of Christ doynge ye will of God fro the herte
49006007	with good will servinge ye Lorde and not men .
49006008	And remember that whatsoever good thinge eny man doeth that shall he receave agayne of the Lorde whether he be bonde or fre .
49006009	And ye masters do eve the same thinges vnto them puttinge awaye threateninges : and remember that even youre master also is in heven nether is ther eny respecte of person with him .
49006010	Finally my brethre be stronge in the Lorde and in the power of his myght .
49006011	Put on ye armour of God that ye maye stonde stedfast agaynst ye crafty assautes of the devyll .
49006012	For we wrestle not agaynst flesshe and bloud : but agaynst rule agaynst power and agaynst worldy rulars of ye darckenes of this worlde agaynst spretuall wickednes for hevenly thinges .
49006013	For this cause take vnto you the armoure of God yt ye maye be able to resist in the evyll daye and to stonde perfect in all thinges .
49006014	Stonde therfore and youre loynes gyrd aboute with veritie havinge on the brest plate of rightewesnes
49006015	and shood with showes prepared by the gospell of peace .
49006016	Above all take to you the shelde of fayth wherwith ye maye quenche all ye fyrie dartes of the wicked .
49006017	And take the helmet of salvacio and the swearde of the sprete which is the worde of God .
49006018	And praye all wayes with all maner prayer and supplicacio : and yt in the sprete : and watch thervnto wt all instance and supplicacio for all saynctes
49006019	and for me that vttraunce maye be geve vnto me that I maye open my mouth boldly to vtter the secretes of the gospell
49006020	whereof I am a messenger in bondes that therin I maye speake frely as it becommeth me to speake .
49006021	But that ye maye also knowe what condicion I am in and what I do Tichicus my deare brother and faythfull minister in the Lorde shall shewe you of all thinges
49006022	whom I sent vnto you for the same purpose that ye myght knowe what case I stonde in and that he myght comfort youre hertes .
49006023	Peace be with the brethren and love with fayth from God the father and from the Lorde Iesu Christ .
49006024	Grace be with all them which love oure lorde Iesus Christ in puernes . Ame
50001001	Paul and Timotheus the servauntes of Iesu Christ To all ye sainctes in Christ Iesu which are at Philippos with ye Bisshops and Deacons .
50001002	Grace be with you and peace from God oure father and from the Lorde Iesus Christ .
50001003	I thanke my God with all remembraunce of you
50001004	all wayes in all my prayers for you and praye with gladnes
50001005	because of the fellowshyp which ye have in the gospell from the fyrst daye vnto now :
50001006	and am suerly certified of this that he which beganne a good worke in you shall go forthe with it vntyll the daye of Iesus Christ
50001007	as it becometh me so to iudge of you all because I have you in my herte and have you also every one companios of grace with me even in my bondes as I defende and stablysshe the gospell .
50001008	For God beareth me recorde how greatly I longe after you all from the very herte rote in Iesus Christ .
50001009	And this I praye yt youre love maye increace more and more in knowledge and in all fealinge
50001010	that ye myght accepte thinges most excellent that ye myght be pure and soche as shuld hurte no manes conscience vntyll the daye of Christ
50001011	filled with the frutes of rightewesnes which frutes come by Iesus Christ vnto the glory and laude of God .
50001012	I wolde ye vnderstode brethern that my busynes is happened vnto the greater furtherynge of the gospell .
50001013	So that my bondes in Christ are manyfest thorow out all the iudgement hall and in all other places :
50001014	In so moche that many of the brethre in ye lorde are boldned thorow my bodes and dare more largely speake the worde with out feare .
50001015	Some ther are which preache Christ of envie and stryfe and some of good wyll .
50001016	The one parte preacheth Christ of stryfe and not purely supposinge to adde more adversitie to my bondes .
50001017	The other parte of love because they se that I am set to defend the gospell .
50001018	What then ? So that Christ be preached all maner wayes whether it be by occasion or of true meaninge I therin ioye : ye and will ioye .
50001019	For I knowe that this shall chaunce to my salvacion thorow youre prayer and ministringe of the sprete of Iesu Christ
50001020	as I hertely loke for and hope that in nothinge I shalbe ashamed : but that with all confidence as all wayes in tymes past even so now Christ shalbe magnified in my body whether it be thorowe lyfe or els deeth .
50001021	For Christ is to me lyfe and deeth is to me a vauntage .
50001022	Yf it chaunce me to live in the flesshe that is to me frutefull forto worke and what to chose I wote not .
50001023	I am constrayned of two thinges : I desyre to be lowsed and to be with Christ which thinge is best of all .
50001024	Neverthelesse to abyde in the flesshe is moare nedfull for you .
50001025	And this am I sure of that I shall abyde and with you all continue for the furtheraunce and ioye of youre fayth
50001026	that ye maye moare aboundantly reioyce in Iesus Christ thorowe me by my comminge to you agayne .
50001027	Only let yovre conversacion be as it be cometh the gospell of Christ : that whether I come and se you or els be absent I maye yet heare of you that ye contynue in one sprete and in one soule labouringe as we do to mayntayne the fayth of the gospell
50001028	and in nothynge fearinge youre adversaries : which is to them a token of perdicion and to you of salvacion and that of God .
50001029	For vnto you it is geven that not only ye shulde beleve on Christ : but also suffre for his sake
50001030	and have eve the same fight which ye sawe me have and now heare of me .
50002001	If ther be amoge you eny consolacion in Christ yf ther be eny cofortable love yf there be eny fellishippe of the sprete yf ther be eny copassion or mercy :
50002002	fulfyll my ioye that ye drawe one waye havinge one love beynge of one accorde and of one mynde
50002003	that nothinge be done thorow stryfe or vayne glory but that in mekenes of mynde every man esteme other better then him selfe
50002004	and that no man consyder his awne but what is mete for other .
50002005	Let the same mynde be in you that was in Christ Iesu :
50002006	Which beynge in the shape of god and thought it not robbery to be equall with god .
50002007	Neverthelesse he made him silfe of no reputacion and toke on him the shape of a servaunte and became lyke vnto men
50002008	and was founde in his aparell as a man . He humbled him silfe and became obediet vnto ye deeth even the deeth of the crosse .
50002009	Wherfore god hath exalted him and geve him a name above all names :
50002010	that in the name of Iesus shuld every knee bowe bothe of thinges in heve and thinges in erth and thinges vnder erth
50002011	and that all tonges shuld confesse that Iesus Christ is the lorde vnto the prayse of God the father .
50002012	Wherfore my dearly beloved as ye have al ways obeyed not when I was present only but now moche more in myne absence even so worke out youre awne saluacio with feare and tremblynge .
50002013	For it is god which worketh in you both ye will and also yt dede eve of good will
50002014	Do all thynge with out murmurynge and disputynge
50002015	that ye maye be fautelesse and pure and the sonnes of God with out rebuke in ye middes of a croked and a perverse nacion amonge which se that ye shyne as lightes in the worlde
50002016	holdinge fast the worde of lyfe vnto my reioysynge in ye daye of Christ that I have not runne in vayne nether have labored in vayne .
50002017	Yee and though I be offered vp vpon the offerynge and sacrifice of youre fayth : I reioyce and reioyce with you all .
50002018	For the same cause also reioyce ye and reioyce ye with me .
50002019	I trust in the lorde Iesus for to sende Timotheus shortly vnto you that I also maye be of good comforte when I knowe what case ye stonde in .
50002020	For I have no ma that is so lyke mynded to me which with so pure affeccio careth for youre matters .
50002021	For all other seke ytir awne and not that which is Iesus Christes
50002022	Ye knowe the proffe of him howe that as a sone with the father so with me bestowed he his labour apon the gospell .
50002023	Him I hope to sende assone as I knowe how it will go with me .
50002024	I trust in the lorde I also my silfe shall come shortly .
50002025	I supposed it necessary to sende brother Epaphroditus vnto you my companion in laboure and felowe soudier youre Apostel and my minister at my nedes .
50002026	For he longed after you and was full of hevines because that ye had hearde saye that he shuld be sicke .
50002027	And no doute he was sicke and that nye vnto deeth . But god had mercy on him : not on him only but on me also lest I shuld have had sorowe apon sorowe .
50002028	I sent him therfore the diligentliar that when ye shuld se him ye myght reioyce agayne and I myght be the lesse sorowfull .
50002029	Receave him therfore in the lorde with all gladnes and make moche of soche :
