50002030	because that for ye worke of Christ he went so farre that he was nye vnto deeth and regarded not his lyfe to fulfill that service which was lackynge on youre parte towarde me .
50003001	Morover my brethren reioyce in the lorde . It greveth me not to write one thinge often to you . For to you it is a sure thynge .
50003002	Beware of dogges beware of evyll workers . Beware of dissencion .
50003003	For we are circucision which worshippe god in the sprete and reioyce in Christ Iesu and have no confidence in the flesshe :
50003004	though I have wherof I myght reioyce in the flesshe . Yf eny other man thynketh that he hath wherof he myght trust in the flesshe : moche moare I :
50003005	circumcised the eyght daye of ye kynred of Israhell of ye trybe of Beniamyn an Ebrue borne of ye Ebrues : as concernynge the lawe a pharisaye
50003006	and as concernynge fervetnes I perseuted the congregacion and as touchynge the rightewesnes which is in the lawe I was vnrebukable .
50003007	But the thynges that were vauntage vnto me I counted losse for Christes sake .
50003008	Ye I thinke all thynges but losse for that excellet knowledges sake of Christ Iesu my lorde . For whom I have counted all thynge losse and do iudge them but donge that I myght wynne Christ
50003009	and myght be founde in him not havynge myne awne rightewesnes which is of the lawe : But that which spryngeth of the fayth which is in Christ . I meane the rightewesnes which cometh of God thorowe fayth
50003010	in knowynge him and the vertue of his resurreccion and the fellowshippe of his passions that I myght be coformable vnto his ( deeth )
50003011	yf by eny meanes I myght attayne vnto the resurreccion from deeth .
50003012	Not as though I had all redy attayned to it Ether were all redy parfect : but I folowe yf yt I maye comprehende that wherin I am comprehended of Christ Iesu .
50003013	Brethren I counte not my silfe that I have gotten it : but one thynge I saye : I forget yt which is behynde and stretche my silfe vnto that which is before
50003014	and preace vnto ye marke apoynted to obtayne the rewarde of the hye callynge of god in Christ Iesu .
50003015	Let vs therfore as many as be perfect be thus wyse minded : and yf ye be other wyse mynded I praye God open even this vnto you .
50003016	Neverthelesse in that wher vnto we are come let vs procede by one rule yt we maye be of one acorde .
50003017	Brethren be folowers of and me loke on them which walke even so as ye have vs for an ensample .
50003018	For many walke ( of whom I have tolde you often and now tell you wepynge ) that they are ye enemyes of ye crosse of Christ
50003019	whose ende is dampnacio whose God is their bely and whose glory is to their shame which are worldely mynded .
50003020	But oure conversacion is in heven from whence we loke for a saveour enen the lorde Iesus Christ
50003021	which shall chaunge oure vile bodies that they maye be fassioned lyke vnto his glorious body acordinge to the workynge wherby he is able to subdue all thinges vnto hym silfe .
50004001	Herfore my brethren dearly beloved and longed for my ioye and croune so continue in the lorde ye beloved .
50004002	I praye Evodias and beseche Sintiches that they be of one accorde in the lorde .
50004003	Yee and I beseche the faythfull yockfelowe helpe the wemen which labored with me in the gospell and with Clement also and with other my labour felowes whose names are in the boke of lyfe .
50004004	Reioyce in the Lorde alwaye and agayne I saye reioyce .
50004005	Let youre softenes be knowen vnto all men . The lorde is even at honde .
50004006	Be not carfull : but in all thynges shewe youre peticion vnto god in prayer and suplicacion wt gevynge of thankes .
50004007	And the peace of god which passeth all vnderstondinge kepe youre hertes and myndes in christ Iesu .
50004008	Furthermore brethren whatsoever thinges are true whatsoever thynges are honest what soever thynges are iust whatsoever thynges are pure whatsoever thynges pertayne to love whatsoever thynges are of honest reporte : yf ther be eny verteous thynge yf there be eny laudable thynge
50004009	those same have ye in youre mynde which ye have both learned and receaved herde and also sene in me : those thynges do and the god of peace shalbe with you .
50004010	I reioyse in the lorde greatly that now at the last ye are revived agayne to care for me in yt wherein ye were also carefull but ye lacked oportunite .
50004011	I speake not because of necessitie . For I have learned in whatsoever estate I am therewith to be content .
50004012	I can both cast doune my silfe I can also excede . Every where and in all thynges I am instructed both to be full and to be hongry : to have plenty and to suffre nede .
50004013	I can do all thynges thorow the helpe of Christ which strengtheth me .
50004014	Not wistondynge ye have well done that ye bare parte with me in my tribvlacion .
50004015	Ye of Philippos knowe that in the begynnynge of the gospell when I departed from Macedonia no congregacion bare parte with me as concernynge gevynge and receavynge but ye only .
50004016	For when I was in Tessalonica ye sent once and afterwarde agayne vnto my nedes :
50004017	not that I desyre gyftes : but I desyre aboudant frute on youre parte .
50004018	I receaved all and have plentie . I was even filled after that I had receaved of Epaphroditus that which came from you an odour that smelleth swete a sacrifice accepted and plesaunt to God .
50004019	My god fulfill all youre nedes thorow his glorious riches in Iesu Christ .
50004020	Vnto God and oure father be prayse for ever more . Amen .
50004021	Salute all the sainctes in Christ Iesu . The brethren which are with me grete you .
50004022	All the saynctes salute you : and most of all they which are of the Emperours housholde .
50004023	The grace of oure lorde Iesu Christ be wt you all . Amen
51001001	Paul an Apostle of Iesu Christ by the wyll of God and brother Timotheus .
51001002	To the sayntes which are at Colossa and brethren that beleve in Christ . Grace be with you and peace from God oure father and from the Lorde Iesus Christ .
51001003	We geve thankes to God the father of oure Lorde Iesus Christ alwayes prayenge for you
51001004	sence we hearde of youre faith which ye have in Christ Iesu and of the love which ye beare to all sayntes
51001005	for the hopes sake which is layde vp in store for you in heven of which hope ye have herde before by ye true worde of the gospell
51001006	which is come vnto you eve as it is in to all ye worlde and is frutefull as it is amoge you fro the fyrst daye in ye which ye herde of it and had experiece in ye grace of God in the trueth
51001007	as ye learned of Epaphra oure deare felowe servaunt which is for you a faythfull minister of Christ
51001008	which also declared vnto vs youre love which ye have in the sprete .
51001009	For this cause we also sence the daye we herde of it have not ceasyd prayinge for you and desyringe that ye myght be fulfilled with the knowledge of his will in all wisdome and spretuall vnderstodynge
51001010	that ye myght walke worthy of the lorde in all thynges that please beynge frutfull in all good workes and encreasynge in ye knowledge of God
51001011	strengthed with all myght thorowe hys glorious power vnto all pacience and longe sufferynge with ioyfulnes
51001012	gevynge thankes vnto the father which hath made vs mete to be part takers of the enheritaunce of sainctes in light .
51001013	Which hath delivered vs from the power of dercknes and hath translated vs in to the kyngdome of his dere sone
51001014	in whom we have redempcion thurow his bloud that is to saye the forgevenes of sinnes
51001015	which is the ymage of the invisible god fyrst begotten of all creatures .
51001016	For by him were all thynges created thynges that are in heven and thynges that are in erth : thynges visible and thynges invisible : whether they be maieste or lordshippe ether rule or power . All thinges are creatyd by hym and in him
51001017	and he is before all thinges and in him all thynges have their beynge .
51001018	And he is the heed of the body that is to wit of the congregacion : he is the begynnynge and fyrst begotten of the deed that in all thynges he might have the preeminence .
51001019	For it pleased the father that in him shuld all fulnes dwell
51001020	and by him to reconcile all thynge vnto him silfe and to set at peace by him thorow the bloud of his crosse both thynges in heven and thynges in erth .
51001021	And you ( which were in tymes past straungers and enymes because youre myndes were set in evyll workes ) hath he now recocilied
51001022	in ye body of his flesshe thorowe deeth to make you holy vnblameable and with out faut in his awne syght
51001023	yf ye continue grounded and stablysshed in the fayth and be not moved awaye from the hope of the gospell wher of ye have herde howe that it is preached amonge all creatures which are vnder heven wher of I Paul am made a minister .
51001024	Now ioye I in my soferinges which I suffre for you and fulfill that which is behynde of the passions of Christ in my flesshe for his bodies sake which is the congregacion
51001025	wher of I am made a minister acordynge to the ordinaunce of god which ordinaunce was geven me vnto you warde to fulfill ye worde of god
51001026	that mistery hid sence the worlde beganne and sence ye begynnynge of generacions : but now is opened to his saynctes
51001027	to whom god wolde make knowen the glorious riches of this mistery amonge the gentyls which riches is Christ in you the hope of glory
51001028	whom we preach warnynge all men and teachinge all men in all wisdome to make all men parfect in Christ Iesu .
51001029	Wherin I also laboure and stryve even as farforth as hys workynge worketh in me myghtely .
51002001	I wolde ye knewe what fyghtinge I have for youre sakes and for them of Laodicia and for as many as have not sene my parson in the flesshe
51002002	that their hertes myght be coforted and knet togedder in love and in all ryches of full vnderstondynge for to knowe ye mistery of God ye father and of Christ
51002003	in whom are hid all the treasures of wisdom and knowledge .
51002004	This I saye lest eny man shuld begyle you with entysinge wordes .
51002005	For though I be absent in the flesshe yet am I present with you in the sprete ioyinge and beholdinge the order that ye kepe and youre stedfast fayth in Christ .
51002006	As ye have therfore receaved Christ Iesu the Lorde even so walke
51002007	roted and bylt in him and stedfaste in the fayth as ye have learned : and therin be plenteous in gevynge thankes .
51002008	Beware lest eny ma come and spoyle you thorow philosophy and disceatfull vanitie thorow the tradicions of me and ordinaunces after the worlde and not after christ .
51002009	For in him dwelleth all the fulnes of the godheed bodyly
51002010	and ye are complete in him which is the heed of all rule and power
51002011	in whom also ye are circucised with circumcision made mith out hondes by puttinge of the sinfull boddy of the flesshe thorow the circumcision yt is in Christ
51002012	in that ye are buryed with him thorow baptim in whom ye are also rysen agayne thorowe fayth that is wrought by the operacion of god which raysed him from deeth .
51002013	And ye which weare deed in synne thorow ye vncircucision of youre flesshe hath he quyckened wt him and hath forgeve vs all oure trespases
51002014	and hath put out ye handwritinge yt was agaynst vs cotayned in ye lawe writte and that hath he take out of the waye and hath fastened it to his crosse
51002015	and hath spoyled rule and power and hath made a shewe of the openly and hath triumphed over them in his awne persone .
51002016	Let no ma therfore trouble youre conscieces aboute meate and drynke or for a pece of an holydaye as the holydaye of the newe mone or of the sabboth dayes
51002017	which are nothinge but shaddowes of thynges to come : but the body is in Christ .
51002018	Let no man make you shote at a wroge ( marke ) which after his awne ymaginacion walketh in the humblenes and holynes of angels thinges which he never sawe : causlesse puft vp with his flesshly mynde
51002019	and holdeth not the heed wherof all the body by ioyntes and couples receaveth norisshment and is knet to gedder and encreaseth with the in creasynge that commeth of god .
51002020	Wherfore if ye be deed with Christ fro ordinaunces of the worlde why as though ye yet lived in the worlde are ye ledde with tradicios of them that saye ?
51002021	Touche not tast not handell not :
51002022	which all perysshe wt the vsinge of the and are after the comaundmentes and doctrins of men
51002023	which thinges have the similitude of wisdome in chosen holynes and humblenes and in that they spare not the body and do the flesshe no worshype vnto his nede .
51003001	If ye be then rysen agayne with christ seke those thynges which are above where Christ sitteth on the right honde of god .
51003002	Set youre affeccion on thynges yt are above and not on thinges which are on ye erth .
51003003	For ye are deed and youre lyfe is hid with Christ in god .
51003004	When Christ which is oure lyfe shall shewe him silfe then shall ye also appere with him in glory .
51003005	Mortifie therfore youre membres which are on the erth fornicacio vnclennes vnnaturall lust evyll cocupiscece and coveteousnes which is worshippynge of ydols :
51003006	for which thynges sakes the wrath of God cometh on the chyldren of vnbeleve .
51003007	In which thynges ye walked once . when ye lived in them .
51003008	But now put ye also awaye from you all thynges wrath fearsnes maliciousnes cursed speakynge filthy speakynge out of youre mouthes .
51003009	Lye not one to another that the olde man with his workes be put of
51003010	and the new put on which is renued in knowledge after the ymage of him that made him
51003011	where is nether gentile ner Iewe circumcision nor vncircumcision Barbarous or Sithian bonde or fre : but Christe is all in all thynges .
51003012	Now therfore as electe of god holy and beloved put on tender mercie kyndnes humblenes of myndes meknes longe sufferynge
51003013	forbearynge one another and forgevynge one another if eny man have a quarrell to a nother even as Christ forgave you even so do ye .
51003014	Above all these thinges put on love which is the bonde of parfectnes .
51003015	And ye peace of god rule in youre hertes to ye which peace ye are called in one body . And se that ye be thankfull .
51003016	Let the worde of Christ dwell in you plenteously in all wisdome . Teache and exhorte youre awne selves in psalmes and hymnes and spretuall songes which have favour wt them syngynge in youre hertes to the lorde .
51003017	And all thynges ( whatsoever ye do in worde or dede ) do in the name of the lorde Iesu gevinge thakes to god the father by him .
51003018	Wyves submit youre selves vnto youre awne husbandes as it is comly in the Lorde .
51003019	Husbandes love youre wyves and be not bitter vnto them .
51003020	Children obey youre fathers and mothers in all thinges for that is wel pleasynge vnto the lorde .
51003021	Fathers rate not youre children lest they be of a desperate mynde .
51003022	Servauntes be obedient vnto youre bodyly masters in all thynges : not with eye service as men pleasers but in synglenes of herte fearynge god .
51003023	And whatsoever ye do do it hertely as though ye did it to the lorde and not vnto men for as moche as ye
51003024	knowe that of the lorde ye shall receave the rewarde of inheritaunce for ye serve the lorde Christ .
51003025	But he that doth wronge shall receave for the wronge that he hath done : for there is no respect of persons .
51004001	Ye masters do vnto youre servauntes that which is iust and egall seinge ye knowe that ye also have a master in heven .
51004002	Continue in prayer and watch in the same with thankes
51004003	gevynge prayenge also for vs that God open vnto vs the dore of vtteraunce that we maye speake the mistery of Christ wherfore I am in bondes :
51004004	yt I maye vtter it as it becometh me to speake .
51004005	Walke wysely to them that are with out and redeme ye tyme .
51004006	Let youre speache be all wayes well favoured and be powdred with salt that ye maye know how to answer every ma .
51004007	The deare brother Tichicos shall tell you of all my busynes which is a faythfull minister and felowe servaunt in the Lorde
51004008	whom I have sent vnto you for the same purpose that he myght knowe how ye do and myght comfort youre hertes
51004009	wt one Onesimus a faythfull and a beloved brother which is one of you . They shall shewe you of all thinges which are adoynge here .
51004010	Aristarchus my preson felowe saluteth you and Marcus Barnabassis systers sonne : touchinge whom ye receaved commaundementes . Yf he come vnto you receave him :
51004011	and Iesus which is called Iustus which are of the circumcision . These only are my workefelowes vnto the kyngdome of God which were vnto my consolacion .
51004012	Epaphras the servaut of Christ which is one of you saluteth you and all wayes laboreth fervently for you in prayers that ye maye stonde perfect and full in all that is the will of God .
51004013	I beare him recorde that he hath a fervet mynde towarde you and towarde them of Laodicia and them of Hierapolis .
51004014	Deare Lucas the Phisicion greteth you and Demas .
51004015	Salute the brethren which are of Laodicia and salute Nymphas and the congregacio which is in his housse .
51004016	And whe the pistle is reed of you make that it be reed in the congregacion of the Laodicians also : and that ye lyke wyse reade ye epistle of Laodicia .
51004017	And saye to Archippus : take hede to the office that thou hast receaved in the Lorde that thou fulfill it .
51004018	The salutacion by the honde of me Paul . Remember my bondes . Grace be with you . Amen .
52001001	Paul Syluanus and Timotheus . Vnto the congregacion of the Tessalonyans in God the father and in ye Lorde Iesus Christ . Grace be with you and peace from God oure father and from the Lorde Iesus Christ .
52001002	We geve God thakes all waye for you all makinge mension of you in oure prayers
52001003	with out ceasynge and call to remembraunce youre worke in the faythe and labour in love and perseveraunce in the hope of oure lorde Iesus Christ in the sight of God oure father :
52001004	because we knowe brethren beloved of god how yt ye are electe .
52001005	For oure gospell came not vnto you in worde only but also in power and also in the holy gost and in moche certayntie as ye knowe after what maner we behaued oure selves amonge you for youre sakes .
52001006	And ye became folowers of vs and of the lord and receaved the worde in moche affliccion with ioye of the holy gost :
52001007	so that ye were an ensample to all that beleve in Macedonia and Achaia .
52001008	For from you sounded out the worde of the lorde not in Macedonia and in Achaia only : but youre fayth also which ye have vnto god spred her silfe abroade in all quartars so greatly that it nedeth not vs to speake eny thynge at all .
52001009	For they the selves shewe of you what maner of entrynge in we had vnto you and how ye tourned to God from ymages for to serve the livynge and true god
52001010	and for to loke for his sonne from heven whom he raysed from deeth : I mean Iesus which delivereth vs from wrath to come .
52002001	For ye youre selves knowe brethren of oure entraunce in vnto you howe that it was not in vayne :
52002002	but even after that we had suffered before and were shamfully entreated at Phillippos ( as ye well knowe ) then were we bolde in oure God to speake vnto you the gospell of God with moche strivynge .
52002003	Oure exhortacion was not to brynge you to erroure nor yet to vnclennes nether was it with gyle :
52002004	but as we were alowed of God that the gospell shuld be comitted vnto vs : even so we speake not as though we entended to please men but God which trieth oure hertes .
52002005	Nether was oure conversacion at eny tyme wt flatterynge wordes as ye well knowe nether in cloked coveteousnes God is recorde :
52002006	nether sought we prayse of men nether of you nor yet of eny other when we myght have bene chargeable as the apostles of Christ
52002007	but we were tender amonge you even as a norsse cheressheth her children
52002008	so was oure affeccion towarde you oure good will was to have dealte vnto you not the gospell of God only : but also oure awne soules because ye were deare vnto vs .
52002009	Ye remember brethre oure laboure and travayle . For we laboured daye and nyght because we wolde not be greveous vnto eny of you and preached vnto you ye gospell of God .
52002010	Ye are witnesses and so is god how holyly and iustly and vnblameable we behaved oure selves amonge you that beleve :
52002011	as ye knowe how that we exhorted and comforted and besought every one of you as a father his childre
52002012	that ye wolde walke worthy of God which hath called you vnto his kyngdome and glory .
52002013	For this cause thanke we god with out ceasynge because that when ye receaved of vs the worde wherwith God was preached ye receaved it not as the worde of man : but even as it was in dede the worde of God which worketh in you that beleve .
52002014	For ye brethre became folowers of the congregacions of god which in Iewry are in Christ Iesu : for ye have suffered lyke thynges of youre kynsmen as we oure selves have suffered of the Iewes .
52002015	Which as they kylled the lorde Iesus and their awne prophetes even so have they persecuted vs and God they please not and are contrary to all men
52002016	and forbid vs to preache vnto the gentyls that they myght be saved to fulfill their synnes all waye . For the wrath of God is come on them even to the vtmost .
52002017	For as moch brethren as we are kept from you for a season as concernynge the bodyly presence but not in the herte we enforsed the more to se you personally with great desire .
52002018	And therfore we wolde have come vnto you I paul once and agayne : but Satan with stode vs .
52002019	For what is oure hope or ioye or croune of reioysynge ? are not ye it in the presence of oure lorde Iesus Christ at his comynge ?
52002020	yes ye are oure glory and ioye .
52003001	Wherfore sence we coulde no lenger forbeare it pleased vs to remayne at Athens alone
52003002	and sent Timotheus oure brother and minister of god and oure laboure felowe in the gospell of Christ to stablysshe you and to coforte you over youre fayth
52003003	yt no ma shulde be moved in these affliccios . For ye youre selves knowe that we are even apoynted therevnto .
52003004	For verely when I was with you I tolde you before that we shulde suffre tribulacion even as it came to passe and as ye knowe .
52003005	For this cause when I coulde no lenger forbeare I sent that I myght have knowledge of youre fayth lest haply the tempter had tempted you and that oure laboure had bene bestowed in vayne .
52003006	But now lately whe Timotheus came fro you vnto vs and declared to vs youre fayth and youre love and how that ye have good remembraunce of vs all wayes desyringe to se vs as we desyre to se you .
52003007	Therfore brethre we had consolacion in you in all oure adversite and necessite through youre fayth .
52003008	For now are we alyve yf ye stonde stedfast in the lorde .
52003009	For what thankes can we recompence to god agayne for you over all the ioye that we ioye for youre sakes before oure god
52003010	whyle we nyght and daye praye excedingly that we myght se you presently and myght fulfill that wich is lackynge in youre fayth .
52003011	God him silfe oure father and oure lorde Iesus Christ gyde oure iorney vnto you :
52003012	and the lorde increace you and make you flowe ouer in love one towarde another and towarde all men even as we do towarde you
52003013	to make youre hertes stable and vnblameable in holynes before God oure father at the commynge of oure Lorde Iesus Christ with all his sainctes .
52004001	Further more we beseche you brethren and exhorte you in the lorde Iesus that ye increace more and more euen as ye have receaved of vs how ye ought to walke and to please god .
52004002	Ye remember what commaundmetes we gave you in oure lorde Iesu Christ .
52004003	For this is the will of god even that ye shuld be holy and that ye shuld abstayne from fornicacion
52004004	that every one of you shuld knowe how to kepe his vessell in holynes and honoure
52004005	and not in the lust of concupiscence as do the hethen which knowe not god
52004006	that no man goo to farre and defraude his brother in bargayninge : because the lorde is a venger of all suche thinges as we tolde you before tyme and testified .
52004007	For god hath not called vs vnto vnclennes : but vnto holynes .
52004008	He therfore that despiseth despiseth not man but God which hath sent his holy sprete amonge you .
52004009	But as touchynge brotherly love ye nede not that I wryte vnto you . For ye are taught of God to love on another .
52004010	Ye and that thinge verely ye do vnto all the brethre which are thorow oute all Macedonia . We beseche you brethren that ye encreace more and more
52004011	and that ye studye to be quyet and to medle with youre awne busynes and to worke with youre awne hondes as we commaunded you :
52004012	that ye maye behave youre selves honestly towarde them that are with out and that nothinge be lackynge vnto you .
52004013	I wolde not brethren have you ignoraut concerninge them which are fallen aslepe that ye sorowe not as other do which have no hope .
52004014	For yf we beleve that Iesus dyed and rose agayne : even so them also which slepe by IeIesus will God brynge agayne with him .
52004015	And this saye we vnto you in the worde of the Lorde that we which live and are remayninge in the comminge of the Lorde shall not come yerre they which slepe .
52004016	For the Lorde him selfe shall descende fro heve with a showte and the voyce of the archangell and trompe of God . And the deed in Christe shall aryse fyrst :
52004017	then shall we which live and remayne be caught vp with them also in the cloudes to mete the Lorde in ye ayer . And so shall we ever be with the Lorde .
52004018	Wherfore coforte youre selves one another with these wordes
52005001	Of the tymes and seasons brethren ye have no nede that I write vnto you :
52005002	for ye youre selves knowe parfectly that the daye of the Lorde shall come even as a thefe in the nyght .
52005003	When they shall saye peace and no daunger than commeth on the soden destruccion as the travalynge of a woma with childe and they shall not scape .
52005004	But ye brethre are not in darcknes that yt daye shuld come on you as it were a thefe .
52005005	Ye are all the childre of light and the children of ye daye . We are not of ye nyght nether of darcknes .
52005006	Therfore let vs not slepe as do other : but let vs watch and be sober .
52005007	For they that slepe slepe in the nyght : and they that be dronken are dronken in the nyght .
52005008	But let vs which are of the daye be sober    armed with the brest plate of fayth and love and with hope of salvacio as an helmet .
52005009	For god hath not apoynted vs vnto wrath : but to obtayne salvacion by ye meanes of oure lorde Iesu Christ
52005010	which died for vs : that whether we wake or slepe we shuld lyve togedder with him .
52005011	Wherfore comforte youre selves togedder and edifie one another even as ye do .
52005012	We beseche you brethren that ye knowe them which laboure amonge you and have the oversight of you in the Lorde
52005013	and geve you exhortacion that ye have them the more in love for their workes sake and be at peace with them .
52005014	We desyre you brethre warne them that are vnruly comforte the feble mynded forbeare the weake have continuall pacience towarde all men .
52005015	Se that none recopence evill for evyll vnto eny man : but ever folowe that which is good both amonge youre selves and to all men .
52005016	Reioyce ever .
52005017	Praye cotinually .
52005018	In all thinges geve thankes . For this is the wyll of God in Christ Iesu towarde you .
52005019	Quenche not the sprete .
52005020	Despise not prophesyinge .
52005021	Examen all thinges and kepe that which is good .
52005022	Abstayne from all suspicious thinges .
52005023	The very God of peace sanctifie you thorow out . And I praye God that youre whole sprete soulse and body be kept fautlesse vnto ye comynge of oure Lorde Iesus Christ
52005024	Faythfull is he which called you : which will also do it .
52005025	Brethre praye for vs .
52005026	Grete all the brethren with an holy kysse .
52005027	I charge you in the Lorde that this pistle be reed vnto all the holy brethren .
52005028	The grace of the Lorde Iesus Christ be with you . Amen .
53001001	Paul Syluanus and Timotheus . Vnto the congregacion of the Tessalonyans which are in God oure father and in the Lorde Iesus Christ .
53001002	Grace be with you and peace from God oure father and from the Lorde Iesus Christ .
53001003	We are bounde to thanke God all wayes for you brethren as it is mete because that youre fayth groweth excedyngly and every one of you swymmeth in love towarde another betwene youre selves
53001004	so yt we oureselves reioyce of you in the congregacions of God over youre pacience and fayth in all youre persecucions and tribulacios that ye suffre
53001005	which is a token of ye ryghtewes iudgemet of god that ye are counted worthy of the kyngdom of god for which ye also suffre .
53001006	It is verely a rightewes thinge with God to recopence tribulacion to them that trouble you :
53001007	and to you which are troubled rest with vs when the lorde Iesus shall shewe him silfe from heven with his myghty angels
53001008	in flammynge fyre rendrynge vengeaunce vnto them that knowe not God and to them that obeye not vnto the gospell of oure Lorde Iesus Christ
53001009	which shalbe punysshed with everlastynge damnacion from the presence of the lorde and from the glory of his power
53001010	when he shall come to be glorified in his sainctes and to be made marvelous in all them that beleve : because oure testimonye that we had vnto you was beleved eve the same daye that we preached it .
53001011	Wherfore we praye all wayes for you that oure god make you worthy of the callynge and fulfill all delectacion of goodnes and the worke of fayth with power :
53001012	that the name of oure lorde Iesus Christ maye be gloryfied in you and ye in him thorowe the grace of oure God and of the lorde Iesus Christ .
53002001	We beseche you brethren by the commynge of oure lorde Iesu Christ and in that we shall assemble vnto him
53002002	that ye be not sodely moved from youre mynde and be not troubled nether by sprete nether by wordes nor yet by letter which shuld seme to come from vs as though the daye of Christ were at honde .
53002003	Let no ma deceave you by eny meanes for the lorde commeth not excepte ther come a departynge fyrst and that that synfnll man be opened ye sonne of perdicion
53002004	which is an adversarie and is exalted above all that is called god or that is worshipped : so that he shall sitt as God in temple of god and shew him silfe as god .
53002005	Remember ye not that when I was yet with you I tolde you these thynges ?
53002006	And nowe ye knowe what with holdeth : even that he myght be vttered at his tyme .
53002007	For the mistery of that iniquitie doeth he all readie worke which onlie loketh vntill it be taken out of ye waye .
53002008	And then shall that wicked be vttered whom the lorde shall consume with the sprete of hys mouth and shall destroye with the apearaunce of his commynge
53002009	even him whose commynge is by the workynge of Satan wyth all lyinge power signes and wonders :
53002010	and in all deceavablenes of vnrightewesnes amonge them that perysshe : because they receaved not the ( love ) of the truth that they myght have bene saved .
53002011	And therfore god shall sende them stronge delusion that they shuld beleve lyes :
53002012	that all they myght be damned which beleved not the trueth but had pleasure in vnrightewesnes .
53002013	But we are bounde to geve thankes alwaye to god for you brethren beloved of the lorde for because that God hath from the begynnynge chosen you to saluacion thorow sanctifyinge of the sprete and thorowe belevynge the trueth :
53002014	whervnto he called you byoure gospell to obtayne ye glorye that cometh of oure lord Iesu Christ .
53002015	Therfore brethren stonde fast and kepe ye ordinaunces which ye have learned : whether it were by oure preachynge or by pistle .
53002016	Oure lorde Iesu Christ hym silfe and God oure father which hath loved vs and hath geven vs everlastynge consolacion and good hope thorowe grace
53002017	comforte youre hertes and stablysshe you in all doctrine and good doynge .
53003001	Furthermore brethren praye for vs yt the worde of god maye have fre passage and be gloryfied as it is with you :
53003002	and that we maye be delivered from vnresonable and evyll men . For all men have not fayth :
53003003	but the lorde is faythfull which shall stablysshe you and kepe you from evyll .
53003004	Wehave confidence thorow the lorde to you warde that ye both do and will do that which we comaude you .
53003005	And ye lorde gyde youre hertes vnto ye love of God and paciece of Christ .
53003006	We requyre you brethren in the name of oure lorde Iesu Christ yt ye with drawe youre selves from every brother that walketh inordinatly and not after the institucio which ye receaved of vs .
53003007	Ye youre selves knowe how ye ought to folowe vs . For we behaved not oure selves inordinatly amonge you .
53003008	Nether toke we breed of eny ma for nought : but wrought with laboure and travayle nyght and daye because we wolde not be grevous to eny of you :
53003009	not but that we had auctoritie : but to make oure selves an insample vnto you to folowe vs .
53003010	For when we were with you this we warned you of yt yf ther were eny which wolde not worke that ye same shuld not eate .
53003011	We have hearde saye no doute that ther are some which walke amonge you inordinatly and worke not at all but are besy bodies .
53003012	Them that are soche we commaunde and exhorte by oure lorde Iesu Christ that they worke with quyetnes and eate their awne breed .
53003013	Brethren be not wery in well doynge .
53003014	Yf eny man obey not oure sayinges sende vs worde of him by a letter : and have no copanie with him that he maye be ashamed .
53003015	And count him not as an enemy : but warne him as a brother .
53003016	The very lorde of peace geve you peace all wayes by all meanes . The lorde be with you all .
53003017	The salutacion of me Paul with myne awne honde . This is the token in all pistles . So I write .
53003018	The grace of oure lorde Iesus Christ be with you all Amen .
54001001	Paul an Apostle of Iesus Christ by the comaundement of God oure savioure and Lorde Iesus Christ which is oure hope .
54001002	Vnto Timothe his naturall sonne in the fayth . Grace mercy and peace from God oure father and Lorde Iesus Christ oure Lorde .
54001003	As I besought the to abyde styll in Ephesus when I departed into Macedonia even so do that thou comaunde some that they teache no nother wise :
54001004	nether geve hede to fables and genealogies which are endlesse and brede doutes more then godly edyfyinge which is by fayth :
54001005	for ye ende of the comaundemet is love that cometh of a pure herte and of a good conscience and of fayth vnfayned :
54001006	fro the which thinges some have erred and have turned vnto vayne iangelinge
54001007	because they wolde be doctours the scripture and yet vnderstonde not what they speake nether wherof they affirme .
54001008	We knowe yt the lawe is good yf a man vse it lawfully
54001009	vnderstondinge this how yt the lawe is not geven vnto a righteous man bu vnto the vnrighteous and disobediet to the vngodly and to synners to vnholy and vnclean to murtherers of fathers and murtherers of mothers to manslears
54001010	and whormongers : to them that defile them selves with mankynde : to menstealers : to lyars and to periured and so forth yf ther be eny other thinge that is cotrary to holsome doctrine
54001011	accordinge to the gospell of the glory of the blessed God which gospell is committed vnto me .
54001012	And I thanke Christ Iesus oure Lorde which hath made me stronge : for he counted me true and put me in office
54001013	when before I was a blasphemar and a persecuter and a tyraut . But I obtayned mercy because I dyd it ignorautly thorow vnbelefe .
54001014	Neverthelater the grace of oure Lorde was more aboundaunt with fayth and love which is in Christ Iesu .
54001015	This is a true sayinge and by all meanes worthy to be receaved that Christ Iesus came into the world to save synners of whom I am chefe .
54001016	Notwithstondinge for this cause was mercy geve vnto me that Iesus Christ shuld fyrst shewe on me all longe pacience vnto the ensample of them which shall in tyme to come beleve on him vnto eternall lyfe .
54001017	So then vnto god kynge everlastinge immortall invisible and wyse only be honoure and prayse for ever and ever Amen .
54001018	This commaundement commit I vnto the sonne Timotheus accordynge to the prophisies which in tyme past were prophisied of the yt thou in them shuldest fyght a good fyght
54001019	havinge fayth and good consciece which some have put awaye fro them and as cocerninge fayth have made shipwracke .
54001020	Of whose nombre is Himeneus and Alexander which I have delivered vnto Satan yt they myght be taught not to blaspheme
54002001	I exhorte therfore that above all thynges prayers supplicacions intercessions and gevynge of thankes behad for all men :
54002002	for kynges and for all that are in auctorite that we maye live a quyet and a peasable life in all godlines and honestie .
54002003	For that is good and accepted in the sight of god oure savioure
54002004	which will have all men saved and to come vnto the knowledge of ye trueth .
54002005	For ther is one god and one ( mediator ) bitwene god and man which is ye man Christ Iesus
54002006	which gave him silfe a raunsome for all men that it shuld be testified at his tyme
54002007	wherevnto I am ordayned a preacher and an apostle : I tell the trueth in Christ and lye not beynge the teacher of the gentyls in fayth and veritie .
54002008	I wyll therfore that the men praye every where liftynge vp pure hondes without wrath or dowtinge .
54002009	Lykwyse also the wemen that they araye them selves in comlye aparell with shamfastnes and discrete behaveour not with broyded heare other golde or pearles or costly araye :
54002010	but with suche as becometh wemen that professe the worshippynge of God thorow good workes .
54002011	Let the woman learne in silence with all subieccion .
54002012	I suffre not a woman to teache nether to have auctoricie over a man : but forto be in silence .
54002013	For Adam was fyrst formed and then Eve .
54002014	Also Adam was not deceaved but the woman was deceaved and was in transgression .
54002015	Notwithstondynge thorow bearinge of chyldre they shalbe saved so they continue in fayth love and holynes with discrecion .
54003001	This is a true sayinge . Yf a ma covet ye office of a bysshope he desyreth a good worke .
54003002	Ye and a bisshope must be fautlesse the husband of one wyfe sober discrete honestly aparelled harberous apt to teache
54003003	not dronke no fighter not geve to filthy lucre : but gentle abhorrynge fightynge abhorrynge coveteousnes
54003004	and one that rueleth his awne housse honestly havynge chyldren vnder obedience with all honeste .
54003005	For yf a man cannot rule his owne housse how shall he care for the congregacion of God .
54003006	He maye not be a yonge skoler lest he swell and faule into the iudgement of the evyll
54003007	speaker . He must also be well reported of amonge them which are with out forth lest he fall into rebuke and snare of the evyll speaker .
54003008	Lykwyse must the deacons be honest not double tonged not geve vnto moche drynkinge nether vnto filthy lucre :
54003009	but havynge the mistery of the fayth in pure consciece .
54003010	And let them fyrst be proved and then let them minister yf they be founde fautlesse .
54003011	Even so must their wynes be honest not evyll speakers : but sober and faythfull in all thinges .
54003012	Let the deacons be the husbandes of one wyfe and suche as rule their chyldren well and their awne housholdes .
54003013	For they that minister well get them selves good degre and greate libertie in the fayth which is in Christ Iesu .
54003014	These thinges write I vnto the trustinge to come shortly vnto the :
54003015	but and yf I tarie longe yt then thou mayst yet have knowledge how thou oughtest to behave thy silfe in the housse of God which is the congregacion of the livinge God the pillar and grounde of trueth .
54003016	And with out naye great is that mistery of godlines : God was shewed in the flesshe was iustified in the sprete was sene of angels was preached vnto the gentyls was beleved on in erth and receaved vp in glory .
54004001	The sprete speaketh evydently that in the latter tymes some shall departe from the fayth and shall geve hede vnto spretes of erroure and dyvelysshe doctrine of them
54004002	which speake falce thorow ypocrisye and have their consciences marked with an hote yron
54004003	forbyddinge to mary and commaundinge to abstayne from meates which God hath created to be receaved with gevynge thankes of them which beleve and knowe ye trueth .
54004004	For all the creatures of God are good and nothynge to be refused yf it be receaved with thankes gevynge .
54004005	For it is sanctyfyed by the worde of God and prayer .
54004006	Yf thou shalt put the brethren in remembraunce of these thynges thou shalt be a good minister of Iesu Christ which hast bene norisshed vp in the wordes of the fayth and good doctryne which doctryne thou hast continually followed .
54004007	But cast awaye vngostly and olde wyves fables . Exercyse thy silfe vnto godlines .
54004008	For bodely exercise proffiteth lyttll : But godlines is good vnto all thynges as a thynge which hath promyses of the lyfe that is now and of the lyfe to come .
54004009	This is a sure sayinge and of all parties worthy to be receaved .
54004010	For therfore we laboure and suffre rebuke because we beleve in the livynge god which is the savioure of all men : but specially of those that beleve .
54004011	Suche thynges commaunde and teache .
54004012	Let no man despyse thy youth : but be vnto them that beleve an insample in worde in conversacion in love in sprete in fayth and in purenes .
54004013	Till I come geve attendaunce to redynge to exhortacion and to doctryne .
54004014	Despyse not the gyfte that is in ye which was geven the thorow prophesye and with layinge on of ye hondes of an elder .
54004015	These thynges exercyse and geve thy silfe vnto them that it maye be sene how thou profetest in all thinges .
54004016	Take hede vnto thy silfe and vnto learnynge and continue therin . For if thou shalt so do thou shalt save thy silfe and them that heare the .
54005001	Rebuke not an elder : but exhorte him as a father and the yonger me as brethren
54005002	the elder wemen as mothers ye yonger as sisters with all purenes .
54005003	Honoure widdowes which are true wyddowes .
54005004	Yf eny wyddowe have chyldren or neves let them learne fyrst to rule their awne houses godly and to recompence their elders . For that is good and acceptable before God .
54005005	She that is a very wyddowe and frendlesse putteth her trust in god and continueth in supplicacion and prayer nyght and daye .
54005006	But she that liveth in pleasure is deed even yet alive .
54005007	And these thynges commaunde that they maye be without faut
54005008	Yf ther be eny that provideth not for his awne and namly for them of his housholde the same denyeth the fayth and is worsse then an infydell .
54005009	Let no wyddowe be chosen vnder threscore yere olde and soche a one as was the wyfe of one man
54005010	and well reported of in good workes : yf she have noresshed children yf she have bene liberall to straugers yf she have wesshed the saynctes fete yf she have ministred vnto them which were in adversite yf she were continually geve vnto all maner good workes .
54005011	The yonger widdowes refuse . For when they have begone to wexe wantone to the dishonoure of Christ then will they mary
54005012	havynge damnacio because they have broke their fyrst fayth .
54005013	And also they learne to goo from housse to housse ydle ye not ydle only but also tryflynge and busybodyes speakynge thynges which are not comly .
54005014	I will therfore that ye yonger weme mary and beare childre and gyde the housse and geve none occasio to ye adversary to speake evill
54005015	For many of them are all redy turned bake and are gone after Satan .
54005016	And yf eny man or woman that beleveth have widdowes let the minister vnto them and let not the congregacion be charged : that yt maye have sufficient for them that are widdowes in dede .
54005017	The elders yt rule wel are worthy of double honoure most specially they which laboure in ye worde and in teachinge .
54005018	For the scripture sayth : Thou shalt not mousell the mouth of the oxe that treadeth out the corne . And the labourer is worthy of his rewarde .
54005019	Agaynst an elder receave none accusacion : but vnder two or thre witnesses .
54005020	Them that synne rebuke openly that other maye feare .
54005021	I testifie before god and the lorde Iesus Christ and the electe angels that thou observe these thynges with out hasty iudgement and do nothynge parcially .
54005022	Laye hondes sodely on no man nether be partaker of other mes synnes : kepe thy silfe pure .
54005023	Drynke no lenger water but vse a lytell wyne for thy stommakes sake and thyne often diseases .
54005024	Some mennes synnes are open before honde and goo before vnto iudgement : some mennes synnes folowe after .
54005025	Lykwyse also good workes are manyfest before honde and they that are other wyse canot be hid .
54006001	Let as many servauntes as are vnder ye yoke counte their masters worthy of all honour that the name of god and his doctryne be not evyll spoken of .
54006002	Se that they which have belevynge masters despyse them not because they are brethren : but so moche the rather do service for as moche as they are belevynge and beloved and partakers of the benefite .
54006003	These thynges teache and exhorte . Yf eny man teache other wise and is not contet with ye wholsome wordes of oure lorde Iesu christ and with the doctryne of godlines
54006004	he is pufte vp and knoweth nothynge : but wasteth his braynes aboute questions and stryfe of wordes wherof sprynge envie stryfe raylinges evyll surmysinges
54006005	and vayne disputacions of men with corrupte myndes and destitute of the trueth which thynke that lucre is godlines . From soche seperate thy silfe .
54006006	Godlines is great ryches yf a man be content with that he hath .
54006007	For we brought nothynge into the worlde and it is a playne case that we can cary nothynge out .
54006008	When we have fode and rayment let vs therwith be contet .
54006009	They that wilbe ryche faule into temptacio and snares and into many folysshe and noysome lustes which droune me in perdicion and destruccion .
54006010	For coveteousnes is the rote of all evyll which whill some lusted after they erred fro the fayth and tanglyd them selves with many sorowes .
54006011	But thou which arte the man of god flye soche thynges Folowe rightewesnes godlines love pacience and meknes .
54006012	Fyght ye good fyght of fayth . Laye honde on eternall lyfe where vnto thou arte called and hast professed a good profession before many witnesses .
54006013	I geve the charge in the sight of God which quickneth all thinges and before Iesu Christ which vnder Pocius Pilate witnessed a good witnessinge
54006014	yt thou kepe the comaundemet and be with out spotte and vnrebukeable vntyll the apperynge of oure lorde Iesus Christ
54006015	which aperynge ( when the tyme ys come ) he shall shewe that is blessed and myghty only kynge of kynges and lorde of lordes
54006016	which only hath immortalite and dwelleth in light that no man can attayne whom never man sawe nether can se : vnto whom be honoure and rule everlastynge . Amen .
54006017	Charge them that are ryche in this worlde that they be not excedynge wyse and that they trust not in the vncertayne ryches but in the livynge god which geveth vs aboundantly all thynges to enioye them
54006018	and that they do good and be ryche in good workes and redy to geve and to distribute
54006019	layinge vp in store for them selves a good foundacio agaynst the tyme to come yt they maye obteyne eternall lyfe
54006020	O Timothe save that which is geve ye to kepe and avoyde vngostly vanities of voyces and opposicios of sciece falsly so called
54006021	which sciece whyll some professed they have erred as concernynge the fayth . Grace be with the Amen .
55001001	Paul an Apostle of Iesu Christ by the will of God to preache the promes of lyfe which lyfe is in Christ Iesu .
55001002	To Timothe his beloved sonne . Grace mercy and peace from God the father and from Christ Iesu oure Lorde .
55001003	I thanke god whom I serve from myne elders with pure consciece that with out ceasynge I make mencion of the in my prayres nyght and daye
55001004	desyrynge to se the myndfull of thy teares : so that I am filled with ioye
55001005	whe I call to remembraunce the vnfayned fayth that is in the which dwelt fyrst in thy graumoder Lois and in thy mother Eunica : and am assured that it dwelleth in the also .
55001006	Wherfore I warne the that thou stere vp the gyfte of god which is in the by the puttynge on of my hondes .
55001007	For god hath not geven to vs the sprete of feare : but of power and of love and of sobrenes of mynde .
55001008	Be not a shamed to testyfye oure lorde nether be a shamed of me which am bounde for his sake : but suffre adversite with ye gospell also thorow ye power of god
55001009	which saved vs and called vs wt an holy callinge not acordinge to oure dedes but accordynge to his awne purpose and grace which grace was geve vs thorowe Christ Iesu before the worlde was
55001010	but is nowe declared openly by ye appearynge of oure savioure Iesu Christ which hath put away derth and hath brought lyfe and immortalite vnto light thorow the gospell
55001011	whervnto I am apoynted a preacher and an Apostle and a teacher of the gentyls :
55001012	for the which cause I also suffre these thinges . Neverthelesse I am not a shamed For I knowe who I have beleved and am sure that he is able to kepe that which I have comitted to his kepynge agaynst that daye .
55001013	Se thou have the ensample of the holsome wordes which thou heardest of me in fayth and love which is in Iesu Christ .
55001014	That good thinge whiche was committed to thy kepynge kepe in ye holy goost which dwelleth in vs .
55001015	This thou knowest how that all they which are in Asia be turned from me . Of which sorte are Phigelos and hermogenes .
55001016	The lorde geve mercie vnto the housse of Onesiphoros for he ofte refresshed me and was not a shamed of my chayne :
55001017	but when he was at Rome he sought me out very diligently and founde me .
55001018	The lorde graunt vnto him that he maye fynde mercie with the lorde at that daye . And in how many thynges he ministred vnto me at Ephesus thou knowest very wel .
55002001	Thou therfore my sonne be stronge in the grace that is in Christ Iesu .
55002002	And what thynges thou hast hearde of me many bearynge witnes the same diliver to faythfull men which are apte to teache other
55002003	Thou therfore suffre affliccion as a good soudier of Iesu Christ .
55002004	No man that warreth entanglith him silfe with worldely busynes and that be cause he wolde please him that hath chosen him to be a soudier .
55002005	And though a man strive for a mastery yet ys he not crouned except he strive laufully .
55002006	The husbandma that laboreth must fyrst receave of the frutes .
55002007	Consyder what I saye . The lorde geve the vnderstondynge in all thynges .
55002008	Remember that Iesus Christ beynge of he sede of David rose agayne fro deth accordynge to my gospell
55002009	wherin I suffre trouble as an evyll doar even vnto bondes . But the worde of god was not bounde .
55002010	Herefore I suffre all thinges for ye electes sakes that they myght also obtayne that saluacion which is in Christ Iesu with eternall glory .
55002011	It is a true sayinge if we be deed wt him we also shall live with him .
55002012	Yf we be pacient we shall also raigne wt him . If we denye him he also shall denye vs .
55002013	Yf we beleve not yet abideth he faithfull . He cannot denye him silfe .
55002014	Of these thynges put them in remembraunce and testifie before the lorde that they stryve not about wordes which is to no proffet but to pervert the hearers .
55002015	Study to shewe thy silfe laudable vnto god a workman yt nedeth not to be a shamed dividynge the worde of trueth iustly .
55002016	Vngostly and vayne voyces passe over . For they shall encreace vnto greater vngodlynes
55002017	and their wordes shall fret even as doeth a cancre : of whose nombre ys Hymeneos and Philetos
55002018	which as concernynge the trueth have erred sayinge that the resurreccion is past all redy and do destroye the fayth of divers persones .
55002019	But the sure grounde of god remayneth and hath this seale : the lorde knoweth them that are his and let every man that calleth on the name of Christ departe from iniquite .
55002020	Not withstondinge in a greate housse are not only vesselles of golde and of silver : but also of wood and of erthe some for honoure and some vnto dishonoure .
55002021	But Yf a man purdge him silfe from suche felowes he shalbe a vessell sanctified vnto honoure mete for the lorde and prepared vnto all good workes .
55002022	Lustes of youth avoyde and folowe rightwesnes fayth love and peace with them that call on the lorde with pure herte .
55002023	Folisshe and vnlearned questions put from the remebrynge that they do but gendre stryfe .
55002024	But the servaunt of the lorde must not stryve : but must be peasable vnto all men and apte to teache and one that can suffre :
55002025	the evyll in meknes and can informe them that resist yf that god at eny tyme will geve them repentauce for to knowe the trueth :
55002026	that they maye come to the selves agayne out of the snare of the devyll which are now taken of him at his will .
55003001	This understonde that in the last dayes shall come parelous tymes .
55003002	For the me shalbe lovers of their awne selves coveteous bosters proude cursed speakers disobediet to father and mother vnthakfull vnholy
55003003	vnkinde trucebreakers stubborn falce accusars ryatours fearce despisers of the which are good
55003004	traytours heddy hye mynded gredy apon volupteousnes more then the lovers of god
55003005	havynge a similitude of godly lyvynge but have denyed the power ther of and soche abhorre .
55003006	Of this sorte are they which entre in to houses and brynge into bondage wymmen laden with synne which wemen are ledde of divers lustes
55003007	ever learnynge and never able to come vnto the knowledge of the trueth .
55003008	As Iannes and Iambres withstode Moses even so do these resist the trueth men they are of corrupt myndes and leawde as concernynge the fayth :
55003009	but they shall prevayle no leger . For their madnes shalbe vttered vnto all men as theirs was .
55003010	But thou hast sene ye experience of my doctrine fassion of lyuynge purpose fayth longe sufferynge love pacience
55003011	persecucions and affliccions which happened vnto me at Antioche at Iconium and at lystra : which persecucions I suffered paciently . And from them all the lorde delivered me .
55003012	Ye and all that will live godly in Christ Iesu must suffre persecucions .
55003013	But the evyll men and disceavers shall wexe worsse and worsse whill they deceave and are deceaved them selves .
55003014	But continue thou in the thynges which thou hast learned which also were committed vnto the seynge thou knowest of whom thou hast learned them
55003015	and for as moche also as thou hast knowe holy scripture of a chylde which is able to make the wyse vnto saluacion thorowe the fayth which ys in Christ Iesu .
55003016	For all scripture geve by inspiracion of god is proffitable to teache to improve to amende and to instruct in rightewesnes
55003017	yt ye man of god maye be perfect and prepared vnto all good workes .
55004001	I testifie therfore before god and before the lorde Iesu Christ which shall iudge quicke and deed at his aperynge in his kyngdom
55004002	preache the worde be fervent be it in season or out of season . Improve rebuke exhorte with all longe sufferinge and doctryne .
55004003	For the tyme will come when they wyll not suffer wholsome doctryne : but after their awne lustes shall they ( whose eares ytche ) gett the an heepe of teachers
55004004	and shall turne their eares from ye trueth and shalbe geven vnto fables .
55004005	But watch thou in all thynges and suffre adversitie and do the worke of an evangelist fulfill thyne office vnto the vtmost .
55004006	For I am now redy to be offered and the tyme of my departynge is at honde .
55004007	I have fought a good fight and have fulfilled my course and have kept the fayth .
55004008	From hence forth is layde vp for me a croune of rightewesnes which the lorde that is a righteous iudge shall geve me at that daye : not to me only but vnto all them that love his commynge .
55004009	Make spede to come vnto me at once .
55004010	For Demas hath left me and hath loved this present worlde and is departed into Tessalonica . Crescens is gone to Galacia and Titus vnto Dalmacea .
55004011	Only Lucas is with me . Take Marke and bringe him with the for he is necessary vnto me forto minister .
55004012	And Tichicus have I sent to Ephesus .
55004013	The cloke that I lefte at Troada with Carpus whe thou commest brynge with the and the bokes but specially the partchemet .
55004014	Alexander the coppersmyth did me moche evyll the lorde rewarde him accordynge to his dedes
55004015	of whom be thou ware also . For he withstode oure preachynge sore .
55004016	At my fyrst answerynge no man assissted me but all forsoke me . I praye God that it maye not be layde to their charges :
55004017	notwithstondinge the Lorde assisted me and stregthed me that by me the preachinge shuld be fulfilled to the vtmost and that all the gentyls shuld heare . And I was delivered out of the mouth of the lyon .
55004018	And the Lorde shall delivre me from all evyll doynge and shall kepe me vnto his hevenly kyngdome . To who be prayse for ever and ever . Amen .
55004019	Salute Prisca and Aquila and the housholde of Onesiphorus .
55004020	Erastus abode at Corinthu . Trophimos I lefte at Miletum sicke .
55004021	Make spede to come before winter . Eubolus gretith the and Pudes and Linus and Claudia and all the brethren .
55004022	The Lorde Iesus Christ be with thy sprete . Grace be with you . Amen .
56001001	Paul the seruaunt of God and an Apostle of Iesu Christ to preache the fayth of goddis electe and ye knowledge of that trueth which is after godlynes
56001002	vpon the hope of eternall lyfe which lyfe God that cannot lye hath promised before the worlde begane :
56001003	but hath opened his worde at ye tyme apoynted thorow preachynge which preachynge is committed vnto me by the commaundement of god oure saveoure .
56001004	To Titus his naturall sonne in the commen fayth . Grace mercie and peace from God the father and from the lord Iesu Christ oure saveoure .
56001005	For this cause left I ye in Creta that thou shuldest performe that which was lackynge and shuldest ordeyne elders in every citie as I apoynted the .
56001006	Yf eny be fautelesse the husbande of one wyfe havynge faythfull childre which are not selandred of royote nether are disobediet .
56001007	For a bisshoppe must be fautelesse as it be commeth the minister of God : not stubborne not angrye no dronkarde no fyghter not geven to filthy lucre :
56001008	but herberous one that loveth goodnes sobre mynded righteous holy temperat
56001009	and suche as cleveth vnto the true worde of doctryne that he maye be able to exhorte with wholsom learnynge and to improve them that saye agaynst it .
56001010	For ther are many disobedient and talkers of vanite and disceavers of myndes namely they of the circumcisio
56001011	whose mouthes must be stopped which pervert whole houses teachinge thinges which they ought not because of filthy lucre .
56001012	One beynge of the selves which was a poyet of their awne sayde : The Cretayns are all wayes lyars evyll beastes and slowe belies .
56001013	This witnes is true wherfore rebuke them sharply that they maye be sounde in the fayth
56001014	and not takynge hede to Iewes fables and commaudmentes of men that turne from the trueth .
56001015	Vnto the pure are all thynges pure : but vnto them that are defiled and vnbelevynge is nothynge pure : but even the very myndes and consciences of them are defiled .
56001016	They confesse that they knowe god : but with the dedes they denye hym and are abhominable and disobedient and vnto all good workes discommendable .
56002001	But speake thou that which becometh wholsome learninge .
56002002	That ye elder me be sober honest discrete sounde in the fayth in love and in paciece .
56002003	And ye elder weme lykewyse that they be in soche rayment as becommeth holynes not falce accusars not geven to moche drinkynge but teachers of honest thynges
56002004	to make the younge wemen sobremynded to love their husbandes to love their children
56002005	to be discrete chast huswyfly good and obediet vnto their awne husbandes that the worde of god be not evyll spoken of .
56002006	Yonge men lykwyse exhorte that they be sobre mynded .
56002007	Above all thynges shewe thy silfe an insample of good workes with uncorrupt doctryne with honestie and with the wholsome
56002008	worde which cannot be rebuked that he which withstondeth maye be a shamed havynge no thinge in you yt he maye disprayse .
56002009	The servautes exhorte to be obediet vnto their awne masters and to please in all thynges not answerynge agayne
56002010	nether be pickers but that they shewe all good faythfulnes that they maye do worshippe to ye doctryne of oure saveoure God in all thynges .
56002011	For the grace of god that bryngeth saluacion vnto all men hath appered
56002012	and teacheth vs that we shuld denye vngodlynes and wordly lustes and that we shuld live sobre mynded righteously and godly in this present worlde
56002013	lokinge for that blessed hope and glorious apperenge of ye myghty god and of oure savioure Iesu Christ
56002014	which gave him silfe for vs to redeme vs from all vnrightewesnes and to pourge vs a peculiar people vnto him silfe fervently geven vnto good workes .
56002015	These thinges speake and exhorte and rebuke with all commaundynge Se that no man despise the .
56003001	Warne the that they submitte them selves to rule and power to obey the officers that they be readie vnto all good workes
56003002	that they speake evyll of no ma that they be no fyghters but softe shewynge all meknes vnto all men .
56003003	For we oure selves also were in tymes past vnwyse disobedient deceaved in daunger to lustes and to diuers maners of volupteousnes livynge in maliciousnes and envie full of hate hatinge one another .
56003004	But after that the kyndnes and love of oure saveoure God to mawarde appered
56003005	not of ye dedes of rightewesnes which we wrought but of his mercie he saved vs by ye foutayne of the newe birth and with the renuynge of the holy goost
56003006	which he shed on vs aboundantly thorow Iesus Christ oure saveoure
56003007	that we once iustified by his grace shuld be heyres of eternall lyfe thorowe hope
56003008	This is a true sayinge . Of these thinges I wolde thou shuldest certifie that they which beleve God myght be diligent to go forwarde in good workes . These thinges are good and proffitable vnto me .
56003009	Folisshe questions and genealogies and braulinges and stryfe aboute the lawe avoyde for they are vnproffitable and superfluous .
56003010	A ma that is geue to heresie after the fyrst and the seconde admonicion avoyde
56003011	remembrynge that he that is soche is perverted and synneth even damned by his awne iudgement .
56003012	When I shall sende Artemas vnto the or Tichicus be diliget to come to me vnto Nichopolis . For I have determined ther to wynter .
56003013	Brynge zenas ye lawear and Apollos on their iorney diligently that nothynge be lackynge vnto them .
56003014	And let oures olso learne to excell in good workes as farforth as nede requyreth that they be not vnfrutefull .
56003015	All that are with me salute the . Grete them that love vs in the fayth . Grace be with you all Amen .
57001001	Paul the presoner of Iesu Christ and brother Timotheus . Vnto Philemon the beloved and oure helper
57001002	and to the beloved Appia and to Archippus oure felowe soudier and to the congregacion of thy housse .
57001003	Grace be with you and peace from God oure father and from the Lorde Iesus Christ .
57001004	I thake my God makinge mencio all wayes of the in my prayers
57001005	when I heare of thy love and fayth which thou hast towarde the Lorde Iesu and towarde all saynctes :
57001006	so that the fellisshippe that thou hast in the fayth is frutefull thorow knowledge of all good thinges which are in you by Iesus Christ .
57001007	And we have great ioye and consolacion over thy love : for by the ( brother ) the saynctes hertes are comforted .
57001008	Wherfore though I be bolde in Christ to enioyne the that which becometh the :
57001009	yet for loves sake I rather beseche the though I be as I am eve Paul aged and now in bondes for Iesu Christes sake .
57001010	I beseche the for my sonne Onesimus whom I begat in my bondes
57001011	which in tyme passed was to the vnproffetable : but now proffetable bothe to the and also to me
57001012	whom I have sent home agayne . Thou therfore receave him that is to saye myne awne bowels
57001013	whom I wolde fayne have retayned with me that in thy stede he myght have ministred vnto me in ye bondes of the gospell .
57001014	Neverthelesse without thy mynde wolde I doo nothinge that yt good which springeth of the shuld not be as it were of necessitie but willingly .
57001015	Haply he therfore departed for a season yt thou shuldest receave him for ever
57001016	not nowe as a servaut : but above a servaunt I meane a brother beloved specially to me : but how moche more vnto the both in the flesshe and also in the Lorde ?
57001017	Yf thou count me a felowe receave him as my selfe .
57001018	Yf he have hurt the or oweth the ought that laye to my charge .
57001019	I Paul have writte it with myne awne hode . I will recompence it . So that I do not saye to the howe that thou owest vnto me eve thyne awne silfe .
57001020	Even so brother let me enioye the in the Lorde . Comforte my bowels in the Lorde .
57001021	Trustinge in thyne obediece I wrote vnto the knowynge that thou wilt do more then I saye for .
57001022	Moreover prepare me lodgynge : for I trust thorow ye helpe of youre prayers I shalbe geven vnto you .
57001023	Ther salute ye Epaphras my felowe presoner in Christ Iesu
57001024	Marcus Aristarchus Demas Lucas my helpers .
57001025	The grace of oure Lorde Iesu Christ be with youre spretes . Amen .
58001001	God in tyme past diversly and many wayes spake vnto the fathers by Prophetes :
58001002	but in these last dayes he hath spoken vnto vs by his sonne whom he hath made heyre of all thinges : by who also he made the worlde .
58001003	Which sonne beynge the brightnes of his glory and very ymage of his substance bearinge vp all thinges with the worde of his power hath in his awne person pourged oure synnes and is sitten on the right honde of the maiestie an hye
58001004	and is more excellent then the angels in as moche as he hath by inheritaunce obteyned an excellenter name then have they .
58001005	For vnto which of the angels sayde he ateny tyme : Thou arte my sonne this daye be gate I the ? And agayne : I will be his father and he shalbe my sonne .
58001006	And agayne whe he bringeth in the fyrst begotten sonne in to the worlde he sayth : And all the angels of God shall worshippe him .
58001007	And of the angels he sayth : He maketh his angels spretes and his ministres flammes of fyre .
58001008	But vnto the sonne he sayth : God thy seate shalbe forever and ever . The cepter of thy kyngdome is a right cepter .
58001009	Thou hast loved rightewesnes and hated iniquyte . Wherfore God which is thy God hath anoynted the with ye oyle of gladnes above thy felowes .
58001010	And thou Lorde in the begynninge hast layde the foundacion of the erth . And the heves are the workes of thy hondes .
58001011	They shall perisshe but thou shalt endure . They all shall wexe olde as doth a garment :
58001012	and as a vesture shalt thou chaunge them and they shalbe chaunged . But thou arte all wayes and thy yeres shall not fayle .
58001013	Vnto which of the angels sayde he at eny tyme ? Sit on my ryght honde tyll I make thyne enemyes thy fote stole .
58001014	Are they not all mynistrynge spretes sent to minister for their sakes which shalbe heyres of salvacion ?
58002001	Wherfore we ought to geve ye more hede to ye thinges we have herde lest we perysshe .
58002002	For yf the worde which was spoke by angels was stedfast : so yt every trasgressio and disobediece receaved a iust recopece to rewarde :
58002003	how shall we escape yf we despyse so great saluacio which at ye fyrst bega to be preached of ye lorde him silfe and afterwarde was cofermed vnto vs warde by the ye hearde it
58002004	god bearynge witnes therto bothe with sygnes and wonders also and with divers miracles and gyftes of the holy gooste accordynge to his awne will .
58002005	He hath not vnto the angels put in subieccion the worlde to come where of we speake .
58002006	But one in a certayne place witnessed sayinge . What is man that thou arte myndfull of him ?
58002007	After thou haddest for a season made him lower then the angels : thou crounedst him with honour and glory and hast set him above the workes of thy hondes .
58002008	Thou hast put all thynges in subieccion vnder his fete . In that he put all thynges vnder him he left nothynge that is not put vnder him .
58002009	Neverthelesse we yet se not all thynges subdued but him yt was made lesse the ye angelles : we se that it was Iesus which is crouned with glory and honour for the sofferinge of death : that he by the grace of god shulde tast of deeth for all men .
58002010	For it becam him for whom are all thynges and by whom are all thynges after that he had brought many sonnes vnto glory that he shuld make the lorde of their saluacion parfect thorow sofferynge .
58002011	For he that sanctifieth and they which are sanctified are all of one . For which causes sake he is not ashamde to call the brethren
58002012	sayinge : I will declare thy name vnto my brethren and in the myddes of the congregacio will I prayse the .
58002013	And agayne : I will put my trust in him . And agayne . beholde here am I and the children which god hath geven me .
58002014	For as moche then as the children were parte takers of flesshe and bloud he also him silfe lyke wyse toke parte with them for to put doune thorow deth him that had lordshippe over deeth that is to saye the devyll
58002015	and yt he myght delyver the which thorow feare of deeth were all their lyfetyme in dauger of bondage .
58002016	For he in no place taketh on him the angels : but the seede of Abraham taketh he on him .
58002017	Wherfore in all thynges it became him to be made lyke vnto his brethre that he myght be mercifull and a faythfull hye preste in thynges concernynge god for to pourge the peoples synnes .
58002018	For in that he him silfe suffered and was tempted he is able to sucker them that are tempted .
58003001	Wherfore holy brethren partakers of the celestiall callinge cosyder the embasseatour and hye prest of oure profession Christ Iesus
58003002	which was faythfull to him that made him even as was Moses in all his housse .
58003003	And this man was counted worthy of more glory then Moses : In as moche as he which hath prepared the housse hath most honoure in the housse .
58003004	Every housse is prepared of some man . But he that ordeyned all thinges is god .
58003005	And Moses verely was faythfull in all his housse as a minister to beare witnes of tho thinges which shuld be spoken afterwarde .
58003006	But Christ as a sonne hath rule over the housse whose housse are we so that we hold fast the confydence and the reioysynge of that hope vnto the ende .
58003007	Wherfore as the holy goost sayth : to daye if ye shall heare his voyce
58003008	harden not youre hertes after the rebellyon in the daye of temptacion in the wildernes
58003009	where youre fathers tempted me proved me and sawe my workes xl . yeare longe .
58003010	Wherfore I was greved wt ye generacio and sayde . They erre ever in their hertes : they verely have not knowe my wayes
58003011	so that I sware in my wrathe that they shuld not enter into my rest .
58003012	Take hede brethren that therbe in none of you an evyll herte in vnbeleve that he shuld departe from ye lyvynge god :
58003013	but exhorte one another dayly whill is it called to daye lest eny of you wexe harde herted thorow ye deceytfullnesse of sinne
58003014	We are partetakers of Christ yf we kepe sure vnto the ende the fyrst substance
58003015	so longe as it is sayd : to daye yf ye heare his voyce harde not youre hertes as when ye rebelled .
58003016	For some whe they hearde rebelled : howbe it not all yt ca out of Egypt vnder Moses .
58003017	But with who was he despleased . xl . yeares ? Was he not displeased with them that synned : whose carkases were overthorwen in the desert ?
58003018	To whom sware he that they shuld not enter into his rest : but vnto them that beleved not ?
58003019	And we se that they coulde not enter in because of vnbeleve .
58004001	Let vs feare therfore lest eny of vs forsakynge the promes of entrynge into his rest shulde seme to come behinde .
58004002	For vnto vs was it declared as well as vnto them . But it proffited not them that they hearde the worde because they which hearde it coupled it not with fayth .
58004003	But we which have beleved do enter into his rest as contrarywyse he sayde to the other : I have sworne in my wrath they shall not enter into my rest . And that spake he verely longe after that the workes were made and the foudacio of ye worlde layde .
58004004	For he spake in a certayne place of ye seveth daye on this wyse : And god did rest ye seventh daye fro all his workes .
58004005	And in this place agayne : They shall not come into my rest .
58004006	Seynge therfore it foloweth that some muste enter therinto and they to who it was fyrst preached entred not therin for vnbeleves sake .
58004007	Agayne he apoynteth in David a certayne present daye after so longe a tyme sayinge as it is rehearsed : this daye if ye heare his voyce be not harde herted .
58004008	For if Iosue had geven them rest then wolde he not afterwarde have spoke of another daye .
58004009	There remayneth therfore yet a rest to ye people of God .
58004010	For he yt is is entred into his rest doth cease from his awne workes as god did from his .
58004011	Let vs study therfore to entre into that rest lest eny man faule after the same ensample in to vnbelefe .
58004012	For the worde of god is quycke and myghty in operacion and sharper then eny two edged swearde : and entreth through even vnto the dividynge asonder of the soule and the sprete and of the ioyntes and the mary : and iudgeth the thoughtes and the intentes of the herte :
58004013	nether is there eny creature invisible in the sight of it . For all thynges are naked and bare vnto the eyes of him of who we speake .
58004014	Seynge then that we have a great hye prest whych is entred into heven ( I meane Iesus the sonne of God ) let vs holde oure profession .
58004015	For we have not an hye prest which can not have compassion on oure infirmities : but was in all poyntes tempted lyke as we are : but yet with out synne .
58004016	Let vs therfore goo boldely vnto the seate of grace that we maye receave mercy and fynde grace to helpe in tyme of nede .
58005001	For every hye prest that is taken from amoge men is ordeyned for men in thynges pertaynynge to god : to offer gyftes and sacryfyses for synne :
58005002	which can have compassion on the ignoraunt and on them that are out of the waye because that he him silfe also is compased with infirmitie :
58005003	For the which infirmities sake he is bounde to offer for synnes as well for hys awne parte as for the peoples .
58005004	And no man taketh honour vnto him silfe but he that is called of God as was Aaron .
58005005	Even so lykewise Christ glorified not him silfe to be made the hye prest : but he that sayde vnto him : thou arte my sonne this daye begat I the glorified him .
58005006	As he also in another place speaketh : Thou arte a prest for ever after the order of Melchisedech .
58005007	Which in the dayes of his flesshe did offer vp prayers and sup plicacions with stronge cryinge and teares vnto him that was able to save him from deeth : and was also hearde because of his godlines .
58005008	And though he were Goddes sonne yet learned he obediece by tho thynges which he suffered
58005009	and was made parfaite and the cause of eternall saluacion vnto all them that obey him :
58005010	and is called of God an hye prest after the order of Melchisedech .
58005011	Wherof we have many thynges to saye which are harde to be vttered : because ye are dull of hearinge .
58005012	For when as cocerninge ye tyme ye ought to be teachers yet have ye nede agayne that we teache you the fyrst principles of the worde of god : and are become soche as have nede of mylke and not of stronge meate :
58005013	For every man that is feed with mylke is inexperte in the worde of rightewesnes . For he is but a babe .
58005014	But stronge meate belongeth to them that are parfecte which thorow custome have their wittes exercised to iudge both good and evyll also .
58006001	Wherfore let vs leave ye doctryne pertayninge to the beginninge of a Christen man and let vs go vnto perfeccio and now no more laye the foundacio of repentaunce from deed workes and of fayth towarde God
58006002	of baptyme of doctryne and of layinge on of hondes and of resurreccion from deeth and of eternall iudgemet .
58006003	And so will we do yf God permitte .
58006004	For it is not possible yt they which were once lyghted and have tasted of the hevenly gyft and were become partetakers of the holy goost
58006005	and have tasted of the good worde of God and of the power of the worlde to come :
58006006	yf they faule shuld be renued agayne vnto repentaunce : for as moche as they have ( as concerninge them selves ) crucified the sonne of God a fresshe makynge a mocke of him .
58006007	For that erth which drinketh in the rayne wich cometh ofte vpon it and bringeth forth erbes mete for them that dresse it receaveth blessynge of god .
58006008	But that grounde which beareth thornes and bryars is reproved and is nye vnto cursynge : whose ende is to be burned .
58006009	Neverthelesse deare frendes we trust to se better of you and thynges which accompany saluacion though we thus speake .
58006010	For god is not vnrighteous that he shuld forget youre worke and laboure that procedeth of love which love shewed in his name which have ministred vnto the saynctes and yet minister
58006011	Yee and we desyre that every one of you shew the same diligence to the stablysshynge of hope even vnto the ende :
