58006012	that ye faynt not but folowe them which thorow fayth and pacience inheret the promyses .
58006013	For when god made promes to Abraham because he had no greater thinge to sweare by he sware by him silfe
58006014	sayinge : Surely I will blesse the and multiply the in dede .
58006015	And so after that he had taryed a longe tyme he enioyed the promes .
58006016	Men verely sweare by him that is greater then them selves and an othe to confyrme the thynge ys amonge them an ende of all stryfe .
58006017	So god willynge very aboundanly to shewe vnto the heyres of promes the stablenes of his counsayle he added an othe
58006018	that by two immutable thinges ( in which it was vnpossible that god shuld lye ) we myght have parfect consolacion which have fled for to holde fast the hope that is set before vs
58006019	which hope we have as an ancre of the soule both sure and stedfast . Which hope also entreth in into tho thynges which are with in the vayle
58006020	whither ye fore runner is for vs entred in I mea Iesus that is made an hye prest for ever after the order of Melchisedech .
58007001	This Melchisedech kynge of Salem ( which beinge prest of ye most hye god met Abraham as he returned agayne from the slaughter of the kynges and blessed him :
58007002	to whom also Abraham gave tythes of all thynges ) fyrst is by interpretacion kynge of rightewesnes : after yt he is kynge of Sale yt is to saye kynge of peace
58007003	with out father wt out mother with out kynne and hath nether begynnynge of his tyme nether yet ende of his lyfe : but is lykened vnto the sonne of god and cotinueth a preste for ever .
58007004	Consyder what a man this was vnto who the patriarke Abraham gave tythes of the spoyles .
58007005	And verely those children of levy which receave the office of the prestes have a commaundement to take a cordyng to the lawe tythes of the people that is to saye of their brethren yee though they spronge out of the loynes of Abraham .
58007006	But he whose kynred is not counted amonge them receaved tythes of Abraham and blessed him that had the promyses .
58007007	And no man denyeth but that which is lesse receaveth blessinge of yt which is greater .
58007008	And here men that dye receave tythes . But there he receaveth tythes of whom it is witnessed that he liveth .
58007009	And to saye the trueth Levy him silfe also which receaveth tythes payed tythes in Abraham .
58007010	For he was yet in the loynes of his father Abraham when Melchisech met him .
58007011	Yf now therfore perfeccion came by the presthod of the levites ( for vnder that presthod the people recaved the lawe ) what neded it furthermore that an other prest shuld ryse after the order of Melchisedech and not after the order of Aaron ?
58007012	Now no dout yf the presthod be translated then of necessitie must the lawe be translated also .
58007013	For he of whom these thynges are spoken pertayneth vnto another trybe of which never man served at the aultre .
58007014	For it is evidet that oure lorde spronge of the trybe of Iuda of which trybe spake Moses nothynge concernynge presthod .
58007015	And it is yet a more evydent thinge yf after the similitude of Melchisedech ther aryse a nother prest
58007016	which is not made after the lawe of the carnall commaundmet : but after the power of the endlesse lyfe
58007017	( For he testifieth : Thou arte a prest forever after the order of Melchysedech )
58007018	Then the commaundmet that went a fore is disanulled because of hir weaknes and vnproffitablenes .
58007019	For the lawe made nothynge parfecte : but was an introduccion of a better hope by which hope we drawe nye vnto god .
58007020	And for this cause it is a better hope that it was not promysed with out an othe .
58007021	Those prestes were made wt out an oth : but this prest with an oth by him that saide vnto him The lorde sware and will not repent : Thou arte a prest for ever after the order of Melchisedech .
58007022	And for that cause was Iesus a stablyssher of a better testament .
58007023	And amonge them many were made prestes because they were not suffred to endure by the reason of deeth .
58007024	But this man because he endureth ever hath an everlastinge presthod .
58007025	Wherfore he is able also ever to save them that come vnto god by him seynge he ever lyveth to make intercession for vs .
58007026	Soche an hye prest it became vs to have which is wholy harmlesse vndefyled separat from synners and made hyar then heven .
58007027	Which nedeth not dayly ( as yonder hie prestes ) to offer vp sacrifice fyrst for his awne synnes and then for the peoples synnes . For that did he at once for all when he offered vp him silfe .
58007028	For the lawe maketh men prestes which have infirmitie : but the worde of the othe that came fence ye lawe maketh the sonne prest which is parfecte for ever more .
58008001	Of the thynges which we have spoke this is the pyth : that we have soche an hye preste that is sitten on ye right honde of the seate of maieste in heven
58008002	and is a minister of holy thynges and of the very tabernacle which God pyght and not ma .
58008003	For every hye prest is ordeyned to offer gyftes and sacryfises wherfore it is of necessitie that this man have somewhat also to offer .
58008004	For he were not a preste yf he were on ye erth where are prestes that acordynge to ye lawe
58008005	offer giftes which prestes serve vnto ye ensample and shadowe of hevenly thynges : even as the answer of God was geven vnto Moses when he was about to fynnishe the tabernacle : Take hede ( sayde he ) that thou make all thynges accordynge to the patrone shewed to the in the mount .
58008006	Now hath he obtayned a more excellent office in as moche as he is the mediator of a better testament which was made for better promyses .
58008007	For yf that fyrst testament had bene fautelesse : then shuld no place have bene sought for the seconde .
58008008	For in rebukynge the he sayth : Beholde the dayes will come ( sayth the lorde ) and I will fynnyshe apon the housse of Israhel and apon the housse of Iuda
58008009	a newe testament : not lyke the testament that I made with their fathers at that tyme whe I toke them by the hondes to lede them oute of the londe of Egipte for they continued not in my testament and I regarded them not sayth the lorde .
58008010	For this is the testament that I will make with the housse of Israhell : After those dayes sayth the lorde : I will put my lawes in their myndes and in their hertes I will wryte the and I wilbe their God and they shalbe my people .
58008011	And they shall not teache every man his neghboure and every man his brother sayinge : knowe the lorde : For they shall knowe me from the lest to the moste of them :
58008012	For I wilbe mercifull over their vnrightwesnes and on their synnes and on their iniquiries .
58008013	In yt he sayth a new testament he hath abrogat the olde . Now that which is disanulled and wexed olde is redy to vannysshe awaye .
58009001	That fyrst tabernacle verely had ordinaunces and servynges of god and wordly holynes .
58009002	For there was a fore tabernacle made wherin was the candlesticke and the table and the shewe breed which is called wholy .
58009003	But with in the secode vayle was ther a tabernacle which is called holiest of all
58009004	which had the golden senser and the arcke of the testamet overlayde round about with golde wherin was the golden pot with manna and Aarons rodde that spronge and the tables of the testament .
58009005	Over the arcke were the cherubis of glory shadowynge the seate of grace . Of which thynges we wyll not now speake perticularly .
58009006	When these thynges were thus ordeyned the prestes went all wayes into the fyrst tabernacle and executed the service of god .
58009007	But into the seconde went the hye prest alone once every yeare : and not with out bloud which he offered for him silfe and for the ignoraunce of ye people .
58009008	Wherwith ye holy goost this signifyeng yt the waye of holy thynges was not yet opened whill as yet ye fyrst tabernacle was stondynge .
58009009	Which was a similitude for the tyme then present and in which were offered gyftes and sacrifises that coulde not make them that minister parfecte as pertaynynge to the conscience
58009010	with only meates and drinkes and divers wesshynges and iustifyinges of the flesshe which were ordeyned vntyll the tyme of reformacion .
58009011	But Christ beynge an hye prest of good thynges to come came by a greater and a moare parfecte tabernacle not made with hondes : that is to saye not of this maner bildynge
58009012	nether by the bloud of gotes and calves : but by his awne bloud we entred once for all into the holy place and founde eternall redemcion .
58009013	For yf the bloud of oxen and of Gotes and the asshes of an heyfer whe it was sprynckled puryfied the vnclene as touchynge the purifiynge of the flesshe :
58009014	How moche more shall the bloud of Christ ( which thorow the eternall sprete offered him silfe with out spot to God ) pourdge youre consciences from deed workes for to serve the livynge god ?
58009015	And for this cause is he the mediator of ye newe testament that thorow deeth which chaunsed for the redempcion of those transgressions that were in ye fyrst testamet ) they which were called myght receave the promes of eternall inheritaunce .
58009016	For whersoever is a testament there must also be the deeth of him that maketh the testament .
58009017	For the testament taketh auctoritie when men are deed : For it is of no value as longe as he that made it is alive .
58009018	For which cause also nether that fyrst testament was ordeyned with out bloud .
58009019	For when all the commaundementes were redde of Moses vnto all the people he toke ye bloud of calves and of Gotes with water and purple woll and ysope and sprynkled both the boke and all the people
58009020	sayinge : this is the bloud of the testament which god hath apoynted vnto you .
58009021	Morover he sprenkled the tabernacle with bloud also and all the ministrynge vessels .
58009022	And almost all thynges are bye the lawe pourged with bloud and with out effusion of bloud is no remission .
58009023	It is then nede that the similitudes of hevenly thynges be purified with soche thynges : but the hevenly thynges them selves are purified with better sacrifises then are those .
58009024	For Christ is not entred into the holy places that are made with hondes which are but similitudes of true thynges : but is entred into very heven for to appere now in the syght of God for vs :
58009025	not to offer him silfe often as the hye prest entreth in to ye holy place every yeare with straunge bloud
58009026	for then must he have often suffered sence the worlde bega . But now in the ende of the worlde hath he appered once to put synne to flyght by the offerynge vp of him silfe .
58009027	And as it is apoynted vnto men that they shall once dye and then commeth the iudegement even
58009028	so Christ was once offered to take awaye the synnes of many and vnto them that loke for him shall he appeare agayne without synne vnto saluacion .
58010001	For the lawe which hath but the shadowe of good thynges to come and not the thynges in their awne fassion can never with ye sacryfises which they offer yere by yere continually make the comers thervnto parfayte .
58010002	For wolde not then those sacrifises have ceased to have bene offered because that the offerers once pourged shuld have had no moare conscieces of sinnes .
58010003	Neverthelesse in those sacrifises is ther mencion made of synnes every yeare .
58010004	For it is vnpossible that the bloud of oxen and of gotes shuld take awaye synnes .
58010005	Wherfore when he commeth into the worlde he sayth : Sacrifice and offeringe thou woldest not have : but a bodie hast thou ordeyned me .
58010006	In sacrifices and synne offerynges thou hast no lust .
58010007	Then I sayde : Lo I come in the chefest of the boke it is written of me that I shuld doo thy will o god .
58010008	Above when he had sayed sacrifice and offerynge and burnt sacrifices and synne offerynges thou woldest not have nether hast alowed ( which yet are offered by the lawe )
58010009	and then sayde : Lo I come to do thy will o god : he taketh awaye the fyrst to stablisshe the latter .
58010010	By the which will we are sanctified by the offeringe of the body of Iesu Christe once for all .
58010011	And every prest is redy dayly ministrynge and ofte tymes offereth one maner of offerynge which can never take awaye synnes .
58010012	But this man after he had offered one sacrifyce for synnes sat him doune for ever on the right honde of god
58010013	and from hence forth tarieth till his foes be made his fotestole .
58010014	For with one offerynge hath he made parfecte for ever them yt are sanctified .
58010015	And ye holy goost also beareth vs recorde of this even when he tolde before :
58010016	This is the testament that I will make vnto them after those dayes sayth the lorde . I will put my lawes in their hertes and in their mynde I will write them
58010017	and their synnes and iniquyties will I remember no moare .
58010018	And where remission of these thinges is there is no moare offerynge for synne .
58010019	Seynge brethren that by the meanes of the bloud of Iesu we maye be bolde to enter into that holy place
58010020	by the newe and livynge waye which he hath prepared for vs through the vayle that is to saye by his flesshe .
58010021	And seynge also that we have an hye prest which is ruler over ye housse of god
58010022	let vs drawe nye with a true herte in a full fayth sprynckeled in oure hertes from an evyll conscience and wesshed in oure bodies with pure water
58010023	and let vs kepe the profession of oure hope with oute waveringe ( for he is faythfull that promysed )
58010024	and let vs consyder one another to provoke vnto love and to good workes :
58010025	and let vs not forsake the felishippe that we have amoge oure selves as the maner of some is : but let vs exhorte one another and that so moche the more because ye se that the daye draweth nye .
58010026	For yf we synne willyngly after that we have receaved the knowledge of the trueth there remayneth no more sacrifice for synnes
58010027	but a fearfull lokynge for iudgement and violent fyre which shall devoure the adversaries
58010028	He that despiseth Moses lawe dyeth with out mercy vnder two or thre witnesses .
58010029	Of how moche sorer punyshment suppose ye shall he be counted worthy which treadeth vnderfote the sonne of god : and counteth the bloude of the testament as an vnholy thynge wherwith he was sanctified and doth dishonoure to the sprete of grace .
58010030	For we knowe him that hath sayde vengeaunce belongeth vnto me I will recompence sayth the lorde . And agayne : the lorde shall iudge his people .
58010031	It is a fearfull thynge to faule into the hondes of the livynge God .
58010032	Call to remebraunce the dayes that are passed in the which after ye had receaved light ye endured a greate fyght in adversities
58010033	partly whill all men wondred and gased at you for the shame and trioulacion that was done vnto you and partly whill ye became companyons of the which so passed their tyme .
58010034	For ye suffered also with my bondes and toke a worth the spoylynge of youre goodes and that with gladnes knowynge in youre selves how that ye had in heven a better and an endurynge substaunce
58010035	Cast not awaye therfore youre confidence which hath great rewarde to recopence .
58010036	For ye have nede of paciece that after ye have done ye will of god ye myght receave the promes .
58010037	For yet a very lytell whyle and he that shall come will come and will not tary .
58010038	But the iust shall live by faith . And yf he withdrawe him silfe my soule shall have no pleasure in him .
58010039	We are not whiche withdrawe oure selves vnto dampnacio but partayne to fayth to the wynnynge of the soule .
58011001	Fayth is a sure confidence of thynges which are hoped for and a certayntie of thynges which are not sene .
58011002	By it ye elders were well reported of .
58011003	Thorow fayth we vnderstonde that the worlde was ordeyned by the worde of god : and that thynges which are sene were made of thynges which are not sene .
58011004	By fayth Abell offered vnto god a more plenteous sacrifice then Cayn : by which he obteyned witnes that he was righteous god testifyinge of his gyftes : by which also he beynge deed yet speaketh .
58011005	By fayth was Enoch traslated yt he shuld not se deeth : nether was he founde : for God had taken him awaye . Before he was taken awaye he was reported of that he had pleased God :
58011006	but with out fayth it is vnpossible to please him . For he that commeth to God must beleve that God is and that he is a rewarder of them that seke him .
58011007	By fayth Noe honored God after that he was warned of thinges which were not sene and prepared the arcke to the savinge of his houssholde thorowe the which arcke he condempned the worlde and became heyre of the rightewesnes which commeth by fayth .
58011008	By fayth Abraha whe he was called obeyed to goo out into a place which he shuld afterwarde receave to inheritaunce and he wet out not knowynge whether he shuld goo .
58011009	By fayth he removed into the londe yt was promysed him as into a straunge countre and dwelt in tabernacles : and so dyd Isaac and Iacob heyres with him of the same promes .
58011010	For he loked for a citie havinge a foundacio whose bylder and maker is God .
58011011	Thorow fayth Sara also receaved stregth to be with chylde and was delivered of a chylde when she was past age because she iudged him faythfull which had promysed .
58011012	And therfore spronge therof one ( and of one which was as good as deed ) so many in multitude as the starres of ye skye and as the sond of the see shore which is innumerable .
58011013	And they all dyed in fayth and receaved not the promyses : but sawe them a farre of and beleved them and saluted them : and confessed that they were straungers and pilgrems on the erthe .
58011014	They that saye soche thinges declare that they seke a coutre .
58011015	Also yf they had bene myndfull of that countre from whence they came oute they had leasure to have returned agayne .
58011016	But now they desyre a better that is to saye a hevenlye . Wherfore God is not ashamed of them even to be called their God : for he hath prepared for them a citie .
58011017	In fayth Abraham offered vp Isaac whe he was tempted and he offered him beinge his only begotten sonne which had receaved the promyses
58011018	of who it was sayde in Isaac shall thy seed be called :
58011019	for he cosidered that God was able to rayse vp agayne fro deeth . Wherfore receaved he him for an ensample .
58011020	In fayth Isaac blessed Iacob and Esau concerninge thinges to come .
58011021	By fayth Iacob when he was a dyinge blessed both the sonnes of Ioseph and bowed him selfe towarde the toppe of his cepter .
58011022	By fayth Ioseph when he dyed remebred the departinge of the chyldren of Israel and gave commaundement of his bones .
58011023	By fayth Moses when he was borne was hid thre monethes of his father and mother be cause they sawe he was a proper chylde : nether feared they the kynges commaundemet .
58011024	By fayth Moses when he was great refused to be called ye sonne of Pharaos doughter
58011025	and chose rather to suffre adversitie wt the people of God then to enioye the pleasurs of synne for a ceason
58011026	and estemed the rebuke of Christ greater ryches then the treasure of Egypt . For he had a respect vnto ye rewarde .
58011027	By fayth he forsoke Egypt and feared not the fearcenes of the kynge . For he endured even as he had sene him which is invisible .
58011028	Thorow fayth he ordeyned the ester lambe and the effusion of bloud lest he that destroyed the fyrst borne shuld touche them .
58011029	By fayth they passed thorow the reed see as by drye londe which when the Egypcians had assayed to do they were drouned .
58011030	By fayth the walles of Ierico fell doune after they were copased about seven dayes .
58011031	By fayth ye harlot Raab perisshed not with the vnbelevers whe she had receaved the spyes to lodgynge peaseably .
58011032	And what shall I more saye ye tyme wold be to short for me to tell of Gedeo of Barach and of Samson and of Iephthae : also of David and Samuel and of the Prophetes :
58011033	which thorowe fayth subdued kyngdomes wrought righteousnes obteyned the promyses stopped the mouthes of lyons
58011034	queched the violence of fyre escaped the edge of the swearde of weake were made stroge waxed valient in fight turned to flyght the armyes of the alientes .
58011035	And the wemen receaved their deed raysed to lyfe agayne . Other were racked and wolde not be delyvered that they myght receave a better resurreccion .
58011036	Other tasted of mockynges and scourginginges morover of bondes and presonmet :
58011037	were stoned were hewen a sunder were tepted were slayne with sweardes walked vppe and doune in shepes skynnes in gotes skynnes in nede tribulacio and vexacio
58011038	which ye worlde was not worthy of : they wadred in wildernes in moutaynes in dennes and caves of the erth .
58011039	And these all thorow fayth obtayned good reporte and receaved not the promes
58011040	God provydinge a better thinge for vs that they with out vs shuld not be made parfecte .
58012001	Wherfore let vs also ( seynge that we are copased with so great a multitude of witnesses ) laye awaye all that presseth doune and the synne that hageth on and let vs rune with paciece vnto the battayle yt is set before vs
58012002	lokynge vnto Iesus the auctor and fynnyssher of oure fayth which for the ioye that was set before him abode the crosse and despysed the shame and is set doune on the right honde of ye trone of God .
58012003	Consider therfore how that he endured suche speakinge agaynst him of synners lest ye shuld be weried and faynte in youre myndes .
58012004	For ye have not yet resisted vnto bloud sheddinge stryvinge agaynst synne .
58012005	And ye have forgotten the consolacion which speaketh vnto you as vnto chyldren : My sonne despyse not the chastenynge of the Lorde nether faynt when thou arte rebuked of him :
58012006	For whom the Lorde loveth him he chasteneth : yee and he scourgeth every sonne that he receaveth .
58012007	Yf ye endure chastninge God offereth him selfe vnto you as vnto sonnes . What sonne is that whom the father chasteneth not ?
58012008	If ye be not vnder correccio ( where of all are part takers ) then are ye bastardes and not sonnes .
58012009	Moreover seynge we had fathers of oure flesshe which corrected vs and we gave them reverence : shuld we not moche rather be in subieccion vnto the father of spretuall gyftes that we myght live ?
58012010	And they verely for a feaue dayes nurtred vs after their awne pleasure : but he learneth vs vnto that which is proffitable that we myght receave of his holines .
58012011	No manner chastisynge for the present tyme semeth to be ioyeous but greveous : neverthelesse afterwarde it bryngeth the quyet frute of rightewesnes vnto them which are therin exercysed .
58012012	Stretch forthe therfore agayne the hondes which were let doune and the weake knees
58012013	and se that ye have strayght steppes vnto youre fete lest eny haltinge turne out of ye waye : yee let it rather be healed .
58012014	Embrace peace with all men and holynes : with out the which no man shall se the Lorde .
58012015	And looke to that no man be destitue of the grace of God and that no rote of bitternes springe vp and trouble and therby many be defiled :
58012016	and that there be no fornicator or vnclene person as Esau which for one breakfast solde his birthright .
58012017	Ye knowe how that afterwarde when he wolde have inherited the blessinge he was put by and he foude no meanes to come therby agayne : no though he desyred it with teares .
58012018	For ye are not come vnto the mounte that can be touched and vnto burninge fyre nor yet to myst and darcknes and tempest of wedder
58012019	nether vnto the sounde of a trope and the voyce of wordes : which voyce they that hearde it wisshed awaye that the comunicacion shuld not be spoken to them .
58012020	For they were not able to abyde that which was spoken . If a beast had touched the mountayne it must have bene stoned or thrust thorowe with a darte :
58012021	eve so terreble was ye sight which appered . Moses sayde I feare and quake .
58012022	But ye are come vnto the moute Sion and to the citie of the livinge god the celestiall Ierusalem : and to an innumerable sight of angels
58012023	and vnto the congregacion of ye fyrst borne sonnes which are writte in heven and to God the iudge of all and to the spretes of iust and parfecte men
58012024	and to Iesus the mediator of the newe testament and to the spryncklynge of bloud that speaketh better then the bloud of Abell .
58012025	Se that ye despise not him yt speaketh . For yf they escaped not which refused him that spake on erth : moche more shall we not escape yf we turne awaye fro him yt speaketh fro heve :
58012026	whose voyce the shouke the erth and now declareth sayinge : yet once more will I shake not the erth only but also heven .
58012027	No dout yt same that he sayth yet once more signifieth the removinge a waye of those thinges which are shaken as of thinges which have ended their course : that the thynges which are not shaken maye remayne .
58012028	Wherfore if we receave a kyngdom which is not moved we have grace wherby we maye serve god and please him with reverence and godly feare .
58012029	For oure god is a consumynge fyre .
58013001	Let brotherly love continue .
58013002	Be not forgetfull to lodge straungers . For therby have dyvers receaved angels into their houses vnwares .
58013003	Remember them that are in bondes even as though ye were bounde with them . Be myndfull of them which are in adversitie as ye which are yet in youre bodies .
58013004	Let wedlocke be had in pryce in all poyntes and let the chamber be vndefiled : for whore kepers and advoutrars god will iudge .
58013005	Let youre conversacion be with out coveteousnes and be contet with that ye have all redy . For he verely sayd : I will not fayle the nether forsake the :
58013006	that we maye boldly saye : the lorde is my helper and I will not feare what man doeth vnto me .
58013007	Remember them which have the oversight of you which have declared vnto you the worde of god . The ende of whose conversacion se that ye looke vpon and folowe their fayth .
58013008	Iesus Christ yesterdaye and to daye and the same continueth for ever .
58013009	Be not caryed aboute with divers and straunge learnynge . For it is a good thynge that the herte be stablisshed with grace and not with meates which have not proffeted them that have had their pastyme in them .
58013010	We have an altre wherof they maye not eate which serve in the tabernacle .
58013011	For ye bodies of those beastes whose bloud is brought into the holy place by the hie prest to pourge sinne are burnt with out the tentes .
58013012	Therfore Iesus to sanctifye the people with his awne bloud suffered with out the gate .
58013013	Let vs goo forth therfore out of the tentes and suffer rebuke with him .
58013014	For here have we no continuynge citie : but we seke one to come .
58013015	For by him offer we the sacrifice of laude allwayes to god : that is to saye the frute of those lyppes which confesse his name .
58013016	To do good and to distribute forget not for with suche sacrifises god is pleased .
58013017	Obeye the that have the oversight of you and submit youre selves to them for they watch for youre soules even as they that must geve a comptes : that they maye do it with ioye and not with grefe . For that is an vnproffitable thynge for you .
58013018	Praye for vs . We have confidence because we have a good conscience in all thynges and desyre to live honestly .
58013019	I desire you therfore somwhat the moare aboundantly that ye so do that I maye be restored to you quyckly .
58013020	The god of peace that brought agayne fro deth oure lorde Iesus the gret shepperde of the shepe thorowe the bloud of the everlastynge testamet
58013021	make you parfect in all good workes to do his will workynge in you yt which is pleasaut in his syght thorow Iesus christ To whom be prayse for ever whill the worlde endureth Amen .
58013022	I beseche you brethren suffre the wordes of exhortacio : For we have written vnto you in feawe wordes :
58013023	knowe the brother Timothe whom we have sent fro vs with whom ( yf he come shortly ) I will se you .
58013024	Salute the that have the oversight of you and all the saynctes . They of Italy salute you .
58013025	Grace be with you all . Amen .
59001001	Iames the seruaut of God and of the Lorde Iesus Christ sendeth gretinge to ye . xii . trybes which are scattered here and there .
59001002	My brethren count it excedynge ioye when ye faule into divers teptacions
59001003	for as moche as ye knowe how that the tryinge of youre fayth bringeth pacience :
59001004	and let pacience have her parfect worke that ye maye be parfecte and sounde lackinge nothinge .
59001005	Yf eny of you lacke wysdome let him axe of God which geveth to all men indifferentlie and casteth no man in the teth : and it shal be geven him .
59001006	But let him axe in fayth and waver not . For he that douteth is lyke the waves of the see tost of the wynde and caried with violence .
59001007	Nether let that man thinke that he shall receave eny thinge of the Lorde .
59001008	A waveringe mynded man is vnstable in all his wayes .
59001009	Let the brother of lowe degre reioyce in yt he is exalted
59001010	and the ryche in that he is made lowe . For eve as ye flower of the grasse shall he vanysshe awaye .
59001011	The sonne ryseth with heate and the grasse wydereth and his flower falleth awaye and the beautie of the fassion of it perissheth : even so shall the ryche man perisshe with his aboundance .
59001012	Happy is the man that endureth in temptacion for when he is tryed he shall receave the croune of lyfe which the Lorde hath promysed to them that love him .
59001013	Let no man saye when he is tepted that he is tempted of God . For God tepteth not vnto evyll nether tepteth he anie ma .
59001014	But every ma is tepted drawne awaye and entysed of his awne concupiscece .
59001015	Then when lust hath coceaved she bringeth forth synne and synne whe it is fynisshed bringeth forthe deeth .
59001016	Erre not my deare brethren .
59001017	Every good gyfte and every parfayt gyft is from above and commeth doune fro the father of light with whom is no variablenes nether is he chaunged vnto darcknes .
59001018	Of his awne will begat he vs with the worde of lyfe that we shuld be the fyrst frutes of his creatures .
59001019	Wherfore deare brethren let every man be swyfte to heare slowe to speake and slowe to wrath .
59001020	For the wrath of man worketh not that which is ryghteous before God .
59001021	Wherfore laye a parte all fylthynes all superfluite of maliciousnes and receave with meknes the worde yt is grafted in you which is able to save youre soules .
59001022	And se that ye be doars of the worde and not hearers only deceavinge youre awne selves with sophistrie
59001023	For yf eny heare the worde and do it not he is lyke vnto a man that beholdeth his bodyly face in a glasse .
59001024	For assone as he hath loked on him silfe he goeth his waye and forgetteth immediatlie what his fassion was .
59001025	But who so loketh in the parfaict lawe of libertie and continueth ther in ( yf he be not a forgetfull hearer but a doar of ye worke ) the same shall be happie in his dede .
59001026	Yf eny man amonge you seme devoute and refrayne not his tonge : but deceave his awne herte this mannes devocion is in vayne
59001027	Pure devocion and vndefiled before God the father is this : to vysit the frendlesse and widdowes in their adversite and to kepe him silfe vnspotted of the worlde .
59002001	Brethren have not the fayth of oure lorde Iesus Christ the lorde of glory in respecte of persons .
59002002	Yf ther come into youre company a man with a golden rynge and in goodly aparell and ther come in also a poore man in vyle rayment
59002003	and ye have a respecte to him that weareth the gaye clothynge and saye vnto him . Sit thou here in a good place : and saye vnto the poore stonde thou there or sit here vnder my fotestole :
59002004	are ye not parciall in youre selves and have iudged after evyll thoughtes ?
59002005	Harken my deare beloved brethren . Hath not God chosen the poore of this worlde which are ryche in fayth and heyres of the kyngdom which he promysed to them that love him ?
59002006	But ye have despised the poore . Are not the rych they which opresse you : and they which drawe you before iudges ?
59002007	Do not they speake evyll of that good name after which ye be named .
59002008	Yf ye fulfill the royall lawe accordynge to the scripture which sayth . Thou shallt love thyne neghbour as thy silfe ye do well .
59002009	But yf ye regarde one person more then another ye commit synne and are rebuked of the lawe as transgressours .
59002010	Whosoever shall kepe the whole lawe and yet fayle in one poynt he is gyltie in all .
59002011	For he that sayd . Thou shallt not commit adulterie sayed also : thou shallt not kyll . Though thou do none adulterie yet yf thou kill thou arte a transgresser of the lawe .
59002012	So speake ye and so do as they that shalbe iudged by the lawe of libertie .
59002013	For ther shalbe iudgement merciles to him that sheweth no mercy and mercy reioyseth agaynst iudgement :
59002014	What a vayleth it my brethren though a man saye he hath sayth when he hath no dedes ? Can fayth save him ?
59002015	If a brother or a sister be naked or destitute of dayly fode
59002016	and one of you saye vnto them : Departe in peace God sende you warmnes and fode : not withstondinge ye geve the not tho thynges which are nedfull to the body : what helpeth it the ?
59002017	Eve so fayth yf it have no dedes is deed in it selfe .
59002018	Ye and a man myght saye : Thou hast fayth and I have dedes : Shewe me thy fayth by thy dedes : and I will shewe the my fayth by my dedes .
59002019	Belevest thou yt ther is one God ? Thou doest well . The devyls also beleve and tremble .
59002020	Wilt thou vnderstonde o thou vayne man that fayth with out dedes is deed ?
59002021	Was not Abraha oure father iustified thorow workes when he offered Isaac his sonne vpo the aultre ?
59002022	Thou seist how that fayth wrought with his dedes and through the dedes was the fayth made parfect :
59002023	and ye scripture was fulfilled which sayth : Abraham beleved God and it was reputed vnto him for rightewesnes : and he was called the frede of God .
59002024	Ye se then how that of dedes a man is iustified and not of fayth only .
59002025	Lyke wyse also was not Raab the harlot iustifyed thorow workes when she receaved the messengers and sent the out another waye ?
59002026	For as the body with oute the sprete is deed eve so fayth with out dedes is deed
59003001	My brethren be not every ma a master remembringe how that we shall receave the more damnacion :
59003002	for in many thinges we synne all . Yf a man synne not in worde the same is a parfecte ma and able to tame all the body .
59003003	Beholde we put bittes into ye horses mouthes that they shuld obeye vs and we turne aboute all the body .
59003004	Beholde also the shyppes which though they be so gret and are dryven of fearce windes yet are they turned about with a very smale helme whither soever the violence of the governer wyll .
59003005	Even so the tonge is a lyttell member and bosteth great thinges . Beholde how gret a thinge a lyttell fyre kyndleth
59003006	and the tonge is fyre and a worlde of wyckednes . So is the tonge set amonge oure members that it defileth the whole body and setteth a fyre all that we have of nature and is it selfe set a fyre even of hell .
59003007	All the natures of beastes and of byrdes and of serpentes and thinges of ye see are meked and tamed of the nature of man .
59003008	But the tonge can no man tame . Yt is an vntuely evyll full of deedly poyson .
59003009	Therwith blesse we God the father and therwith cursse we me which are made after the similitude of God .
59003010	Out of one mouth proceadeth blessynge and cursynge . My brethren these thinges ought not so to be .
59003011	Doth a fountayne sende forth at one place swete water and bytter also ?
59003012	Can the fygge tree my Brethren beare olive beries : other a vyne beare fygges ?
59003013	So can no fountayne geve bothe salt water and fresshe also . If eny man be wyse and endued with learnynge amonge you let him shewe the workes of his good conversacio in meknes that ys coupled with wisdome .
59003014	But Yf ye have bitter envyinge and stryfe in youre hertes reioyce not : nether be lyars agaynst the trueth .
59003015	This wisdome descedeth not from a boue : but is erthy and naturall and divelisshe .
59003016	For where envyinge and stryfe is there is stablenes and all maner of evyll workes .
59003017	But the wisdom that is from above is fyrst pure then peasable gentle and easy to be entreated full of mercy and good frutes without iudgynge and without simulacio :
59003018	yee and the frute of rightewesnes is sowen in peace of them that mayntene peace .
59004001	From whence commeth warre and fighttynge amonge you : come they not here hence ? even of youre volupteousnes that rayne in youre members .
59004002	Ye lust and have not . Ye envie and have indignacion and cannot obtayne . Ye fight and warre and have not because ye axe not .
59004003	Ye axe and receave not because ye axe a mysse : even to consume it apon youre volupteousnes .
59004004	Ye advouterars and wemen that breke matrimonie : knowe ye not how yt the freshippe of ye worlde is ennimite to god warde ? Whosoever wilbe a frende of the worlde is made the enemie of god .
59004005	Ether do ye thinke that the scripture sayth in vayne The sprite that dwelleth in you lusteth eve contrary to envie :
59004006	but geveth more grace .
59004007	Submit youre selves to god and resist the devyll and he will flye from you .
59004008	Drawe nye to god and he will drawe nye to you . Clense youre hondes ye synners and pourdge youre hertes ye waverynge mynded .
59004009	Suffre affliccios : sorowe ye and wepe . Let youre laughter be turned to mornynge and youre ioye to hevynes .
59004010	Cast doune youre selves before the lorde and he shall lift you vp .
59004011	Backbyte not one another brethren . He that backbyteh hys brother and he that iudgeth his brother backbyteth the lawe and iudgeth the lawe . But and yf thou iudge the lawe thou art not an observer of ye lawe : but a iudge .
59004012	Ther is one lawe gever which is able to save and to distroye . What art thou that iudgest another man ?
59004013	Go to now ye that saye : to daye and to morow let vs go into soche a citie and continue there a yeare and bye and sell and wynne :
59004014	and yet can not tell what shall happen to morowe . For what thynge is youre lyfe ? It is even a vapoure that apereth for a lytell tyme and the vanyssheth awaye :
59004015	For that ye ought to saye : yf the lorde will and yf we live let vs do this or that .
59004016	But nowe ye reioyce in youre bostinges . All soche reioysynge is evyll .
59004017	Therfore to him that knoweth how to do good and doth it not to him it is synne .
59005001	Goo to now ye ryche men . Wepe and howle on youre wretchednes that shall come apon you .
59005002	Youre ryches is corrupte youre garmentes are motheaten .
59005003	Youre golde and youre silver are cankred and the rust of them shalbe a witnes vnto you and shall eate youre flesshe as it were fyre . Ye have heaped treasure togedder in youre last dayes :
59005004	Beholde the hyre of ye labourers which have reped doune youre feldes ( which hyer is of you kept backe by fraude ) cryeth : and ye cryes of them which have reped are entred into the eares of the lorde Sabaoth .
59005005	Ye have lived in pleasure on the erth and in wantannes . Ye have norysshed youre hertes as in a daye of slaughter .
59005006	Ye have condempned and have killed the iust and he hath not resisted you .
59005007	Be pacient therfore brethren vnto the commynge of the lorde . Beholde the husbande man wayteth for the precious frute of the erth and hath longe pacience ther vppon vntill he receave ( the erly and the latter rayne . )
59005008	Be ye also pacient therfore and settle youre hertes for ye commynge of the lorde draweth nye .
59005009	Grodge not one agaynst another brethre lest ye be dapned . Beholde the iudge stondeth before the dore .
59005010	Take ( my brethren ) the prophettes for an ensample of sufferynge adversitie and of longe pacience which spake in the name of the lorde .
59005011	Beholde we counte them happy which endure . Ye have hearde of the pacience of Iob and have knowen what ende the lorde made . For the lorde is very pitifull and mercifull .
59005012	But above all thynges my brethre sweare not nether by heven nether by erth nether by eny other othe . Let youre ye be ye and youre maye naye : lest ye faule into ypocrecy .
59005013	Yf eny of you be evyll vexed let him praye . Yf eny of you be mery let him singe Psalmes .
59005014	Yf eny be defeated amonge you let him call for the elders of the congregacion and let the praye over him and anoynte him with oyle in the name of the lorde :
59005015	and the prayer of fayth shall save the sicke and the lorde shall rayse him vp : and yf he have committed synnes they shalbe forgeuen him .
59005016	knowledge youre fautes one to another : and praye one for another that ye maye be healed . The prayer of a ryghteous ma avayleth moche yf it be fervet .
59005017	Helias was a man mortall even as we are and he prayed in his prayer that it myght not rayne : and it rayned not on the erth by the space of thre yeares and sixe monethes .
59005018	And he prayed agayne and the heve gave rayne and the erth brought forth her frute .
59005019	Brethren yf eny of you erre from the trueth and an other convert him
59005020	let the same knowe that he which converted the synner fro goynge a straye out of his waye shall save a soule fro deeth and shall hyde ye multitude of synnes .
60001001	Peter an Apostle of Iesu Christ to them that dwell here and there as straungers thorowout Pontus Galacia Capadocia Asia and Bethinia electe
60001002	by ye forknowledge of God ye father thorow the sanctifyinge of the sprete vnto obedience and springklinge of the bloud of Iesus Christ . Grace be with you and peace be multiplyed .
60001003	Blessed be God ye father of oure Lorde Iesus Christ which thorow is aboundant mercie begat vs agayne vnto a lively hope by the resurreccion of Iesus Christ fro deeth
60001004	to enioye an inheritaunce immortall and vndefiled and that purifieth not reserved in heven for you
60001005	which are kept by the power of God thorow fayth vnto salvacion which salvacion is prepared all redy to be shewed in the last tyme
60001006	in the which tyme ye shall reioyce though now for a season ( if nede requyre ) ye are in hevines thorowe manifolde temptacions
60001007	that youre fayth once tried beinge moche more precious then golde yt perissheth ( though it be tried with fyre ) myght be founde vnto lawde glory and honoure at the apperinge of Iesus Christ :
60001008	who ye have not sene and yet love him in whom even now though ye se him not ye yet beleue and reioyce with ioye vnspeakable and glorious :
60001009	receavynge the ende of youre fayth the salvacion of youre soules .
60001010	Of which salvacion have the Prophetes enquyred and searched which prophisied of ye grace that shuld come vnto you
60001011	searchinge whe or at what tyme the sprete of Christ which was in them shuld signifie which sprete testified before the passions that shuld come vnto Christ and the glory that shuld folowe after :
60001012	vnto which Prophetes it was declared that not vnto them selves but vnto vs they shuld minister the thinges which are now shewed vnto you of them which by ye holy goost sent doune fro heven have preached vnto you the thinges which the angels desyre to beholde .
60001013	Wherfore gyrde vp ye loynes of youre myndes be sober and trust perfectly on the grace yt is brought vnto you by the declaringe of Iesus Christ
60001014	as obediet chyldre not facioninge youre selves vnto youre olde lustes of ignoracye :
60001015	but as he which called you is holy eve so be ye holy in all maner of conuersacion
60001016	because it is written . Be ye holy for I am holy .
60001017	And yf so be yt ye call on the father which with out respecte of person iudgeth accordinge to every manes worke se yt ye passe the tyme of youre pilgremage in feare .
60001018	For as moche as ye know how that ye were not redemed with corruptible sylver and golde from youre vayne conversacion which ye receaved by the tradicions of the fathers :
60001019	but with the precious bloud of Christ as of a lambe vndefiled and withouten spot
60001020	which was ordeyened before the worlde was made : but was declared in the last tymes for youre
60001021	sakes which by his meanes have beleved on god that raysed him from deth and glorified him that youre fayth and hope myght be in god .
60001022	And for as moche as ye have purified youre soules thorowe the sprete in obeyinge the trueth for to love brotherly withouten saynynge se that ye love one another with a pure hert fervently :
60001023	for ye are borne a newe not of mortall seed but of immortall by the worde of god which liveth and lasteth for ever .
60001024	For all flesshe is as grasse and all the glory of man is as the floure of grasse . The grasse widdereth and the flower falleth awaye
60001025	but the worde of the lorde endureth ever . And this is the worde which by the gospell was preached amonge you .
60002001	Wherfore laye asyde all maliciousnes and all gyle and dissimulacion and envie and all backbytynge :
60002002	and as newe borne babes desyre that reasonable mylke which is with out corrupcion that ye maye growe therin .
60002003	If so be that ye have tasted how plesaunt the lorde is
60002004	to whom ye come as vnto a livynge stone disalowed of men but chosen of god and precious :
60002005	and ye as lyvynge stones are made a spretuall housse and an holy presthode for to offer vp spretuall sacryfice acceptable to god by Iesus Christ .
60002006	Wherfore it is contayned in the scripture : beholde I put in Sion an heed corner stone electe and precious : and he that beleveth on him shall not be ashamed .
60002007	Vnto you therfore which beleve he is precious : but vnto them which beleve not ye stone which ye bylders refused ye same is made ye heed stone in the corner
60002008	and a stone to stomble at and a rocke to offende them which stomble at the worde and beleve not that where on they were set .
60002009	But ye are a chosyn generacion a royall presthod an holy nacio and a peculiar people that ye shuld shewe the vertues of him that called you out of darknes into hys marvelous light
60002010	which in tyme past were not a people yet are now the people of God : which were not vnder mercye but now have obteyned mercye .
60002011	Derly beloved I beseche you as straugers and pilgrems abstayne from flesshly lustes which fyght agaynst the soule
60002012	and se that ye have honest conversacion amonge the getyls that they which backbyte you as evyll doars maye se youre good workes and prayse god in the daye of visitacion .
60002013	Submit youre selves vnto all manner ordinaunce of man for the lordes sake whether it be vnto the kynge as vnto the chefe heed :
60002014	other vnto rulars as vnto them that are sent of him for the punysshment of evyll doars : but for the laude of them that do well .
60002015	For so is the will of god that ye put to sylence the ygnorancie of the folyshe men :
60002016	as fre and not as havinge ye libertie for a cloke of maliciousnes but even as the servautes of god .
60002017	Honoure all men . Love brotherly felishippe . Feare god and honour the kynge .
60002018	Servauntes obey youre masters with all feare not only yf they be good and courteous : but also though they be frowarde .
60002019	For it is thankeworthye yf a man for conscience towarde god endure grefe sufferinge wrongfully .
60002020	For what prayse is it if when ye be buffeted for youre fautes ye take it paciently ? But and yf when ye do well ye suffer wronge and take it paciently then is there thanke with God .
60002021	For herevnto verely were ye called : for Christ also suffered for vs levinge vs an insample yt ye shuld folowe his steppes
60002022	which dyd no sinne nether was ther gyle founde in his mouth :
60002023	which when he was reviled reviled not agayne : whe he suffered he threatened not : but comitted the cause to him that iudgeth ryghteously
60002024	which his awne silfe bare oure synnes in his body on the tree that we shuld be delyvered from synne and shuld lyve in rightewesnes . By whose strypes ye were healed .
60002025	For ye were as shepe goinge astraye : but are now returned vnto ye shepheerd and bisshoppe of youre soules .
60003001	Lykewyse let the wyves be in subieccio to their husbades that eve they which beleve not the worde maye with out the worde be wonne by the conversacion of ye wyves :
60003002	whill they beholde youre pure coversacion coupled with feare .
60003003	Whose apparell shall not be outwarde with broyded heare and hanginge on of golde other in puttinge on of gorgious aparell :
60003004	but let the hyd man of the herte be incorrupt with a meke and a quyet sprete which sprete is before God a thinge moche set by .
60003005	For after this maner in the olde tyme dyd the holy wemen which trusted in God tyer the selves and were obediet to their husbades
60003006	eve as Sara obeyed Abraha and called him Lorde : whose doughters ye are as longe as ye do well and be not afrayde of every shadowe .
60003007	Lyke wyse ye men dwell with them accordinge to knowledge gevinge honoure vnto the wyfe as vnto the weaker vessell and as vnto them that are heyres also of the grace of lyfe that youre prayers be not let .
60003008	In coclusion be ye all of one mynde one suffre with another love as brethren be petifull be courteous
60003009	not redringe evyll for evyll nether rebuke for rebuke : but contrary wyse blesse remembringe yt ye are thervnto called even yt ye shuld be heyres of blessinge .
60003010	If eny ma longe after life and loveth to se good dayes let him refrayne his tonge fro evyll and his lippes that they speake not gyle .
60003011	Let him eschue evyll and do good : let him seke peace and ensue it .
60003012	For ye eyes of ye Lorde are over ye righteous and his eares are open vnto their prayers . But ye face of the Lorde beholdeth the that do evyll .
60003013	Moreover who is it that will harme you yf ye folowe yt which is good ?
60003014	Not withstondynge happy are ye yf ye suffre for rightewesnessis sake . Ye and feare not though they seme terrible vnto you nether be troubled :
60003015	but sanctifie the Lorde God in youre hertes . Be redy all wayes to geve an answere to every man that axeth you a reson of the hope that is in you and that with meaknes and feare :
60003016	havinge a good consciece that when they backbyte you as evyll doars they maye be ashamed for as moche as they have falsely accused youre good conversacion in Christ .
60003017	It is better ( yf the wyll of God be so ) that ye suffre for well doynge then for evyll doynge .
60003018	For as moche as Christ hath once suffered for synnes ye iuste for ye vniuste forto bringe vs to God and was kylled as pertayninge to the flesshe : but was quyckened in the sprete .
60003019	In which sprete he also wet and preached vnto the spretes that were in preson
60003020	which were in tyme passed disobedient when the longe sufferinge of God abode excedinge paciently in the dayes of Noe whyll the arcke was a preparinge wherin feawe ( that is to saye . viii soules ) were saved by water
60003021	which signifieth baptim that now saveth vs not ye puttinge awaye of ye filth of the flesshe but in that a good conscience consenteth to God by ye resurreccio of Iesus Christ
60003022	which is oure right honde of God and is gone into heve angels power and myght subdued vnto him .
60004001	For as moche as christ hath suffred for vs in the flesshe arme youre selves lyke wyse with the same mynde : for he which suffereth in the flesshe ceasith fro synne
60004002	that he hence forwarde shuld lyve as moche tyme as remayneth in the flesshe : not after ye lustes of men but after the will of God .
60004003	For it is sufficient for vs that we have spent the tyme that is past of the lyfe after the will of the gentyls walkinge in wantannes lustes dronkennes in eatinge drinkinge and in abominable ydolatrie .
60004004	And it semeth to them a straunge thinge that ye runne not also with them vnto the same excesse of ryote and therfore speake they evill of you
60004005	which shall geve a coptes to him that is redy to iudge quycke and deed .
60004006	For vnto this purpose verely was ye gospell preached vnto the ( deed ) that they shuld be condempned of men in ye flesshe but shuld live before God in the sprete .
60004007	The ende of all thinges is at honde . Be ye therfore discrete and sober yt ye maye be apte to prayers .
60004008	But above all thinges have fervet love amoge you . For love covereth the multitude of synnes .
60004009	Be ye herberous one to another and that wt out grudginge .
60004010	As every man hath receaved the gyfte minister the same one to another as good ministers of the manyfolde grace of God .
60004011	Yf eny man speake let him talke as though he spake ye wordes of God . If eny man minister let him do it as of ye abilitie which god ministreth vnto him . That god in all thinges maye be glorified thorow Iesus Christ to whom be prayse and dominion for ever and whyll the worlde stondeth . Amen .
60004012	Dearly beloved be not troubled in this heate which now is come amoge you to trye you as though some strauge thinge had happened vnto you :
60004013	but reioyce in as moche as ye are partetakers of Christes passions that when his glory appereth ye maye be mery and glad .
60004014	If ye be rayled vpon for the name of Christ happie are ye . For the sprete of glory and the sprete of god resteth apon you . On their parte he is evyll spoken of : but on youre parte he is glorified .
60004015	Se that none of you suffre as a murtherer or as a thefe or an evyll doar or as a busybody in other mens matters .
60004016	Yf eny man suffre as a Christe man let him not be ashamed : but let him glorifie god on his behalfe .
60004017	For the tyme is come that iudgement must begynne at the housse of god . If it fyrst begynne at vs what shall the ende be of them which beleve not the gospell of god ?
60004018	And yf the righteous scasly be saved : where shall the vngodly and the sinner appere ?
60004019	Wherfore let them that suffer accordynge to the will of god commit their soules to him with well doynge as vnto a faythfull creator
60005001	The elders which are amonge you I exhorte which am also an elder and a witnes of the affliccions of Christ and also a partaker of the glory that shalbe opened :
60005002	se that ye fede Christes flocke which is amonge you takynge the oversyght of them not as though ye were compelled therto but willyngly : not for the desyre of filthy lucre but of a good mynde .
60005003	not as though ye were lordes over the parisshes : but that ye be a insample to the flocke .
60005004	And when the chef shepheerde shall appere ye shall receave an incorruptible croune of glorye .
60005005	Lykwyse ye yonger submit youre selves vnto the elder . Submit youre selves every man one to another knet youre selves togedder in lowlines of mynde . For god resisteth ye proude and geveth grace to the humble .
60005006	Submit youre selves therfore vnder the myghty honde of god that he maye exalt you whe the tyme is come .
60005007	Cast all youre care to him : for he careth for you .
60005008	Be sober and watch for youre adversary ye devyll as a rorynge lion walketh about sekynge whom he maye devoure :
60005009	whom resist stedfust in the fayth remebrynge that ye do but fulfill the same affliccios which are apoynted to youre brethren that are in the worlde .
60005010	The God of all grace which called you vnto his eternall glory by Christ Iesus shall his awne silfe after ye have soffred a lytell affliccio make you perfect : shall settle strenght and stablishe you .
60005011	To him be glory and dominio for ever and whill the worlde endureth Amen .
60005012	By Silvanus a faythfull brother vnto you ( as I suppose ) have I written brefly exhortynge and testifyinge how that this is the true grace of god wherin ye stonde .
60005013	The companious of youre eleccion yt are at Babilo saluteth you and Marcus my sonne .
60005014	Grete ye one another with the kysse of love . Peace be with you all which are in Christ Iesus . Amen .
61001001	Simon Peter a seruaunt and an Apostle of Iesus Christ to them which have obtayned lyke precious fayth with vs in the rightewesnes that commeth of oure God and savioure Iesus Christ .
61001002	Grace with you and peace be multiplied in the knowledge of God and of Iesus oure Lorde .
61001003	Accordinge as his godly power hath geven vnto vs all thinges that pertayne vnto lyfe and godlynes thorow the knowledge of him that hath called vs by vertue and glory
61001004	by the meanes whereof are geven vnto vs excellent and moste greate promises that by the helpe of them ye shuld be partakers of the godly nature in that ye flye the corrupcion of worldy lust .
61001005	And hervnto geve all diligence : in youre fayth minister vertve and in vertue knowledge
61001006	and in knowledge temperancy and in temrancy pacience in pacience godlynes
61001007	in godlynes brotherly kyndnes in brotherly kyndnes love .
61001008	For yf these thinges be amonge you and are plenteous they wyll make you that ye nether shalbe ydle nor vnfrutefull in the knowledge of oure lorde Iesus Christ .
61001009	But he yt lacketh these thynges is blynde and gropeth for ye waye with his honde and hath forgotten yt he was pourged from his olde synnes .
61001010	Wherfore brethren geve the moare diligence forto make youre callynge and eleccion sure . For yf ye do soche thynges ye shall never erre .
61001011	Ye and by this meanes an entrynge in shall be ministred vnto you aboundantly in to the everlastynge kyngdome of oure lorde and saveoure Iesus Christ .
61001012	Wherfore I will not be necgligent to put you allwayes in remembraunce of soche thinges though that ye knowe them youre selves and be also stablisshed in the present trueth .
61001013	Notwithstodinge I thynke yt mete ( as longe as I am in this tabernacle ) to stere you vp by puttynge you in remebraunce
61001014	for as moch as I am sure howe that the tyme is at honde yt I must put of my tabernacle even as oure lorde Iesus Christ hath shewed me .
61001015	I will enfource therfore that on every syde ye myght have wherwith to stere vp the remembraunce of these thynges after my departynge .
61001016	For we folowed not decevable fables whe we openned vnto you the power and commynge of oure lorde Iesus Christ but with oure eyes we sawe his maieste :
61001017	even then verely when he receaved of god the father honour and glory and when ther came soche a voyce to him from excellent glorie . This is my dere beloved sonne in whom I have delite .
61001018	This voyce we hearde when it came from heven beynge with him in the holy mounte .
61001019	We have also a right sure worde of prophesye wher vnto yf ye take hede as vnto a lyght yt shyneth in a darke place ye do wel vntill the daye dawne and the daye starre aryse in youre hertes .
61001020	So that ye fyrst knowe this . that no prophesye in the scripture hath eny private interpretacio .
61001021	For the scripture came never by the will of man : but holy men of god spake as they were moved by the holy goost .
61002001	Ther were falce prophetes amonge the people even as ther shalbe falce teachers amonge you : wich prevely shall brynge in damnable sectes even denyinge the Lorde that hath bought them and brynge vpon them selves swyft damnacion
61002002	and many shall folowe their damnable wayes by which the waye of trueth shalbe evyll spoken of
61002003	and thorow coveteousnes shall they with fayned wordes make marchandyse of you whose iudgement is not farre of and their dampnacion slepeth not .
61002004	For yf god spared not the angels that synned but cast them doune into hell and delyuered them in chaynes of darknes to be kept vnto iudgement .
61002005	Nether spared the olde worlde but saved Noe the ryghte preacher of rightewesnes and brought in the flud vpon the worlde of the vngodly
61002006	and turned the cities of zodom and Gomor into asshes : overthrewe them damned the and made on them an ensample vnto all yt after shuld live vngodly .
61002007	And iust Lot vexed with the vnclenly conversacio of the wicked delivered he .
61002008	For he beynge ryghteous and dwellynge amonge them in seynge and hearynge vexed his righteous soule from daye to daye with their vnlawfull dedes .
61002009	The lorde knoweth how to deliver the godly out of temptacion and how to reserve the vniuste vnto the daye of iudgement for to be punisshed :
61002010	namely them that walke after the flesshe in the lust of vnclennes and despyse the rulars . Presumpteous are they and stubborne and feare not to speake evyll of them that are in auctorite .
61002011	When ye angels which are greater bothe in power and myght receave not of ye lorde raylynge iudgement agaynst them .
61002012	But these as brute beastes naturally made to betaken and destroyed speake evyll of that they knowe not and shall perisshe through their awne destruccion
61002013	and receave the rewarde of vnrightewesnes . They count it pleasure to live deliciously for a season . Spottes they are and filthines livinge at pleasure and in disceaveable wayes feastynge with you :
61002014	havinge eyes full of advoutrie and that canot cease to synne begylynge vnstable soules . Hertes they have exercised wt coveteousnes . They are cursed chyldren
61002015	and have forsaken the right waye and are gone astraye folowinge ye waye of Balam the sonne of Bosor which loved the rewarde of vnrightewesnes :
61002016	but was rebuked of his iniquitie . The tame and dome beast speakinge with manes voyce forbade the folisshnes of the Prophete .
61002017	These are welles without water and cloudes caried about of a tepest to whome the myst of darcknes is reserved for ever .
61002018	For when they have spoke the swellinge wordes of vanytie they begyle wt wantanes thorowe yt lustes of the flesshe them that were clene escaped : but now are wrapped in errours .
61002019	They promys them libertye and are them selves ye bonde servauntes of corrupcion . For of whom soever a man is over come vnto ye same is he in bondage .
61002020	For yf they after they have escaped from the filthynes of the worlde thorowe ye knowledge of ye Lorde and of ye saviour Iesus Christ they are yet tagled agayne therin and overcome : then is ye latter ende worsse with them then the beginninge .
61002021	For it had bene better for the not to have knowne ye waye of righteousnes then after they have knowe it to turne fro the holy comaundmet geve vnto them .
61002022	It is happened vnto them accordinge to the true proverbe : The dogge is turned to his vomet agayne and the sow that was wesshed to her wallowynge in the myre .
61003001	This is the seconde pistle that I now wryte vnto you beloved wherwith I stere vp and warne youre pure myndes to call to remembrauce
61003002	the wordes which were tolde before of the holy prophetes and also the commaundement of vs the apostles of the lorde and saveour .
61003003	This fyrst vnderstode that ther shall come in the last dayes mockers which will walke after their awne lustes
61003004	and saye . Where is the promes of his comynge ? For sence ye fathers dyed all thinges cotinue in ye same estate wher in they were at ye begynninge .
61003005	This they knowe not ( and that willyngly ) how that the hevens a great whyle ago were and the erth that was in the water appered vp out of the water by the worde of god :
61003006	by the which thinges the worlde yt then was perisshed over flowen wt the water .
61003007	But the heves verely and erth which are now are kept by the same worde in store and reserved vnto fyre agaynst the daye of iudgement and perdicion of vngodly men .
61003008	Derely beloved be not ignorant of this one thynge how that one daye is wt the lorde as a thousande yeare and a thousand yeare as one daye .
61003009	The lorde is not slacke to fulfill his promes as some men cout slacknes : but is pacient to vs warde and wolde have no man lost but wolde receave all men to repentauce .
61003010	Neverthelesse ye daye of the lorde will come as a thefe in ye nyght in the which daye ye hevens shall perisshe with terrible noyes and the elemetes shall melt with heet and the erth with the workes that are therin shall burne .
61003011	Yf all these thinges shall perisshe what maner persons ought ye to be in holy conversacion and godlynes :
61003012	lokynge for and hastynge vnto the commynge of the daye of God in which the hevens shall perisshe with fyre and the elementes shalbe consumed with heate .
61003013	Neverthelesse we loke for a newe heven and a newe erth accordynge to his promes where in dwelleth rightewesnes .
61003014	Wherfore derly beloved seynge yt ye loke for soche thynges be diliget that ye maye be founde of him in peace wt out spotte and vndefiled
61003015	And suppose that ye longe sufferynge of the lorde is saluacion even as oure derely beloved brother Paul accordynge to ye wysdome geve vnto him wrote to you
61003016	yee almost in very pistle speakynge of soche thynges : amoge which are many thynges harde to be vnderstonde which they that are vnlearned and vnstable pervert as they do other scriptures vnto their awne destruccio .
61003017	Ye therfore beloved seynge ye knowe it before hande beware lest ye be also plucked a waye with the erroure of the wicked and fall from youre awne stedfastnes :
61003018	but growe in grace and in the knowledge of oure lorde and saveoure Iesus Christ . To whom he glory bothe now and for ever . Amen .
62001001	That which was fro the begynninge concerninge which we have hearde which we have sene with oure eyes which we have loked vpon and oure hondes have hadled of the worde of life .
62001002	For the lyfe appered and we have sene and beare witnes and shewe vnto you that eternall lyfe which was with the father and appered vnto vs .
62001003	That which we have sene and herde declare we vnto you that ye maye have felloushippe with vs and that oure fellishippe maye be with the father and his sonne Iesus Christ .
62001004	And this write we vnto you that oure ioye maye be full .
62001005	And this is the tydynges which we have hearde of him and declare vnto you that god is lyght and in him is no darknes at all
62001006	yf we saye that we have fellishippe with him and yet walke in darknes we lye and do not the truth :
62001007	but and yf we walke in ( lyght ) even as he is in lyght then have we fellishippe with him and the bloud of Iesus Christ his sonne clenseth vs from all synne .
62001008	Yf we saye that we have no synne we deceave oure selves and trueth is not in vs .
62001009	Yf we knowledge oure synnes he is faythfull and iust to forgeve vs oure synnes and to clense vs from all vnrightewesnes .
62001010	Yf we saye we have not sinned we make him a lyar and his worde is not in vs .
62002001	My lytell children these thynges write I vnto you that ye synne not : yf eny man synne yet we have an advocate with ye father Iesus Christ which is righteous :
62002002	and he it is that obteyneth grace for oure synnes : not for oure synnes only : but also for the synnes of all the worlde .
62002003	And herby we are sure that we knowe him yf we kepe his comaundementes .
62002004	He that sayth I knowe him and kepeth not his commaundementes is a lyar and the veritie is not in him .
62002005	Whosoever kepeth his ( worde ) in him is the love of god parfect in dede . And therby knowe we that we are in him .
62002006	He that sayth he bydeth in him ought to walke even as he walked .
62002007	Brethren I write no newe comaundement vnto you : but that olde comaundemet which ye hearde from the begynnynge .
62002008	The olde comaundement is the worde which ye hearde from the begynnynge . Agayne a newe comaundement I write vnto you a thynge that is true in him and also in you : for the darknes is past and the true lyght now shyneth .
62002009	He that sayth how that he is in the light and yet hateth his brother is in darknes even vntyll this tyme .
62002010	He that loveth his brother abydeth in the light and ther is none occasion of evyll in him .
62002011	He that hateth his brother is in darknes and walketh in darknes : and cannot tell whither he goeth because that darknes hath blynded his eyes .
62002012	Babes I write vnto you how that youre synnes are forgeven you for his names sake .
62002013	I wryte vnto you fathers how that ye have knowen him that was from the begynnynge . I wryte vnto you yonge men how that ye have overcome the wicked . I wryte vnto you lytell children how that ye have knowne the father .
62002014	I wryte vnto you fathers how that ye have knowe him that was fro the begynnynge . I wryte vnto you youge men how that ye are stronge : and the worde of God abydeth in you and ye have overcome that wicked .
62002015	Se that ye love not the worlde nether the thynges that are in the worlde . Yf eny man love the worlde the love of the father is not in him .
62002016	For all that is in ye worlde ( as the lust of the flesshe the lust of the eyes and ye pryde of gooddes ) is not of the father : but of ye worlde
62002017	And the worlde vannyssheth awaye and the lust therof : but he that fulfilleth the will of god abydeth ever .
62002018	Lytell children it is the last tyme and as ye have herde how that Antichrist shall come : even now are there many Antichristes come allredy . Wherby we knowe that it is the last tyme .
62002019	They went oute from vs but they were not of vs . For yf they had bene of vs they wolde no dout have continued with vs . But that fortuned that yt myght appere that they were not of vs .
62002020	And ye have an oyntment of ye holy gost and ye knowe all thynges .
62002021	I wrote not vnto you as though ye knewe not the trueth : but as though ye knewe it and knowe also that no lye commeth of trueth .
62002022	Who is a lyar : but he that denyeth that Iesus is Christ ? The same is the Antichrist that denyeth the father and the sonne .
62002023	Whosoever denyeth the sonne the same hath not the father .
62002024	Let therfore abyde in you that same which ye hearde from the begynnynge . Yf that which ye hearde from ye begynnynge shall remayne in you ye also shall continewe in the sonne and in the father
62002025	And this is the promes yt he hath promysed vs even eternall lyfe .
62002026	This have I writte vnto you concernynge the yt disceave you .
62002027	And ye anoyntynge which ye have receaved of him dwelleth in you . And ye nede not that eny man teache you : but as ye annoyntynge teaheth you all thynges and is true and is no lye : and as it taught you even so byde therin .
62002028	And nowe babes abyde in him that when he shall appere we maye be bolde and not be made a shamed of him at his commynge .
62002029	Yf ye knowe that he is righteous knowe also that he which foloweth rightewesnes is borne of him .
62003001	Beholde what love the father hath shewed on vs that we shuld be called the sonnes of god . For this cause the worlde knoweth you not because it knoweth not him .
62003002	Derely beloved now are we ye sonnes of God and yet it dothe not appere what we shal be . But we knowe that when it shall appere we shal be lyke him . For we shall se him as he is .
62003003	And every man that hath thys hope in him pourgeth him silfe even as he ys pure .
62003004	Whosover committeth synne committeth vnrighteousnes also for synne is vnrighteousnes .
62003005	And ye knowe that he appered to take awaye oure synnes and in him is no synne .
62003006	As many as byde in him synne not : whosoever synneth hath not sene him nether hath knowen him .
62003007	Babes let no man deceave you He that doeth righteousnes is righteous even as he is righteous .
62003008	He that comitteth synne is of the devill : for the devyll synneth sence the begynnynge . For this purpose appered the sonne of god to lowse the workes of the devill .
62003009	Whosoever is borne of god sinneth not : for his seed remayneth in him and he cannot sinne because he is borne of god .
62003010	In this are the children of god knowen and the children of the devyll . Whosoever doeth not rightewesnes is not of God nether he that loveth not his brother .
62003011	For this is the tydinges that ye hearde fro the begynninge that we shuld love one another :
62003012	not as Cayn which was of the wicked and slewe his brother . And wherfore slewe he him ? Because his awne workes were evyll and his brothers good .
62003013	Marvayle not my brethren though the worlde hate you .
62003014	We knowe that we are translated from deeth vnto lyfe be cause we love the brethren . He that loveth not his brother abydeth in deeth .
62003015	Whosoever hateth his brother is a man slear . And ye knowe that no man slear hath eternall lyfe abydinge in him .
62003016	Herby perceave we love : that he gave his lyfe for vs : and therfore ought we also to geve oure lyves for the brethre .
62003017	Whosoever hath this worldes good and seith his brother have neade : and shutteth vp his copassion from him : how dwelleth the love of God in him ?
62003018	My babes let vs not love in worde nether in tonge : but with dede and in veritie :
62003019	for therby we knowe that we are of the veritie and can before him quiet oure hertes .
62003020	But yf oure hertes condempne vs God is gretter then oure hertes and knoweth all thinges .
62003021	Beloved yf oure hertes condempne vs not then have we trust to god warde :
62003022	and what soever we axe we shall receave of him : be cause we kepe his commaundementes and do those thinges which are pleasinge in his sight .
62003023	And this is his comaundemet that we beleve on ye name of his sonne Iesus Christ and love one another as he gave comaundemet .
62003024	And he yt kepeth his comaundemetes dwelleth in him and he in him : and therby we knowe that ther abydeth in vs of the sprete which he gave vs .
62004001	Ye beloved beleve not every sprete : but prove the spretes whether they are of God or no : for many falce Prophetes are gone out into the worlde .
62004002	Herby shall ye knowe the sprete of God . Every sprete that confesseth that Iesus Christ is come in the flesshe is of God .
62004003	And every sprete which cofesseth not yt Iesus Christ is come in the flesshe is not of God . And this is that sprete of Antichrist of whom ye have hearde howe that he shuld come : and even now alredy is he in the worlde .
62004004	Lytell chyldre ye are of God and have overcome them : for greater is he yt is in you then he that is in the worlde .
62004005	They are of the worlde and therfore speake they of the worlde and the worlde heareth them .
62004006	We are of God . He yt knoweth God heareth vs : he that is not of God heareth vs not . Herby knowe we ye sprete of veritie and the sprete of erroure .
62004007	Beloved let vs love one another : for love cometh of God . And every one that loveth is borne of God and knoweth God .
62004008	He that loveth not knoweth not God : for God is love .
62004009	In this appered ye love of god to vs ward because that god sent his only begotten sonne into the worlde that we myght live thorow him .
62004010	Herin is love not that we loved god but that he loved vs and sent his sonne to make agrement for oure sinnes .
62004011	Beloved yf god so loved vs we ought also to love one another .
62004012	No man hath sene god at enytyme . Yf we love one another god dwelleth in vs and his love is parfect in vs .
62004013	Herby know we that we dwell in him and he in vs : because he hath geven vs of his sprete .
62004014	And we have sene and do testifie that the father sent the sonne which is the saveour of the worlde .
62004015	Whosoever confesseth that Iesus is the sonne of god in him dwelleth god and he in god .
62004016	And we have knowen and beleved the love that god hath to vs . God is love and he that dwelleth in love dwelleth in god and god in him .
62004017	Herin is the love perfect in vs that we shuld have trust in the daye of iudgement : For as he is even so are we in this worlde .
62004018	Ther is no feare in love but parfect love casteth out all feare for feare hath paynfulnes . He yt feareth is not parfect in love .
62004019	We love him for he loved vs fyrst .
62004020	Yf a man saye I love god and yet hate his brother he is a lyar . For how can he yt loveth not his brother whom he hath sene love god whom he hath not sene ?
62004021	And this commaundemet have we of him : that he which loveth God shuld love his brother also .
62005001	Whosoever beleveh that Iesus is Christ is borne of god . And every one yt loveth him which begat loveth him also which was begotte of him .
62005002	In this we knowe yt we love the children of god whe we love god and kepe his comaudementes .
62005003	This is ye love of god yt we kepe his comaundemetes and his comaundementes are not greveous
62005004	For all that is borne of god over commeth the worlde . And this is the victory that overcometh the worlde even oure fayth .
62005005	Who is it that overcommeth the worlde : but he which beleveth that Iesus is ye sonne of god ?
62005006	This Iesus Christ is he that ca by water and bloud not by water only : but by water and bloud . And it is the sprete that beareth witnes because the sprete ys trueth .
62005007	( For ther are thre which beare recorde in heuen the father the worde and the wholy goost . And these thre are one )
62005008	For there are thre which beare recorde ( in erth : ) the sprete and water and bloud : and these thre are one .
62005009	Yf we receave the witnes of men the witnes of god is greater . For this is the witnes of god which he testifyed of his sonne .
62005010	He that beleveth on the sonne of god hath the witnes in him silfe . He that beleveth not God hath made him a lyar be cause he beleved not the recorde that god gave of his sonne .
62005011	And this ys that recorde how that god hath geven vnto vs eternall lyfe and this lyfe is in his sonne .
62005012	He that hath the sonne hath lyfe : and he that hath not the sonne of god hath not lyfe .
62005013	These thynges have I written vnto you that beleve on the name of the sonne of God that ye maye knowe howe that ye have eternall lyfe and that ye maye beleve on the name of the sonne of god .
62005014	And this is the trust that we have in him : that yf we axe eny thinge accordynge to his will he heareth vs .
62005015	And yf we knowe that he heare vs what soever we axe we knowe that we shall have the peticions that we desyre of him .
62005016	Yf eny man se his brother synne a synne that is not vnto deeth let him axe and he shall geve him lyfe for them that synne not vnto deeth . Ther is a synne vnto deeth for which saye I not that a man shuld praye .
62005017	All vnrightewesnes is synne and ther is synne not vnto deeth .
62005018	We knowe that whosoever is borne of god synneth not : but he that is begotten of god kepeth him silfe and that wicked toucheth him not .
62005019	We knowe that we are of god and that the worlde is altogedder set on wickednes .
